311 <script>

312

313 $('#support-menu-button').on('click', function () {

314 $('#support-menu').dialog({

315 resizable: false,

316 autoOpen: true,

317 draggable: false,

318 dialogClass: 'support_dialog',

319 modal: true,

320 width: 295,

321 open: function(event, ui) {

322 setTimeout(function() { $('#supportSearchTerm').focus(); }, 1);

323 $('.support-close-link').click(function(event) {

324 $('#support-menu').dialog('close');

325 });

326 //close if click anywhere outside the dialog box

327 $('.ui-widget-overlay').click(function (event) {

328 event.preventDefault();

329 $('#support-menu').dialog('close');

330 });

331 },

332 position: {

333 my: 'right top',

334 at: 'right bottom',

335 of: $('#support-menu-button')

336 }

337 });

338

339 var timerid;

340 $(window).resize(function () {

341 (timerid && clearTimeout(timerid));

342 timerid = setTimeout(function () {

343 $("#support-menu").dialog("option", "position", {

344 my: 'right top',

345 at: 'right bottom',

346 of: $('#support-menu-button')

347 });

348 });

349 });

350 return false;

351 });

352 </script>

353

354 </li>

721Legislation and Law Numbers</label>

723 <input type="text" name="legislationNumbers" id="legislation-legislationNumbers" placeholder="Examples: hr5, h.r.5, sjres8, sa2, pl116-21" value="" />

724

725 </div>

4810 <label class="quick-search-label-checkradio selectByDateLabel" for="house-communications-dateOperator">

4813 <select id="house-communications-dateOperator" name="dateOperator" class="auto-width">

4814

4815 <option value="equal" selected="selected">

4816is equal to</option>

5462

5463 <script type="text/javascript">

5464

5465 $(document).ready(function() {

5466 // search focus

5467 $('#search_main input[id=search]').focus();

5468

5469 // header

5470 $('.nav-links-main').clone().removeClass('nav-links nav-links-main').addClass('nav-links-clone nav-links-clone-main').prependTo('nav.nav-links-clone-wrapper');

5471 $('.nav-links-tertiary .tertiary').clone().removeClass('nav-links nav-links-tertiary').addClass('nav-links-clone').appendTo('.nav-links-clone');

5472 $('html').click(function() {

5473 $('.nav-links-clone-wrapper').slideUp();

5474 $('.nav-links-toggle').removeClass('active').attr('aria-expanded', 'false');

5475 });

5476 $('.nav-links-toggle, .tertiary-more-toggle').click(function(event){

5477 event.stopPropagation();

5478 });

5479 $('.nav-links-toggle').click(function() {

5480 if($('.nav-links-clone-wrapper').is(':hidden')) {

5481 $('.nav-links-clone-wrapper').slideDown();

5482 $('.nav-links-toggle').addClass('active').attr('aria-expanded', 'true');

5483 } else {

5484 $('.nav-links-clone-wrapper').slideUp();

5485 $('.nav-links-toggle').removeClass('active').attr('aria-expanded', 'false');

5486 }

5487 });

5488 $(window).on("load resize scroll",function(e){

5489 $('.nav-links-clone-wrapper').hide();

5490 $('.nav-links-toggle').removeClass('active').attr('aria-expanded', 'false');

5491 });

5492 $('.h_account').tooltip();

5493 });

5494 </script>

5855 <div class="tertiary_section">

5856

5857 <h3>

5858More on This Bill</h3>

5859

5860 <ul class="plain">

5861

5862 <li>

5863

5864 <a id="constAuthButton" href="#" >

5865Constitutional Authority Statement</a>

5866

5867 <script>

5868

5869 $('#constAuthButton').on('click', function () {

5870 var msg = '[Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 59 (Thursday, April 12, 2018)]<br />

5871From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [<a href=\'http://www.gpo.gov\'>

5872www.gpo.gov</a>

5873]<br />

5874By Mr. CONAWAY:<br />

5875H.R. 2.<br />

5876Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant<br />

5877to the following:<br />

5878The ability to regulate interstate commerce and with<br />

5879foreign Nations pursuant to Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3<br />

5880includes the power to regulate commodity prices, practices<br />

5881affecting them and the trading or donation of the commodities<br />

5882to impoverished nations. In addition, the Congress has the<br />

5883power to provide for the general Welfare of the United States<br />

5884under Article 1, Section 8, Clause 1 which includes the power<br />

5885to promote the development of Rural America through research<br />

5886and extension of credit.<br />

5887[Page H3209]<br />

5888<br/>

5889<br/>

5890<h3>

5891About Constitutional Authority Statements </h3>

5892 On January 5, 2011, the House of Representatives adopted an amendment to House Rule XII. Rule XII, clause 7(c) requires that, to be accepted for introduction by the House Clerk, all bills (H.R.) and joint resolutions (H.J.Res.) must provide a document stating \"as specifically as practicable the power or powers granted to Congress in the Constitution to enact the bill or joint resolution.\"';

5893 $('#constAuthorityStatement').empty().append(msg);

5894 $('#constAuthorityStatement').dialog({

5895 autoOpen: true,

5896 dialogClass: 'congress_dialog',

5897 title: 'Constitutional Authority Statement',

5898 height: 320,

5899 width: 500,

5900 modal: true,

5901 close: function(){

5902 $('.dialog_link', $(this).parents('li')).focus();

5903 },

5904 buttons: {

5905 "Close": function(){

5906 $(this).dialog("close");

5907 }

5908 }

5909 });

5910 var timerid;

5911 $(window).resize(function () {

5912 (timerid && clearTimeout(timerid));

5913 timerid = setTimeout(function () {

5914 $("#constAuthorityStatement").dialog("option", "position", {

5915 my: "center",

5916 at: "center",

5917 of: window

5918 });

5919 });

5920 });

5921 return false;

5922 });

5923 </script>

5924

5925</li>

5926

5927<li>

5928

5929 <a id="cboEstimateButton" href="#" >

5930CBO Cost Estimates [5]</a>

5931

5932 <script>

5933

5934 $('#cboEstimateButton').on('click', function () {

5935 var msg = '<p class="messages">

593612/11/2018<br>

5937<a href="https://www.cbo.gov/publication/54880" target="_blank" >

5938Direct Spending and Revenue Effects for the Conference Agreement on H.R. 2</a>

5939</p>

5940<p class="messages">

594109/11/2018<br>

5942<a href="https://www.cbo.gov/publication/54450" target="_blank" >

5943Letter to the Honorable Ron Kind</a>

5944</p>

5945<p class="messages">

594607/24/2018<br>

5947<a href="https://www.cbo.gov/publication/54284" target="_blank" >

5948CBO Cost Estimates for H.R. 2 as passed by the House of Representatives and as passed by the Senate</a>

5949</p>

5950<p class="messages">

595105/02/2018<br>

5952<a href="https://www.cbo.gov/publication/53819" target="_blank" >

5953As ordered reported by the House Committee on Agriculture on April 18, 2018</a>

5954</p>

5955<p class="messages">

595604/13/2018<br>

5957<a href="https://www.cbo.gov/publication/53760" target="_blank" >

5958As introduced on April 12, 2018</a>

5959</p>

5960<h3>

5961About CBO Cost Estimates</h3>

5962<p>

5963CBO produces cost estimates for select bills and resolutions. Bills for which the Library has received CBO Cost Estimate data link to the CBO Cost Estimates. CBO Cost Estimates can be searched from <a href=\"https://www.cbo.gov/cost-estimates\" target=_blank>

5964CBO\'s Cost Estimates Search page</a>

5965.</p>

5966';

5967 $('#cboEstimate').empty().append(msg);

5968 $('#cboEstimate').dialog({

5969 resizable: false,

5970 autoOpen: true,

5971 dialogClass: 'congress_dialog',

5972 height: 320,

5973 width: 500,

5974 modal: true,

5975 create: function() {

5976 $(".ui-dialog-title").html('Congressional Budget Office (CBO)<br/>

5977Cost Estimates for H.R.2 [115th]');

5978 },

5979 close: function(){

5980 $('.dialog_link', $(this).parents('li')).focus();

5981 },

5982 buttons: {

5983 "Close": function(){

5984 $(this).dialog("close");

5985 }

5986 }

5987 });

5988

5989 var timerid;

5990 $(window).resize(function () {

5991 (timerid && clearTimeout(timerid));

5992 timerid = setTimeout(function () {

5993 $("#cboEstimate").dialog("option", "position", {

5994 my: "center",

5995 at: "center",

5996 of: window

5997 });

5998 });

5999 });

6000 return false;

6001 });

6002 </script>

6003

6004</li>

6005 </ul>

6006

6007 </div>

6008

6009

6010

6011

6012 <div class="tertiary_section">

6183<script>

6184

6185(function ($) {

6186 $('ul.tabs_links').find('li.selected').find('a').focus();

6187 $("<select />

6188").appendTo(".tabs_container .select_container").addClass('tabs_mobile').attr('id', 'tabs_mobile');

6189 $(".tabs_container .tabs_links li").each(function() {

6190 var item = $(this);

6191 var itemLink = $(this).find('a');

6192

6193 $("<option />

6194", {

6195 "value" : itemLink.attr("href"),

6196 "text" : itemLink.text()

6197 }).prop('selected', item.attr('class') == 'selected').appendTo(".tabs_container select");

6198 });

6199

6200 $(".tabs_container select").change(function() {

6201 window.location = $(this).find("option:selected").val();

6202 });

6203}(jQuery));

6204</script>

6328<pre id="billTextContainer">

6329[115th Congress Public Law 334]

6330[From the U.S. Government Publishing Office]

6331

6332

6333

6334[[Page 4489]]

6335

6336 AGRICULTURE IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 2018

6337

6338[[Page 132 STAT. 4490]]

6339

6340Public Law 115-334

6341115th Congress

6342

6343 An Act

6344

6345

6346

6347 To provide for the reform and continuation of agricultural and other

6348programs of the Department of Agriculture through fiscal year 2023, and

6349 for other purposes. &lt;&lt;NOTE: Dec. 20, 2018 - [H.R. 2]&gt;&gt;

6350

6351 Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the

6352United States of America in Congress assembled, &lt;&lt;NOTE: Agriculture

6353Improvement Act of 2018.&gt;&gt;

6354SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE; TABLE OF CONTENTS.

6355

6356 (a) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 9001 note.&gt;&gt; Short Title.--This Act may be cited

6357as the ``Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018''.

6358

6359 (b) Table of Contents.--The table of contents for this Act is as

6360follows:

6361

6362Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.

6363Sec. 2. Definition of Secretary.

6364

6365 TITLE I--COMMODITIES

6366

6367 Subtitle A--Commodity Policy

6368

6369Sec. 1101. Definition of effective reference price.

6370Sec. 1102. Base acres.

6371Sec. 1103. Payment yields.

6372Sec. 1104. Payment acres.

6373Sec. 1105. Producer election.

6374Sec. 1106. Price loss coverage.

6375Sec. 1107. Agriculture risk coverage.

6376Sec. 1108. Repeal of transition assistance for producers of upland

6377 cotton.

6378

6379 Subtitle B--Marketing Loans

6380

6381Sec. 1201. Extensions.

6382Sec. 1202. Loan rates for nonrecourse marketing assistance loans.

6383Sec. 1203. Economic adjustment assistance for textile mills.

6384Sec. 1204. Special competitive provisions for extra long staple cotton.

6385Sec. 1205. Availability of recourse loans.

6386

6387 Subtitle C--Sugar

6388

6389Sec. 1301. Sugar policy.

6390

6391 Subtitle D--Dairy Margin Coverage and Other Dairy Related Provisions

6392

6393Sec. 1401. Dairy margin coverage.

6394Sec. 1402. Reauthorizations.

6395Sec. 1403. Class I skim milk price.

6396Sec. 1404. Dairy product donation.

6397

6398 Subtitle E--Supplemental Agricultural Disaster Assistance

6399

6400Sec. 1501. Supplemental agricultural disaster assistance.

6401

6402 Subtitle F--Noninsured Crop Assistance

6403

6404Sec. 1601. Noninsured crop assistance program.

6405

6406 Subtitle G--Administration

6407

6408Sec. 1701. Regulations.

6409Sec. 1702. Suspension of permanent price support authority.

6410

6411[[Page 132 STAT. 4491]]

6412

6413Sec. 1703. Payment limitations.

6414Sec. 1704. Adjusted gross income limitations.

6415Sec. 1705. Farm Service Agency accountability.

6416Sec. 1706. Implementation.

6417Sec. 1707. Exemption from certain reporting requirements for certain

6418 producers.

6419

6420 TITLE II--CONSERVATION

6421

6422 Subtitle A--Wetland Conservation

6423

6424Sec. 2101. Wetland conversion.

6425Sec. 2102. Wetland conservation.

6426Sec. 2103. Mitigation banking.

6427

6428 Subtitle B--Conservation Reserve Program

6429

6430Sec. 2201. Conservation reserve.

6431Sec. 2202. Conservation reserve enhancement program.

6432Sec. 2203. Farmable wetland program.

6433Sec. 2204. Pilot programs.

6434Sec. 2205. Duties of owners and operators.

6435Sec. 2206. Duties of the Secretary.

6436Sec. 2207. Payments.

6437Sec. 2208. Contracts.

6438Sec. 2209. Eligible land; State law requirements.

6439

6440 Subtitle C--Environmental Quality Incentives Program and Conservation

6441 Stewardship Program

6442

6443Sec. 2301. Repeal of conservation programs.

6444Sec. 2302. Purposes of environmental quality incentives program.

6445Sec. 2303. Definitions under environmental quality incentives program.

6446Sec. 2304. Establishment and administration of environmental quality

6447 incentives program.

6448Sec. 2305. Environmental quality incentives program plan.

6449Sec. 2306. Limitation on payments under environmental quality incentives

6450 program.

6451Sec. 2307. Conservation innovation grants and payments.

6452Sec. 2308. Conservation stewardship program.

6453Sec. 2309. Grassland conservation initiative.

6454

6455 Subtitle D--Other Conservation Programs

6456

6457Sec. 2401. Watershed protection and flood prevention.

6458Sec. 2402. Soil and water resources conservation.

6459Sec. 2403. Emergency conservation program.

6460Sec. 2404. Conservation of private grazing land.

6461Sec. 2405. Grassroots source water protection program.

6462Sec. 2406. Voluntary public access and habitat incentive program.

6463Sec. 2407. Wildlife management.

6464Sec. 2408. Feral swine eradication and control pilot program.

6465Sec. 2409. Report on small wetlands.

6466Sec. 2410. Sense of Congress relating to increased watershed-based

6467 collaboration.

6468

6469 Subtitle E--Funding and Administration

6470

6471Sec. 2501. Commodity Credit Corporation.

6472Sec. 2502. Delivery of technical assistance.

6473Sec. 2503. Administrative requirements for conservation programs.

6474Sec. 2504. Temporary administration of conservation programs.

6475

6476 Subtitle F--Agricultural Conservation Easement Program

6477

6478Sec. 2601. Establishment and purposes.

6479Sec. 2602. Definitions.

6480Sec. 2603. Agricultural land easements.

6481Sec. 2604. Wetland reserve easements.

6482Sec. 2605. Administration.

6483

6484 Subtitle G--Regional Conservation Partnership Program

6485

6486Sec. 2701. Establishment and purposes.

6487Sec. 2702. Definitions.

6488Sec. 2703. Regional conservation partnerships.

6489Sec. 2704. Assistance to producers.

6490Sec. 2705. Funding.

6491Sec. 2706. Administration.

6492

6493[[Page 132 STAT. 4492]]

6494

6495Sec. 2707. Critical conservation areas.

6496

6497 Subtitle H--Repeals and Technical Amendments

6498

6499 PART I--Repeals

6500

6501Sec. 2811. Repeal of Conservation Corridor Demonstration Program.

6502Sec. 2812. Repeal of cranberry acreage reserve program.

6503Sec. 2813. Repeal of National Natural Resources Foundation.

6504Sec. 2814. Repeal of flood risk reduction.

6505Sec. 2815. Repeal of study of land use for expiring contracts and

6506 extension of authority.

6507Sec. 2816. Repeal of Integrated Farm Management Program Option.

6508Sec. 2817. Repeal of clarification of definition of agricultural lands.

6509

6510 PART II--Technical Amendments

6511

6512Sec. 2821. Technical amendments.

6513Sec. 2822. State technical committees.

6514

6515 TITLE III--TRADE

6516

6517 Subtitle A--Food for Peace Act

6518

6519Sec. 3101. Labeling requirements.

6520Sec. 3102. Food aid quality assurance.

6521Sec. 3103. Local sale and barter of commodities.

6522Sec. 3104. Minimum levels of assistance.

6523Sec. 3105. Food aid consultative group.

6524Sec. 3106. Issuance of regulations.

6525Sec. 3107. Oversight, monitoring, and evaluation.

6526Sec. 3108. Assistance for stockpiling and rapid transportation,

6527 delivery, and distribution of shelf-stable prepackaged foods.

6528Sec. 3109. Consideration of impact of provision of agricultural

6529 commodities and other assistance on local farmers and

6530 economy.

6531Sec. 3110. Allowance for distribution costs.

6532Sec. 3111. Prepositioning of agricultural commodities.

6533Sec. 3112. Annual report regarding food aid programs and activities.

6534Sec. 3113. Deadline for agreements to finance sales or to provide other

6535 assistance.

6536Sec. 3114. Minimum level of nonemergency food assistance.

6537Sec. 3115. Termination date for micronutrient fortification programs.

6538Sec. 3116. John Ogonowski and Doug Bereuter Farmer-to-Farmer program.

6539

6540 Subtitle B--Agricultural Trade Act of 1978

6541

6542Sec. 3201. Agricultural trade promotion and facilitation.

6543

6544 Subtitle C--Other Agricultural Trade Laws

6545

6546Sec. 3301. Growing American Food Exports.

6547Sec. 3302. Food for Progress Act of 1985.

6548Sec. 3303. Bill Emerson Humanitarian Trust Act.

6549Sec. 3304. Promotion of agricultural exports to emerging markets.

6550Sec. 3305. Cochran fellowship program.

6551Sec. 3306. Borlaug International Agricultural Science and Technology

6552 Fellowship program.

6553Sec. 3307. International Agricultural Education Fellowship program.

6554Sec. 3308. International food security technical assistance.

6555Sec. 3309. McGovern-Dole International Food for Education and Child

6556 Nutrition program.

6557Sec. 3310. Global Crop Diversity Trust.

6558Sec. 3311. Local and regional food aid procurement projects.

6559Sec. 3312. Foreign trade missions.

6560

6561 TITLE IV--NUTRITION

6562

6563 Subtitle A--Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program

6564

6565Sec. 4001. Requirements for online acceptance of benefits.

6566Sec. 4002. Re-evaluation of thrifty food plan.

6567Sec. 4003. Food distribution program on Indian reservations.

6568Sec. 4004. Simplified homeless housing costs.

6569Sec. 4005. Employment and training for supplemental nutrition assistance

6570 program.

6571Sec. 4006. Improvements to electronic benefit transfer system.

6572Sec. 4007. Review of supplemental nutrition assistance program

6573 operations.

6574Sec. 4008. Retail incentives.

6575

6576[[Page 132 STAT. 4493]]

6577

6578Sec. 4009. Required action on data match information.

6579Sec. 4010. Incentivizing technology modernization.

6580Sec. 4011. Interstate data matching to prevent multiple issuances.

6581Sec. 4012. Requirement of live-production environments for certain pilot

6582 projects relating to cost sharing for computerization.

6583Sec. 4013. Quality control improvements.

6584Sec. 4014. Evaluation of child support enforcement cooperation

6585 requirements.

6586Sec. 4015. Longitudinal data for research.

6587Sec. 4016. Authorization of appropriations.

6588Sec. 4017. Assistance for community food projects.

6589Sec. 4018. Emergency food assistance program.

6590Sec. 4019. Nutrition education.

6591Sec. 4020. Retail food store and recipient trafficking.

6592Sec. 4021. Public-private partnerships.

6593Sec. 4022. Technical corrections.

6594

6595 Subtitle B--Commodity Distribution Programs

6596

6597Sec. 4101. Commodity distribution program.

6598Sec. 4102. Commodity supplemental food program.

6599Sec. 4103. Distribution of surplus commodities to special nutrition

6600 projects.

6601Sec. 4104. Food donation standards.

6602

6603 Subtitle C--Miscellaneous

6604

6605Sec. 4201. Seniors farmers' market nutrition program.

6606Sec. 4202. Purchase of fresh fruits and vegetables for distribution to

6607 schools and service institutions.

6608Sec. 4203. Service of traditional foods in public facilities.

6609Sec. 4204. Healthy food financing initiative.

6610Sec. 4205. The Gus Schumacher nutrition incentive program.

6611Sec. 4206. Micro-grants for food security.

6612Sec. 4207. Buy American requirements.

6613Sec. 4208. Healthy fluid milk incentives projects.

6614

6616

6618

6620 for farm ownership loans.

6623Sec. 5104. Relending program to resolve ownership and succession on

6624 farmland.

6625

6627

6629Sec. 5202. Microloans.

6630Sec. 5203. Cooperative lending pilot projects.

6631

6632 Subtitle C--Administrative Provisions

6633

6634Sec. 5301. Beginning farmer and rancher individual development accounts

6635 pilot program.

6636Sec. 5302. Loan authorization levels.

6637Sec. 5303. Loan fund set-asides.

6638Sec. 5304. Use of additional funds for direct operating microloans under

6639 certain conditions.

6640Sec. 5305. Equitable relief.

6641Sec. 5306. Socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers; qualified

6642 beginning farmers and ranchers.

6643Sec. 5307. Emergency loan eligibility.

6644

6645 Subtitle D--Miscellaneous

6646

6647Sec. 5401. Technical corrections to the Consolidated Farm and Rural

6648 Development Act.

6649Sec. 5402. State agricultural mediation programs.

6650Sec. 5403. Compensation of bank directors.

6651Sec. 5404. Sharing of privileged and confidential information.

6652Sec. 5405. Facility headquarters.

6653Sec. 5406. Removal and prohibition authority; industry-wide prohibition.

6654Sec. 5407. Jurisdiction over institution-affiliated parties.

6655Sec. 5408. Definition of institution-affiliated party.

6656Sec. 5409. Prohibition on use of funds.

6657

6658[[Page 132 STAT. 4494]]

6659

6660Sec. 5410. Expansion of acreage exception to loan amount limitation.

6661Sec. 5411. Repeal of obsolete provisions; technical corrections.

6662Sec. 5412. Corporation as conservator or receiver; certain other powers.

6663Sec. 5413. Reporting.

6664Sec. 5414. Study on loan risk.

6665Sec. 5415. GAO report on ability of the Farm Credit System to meet the

6666 agricultural credit needs of Indian tribes and their members.

6667Sec. 5416. GAO report on credit service to socially disadvantaged

6668 farmers and ranchers.

6669

6670 TITLE VI--RURAL DEVELOPMENT

6671

6672 Subtitle A--Improving Health Outcomes in Rural America

6673

6675 prioritizations.

6678

6679 Subtitle B--Connecting Rural Americans to High Speed Broadband

6680

6681Sec. 6201. Access to broadband telecommunications services in rural

6682 areas.

6683Sec. 6202. Expansion of middle mile infrastructure into rural areas.

6684Sec. 6203. Modifications to the Rural Gigabit Program.

6685Sec. 6204. Community Connect Grant Program.

6686Sec. 6205. Outdated broadband systems.

6687Sec. 6206. Default and deobligation; deferral.

6688Sec. 6207. Public notice, assessments, and reporting requirements.

6689Sec. 6208. Environmental reviews.

6690Sec. 6209. Use of loan proceeds to refinance loans for deployment of

6691 broadband service.

6692Sec. 6210. Smart utility authority for broadband.

6693Sec. 6211. Refinancing of telephone loans.

6694Sec. 6212. Federal broadband program coordination.

6695Sec. 6213. Transition rule.

6696Sec. 6214. Rural broadband integration working group.

6697

6698 Subtitle C--Miscellaneous

6699

6700Sec. 6301. Exclusion of certain populations from definition of rural

6701 area.

6702Sec. 6302. Establishment of technical assistance program.

6703Sec. 6303. Rural energy savings program.

6704Sec. 6304. Northern Border Regional Commission reauthorization.

6705Sec. 6305. Definition of rural area for purposes of the Housing Act of

6706 1949.

6708 Development.

6709

6710 Subtitle D--Additional Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural

6711 Development Act

6712

6713Sec. 6401. Strategic economic and community development.

6714Sec. 6402. Expanding access to credit for rural communities.

6715Sec. 6403. Water, waste disposal, and wastewater facility grants.

6716Sec. 6404. Rural water and wastewater technical assistance and training

6717 programs.

6718Sec. 6405. Rural water and wastewater circuit rider program.

6719Sec. 6406. Tribal college and university essential community facilities.

6720Sec. 6407. Emergency and imminent community water assistance grant

6721 program.

6722Sec. 6408. Water systems for rural and native villages in Alaska.

6723Sec. 6409. Rural decentralized water systems.

6724Sec. 6410. Solid waste management grants.

6725Sec. 6411. Rural business development grants.

6726Sec. 6412. Rural cooperative development grants.

6727Sec. 6413. Locally or regionally produced agricultural food products.

6728Sec. 6414. Appropriate technology transfer for rural areas program.

6729Sec. 6415. Rural economic area partnership zones.

6730Sec. 6416. Intemediary relending program.

6731Sec. 6417. Access to information to verify income for participants in

6732 certain rural housing programs.

6733Sec. 6418. Providing for additional fees for guaranteed loans under the

6734 Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act.

6735Sec. 6419. Rural Business-Cooperative Service programs technical

6736 assistance and training.

6737Sec. 6420. National Rural Development Partnership.

6738Sec. 6421. Grants for NOAA weather radio transmitters.

6739Sec. 6422. Rural microentrepreneur assistance program.

6740Sec. 6423. Health care services.

6741Sec. 6424. Rural innovation stronger economy grant program.

6742

6743[[Page 132 STAT. 4495]]

6744

6745Sec. 6425. Delta Regional Authority.

6746Sec. 6426. Rural business investment program.

6747Sec. 6427. Rural business investment program.

6748

6749 Subtitle E--Additional Amendments to the Rural Electrification Act of

6750 1936

6751

6752Sec. 6501. Amendments to section 2 of the Rural Electrification Act of

6753 1936.

6754Sec. 6502. Loans for telephone service.

7213SEC. 2. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 9001 note.&gt;&gt; DEFINITION OF SECRETARY.

7214

7215 In this Act, the term ``Secretary'' means the Secretary of

7216Agriculture.

7217

7218 TITLE I--COMMODITIES

7219

7220 Subtitle A--Commodity Policy

7221

7222SEC. 1101. DEFINITION OF EFFECTIVE REFERENCE PRICE.

7223

7224 Section 1111 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9011) is

7225amended--

7226 (1) by redesignating paragraphs (8) through (25) as

7227 paragraphs (9) through (26), respectively; and

7228 (2) by inserting after paragraph (7) the following:

7229 ``(8) Effective reference price.--The term `effective

7230 reference price', with respect to a covered commodity for a crop

7231 year, means the lesser of the following:

7232 ``(A) An amount equal to 115 percent of the

7233 reference price for such covered commodity.

7234 ``(B) An amount equal to the greater of--

7235 ``(i) the reference price for such covered

7236 commodity; or

7237 ``(ii) 85 percent of the average of the

7238 marketing year average price of the covered

7239 commodity for the

7240

7241[[Page 132 STAT. 4501]]

7242

7243 most recent 5 crop years, excluding each of the

7244 crop years with the highest and lowest marketing

7245 year average price.''.

7246SEC. 1102. BASE ACRES.

7247

7248 (a) Technical Corrections.--Section 1112(c)(2) of the Agricultural

7249Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9012(c)(2)) is amended by striking subparagraph

7250(A) and inserting the following:

7251 ``(A) Any acreage on the farm enrolled in--

7252 ``(i) the conservation reserve program

7253 established under subchapter B of chapter 1 of

7254 subtitle D of title XII of the Food Security Act

7255 of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3831 et seq.); or

7256 ``(ii) a wetland reserve easement under

7257 section 1265C of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16

7258 U.S.C. 3865c).''.

7259

7260 (b) Reduction in Base Acres.--Section 1112(d) of the Agricultural

7261Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9012(d)) is amended by adding at the end the

7262following:

7263 ``(3) Treatment of base acres on farms entirely planted to

7264 grass or pasture.--

7265 ``(A) In general.--In the case of a farm on which

7266 all of the cropland was planted to grass or pasture

7267 (including cropland that was idle or fallow), as

7268 determined by the Secretary, during the period beginning

7269 on January 1, 2009, and ending on December 31, 2017, the

7270 Secretary shall maintain all base acres and payment

7271 yields for the covered commodities on the farm, except

7272 that no payment shall be made with respect to those base

7273 acres under section 1116 or 1117 for the 2019 through

7274 2023 crop years.

7275 ``(B) Ineligibility.--The producers on a farm for

7276 which all of the base acres are maintained under

7277 subparagraph (A) shall be ineligible for the option to

7278 change the election applicable to the producers on the

7279 farm under section 1115(h).

7280 ``(4) Prohibition on reconstitution of farm.--The Secretary

7281 shall ensure that producers on a farm do not reconstitute the

7282 farm to void or change the treatment of base acres under this

7283 section.''.

7284SEC. 1103. PAYMENT YIELDS.

7285

7286 (a) Treatment of Designated Oilseeds.--Section 1113(b) of the

7287Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9013(b)) is amended--

7288 (1) in paragraph (1), by striking ``designated oilseeds''

7289 and inserting ``oilseeds designated before the date of enactment

7290 of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018'';

7291 (2) in paragraphs (2) and (3), by striking ``a designated

7292 oilseed'' each place it appears and inserting ``an oilseed

7293 designated before the date of enactment of the Agriculture

7294 Improvement Act of 2018''; and

7295 (3) by adding at the end the following:

7296 ``(4) Treatment of oilseeds designated after certain date.--

7297 In the case of oilseeds designated on or after the date of

7298 enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, the

7299 payment yield shall be equal to 90 percent of the average of the

7300 yield per planted acre for the most recent 5 crop years, as

7301 determined by the Secretary, excluding any crop year in which

7302 the acreage planted to the covered commodity was zero.''.

7303

7304[[Page 132 STAT. 4502]]

7305

7306 (b) Single Opportunity to Update Yields.--Section 1113 of the

7307Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9013) is amended by striking

7308subsection (d) and inserting the following:

7309 ``(d) Single Opportunity to Update Yields.--

7310 ``(1) Election to update.--At the sole discretion of the

7311 owner of a farm, the owner of a farm shall have a 1-time

7312 opportunity to update, on a covered-commodity-by-covered-

7313 commodity basis, the payment yield that would otherwise be used

7314 in calculating any price loss coverage payment for each covered

7315 commodity on the farm for which the election is made.

7316 ``(2) Method of updating yields for covered commodities.--If

7317 the owner of a farm elects to update yields under paragraph (1),

7318 the payment yield for a covered commodity on the farm, for the

7319 purpose of calculating price loss coverage payments only, shall

7320 be equal to the product obtained by multiplying--

7321 ``(A) 90 percent;

7322 ``(B) the average of the yield per planted acre for

7323 the crop of covered commodities on the farm for the 2013

7324 through 2017 crop years, as determined by the Secretary,

7325 excluding any crop year in which the acreage planted to

7326 the covered commodity was zero; and

7327 ``(C) subject to paragraph (3), the ratio obtained

7328 by dividing--

7329 ``(i) the average of the 2008 through 2012

7330 national average yield per planted acre for the

7331 covered commodity, as determined by the Secretary;

7332 by

7333 ``(ii) the average of the 2013 through 2017

7334 national average yield per planted acre for the

7335 covered commodity, as determined by the Secretary.

7336 ``(3) Limitation.--In no case shall the ratio obtained under

7337 paragraph (2)(C) be less than 90 percent or greater than 100

7338 percent.

7339 ``(4) Use of county average yield.--For the purposes of

7340 determining the average yield per planted acre under paragraph

7341 (2)(B), if the yield per planted acre for a crop of a covered

7342 commodity for a farm for any of the crop years described in that

7343 subparagraph was less than 75 percent of the average of county

7344 yields for those crop years for that commodity, the Secretary

7345 shall assign a yield for that crop year equal to 75 percent of

7346 the average of the 2013 through 2017 county yield for the

7347 covered commodity.

7348 ``(5) Upland cotton conversion.--In the case of seed cotton,

7349 for purposes of determining the average of the yield per planted

7350 acre under this subsection, the average yield for seed cotton

7351 per planted acre shall be equal to 2.4 times the average yield

7352 for upland cotton per planted acre.

7353 ``(6) Time for election.--An election under this subsection

7354 shall be made at a time and manner so as to be in effect

7355 beginning with the 2020 crop year, as determined by the

7356 Secretary.''.

7357SEC. 1104. PAYMENT ACRES.

7358

7359 Section 1114 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9014) is

7360amended--

7361 (1) in subsection (d)--

7362

7363[[Page 132 STAT. 4503]]

7364

7365 (A) in paragraph (1), by inserting ``, unless the

7366 sum of the base acres on the farm, when combined with

7367 the base acres of other farms in which the producer has

7368 an interest, is more than 10 acres'' before the period

7369 at the end; and

7370 (B) in paragraph (2)--

7371 (i) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``or'' at

7372 the end;

7373 (ii) in subparagraph (B), by striking the

7374 period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and

7375 (iii) by adding at the end the following:

7376 ``(C) a beginning farmer or rancher (as defined in

7377 subsection (a) of section 2501 of the Food, Agriculture,

7378 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279)); or

7379 ``(D) a veteran farmer or rancher (as defined in

7380 subsection (a) of section 2501 of the Food, Agriculture,

7381 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279)).'';

7382 and

7383 (2) in subsection (e), by adding at the end the following:

7384 ``(5) Effect of reduction.--For each crop year for which

7385 fruits, vegetables (other than mung beans and pulse crops), or

7386 wild rice are planted to base acres on a farm for which a

7387 reduction in payment acres is made under this subsection, the

7388 Secretary shall consider such base acres to be planted, or

7389 prevented from being planted, to a covered commodity for

7390 purposes of any adjustment or reduction of base acres for the

7391 farm under section 1112.''.

7392SEC. 1105. PRODUCER ELECTION.

7393

7394 Section 1115 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9015) is

7395amended--

7396 (1) in subsection (a), in the matter preceding paragraph

7397 (1), by striking ``Except as provided in subsection (g), for the

7398 2014 through 2018 crop years'' and inserting ``For the 2014

7399 through 2018 crop years (except as provided in subsection (g))

7400 and for the 2019 through 2023 crop years (subject to subsection

7401 (h))'';

7402 (2) in subsection (b), in the matter preceding paragraph

7403 (1), by striking ``subsection (a), the producers on a farm that

7404 elect under paragraph (2) of such subsection to obtain

7405 agriculture risk coverage under section 1117'' and inserting

7406 ``subsection (a) or (h), as applicable, the producers on a farm

7407 that elect to obtain agriculture risk coverage'';

7408 (3) in subsection (c)--

7409 (A) in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by

7410 inserting ``or the 2019 crop year, as applicable'' after

7411 ``2014 crop year'';

7412 (B) in paragraph (1), by inserting ``or the 2019

7413 crop year, as applicable,'' after ``2014 crop year'';

7414 and

7415 (C) by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the

7416 following:

7417 ``(2) subject to subsection (h), the producers on the farm

7418 shall be deemed to have elected, as applicable--

7419 ``(A) price loss coverage for all covered

7420 commodities on the farm for the 2015 through 2018 crop

7421 years; and

7422 ``(B) the same coverage for each covered commodity

7423 on the farm for the 2020 through 2023 crop years as was

7424 applicable for the 2015 through 2018 crop years.'';

7425

7426[[Page 132 STAT. 4504]]

7427

7428 (4) in subsection (g)(1), by inserting ``for the 2018 crop

7429 year,'' before ``all of the producers''; and

7430 (5) by adding at the end the following:

7431

7432 ``(h) Option to Change Election.--

7433 ``(1) In general.--For the 2021 crop year and each crop year

7434 thereafter, all of the producers on a farm may change the

7435 election under subsection (a), subsection (c), or this

7436 subsection, as applicable, to price loss coverage or agriculture

7437 risk coverage, as applicable.

7438 ``(2) Applicability.--An election change under paragraph (1)

7439 shall apply to--

7440 ``(A) the crop year for which the election change is

7441 made; and

7442 ``(B) each crop year thereafter until another

7443 election change is made under that paragraph.''.

7444SEC. 1106. PRICE LOSS COVERAGE.

7445

7446 Section 1116 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9016) is

7447amended--

7448 (1) in subsection (a)--

7449 (A) by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as

7450 subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively, and indenting

7451 appropriately;

7452 (B) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) (as so

7453 redesignated)--

7454 (i) by inserting ``or (h)'' after ``subsection

7455 (a)''; and

7456 (ii) by striking ``determines that, for any of

7457 the 2014 through 2018 crop years--'' and inserting

7458 ``determines that--

7459 ``(1) for any of the 2014 through 2018 crop years--'';

7460 (C) in paragraph (1)(B) (as so redesignated), by

7461 striking the period at the end and inserting ``; or'';

7462 and

7463 (D) by adding at the end the following:

7464 ``(2) for any of the 2019 through 2023 crop years--

7465 ``(A) the effective price for the covered commodity

7466 for the crop year; is less than

7467 ``(B) the effective reference price for the covered

7468 commodity for the crop year.'';

7469 (2) in subsection (c)--

7470 (A) by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as

7471 clauses (i) and (ii), respectively, and indenting

7472 appropriately;

7473 (B) in the matter preceding clause (i) (as so

7474 redesignated), by striking ``The payment rate'' and

7475 inserting the following:

7476 ``(1) In general.--

7477 ``(A) 2014 through 2018 crop years.--For the 2014

7478 through 2018 crop years, the payment rate'';

7479 (C) in paragraph (1) (as so designated), by adding

7480 at the end the following:

7481 ``(B) 2019 through 2023 crop years.--For the 2019

7482 through 2023 crop years, the payment rate shall be equal

7483 to the difference between--

7484 ``(i) the effective reference price for the

7485 covered commodity; and

7486 ``(ii) the effective price determined under

7487 subsection (b) for the covered commodity.''; and

7488 (D) by adding at the end the following:

7489

7490[[Page 132 STAT. 4505]]

7491

7492 ``(2) Announcement.--Not later than 30 days after the end of

7493 each applicable 12-month marketing year for each covered

7494 commodity, the Secretary shall publish the payment rate

7495 determined under paragraph (1).

7496 ``(3) Insufficient data.--In the case of a covered

7497 commodity, such as temperate japonica rice, for which the

7498 Secretary cannot determine the payment rate for the most recent

7499 12-month marketing year by the date described in paragraph (2)

7500 due to insufficient reporting of timely pricing data by 1 or

7501 more nongovernmental entities, including a marketing cooperative

7502 for the covered commodity, the Secretary shall publish the

7503 payment rate as soon as practicable after the marketing year

7504 data are made available.''; and

7505 (3) by striking subsection (g) and inserting the following:

7506

7507 ``(g) Reference Price for Temperate Japonica Rice.--In order to

7508reflect price premiums, the Secretary shall provide a reference price

7509with respect to temperate japonica rice in an amount equal to the amount

7510established under subparagraph (F) of section 1111(19), as adjusted by

7511paragraph (8) of such section, multiplied by the ratio obtained by

7512dividing--

7513 ``(1) the simple average of the marketing year average price

7514 of medium grain rice from the 2012 through 2016 crop years; by

7515 ``(2) the simple average of the marketing year average price

7516 of all rice from the 2012 through 2016 crop years.''.

7528 years'';

7529 (2) in subsection (c)--

7530 (A) in paragraph (2)--

7531 (i) in subparagraph (A), by striking

7532 ``paragraph (4)'' and inserting ``paragraphs (4)

7533 and (5)''; and

7534 (ii) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``(5)''

7535 and inserting ``(6)'';

7536 (B) in paragraph (3)--

7543 following:

7549 planted acre for the covered commodity or historical

7550 county yield per planted acre for the covered commodity

7551 for any of

7552

7554

7555 the 5 most recent crop years, as determined by the

7556 Secretary, is less than 80 percent of the transitional

7557 yield, as determined by the Secretary, the amounts used

7558 for any of those years in paragraph (2)(A) or (3)(A)(i)

7559 shall be 80 percent of the transitional yield.'';

7560 (D) by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (6);

7561 (E) by inserting after paragraph (4) the following:

7562 ``(5) Trend-adjusted yield.--The Secretary shall calculate

7563 and use a trend-adjusted yield factor to adjust the yield

7565 taking into consideration, but not exceeding, the trend-adjusted

7566 yield factor that is used to increase yield history under the

7568 et seq.) for that crop and county.''; and

7570 (i) by striking ``Reference price.--If the

7571 national average market price'' and inserting the

7572 following: ``Low national average market price.--

7573 ``(A) Reference price.--For the 2014 through 2018

7574 crop years, if the national average market price''; and

7575 (ii) by adding at the end the following:

7576 ``(B) Effective reference price.--For the 2019

7577 through 2023 crop years, if the national average market

7578 price received by producers during the 12-month

7579 marketing year for any of the 5 most recent crop years

7580 is lower than the effective reference price for the

7581 covered commodity, the Secretary shall use the effective

7582 reference price for any of those years for the amounts

7583 in paragraph (2)(B) or (3)(A)(ii).'';

7584 (3) in subsection (d)--

7585 (A) in paragraph (1), by redesignating subparagraphs

7586 (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively, and

7587 indenting appropriately;

7588 (B) by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as

7589 subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively, and indenting

7590 appropriately;

7591 (C) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) (as so

7592 redesignated), by striking ``The payment'' and inserting

7593 the following:

7594 ``(1) In general.--The payment''; and

7595 (D) by adding at the end the following:

7596 ``(2) Announcement.--Not later than 30 days after the end of

7597 each applicable 12-month marketing year for each covered

7598 commodity, the Secretary shall publish the payment rate

7599 determined under paragraph (1) for each county.'';

7600 (4) in subsection (e), in the matter preceding paragraph

7601 (1), by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023'';

7602 (5) in subsection (g)--

7603 (A) in paragraph (2), by striking ``to the maximum

7604 extent practicable,'';

7605 (B) in paragraph (3), by striking ``and'' after the

7606 semicolon at the end;

7607 (C) in paragraph (4)--

7608 (i) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A),

7609 by inserting ``effective for the 2014 through 2018

7610 crop years,'' before ``in the case of''; and

7611

7612[[Page 132 STAT. 4507]]

7613

7614 (ii) in subparagraph (B), by striking the

7615 period at the end and inserting ``; and''; and

7616 (D) by adding at the end the following:

7617 ``(5) effective for the 2019 through 2023 crop years, in the

7618 case of county coverage, assign an actual or benchmark county

7619 yield for each planted acre for the crop year for the covered

7620 commodity--

7621 ``(A) for a county for which county data collected

7622 by the Risk Management Agency are sufficient for the

7623 Secretary to offer a county-wide insurance product,

7624 using the actual average county yield determined by the

7625 Risk Management Agency; or

7626 ``(B) for a county not described in subparagraph

7627 (A), using--

7628 ``(i) other sources of yield information, as

7629 determined by the Secretary; or

7630 ``(ii) the yield history of representative

7631 farms in the State, region, or crop reporting

7632 district, as determined by the Secretary.''; and

7633 (6) by adding at the end the following:

7634

7635 ``(h) Publications.--

7636 ``(1) County guarantee.--

7637 ``(A) In general.--For each crop year for a covered

7638 commodity, the Secretary shall publish information

7639 describing, for that crop year for the covered commodity

7640 in each county--

7641 ``(i) the agriculture risk coverage guarantee

7642 for county coverage determined under subsection

7643 (c)(1);

7644 ``(ii) the average historical county yield

7645 determined under subsection (c)(2)(A); and

7646 ``(iii) the national average market price

7647 determined under subsection (c)(2)(B).

7648 ``(B) Timing.--

7649 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

7650 clauses (ii) and (iii), not later than 30 days

7651 after the end of each applicable 12-month

7652 marketing year, the Secretary shall publish the

7653 information described in subparagraph (A).

7654 ``(ii) Insufficient data.--In the case of a

7655 covered commodity, such as temperate japonica

7656 rice, for which the Secretary cannot determine the

7657 national average market price for the most recent

7658 12-month marketing year by the date described in

7659 clause (i) due to insufficient reporting of timely

7660 pricing data by 1 or more nongovernmental

7661 entities, including a marketing cooperative for

7662 the covered commodity, as soon as practicable

7663 after the pricing data are made available, the

7664 Secretary shall publish information describing--

7665 ``(I) the agriculture risk coverage

7666 guarantee under subparagraph (A)(i); and

7667 ``(II) the national average market

7668 price under subparagraph (A)(iii).

7669 ``(iii) Transition.--Not later than 60 days

7670 after the date of enactment of the Agriculture

7671 Improvement Act of 2018, the Secretary shall

7672 publish the information described in clauses (i)

7673 and (ii) of subparagraph (A) for the 2018 crop

7674 year.

7675

7676[[Page 132 STAT. 4508]]

7677

7678 ``(2) Actual average county yield.--As soon as practicable

7679 after each crop year, the Secretary shall determine and publish

7680 each actual average county yield for each covered commodity, as

7681 determined under subsection (b)(1)(A).

7682 ``(3) Data sources for county yields.--For the 2018 crop

7683 year and each crop year thereafter, the Secretary shall make

7684 publicly available information describing, for the most recent

7685 crop year--

7686 ``(A) the sources of data used to calculate county

7687 yields under subsection (c)(2)(A) for each covered

7688 commodity--

7689 ``(i) by county; and

7690 ``(ii) nationally; and

7691 ``(B) the number and outcome of occurrences in which

7692 the Farm Service Agency reviewed, changed, or determined

7693 not to change a source of data used to calculate county

7694 yields under subsection (c)(2)(A).

7695

7696 ``(i) Administrative Units.--

7697 ``(1) In general.--For purposes of agriculture risk coverage

7698 payments in the case of county coverage, a county may be divided

7699 into not greater than 2 administrative units in accordance with

7700 this subsection.

7701 ``(2) Eligible counties.--A county that may be divided into

7702 administrative units under this subsection is a county that--

7703 ``(A) is larger than 1,400 square miles; and

7704 ``(B) contains more than 190,000 base acres.

7705 ``(3) Elections.--Before making any agriculture risk

7706 coverage payments for the 2019 crop year, the Farm Service

7707 Agency State committee, in consultation with the Farm Service

7708 Agency county or area committee of a county described in

7709 paragraph (2), may make a 1-time election to divide the county

7710 into administrative units under this subsection along a boundary

7711 that better reflects differences in weather patterns, soil

7712 types, or other factors.

7713 ``(4) Limitation.--The Secretary shall--

7714 ``(A) limit the number of counties that may be

7715 divided into administrative units under paragraph (3) to

7716 25 counties; and

7717 ``(B) give preference to the division of counties

7718 that have greater variation in climate, soils, and

7719 expected productivity between the proposed

7720 administrative units.

7721 ``(5) Administration.--For purposes of providing agriculture

7722 risk coverage payments in the case of county coverage, the

7723 Secretary shall consider an administrative unit elected under

7724 paragraph (3) to be a county for the 2019 through 2023 crop

7725 years.''.

7734 Subtitle B--Marketing Loans

7735

7742U.S.C. 9034) is amended--

7744 (i), by striking ``2019''and inserting ``2024''; and

7745 (2) in subsection (g), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

7746 ``2023''.

7748 (c) Loan Deficiency Payments.--

7749 (1) Extension.--Section 1205(a)(2)(B) of the Agricultural

7750 Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9035(a)(2)(B)) is amended by striking

7751 ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

7756SEC. 1202. LOAN RATES FOR NONRECOURSE MARKETING ASSISTANCE LOANS.

7757

7758 (a) In General.--Section 1202 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7

7759U.S.C. 9032) is amended--

7760 (1) in subsection (a), by striking the subsection heading

7761 and inserting ``2014 through 2018 crop years'';

7762 (2) by redesignating subsections (b) and (c) as subsections

7763 (c) and (d), respectively;

7764 (3) by inserting after subsection (a) the following:

7765

7766 ``(b) 2019 Through 2023 Crop Years.--For purposes of each of the

77672019 through 2023 crop years, the loan rate for a marketing assistance

7768loan under section 1201 for a loan commodity shall be equal to the

7769following:

7770 ``(1) In the case of wheat, $3.38 per bushel.

7771 ``(2) In the case of corn, $2.20 per bushel.

7772 ``(3) In the case of grain sorghum, $2.20 per bushel.

7773 ``(4) In the case of barley, $2.50 per bushel.

7774 ``(5) In the case of oats, $2.00 per bushel.

7775 ``(6)(A) Subject to subparagraphs (B) and (C), in the case

7776 of base quality of upland cotton, the simple average of the

7777 adjusted prevailing world price for the 2 immediately preceding

7778 marketing years, as determined by the Secretary and announced

7779 October 1 preceding the next domestic planting.

7780 ``(B) Except as provided in subparagraph (C), the loan rate

7781 determined under subparagraph (A) may not equal less than an

7782 amount equal to 98 percent of the loan rate for base quality of

7783 upland cotton for the preceding year.

7784 ``(C) The loan rate determined under subparagraph (A) may

7785 not be equal to an amount--

7786 ``(i) less than $0.45 per pound; or

7787 ``(ii) more than $0.52 per pound.

7788 ``(7) In the case of extra long staple cotton, $0.95 per

7789 pound.

7790 ``(8) In the case of long grain rice, $7.00 per

7791 hundredweight.

7792

7793[[Page 132 STAT. 4510]]

7794

7795 ``(9) In the case of medium grain rice, $7.00 per

7796 hundredweight.

7797 ``(10) In the case of soybeans, $6.20 per bushel.

7798 ``(11) In the case of other oilseeds, $10.09 per

7799 hundredweight for each of the following kinds of oilseeds:

7800 ``(A) Sunflower seed.

7801 ``(B) Rapeseed.

7802 ``(C) Canola.

7803 ``(D) Safflower.

7804 ``(E) Flaxseed.

7805 ``(F) Mustard seed.

7806 ``(G) Crambe.

7807 ``(H) Sesame seed.

7808 ``(I) Other oilseeds designated by the Secretary.

7809 ``(12) In the case of dry peas, $6.15 per hundredweight.

7810 ``(13) In the case of lentils, $13.00 per hundredweight.

7811 ``(14) In the case of small chickpeas, $10.00 per

7812 hundredweight.

7813 ``(15) In the case of large chickpeas, $14.00 per

7814 hundredweight.

7815 ``(16) In the case of graded wool, $1.15 per pound.

7816 ``(17) In the case of nongraded wool, $0.40 per pound.

7817 ``(18) In the case of mohair, $4.20 per pound.

7818 ``(19) In the case of honey, $0.69 per pound.

7819 ``(20) In the case of peanuts, $355 per ton.''; and

7820 (4) in subsection (c) (as so redesignated), by striking

7821 ``subsection (a)(11)'' and inserting ``subsections (a)(11) and

7822 (b)(11)''.

7823

7824 (b) Conforming Amendment.--Section 1204(h)(1) of the Agricultural

7825Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9034(h)(1)) is amended by striking ``section

78261202(a)(20)'' and inserting ``subsection (a)(20) or (b)(20), as

7827applicable, of section 1202''.

7828SEC. 1203. ECONOMIC ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE FOR TEXTILE MILLS.

7831Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 8737) is amended by striking subsection

7832(c).

7833 (b) 2014 Authority.--Section 1207(c) of the Agricultural Act of 2014

7835inserting ``Economic Adjustment Assistance for Textile Mills''.

7836SEC. 1204. SPECIAL COMPETITIVE PROVISIONS FOR EXTRA LONG STAPLE

7837 COTTON.

7838

7839 (a) In General.--Section 1208(a) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7

7840U.S.C. 9038(a)) is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by

7841striking ``2019'' and inserting ``2024''.

7842 (b) Payments Under Program; Trigger.--Section 1208(b)(2) of the

7843Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9038(b)(2)) is amended by striking

7844``134 percent'' and inserting ``113 percent''.

7845SEC. 1205. AVAILABILITY OF RECOURSE LOANS.

7846

7847 (a) In General.--Section 1209 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7

7848U.S.C. 9039) is amended in subsections (a)(2) and (b) by striking

7849``2018'' each place it appears and inserting ``2023''.

7850 (b) Recourse Loans Available for Contaminated Commodities.--Section

78511209 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9039) is amended--

7852 (1) by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d); and

7853

7854[[Page 132 STAT. 4511]]

7855

7856 (2) by inserting after subsection (b) the following:

7857

7858 ``(c) Recourse Loans Available for Contaminated Commodities.--In the

7859case of a loan commodity that is ineligible for 100 percent of the

7860nonrecourse marketing loan rate in the county due to a determination

7861that the commodity is contaminated yet still merchantable, for each of

7862the 2019 through 2023 crops of such loan commodity, the Secretary shall

7863make available recourse commodity loans, at the rate provided under

7864section 1202, on any production.''.

7866 Subtitle C--Sugar

7867

7868SEC. 1301. SUGAR POLICY.

7869

7870 (a) Sugar Program.--

7871 (1) Sugarcane.--Section 156(a) of the Federal Agriculture

7872 Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C. 7272(a)) is

7873 amended--

7874 (A) in paragraph (3), by striking ``and'' at the

7875 end;

7876 (B) in paragraph (4), by striking the period at the

7877 end and inserting ``; and''; and

7878 (C) by adding at the end the following:

7879 ``(5) 19.75 cents per pound for raw cane sugar for each of

7880 the 2019 through 2023 crop years.''.

7881 (2) Sugar beets.--Section 156(b)(2) of the Federal

7882 Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C.

7883 7272(b)(2)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

7884 ``2023''.

7885 (3) Effective period.--Section 156(i) of the Federal

7886 Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C.

7887 7272(i)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

7888

7889 (b) Flexible Marketing Allotments for Sugar.--

7890 (1) Sugar estimates.--Section 359b(a)(1) of the Agricultural

7891 Adjustment Act of 1938 (7 U.S.C. 1359bb(a)(1)) is amended by

7892 striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

7893 (2) Effective period.--Section 359l(a) of the Agricultural

7894 Adjustment Act of 1938 (7 U.S.C. 1359ll(a)) is amended by

7895 striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

7896

7897 Subtitle D--Dairy Margin Coverage and Other Dairy Related Provisions

7898

7899SEC. 1401. DAIRY MARGIN COVERAGE.

7900

7901 (a) Review of Data Used in Calculation of Average Feed Cost.--Not

7902later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

7903Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

7904Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and

7905Forestry of the Senate a report evaluating the extent to which the

7906average cost of feed used by a dairy operation to produce a

7907hundredweight of milk calculated by the Secretary as required by section

79081402(a) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9052(a)) is

7909representative of actual dairy feed costs.

7910 (b) Corn Silage Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date of the

7911enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on

7912Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on

7913Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

7914

7915[[Page 132 STAT. 4512]]

7916

7917Senate a report detailing the costs incurred by dairy operations in the

7918use of corn silage as feed, and the difference between the feed cost of

7919corn silage and the feed cost of corn.

7920 (c) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 9052 note.&gt;&gt; Collection of Alfalfa Hay Data.--Not

7921later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

7922Secretary, acting through the National Agricultural Statistics Service,

7923shall revise monthly price survey reports to include prices for high-

7924quality alfalfa hay in the top five milk producing States, as measured

7925by volume of milk produced during the previous month.

7926

7927 (d) Registration of Multiproducer Dairy Operations.--Section 1404(b)

7928of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9054(b)) is amended--

7929 (1) by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and

7930 (2) by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following:

7931 ``(3) Election period for 2019 calendar year.--For the 2019

7932 calendar year, the Secretary shall--

7933 ``(A) open the election period not later than 60

7934 days after the effective date described in section

7935 1401(m) of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018; and

7936 ``(B) hold that election period open for not less

7937 than 90 days.

7938 ``(4) Treatment of multiproducer dairy operation.--

7939 ``(A) In general.--If a participating dairy

7940 operation is operated by more than 1 dairy producer, the

7941 dairy producers of the dairy operation who elect to

7942 participate shall be treated as a single dairy operation

7943 for purposes of participating in dairy margin coverage.

7944 ``(B) Rule of construction.--Subparagraph (A) shall

7945 not be construed to allow a producer to adjust the

7946 proportion of their share covered under tier I or tier

7947 II premiums from the proportion covered for the

7948 operation.''.

7949

7950 (e) Relation to Livestock Gross Margin for Dairy Program.--

7951 (1) In general.--Section 1404 of the Agricultural Act of

7952 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9054) is amended by striking subsection (d).

7953 (2) Retroactive program option.--Section 1404(b)(2) of the

7954 Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9054(b)(2)) is amended--

7955 (A) by striking ``The Secretary'' and inserting the

7956 following:

7957 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary''; and

7958 (B) by adding at the end the following:

7959 ``(B) Retroactive program option.--In the case of a

7960 dairy operation that, by operation of subsection (d) (as

7961 in effect on the day before the date of enactment of the

7962 Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018), was ineligible to

7963 participate in the margin protection program for any

7964 part of calendar year 2018, the Secretary shall

7965 establish a new election period for that calendar year

7966 that ends on a date that is not less than 90 days after

7967 the date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act

7968 of 2018 and the Secretary determines is necessary for

7969 dairy operations to make new elections to participate in

7970 the margin protection program (as in effect on the day

7971 before the date of enactment of the Agriculture

7972 Improvement Act of 2018) for that calendar year,

7973 including dairy operations that elected to participate

7974 in the livestock gross margin for dairy program under

7975 the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1501 et

7976

7977[[Page 132 STAT. 4513]]

7978

7979 seq.) before the date of enactment of the Bipartisan

7980 Budget Act of 2018 (Public Law 115-123).''.

7981

7982 (f) Production History of Participating Dairy Operators.--

7983 (1) Adjustment.--Section 1405 of the Agricultural Act of

7984 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9055) is amended--

7985 (A) in subsection (a)--

7986 (i) in paragraph (2), by striking ``In

7987 subsequent years'' and inserting ``In the

7988 subsequent calendar years ending before January 1,

7989 2019''; and

7990 (ii) in paragraph (3), by inserting ``, as

7991 applicable'' after ``paragraph (2)''; and

7992 (B) in subsection (b)--

7993 (i) by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as

7994 subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively, and

7995 indenting appropriately;

7996 (ii) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)

7997 (as so redesignated), by striking ``In the case''

7998 and inserting the following:

7999 ``(1) Dairy operations with less than 1 year of production

8000 history.--In the case''; and

8001 (iii) by adding at the end the following:

8002 ``(2) Dairy operations with 1 year or more of production

8003 history.--In the case of a participating dairy operation that

8004 was not in operation prior to January 1, 2014, that has not

8005 established a production history, and that has been in operation

8006 for equal to or longer than 1 year, the participating dairy

8007 operation shall elect the annual milk marketings during any 1

8008 calendar year to determine the production history of the

8009 participating dairy operation.

8010 ``(3) Adjustment.--The Secretary shall adjust the production

8011 history of a participating dairy operation determined under

8012 paragraph (1) or (2) to reflect any increase or decrease in the

8013 national average milk production relative to calendar year

8014 2017.''.

8015 (2) Limitation on changes to business structure.--Section

8016 1405 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9055) is amended

8017 by adding at the end the following new subsection:

8018

8019 ``(d) Limitation on Changes to Business Structure.--The Secretary

8020may not make dairy margin coverage payments to a participating dairy

8021operation if the Secretary determines that the participating dairy

8022operation has reorganized the structure of such operation solely for the

8023purpose of qualifying as a new operation under subsection (b).''.

8024 (g) Coverage Level Threshold and Coverage Percentage.--Section 1406

8025of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9056) is amended by striking

8026subsection (a) and inserting the following:

8027 ``(a) Coverage Level Threshold and Coverage Percentage.--

8028 ``(1) Coverage level threshold.--

8029 ``(A) In general.--For purposes of receiving dairy

8030 margin coverage payments for a month, a participating

8031 dairy operation shall annually elect a coverage level

8032 threshold that is equal to $4.00, $4.50, $5.00, $5.50,

8033 $6.00, $6.50, $7.00, $7.50, $8.00, $8.50, $9.00, or

8034 $9.50.

8035 ``(B) Applicability.--Except as provided in

8036 subparagraph (C), the coverage level threshold elected

8037 under

8038

8039[[Page 132 STAT. 4514]]

8040

8041 subparagraph (A) shall apply to the covered production

8042 elected by the participating dairy operation under

8043 paragraph (2).

8044 ``(C) Second coverage election for tier ii.--In the

8045 case of a participating dairy operation that elects a

8046 coverage level threshold of $8.50, $9.00, or $9.50 under

8047 subparagraph (A)--

8048 ``(i) that coverage level threshold shall

8049 apply to the first 5,000,000 pounds of milk

8050 marketings included in the covered production

8051 elected by the participating dairy operation; and

8052 ``(ii) the participating dairy operation shall

8053 elect a coverage level threshold that is equal to

8054 $4.00, $4.50, $5.00, $5.50, $6.00, $6.50, $7.00,

8055 $7.50, or $8.00 to apply to milk marketings in

8056 excess of 5,000,000 pounds included in the covered

8057 production elected by the participating dairy

8058 operation.

8059 ``(2) Coverage percentage.--For purposes of receiving dairy

8060 margin coverage payments for a month, a participating dairy

8061 operation shall annually elect a percentage of coverage, in 5-

8062 percent increments, not exceeding 95 percent of the production

8063 history of the participating dairy operation.''.

8064

8115

8116 (i) Repayment of Premiums.--Section 1407 of the Agricultural Act of

81172014 (7 U.S.C. 9057) is amended by adding at the end the following:

8118 ``(f) Repayment of Premiums.--

8119 ``(1) In general.--Each dairy operation described in

8120 paragraph (2) shall be eligible to receive a repayment from the

8121 Secretary in an amount equal to the difference between--

8122 ``(A) the total amount of premiums paid by the

8123 participating dairy operation under this section for

8124 each applicable calendar year; and

8125 ``(B) the total amount of payments made to the

8126 participating dairy operation under section 1406 for

8127 that calendar year.

8128 ``(2) Eligibility.--A dairy operation that is eligible to

8129 receive a repayment under paragraph (1) is a dairy operation

8130 that--

8131 ``(A) participated in the margin protection program,

8132 as in effect for any of calendar years 2014 through

8133 2017; and

8134 ``(B) submits to the Secretary an application for

8135 the repayment at such time, in such manner, and

8136 containing such information as the Secretary may

8137 require.

8138 ``(3) Method of repayment.--A dairy operation that is

8139 eligible to receive a repayment under paragraph (1) shall elect

8140 to receive the repayment--

8141 ``(A) in an amount equal to 75 percent of the

8142 repayment calculated under that paragraph as credit that

8143 may be used by the dairy operation for dairy margin

8144 coverage premiums; or

8145 ``(B) in an amount equal to 50 percent of the

8146 repayment calculated under that paragraph as a direct

8147 cash repayment.

8148 ``(4) Applicability.--Paragraph (1) shall only apply to a

8149 calendar year during the period of calendar years 2014 through

8150 2017 for which the amount described in subparagraph (A) of that

8151 paragraph is greater than the amount described in subparagraph

8152 (B) of that paragraph.''.

8153

8154 (j) Premium Discount.--Section 1407 of the Agricultural Act of 2014

8155(7 U.S.C. 9057) (as amended by subsection (i)) is amended by adding at

8156the end the following:

8157 ``(g) Premium Discount.--The premium per hundredweight specified in

8158the tables contained in subsections (b) and (c) for each coverage level

8159shall be reduced by 25 percent in accordance with the following:

8160

8161[[Page 132 STAT. 4516]]

8162

8163 ``(1) In general.--For each of calendar years 2019 through

8164 2023, for a participating dairy operation that makes a 1-time

8165 election of coverage level in a tier and of a percentage of

8166 coverage under section 1406(a) for the 5-year period beginning

8167 in January 2019.

8168 ``(2) New dairy operations.--For each applicable calendar

8169 year through 2023, for a participating dairy operation that--

8170 ``(A) establishes a production history pursuant to

8171 section 1405(b); and

8172 ``(B) makes a 1-time election of coverage level in a

8173 tier and of a percentage of coverage under section

8174 1406(a) for the period beginning with the first

8175 available calendar year and ending in December 2023.

8176 ``(3) Full participation required.--Notwithstanding the

8177 annual elections under section 1406(a)--

8178 ``(A) a 1-time enrollment under this subsection

8179 shall remain in effect for the full duration applicable

8180 to a participating dairy operation in accordance with

8181 paragraph (1) or (2)(B), as applicable; and

8182 ``(B) a participating dairy operation that makes a

8183 1-time enrollment under this subsection and is

8184 noncompliant under section 1408 shall be subject to that

8185 section.''.

8186

8187 (k) Conforming Amendments Related to Program Name.--

8188 (1) Heading.--The heading of part I of subtitle D of title I

8189 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law 113-79; 128 Stat.

8190 688) is amended to read as follows:

8191

8192 ``PART I--DAIRY MARGIN COVERAGE''.

8193

8194 (2) Definitions.--Section 1401 of the Agricultural Act of

8195 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9051) is amended--

8196 (A) by striking paragraphs (5) and (6) and inserting

8197 the following new paragraphs:

8199 coverage' means the dairy margin coverage program required by

8200 section 1403.

8202 coverage payment' means a payment made to a participating dairy

8203 operation under dairy margin coverage pursuant to section

8204 1406.''; and

8205 (B) in paragraphs (7) and (8), by striking ``the

8206 margin protection program'' both places it appears and

8207 inserting ``dairy margin coverage''.

8209 1402(b)(1) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9052(b)(1))

8210 is amended in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) by striking

8212 coverage''.
