8307SEC. 1402. REAUTHORIZATIONS.

8308

8309 (a) Forward Pricing.--Section 1502(e) of the Food, Conservation, and

8310Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 8772(e)) is amended--

8311 (1) in paragraph (1), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

8312 ``2023''; and

8313 (2) in paragraph (2), by striking ``2021'' and inserting

8314 ``2026''.

8315

8316 (b) Indemnity Program.--Section 3 of Public Law 90-484 (7 U.S.C.

83174553) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

8318 (c) Promotion and Research.--Section 113(e)(2) of the Dairy

8319Production Stabilization Act of 1983 (7 U.S.C. 4504(e)(2)) is amended by

8320striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

8321SEC. 1403. CLASS I SKIM MILK PRICE.

8322

8323 (a) Class I Skim Milk Price.--Section 8c(5)(A) of the Agricultural

8324Adjustment Act (7 U.S.C. 608c(5)(A)), reenacted with amendments by the

8325Agricultural Marketing Agreement Act of 1937, is amended by striking

8326``Throughout'' in the third sentence and all that follows through the

8327period at the end of the fourth sentence and inserting ``Throughout the

83282-year period beginning on the effective date of this sentence (and

8329subsequent to such 2-year period unless modified by amendment to the

8330order involved), for purposes of determining prices for milk of the

8331highest use classification, the Class I skim milk price per

8332hundredweight specified in section 1000.50(b) of title 7, Code of

8333Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), shall be the sum of the

8334adjusted Class I differential specified in section 1000.52 of such title

83357 (or successor regulations), plus the adjustment to Class I prices

8336specified in sections 1005.51(b), 1006.51(b), and 1007.51(b) of such

8337title 7 (or successor regulations), plus the simple average of the

8338advanced pricing factors computed in sections 1000.50(q)(1) and

83391000.50(q)(2) of such title 7 (or successor regulations), plus $0.74.''.

8340 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 608c note.&gt;&gt; Effective Date and Implementation.--

8341 (1) Effective date.--The amendment made by subsection (a)

8342 shall take effect on the first day of the first month beginning

8343 more than 120 days after the date of enactment of this Act.

8344 (2) Implementation.--Implementation of the amendment made by

8345 subsection (a) shall not be subject to any of the following:

8346 (A) The notice and comment provisions of section 553

8347 of title 5, United States Code.

8348

8349[[Page 132 STAT. 4519]]

8350

8351 (B) The notice and hearing requirements of section

8352 8c(3) of the Agricultural Adjustment Act (7 U.S.C.

8353 608c(3)), reenacted with amendments by the Agricultural

8354 Marketing Agreement Act of 1937.

8355 (C) The order amendment requirements of section

8356 8c(17) of that Act (7 U.S.C. 608c(17)).

8357 (D) A referendum under section 8c(19) of that Act (7

8358 U.S.C. 608c(19)).

8359SEC. 1404. DAIRY PRODUCT DONATION.

8360

8361 (a) Repeal of Dairy Product Donation Program.--Section 1431 of the

8362Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9071) is repealed.

8363 (b) Milk Donation Program.--

8364 (1) In general.--Part III of subtitle D of title I of the

8365 Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law 113-79; 128 Stat. 695) is

8366 amended to read as follows:

8367

8368 ``PART III--MILK DONATION PROGRAM

8369

8370``SEC. 1431. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 9071.&gt;&gt; MILK DONATION PROGRAM.

8371

8372 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

8373 ``(1) Eligible dairy organization.--The term `eligible dairy

8374 organization' means a dairy farmer (either individually or as

8375 part of a cooperative), or a dairy processor, who--

8376 ``(A) accounts to a Federal milk marketing order

8377 marketwide pool; and

8378 ``(B) incurs qualified expenses under subsection

8379 (e).

8380 ``(2) Eligible distributor.--The term `eligible distributor'

8381 means a public or private nonprofit organization that

8382 distributes donated eligible milk.

8383 ``(3) Eligible milk.--The term `eligible milk' means Class I

8384 fluid milk products produced and processed in the United States.

8385 ``(4) Eligible partnership.--The term `eligible partnership'

8386 means a partnership between an eligible dairy organization and

8387 an eligible distributor.

8388 ``(5) Participating partnership.--The term `participating

8389 partnership' means an eligible partnership for which the

8390 Secretary has approved a donation and distribution plan for

8391 eligible milk under subsection (c)(2).

8392

8393 ``(b) Program Required; Purposes.--Not later than 180 days after the

8394date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, the

8395Secretary shall establish and administer a milk donation program for the

8396purposes of--

8397 ``(1) encouraging the donation of eligible milk;

8398 ``(2) providing nutrition assistance to individuals in low-

8399 income groups; and

8400 ``(3) reducing food waste.

8401

8402 ``(c) Donation and Distribution Plans.--

8403 ``(1) In general.--To be eligible to receive reimbursement

8404 under subsection (d), an eligible partnership shall submit to

8405 the Secretary a donation and distribution plan that--

8406 ``(A) describes the process that the eligible

8407 partnership will use for the donation, processing,

8408 transportation, temporary storage, and distribution of

8409 eligible milk;

8410

8411[[Page 132 STAT. 4520]]

8412

8413 ``(B) includes an estimate of the quantity of

8414 eligible milk that the eligible partnership will donate

8415 each year, based on--

8416 ``(i) preplanned donations; and

8417 ``(ii) contingency plans to address

8418 unanticipated donations; and

8419 ``(C) describes the rate at which the eligible

8420 partnership will be reimbursed, which shall be based on

8421 a percentage of the limitation described in subsection

8422 (e)(2), not to exceed 100 percent.

8423 ``(2) Review and approval.--Not less frequently than

8424 annually, the Secretary shall--

8425 ``(A) review donation and distribution plans

8426 submitted under paragraph (1); and

8427 ``(B) determine whether to approve or disapprove

8428 each of those donation and distribution plans.

8429

8430 ``(d) Reimbursement.--

8431 ``(1) In general.--On receipt of appropriate documentation

8432 under paragraph (2), the Secretary shall reimburse an eligible

8433 dairy organization that is a member of a participating

8434 partnership on a regular basis for qualified expenses described

8435 in subsection (e).

8436 ``(2) Documentation.--

8437 ``(A) In general.--An eligible dairy organization

8438 shall submit to the Secretary such documentation as the

8439 Secretary may require to demonstrate the qualified

8440 expenses described in subsection (e) of the eligible

8441 dairy organization.

8442 ``(B) Verification.--The Secretary may verify the

8443 accuracy of documentation submitted under subparagraph

8444 (A) by spot checks and audits.

8445 ``(3) Retroactive reimbursement.--In providing

8446 reimbursements under paragraph (1), the Secretary may provide

8447 reimbursements for qualified expenses incurred before the date

8448 on which the donation and distribution plan for the applicable

8449 participating partnership was approved by the Secretary.

8450

8451 ``(e) Qualified Expenses.--

8452 ``(1) In general.--The amount of a reimbursement under

8453 subsection (d) shall be an amount equal to the product of--

8454 ``(A) the quantity of eligible milk donated by the

8455 eligible dairy organization under a donation and

8456 distribution plan approved by the Secretary under

8457 subsection (c); and

8458 ``(B) subject to the limitation under paragraph (2),

8459 the rate described in that donation and distribution

8460 plan under subsection (c)(1)(C).

8461 ``(2) Limitation.--Expenses eligible for reimbursement under

8462 subsection (d) shall not exceed the value that an eligible dairy

8463 organization incurred by accounting to the Federal milk

8464 marketing order pool at the difference in the Class I milk value

8465 and the lowest classified price for the applicable month (either

8466 Class III milk or Class IV milk).

8467

8468 ``(f) Preapproval.--

8469 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall--

8470 ``(A) establish a process for an eligible

8471 partnership to apply for preapproval of donation and

8472 distribution plans under subsection (c); and

8473

8474[[Page 132 STAT. 4521]]

8475

8476 ``(B) not less frequently than annually, preapprove

8477 an amount for qualified expenses described in subsection

8478 (e) that the Secretary will allocate for reimbursement

8479 under each donation and distribution plan preapproved

8480 under subparagraph (A), based on an assessment of--

8481 ``(i) the feasibility of the plan; and

8482 ``(ii) the extent to which the plan advances

8483 the purposes described in subsection (b).

8484 ``(2) Preference.--In preapproving amounts for reimbursement

8485 under paragraph (1)(B), the Secretary shall give preference to

8486 eligible partnerships that will provide funding and in-kind

8487 contributions in addition to the reimbursements.

8488 ``(3) Adjustments.--

8489 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall adjust or

8490 increase amounts preapproved for reimbursement under

8491 paragraph (1)(B) based on performance and demand.

8492 ``(B) Requests for increase.--

8493 ``(i) In general.--The Secretary shall

8494 establish a procedure for a participating

8495 partnership to request an increase in the amount

8496 preapproved for reimbursement under paragraph

8497 (1)(B) based on changes in conditions.

8498 ``(ii) Interim approval; incremental

8499 increase.--The Secretary may provide an interim

8500 approval of an increase requested under clause (i)

8501 and an incremental increase in the amount of

8502 reimbursement to the applicable participating

8503 partnership to allow time for the Secretary to

8504 review the request without interfering with the

8505 donation and distribution of eligible milk by the

8506 participating partnership.

8507

8508 ``(g) Prohibition on Resale of Products.--

8509 ``(1) In general.--An eligible distributor that receives

8510 eligible milk donated under this section may not sell the

8511 products back into commercial markets.

8512 ``(2) Prohibition on future participation.--An eligible

8513 distributor that the Secretary determines has violated paragraph

8514 (1) shall not be eligible for any future participation in the

8515 program established under this section.

8516

8517 ``(h) Administration.--The Secretary shall publicize opportunities

8518to participate in the program established under this section.

8519 ``(i) Reviews.--The Secretary shall conduct appropriate reviews or

8520audits to ensure the integrity of the program established under this

8521section.

8522 ``(j) Funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity Credit Corporation,

8523the Secretary shall use to carry out this section $9,000,000 for fiscal

8524year 2019, and $5,000,000 for each fiscal year thereafter, to remain

8525available until expended.''.

8526 (2) Conforming amendment.--Section 1401 of the Agricultural

8527 Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9051) is amended, in the matter preceding

8528 paragraph (1), by striking ``and part III''.

8529

8530[[Page 132 STAT. 4522]]

8531

8532 Subtitle E--Supplemental Agricultural Disaster Assistance

8533

8534SEC. 1501. SUPPLEMENTAL AGRICULTURAL DISASTER ASSISTANCE.

8535

8536 (a) Members of Indian Tribes.--Section 1501(a)(1)(B) of the

8537Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(a)(1)(B)) is amended--

8538 (1) by redesignating clauses (iii) and (iv) as clauses (iv)

8539 and (v), respectively; and

8540 (2) by inserting after clause (ii) the following:

8541 ``(iii) an Indian tribe or tribal organization

8542 (as those terms are defined in section 4 of the

8543 Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance

8544 Act (25 U.S.C. 5304));''.

8545

8546 (b) Covered Livestock Losses for Livestock Indemnity Payments.--

8547Section 1501(b) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(b)) is

8548amended--

8549 (1) in paragraph (1)--

8550 (A) by striking ``or'' at the end of subparagraph

8551 (A);

8552 (B) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``cold.'' and

8553 inserting ``cold, on the condition that in the case of

8554 the death loss of unweaned livestock due to that adverse

8555 weather, the Secretary may disregard any management

8556 practice, vaccination protocol, or lack of vaccination

8557 by the eligible producer on a farm; or''; and

8558 (C) by adding at the end the following new

8559 subparagraph:

8560 ``(C) disease that, as determined by the Secretary--

8561 ``(i) is caused or transmitted by a vector;

8562 and

8563 ``(ii) is not susceptible to control by

8564 vaccination or acceptable management practices.'';

8565 and

8566 (2) in paragraph (4), by striking ``A payment'' and

8567 inserting ``Payment reductions.--A payment''.

8568

8569 (c) Emergency Assistance for Livestock, Honey Bees, and Farm-raised

8570Fish.--

8571 (1) In general.--Section 1501(d)(2) of the Agricultural Act

8572 of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(d)(2)) is amended by inserting ``,

8573 including inspections of cattle tick fever'' before the period

8574 at the end.

8575 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 9081 note.&gt;&gt; Effective date.--The

8576 amendment made by paragraph (1) shall apply to inspections of

8577 cattle tick fever conducted on or after the date of enactment of

8578 this Act.

8579

8580 (d) Tree Assistance Program.--Section 1501(e) of the Agricultural

8581Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(e)) is amended--

8582 (1) in paragraph (3), in the matter preceding subparagraph

8583 (A), by striking ``paragraph (4)'' and inserting ``paragraphs

8584 (4) and (5)''; and

8585 (2) by adding at the end the following:

8586 ``(5) Payment rate for beginning and veteran producers.--

8587 Subject to paragraph (4), in the case of a beginning farmer or

8588 rancher or a veteran farmer or rancher (as those terms are

8589 defined in subsection (a) of section 2501 of the Food,

8590 Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C.

8591 2279)) that is eligible to receive assistance under this

8592 subsection, the Secretary shall provide reimbursement of 75

8593 percent of the costs under subparagraphs (A)(i) and (B) of

8594 paragraph (3).''.

8595

8596[[Page 132 STAT. 4523]]

8597

8598 (e) Payment Limitation.--Section 1501(f)(2) of the Agricultural Act

8599of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(f)(2)) is amended by striking ``this section

8600(excluding payments received under subsections (b) and (e))'' and

8601inserting ``subsection (c)''.

8602

8603 Subtitle F--Noninsured Crop Assistance

8604

8605SEC. 1601. NONINSURED CROP ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.

8606

8607 Section 196 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of

86081996 (7 U.S.C. 7333) is amended--

8609 (1) in subsection (a)--

8610 (A) in paragraph (1), by adding at the end the

8611 following:

8612 ``(C) Data collection and sharing.--The Secretary

8613 shall coordinate with the Administrator of the Risk

8614 Management Agency on the type and format of data

8615 received under the noninsured crop disaster assistance

8616 program that--

8617 ``(i) best facilitates the use of that data in

8618 developing policies or plans of insurance offered

8619 under the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

8620 1501 et seq.); and

8621 ``(ii) ensures the availability of that data

8622 on a regular basis.

8623 ``(D) Coordination.--The Secretary shall coordinate

8624 between the agencies of the Department that provide

8625 programs or services to farmers and ranchers that are

8626 potentially eligible for the noninsured crop disaster

8627 assistance program under this section--

8628 ``(i) to make available coverage under--

8629 ``(I) the fee waiver under

8630 subsection (k)(2); or

8631 ``(II) the premium discount under

8632 subsection (l)(3); and

8633 ``(ii) to share eligibility information to

8634 reduce paperwork and avoid duplication.'';

8635 (B) in paragraph (2), by striking subparagraph (A)

8636 and inserting the following:

8637 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), in

8638 this section, the term `eligible crop' means each

8639 commercial crop or other agricultural commodity that is

8640 produced for food or fiber (except livestock) for which

8641 catastrophic risk protection under subsection (b) of

8642 section 508 of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

8643 1508) and additional coverage under subsections (c) and

8644 (h) of such section are not available or, if such

8645 coverage is available, it is only available under a

8646 policy that provides coverage for specific intervals

8647 based on weather indexes or under a whole farm plan of

8648 insurance.''; and

8649 (C) in paragraph (4)(B)--

8650 (i) by striking clause (i) and inserting the

8651 following:

8652 ``(i) In general.--

8653 ``(I) Agricultural act of 2014.--

8654 During the first 4 crop years of

8655 planting, as determined by the

8656 Secretary, native sod acreage that has

8657 been tilled for the production of an

8658 annual crop during the period beginning

8659 on February 8, 2014, and ending on the

8660 date of enactment of the Agriculture

8661

8662[[Page 132 STAT. 4524]]

8663

8664 Improvement Act of 2018 shall be subject

8665 to a reduction in benefits under this

8666 section as described in this

8667 subparagraph.

8668 ``(II) Subsequent years.--Native sod

8669 acreage that has been tilled for the

8670 production of an eligible crop after the

8671 date of enactment of the Agriculture

8672 Improvement Act of 2018 shall be subject

8673 to a reduction in benefits under this

8674 section as described in this

8675 subparagraph for not more than any 4

8676 crop years--

8677 ``(aa) during the first 10

8678 crop years after the initial

8679 tillage; and

8680 ``(bb) during which a crop

8681 on that acreage is enrolled

8682 under subsection (l)(2) or

8683 (k).''; and

8684 (ii) in clause (iii)(I), by striking

8685 ``transitional yield of the producer'' and

8686 inserting ``county expected yield'';

8687 (2) in subsection (b)--

8688 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``not later than

8689 30 days'' and inserting ``by an appropriate deadline'';

8690 and

8691 (B) by adding at the end the following:

8692 ``(4) Streamlined submission process.--The Secretary shall

8693 establish a streamlined process for the submission of records

8694 and acreage reports under paragraphs (2) and (3) for diverse

8695 production systems such as those typical of urban production

8696 systems, other small-scale production systems, and direct-to-

8697 consumer production systems.'';

8698 (3) in subsection (d)--

8699 (A) by redesignating paragraphs (1), (2), and (3) as

8700 paragraphs (2), (3), and (4), respectively;

8701 (B) by inserting before paragraph (2) (as so

8702 redesignated) the following:

8703 ``(1) the producer's share of the total acres devoted to the

8704 eligible crop; by''; and

8705 (C) in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated), by

8706 striking ``established yield for the crop'' and

8707 inserting ``approved yield for the crop, as determined

8708 by the Secretary'';

8709 (4) in subsection (e)--

8710 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``farm'' and

8711 inserting ``approved'';

8712 (B) in paragraph (2)--

8713 (i) in the second sentence--

8714 (I) by inserting ``approved'' before

8715 ``yield''; and

8716 (II) by striking ``Subject'' and

8717 inserting the following:

8718 ``(B) Calculation.--Subject''; and

8719 (ii) in the matter preceding subparagraph (B)

8720 (as so designated)--

8721 (I) by striking ``yield coverage''

8722 and inserting ``an approved yield''; and

8723 (II) by striking ``The Secretary''

8724 and inserting the following:

8725 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary''; and

8726 (C) in paragraph (3), by striking ``transitional

8727 yield of the producer'' and inserting ``county expected

8728 yield'';

8729 (5) in subsection (i)(2), by striking ``exceed $125,000''

8730 and inserting the following: ``exceed--

8731

8732[[Page 132 STAT. 4525]]

8733

8735 subsection (c), $125,000; and

8736 ``(B) in the case of additional coverage under

8737 subsection (l), $300,000'';

8738 (6) in subsection (k)(1)--

8739 (A) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``$250'' and

8740 inserting ``$325''; and

8749 and (C) as subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D),

8750 respectively;

8751 (ii) by inserting before subparagraph (B) (as

8752 so redesignated) the following:

8753 ``(A) the producer's share of the total acres

8754 devoted to the crop;''; and

8756 redesignated), by inserting ``, contract price, or

8762 the end;

8767 crop; or'';

8768 (C) by striking paragraphs (3) and (5); and

8769 (D) by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3).

8819SEC. 1704. ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME LIMITATIONS.

8824 Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,'' after ``under''; and

8827 established by paragraph (1) with respect to a payment pursuant

8828 to a covered benefit described in paragraph (2)(C), on a case-

8829 by-case basis, if the Secretary determines that environmentally

8830 sensitive land of special significance would be protected as a

8831 result of such waiver.''.

8834Act of 1985 (7 U.S.C. 1308-3a(b)(1)) is amended by inserting ``subject

8835to paragraph (3),'' after ``of law,''.

8838before the date of enactment of this Act, shall apply with respect to
