8840described in subsection (b)(2) of that section (as so in effect on that

8841day).

8842SEC. 1705. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6932 note.&gt;&gt; FARM SERVICE AGENCY

8843 ACCOUNTABILITY.

8844

8845 (a) In General.--Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment

8846of this Act, the Secretary shall establish policies, procedures, and

8847plans to improve program accountability and integrity through targeted

8848and coordinated activities, including utilizing data mining to identify

8849and reduce errors, waste, fraud, and abuse in programs administered by

8850the Farm Service Agency.

8851 (b) Report.--Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of

8852this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of

8853the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

8854Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report describing the progress

8855and results of the activities conducted under subsection (a).

8856

8857[[Page 132 STAT. 4527]]

8858

8859SEC. 1706. IMPLEMENTATION.

8860

8861 (a) Maintenance of Base Acres and Payment Yields.--Section 1614(a)

8862of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9097(a)) is amended by

8863inserting ``, and as adjusted pursuant to sections 1112 and 1113''

8864before the period at the end.

8865 (b) Streamlining.--Section 1614 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7

8866U.S.C. 9097) is amended by striking subsection (b) and inserting the

8867following:

8868 ``(b) Streamlining.--In implementing this title and the amendments

8869made by this title, the Secretary shall--

8870 ``(1) continue to reduce administrative burdens and costs to

8871 producers by streamlining and reducing paperwork, forms, and

8872 other administrative requirements, to ensure that--

8873 ``(A) a producer (or an agent of a producer) may

8874 report information, electronically (including geospatial

8875 data) or conventionally, to the Department of

8876 Agriculture, subject to the Secretary--

8877 ``(i) establishing reasonable levels of

8878 tolerance that reflect the differences in accuracy

8879 between measures of common land units and

8880 geospatial data; and

8881 ``(ii) ensuring that discrepancies that occur

8882 within the levels of tolerance established under

8883 clause (i) shall not be used to penalize a

8884 producer (or an agent of a producer) under any

8885 program administered by the Department of

8886 Agriculture;

8887 ``(B) on the request of a producer (or an agent of a

8888 producer), the Department of Agriculture electronically

8889 shares with the producer (or agent) in real time and

8890 without cost to the producer (or agent) the common land

8891 unit data, related farm level data, conservation

8892 practices, and other information of the producer through

8893 a single Department of Agriculture-wide login;

8894 ``(C) not later than September 30, 2020, the

8895 Administrator of the Risk Management Agency and the

8896 Administrator of the Farm Service Agency shall implement

8897 a consistent method for determining crop acreage,

8898 acreage yields, farm acreage, property descriptions, and

8899 other common informational requirements, including

8900 measures of common land units;

8901 ``(D) except in the case of misrepresentation,

8902 fraud, or scheme and device, no crop insurance agent,

8903 approved insurance provider, or employee or contractor

8904 of a crop insurance agency or approved insurance

8905 provider bears responsibility or liability under the

8906 Acreage Crop Reporting and Streamlining Initiative (or

8907 any successor or similar initiative) for the eligibility

8908 of a producer for a program administered by the

8909 Department of Agriculture, not including a policy or

8910 plan of insurance offered under the Federal Crop

8911 Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1501 et seq.); and

8912 ``(E) on request of a crop insurance agent or

8913 approved insurance provider required to deliver policies

8914 and plans of insurance under the Federal Crop Insurance

8915 Act (7 U.S.C. 1501 et seq.) the crop insurance agent or

8916 approved insurance provider receives, in a timely

8917 manner, any information held by the Farm Service Agency

8918 that is necessary to ensure effective crop insurance

8919 coverage for farmer customers;

8920

8921[[Page 132 STAT. 4528]]

8922

8923 ``(2) continue to improve coordination, information sharing,

8924 and administrative work among the Farm Service Agency, Risk

8925 Management Agency, Natural Resources Conservation Service, and

8926 other agencies, as determined by the Secretary;

8927 ``(3) continue to take advantage of new technologies to

8928 enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the delivery of

8929 Department of Agriculture programs to producers, including by

8930 developing and making publicly available data standards and

8931 security procedures to allow third-party providers to develop

8932 applications that use or feed data (including geospatial and

8933 precision agriculture data) into the datasets and analyses of

8934 the Department of Agriculture; and

8935 ``(4) reduce administrative burdens on producers

8936 participating in price loss coverage or agriculture risk

8937 coverage by offering--

8938 ``(A) those producers an option to remotely and

8939 electronically sign annual contracts for that coverage;

8940 and

8941 ``(B) to the maximum extent practicable, an option

8942 to sign a multiyear contract for that coverage.''.

8943

8944 (c) Implementation.--Section 1614(c) of the Agricultural Act of 2014

8945(7 U.S.C. 9097(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

8946 ``(4) Agriculture improvement act of 2018.--The Secretary

8947 shall make available to the Farm Service Agency to carry out

8948 title I of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 and the

8949 amendments made by that title $15,500,000.''.

8950

8951 (d) Loan Implementation.--Section 1614(d)(1) of the Agricultural Act

8952of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9097(d)(1)) is amended by striking ``under subtitles''

8953and all that follows through ``except'' and inserting ``under subtitle B

8954or C, under the amendments made by subtitle B or C, or under the

8955amendments made by subtitle B or C of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

89562018, except''.

8957 (e) Deobligation of Unliquidated Obligations.--Section 1614 of the

8958Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9097) is amended by adding at the end

8959the following:

8960 ``(e) Deobligation of Unliquidated Obligations.--

8961 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (3), any payment

8962 obligated or otherwise made available by the Secretary under

8963 this title on or after the date of enactment of the Agriculture

8964 Improvement Act of 2018 that is not disbursed to the recipient

8965 by the date that is 5 years after the date on which the payment

8966 is obligated or otherwise made available shall--

8967 ``(A) be deobligated; and

8968 ``(B) revert to the Treasury.

8969 ``(2) Outstanding payments.--

8970 ``(A) In general.--Subject to paragraph (3), any

8971 payment obligated or otherwise made available by the

8972 Farm Service Agency (or any predecessor agency of the

8973 Department of Agriculture) under the laws described in

8974 subparagraph (B) before the date of enactment of the

8975 Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, that is not

8976 disbursed by the date that is 5 years after the date on

8977 which the payment is obligated or otherwise made

8978 available shall--

8979 ``(i) be deobligated; and

8980 ``(ii) revert to the Treasury.

8981 ``(B) Laws described.--The laws referred to in

8982 subparagraph (A) are any of the following:

8983

8984[[Page 132 STAT. 4529]]

8985

8986 ``(i) This title.

8987 ``(ii) Title I of the Food, Conservation, and

8988 Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 8702 et seq.).

8989 ``(iii) Title I of the Farm Security and Rural

8990 Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 7901 et seq.).

8991 ``(iv) The Agricultural Market Transition Act

8992 (7 U.S.C. 7201 et seq.).

8993 ``(v) Titles I through XI of the Food,

8994 Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990

8995 (Public Law 101-624; 104 Stat. 3374) and the

8996 amendments made by those titles.

8997 ``(vi) Titles I through X of the Food Security

8998 Act of 1985 (Public Law 99-198; 99 Stat. 1362) and

8999 the amendments made by those titles.

9000 ``(vii) Titles I through XI of the Agriculture

9001 and Food Act of 1981 (Public Law 97-98; 95 Stat.

9002 1218) and the amendments made by those titles.

9003 ``(viii) Titles I through X of the Food and

9004 Agriculture Act of 1977 (Public Law 95-113; 91

9005 Stat. 917) and the amendments made by those

9006 titles.

9007 ``(3) Waiver.--The Secretary may delay the date of the

9008 deobligation and reversion under paragraph (1) or (2) of any

9009 payment--

9010 ``(A) that is the subject of--

9011 ``(i) ongoing administrative review or appeal;

9012 ``(ii) litigation; or

9013 ``(iii) the settlement of an estate; or

9014 ``(B) for which the Secretary otherwise determines

9015 that the circumstances are such that the delay is

9016 equitable.''.

9017

9018 (f) Report.--Section 1614 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C.

90199097) (as amended by subsection (e)) is amended by adding at the end the

9020following:

9021 ``(f) Report.--Not later than January 1, 2020, and each January 1

9022thereafter through January 1, 2023, the Secretary shall submit to the

9023Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

9024Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report

9025that describes the tilled native sod acreage that was subject to a

9026reduction in benefits under section 196(a)(4)(B) of the Federal

9027Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C. 7333(a)(4)(B)

9028and section 508(o)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

90291508(o)(2))--

9030 ``(1) as of the date of submission of the report; and

9031 ``(2) by State and county, relative to the total acres of

9032 cropland in the State or county.''.

9033SEC. 1707. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 31 USC 6101 note.&gt;&gt; EXEMPTION FROM CERTAIN

9034 REPORTING REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN

9035 PRODUCERS.

9036

9037 (a) Definition of Exempted Producer.--In this section, the term

9038``exempted producer'' means an individual or entity that is eligible to

9039participate in--

9040 (1) a conservation program under title II or a law amended

9041 by title II;

9042 (2) an indemnity or disease control program under the Animal

9043 Health Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8301 et seq.) or the Plant

9044 Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 7701 et seq.); or

9045 (3) a commodity program under title I of the Agricultural

9046 Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9011 et seq.), excluding the assistance

9047

9048[[Page 132 STAT. 4530]]

9049

9050 provided to users of cotton under sections 1207(c) and 1208 of

9051 that Act (7 U.S.C. 9037(c), 9038).

9052

9053 (b) Exemption.--Notwithstanding the Federal Funding Accountability

9054and Transparency Act of 2006 (Public Law 109-282; 31 U.S.C. 6101 note),

9055the requirements of parts 25 and 170 of title 2, Code of Federal

9056Regulations (or successor regulations), shall not apply with respect to

9057assistance received by an exempted producer from the Secretary, acting

9058through the Chief of the Natural Resources Conservation Service, the

9059Administrator of the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, or the

9060Administrator of the Farm Service Agency.

9061

9062 TITLE II--CONSERVATION

9063

9064 Subtitle A--Wetland Conservation

9065

9066SEC. 2101. WETLAND CONVERSION.

9067

9068 Section 1221(d) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3821(d))

9069is amended--

9070 (1) by striking ``Except as'' and inserting the following:

9071 ``(1) In general.--Except as''; and

9072 (2) by adding at the end the following:

9073 ``(2) Duty of the secretary.--No person shall become

9074 ineligible under paragraph (1) if the Secretary determines that

9075 an exemption under section 1222(b) applies to that person.''.

9076SEC. 2102. WETLAND CONSERVATION.

9077

9078 Section 1222(c) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3822(c))

9079is amended--

9080 (1) by striking ``No program'' and inserting the following:

9081 ``(1) In general.--No program'';

9082 (2) in paragraph (1) (as so designated), by inserting ``,

9083 which, except as provided in paragraph (2), shall be conducted

9084 in the presence of the affected person'' before the period at

9085 the end; and

9086 (3) by adding at the end the following:

9087 ``(2) Exception.--The Secretary may conduct an on-site visit

9088 under paragraph (1) without the affected person present if the

9089 Secretary has made a reasonable effort to include the presence

9090 of the affected person at the on-site visit.''.

9091SEC. 2103. MITIGATION BANKING.

9092

9093 Section 1222(k)(1)(B) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

90943822(k)(1)(B)) is amended to read as follows:

9095 ``(B) Authorization of appropriations.--There is

9096 authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry

9097 out this paragraph $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years

9098 2019 through 2023.''.

9099

9100 Subtitle B--Conservation Reserve Program

9101

9102SEC. 2201. CONSERVATION RESERVE.

9103

9104 (a) In General.--Section 1231(a) of the Food Security Act of 1985

9105(16 U.S.C. 3831(a)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

9106``2023''.

9107

9108[[Page 132 STAT. 4531]]

9109

9110 (b) Eligible Land.--Section 1231(b) of the Food Security Act of 1985

9111(16 U.S.C. 3831(b)) is amended--

9112 (1) in paragraph (1)(B), by striking ``Agricultural Act of

9113 2014 (except for land enrolled in the conservation reserve

9114 program as of that date)'' and inserting ``Agriculture

9115 Improvement Act of 2018, on the condition that the Secretary

9116 shall consider to be planted cropland enrolled in the

9117 conservation reserve program'';

9118 (2) by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs

9119 (5) and (6), respectively;

9120 (3) by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

9121 ``(4) cropland, marginal pasture land, and grasslands that

9122 will have a positive impact on water quality and will be devoted

9123 to--

9124 ``(A) a grass sod waterway;

9125 ``(B) a contour grass sod strip;

9126 ``(C) a prairie strip;

9127 ``(D) a filterstrip;

9128 ``(E) a riparian buffer;

9129 ``(F) a wetland or a wetland buffer;

9130 ``(G) a saturated buffer;

9131 ``(H) a bioreactor; or

9132 ``(I) another similar water quality practice, as

9133 determined by the Secretary;'';

9134 (4) in paragraph (5) (as so redesignated)--

9135 (A) in subparagraph (C), by striking ``or

9136 filterstrips or riparian buffers devoted to trees,

9137 shrubs, or grasses'' and inserting ``salt tolerant

9138 vegetation, field borders, or practices to benefit State

9139 or federally identified wellhead protection areas''; and

9140 (B) in subparagraph (E), by striking ``or'' after

9141 the semicolon;

9142 (5) in paragraph (6) (as so redesignated), in subparagraph

9143 (B)(ii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ``;

9144 or''; and

9145 (6) by adding at the end the following:

9146 ``(7) as determined by the Secretary, land--

9147 ``(A) that was enrolled in the conservation reserve

9148 program under a 15-year contract that expired on

9149 September 30, 2017, or September 30, 2018;

9150 ``(B) for which there was no opportunity for

9151 additional enrollment in that program; and

9152 ``(C) on which the conservation practice under the

9153 expired contract under subparagraph (A) is

9154 maintained.''.

9155

9156 (c) Enrollment.--Section 1231(d) of the Food Security Act of 1985

9157(16 U.S.C. 3831(d)) is amended--

9158 (1) in paragraph (1), by striking subparagraphs (A) through

9159 (E) and inserting the following:

9160 ``(A) fiscal year 2019, not more than 24,000,000

9161 acres;

9162 ``(B) fiscal year 2020, not more than 24,500,000

9163 acres;

9164 ``(C) fiscal year 2021, not more than 25,000,000

9165 acres;

9166 ``(D) fiscal year 2022, not more than 25,500,000

9167 acres; and

9168 ``(E) fiscal year 2023, not more than 27,000,000

9169 acres.'';

9170 (2) in paragraph (2)--

9171 (A) by striking subparagraphs (A) and (B) and

9172 inserting the following:

9173

9174[[Page 132 STAT. 4532]]

9175

9176 ``(A) Limitation.--For purposes of applying the

9177 limitations in paragraph (1)--

9178 ``(i) the Secretary shall enroll and maintain

9179 in the conservation reserve not fewer than

9180 2,000,000 acres of the land described in

9181 subsection (b)(3) by September 30, 2023; and

9182 ``(ii) in carrying out clause (i), to the

9183 maximum extent practicable, the Secretary shall

9184 maintain in the conservation reserve at any one

9185 time during--

9186 ``(I) fiscal year 2019, 1,000,000

9187 acres;

9188 ``(II) fiscal year 2020, 1,500,000

9189 acres; and

9190 ``(III) fiscal years 2021 through

9191 2023, 2,000,000 acres.

9192 ``(B) Priority.--In enrolling acres under

9193 subparagraph (A), the Secretary may give priority to

9194 land, as determined by the Secretary--

9195 ``(i) with expiring conservation reserve

9196 contracts;

9197 ``(ii) at risk of conversion or development;

9198 or

9199 ``(iii) of ecological significance, including

9200 land that--

9201 ``(I) may assist in the restoration

9202 of threatened or endangered species

9203 under the Endangered Species Act of 1973

9204 (16 U.S.C. 1531 et seq.);

9205 ``(II) may assist in preventing a

9206 species from being listed as a

9207 threatened or endangered species under

9208 the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16

9209 U.S.C. 1531 et seq.); or

9210 ``(III) improves or creates wildlife

9211 habitat corridors.'';

9212 (B) in subparagraph (C)--

9213 (i) by striking ``In enrolling'' and inserting

9214 the following:

9215 ``(i) In general.--In enrolling'';

9216 (ii) in clause (i) (as so designated), by

9217 striking ``a continuous'' and inserting ``an

9218 annual''; and

9219 (iii) by adding at the end the following:

9220 ``(ii) Timing of grassland ranking period.--

9221 For purposes of grasslands described in subsection

9222 (b)(3), the Secretary shall announce at least 1

9223 ranking period subsequent to the announcement of

9224 general enrollment offers.''; and

9225 (C) by adding at the end the following:

9226 ``(D) Reservation of unenrolled acres.--If the

9227 Secretary is unable in a fiscal year to enroll enough

9228 acres of land described in subsection (b)(3) to meet the

9229 number of acres described in clause (ii) or (iii) of

9230 subparagraph (A) for the fiscal year--

9231 ``(i) the Secretary shall reserve the

9232 remaining number of acres for that fiscal year for

9233 the enrollment of land described in subsection

9234 (b)(3); and

9235 ``(ii) that number of acres shall not be

9236 available for the enrollment of any other type of

9237 eligible land.''; and

9238 (3) by adding at the end the following:

9239 ``(3) Water quality practices to foster clean lakes,

9240 estuaries, and rivers (clear initiative).--

9241

9242[[Page 132 STAT. 4533]]

9243

9244 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall give priority

9245 within continuous enrollment under paragraph (6) to the

9246 enrollment of land described in subsection (b)(4).

9247 ``(B) Sediment and nutrient loadings.--In carrying

9248 out subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall give priority

9249 to the implementation of practices on land that, if

9250 enrolled, will help reduce sediment loadings, nutrient

9251 loadings, and harmful algal blooms, as determined by the

9252 Secretary.

9253 ``(C) Acreage.--

9254 ``(i) In general.--Of the acres maintained in

9255 the conservation reserve in accordance with

9256 paragraph (1), to the maximum extent practicable,

9257 not less than 40 percent of acres enrolled in the

9258 conservation reserve using continuous enrollment

9259 under paragraph (6) shall be of land described in

9260 subsection (b)(4).

9261 ``(ii) Limitation.--The acres described in

9262 clause (i) shall not include grasslands described

9263 in subsection (b)(3).

9264 ``(D) Report.--The Secretary shall--

9265 ``(i) in the monthly publication of the

9266 Secretary describing conservation reserve program

9267 statistics, include a description of enrollments

9268 through the priority under this paragraph; and

9269 ``(ii) publish on the website of the Farm

9270 Service Agency an annual report describing a

9271 summary of, with respect to the enrollment

9272 priority under this paragraph--

9273 ``(I) new enrollments;

9274 ``(II) expirations;

9275 ``(III) geographic distribution; and

9276 ``(IV) estimated water quality

9277 benefits.

9278 ``(4) State enrollment rates.--At the beginning of each of

9279 fiscal years 2019 through 2023, to the maximum extent

9280 practicable, the Secretary shall allocate to the States

9281 proportionately 60 percent of the available number of acres each

9282 year for enrollment in the conservation reserve, in accordance

9283 with historical State enrollment rates, taking into

9284 consideration--

9285 ``(A) the average number of acres of all land

9286 enrolled in the conservation reserve in each State

9287 during each of fiscal years 2007 through 2016;

9288 ``(B) the average number of acres of all land

9289 enrolled in the conservation reserve nationally during

9290 each of fiscal years 2007 through 2016; and

9291 ``(C) the acres available for enrollment during each

9292 of fiscal years 2019 through 2023, excluding acres

9293 described in paragraph (2).

9294 ``(5) Frequency.--In carrying out this subchapter, for

9295 contracts that are not available on a continuous enrollment

9296 basis, the Secretary shall hold a signup and enrollment not less

9297 often than once each year.

9298 ``(6) Continuous enrollment procedure.--

9299 ``(A) In general.--To the maximum extent

9300 practicable, the Secretary shall allow producers to

9301 submit applications on a continuous basis for enrollment

9302 in--

9303 ``(i) the conservation reserve of--

9304

9305[[Page 132 STAT. 4534]]

9306

9307 ``(I) marginal pasture land

9308 described in subsection (b)(2);

9309 ``(II) land described in subsection

9310 (b)(4); and

9311 ``(III) cropland described in

9312 subsection (b)(5); and

9313 ``(ii) the conservation reserve enhancement

9314 program under section 1231A.

9315 ``(B) Limitation.--For purposes of applying the

9316 limitations in paragraph (1)--

9317 ``(i) the Secretary shall, to the maximum

9318 extent practicable, enroll and maintain not fewer

9319 than 8,600,000 acres of land under subparagraph

9320 (A) by September 30, 2023; and

9321 ``(ii) in carrying out clause (i), to the

9322 maximum extent practicable, the Secretary shall

9323 maintain in the conservation reserve at any one

9324 time during--

9325 ``(I) fiscal year 2019, 8,000,000

9326 acres;

9327 ``(II) fiscal year 2020, 8,250,000

9328 acres;

9329 ``(III) fiscal year 2021, 8,500,000

9330 acres; and

9331 ``(IV) fiscal years 2022 and 2023,

9332 8,600,000 acres.''.

9333

9334 (d) Eligibility for Consideration.--Section 1231(h) of the Food

9335Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3831(h)) is amended--

9336 (1) by striking ``On the expiration'' and inserting the

9337 following:

9338 ``(1) In general.--On the expiration''; and

9339 (2) by adding at the end the following:

9340 ``(2) Reenrollment limitation for certain land.--

9341 ``(A) In general.--Except as provided in

9342 subparagraph (B), land subject to a contract entered

9343 into under this subchapter shall be eligible for only

9344 one reenrollment in the conservation reserve under

9345 paragraph (1) if the land is devoted to hardwood trees.

9346 ``(B) Exclusions.--Subparagraph (A) shall not apply

9347 to--

9348 ``(i) riparian forested buffers;

9349 ``(ii) forested wetlands enrolled under

9350 subsection (d)(3) or the conservation reserve

9351 enhancement program under section 1231A; and

9352 ``(iii) shelterbelts.''.

9353SEC. 2202. CONSERVATION RESERVE ENHANCEMENT PROGRAM.

9354

9355 (a) In General.--Subchapter B of chapter 1 of subtitle D of title

9356XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 is amended by inserting after

9357section 1231 (16 U.S.C. 3831) the following:

9358``SEC. 1231A. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3831a.&gt;&gt; CONSERVATION RESERVE

9359 ENHANCEMENT PROGRAM.

9360

9361 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

9362 ``(1) CREP.--The term `CREP' means a conservation reserve

9363 enhancement program carried out under subsection (b)(1).

9364 ``(2) Eligible land.--The term `eligible land' means land

9365 that is eligible to be included in the program established under

9366 this subchapter.

9367 ``(3) Eligible partner.--The term `eligible partner' means--

9368 ``(A) a State;

9369 ``(B) a political subdivision of a State;

9370

9371[[Page 132 STAT. 4535]]

9372

9373 ``(C) an Indian tribe (as defined in section 4 of

9374 the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance

9375 Act (25 U.S.C. 5304)); or

9376 ``(D) a nongovernmental organization.

9377 ``(4) Management.--The term `management' means an activity

9378 conducted by an owner or operator under a contract entered into

9379 under this subchapter after the establishment of a conservation

9380 practice on eligible land, to regularly maintain or enhance the

9381 vegetative cover established by the conservation practice--

9382 ``(A) throughout the term of the contract; and

9383 ``(B) consistent with the conservation plan that

9384 covers the eligible land.

9385

9386 ``(b) Agreements.--

9387 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary may enter into an agreement

9388 with an eligible partner to carry out a conservation reserve

9389 enhancement program--

9390 ``(A) to assist in enrolling eligible land in the

9391 program established under this subchapter; and

9392 ``(B) that the Secretary determines will advance the

9393 purposes of this subchapter.

9394 ``(2) Contents.--An agreement entered into under paragraph

9395 (1) shall--

9396 ``(A) describe--

9397 ``(i) 1 or more specific State or nationally

9398 significant conservation concerns to be addressed

9399 by the agreement;

9400 ``(ii) quantifiable environmental goals for

9401 addressing the concerns under clause (i);

9402 ``(iii) a suitable acreage goal for enrollment

9403 of eligible land under the agreement, as

9404 determined by the Secretary;

9405 ``(iv) the location of eligible land to be

9406 enrolled in the project area identified under the

9407 agreement;

9408 ``(v) the payments to be offered by the

9409 Secretary and eligible partner to an owner or

9410 operator; and

9411 ``(vi) an appropriate list of conservation

9412 reserve program conservation practices that are

9413 appropriate to meeting the concerns described

9414 under clause (i), as determined by the Secretary

9415 in consultation with eligible partners;

9416 ``(B) subject to subparagraph (C), require the

9417 eligible partner to provide matching funds--

9418 ``(i) in an amount determined during a

9419 negotiation between the Secretary and 1 or more

9420 eligible partners, if the majority of the matching

9421 funds to carry out the agreement are provided by 1

9422 or more eligible partners that are not

9423 nongovernmental organizations; or

9424 ``(ii) in an amount not less than 30 percent

9425 of the cost required to carry out the conservation

9426 measures and practices described in the agreement,

9427 if a majority of the matching funds to carry out

9428 the agreement are provided by 1 or more

9429 nongovernmental organizations; and

9430 ``(C) include procedures to allow for a temporary

9431 waiver of the matching requirements under subparagraph

9432 (B), or

9433

9434[[Page 132 STAT. 4536]]

9435

9436 continued enrollment with a temporary suspension of

9437 incentives or eligible partner contributions for new

9438 agreements, during a period when an eligible partner

9439 loses the authority or ability to provide matching

9440 contributions, if the Secretary determines that the

9441 temporary waiver or continued enrollment with a

9442 temporary suspension will advance the purposes of this

9443 subchapter.

9444 ``(3) Effect on existing agreements.--

9445 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), an

9446 agreement under this subsection shall not affect,

9447 modify, or interfere with existing agreements under this

9448 subchapter.

9449 ``(B) Modification of existing agreements.--To

9450 implement this section, the signatories to an agreement

9451 under this subsection may mutually agree to a

9452 modification of an agreement entered into before the

9453 date of enactment of this section under the Conservation

9454 Reserve Enhancement Program established by the Secretary

9455 under this subchapter.

9456

9457 ``(c) Payments.--

9458 ``(1) Matching requirement.--Funds provided by an eligible

9459 partner may be in cash, in-kind contributions, or technical

9460 assistance, as determined by the Secretary.

9461 ``(2) Marginal pastureland cost-share payments.--The

9462 Secretary shall ensure that cost-share payments to an owner or

9463 operator to install stream fencing, crossings, and alternative

9464 water development on marginal pastureland under a CREP reflect

9465 the fair market value of the cost of installation.

9466 ``(3) Cost-share and practice incentive payments.--

9467 ``(A) In general.--On request of an owner or

9468 operator, the Secretary shall provide cost-share

9469 payments when a major component of a conservation

9470 practice is completed under a CREP, as determined by the

9471 Secretary.

9472 ``(B) Exemption.--For purposes of implementing

9473 conservation practices on land enrolled under a CREP,

9474 the Secretary may waive the contribution limitation

9475 described in section 1234(b)(2)(A).

9476 ``(4) Riparian buffer management payments.--

9477 ``(A) In general.--In the case of an agreement under

9478 subsection (b)(1) that includes riparian buffers as an

9479 eligible practice, the Secretary shall make cost-share

9480 payments to encourage the regular management of the

9481 riparian buffer throughout the term of the agreement,

9482 consistent with the conservation plan that covers the

9483 eligible land.

9484 ``(B) Limitation.--The amount of payments received

9485 by an owner or operator under subparagraph (A) shall not

9486 be greater than 100 percent of the normal and customary

9487 projected management cost, as determined by the

9488 Secretary, in consultation with the applicable State

9489 technical committee established under section 1261(a).

9490

9491 ``(d) Forested Riparian Buffer Practice.--

9492 ``(1) Food-producing woody plants.--In the case of an

9493 agreement under subsection (b)(1) that includes forested

9494 riparian buffers as an eligible practice, the Secretary shall

9495 allow an owner or operator--

9496 ``(A) to plant food-producing woody plants in the

9497 forested riparian buffers, on the conditions that--

9498

9499[[Page 132 STAT. 4537]]

9500

9501 ``(i) the plants shall contribute to the

9502 conservation of soil, water quality, and wildlife

9503 habitat; and

9504 ``(ii) the planting shall be consistent with--

9505 ``(I) recommendations of the

9506 applicable State technical committee

9507 established under section 1261(a); and

9508 ``(II) technical guide standards of

9509 the applicable field office of the

9510 Natural Resources Conservation Service;

9511 and

9512 ``(B) to harvest from plants described in

9513 subparagraph (A), on the conditions that--

9514 ``(i) the harvesting shall not damage the

9515 conserving cover or otherwise have a negative

9516 impact on the conservation concerns targeted by

9517 the CREP;

9518 ``(ii) only native plant species appropriate

9519 to the region shall be used within 35 feet of the

9520 watercourse; and

9521 ``(iii) the producer shall be subject to a

9522 reduction in the rental rate commensurate to the

9523 value of the crop harvested.

9524 ``(2) Technical assistance.--For the purpose of enrolling

9525 forested riparian buffers in a CREP, the Administrator of the

9526 Farm Service Agency shall coordinate with the applicable State

9527 forestry agency.

9528

9529 ``(e) Drought and Water Conservation Agreements.--In the case of an

9530agreement under subsection (b)(1) to address regional drought concerns,

9531in accordance with the conservation purposes of the CREP, the Secretary,

9532in consultation with the applicable State technical committee

9533established under section 1261(a), may--

9534 ``(1) notwithstanding subsection (a)(2), enroll other

9535 agricultural land on which the resource concerns identified in

9536 the agreement can be addressed if the enrollment of the land is

9537 critical to the accomplishment of the purposes of the agreement;

9538 ``(2) permit dryland agricultural uses with the adoption of

9539 best management practices on enrolled land if the agreement

9540 involves the significant long-term reduction of consumptive

9541 water use and dryland production is compatible with the

9542 agreement; and

9543 ``(3) calculate annual rental payments consistent with

9544 existing administrative practice for similar drought and water

9545 conservation agreements under this subtitle and ensure regional

9546 consistency in those rates.

9547

9548 ``(f) Status Report.--Not later than 180 days after the end of each

9549fiscal year, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report that

9550describes, with respect to each agreement entered into under subsection

9551(b)(1)--

9552 ``(1) the status of the agreement;

9553 ``(2) the purposes and objectives of the agreement;

9554 ``(3) the Federal and eligible partner commitments made

9555 under the agreement; and

9556 ``(4) the progress made in fulfilling those commitments.''.

9557

9558 (b) Conforming Amendments.--

9559 (1) Section 1240R(c)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16

9560 U.S.C. 3839bb-5(c)(3)) is amended by striking ``a special

9561 conservation reserve enhancement program described in section

9562 1234(f)(4)'' and inserting ``a conservation reserve enhancement

9563 program under section 1231A''.

9564

9565[[Page 132 STAT. 4538]]

9566

9567 (2) Section 1244(f)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16

9568 U.S.C. 3844(f)(3)) is amended by striking ``subsection

9569 (d)(2)(A)(ii) or (g)(2) of section 1234'' and inserting

9570 ``section 1231A''.

9571SEC. 2203. FARMABLE WETLAND PROGRAM.

9572

9573 Section 1231B of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3831b) is

9574amended--

9575 (1) in subsection (a)(1), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

9576 ``2023''; and

9577 (2) in subsection (f)(2), by striking ``1234(d)(2)(A)(ii)''

9578 and inserting ``1234(d)''.

9579SEC. 2204. PILOT PROGRAMS.

9580

9581 Subchapter B of chapter 1 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food

9582Security Act of 1985 is amended by inserting after section 1231B (16

9583U.S.C. 3831b) the following:

9584``SEC. 1231C. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3831c.&gt;&gt; PILOT PROGRAMS.

9585

9586 ``(a) CLEAR 30.--

9587 ``(1) In general.--

9588 ``(A) Enrollment.--The Secretary shall establish a

9589 pilot program to enroll land in the conservation reserve

9590 program through a 30-year conservation reserve contract

9591 (referred to in this subsection as a `CLEAR 30

9592 contract') in accordance with this subsection.

9593 ``(B) Inclusion of acreage limitation.--For purposes

9594 of applying the limitations in section 1231(d)(1), the

9595 Secretary shall include acres of land enrolled under

9596 this subsection.

9597 ``(2) Expired conservation contract election.--

9598 ``(A) Definition of covered contract.--In this

9599 paragraph, the term `covered contract' means a contract

9600 entered into under this subchapter that--

9601 ``(i) expires on or after the date of

9602 enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

9603 2018; and

9604 ``(ii) covers land enrolled in the

9605 conservation reserve program under the clean

9606 lakes, estuaries, and rivers priority described in

9607 section 1231(d)(3) (or the predecessor practices

9608 that constitute the priority, as determined by the

9609 Secretary).

9610 ``(B) Election.--On the expiration of a covered

9611 contract, an owner or operator party to the covered

9612 contract shall elect--

9613 ``(i) not to reenroll the land under the

9614 contract;

9615 ``(ii) to offer to reenroll the land under the

9616 contract if the land remains eligible under the

9617 terms in effect as of the date of expiration; or

9618 ``(iii) not to reenroll the land under the

9619 contract and to enroll that land through a CLEAR

9620 30 contract under this subsection.

9621 ``(3) Eligible land.--Only land that is subject to an

9622 expired covered contract shall be eligible for enrollment

9623 through a CLEAR 30 contract under this subsection.

9624 ``(4) Term.--The term of a CLEAR 30 contract shall be 30

9625 years.

9626 ``(5) Agreements.--To be eligible to enroll land in the

9627 conservation reserve program through a CLEAR 30 contract,

9628

9629[[Page 132 STAT. 4539]]

9630

9631 the owner of the land shall enter into an agreement with the

9632 Secretary--

9633 ``(A) to implement a conservation reserve plan

9634 developed for the land;

9635 ``(B) to comply with the terms and conditions of the

9636 contract and any related agreements; and

9637 ``(C) to temporarily suspend the base history for

9638 the land covered by the contract.

9639 ``(6) Terms and conditions of clear 30 contracts.--

9640 ``(A) In general.--A CLEAR 30 contract shall include

9641 terms and conditions that--

9642 ``(i) permit--

9643 ``(I) repairs, improvements, and

9644 inspections on the land that are

9645 necessary to maintain existing public

9646 drainage systems; and

9647 ``(II) owners to control public

9648 access on the land while identifying

9649 access routes to be used for restoration

9650 activities and management and contract

9651 monitoring;

9652 ``(ii) prohibit--

9653 ``(I) the alteration of wildlife

9654 habitat and other natural features of

9655 the land, unless specifically authorized

9656 by the Secretary as part of the

9657 conservation reserve plan;

9658 ``(II) the spraying of the land with

9659 chemicals or the mowing of the land,

9660 except where the spraying or mowing is

9661 authorized by the Secretary or is

9662 necessary--

9663 ``(aa) to comply with

9664 Federal or State noxious weed

9665 control laws;

9666 ``(bb) to comply with a

9667 Federal or State emergency pest

9668 treatment program; or

9669 ``(cc) to meet habitat needs

9670 of specific wildlife species;

9671 ``(III) any activity to be carried

9672 out on the land of the owner or

9673 successor that is immediately adjacent

9674 to, and functionally related to, the

9675 land that is subject to the contract if

9676 the activity will alter, degrade, or

9677 otherwise diminish the functional value

9678 of the land; and

9679 ``(IV) the adoption of any other

9680 practice that would tend to defeat the

9681 purposes of the conservation reserve

9682 program, as determined by the Secretary;

9683 and

9684 ``(iii) include any additional provision that

9685 the Secretary determines is appropriate to carry

9686 out this section or facilitate the practical

9687 administration of this section.

9688 ``(B) Violation.--On the violation of a term or

9689 condition of a CLEAR 30 contract, the Secretary may

9690 require the owner to refund all or part of any payments

9691 received by the owner under the conservation reserve

9692 program, with interest on the payments, as determined

9693 appropriate by the Secretary.

9694 ``(C) Compatible uses.--Land subject to a CLEAR 30

9695 contract may be used for compatible economic uses,

9696

9697[[Page 132 STAT. 4540]]

9698

9699 including hunting and fishing, managed timber harvest,

9700 or periodic haying or grazing, if the use--

9701 ``(i) is specifically permitted by the

9702 conservation reserve plan developed for the land;

9703 and

9704 ``(ii) is consistent with the long-term

9705 protection and enhancement of the conservation

9706 resources for which the contract was established.

9707 ``(7) Compensation.--

9708 ``(A) Amount of payments.--The Secretary shall

9709 provide payment under this subsection to an owner of

9710 land enrolled through a CLEAR 30 contract using 30

9711 annual payments in an amount equal to the amount that

9712 would be used if the land were to be enrolled in the

9713 conservation reserve program under section 1231(d)(3).

9714 ``(B) Form of payment.--Compensation for a CLEAR 30

9715 contract shall be provided by the Secretary in the form

9716 of a cash payment in an amount determined under

9717 subparagraph (A).

9718 ``(C) Timing.--The Secretary shall provide any

9719 annual payment obligation under subparagraph (A) as

9720 early as practicable in each fiscal year.

9721 ``(D) Payments to others.--The Secretary shall make

9722 a payment, in accordance with regulations prescribed by

9723 the Secretary, in a manner as the Secretary determines

9724 is fair and reasonable under the circumstances, if an

9725 owner who is entitled to a payment under this section--

9726 ``(i) dies;

9727 ``(ii) becomes incompetent;

9728 ``(iii) is succeeded by another person or

9729 entity who renders or completes the required

9730 performance; or

9731 ``(iv) is otherwise unable to receive the

9732 payment.

9733 ``(8) Technical assistance.--

9734 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall assist owners

9735 in complying with the terms and conditions of a CLEAR 30

9736 contract.

9737 ``(B) Contracts or agreements.--The Secretary may

9738 enter into 1 or more contracts with private entities or

9739 agreements with a State, nongovernmental organization,

9740 or Indian Tribe to carry out necessary maintenance of a

9741 CLEAR 30 contract if the Secretary determines that the

9742 contract or agreement will advance the purposes of the

9743 conservation reserve program.

9744 ``(9) Administration.--

9745 ``(A) Conservation reserve plan.--The Secretary

9746 shall develop a conservation reserve plan for any land

9747 subject to a CLEAR 30 contract, which shall include

9748 practices and activities necessary to maintain, protect,

9749 and enhance the conservation value of the enrolled land.

9750 ``(B) Delegation of contract administration.--

9751 ``(i) Federal, state, or local government

9752 agencies.--The Secretary may delegate any of the

9753 management, monitoring, and enforcement

9754 responsibilities of the Secretary under this

9755 subsection to other Federal, State, or local

9756 government agencies that have the appropriate

9757 authority, expertise, and resources necessary to

9758 carry out those delegated responsibilities.

9759

9760[[Page 132 STAT. 4541]]

9761

9762 ``(ii) Conservation organizations.--The

9763 Secretary may delegate any management

9764 responsibilities of the Secretary under this

9765 subsection to conservation organizations if the

9766 Secretary determines the conservation organization

9767 has similar expertise and resources.

9768

9769 ``(b) Soil Health and Income Protection Pilot Program.--

9770 ``(1) Definition of eligible land.--In this subsection:

9771 ``(A) In general.--The term `eligible land' means

9772 cropland that--

9773 ``(i) is selected by the owner or operator of

9774 the land for proposed enrollment in the pilot

9775 program under this subsection; and

9776 ``(ii) as determined by the Secretary--

9777 ``(I) is located within 1 or more

9778 States that are part of the prairie

9779 pothole region, as selected by the

9780 Secretary based on consultation with

9781 State Committees of the Farm Service

9782 Agency and State technical committees

9783 established under section 1261(a) from

9784 that region;

9785 ``(II) had a cropping history or was

9786 considered to be planted during each of

9787 the 3 crop years preceding enrollment;

9788 and

9789 ``(III) is verified to be less-

9790 productive land, as compared to other

9791 land on the applicable farm.

9792 ``(B) Exclusion.--The term `eligible land' does not

9793 include any land that was enrolled in a conservation

9794 reserve program contract in any of the 3 crop years

9795 preceding enrollment in the pilot program under this

9796 subsection.

9797 ``(2) Establishment.--

9798 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall establish a

9799 voluntary soil health and income protection pilot

9800 program under which eligible land is enrolled through

9801 the use of contracts to assist owners and operators of

9802 eligible land to conserve and improve the soil, water,

9803 and wildlife resources of the eligible land.

9804 ``(B) Deadline for participation.--Eligible land may

9805 be enrolled in the program under this section through

9806 December 31, 2020.

9807 ``(3) Contracts.--

9808 ``(A) Requirements.--A contract described in

9809 paragraph (2) shall--

9810 ``(i) be entered into by the Secretary, the

9811 owner of the eligible land, and (if applicable)

9812 the operator of the eligible land; and

9813 ``(ii) provide that, during the term of the

9814 contract--

9815 ``(I) the lowest practicable cost

9816 perennial conserving use cover crop for

9817 the eligible land, as determined by the

9818 applicable State conservationist after

9819 considering the advice of the applicable

9820 State technical committee, shall be

9821 planted on the eligible land;

9822 ``(II) except as provided in

9823 subparagraph (E), the owner or operator

9824 of the eligible land shall pay the cost

9825 of planting the conserving use cover

9826 crop under subclause (I);

9827

9828[[Page 132 STAT. 4542]]

9829

9830 ``(III) subject to subparagraph (F),

9831 the eligible land may be harvested for

9832 seed, hayed, or grazed outside the

9833 primary nesting season established for

9834 the applicable county;

9835 ``(IV) the eligible land may be

9836 eligible for a walk-in access program of

9837 the applicable State, if any; and

9838 ``(V) a nonprofit wildlife

9839 organization may provide to the owner or

9840 operator of the eligible land a payment

9841 in exchange for an agreement by the

9842 owner or operator not to harvest the

9843 conserving use cover.

9844 ``(B) Payments.--Except as provided in subparagraphs

9845 (E) and (F)(ii)(II), the annual rental rate for a

9846 payment under a contract described in paragraph (2)

9847 shall be equal to 50 percent of the average rental rate

9848 for the applicable county under section 1234(d), as

9849 determined by the Secretary.

9850 ``(C) Limitation on enrolled land.--Not more than 15

9851 percent of the eligible land on a farm may be enrolled

9852 in the pilot program under this subsection.

9853 ``(D) Term.--

9854 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

9855 clause (ii), each contract described in paragraph

9856 (2) shall be for a term of 3, 4, or 5 years, as

9857 determined by the parties to the contract.

9858 ``(ii) Early termination.--

9859 ``(I) Secretary.--The Secretary may

9860 terminate a contract described in

9861 paragraph (2) before the end of the term

9862 described in clause (i) if the Secretary

9863 determines that the early termination of

9864 the contract is necessary.

9865 ``(II) Owners and operators.--An

9866 owner and (if applicable) an operator of

9867 eligible land enrolled in the pilot

9868 program under this subsection may

9869 terminate a contract described in

9870 paragraph (2) before the end of the term

9871 described in clause (i) if the owner and

9872 (if applicable) the operator pay to the

9873 Secretary an amount equal to the amount

9874 of rental payments received under the

9875 contract.

9876 ``(E) Beginning, limited resource, socially

9877 disadvantaged, or veteran farmers and ranchers.--With

9878 respect to a beginning, limited resource, socially

9879 disadvantaged, or veteran farmer or rancher, as

9880 determined by the Secretary--

9881 ``(i) a contract described in paragraph (2)

9882 shall provide that, during the term of the

9883 contract, of the actual cost of establishment of

9884 the conserving use cover crop under subparagraph

9885 (A)(ii)(I)--

9886 ``(I) using the funds of the

9887 Commodity Credit Corporation, the

9888 Secretary shall pay 50 percent; and

9889 ``(II) the beginning, limited

9890 resource, socially disadvantaged, or

9891 veteran farmer or rancher shall pay 50

9892 percent; and

9893

9894[[Page 132 STAT. 4543]]

9895

9896 ``(ii) the annual rental rate for a payment

9897 under a contract described in paragraph (2) shall

9898 be equal to 75 percent of the average rental rate

9899 for the applicable county under section 1234(d),

9900 as determined by the Secretary.

9901 ``(F) Harvesting, haying, and grazing outside

9902 applicable period.--The harvesting for seed, haying, or

9903 grazing of eligible land under subparagraph (A)(ii)(III)

9904 outside of the primary nesting season established for

9905 the applicable county shall be subject to the conditions

9906 that--

9907 ``(i) with respect to eligible land that is so

9908 hayed or grazed, adequate stubble height shall be

9909 maintained to protect the soil on the eligible

9910 land, as determined by the applicable State

9911 conservationist after considering the advice of

9912 the applicable State technical committee; and

9913 ``(ii) with respect to eligible land that is

9914 so harvested for seed--

9915 ``(I) the eligible land shall not be

9916 eligible to be insured or reinsured

9917 under the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7

9918 U.S.C. 1501 et seq.); and

9919 ``(II) the rental payment otherwise

9920 applicable to the eligible land under

9921 this subsection shall be reduced by 25

9922 percent.

9923 ``(4) Acreage limitation.--Of the number of acres available

9924 for enrollment in the conservation reserve under section

9925 1231(d)(1), not more than 50,000 total acres of eligible land

9926 may be enrolled under the pilot program under this subsection.

9927 ``(5) Report.--The Secretary shall submit to the Committee

9928 on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee

9929 on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate an annual

9930 report describing the eligible land enrolled in the pilot

9931 program under this subsection, including--

9932 ``(A) the estimated conservation value of the land;

9933 and

9934 ``(B) estimated savings from reduced commodity

9935 payments, crop insurance indemnities, and crop insurance

9936 premium subsidies.''.

9937SEC. 2205. DUTIES OF OWNERS AND OPERATORS.

9938

9939 Section 1232(a) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3832(a))

9940is amended--

9941 (1) by redesignating paragraphs (10) and (11) as paragraphs

9942 (11) and (12), respectively; and

9943 (2) by inserting after paragraph (9) the following:

9944 ``(10) on land devoted to hardwood or other trees, excluding

9945 windbreaks and shelterbelts, to carry out proper thinning and

9946 other practices--

9947 ``(A) to enhance the conservation benefits and

9948 wildlife habitat resources addressed by the conservation

9949 practice under which the land is enrolled; and

9950 ``(B) to promote forest management;''.

9951SEC. 2206. DUTIES OF THE SECRETARY.

9952

9953 (a) Cost-Share and Rental Payments.--Section 1233(a) of the Food

9954Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3833(a)) is amended--

9955 (1) in paragraph (1), by inserting ``, including the cost of

9956 fencing and other water distribution practices, if applicable''

9957 after ``interest''; and

9958

9959[[Page 132 STAT. 4544]]

9960

9961 (2) in paragraph (2)--

9962 (A) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by

9963 striking ``in an amount necessary to compensate'' and

9964 inserting ``, in accordance with section 1234(d),'';

9965 (B) in subparagraph (A)--

9966 (i) by inserting ``, marginal pastureland,''

9967 after ``cropland''; and

9968 (ii) by adding ``or'' at the end;

9969 (C) by striking subparagraph (B); and

9970 (D) by redesignating subparagraph (C) as

9971 subparagraph (B).

9972

9973 (b) Specified Activities Permitted.--Section 1233 of the Food

9974Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3833) is amended by striking subsection

9975(b) and inserting the following:

9976 ``(b) Specified Activities Permitted.--

9977 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary, in coordination with the

9978 applicable State technical committee established under section

9979 1261(a), shall permit certain activities or commercial uses of

9980 established cover on land that is subject to a contract under

9981 the conservation reserve program if--

9982 ``(A) those activities or uses--

9983 ``(i) are consistent with the conservation of

9984 soil, water quality, and wildlife habitat;

9985 ``(ii) are subject to appropriate restrictions

9986 during the primary nesting season for birds in the

9987 local area that are economically significant, in

9988 significant decline, or conserved in accordance

9989 with Federal or State law;

9990 ``(iii) contribute to the health and vigor of

9991 the established cover; and

9992 ``(iv) are consistent with a site-specific

9993 plan, including vegetative management

9994 requirements, stocking rates, and frequency and

9995 duration of activity, taking into consideration

9996 regional differences, such as climate, soil type,

9997 and natural resources; and

9998 ``(B) the Secretary, in coordination with the State

9999 technical committee, includes contract modifications--

10000 ``(i) without any reduction in the rental rate

10001 for--

10002 ``(I) emergency haying, emergency

10003 grazing, or other emergency use of the

10004 forage in response to a localized or

10005 regional drought, flooding, wildfire, or

10006 other emergency, on all practices,

10007 outside the primary nesting season,

10008 when--

10009 ``(aa) the county is

10010 designated as D2 (severe

10011 drought) or greater according to

10012 the United States Drought

10013 Monitor;

10014 ``(bb) there is at least a

10015 40 percent loss in forage

10016 production in the county; or

10017 ``(cc) the Secretary, in

10018 coordination with the State

10019 technical committee, determines

10020 that the program can assist in

10021 the response to a natural

10022 disaster event without permanent

10023 damage to the established cover;

10024 ``(II) emergency grazing on all

10025 practices during the primary nesting

10026 season if payments are authorized for a

10027 county under the livestock forage

10028 disaster program under clause (ii) of

10029 section 1501(c)(3)(D) of the

10030 Agricultural Act of 2014 (7

10031

10032[[Page 132 STAT. 4545]]

10033

10034 U.S.C. 9081(c)(3)(D)), at 50 percent of

10035 the normal carrying capacity determined

10036 under clause (i) of that section,

10037 adjusted to the site-specific plan;

10038 ``(III) emergency haying on certain

10039 practices, outside the primary nesting

10040 season, if payments are authorized for a

10041 county under the livestock forage

10042 disaster program under clause (ii) of

10043 section 1501(c)(3)(D) of the

10044 Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C.

10045 9081(c)(3)(D)), on not more than 50

10046 percent of contract acres, as identified

10047 in the site-specific plan;

10048 ``(IV) grazing of all practices,

10049 outside the primary nesting season, if

10050 included as a mid-contract management

10051 practice under section 1232(a)(5);

10052 ``(V) the intermittent and seasonal

10053 use of vegetative buffer established

10054 under paragraphs (4) and (5) of section

10055 1231(b) that are incidental to

10056 agricultural production on land adjacent

10057 to the buffer such that the permitted

10058 use--

10059 ``(aa) does not destroy the

10060 permanent vegetative cover; and

10061 ``(bb) retains suitable

10062 vegetative structure for

10063 wildlife cover and shelter

10064 outside the primary nesting

10065 season; or

10066 ``(VI) grazing on all practices,

10067 outside the primary nesting season, if

10068 conducted by a beginning farmer or

10069 rancher; or

10070 ``(ii) with a 25 percent reduction in the

10071 annual rental rate for the acres covered by the

10072 authorized activity, including--

10073 ``(I) grazing not more frequently

10074 than every other year on the same land,

10075 except that during the primary nesting

10076 season, grazing shall be subject to a 50

10077 percent reduction in the stocking rate

10078 specified in the site-specific plan;

10079 ``(II) grazing of all practices

10080 during the primary nesting season, with

10081 a 50 percent reduction in the stocking

10082 rate specified in the site-specific

10083 plan;

10084 ``(III) haying and other commercial

10085 use (including the managed harvesting of

10086 biomass and excluding the harvesting of

10087 vegetative cover), on the condition that

10088 the activity--

10089 ``(aa) is completed outside

10090 the primary nesting season;

10091 ``(bb) occurs not more than

10092 once every 3 years; and

10093 ``(cc) maintains 25 percent

10094 of the total contract acres

10095 unharvested, in accordance with

10096 a site-specific plan that

10097 provides for wildlife cover and

10098 shelter;

10099 ``(IV) annual grazing outside the

10100 primary nesting season if consistent

10101 with a site-specific plan that is

10102 authorized for the control of invasive

10103 species; and

10104 ``(V) the installation of wind

10105 turbines and associated access, except

10106 that in permitting the installation of

10107 wind turbines, the Secretary shall

10108

10109[[Page 132 STAT. 4546]]

10110

10111 determine the number and location of

10112 wind turbines that may be installed,

10113 taking into account--

10114 ``(aa) the location, size,

10115 and other physical

10116 characteristics of the land;

10117 ``(bb) the extent to which

10118 the land contains threatened or

10119 endangered wildlife and wildlife

10120 habitat; and

10121 ``(cc) the purposes of the

10122 conservation reserve program

10123 under this subchapter.

10124 ``(2) Conditions on haying and grazing.--

10125 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary may permit haying

10126 or grazing in accordance with paragraph (1) on any land

10127 or practice subject to a contract under the conservation

10128 reserve program.

10129 ``(B) Exceptions.--

10130 ``(i) Damage to vegetative cover.--Haying or

10131 grazing described in paragraph (1) shall not be

10132 permitted on land subject to a contract under the

10133 conservation reserve program, or under a

10134 particular practice, if haying or grazing for that

10135 year under that practice, as applicable, would

10136 cause long-term damage to vegetative cover on that

10137 land.

10138 ``(ii) Special agreements.--

10139 ``(I) In general.--Except as

10140 provided in subclause (II), haying or

10141 grazing described in paragraph (1) shall

10142 not be permitted on--

10143 ``(aa) land covered by a

10144 contract enrolled under the

10145 State acres for wildlife

10146 enhancement program established

10147 by the Secretary; or

10148 ``(bb) land covered by a

10149 contract enrolled under a

10150 conservation reserve enhancement

10151 program established under

10152 section 1231A or the

10153 Conservation Reserve Enhancement

10154 Program established by the

10155 Secretary under this subchapter.

10156 ``(II) Exception.--Subclause (I)

10157 shall not apply to land on which haying

10158 or grazing is specifically permitted

10159 under the applicable conservation

10160 reserve enhancement program agreement or

10161 other partnership agreement entered into

10162 under this subchapter.''.

10163

10164 (c) Natural Disaster or Adverse Weather as Mid-contract

10165Management.--Section 1233 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

101663833) is amended by adding at the end the following:

10167 ``(e) Natural Disaster or Adverse Weather as Mid-contract

10168Management.--In the case of a natural disaster or adverse weather event

10169that has the effect of a management practice consistent with the

10170conservation plan, the Secretary shall not require further management

10171practices pursuant to section 1232(a)(5) that are intended to achieve

10172the same effect.''.

10173SEC. 2207. PAYMENTS.

10174

10175 (a) Cost Sharing Payments.--Section 1234(b) of the Food Security Act

10176of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3834(b)) is amended--

10177 (1) by striking paragraphs (2) through (4) and inserting the

10178 following:

10179 ``(2) Limitations.--

10180

10181[[Page 132 STAT. 4547]]

10182

10183 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall ensure, to

10184 the maximum extent practicable, that cost sharing

10185 payments to an owner or operator under this subchapter,

10186 when combined with the sum of payments from all other

10187 funding sources for measures and practices described in

10188 paragraph (1), do not exceed 100 percent of the total

10189 actual cost of establishing those measures and

10190 practices, as determined by the Secretary.

10191 ``(B) Mid-contract management grazing.--The

10192 Secretary may not make any cost sharing payment to an

10193 owner or operator under this subchapter pursuant to

10194 section 1232(a)(5).

10195 ``(C) Seed cost.--In the case of seed costs related

10196 to the establishment of cover, cost sharing payments

10197 under this subchapter shall not exceed 50 percent of the

10198 actual cost of the seed mixture, as determined by the

10199 Secretary.'';

10200 (2) by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (3);

10201 (3) in paragraph (3) (as so redesignated), by striking ``An

10202 owner'' and inserting ``Except in the case of incentive payments

10203 that are related to the cost of the establishment of a practice

10204 and received from eligible partners under the conservation

10205 reserve enhancement program under section 1231A, an owner''; and

10206 (4) by adding at the end the following:

10207 ``(4) Practice incentives for continuous practices.--In

10208 addition to the cost sharing payment described in this

10209 subsection, the Secretary shall make an incentive payment to an

10210 owner or operator of land enrolled under section 1231(d)(6) in

10211 an amount not to exceed 50 percent of the actual cost of

10212 establishing all measures and practices described in paragraph

10213 (1), including seed costs related to the establishment of cover,

10214 as determined by the Secretary.''.

10215

10216 (b) Incentive Payments.--Section 1234(c) of the Food Security Act of

102171985 (16 U.S.C. 3834(c)) is amended--

10218 (1) in the subsection heading, by striking ``Incentive'' and

10219 inserting ``Forest Management Incentive'';

10220 (2) in paragraph (1), by striking ``The Secretary'' and

10221 inserting ``Using funds made available under section

10222 1241(a)(1)(A), the Secretary''; and

10223 (3) in paragraph (2), by striking ``150 percent'' and

10224 inserting ``100 percent''.

10225

10226 (c) Annual Rental Payments.--Section 1234(d) of the Food Security

10227Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3834(d)) is amended--

10228 (1) in paragraph (1)--

10229 (A) by striking ``the Secretary may consider, among

10230 other things, the amount'' and inserting the following:

10231 ``the Secretary shall consider--

10232 ``(A) the amount'';

10233 (B) in subparagraph (A) (as so designated), by

10234 striking the period at the end and inserting a

10235 semicolon; and

10236 (C) by adding at the end the following:

10237 ``(B) the impact on the local farmland rental

10238 market; and

10239 ``(C) such other factors as the Secretary determines

10240 to be appropriate.'';

10241 (2) in paragraph (2)--

10242 (A) in subparagraph (A)--

10243

10244[[Page 132 STAT. 4548]]

10245

10246 (i) in clause (i), by striking ``; or'' and

10247 inserting a period;

10248 (ii) by striking clause (ii); and

10249 (iii) by striking ``determined through--'' in

10250 the matter preceding clause (i) and all that

10251 follows through ``the submission of bids'' in

10252 clause (i) and inserting ``determined through the

10253 submission of applications'';

10254 (B) by redesignating subparagraph (B) as

10255 subparagraph (C);

10256 (C) by inserting after subparagraph (A) the

10257 following:

10258 ``(B) Multiple enrollments.--

10259 ``(i) In general.--Subject to clause (ii), if

10260 land subject to a contract entered into under this

10261 subchapter is reenrolled under section 1231(h)(1)

10262 or has been previously enrolled in the

10263 conservation reserve, the annual rental payment

10264 shall be in an amount that is not more than 85

10265 percent in the case of general enrollment

10266 contacts, or 90 percent in the case of continuous

10267 enrollment contracts, of the applicable estimated

10268 average county rental rate published pursuant to

10269 paragraph (4) for the year in which the

10270 reenrollment occurs.

10271 ``(ii) Conservation reserve enhancement

10272 program.--The reduction in annual rental payments

10273 under clause (i) may be waived as part of the

10274 negotiation between the Secretary and an eligible

10275 partner to enter into a conservation reserve

10276 enhancement program agreement under section

10277 1231A.'';

10278 (D) in subparagraph (C) (as so redesignated), by

10279 striking ``In the case'' and inserting ``Notwithstanding

10280 subparagraph (A), in the case''; and

10281 (E) by adding at the end the following:

10282 ``(D) Continuous sign-up incentives.--The Secretary

10283 shall make an incentive payment to the owner or operator

10284 of land enrolled under section 1231(d)(6) at the time of

10285 initial enrollment in an amount equal to 32.5 percent of

10286 the amount of the first annual rental payment under

10287 subparagraph (A).'';

10288 (3) by striking paragraph (4);

10289 (4) by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (4); and

10290 (5) in paragraph (4) (as so redesignated)--

10291 (A) in subparagraph (A)--

10292 (i) by striking ``, not less frequently than

10293 once every other year,'' and inserting

10294 ``annually''; and

10295 (ii) by inserting ``, and shall publish the

10296 estimates derived from the survey not later than

10297 September 15 of each year'' before the period at

10298 the end;

10299 (B) in subparagraph (B), by inserting ``and the

10300 average current and previous soil rental rates for each

10301 county'' after ``subparagraph (A)'';

10302 (C) in subparagraph (C), by striking ``may use'' and

10303 inserting ``shall consider''; and

10304 (D) by adding at the end the following:

10305 ``(D) Submission of additional information by state

10306 fsa offices and crep partners.--

10307 ``(i) In general.--The Secretary shall provide

10308 an opportunity for State Committees of the Farm

10309 Service Agency or eligible partners (as defined in

10310 section

10311

10312[[Page 132 STAT. 4549]]

10313

10314 1231A(a)) in conservation reserve enhancement

10315 programs under section 1231A to propose an

10316 alternative soil rental rate prior to finalizing

10317 new rates, on the condition that documentation

10318 described in clause (ii) is provided to support

10319 the proposed alternative.

10320 ``(ii) Acceptable documentation.--

10321 Documentation referred to in clause (i) includes--

10322 ``(I) an average of cash rents from

10323 a random sample of lease agreements;

10324 ``(II) cash rent estimates from a

10325 published survey;

10326 ``(III) neighboring county estimate

10327 comparisons from the National

10328 Agricultural Statistics Service;

10329 ``(IV) an average of cash rents from

10330 Farm Service Agency farm business plans;

10331 ``(V) models that estimate cash

10332 rents, such as models that use returns

10333 to estimate crop production or land

10334 value data; or

10335 ``(VI) other documentation, as

10336 determined by the Secretary.

10337 ``(iii) Notification.--Not less than 14 days

10338 prior to the announcement of new or revised soil

10339 rental rates, the Secretary shall offer a briefing

10340 to the Chairman and Ranking Member of the

10341 Committee on Agriculture of the House of

10342 Representatives and the Chairman and Ranking

10343 Member of the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition,

10344 and Forestry of the Senate, including information

10345 on and the rationale for the alternative rates

10346 proposed under clause (i) that were accepted or

10347 rejected.

10348 ``(E) Rental rate limitation.--Notwithstanding

10349 forest management incentive payments described in

10350 subsection (c), the county average soil rental rate

10351 (before any adjustments relating to specific practices,

10352 wellhead protection, or soil productivity) shall not

10353 exceed--

10354 ``(i) 85 percent of the estimated rental rate

10355 determined under this paragraph for general

10356 enrollment; or

10357 ``(ii) 90 percent of the estimated rental rate

10358 determined under this paragraph for continuous

10359 enrollment.''.

10360

10361 (d) Payment Limitation for Rental Payments.--Section 1234(g) of the

10362Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3834(g)) is amended--

10363 (1) in paragraph (1), by striking ``The total'' and

10364 inserting ``Except as provided in paragraph (2), the total'';

10365 and

10366 (2) by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following:

10367 ``(2) Wellhead protection.--Paragraph (1) and section

10368 1001D(b) shall not apply to rental payments received by a rural

10369 water district or association for land that is enrolled under

10370 this subchapter for the purpose of protecting a wellhead.''.

10371SEC. 2208. CONTRACTS.

10372

10373 (a) Transition Option for Certain Farmers or Ranchers.--Section

103741235(f) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3835(f)) is

10375amended--

10376 (1) in paragraph (1)--

10377

10378[[Page 132 STAT. 4550]]

10379

10380 (A) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by

10381 striking ``retired farmer or rancher'' and inserting

10382 ``contract holder'';

10383 (B) by striking ``retired or retiring owner or

10384 operator'' each place it appears and inserting

10385 ``contract holder'';

10386 (C) in subparagraph (A), in the matter preceding

10387 clause (i), by striking ``1 year'' and inserting ``2

10388 years'';

10389 (D) in subparagraph (B), by inserting ``, including

10390 a lease with a term of less than 5 years and an option

10391 to purchase'' after ``option to purchase'';

10392 (E) in subparagraph (D), by striking ``; and'' and

10393 inserting a semicolon;

10394 (F) by redesignating subparagraph (E) as

10395 subparagraph (F); and

10396 (G) by inserting after subparagraph (D) the

10397 following:

10398 ``(E) give priority to the enrollment of the land

10399 covered by the contract in--

10400 ``(i) the environmental quality incentives

10401 program established under subchapter A of chapter

10402 4;

10403 ``(ii) the conservation stewardship program

10404 established under subchapter B of chapter 4; or

10405 ``(iii) the agricultural conservation easement

10406 program established under subtitle H; and''; and

10407 (2) in paragraph (2)--
