10409 striking ``The Secretary'' and inserting ``To the extent

10410 that the maximum number of acres permitted to be

10411 enrolled under the conservation reserve program has not

10412 been met, the Secretary''; and

10413 (B) by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the

10414 following:

10415 ``(A)(i) is carried out on land described in

10416 paragraph (4) or (5) of section 1231(b); and

10417 ``(ii) is eligible for continuous enrollment under

10418 section 1231(d)(6); and''.

10419

10420 (b) End of Contract Considerations.--Section 1235(g) of the Food

10421Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3835(g)) is amended to read as follows:

10422 ``(g) End of Contract Considerations.--The Secretary shall not

10423consider an owner or operator to be in violation of a term or condition

10424of the conservation reserve contract if--

10425 ``(1) during the year prior to expiration of the contract,

10426 the owner or operator--

10427 ``(A)(i) enters into a contract under the

10428 environmental quality incentives program established

10429 under subchapter A of chapter 4; and

10430 ``(ii) begins the establishment of a practice under

10431 that contract; or

10432 ``(B)(i) enters into a contract under the

10433 conservation stewardship program established under

10434 subchapter B of chapter 4; and

10435 ``(ii) begins the establishment of a practice under

10436 that contract; or

10437 ``(2) during the 3 years prior to the expiration of the

10438 contract, the owner or operator begins the certification process

10439 under the Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6501 et

10440 seq.).''.

10441

10442[[Page 132 STAT. 4551]]

10443

10444SEC. 2209. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3831 note.&gt;&gt; ELIGIBLE LAND; STATE LAW

10445 REQUIREMENTS.

10446

10447 The Secretary shall revise paragraph (4) of section 1410.6(d) of

10448title 7, Code of Federal Regulations, to provide that land enrolled

10449under a Conservation Reserve Enhancement Program agreement initially

10450established before January 1, 2014 (including an amended or successor

10451Conservation Reserve Enhancement Program agreement, as determined by the

10452Secretary), shall not be ineligible for enrollment in the conservation

10453reserve program established under subchapter B of chapter 1 of subtitle

10454D of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3831 et seq.)

10455under that paragraph if the Deputy Administrator (as defined in section

104561410.2(b) of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor

10457regulations)), on recommendation from and in consultation with the

10458applicable State technical committee established under section 1261(a)

10459of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3861(a)) determines, under

10460such terms and conditions as the Deputy Administrator, in consultation

10461with the State technical committee, determines to be appropriate, that

10462making that land eligible for enrollment in that program is not contrary

10463to the purposes of that program.

10464

10465 Subtitle C--Environmental Quality Incentives Program and Conservation

10466 Stewardship Program

10467

10468SEC. 2301. REPEAL OF CONSERVATION PROGRAMS.

10469

10470 (a) In General.--Chapter 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food

10471Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa et seq.) is amended--

10472 (1) by striking the chapter designation and heading and

10473 inserting the following:

10474

10475 ``CHAPTER 4--ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY INCENTIVES PROGRAM AND CONSERVATION

10476 STEWARDSHIP PROGRAM

10477

10478 ``Subchapter A--Environmental Quality Incentives Program''; and

10479

10480 (2) by inserting after section 1240H the following:

10481

10482 ``Subchapter B--Conservation Stewardship Program''.

10483

10484 (b) Conservation Stewardship Program.--Subchapter B of chapter 2 of

10485subtitle D of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

104863838d et seq.) is amended--

10487 (1) by redesignating sections 1238D through 1238G &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16

10488 USC 3838d-3838g.&gt;&gt; as sections 1240I through 1240L,

10489 respectively; and

10490 (2) by moving sections 1240I through 1240L &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16

10491 USC 3839aa-21-- 3839aa-24.&gt;&gt; (as so redesignated) so as to

10492 appear after the subchapter heading for subchapter B of chapter

10493 4 of subtitle D of title XII of that Act (as added by subsection

10494 (a)(2)).

10495

10496 (c) Repeal.--

10497 (1) In general.--Chapter 2 of subtitle D of title XII of the

10498 Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3838 et seq.) (as amended

10499 by subsection (b)) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3838-3838c.&gt;&gt; is repealed.

10500

10501[[Page 132 STAT. 4552]]

10502

10503 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3838d note.&gt;&gt; Termination of

10504 conservation stewardship program.--Effective on the date of

10505 enactment of this Act, the conservation stewardship program

10506 under subchapter B of chapter 2 of subtitle D of title XII of

10507 the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3838d et seq.) (as in

10508 effect on the day before the date of enactment of this Act)

10509 shall cease to be effective.

10510 (3) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3839aa-21 note.&gt;&gt; Transitional

10511 provisions.--

10512 (A) Effect on existing contracts and agreements.--

10513 The cessation of effectiveness under paragraph (2) shall

10514 not affect--

10515 (i) the validity or terms of any contract

10516 entered into by the Secretary under subchapter B

10517 of chapter 2 of subtitle D of title XII of the

10518 Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3838d et

10519 seq.) before the date of enactment of this Act, or

10520 any payments, modifications, or technical

10521 assistance required to be made in connection with

10522 the contract; or

10523 (ii) subject to subparagraph (D), any

10524 agreement entered into by the Secretary under the

10525 regional conservation partnership program under

10526 subtitle I of title XII of the Food Security Act

10527 of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871 et seq.) on or before

10528 September 30, 2018, under which conservation

10529 stewardship program acres and associated funding

10530 have been allocated to the agreement for the

10531 purpose of entering into a contract under

10532 subchapter B of chapter 2 of subtitle D of title

10533 XII of that Act (16 U.S.C. 3838d et seq.) (as in

10534 effect on the day before the date of enactment of

10535 this Act).

10536 (B) Extension permitted.--Notwithstanding paragraph

10537 (2), the Secretary may extend for 1 year a contract

10538 described in subparagraph (A)(i) if that contract

10539 expires on or before December 31, 2019, under the terms

10540 and payment rate of the existing contract and in

10541 accordance with subchapter B of chapter 2 of subtitle D

10542 of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

10543 3838d et seq.) (as in effect on the day before the date

10544 of enactment of this Act).

10545 (C) Renewal not permitted.--

10546 (i) In general.--Notwithstanding subparagraph

10547 (A), and subject to clause (ii), the Secretary may

10548 not renew a contract or agreement described in

10549 that subparagraph.

10550 (ii) Exception.--The Secretary may renew a

10551 contract described in subparagraph (A)(i)--

10552 (I) if that contract expires on or

10553 after December 31, 2019;

10554 (II) under the terms of the

10555 conservation stewardship program under

10556 subchapter B of chapter 4 of subtitle D

10557 of title XII of the Food Security Act of

10558 1985 (as added by subsections (a)(2) and

10559 (b)); and

10560 (III) subject to the limitation on

10561 funding for that subchapter under

10562 section 1241 of the Food Security Act of

10563 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3841).

10564 (D) RCPP contracts.--

10565

10566[[Page 132 STAT. 4553]]

10567

10568 (i) Treatment of acreage.--In the case of an

10569 agreement described in subparagraph (A)(ii), the

10570 Secretary may provide an amount of funding that is

10571 equivalent to the value of any acres covered by

10572 the agreement.

10573 (ii) Funds and acres not obligated.--In the

10574 case of an agreement described in subparagraph

10575 (A)(ii) to which program acres and associated

10576 funding have been allocated but not yet obligated

10577 to enter into a contract under subchapter B of

10578 chapter 2 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food

10579 Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3838d et seq.) (as

10580 in effect on the day before the date of enactment

10581 of this Act)--

10582 (I) the Secretary shall modify the

10583 agreement to authorize the entrance into

10584 a contract under subchapter B of chapter

10585 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food

10586 Security Act of 1985 (as added by

10587 subsections (a)(2) and (b)); and

10588 (II) the funds associated with the

10589 conservation stewardship program acres

10590 allocated under that agreement, on

10591 modification under subclause (I), may be

10592 used to enter into conservation

10593 stewardship program contracts with

10594 producers under subchapter B of chapter

10595 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food

10596 Security Act of 1985 (as added by

10597 subsections (a)(2) and (b)).

10598 (4) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3839aa-21 note.&gt;&gt; Contract

10599 administration.--Subject to paragraphs (3)(C) and

10600 (3)(D)(ii)(II), the Secretary shall administer each contract and

10601 agreement described in clauses (i) and (ii) of paragraph (3)(A)

10602 until the expiration of the contract or agreement in accordance

10603 with the regulations to carry out the conservation stewardship

10604 program under subchapter B of chapter 2 of subtitle D of title

10605 XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3838d et seq.)

10606 (as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of this

10607 Act) that are in effect on the day before that date of

10608 enactment.

10609 (5) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3839aa-21 note.&gt;&gt; Funding.--

10610 Notwithstanding paragraphs (1) and (2), any funds made available

10611 from the Commodity Credit Corporation under section 1241(a)(4)

10612 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3841(a)(4)) for

10613 fiscal years 2014 through 2018 shall be available to carry out--

10614 (A) any contract or agreement described in paragraph

10615 (3)(A)(i) for fiscal year 2019;

10616 (B) any contract or agreement described in paragraph

10617 (3)(A)(ii);

10618 (C) any contract extended under paragraph (3)(B);

10619 and

10620 (D) any contract or agreement under subchapter B of

10621 chapter 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food

10622 Security Act of 1985 (as added by subsections (a)(2) and

10623 (b)).

10624

10701SEC. 2302. PURPOSES OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY INCENTIVES PROGRAM.

10702

10703 Section 1240 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa) is

10704amended by striking paragraph (4) and inserting the following:

10705 ``(4) assisting producers to make beneficial, cost-effective

10706 changes to production systems, including addressing identified,

10707 new, or expected resource concerns related to organic

10708 production, grazing management, fuels management, forest

10709 management, nutrient management associated with crops and

10710 livestock, pest management, irrigation management, adapting to,

10711 and mitigating against, increasing weather volatility, drought

10712 resiliency measures, or other practices on agricultural and

10713 forested land.''.

10714SEC. 2303. DEFINITIONS UNDER ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY INCENTIVES

10715 PROGRAM.

10716

10717 Section 1240A of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa-1)

10718is amended--

10719 (1) by redesignating paragraphs (1), (2), (3), (4) and (5)

10720 as paragraphs (2), (4), (5), (6), and (8), respectively;

10721 (2) by inserting before paragraph (2) (as so redesignated)

10722 the following:

10723 ``(1) Conservation planning assessment.--The term

10724 `conservation planning assessment' means a report, as determined

10725 by the Secretary, that--

10726 ``(A) is developed by--

10727 ``(i) a State or unit of local government

10728 (including a conservation district);

10729 ``(ii) a Federal agency; or

10730 ``(iii) a third-party provider certified under

10731 section 1242(e) (including a certified rangeland

10732 professional);

10733 ``(B) assesses rangeland or cropland function and

10734 describes conservation activities to enhance the

10735 economic and ecological management of that land; and

10736 ``(C) can be incorporated into a comprehensive

10737 planning document required by the Secretary for

10738 enrollment in a conservation program of the Department

10739 of Agriculture.'';

10740 (3) in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated), in subparagraph

10741 (B)(vi)--

10742 (A) by inserting ``environmentally sensitive

10743 areas,'' after ``marshes,''; and

10744 (B) by inserting ``identified or expected'' before

10745 ``resource concerns'';

10746 (4) by inserting after paragraph (2) (as so redesignated)

10747 the following:

10748 ``(3) Incentive practice.--The term `incentive practice'

10749 means a practice or set of practices approved by the Secretary

10750 that, when implemented and maintained on eligible land, address

10751 1 or more priority resource concerns.'';

10752 (5) in paragraph (6) (as so redesignated)--

10753

10754[[Page 132 STAT. 4556]]

10755

10756 (A) in subparagraph (A)--

10757 (i) in clause (iv), by striking ``and'' at the

10758 end;

10759 (ii) by redesignating clause (v) as clause

10760 (vii); and

10761 (iii) by inserting after clause (iv) the

10762 following:

10763 ``(v) soil testing;

10764 ``(vi) soil remediation to be carried out by

10765 the producer; and''; and

10766 (B) in subparagraph (B)--

10767 (i) in clause (i), by striking ``and'' at the

10768 end;

10769 (ii) by redesignating clause (ii) as clause

10770 (vi); and

10771 (iii) by inserting after clause (i) the

10772 following:

10773 ``(ii) planning for resource-conserving crop

10774 rotations (as defined in section 1240L(d)(1));

10775 ``(iii) soil health planning, including

10776 increasing soil organic matter and the use of

10777 cover crops;

10778 ``(iv) a conservation planning assessment;

10779 ``(v) precision conservation management

10780 planning; and'';

10781 (6) by inserting after paragraph (6) (as so redesignated)

10782 the following:

10783 ``(7) Priority resource concern.--The term `priority

10784 resource concern' means a natural resource concern or problem,

10785 as determined by the Secretary, that--

10786 ``(A) is identified at the national, State, or local

10787 level as a priority for a particular area of a State;

10788 and

10789 ``(B) represents a significant concern in a State or

10790 region.''; and

10791 (7) by adding at the end the following:

10792 ``(9) Soil remediation.--The term `soil remediation' means

10793 scientifically based practices that--

10794 ``(A) ensure the safety of producers from

10795 contaminants in soil;

10796 ``(B) limit contaminants in soil from entering

10797 agricultural products for human or animal consumption;

10798 and

10799 ``(C) regenerate and sustain the soil.

10800 ``(10) Soil testing.--The term `soil testing' means the

10801 evaluation of soil health, including testing for--

10802 ``(A) the optimal level of constituents in the soil,

10803 such as organic matter, nutrients, and the potential

10804 presence of soil contaminants, including heavy metals,

10805 volatile organic compounds, polycyclic aromatic

10806 hydrocarbons, or other contaminants; and

10807 ``(B) the biological and physical characteristics

10808 indicative of proper soil functioning.''.

10809SEC. 2304. ESTABLISHMENT AND ADMINISTRATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL

10810 QUALITY INCENTIVES PROGRAM.

10811

10812 (a) Establishment.--Section 1240B(a) of the Food Security Act of

108131985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa-2(a)) is amended by striking ``2019'' and

10814inserting ``2023''.

10815 (b) Payments.--Section 1240B(d) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16

10816U.S.C. 3839aa-2(d)) is amended--

10817 (1) in paragraph (4)(B)--

10818 (A) in clause (i)--

10819 (i) by striking ``Not more than'' and

10820 inserting ``On an election by a producer described

10821 in subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall provide

10822 at least'';

10823

10824[[Page 132 STAT. 4557]]

10825

10826 (ii) by striking ``may be provided''; and

10827 (iii) by striking ``the purpose of'' and

10828 inserting ``all costs related to''; and

10829 (B) by adding at the end the following:

10830 ``(iii) Notification and documentation.--The

10831 Secretary shall--

10832 ``(I) notify each producer described

10833 in subparagraph (A), at the time of

10834 enrollment in the program, of the option

10835 to receive advance payments under clause

10836 (i); and

10837 ``(II) document the election of each

10838 producer described in subparagraph (A)

10839 to receive advance payments under clause

10840 (i) with respect to each practice that

10841 has costs described in that clause.'';

10842 and

10843 (2) by adding at the end the following:

10844 ``(7) Increased payments for high-priority practices.--

10845 ``(A) State determination.--Each State, in

10846 consultation with the State technical committee

10847 established under section 1261(a) for the State, may

10848 designate not more than 10 practices to be eligible for

10849 increased payments under subparagraph (B), on the

10850 condition that the practice, as determined by the

10851 Secretary--

10852 ``(i) addresses specific causes of impairment

10853 relating to excessive nutrients in groundwater or

10854 surface water;

10855 ``(ii) addresses the conservation of water to

10856 advance drought mitigation and declining aquifers;

10857 ``(iii) meets other environmental priorities

10858 and other priority resource concerns identified in

10859 habitat or other area restoration plans; or

10860 ``(iv) is geographically targeted to address a

10861 natural resource concern in a specific watershed.

10862 ``(B) Increased payments.--Notwithstanding paragraph

10863 (2), in the case of a practice designated under

10864 subparagraph (A), the Secretary may increase the amount

10865 that would otherwise be provided for a practice under

10866 this subsection to not more than 90 percent of the costs

10867 associated with planning, design, materials, equipment,

10868 installation, labor, management, maintenance, or

10869 training.''.

10870

10871 (c) Allocation of Funding.--Section 1240B(f) of the Food Security

10872Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa-2(f)) is amended--

10873 (1) in paragraph (1)--

10874 (A) by striking ``2014 through 2018'' and inserting

10875 ``2019 through 2023'';

10876 (B) by striking ``60'' and inserting ``50''; and

10877 (C) by striking ``production.'' and inserting

10878 ``production, including grazing management practices.'';

10879 and

10880 (2) in paragraph (2)--

10881 (A) by striking ``For each'' and inserting the

10882 following:

10883 ``(A) Fiscal years 2014 through 2018.--For each'';

10884 and

10885 (B) by adding at the end the following:

10886 ``(B) Fiscal years 2019 through 2023.--For each of

10887 fiscal years 2019 through 2023, at least 10 percent of

10888 the funds made available for payments under the program

10889

10890[[Page 132 STAT. 4558]]

10891

10892 shall be targeted at practices benefitting wildlife

10893 habitat under subsection (g).''.

10894

10895 (d) Wildlife Habitat Incentive Program.--Section 1240B(g) of the

10896Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa-2(g)) is amended by adding

10897at the end the following:

10898 ``(3) Maximum term.--In the case of a contract under the

10899 program entered into solely for the establishment of 1 or more

10900 annual management practices for the benefit of wildlife as

10901 described in paragraph (1), notwithstanding any maximum contract

10902 term established by the Secretary, the contract shall have a

10903 term that does not exceed 10 years.

10904 ``(4) Included practices.--For the purpose of providing

10905 seasonal wetland habitat for waterfowl and migratory birds, a

10906 practice that is eligible for payment under paragraph (1) and

10907 targeted for funding under subsection (f) may include--

10908 ``(A) a practice to carry out postharvest flooding;

10909 or

10910 ``(B) a practice to maintain the hydrology of

10911 temporary and seasonal wetlands of not more than 2 acres

10912 to maintain waterfowl and migratory bird habitat on

10913 working cropland.''.

10914

10915 (e) Water Conservation or Irrigation Efficiency Practice.--Section

109161240B(h) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa-2(h)) is

10917amended--

10918 (1) by striking paragraph (1) and inserting the following:

10919 ``(1) Availability of payments.--The Secretary may provide

10920 water conservation and system efficiency payments under this

10921 subsection to an entity described in paragraph (2) or a producer

10922 for--

10923 ``(A) water conservation scheduling, water

10924 distribution efficiency, soil moisture monitoring, or an

10925 appropriate combination thereof;

10926 ``(B) irrigation-related structural or other

10927 measures that conserve surface water or groundwater,

10928 including managed aquifer recovery practices; or

10929 ``(C) a transition to water-conserving crops, water-

10930 conserving crop rotations, or deficit irrigation.'';

10931 (2) by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3);

10932 (3) by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

10933 ``(2) Eligibility of certain entities.--

10934 ``(A) In general.--Notwithstanding section

10935 1001(f)(6), the Secretary may enter into a contract

10936 under this subsection with a State, irrigation district,

10937 groundwater management district, acequia, land-grant

10938 mercedes, or similar entity under a streamlined

10939 contracting process to implement water conservation or

10940 irrigation practices under a watershed-wide project that

10941 will effectively conserve water, provide fish and

10942 wildlife habitat, or provide for drought-related

10943 environmental mitigation, as determined by the

10944 Secretary.

10945 ``(B) Implementation.--Water conservation or

10946 irrigation practices that are the subject of a contract

10947 entered into under subparagraph (A) shall be implemented

10948 on--

10949 ``(i) eligible land of a producer; or

10950 ``(ii) land that is--

10951 ``(I) under the control of an

10952 irrigation district, groundwater

10953 management district, acequia, land-grant

10954 mercedes, or similar entity; and

10955

10956[[Page 132 STAT. 4559]]

10957

10958 ``(II) adjacent to eligible land

10959 described in clause (i), as determined

10960 by the Secretary.

10961 ``(C) Waiver authority.--The Secretary may waive the

10962 applicability of the limitations in section 1001D(b) or

10963 section 1240G for a payment made under a contract

10964 entered into under this paragraph if the Secretary

10965 determines that the waiver is necessary to fulfill the

10966 objectives of the project.

10967 ``(D) Contract limitations.--If the Secretary grants

10968 a waiver under subparagraph (C), the Secretary may

10969 impose a separate payment limitation for the contract

10970 with respect to which the waiver applies.'';

10971 (4) in paragraph (3) (as so redesignated)--

10972 (A) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by

10973 striking ``to a producer'' and inserting ``under this

10974 subsection'';

10975 (B) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``the eligible

10976 land of the producer is located, there is a reduction in

10977 water use in the operation of the producer'' and

10978 inserting ``the land on which the practices will be

10979 implemented is located, there is a reduction in water

10980 use in the operation on that land''; and

10981 (C) in subparagraph (B), by inserting ``except in

10982 the case of an application under paragraph (2),'' before

10983 ``the producer agrees''; and

10984 (5) by adding at the end the following:

10985 ``(4) Effect.--Nothing in this subsection authorizes the

10986 Secretary to modify the process for determining the annual

10987 allocation of funding to States under the program.''.

10988

10989 (f) Payments for Conservation Practices Related to Organic

10990Production.--Section 1240B(i)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16

10991U.S.C. 3839aa-2(i)(3)) is amended--

10992 (1) in the first sentence, by striking ``Payments'' and

10993 inserting the following:

10994 ``(A) In general.--Payments'';

10995 (2) in the second sentence, by striking ``In applying these

10996 limitations'' and inserting the following:

10997 ``(B) Technical assistance.--In applying the

10998 limitations under subparagraph (A)''; and

10999 (3) in subparagraph (A) (as so designated)--

11000 (A) by striking ``aggregate, $20,000 per year or

11001 $80,000 during any 6-year period.'' and inserting the

11002 following: ``aggregate--

11003 ``(i) through fiscal year 2018--

11004 ``(I) $20,000 per year; or

11005 ``(II) $80,000 during any 6-year

11006 period; and''; and

11007 (B) by adding at the end the following:

11008 ``(ii) during the period of fiscal years 2019

11009 through 2023, $140,000.''.

11010

11011 (g) Conservation Incentive Contracts.--Section 1240B of the Food

11012Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa-2) is amended by adding at the

11013end the following:

11014 ``(j) Conservation Incentive Contracts.--

11015 ``(1) Identification of eligible priority resource concerns

11016 for states.--

11017

11018[[Page 132 STAT. 4560]]

11019

11020 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary, in consultation

11021 with the applicable State technical committee

11022 established under section 1261(a), shall identify

11023 watersheds (or other appropriate regions or areas within

11024 a State) and the corresponding priority resource

11025 concerns for those watersheds or other regions or areas

11026 that are eligible to be the subject of an incentive

11027 contract under this subsection.

11028 ``(B) Limitation.--For each of the relevant land

11029 uses within the watersheds, regions, or other areas

11030 identified under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall

11031 identify not more than 3 eligible priority resource

11032 concerns.

11033 ``(2) Contracts.--

11034 ``(A) Authority.--

11035 ``(i) In general.--The Secretary shall enter

11036 into contracts with producers under this

11037 subsection that require the implementation,

11038 adoption, management, and maintenance of incentive

11039 practices that effectively address at least 1

11040 eligible priority resource concern identified

11041 under paragraph (1) for the term of the contract.

11042 ``(ii) Inclusions.--Through a contract entered

11043 into under clause (i), the Secretary may provide--

11044 ``(I) funding, through annual

11045 payments, for certain incentive

11046 practices to attain increased levels of

11047 conservation on eligible land; or

11048 ``(II) assistance, through a

11049 practice payment, to implement an

11050 incentive practice.

11051 ``(B) Term.--A contract under this subsection shall

11052 have a term of not less than 5, and not more than 10,

11053 years.

11054 ``(C) Prioritization.--Notwithstanding section

11055 1240C, the Secretary shall develop criteria for

11056 evaluating incentive practice applications that--

11057 ``(i) give priority to applications that

11058 address eligible priority resource concerns

11059 identified under paragraph (1); and

11060 ``(ii) evaluate applications relative to other

11061 applications for similar agriculture and forest

11062 operations.

11063 ``(3) Incentive practice payments.--

11064 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall provide

11065 payments to producers through contracts entered into

11066 under paragraph (2) for--

11067 ``(i) adopting and installing incentive

11068 practices; and

11069 ``(ii) managing, maintaining, and improving

11070 the incentive practices for the duration of the

11071 contract, as determined appropriate by the

11072 Secretary.

11073 ``(B) Payment amounts.--In determining the amount of

11074 payments under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall

11075 consider, to the extent practicable--

11076 ``(i) the level and extent of the incentive

11077 practice to be installed, adopted, completed,

11078 maintained, managed, or improved;

11079 ``(ii) the cost of the installation, adoption,

11080 completion, management, maintenance, or

11081 improvement of the incentive practice;

11082 ``(iii) income foregone by the producer,

11083 including payments, as appropriate, to address--

11084

11085[[Page 132 STAT. 4561]]

11086

11087 ``(I) increased economic risk;

11088 ``(II) loss in revenue due to

11089 anticipated reductions in yield; and

11090 ``(III) economic losses during

11091 transition to a resource-conserving

11092 cropping system or resource-conserving

11093 land use; and

11094 ``(iv) the extent to which compensation would

11095 ensure long-term continued maintenance,

11096 management, and improvement of the incentive

11097 practice.

11098 ``(C) Delivery of payments.--In making payments

11099 under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall, to the

11100 extent practicable--

11101 ``(i) in the case of annual payments under

11102 paragraph (2)(A)(ii)(I), make those payments as

11103 soon as practicable after October 1 of each fiscal

11104 year for which increased levels of conservation

11105 are maintained during the term of the contract;

11106 and

11107 ``(ii) in the case of practice payments under

11108 paragraph (2)(A)(ii)(II), make those payments as

11109 soon as practicable on the implementation of an

11110 incentive practice.''.

11113 Section 1240E(a)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

111143839aa-5(a)(3)) is amended by inserting ``progressive'' before

11115``implementation''.

11117 INCENTIVES PROGRAM.

11124 through 2023,'' after ``2018,''.

11125SEC. 2307. CONSERVATION INNOVATION GRANTS AND PAYMENTS.

11126

11127 (a) Competitive Grants for Innovative Conservation Approaches.--

11128Section 1240H(a)(2) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa-

111298(a)(2)) is amended--

11130 (1) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``program;'' and

11131 inserting ``program or community colleges (as defined in section

11132 1473E(a) of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and

11133 Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3319e(a))) carrying out

11134 demonstration projects on land of the community college;'';

11135 (2) by redesignating subparagraphs (E) and (F) as

11136 subparagraphs (G) and (H), respectively; and

11137 (3) by inserting after subparagraph (D) the following:

11138 ``(E) partner with farmers to develop innovative

11139 practices for urban, indoor, or other emerging

11140 agricultural operations;

11141 ``(F) utilize edge-of-field and other monitoring

11142 practices on farms--

11143 ``(i) to quantify the impacts of practices

11144 implemented under the program; and

11145 ``(ii) to assist producers in making the best

11146 conservation investments for the operations of the

11147 producers;''.

11148

11149[[Page 132 STAT. 4562]]

11150

11151 (b) Air Quality Concerns From Agricultural Operations.--Section

111521240H(b)(2) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa-8(b)(2))

11153is amended by striking ``$25,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009

11154through 2018'' and inserting ``$37,500,000 for each of fiscal years 2019

11155through 2023''.

11156 (c) On-Farm Conservation Innovation Trials; Reporting and

11157Database.--Section 1240H of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

111583839aa-8) is amended by striking subsection (c) and inserting the

11159following:

11160 ``(c) On-Farm Conservation Innovation Trials.--

11161 ``(1) Definitions.--In this subsection:

11162 ``(A) Eligible entity.--The term `eligible entity'

11163 means, as determined by the Secretary--

11164 ``(i) a third-party private entity the primary

11165 business of which is related to agriculture;

11166 ``(ii) a nongovernmental organization with

11167 experience working with agricultural producers; or

11168 ``(iii) a governmental organization.

11169 ``(B) New or innovative conservation approach.--The

11170 term `new or innovative conservation approach' means--

11171 ``(i) new or innovative--

11172 ``(I) precision agriculture

11173 technologies;

11174 ``(II) enhanced nutrient management

11175 plans, nutrient recovery systems, and

11176 fertilization systems;

11177 ``(III) soil health management

11178 systems, including systems to increase

11179 soil carbon levels;

11180 ``(IV) water management systems;

11181 ``(V) resource-conserving crop

11182 rotations (as defined in section

11183 1240L(d)(1));

11184 ``(VI) cover crops; and

11185 ``(VII) irrigation systems; and

11186 ``(ii) any other conservation approach

11187 approved by the Secretary as new or innovative.

11188 ``(2) Testing new or innovative conservation approaches.--

11189 Using $25,000,000 of the funds made available to carry out this

11190 subchapter for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023, the

11191 Secretary shall carry out on-farm conservation innovation

11192 trials, on eligible land of producers, to test new or innovative

11193 conservation approaches--

11194 ``(A) directly with producers; or

11195 ``(B) through eligible entities.

11196 ``(3) Incentive payments.--

11197 ``(A) Agreements.--In carrying out paragraph (2),

11198 the Secretary shall enter into agreements with producers

11199 (either directly or through eligible entities) on whose

11200 land an on-farm conservation innovation trial is being

11201 carried out to provide payments (including payments to

11202 compensate for foregone income, as appropriate to

11203 address the increased economic risk potentially

11204 associated with new or innovative conservation

11205 approaches) to the producers to assist with adopting and

11206 evaluating new or innovative conservation approaches to

11207 achieve conservation benefits.

11208 ``(B) Adjusted gross income requirements.--

11209 ``(i) In general.--Adjusted gross income

11210 requirements under section 1001D(b)(1) shall--

11211

11212[[Page 132 STAT. 4563]]

11213

11214 ``(I) apply to producers receiving

11215 payments under this subsection; and

11216 ``(II) be enforced by the Secretary.

11217 ``(ii) Reporting.--An eligible entity

11218 participating in an on-farm conservation

11219 innovation trial under this subsection shall

11220 report annually to the Secretary on the amount of

11221 payments made to individual farm operations under

11222 this subsection.

11223 ``(C) Limitation on administrative expenses.--None

11224 of the funds made available to carry out this subsection

11225 may be used to pay for the administrative expenses of an

11226 eligible entity.

11227 ``(D) Length of agreements.--An agreement entered

11228 into under subparagraph (A) shall be for a period

11229 determined by the Secretary that is--

11230 ``(i) not less than 3 years; and

11231 ``(ii) if appropriate, more than 3 years,

11232 including if such a period is appropriate to

11233 support--

11234 ``(I) adaptive management over

11235 multiple crop years; and

11236 ``(II) adequate data collection and

11237 analysis by a producer or eligible

11238 entity to report the natural resource

11239 and agricultural production benefits of

11240 the new or innovative conservation

11241 approaches to the Secretary.

11242 ``(4) Flexible adoption.--The scale of adoption of a new or

11243 innovative conservation approach under an on-farm conservation

11244 innovation trial under an agreement under paragraph (2) may

11245 include multiple scales on an operation, including whole farm,

11246 field-level, or sub-field scales.

11247 ``(5) Technical assistance.--The Secretary shall provide

11248 technical assistance--

11249 ``(A) to each producer or eligible entity

11250 participating in an on-farm conservation innovation

11251 trial under paragraph (2) with respect to the design,

11252 installation, and management of the new or innovative

11253 conservation approaches; and

11254 ``(B) to each eligible entity participating in an

11255 on-farm conservation innovation trial under paragraph

11256 (2) with respect to data analyses of the on-farm

11257 conservation innovation trial.

11258 ``(6) Geographic scope.--The Secretary shall identify a

11259 diversity of geographic regions of the United States in which to

11260 establish on-farm conservation innovation trials under paragraph

11261 (2), taking into account factors such as soil type, cropping

11262 history, and water availability.

11263 ``(7) Soil health demonstration trial.--Using funds made

11264 available to carry out this subsection, the Secretary shall

11265 carry out a soil health demonstration trial under which the

11266 Secretary coordinates with eligible entities--

11267 ``(A) to provide incentives to producers to

11268 implement conservation practices that--

11269 ``(i) improve soil health;

11270 ``(ii) increase carbon levels in the soil; or

11271 ``(iii) meet the goals described in clauses

11272 (i) and (ii);

11273

11274[[Page 132 STAT. 4564]]

11275

11276 ``(B) to establish protocols for measuring carbon

11277 levels in the soil and testing carbon levels on land

11278 where conservation practices described in subparagraph

11279 (A) were applied to evaluate gains in soil health as a

11280 result of the practices implemented by the producers in

11281 the soil health demonstration trial; and

11282 ``(C)(i) not later than September 30, 2020, to

11283 initiate a study regarding changes in soil health and,

11284 if feasible, economic outcomes, generated as a result of

11285 the conservation practices described in subparagraph (A)

11286 that were applied by producers through the soil health

11287 demonstration trial; and

11288 ``(ii) to submit to the Committee on Agriculture of

11289 the House of Representatives and the Committee on

11290 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

11291 annual reports on the progress and results of the study

11292 under clause (i).

11293

11294 ``(d) Reporting and Database.--

11295 ``(1) Report required.--Not later than September 30, 2019,

11296 and every 2 years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the

11297 Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

11298 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

11299 a report on the status of activities funded under this section,

11300 including--

11301 ``(A) funding awarded;

11302 ``(B) results of the activities, including, if

11303 feasible, economic outcomes;

11304 ``(C) incorporation of findings from the activities,

11305 such as new technology and innovative approaches, into

11306 the conservation efforts implemented by the Secretary;

11307 and

11308 ``(D) on completion of the study required under

11309 subsection (c)(7)(C), the findings of the study.

11310 ``(2) Conservation practice database.--

11311 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall use the data

11312 reported under paragraph (1) to establish and maintain a

11313 publicly available conservation practice database that

11314 provides--

11315 ``(i) a compilation and analysis of effective

11316 conservation practices for soil health, nutrient

11317 management, and source water protection in varying

11318 soil compositions, cropping systems, slopes, and

11319 landscapes; and

11320 ``(ii) a list of recommended new and effective

11321 conservation practices.

11322 ``(B) Privacy.--Information provided under

11323 subparagraph (A) shall be transformed into a statistical

11324 or aggregate form so as to not include any identifiable

11325 or personal information of individual producers.''.

11326SEC. 2308. CONSERVATION STEWARDSHIP PROGRAM.

11327

11328 (a) Definitions.--Section 1240I of the Food Security Act of 1985 (as

11329redesignated by section 2301(b)) is amended--

11330 (1) in paragraph (2)(B)--

11331 (A) in clause (i), by striking ``and'' at the end;

11332 (B) in clause (ii), by striking the period at the

11333 end and inserting a semicolon; and

11334 (C) by adding at the end the following:

11335

11336[[Page 132 STAT. 4565]]

11337

11338 ``(iii) development of a comprehensive

11339 conservation plan, as defined in section

11340 1240L(e)(1);

11341 ``(iv) soil health planning, including

11342 planning to increase soil organic matter; and

11343 ``(v) activities that will assist a producer

11344 to adapt to, or mitigate against, increasing

11345 weather volatility.''; and

11346 (2) in paragraph (7), by striking the period at the end and

11347 inserting the following: ``through the use of--

11348 ``(A) quality criteria under a resource management

11349 system;

11350 ``(B) predictive analytics tools or models developed

11351 or approved by the Natural Resources Conservation

11352 Service;

11353 ``(C) data from past and current enrollment in the

11354 program; and

11355 ``(D) other methods that measure conservation and

11356 improvement in priority resource concerns, as determined

11357 by the Secretary.''.

11358

11359 (b) Conservation Stewardship Program.--

11360 (1) Establishment.--Subsection (a) of section 1240J of the

11361 Food Security Act of 1985 (as redesignated by section 2301(b))

11362 is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by striking

11363 ``2014 through 2018'' and inserting ``2019 through 2023''.

11364 (2) Exclusions.--Subsection (b)(2) of section 1240J of the

11365 Food Security Act of 1985 (as redesignated by section 2301(b))

11366 is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by striking

11367 ``the Agricultural Act of 2014'' and inserting the ``Agriculture

11368 Improvement Act of 2018''.

11369

11370 (c) Stewardship Contracts.--Section 1240K of the Food Security Act

11371of 1985 (as redesignated by section 2301(b)) is amended--

11372 (1) in subsection (b), by striking paragraph (1) and

11373 inserting the following:

11374 ``(1) Ranking of applications.--

11375 ``(A) In general.--In evaluating contract offers

11376 submitted under subsection (a) and contract renewals

11377 under subsection (e), the Secretary shall rank

11378 applications based on--

11379 ``(i) the natural resource conservation and

11380 environmental benefits that result from the

11381 conservation treatment on all applicable priority

11382 resource concerns at the time of submission of the

11383 application;

11384 ``(ii) the degree to which the proposed

11385 conservation activities increase natural resource

11386 conservation and environmental benefits; and

11387 ``(iii) other consistent criteria, as

11388 determined by the Secretary.

11389 ``(B) Additional criterion.--If 2 or more

11390 applications receive the same ranking under subparagraph

11391 (A), the Secretary shall rank those contracts based on

11392 the extent to which the actual and anticipated

11393 conservation benefits from each contract are provided at

11394 the lowest cost relative to other similarly beneficial

11395 contract offers.'';

11396 (2) in subsection (c)--

11397 (A) by striking ``the program under subsection (a)''

11398 and inserting ``a contract or contract renewal under

11399 this section'';

11400

11401[[Page 132 STAT. 4566]]

11402

11403 (B) by inserting ``or contract renewal'' before

11404 ``offer ranks'';

11405 (C) by inserting ``or contract renewal'' after

11406 ``stewardship contract''; and

11407 (D) by adding ``or contract renewal'' before the

11408 period at the end;

11409 (3) in subsection (d)(2)(A), by striking ``1238G(d)'' and

11410 inserting ``1240L(c)''; and

11411 (4) in subsection (e)--

11412 (A) in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by

11413 striking ``At the end'' and all that follows through

11414 ``period'' the second place it appears and inserting the

11415 following: ``The Secretary may provide the producer an

11416 opportunity to renew an existing contract in the first

11417 half of the fifth year of the contract period'';

11418 (B) in paragraph (1), by striking ``initial'' and

11419 inserting ``existing'';

11420 (C) in paragraph (2)--

11421 (i) by inserting ``new or improved'' after

11422 ``integrate''; and

11423 (ii) by inserting ``demonstrating continued

11424 improvement during the additional 5-year period,''

11425 after ``operation,''; and

11426 (D) in paragraph (3)(B), by striking ``to exceed the

11427 stewardship threshold of'' and inserting ``to adopt or

11428 improve conservation activities, as determined by the

11429 Secretary, to achieve higher levels of performance with

11430 respect to not less than''.

11431

11432 (d) Duties of Secretary.--Section 1240L of the Food Security Act of

114331985 (as redesignated by section 2301(b)) is amended--

11434 (1) in subsection (b), in the matter preceding paragraph

11435 (1), by striking ``acres'' and inserting ``funding'';

11436 (2) by striking subsection (c);

11437 (3) by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections

11438 (c) and (d), respectively;

11439 (4) in subsection (c) (as so redesignated), by adding at the

11440 end the following:

11441 ``(5) Payment for cover crop activities.--The amount of a

11442 payment under this subsection for cover crop activities shall be

11443 not less than 125 percent of the annual payment amount

11444 determined by the Secretary under paragraph (2).'';

11445 (5) in subsection (d) (as so redesignated)--

11446 (A) in the subsection heading, by inserting ``and

11447 Advanced Grazing Management'' after ``Rotations'';

11448 (B) by striking paragraph (2);

11449 (C) by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (4) as

11450 paragraphs (2) and (1), respectively, and moving the

11451 paragraphs so as to appear in numerical order;

11452 (D) in paragraph (1) (as so redesignated)--

11453 (i) by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through

11454 (D) and (E) as clauses (i) through (iv) and (vi),

11455 respectively, and indenting appropriately;

11456 (ii) by striking the paragraph designation and

11457 all that follows through ``the term'' in the

11458 matter preceding clause (i) (as so redesignated)

11459 and inserting the following:

11460 ``(1) Definitions.--In this subsection:

11461

11462[[Page 132 STAT. 4567]]

11463

11464 ``(A) Advanced grazing management.--The term

11465 `advanced grazing management' means the use of a

11466 combination of grazing practices (as determined by the

11467 Secretary), which may include management-intensive

11468 rotational grazing, that provide for--

11469 ``(i) improved soil health and carbon

11470 sequestration;

11471 ``(ii) drought resilience;

11472 ``(iii) wildlife habitat;

11473 ``(iv) wildfire mitigation;

11474 ``(v) control of invasive plants; and

11475 ``(vi) water quality improvement.

11476 ``(B) Management-intensive rotational grazing.--The

11477 term `management-intensive rotational grazing' means a

11478 strategic, adaptively managed multipasture grazing

11479 system in which animals are regularly and systematically

11480 moved to fresh pasture in a manner that--

11481 ``(i) maximizes the quantity and quality of

11482 forage growth;

11483 ``(ii) improves manure distribution and

11484 nutrient cycling;

11485 ``(iii) increases carbon sequestration from

11486 greater forage harvest;

11487 ``(iv) improves the quality and quantity of

11488 cover for wildlife;

11489 ``(v) provides permanent cover to protect the

11490 soil from erosion; and

11491 ``(vi) improves water quality.

11492 ``(C) Resource-conserving crop rotation.--The

11493 term''; and

11494 (iii) in subparagraph (C) (as so designated)--

11495 (I) in clause (iv) (as so

11496 redesignated), by striking ``and'' at

11497 the end; and

11498 (II) by inserting after clause (iv)

11499 (as so redesignated) the following:

11500 ``(v) builds soil organic matter; and'';

11501 (E) in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated), by

11502 striking ``improve resource-conserving'' and all that

11503 follows through the period at the end and inserting the

11504 following: ``improve, manage, and maintain--

11505 ``(A) resource-conserving crop rotations; or

11506 ``(B) advanced grazing management.'';

11507 (F) in paragraph (3)--

11508 (i) by striking ``paragraph (1)'' and

11509 inserting ``paragraph (2)''; and

11510 (ii) by striking ``and maintain'' and all that

11511 follows through the period at the end and

11512 inserting ``or improve, manage, and maintain

11513 resource-conserving crop rotations or advanced

11514 grazing management for the term of the

11515 contract.''; and

11516 (G) by adding at the end the following:

11517 ``(4) Amount of payment.--An additional payment provided

11518 under paragraph (2) shall be not less than 150 percent of the

11519 annual payment amount determined by the Secretary under

11520 subsection (c)(2).'';

11521 (6) by inserting after subsection (d) (as so redesignated)

11522 the following:

11523

11524 ``(e) Payment for Comprehensive Conservation Plan.--

11525

11526[[Page 132 STAT. 4568]]

11527

11528 ``(1) Definition of comprehensive conservation plan.--In

11529 this subsection, the term `comprehensive conservation plan'

11530 means a conservation plan that meets or exceeds the stewardship

11531 threshold for each priority resource concern identified by the

11532 Secretary under subsection (a)(2).

11533 ``(2) Payment for comprehensive conservation plan.--The

11534 Secretary shall provide a 1-time payment to a producer that

11535 develops a comprehensive conservation plan.

11536 ``(3) Amount of payment.--The Secretary shall determine the

11537 amount of payment under paragraph (2) based on--

11538 ``(A) the number of priority resource concerns

11539 addressed in the comprehensive conservation plan; and

11540 ``(B) the number of types of land uses included in

11541 the comprehensive conservation plan.'';

11542 (7) in subsection (f), by striking ``2014 through 2018'' and

11543 inserting ``2019 through 2023'';

11544 (8) in subsection (h)--

11545 (A) by striking the subsection designation and

11546 heading and all that follows through ``The Secretary''

11547 and inserting the following:

11548

11549 ``(h) Organic Certification.--

11550 ``(1) Coordination.--The Secretary''; and

11551 (B) by adding at the end the following:

11552 ``(2) Allocation.--

11553 ``(A) In general.--Using funds made available for

11554 the program for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023,

11555 the Secretary shall allocate funding to States to

11556 support organic production and transition to organic

11557 production through paragraph (1).

11558 ``(B) Determination.--The Secretary shall determine

11559 the allocation to a State under subparagraph (A) based

11560 on--

11561 ``(i) the number of certified and

11562 transitioning organic operations within the State;

11563 and

11564 ``(ii) the number of acres of certified and

11565 transitioning organic production within the

11566 State.''; and

11567 (9) by adding at the end the following:

11568

11569 ``(j) Streamlining and Coordination.--To the maximum extent

11570feasible, the Secretary shall provide for streamlined and coordinated

11571procedures for the program and the environmental quality incentives

11572program under subchapter A, including applications, contracting,

11573conservation planning, conservation practices, and related

11574administrative procedures.

11575 ``(k) Soil Health.--To the maximum extent feasible, the Secretary

11576shall manage the program to enhance soil health.

11577 ``(l) Annual Report.--Each fiscal year, the Secretary shall submit

11578to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

11579Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report

11580describing the payment rates for conservation activities offered to

11581producers under the program and an analysis of whether payment rates can

11582be reduced for the most expensive conservation activities.''.

11583SEC. 2309. GRASSLAND CONSERVATION INITIATIVE.

11584

11585 Subchapter B of chapter 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food

11586Security Act of 1985 (as added by subsections (a)(2) and (b) of section

115872301) is amended by adding at the end the following:

11588

11589[[Page 132 STAT. 4569]]

11590

11591``SEC. 1240L-1. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3839aa-25.&gt;&gt; GRASSLAND

11592 CONSERVATION INITIATIVE.

11593

11594 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

11595 ``(1) Eligible land.--Notwithstanding sections 1240I(4) and

11596 1240J(b)(2), the term `eligible land' means cropland on a farm

11597 for which base acres have been maintained by the Secretary under

11598 section 1112(d)(3) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C.

11599 9012(d)(3)).

11600 ``(2) Initiative.--The term `initiative' means the grassland

11601 conservation initiative established under subsection (b).

11602

11603 ``(b) Establishment and Purpose.--The Secretary shall establish

11604within the program a grassland conservation initiative for the purpose

11605of assisting producers in protecting grazing uses, conserving and

11606improving soil, water, and wildlife resources, and achieving related

11607conservation values by conserving eligible land through grassland

11608conservation contracts under subsection (e).

11609 ``(c) Election.--Beginning in fiscal year 2019, the Secretary shall

11610provide a 1-time election to enroll eligible land in the initiative

11611under a contract described in subsection (e).

11612 ``(d) Method of Enrollment.--The Secretary shall--

11613 ``(1) notwithstanding subsection (b) of section 1240K,

11614 determine under subsection (c) of that section that eligible

11615 land ranks sufficiently high under the evaluation criteria

11616 described in subsection (b) of that section; and

11617 ``(2) enroll the eligible land in the initiative under a

11618 contract described in subsection (e).

11619

11620 ``(e) Grassland Conservation Contract.--

11621 ``(1) In general.--Notwithstanding section 1240K(a)(1), to

11622 enroll eligible land in the initiative under a grassland

11623 conservation contract, a producer shall agree--

11624 ``(A) to meet or exceed the stewardship threshold

11625 for not less than 1 priority resource concern by the

11626 date on which the contract expires; and

11627 ``(B) to comply with the terms and conditions of the

11628 contract.

11629 ``(2) Terms.--A grassland conservation contract entered into

11630 under this section shall--

11631 ``(A)(i) be for a single 5-year term; and

11632 ``(ii) not be subject to renewal or reenrollment

11633 under section 1240K(e); and

11634 ``(B) be subject to section 1240K(d).

11635 ``(3) Early termination.--The Secretary shall allow a

11636 producer that enters into a grassland conservation contract

11637 under this section--

11638 ``(A) to terminate the contract at any time; and

11639 ``(B) to retain payments already received under the

11640 contract.

11641

11642 ``(f) Grassland Conservation Plan.--The grassland conservation plan

11643developed for eligible land shall be limited to--

11644 ``(1) eligible land; and

11645 ``(2) resource concerns and activities relating to

11646 grassland.

11647

11648 ``(g) Payments.--

11649 ``(1) In general.--Beginning in fiscal year 2019, of the

11650 funds made available for this subchapter under section

11651 1241(a)(3)(B), and notwithstanding any payment under title I of

11652 the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, an amendment made by

11653 that title, or section 1240L(c), the Secretary shall make annual

11654 grassland conservation contract payments to the

11655

11656[[Page 132 STAT. 4570]]

11657

11658 producer of any eligible land that is the subject of a grassland

11659 conservation contract under this section.

11660 ``(2) Payment noneligibility.--A grassland conservation

11661 contract under this section shall not be--

11662 ``(A) eligible for payments under section 1240L(d);

11663 or

11664 ``(B) subject to the payment limitations under this

11665 subchapter.

11666 ``(3) Limitation.--The amount of an annual payment under

11667 this subsection shall be $18 per acre, not to exceed the number

11668 of base acres on a farm.

11669

11670 ``(h) Considered Planted.--The Secretary shall consider land

11671enrolled under a grassland conservation contract under this section

11672during a crop year to be planted or considered planted to a covered

11673commodity (as defined in section 1111 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7

11674U.S.C. 9011)) during that crop year.

11675 ``(i) Other Contracts.--A producer with an agricultural operation

11676that contains land eligible under this section and land eligible under

11677section 1240K--

11678 ``(1) may enroll the land eligible under this section

11679 through a contract under this section or under section 1240K;

11680 and

11681 ``(2) shall not be prohibited from enrolling the land

11682 eligible under section 1240K through a contract under section

11683 1240K.''.

11684

11685 Subtitle D--Other Conservation Programs

11686

11687SEC. 2401. WATERSHED PROTECTION AND FLOOD PREVENTION.

11688

11690Protection and Flood Prevention Act (16 U.S.C. 1003) is amended--

11691 (1) by striking the section designation and all that follows

11692 through ``In order to assist'' and inserting the following:

11693``SEC. 3. ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS.

11694

11695 ``(a) In General.--In order to assist''; and

11696 (2) by adding at the end the following:

11697

11698 ``(b) Waiver.--The Secretary may waive the watershed plan for works

11699of improvement if the Secretary determines that--

11700 ``(1) the watershed plan is unnecessary or duplicative; and

11701 ``(2) the works of improvement are otherwise consistent with

11702 applicable requirements under section 4.''.

11703

11704 (b) Authorization of Appropriations.--Section 14(h)(2)(E) of the

11705Watershed Protection and Flood Prevention Act (16 U.S.C. 1012(h)(2)(E))

11706is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

11708and Flood Prevention Act (16 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.) is amended by adding

11709at the end the following:

11714available to carry out this Act $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2019 and

11715each fiscal year thereafter.''.

11737SEC. 2403. EMERGENCY CONSERVATION PROGRAM.

11738

11739 (a) Repair or Replacement of Fencing.--

11740 (1) In general.--Section 401 of the Agricultural Credit Act

11741 of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2201) is amended--

11742 (A) by inserting ``wildfires,'' after

11743 ``hurricanes,'';

11744 (B) by striking the section designation and all that

11745 follows through ``The Secretary of Agriculture'' and

11746 inserting the following:

11747``SEC. 401. EMERGENCY CONSERVATION PROGRAM.

11748

11749 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary of Agriculture (referred to in this

11750title as the `Secretary')''; and

11751 (C) by adding at the end the following:

11752

11753 ``(b) Repair or Replacement of Fencing.--

11754 ``(1) In general.--With respect to a payment to an

11755 agricultural producer under subsection (a) for the repair or

11756 replacement of fencing, the Secretary shall give the

11757 agricultural producer the option of receiving not more than 25

11758 percent of the payment, determined by the Secretary based on the

11759 applicable percentage of the fair market value of the cost of

11760 the repair or replacement, before the agricultural producer

11761 carries out the repair or replacement.

11762 ``(2) Return of funds.--If the funds provided under

11763 paragraph (1) are not expended by the end of the 60-day period

11764 beginning on the date on which the agricultural producer

11765 receives those funds, the funds shall be returned within a

11766 reasonable timeframe, as determined by the Secretary.''.

11767 (2) Conforming amendments.--

11768 (A) Sections 402, 403, 404, and 405 of the

11769 Agricultural Credit Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2202, 2203,

11770 2204, 2205) are amended by striking ``Secretary of

11771 Agriculture'' each place it appears and inserting

11772 ``Secretary''.

11773 (B) Section 407(a) of the Agricultural Credit Act of

11774 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2206(a)) is amended by striking

11775 paragraph (4).

11776

11777 (b) Cost Share Payments.--Title IV of the Agricultural Credit Act of

117781978 is amended by inserting after section 402 (16 U.S.C. 2202) the

11779following:

11780``SEC. 402A. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 2202a.&gt;&gt; COST-SHARE REQUIREMENT.

11781

11782 ``(a) Cost-share Rate.--Subject to subsections (b) and (c), the

11783maximum cost-share payment under sections 401 and 402 shall

11784

11785[[Page 132 STAT. 4572]]

11786

11787not exceed 75 percent of the total allowable cost, as determined by the

11788Secretary.

11789 ``(b) Exception.--Notwithstanding subsection (a), a payment to a

11790limited resource farmer or rancher, a socially disadvantaged farmer or

11791rancher (as defined in subsection (a) of section 2501 of the Food,

11792Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279), or a

11793beginning farmer or rancher under section 401 or 402 shall not exceed 90

11794percent of the total allowable cost, as determined by the Secretary.

11795 ``(c) Limitation.--The total payment under sections 401 and 402 for

11796a single event may not exceed 50 percent of the agriculture value of the

11797land, as determined by the Secretary.''.

11798 (c) Payment Limitations.--Title IV of the Agricultural Credit Act of

117991978 (16 U.S.C. 2201 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 402A

11800(as added by subsection (b)) the following:

11801``SEC. 402B. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 2202b.&gt;&gt; PAYMENT LIMITATION.

11802

11803 ``The maximum payment made under the emergency conservation program

11804to an agricultural producer under sections 401 and 402 shall not exceed

11805$500,000.''.

11806 (d) Watershed Protection Program.--Section 403 of the Agricultural

11807Credit Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2203) is amended--

11808 (1) by striking the section heading and inserting

11809 ``emergency watershed program''; and

11810 (2) in subsection (a), by inserting ``watershed protection''

11811 after ``emergency''.

11812

11813 (e) Funding and Administration.--Section 404 of the Agricultural

11814Credit Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2204) is amended--

11815 (1) in the fourth sentence, by striking ``The Corporation''

11816 and inserting the following:

11817

11818 ``(d) Limitation.--The Commodity Credit Corporation'';

11819 (2) in the third sentence (as amended by subsection

11820 (a)(2)(A)), by striking ``In implementing the provisions of''

11821 and inserting the following:

11822

11823 ``(c) Use of Commodity Credit Corporation.--In implementing'';

11824 (3) by striking the second sentence;

11825 (4) by striking the section designation and all that follows

11826 through ``There are authorized'' in the first sentence and

11827 inserting the following:

11828``SEC. 404. FUNDING AND ADMINISTRATION.

11829

11830 ``(a) Authorization of Appropriations.--There are authorized'';

11831 (5) in subsection (a) (as so designated), by inserting ``,

11832 to remain available until expended'' before the period at the

11833 end; and

11834 (6) by inserting after subsection (a) (as so designated) the

11835 following:

11836

11837 ``(b) Set-aside for Fencing.--Of the amounts made available under

11838subsection (a) for a fiscal year, 25 percent shall be set aside until

11839April 1 of that fiscal year for the repair or replacement of fencing.''.

11889 period of fiscal years 2019 through 2023'' before

11890 the period at the end;

11897 period of fiscal years 2019 through 2023 to encourage public

11899 section 1265C through agreements with States and tribal

11900 governments under this section.''.

11901SEC. 2407. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 1531 note.&gt;&gt; WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT.

11902

11903 (a) In General.--The Secretary and the Secretary of the Interior

11904shall continue to carry out the Working Lands for Wildlife model of

11905conservation on working landscapes, as implemented on

11906

11907[[Page 132 STAT. 4574]]

11908

11909the day before the date of enactment of this Act, in accordance with--

11910 (1) the document entitled ``Partnership Agreement Between

11911 the United States Department of Agriculture Natural Resources

11912 Conservation Service and the United States Department of the

11913 Interior Fish and Wildlife Service'', numbered A-3A7516-937, and

11914 formalized by the Chief of the Natural Resources Conservation

11915 Service on September 15, 2016, and by the Director of the United

11916 States Fish and Wildlife Service on August 4, 2016, as in effect

11917 on September 15, 2016; and

11918 (2) United States Fish and Wildlife Service Director's Order

11919 No. 217, dated August 9, 2016, as in effect on August 9, 2016.

11920

11921 (b) Expansion of Model.--The Secretary and the Secretary of the

11922Interior may expand the conservation model described in subsection (a)

11923through a new partnership agreement between the Farm Service Agency and

11924the United States Fish and Wildlife Service for the purpose of carrying

11925out conservation activities for species conservation.

11926 (c) Extension of Period of Regulatory Predictability.--

11927 (1) Definition of period of regulatory predictability.--In

11928 this subsection, the term ``period of regulatory

11929 predictability'' means the period of regulatory predictability

11930 under the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1531 et

11931 seq.) initially determined in accordance with the document and

11932 order described in paragraphs (1) and (2), respectively, of

11933 subsection (a).

11934 (2) Extension.--After the period of regulatory

11935 predictability, on request of the Secretary, the Secretary of

11936 the Interior, acting through the Director of the United States

11937 Fish and Wildlife Service, may provide additional consultation

11938 under section 7(a)(2) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16

11939 U.S.C. 1536(a)(2)), or additional conference under section

11940 7(a)(4) of that Act (16 U.S.C. 1536(a)(4)), as applicable, with

11941 the Chief of the Natural Resources Conservation Service or the

11942 Administrator of the Farm Service Agency, as applicable, to

11943 extend the period of regulatory predictability.

11944SEC. 2408. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 8351 note.&gt;&gt; FERAL SWINE ERADICATION AND

11945 CONTROL PILOT PROGRAM.

11946

11947 (a) In General.--The Secretary shall establish a feral swine

11948eradication and control pilot program to respond to the threat feral

11949swine pose to agriculture, native ecosystems, and human and animal

11950health.

11951 (b) Duties of the Secretary.--In carrying out the pilot program, the

11952Secretary shall--

11953 (1) study and assess the nature and extent of damage to the

11954 pilot areas caused by feral swine;

11955 (2) develop methods to eradicate or control feral swine in

11956 the pilot areas;

11957 (3) develop methods to restore damage caused by feral swine;

11958 and

11959 (4) provide financial assistance to agricultural producers

11960 in pilot areas.

11961

11962 (c) Assistance.--The Secretary may provide financial assistance to

11963agricultural producers under the pilot program to implement methods to--

11964 (1) eradicate or control feral swine in the pilot areas; and

11965

11966[[Page 132 STAT. 4575]]

11967

11968 (2) restore damage caused by feral swine.

11969

11970 (d) Coordination.--The Secretary shall ensure that the Natural

11971Resources Conservation Service and the Animal and Plant Health

11972Inspection Service coordinate for purposes of this section through State

11973technical committees established under section 1261(a) of the Food

11974Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3861(a)).

11975 (e) Pilot Areas.--The Secretary shall carry out the pilot program in

11976areas of States in which feral swine have been identified as a threat to

11977agriculture, native ecosystems, or human or animal health, as determined

11978by the Secretary.

11979 (f) Cost Sharing.--

11980 (1) Federal share.--The Federal share of the costs of

11981 activities under the pilot program may not exceed 75 percent of

11982 the total costs of such activities.

11983 (2) In-kind contributions.--The non-Federal share of the

11984 costs of activities under the pilot program may be provided in

11985 the form of in-kind contributions of materials or services.

11986

11987 (g) Funding.--

11988 (1) Mandatory funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity Credit

11989 Corporation, the Secretary shall use to carry out this section

11990 $75,000,000 for the period of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.

11991 (2) Distribution of funds.--Of the funds made available

11992 under paragraph (1)--

11993 (A) 50 percent shall be allocated to the Natural

11994 Resources Conservation Service to carry out the pilot

11995 program, including the provision of financial assistance

11996 to producers for on-farm trapping and technology related

11997 to capturing and confining feral swine; and

11998 (B) 50 percent shall be allocated to the Animal and

11999 Plant Health Inspection Service to carry out the pilot

12000 program, including the use of established, and testing

12001 of innovative, population reduction methods.

12002 (3) Limitation on administrative expenses.--Not more than 10

12003 percent of funds made available under this section may be used

12004 for administrative expenses of the pilot program.

12005SEC. 2409. REPORT ON SMALL WETLANDS.

12006

12007 (a) In General.--The Secretary, acting through the Chief of the

12008Natural Resources Conservation Service, shall submit to the Committee on

12009Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on

12010Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report describing

12011the number of wetlands with an area not more than 1 acre that have been

12012delineated in each of the States of North Dakota, South Dakota,

12013Minnesota, and Iowa during fiscal years 2014 through 2018.

12014 (b) Requirement.--In the report under subsection (a), the Secretary,

12015acting through the Chief of the Natural Resources Conservation Service,

12016shall list the number of wetlands acres in each State described in the

12017report by tenths of an acre, and ensure the report is based on the best

12018available science.

12019SEC. 2410. SENSE OF CONGRESS RELATING TO INCREASED WATERSHED-BASED

12020 COLLABORATION.

12021

12022 It is the sense of Congress that the Federal Government should

12023recognize and encourage partnerships at the watershed level between

12024nonpoint sources and regulated point sources to advance the goals of the

12025Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C.

12026

12027[[Page 132 STAT. 4576]]

12028

120291251 et seq.) and provide benefits to farmers, landowners, and the

12030public.

12031

12032 Subtitle E--Funding and Administration

12033

12034SEC. 2501. COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION.

12035

12036 (a) Annual Funding.--Section 1241(a) of the Food Security Act of

120371985 (16 U.S.C. 3841(a)) is amended--

12038 (1) in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking

12039 ``2018 (and fiscal year 2019 in the case of the program

12040 specified in paragraph (5))'' and inserting ``2023'';

12041 (2) in paragraph (1)--

12042 (A) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``$10,000,000

12043 for the period of fiscal years 2014 through 2018'' and

12044 inserting ``$12,000,000 for the period of fiscal years

12045 2019 through 2023''; and

12046 (B) in subparagraph (B)--

12047 (i) by striking ``$33,000,000 for the period

12048 of fiscal years 2014 through 2018'' and inserting

12049 ``$50,000,000 for the period of fiscal years 2019

12050 through 2023, including not more than $5,000,000

12051 to provide outreach and technical assistance,'';

12052 and

12053 (ii) by striking ``retired or retiring owners

12054 and operators'' and inserting ``contract

12055 holders'';

12056 (3) in paragraph (2)--

12057 (A) in subparagraph (D), by striking ``and'' at the

12058 end;

12059 (B) in subparagraph (E), by striking the period at

12060 the end and inserting ``; and''; and

12063 through 2023.'';

12084 Act of 2018), using such sums as are necessary to administer

12085 contracts entered into before that date of enactment'' before
