12087 (6) by striking paragraph (5).

12088

12089 (b) Availability of Funds.--Section 1241(b) of the Food Security Act

12090of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3841(b)) is amended by striking ``2018

12091

12092[[Page 132 STAT. 4577]]

12093

12094(and fiscal year 2019 in the case of the program specified in subsection

12095(a)(5))'' and inserting ``2023''.

12096 (c) Report on Program Enrollments and Assistance.--Section 1241(i)

12097of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3841(i)) is amended to read

12098as follows:

12099 ``(i) Report on Program Enrollments and Assistance.--Not later than

12100December 15 of each of calendar years 2019 through 2023, the Secretary

12101shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

12102Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and

12103Forestry of the Senate an annual report containing statistics by State

12104related to enrollments in conservation programs under this title, as

12105follows:

12106 ``(1) The annual and current cumulative activity reflecting

12107 active agreement and contract enrollment statistics.

12108 ``(2) Secretarial exceptions, waivers, and significant

12109 payments, including--

12110 ``(A) payments made under the agricultural

12111 conservation easement program for easements valued at

12112 $250,000 or greater;

12113 ``(B) payments made under the regional conservation

12114 partnership program subject to the waiver of adjusted

12115 gross income limitations pursuant to section

12116 1271C(c)(3);

12117 ``(C) waivers granted by the Secretary under section

12118 1001D(b)(3);

12119 ``(D) exceptions and activity associated with

12120 section 1240B(h)(2); and

12121 ``(E) exceptions provided by the Secretary under

12122 section 1265B(b)(2)(B)(ii).''.

12123

12124 (d) Allocations Review and Update.--Section 1241(g) of the Food

12125Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3841(g)) is amended--

12126 (1) in paragraph (1)--

12127 (A) by striking ``January'' and all that follows

12128 through ``shall'' and inserting ``1 year after the date

12129 of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

12130 the Secretary, acting through the Chief of the Natural

12131 Resources Conservation Service and the Administrator of

12132 the Farm Service Agency, shall'';

12133 (B) by inserting ``annual'' after ``utilize''; and

12134 (C) by inserting ``relevant data on local natural

12135 resource concerns, resource inventories, evaluations and

12136 reports, recommendations from State technical committees

12137 established under section 1261(a),'' after ``accounting

12138 for''; and

12139 (2) in paragraph (2)--

12140 (A) by striking ``that the formulas'' and inserting

12141 the following: ``that--

12142 ``(A) the formulas'';

12143 (B) in subparagraph (A) (as so designated), by

12144 striking the period at the end and inserting a

12145 semicolon; and

12146 (C) by adding at the end the following:

12147 ``(B) to the maximum extent practicable, local

12148 natural resource concerns are considered a leading

12149 factor in determining annual funding allocation to

12150 States;

12151 ``(C) the process used at the national level to

12152 evaluate State budget proposals and to allocate funds is

12153 reviewed annually to assess the effect of allocations in

12154 addressing identified natural resource priorities and

12155 objectives; and

12156

12157[[Page 132 STAT. 4578]]

12158

12159 ``(D) the allocation of funds to States addresses

12160 priority natural resource concerns and objectives.''.

12161

12162 (e) Assistance to Certain Farmers or Ranchers for Conservation

12163Access.--Section 1241(h) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

121643841(h)) is amended--

12165 (1) in paragraph (1)--

12166 (A) by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as

12167 clauses (i) and (ii), respectively, and indenting

12168 appropriately;

12169 (B) in the matter preceding clause (i) (as so

12170 redesignated), by striking ``Of the funds'' and

12171 inserting the following:

12172 ``(A) Fiscal years 2009 through 2018.--Of the

12173 funds''; and

12174 (C) by adding at the end the following:

12175 ``(B) Fiscal years 2019 through 2023.--Of the funds

12176 made available for each of fiscal years 2019 through

12177 2023 to carry out the environmental quality incentives

12178 program under subchapter A of chapter 4 of subtitle D

12179 and the conservation stewardship program under

12180 subchapter B of chapter 4 of subtitle D, the Secretary

12181 shall use, to the maximum extent practicable--

12182 ``(i) 5 percent to assist beginning farmers or

12183 ranchers; and

12184 ``(ii) 5 percent to assist socially

12185 disadvantaged farmers or ranchers.'';

12186 (2) in paragraph (2), by inserting ``and, in the case of

12187 fiscal years 2019 through 2023, under the conservation

12188 stewardship program under subchapter B of chapter 4 of subtitle

12189 D'' before the period at the end;

12190 (3) in paragraph (3), by striking ``year, acres not

12191 obligated under paragraph (1)'' and inserting ``year through

12192 fiscal year 2018, acres not obligated under paragraph (1)(A)'';

12193 and

12194 (4) in paragraph (4), by striking ``subparagraph (A) or (B)

12195 of paragraph (1)'' and inserting ``, as applicable, clause (i)

12196 or (ii) of paragraph (1)(A) or clause (i) or (ii) of paragraph

12197 (1)(B)''.

12198

12199 (f) Conservation Standards and Requirements.--Section 1241 of the

12200Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3841) is amended by adding at the

12201end the following:

12202 ``(j) Conservation Standards and Requirements.--

12203 ``(1) In general.--Subject to the requirements of this

12204 title, the Natural Resources Conservation Service shall serve as

12205 the lead agency in developing and establishing technical

12206 standards and requirements for conservation programs carried out

12207 under this title, including--

12208 ``(A) standards for conservation practices under

12209 this title;

12210 ``(B) technical guidelines for implementing

12211 conservation practices under this title, including the

12212 location of the conservation practices; and

12213 ``(C) standards for conservation plans.

12214 ``(2) Consistency of farm service agency technical standards

12215 and payment rates.--The Administrator of the Farm Service Agency

12216 shall ensure that--

12217 ``(A) technical standards of programs administered

12218 by the Farm Service Agency are consistent with the

12219 technical

12220

12221[[Page 132 STAT. 4579]]

12222

12223 standards established by the Natural Resources

12224 Conservation Service under paragraph (1); and

12225 ``(B) payment rates, to the extent practicable, are

12226 consistent between the Farm Service Agency and the

12227 Natural Resources Conservation Service.''.

12228SEC. 2502. DELIVERY OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.

12229

12230 (a) Definitions.--Section 1242(a) of the Food Security Act of 1985

12231(16 U.S.C. 3842(a)) is amended to read as follows:

12232 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

12233 ``(1) Eligible participant.--The term `eligible participant'

12234 means a producer, landowner, or entity that is participating in,

12235 or seeking to participate in, programs in which the producer,

12236 landowner, or entity is otherwise eligible to participate under

12237 this title or the agricultural management assistance program

12238 under section 524(b) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

12239 1524(b)).

12240 ``(2) Third-party provider.--The term `third-party provider'

12241 means a commercial entity (including a farmer cooperative,

12242 agriculture retailer, or other commercial entity (as defined by

12243 the Secretary)), a nonprofit entity, a State or local government

12244 (including a conservation district), or a Federal agency, that

12245 has expertise in the technical aspect of conservation planning,

12246 including nutrient management planning, watershed planning, or

12247 environmental engineering.''.

12248

12249 (b) Certification Process.--Section 1242(e) of the Food Security Act

12250of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3842(e)) is amended by adding at the end the

12251following:

12252 ``(4) Certification process.--The Secretary shall certify a

12253 third-party provider through--

12254 ``(A) a certification process administered by the

12255 Secretary, acting through the Chief of the Natural

12256 Resources Conservation Service; or

12257 ``(B) a non-Federal entity approved by the Secretary

12258 to perform the certification.

12259 ``(5) Streamlined certification.--The Secretary shall

12260 provide a streamlined certification process for a third-party

12261 provider that has an appropriate specialty certification,

12262 including a sustainability certification.''.

12263

12264 (c) Expedited Revision of Standards.--Section 1242(h) of the Food

12265Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3842(h)) is amended--

12266 (1) in paragraph (1)--

12267 (A) by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the

12268 following:

12269 ``(A) not later than 1 year after the date of

12270 enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

12271 complete a review of each conservation practice

12272 standard, including engineering design specifications,

12273 in effect on the day before the date of enactment of

12274 that Act;'';

12275 (B) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``and'' at the

12276 end;

12277 (C) in subparagraph (C), by striking the period at

12278 the end and inserting ``; and''; and

12279 (D) by adding at the end the following:

12280 ``(D) evaluate opportunities to increase flexibility

12281 in conservation practice standards in a manner that

12282 ensures equivalent natural resource benefits.'';

12283

12284[[Page 132 STAT. 4580]]

12285

12286 (2) in paragraph (2), by inserting ``State technical

12287 committees established under section 1261(a),'' before ``crop

12288 consultants''; and

12289 (3) by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following:

12290 ``(3) Expedited revision of standards.--Not later than 1

12291 year after the date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement

12292 Act of 2018, the Secretary shall develop for the programs under

12293 this title an administrative process for--

12294 ``(A) expediting the establishment and revision of

12295 conservation practice standards;

12296 ``(B) considering conservation innovations and

12297 scientific and technological advancements with respect

12298 to any establishment or revision under subparagraph (A);

12299 ``(C) allowing local flexibility in the creation

12300 of--

12301 ``(i) interim practice standards and

12302 supplements to existing practice standards to

12303 address the considerations described in

12304 subparagraph (B); and

12305 ``(ii) partnership-led proposals for new and

12306 innovative techniques to facilitate implementing

12307 agreements and grants under this title; and

12308 ``(D) soliciting regular input from State technical

12309 committees established under section 1261(a) for

12310 recommendations that identify innovations or

12311 advancements described in subparagraph (B).

12312 ``(4) Report.--Not later than 2 years after the date of

12313 enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, and every

12314 2 years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a

12315 report on--

12316 ``(A) the administrative process developed under

12317 paragraph (3);

12318 ``(B) conservation practice standards that were

12319 established or revised under that process; and

12320 ``(C) conservation innovations that were considered

12321 under that process.''.

12322SEC. 2503. ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS FOR CONSERVATION PROGRAMS.

12323

12324 (a) Acreage Limitations.--Section 1244(f) of the Food Security Act

12325of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3844(f)) is amended--

12326 (1) in paragraph (1)(B), by striking ``10'' and inserting

12327 ``15''; and

12328 (2) in paragraph (5), by striking ``the Agricultural Act of

12329 2014'' and inserting ``the Agriculture Improvement Act of

12330 2018''.

12331

12332 (b) Requirements for Conservation Programs.--Section 1244 of the

12333Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3844) is amended--

12334 (1) by striking subsection (m);

12335 (2) by redesignating subsections (j) through (l) as

12336 subsections (k) through (m), respectively; and

12337 (3) by inserting after subsection (i) the following:

12338

12339 ``(j) Review and Guidance for Practice Costs and Payment Rates.--

12340 ``(1) In general.--Not later than 1 year after the date of

12341 enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, and not

12342 later than October 1 of each year thereafter, the Secretary

12343 shall--

12344

12345[[Page 132 STAT. 4581]]

12346

12347 ``(A) review the estimates for practice costs and

12348 rates of payments made to producers for practices on

12349 eligible land under this title; and

12350 ``(B) evaluate whether those costs and rates reflect

12351 a payment that--

12352 ``(i) encourages participation in a

12353 conservation program administered by the

12354 Secretary;

12355 ``(ii) encourages implementation of the most

12356 effective practices to address local natural

12357 resource concerns on eligible land; and

12358 ``(iii) accounts for regional, State, and

12359 local variability relating to the complexity,

12360 implementation, and adoption of practices on

12361 eligible land.

12362 ``(2) Guidance; review.--The Secretary shall--

12363 ``(A) issue guidance to States to annually review

12364 and adjust the estimates for practice costs and rates of

12365 payments made to producers to reflect the evaluation

12366 factors described in paragraph (1)(B); and

12367 ``(B) determine the appropriate practice costs and

12368 rates of payments for each State by--

12369 ``(i) annually reviewing each conservation

12370 program payment schedule and payment rate used in

12371 the State; and

12372 ``(ii) consulting with the State technical

12373 committee established under section 1261(a) in

12374 that State.''.

12375

12376 (c) Funding for Indian Tribes.--Section 1244(m) of the Food Security

12377Act of 1985 (as redesignated by subsection (b)(2)) is amended--

12378 (1) by striking ``may'' and inserting ``shall'';

12379 (2) by striking ``that the goals'' and inserting the

12380 following: ``that--

12381 ``(1) the goals'';

12382 (3) in paragraph (1) (as so designated), by striking

12383 ``arrangements, and that statutory'' and inserting the

12384 following: ``arrangements;

12385 ``(2) a sufficient number of eligible participants will be

12386 aggregated under the alternative funding arrangement to

12387 accomplish the underlying purposes and objectives of the

12388 applicable program; and

12389 ``(3) statutory''; and

12390 (4) in paragraph (3) (as so designated), by striking the

12391 period at the end and inserting ``, except that the Secretary

12392 may approve a waiver if the Secretary is authorized to approve a

12393 waiver under the statutory authority of the applicable

12394 program.''.

12395

12396 (d) Source Water Protection Through Targeting of Agricultural

12397Practices.--Section 1244 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

123983844) (as amended by subsection (b)) is amended by adding at the end the

12399following:

12400 ``(n) Source Water Protection Through Targeting of Agricultural

12401Practices.--

12402 ``(1) In general.--In carrying out any conservation program

12403 administered by the Secretary, the Secretary shall encourage

12404 practices that relate to water quality and water quantity that

12405 protect source water for drinking water (including protecting

12406 against public health threats) while also benefitting

12407 agricultural producers.

12408

12409[[Page 132 STAT. 4582]]

12410

12411 ``(2) Collaboration with water systems and increased

12412 incentives.--

12413 ``(A) In general.--In encouraging practices under

12414 paragraph (1), the Secretary shall--

12415 ``(i) work collaboratively with community

12416 water systems and State technical committees

12417 established under section 1261(a) to identify, in

12418 each State, local priority areas for the

12419 protection of source waters for drinking water;

12420 and

12421 ``(ii) subject to subparagraph (B), for

12422 practices described in paragraph (1), offer to

12423 producers increased incentives and higher payment

12424 rates than are otherwise statutorily authorized by

12425 the applicable conservation program administered

12426 by the Secretary.

12427 ``(B) Limitation.--An increased payment under

12428 subparagraph (A)(ii) shall not exceed 90 percent of

12429 practice costs associated with planning, design,

12430 materials, equipment, installation, labor, management,

12431 maintenance, or training.

12432 ``(3) Reservation of funds.--

12433 ``(A) In general.--In each of fiscal years 2019

12434 through 2023, the Secretary shall use to carry out this

12435 subsection not less than 10 percent of any funds

12436 available for conservation programs administered by the

12437 Secretary under this title (other than the conservation

12438 reserve program established under subchapter B of

12439 chapter 1 of subtitle D).

12440 ``(B) Limitation.--Funds available for a specific

12441 conservation program shall not be transferred to fund a

12442 different conservation program under this title.''.

12443

12444 (e) Environmental Services Market.--Section 1244 of the Food

12445Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3844) (as amended by subsection (d)) is

12446amended by adding at the end the following:

12447 ``(o) Environmental Services Market.--The Secretary may not

12448prohibit, through a contract, easement, or agreement under this title, a

12449participant in a conservation program administered by the Secretary

12450under this title from participating in, and receiving compensation from,

12451an environmental services market if 1 of the purposes of the market is

12452the facilitation of additional conservation benefits that are consistent

12453with the purposes of the conservation program administered by the

12454Secretary.''.

12455 (f) Regulatory Certainty.--Section 1244 of the Food Security Act of

124561985 (16 U.S.C. 3844) (as amended by subsection (e)) is amended by

12457adding at the end the following:

12458 ``(p) Regulatory Certainty.--

12459 ``(1) In general.--In addition to technical and programmatic

12460 information that the Secretary is otherwise authorized to

12461 provide, on request of a Federal agency, a State, an Indian

12462 tribe, or a unit of local government, the Secretary may provide

12463 technical and programmatic information--

12464 ``(A) subject to paragraph (2), to the Federal

12465 agency, State, Indian tribe, or unit of local government

12466 to support specifically the development of mechanisms

12467 that would provide regulatory certainty, regulatory

12468 predictability, safe harbor protection, or other similar

12469 regulatory assurances to a farmer, rancher, or private

12470 nonindustrial forest landowner under a regulatory

12471 requirement--

12472 ``(i) that relates to soil, water, or

12473 wildlife; and

12474

12475[[Page 132 STAT. 4583]]

12476

12477 ``(ii) over which that Federal agency, State,

12478 Indian tribe, or unit of local government has

12479 authority; and

12480 ``(B) relating to conservation practices or

12481 activities that could be implemented by a farmer,

12482 rancher, or private nonindustrial forest landowner to

12483 address a targeted soil, water, or wildlife resource

12484 concern that is the direct subject of a regulatory

12485 requirement enforced by that Federal agency, State,

12486 Indian tribe, or unit of local government, as

12487 applicable.

12488 ``(2) Mechanisms.--The Secretary shall only provide

12489 additional technical and programmatic information under

12490 paragraph (1) if the mechanisms to be developed by the Federal

12491 agency, State, Indian tribe, or unit of local government, as

12492 applicable, under paragraph (1)(A) are anticipated to include,

12493 at a minimum--

12494 ``(A) the implementation of 1 or more conservation

12495 practices or activities that effectively addresses the

12496 soil, water, or wildlife resource concern identified

12497 under paragraph (1);

12498 ``(B) the on-site confirmation that the applicable

12499 conservation practices or activities identified under

12500 subparagraph (A) have been implemented;

12501 ``(C) a plan for a periodic audit, as appropriate,

12502 of the continued implementation or maintenance of each

12503 of the conservation practices or activities identified

12504 under subparagraph (A); and

12505 ``(D) notification to a farmer, rancher, or private

12506 nonindustrial forest landowner of, and an opportunity to

12507 correct, any noncompliance with a requirement to obtain

12508 regulatory certainty, regulatory predictability, safe

12509 harbor protection, or other similar regulatory

12510 assurance.

12511 ``(3) Continuing current collaboration on soil, water, or

12512 wildlife conservation practices.--The Secretary shall--

12513 ``(A) continue collaboration with Federal agencies,

12514 States, Indian tribes, or local units of government on

12515 existing regulatory certainty, regulatory

12516 predictability, safe harbor protection, or other similar

12517 regulatory assurances in accordance with paragraph (2);

12518 and

12519 ``(B) continue collaboration with the Secretary of

12520 the Interior on consultation under section 7(a)(2) of

12521 the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C.

12522 1536(a)(2)) or conference under section 7(a)(4) of that

12523 Act (16 U.S.C. 1536(a)(4)), as applicable, for wildlife

12524 conservation efforts, including the Working Lands for

12525 Wildlife model of conservation on working landscapes, as

12526 implemented on the day before the date of enactment of

12527 the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, in accordance

12528 with--

12529 ``(i) the document entitled `Partnership

12530 Agreement Between the United States Department of

12531 Agriculture Natural Resources Conservation Service

12532 and the United States Department of the Interior

12533 Fish and Wildlife Service', numbered A-3A75-16-

12534 937, and formalized by the Chief of the Natural

12535 Resources Conservation Service on September 15,

12536 2016, and by the Director of the United States

12537 Fish and Wildlife Service on August 4, 2016, as in

12538 effect on September 15, 2016; and

12539

12540[[Page 132 STAT. 4584]]

12541

12542 ``(ii) United States Fish and Wildlife Service

12543 Director's Order No. 217, dated August 9, 2016, as

12544 in effect on August 9, 2016.

12545 ``(4) Savings clause.--Nothing in this subsection--

12546 ``(A) preempts, displaces, or supplants any

12547 authority or right of a Federal agency, a State, an

12548 Indian tribe, or a unit of local government;

12549 ``(B) modifies or otherwise affects, preempts, or

12550 displaces--

12551 ``(i) any cause of action; or

12552 ``(ii) a provision of Federal or State law

12553 establishing a remedy for a civil or criminal

12554 cause of action; or

12555 ``(C) applies to a case in which the Department of

12556 Agriculture is the originating agency requesting a

12557 consultation or other technical and programmatic

12558 information or assistance from another Federal agency in

12559 assisting farmers, ranchers, or nonindustrial private

12560 forest landowners participating in a conservation

12561 program administered by the Secretary.''.

12562SEC. 2504. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3801 note.&gt;&gt; TEMPORARY ADMINISTRATION

12563 OF CONSERVATION PROGRAMS.

12564

12565 (a) Interim Administration.--Subject to subsection (d), the

12566Secretary shall use the applicable regulations in effect on the day

12567before the date of enactment of this Act, to the extent that the terms

12568and conditions of those regulations are consistent with the amendments

12569made by this title, to carry out the programs under laws as amended by

12570this title, including--

12571 (1) the conservation reserve program under subchapter B of

12572 chapter 1 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food Security Act of

12573 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3831 et seq.) (as amended by subtitle B);

12574 (2) the environmental quality incentives program under

12575 subchapter A of chapter 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food

12576 Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa et seq) (as added by

12577 section 2301(a)(1) and amended by subtitle C);

12578 (3) the conservation stewardship program under subchapter B

12579 of chapter 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food Security Act

12580 of 1985 (as added by subsections (a)(2) and (b) of section 2301

12581 and amended by subtitle C); and

12582 (4) the agricultural conservation easement program

12583 established under subtitle H of title XII of the Food Security

12584 Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865 et seq.) (as amended by subtitle F).

12585

12586 (b) Regional Conservation Partnership Program.--Notwithstanding

12587subsection (e) of section 1271E of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16

12588U.S.C. 3871e) (as amended by section 2706), and subject to subsection

12589(d), for fiscal year 2019, the Secretary may use an availability of

12590program funding announcement consistent with the amendments made by

12591subtitle G to carry out the regional conservation partnership program

12592under subtitle I of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16

12593U.S.C. 3871 et seq.) without issuing a regulation.

12594 (c) Funding.--The Secretary may only use funds authorized to be made

12595available by this title or the amendments made by this title for the

12596specific programs described in paragraphs (1) through (4) of subsection

12597(a) and subsection (b), in accordance

12598

12599[[Page 132 STAT. 4585]]

12600

12601with any restrictions on the use of those funds, for the purposes

12602described in subsections (a) and (b).

12603 (d) Termination of Authority.--The authority of the Secretary to

12604carry out subsections (a) and (b) shall terminate on September 30, 2019.

12605 (e) Permanent Administration.--Effective beginning on the

12606termination date described in subsection (d), the Secretary shall carry

12607out this title and the amendments made by this title in accordance with

12608such final regulations as the Secretary considers necessary to carry out

12609this title and the amendments made by this title.

12610

12611 Subtitle F--Agricultural Conservation Easement Program

12612

12613SEC. 2601. ESTABLISHMENT AND PURPOSES.

12614

12615 Section 1265(b) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865(b))

12616is amended--

12617 (1) in paragraph (3), by inserting ``that negatively affect

12618 the agricultural uses and conservation values'' after ``that

12619 land''; and

12620 (2) in paragraph (4), by striking ``restoring and'' and

12621 inserting ``restoring or''.

12622SEC. 2602. DEFINITIONS.

12623

12624 Section 1265A of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865a) is

12625amended--

12626 (1) in paragraph(1)(B), by striking ``subject to an

12627 agricultural land easement plan, as approved by the Secretary'';

12628 (2) by redesignating paragraphs (2), (3), (4), and (5) as

12629 paragraphs (3), (4), (6), and (7), respectively;

12630 (3) by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

12631 ``(2) Buy-protect-sell transaction.--

12632 ``(A) In general.--The term `buy-protect-sell

12633 transaction' means a legal arrangement--

12634 ``(i) between an eligible entity and the

12635 Secretary relating to land that an eligible entity

12636 owns or is going to purchase prior to acquisition

12637 of an agricultural land easement;

12638 ``(ii) under which the eligible entity

12639 certifies to the Secretary that the eligible

12640 entity shall--

12641 ``(I)(aa) hold an agricultural land

12642 easement on that land, but transfer

12643 ownership of the land to a farmer or

12644 rancher that is not an eligible entity

12645 prior to or on acquisition of the

12646 agricultural land easement; or

12647 ``(bb) hold an agricultural land

12648 easement on that land, but transfer

12649 ownership of the land to a farmer or

12650 rancher that is not an eligible entity

12651 in a timely manner and, subject to

12652 subparagraph (B), not later than 3 years

12653 after the date of acquisition of the

12654 agricultural land easement; and

12655 ``(II) make an initial sale of the

12656 land subject to the agricultural land

12657 easement to a farmer or rancher at not

12658 more than agricultural value, plus any

12659 reasonable holding and transaction costs

12660

12661[[Page 132 STAT. 4586]]

12662

12663 incurred by the eligible entity, as

12664 determined by the Secretary; and

12665 ``(iii) under which the Secretary shall be

12666 reimbursed for the entirety of the Federal share

12667 of the cost of the agricultural land easement by

12668 the eligible entity if the eligible entity fails

12669 to transfer ownership under item (aa) or (bb), as

12670 applicable, of clause (ii)(I).

12671 ``(B) Time extension.--Under subparagraph

12672 (A)(ii)(I)(bb), an eligible entity may transfer land

12673 later than 3 years after the date of acquisition of the

12674 agricultural land easement if the Secretary determines

12675 an extension of time is justified.'';

12676 (4) in paragraph (4) (as so redesignated)--

12677 (A) in subparagraph (A)(i)--

12678 (i) by striking ``to a'' and inserting the

12679 following: ``to--

12680 ``(I) a'';

12681 (ii) in subclause (I) (as so designated), by

12682 adding ``or'' at the end; and

12683 (iii) by adding at the end the following:

12684 ``(II) a buy-protect-sell

12685 transaction;''; and

12686 (B) in subparagraph (B)(i)(II), by striking ``, as

12687 determined by the Secretary in consultation with the

12688 Secretary of the Interior at the local level''; and

12689 (5) by inserting after paragraph (4) (as so redesignated)

12690 the following:

12691 ``(5) Monitoring report.--The term `monitoring report' means

12692 a report, the contents of which are formulated and prepared by

12693 the holder of an agricultural land easement, that accurately

12694 documents whether the land subject to the agricultural land

12695 easement is in compliance with the terms and conditions of the

12696 agricultural land easement.''.

12697SEC. 2603. AGRICULTURAL LAND EASEMENTS.

12698

12699 (a) Availability of Assistance.--Section 1265B(a) of the Food

12700Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865b(a)) is amended--

12701 (1) in paragraph (1), by striking ``and'' at the end;

12702 (2) in paragraph (2), by striking ``provide for the

12703 conservation of natural resources pursuant to an agricultural

12704 land easement plan.'' and inserting ``implement the program,

12705 including technical assistance for the development of a

12706 conservation plan under subsection (b)(4)(C)(iv); and''; and

12707 (3) by adding at the end the following:

12708 ``(3) buy-protect-sell transactions.''.

12709

12710 (b) Cost-share Assistance.--

12711 (1) Scope of assistance available.--Section 1265B(b)(2) of

12712 the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865b(b)(2)) is

12713 amended--

12714 (A) in subparagraph (B), by striking clause (ii) and

12715 inserting the following:

12716 ``(ii) Grasslands exception.--In the case of

12717 grassland of special environmental significance,

12718 as determined by the Secretary, the Secretary may

12719 provide an amount not to exceed 75 percent of the

12720 fair market value of the agricultural land

12721 easement.

12722

12723[[Page 132 STAT. 4587]]

12724

12725 ``(iii) Permissible forms.--The non-Federal

12726 share provided by an eligible entity under this

12727 subparagraph may comprise--

12728 ``(I) cash resources;

12729 ``(II) a charitable donation or

12730 qualified conservation contribution (as

12731 defined in section 170(h) of the

12732 Internal Revenue Code of 1986) from the

12733 private landowner from which the

12734 agricultural land easement will be

12735 purchased;

12736 ``(III) costs associated with

12737 securing a deed to the agricultural land

12738 easement, including the cost of

12739 appraisal, survey, inspection, and

12740 title; and

12741 ``(IV) other costs, as determined by

12742 the Secretary.''; and

12743 (B) by striking subparagraph (C).

12744 (2) Evaluation and ranking of applications.--Section

12745 1265B(b)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

12746 3865b(b)(3)) is amended--

12747 (A) by redesignating subparagraph (C) as

12748 subparagraph (E); and

12749 (B) by inserting after subparagraph (B) the

12750 following:

12751 ``(C) Accounting for geographic differences.--The

12752 Secretary may adjust the criteria established under

12753 subparagraph (A) to account for geographic differences,

12754 if the adjustments--

12755 ``(i) meet the purposes of the program; and

12756 ``(ii) continue to maximize the benefit of the

12757 Federal investment under the program.

12758 ``(D) Priority.--In evaluating applications under

12759 the program, the Secretary may give priority to an

12760 application for the purchase of an agricultural land

12761 easement that, as determined by the Secretary, maintains

12762 agricultural viability.''.

12763 (3) Agreements with eligible entities.--Section 1265B(b)(4)

12764 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865b(b)(4)) is

12765 amended--

12766 (A) in subparagraph (C), by striking clauses (iii)

12767 and (iv) and inserting the following:

12768 ``(iii) include a right of enforcement for the

12769 Secretary that--

12770 ``(I) may be used only if the terms

12771 and conditions of the easement are not

12772 enforced by the eligible entity; and

12773 ``(II) does not extend to a right of

12774 inspection unless--

12775 ``(aa)(AA) the holder of the

12776 easement fails to provide

12777 monitoring reports in a timely

12778 manner; or

12779 ``(BB) the Secretary has a

12780 reasonable and articulable

12781 belief that the terms and

12782 conditions of the easement have

12783 been violated; and

12784 ``(bb) prior to the

12785 inspection, the Secretary

12786 notifies the eligible entity and

12787 the landowner of the inspection

12788 and provides a reasonable

12789 opportunity for the eligible

12790 entity and the landowner to

12791 participate in the inspection;

12792

12793[[Page 132 STAT. 4588]]

12794

12795 ``(iv) include a conservation plan only for

12796 any portion of the land subject to the

12797 agricultural land easement that is highly erodible

12798 cropland; and'';

12799 (B) by redesignating subparagraphs (D) and (E) as

12800 subparagraphs (E) and (F), respectively; and

12801 (C) by inserting after subparagraph (C) the

12802 following:

12803 ``(D) Additional permitted terms and conditions.--An

12804 eligible entity may include terms and conditions for an

12805 agricultural land easement that--

12806 ``(i) are intended to keep the land subject to

12807 the agricultural land easement under the ownership

12808 of a farmer or rancher, as determined by the

12809 Secretary;

12810 ``(ii) allow subsurface mineral development on

12811 the land subject to the agricultural land easement

12812 and in accordance with applicable State law if, as

12813 determined by the Secretary--

12814 ``(I) the subsurface mineral

12815 development--

12816 ``(aa) has a limited and

12817 localized impact;

12818 ``(bb) does not harm the

12819 agricultural use and

12820 conservation values of the land

12821 subject to the easement;

12822 ``(cc) does not materially

12823 alter or affect the existing

12824 topography;

12825 ``(dd) shall comply with a

12826 subsurface mineral development

12827 plan that--

12828 ``(AA) includes a plan

12829 for the remediation of

12830 impacts to the agricultural

12831 use and conservation values

12832 of the land subject to the

12833 easement; and

12834 ``(BB) is approved by

12835 the Secretary prior to the

12836 initiation of mineral

12837 development activity;

12838 ``(ee) is not accomplished

12839 by any surface mining method;

12840 ``(ff) is within the

12841 impervious surface limits of the

12842 easement under subparagraph

12843 (C)(v); and

12844 ``(gg) uses practices and

12845 technologies that minimize the

12846 duration and intensity of

12847 impacts to the agricultural use

12848 and conservation values of the

12849 land subject to the easement;

12850 and

12851 ``(II) each area impacted by the

12852 subsurface mineral development shall be

12853 reclaimed and restored by the holder of

12854 the mineral rights at cessation of

12855 operation; and

12856 ``(iii) include other relevant activities

12857 relating to the agricultural land easement, as

12858 determined by the Secretary.''.

12859 (4) Certification of eligible entities.--Section 1265B(b)(5)

12860 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865b(b)(5)) is

12861 amended--

12862 (A) in subparagraph (A)--

12863 (i) in clause (ii), by striking ``; and'' and

12864 inserting a semicolon;

12865 (ii) in clause (iii), by striking the period

12866 at the end and inserting ``; and''; and

12867 (iii) by adding at the end the following:

12868

12869[[Page 132 STAT. 4589]]

12870

12871 ``(iv) allow a certified eligible entity to

12872 use its own terms and conditions, notwithstanding

12873 paragraph (4)(C), as long as the terms and

12874 conditions are consistent with the purposes of the

12875 program.''; and

12876 (B) in subparagraph (B)--

12877 (i) in clause (iii), by redesignating

12878 subclauses (I) through (III) as items (aa) through

12879 (cc), respectively, and indenting appropriately;

12880 (ii) by redesignating clauses (i) through

12881 (iii) as subclauses (I) through (III),

12882 respectively, and indenting appropriately;

12883 (iii) in the matter preceding subclause (I)

12884 (as so redesignated), by striking ``entity will''

12885 and inserting the following: ``eligible entity--

12886 ``(i) will'';

12887 (iv) in clause (i)(III)(cc) (as so

12888 redesignated), by striking the period at the end

12889 and inserting a semicolon; and

12890 (v) by adding at the end the following:

12891 ``(ii) has--

12892 ``(I) been accredited by the Land

12893 Trust Accreditation Commission, or by an

12894 equivalent accrediting body, as

12895 determined by the Secretary;

12896 ``(II) acquired not fewer than 10

12897 agricultural land easements under the

12898 program or any predecessor program; and

12899 ``(III) successfully met the

12900 responsibilities of the eligible entity

12901 under the applicable agreements with the

12902 Secretary, as determined by the

12903 Secretary, relating to agricultural land

12904 easements that the eligible entity has

12905 acquired under the program or any

12906 predecessor program; or

12907 ``(iii) is a State department of agriculture

12908 or other State agency with statutory authority for

12909 farm and ranchland protection that has--

12910 ``(I) acquired not fewer than 10

12911 agricultural land easements under the

12912 program or any predecessor program; and

12913 ``(II) successfully met the

12914 responsibilities of the eligible entity

12915 under the applicable agreements with the

12916 Secretary, as determined by the

12917 Secretary, relating to agricultural land

12918 easements that the eligible entity has

12919 acquired under the program or any

12920 predecessor program.''.

12921 (5) Technical assistance.--Section 1265B of the Food

12922 Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865b) is amended by striking

12923 subsection (d) and inserting the following:

12924

12925 ``(d) Technical Assistance.--The Secretary may provide technical

12926assistance, if requested, to assist in compliance with the terms and

12927conditions of easements.''.

12928SEC. 2604. WETLAND RESERVE EASEMENTS.

12929

12930 Section 1265C of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865c) is

12931amended--

12932 (1) in subsection (b)--

12933 (A) in paragraph (3)(C), by inserting ``or improving

12934 water quality'' before the period at the end; and

12935

12936[[Page 132 STAT. 4590]]

12937

12938 (B) in paragraph (5)--

12939 (i) in subparagraph (C)--

12940 (I) by striking ``Land subject'' and

12941 inserting the following:

12942 ``(i) In general.--Land subject'';

12943 (II) in clause (i) (as so

12944 designated), by inserting ``water

12945 management,'' after ``timber harvest,'';

12946 and

12947 (III) by adding at the end the

12948 following:

12949 ``(ii) Compatible use authorization.--In

12950 evaluating and authorizing a compatible economic

12951 use under clause (i), the Secretary shall--

12952 ``(I) request and consider the

12953 advice of the applicable State technical

12954 committee established under section

12955 1261(a) about the 1 or more types of

12956 uses that may be authorized to be

12957 conducted on land subject to a wetland

12958 reserve easement, including the

12959 frequency, timing, and intensity of

12960 those uses;

12961 ``(II) consider the ability of an

12962 authorized use to facilitate the

12963 practical administration and management

12964 of that land; and

12965 ``(III) ensure that an authorized

12966 use furthers the functions and values

12967 for which the wetland reserve easement

12968 was established.''; and

12969 (ii) in subparagraph (D)(i)(III), by inserting

12970 after ``under subsection (f)'' the following: ``or

12971 a grazing management plan that is consistent with

12972 the wetland reserve easement plan and has been

12973 reviewed, and modified as necessary, at least

12974 every 5 years''; and

12975 (2) in subsection (f)--

12976 (A) by striking paragraph (1) and inserting the

12977 following:

12978 ``(1) Wetland reserve easement plan.--

12979 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall develop a

12980 wetland reserve easement plan--

12981 ``(i) for any eligible land subject to a

12982 wetland reserve easement; and

12983 ``(ii) that restores, protects, enhances,

12984 manages, maintains, and monitors the eligible land

12985 subject to the wetland reserve easements acquired

12986 under this section.

12987 ``(B) Practices and activities.--A wetland reserve

12988 easement plan under subparagraph (A) shall include

12989 practices and activities, including repair or

12990 replacement, that are necessary to restore and maintain

12991 the enrolled land and the functions and values of the

12992 wetland subject to a wetland reserve easement.'';

12993 (B) by redesignating paragraphs (2) and (3) as

12994 paragraphs (3) and (4), respectively; and

12995 (C) by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

12996 ``(2) Alternative plant communities.--The Secretary, in

12997 coordination with State technical committees established under

12998 section 1261(a) and pursuant to State-specific criteria and

12999 guidelines, may authorize the establishment or restoration of a

13000 hydrologically appropriate native community or alternative

13001 naturalized vegetative community as part of a wetland reserve

13002 easement plan on land subject to a wetland reserve easement

13003

13004[[Page 132 STAT. 4591]]

13005

13006 if that hydrologically appropriate native or alternative

13007 naturalized vegetative community shall--

13008 ``(A) substantially support or benefit migratory

13009 waterfowl or other wetland wildlife; or

13010 ``(B) meet local resource concerns or needs

13011 (including as an element of a regional, State, or local

13012 wildlife initiative or plan).''.

13013SEC. 2605. ADMINISTRATION.

13014

13015 Section 1265D of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865d) is

13016amended--

13017 (1) in paragraph (a)(4), by striking ``proposed'' and

13018 inserting ``permitted'';

13019 (2) by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:

13020

13021 ``(c) Subordination, Exchange, Modification, and Termination.--

13022 ``(1) Subordination.--The Secretary may subordinate any

13023 interest in land, or portion of such interest, administered by

13024 the Secretary (including for the purposes of utilities and

13025 energy transmission services) either directly or on behalf of

13026 the Commodity Credit Corporation under the program if the

13027 Secretary determines that the subordination--

13028 ``(A) increases conservation values or has a limited

13029 negative effect on conservation values;

13030 ``(B) minimally affects the acreage subject to the

13031 interest in land; and

13032 ``(C) is in the public interest or furthers the

13033 practical administration of the program.

13034 ``(2) Modification and exchange.--

13035 ``(A) Authority.--The Secretary may approve a

13036 modification or exchange of any interest in land, or

13037 portion of such interest, administered by the Secretary,

13038 either directly or on behalf of the Commodity Credit

13039 Corporation under the program if the Secretary

13040 determines that--

13041 ``(i) no reasonable alternative exists and the

13042 effect on the interest in land is avoided or

13043 minimized to the extent practicable; and

13044 ``(ii) the modification or exchange--

13045 ``(I) results in equal or increased

13046 conservation values;

13047 ``(II) results in equal or greater

13048 economic value to the United States;

13049 ``(III) is consistent with the

13050 original intent of the easement;

13051 ``(IV) is consistent with the

13052 purposes of the program; and

13053 ``(V) is in the public interest or

13054 furthers the practical administration of

13055 the program.

13056 ``(B) Limitation.--In modifying or exchanging an

13057 interest in land, or portion of such interest, under

13058 this paragraph, the Secretary may not increase any

13059 payment to an eligible entity.

13060 ``(3) Termination.--The Secretary may approve a termination

13061 of any interest in land, or portion of such interest,

13062 administered by the Secretary, directly or on behalf of the

13063 Commodity Credit Corporation under the program if the Secretary

13064 determines that--

13065

13066[[Page 132 STAT. 4592]]

13067

13068 ``(A) termination is in the interest of the Federal

13069 Government;

13070 ``(B) the United States will be fully compensated

13071 for--

13072 ``(i) the fair market value of the interest in

13073 land;

13074 ``(ii) any costs relating to the termination;

13075 and

13076 ``(iii) any damages determined appropriate by

13077 the Secretary; and

13078 ``(C) the termination will--

13079 ``(i) address a compelling public need for

13080 which there is no practicable alternative even

13081 with avoidance and minimization; and

13082 ``(ii) further the practical administration of

13083 the program.

13084 ``(4) Consent.--The Secretary shall obtain consent from the

13085 landowner and eligible entity, if applicable, for any

13086 subordination, exchange, modification, or termination of

13087 interest in land, or portion of such interest, under this

13088 subsection.

13089 ``(5) Notice.--At least 90 days before taking any

13090 termination action described in paragraph (3), the Secretary

13091 shall provide written notice of such action to the Committee on

13092 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on

13093 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate.''; and

13094 (3) in subsection (d)--

13095 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``transferred into

13096 the program'' and inserting ``enrolled in an easement

13097 under section 1265C(b)''; and

13098 (B) by adding at the end the following:

13099 ``(3) Agricultural land easements.--A farmer or rancher who

13100 owns eligible land subject to an agricultural land easement may

13101 enter into a contract under subchapter B of chapter 1 of

13102 subtitle D.''.

13103

13104 Subtitle G--Regional Conservation Partnership Program

13105

13106SEC. 2701. ESTABLISHMENT AND PURPOSES.

13107

13108 Section 1271 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871) is

13109amended--

13110 (1) in subsection (a)--

13111 (A) in paragraph (1), by inserting ``, including

13112 partnership agreements funded through alternative

13113 funding arrangements or grant agreements under section

13114 1271C(d),'' after ``partnership agreements''; and

13115 (B) in paragraph (2), by striking ``contracts with

13116 producers'' and inserting ``program contracts with

13117 producers''; and

13118 (2) in subsection (b)--

13119 (A) in paragraph (1), in the matter preceding

13120 subparagraph (A), by striking ``use covered programs''

13121 and inserting ``carry out eligible activities'';

13122 (B) by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the

13123 following:

13124 ``(2) To further the conservation, protection, restoration,

13125 and sustainable use of soil, water (including sources of

13126 drinking water and groundwater), wildlife, agricultural land,

13127 and related

13128

13129[[Page 132 STAT. 4593]]

13130

13131 natural resources on eligible land on a regional or watershed

13132 scale.'';

13133 (C) in paragraph (3)--

13134 (i) in subparagraph (A), by inserting ``,

13135 including through alignment of partnership

13136 projects with other national, State, and local

13137 agencies and programs addressing similar natural

13138 resource or environmental concerns'' after

13139 ``eligible land''; and

13140 (ii) in subparagraph (B), by striking

13141 ``installation'' and inserting ``adoption,

13142 installation,''; and

13143 (D) by adding at the end the following:

13144 ``(4) To encourage the flexible and streamlined delivery of

13145 conservation assistance to producers through partnership

13146 agreements.

13147 ``(5) To engage producers and eligible partners in

13148 conservation projects to achieve greater conservation outcomes

13149 and benefits for producers than would otherwise be achieved.''.

13150SEC. 2702. DEFINITIONS.

13151

13152 Section 1271A of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871a) is

13153amended--

13154 (1) in paragraph (1)--

13155 (A) in subparagraph (C), by inserting ``, not

13156 including the grassland conservation initiative under

13157 section 1240L-1'' before the period at the end; and

13158 (B) by adding at the end the following:

13159 ``(E) The conservation reserve program established

13160 under subchapter B of chapter 1 of subtitle D.

13161 ``(F) The programs established by the Secretary to

13162 carry out the Watershed Protection and Flood Prevention

13163 Act (16 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.), except for any program

13164 established by the Secretary to carry out section 14 (16

13165 U.S.C. 1012) of that Act.'';

13166 (2) by striking paragraphs (2) and (3) and inserting the

13167 following:

13168 ``(2) Eligible activity.--The term `eligible activity' means

13169 a practice, activity, agreement, easement, or related

13170 conservation measure that is available under the statutory

13171 authority for a covered program.

13172 ``(3) Eligible land.--The term `eligible land' means any

13173 agricultural or nonindustrial private forest land or associated

13174 land on which the Secretary determines an eligible activity

13175 would help achieve conservation benefits.'';

13176 (3) in paragraph (4)--

13177 (A) in subparagraph (E), by inserting ``acequia,''

13178 after ``irrigation district,''; and

13179 (B) by adding at the end the following:

13180 ``(I) An organization described in section

13181 1265A(3)(B).

13182 ``(J) A conservation district.'';

13183 (4) by striking paragraph (5) and inserting the following:

13184 ``(5) Partnership agreement.--The term `partnership

13185 agreement' means the programmatic agreement entered into between

13186 the Secretary and an eligible partner, subject to the terms and

13187 conditions under section 1271B.''; and

13188 (5) by adding at the end the following:

13189 ``(7) Program contract.--

13190

13191[[Page 132 STAT. 4594]]

13192

13193 ``(A) In general.--The term `program contract' means

13194 the contract between the Secretary and a producer

13195 entered into under this subtitle.

13196 ``(B) Exclusion.--The term `program contract' does

13197 not include a contract under a covered program.''.

13198SEC. 2703. REGIONAL CONSERVATION PARTNERSHIPS.

13199

13200 Section 1271B of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871b) is

13201amended--

13202 (1) by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following:

13203

13204 ``(b) Length.--

13205 ``(1) In general.--A partnership agreement shall be--

13206 ``(A) for a period not to exceed 5 years; or

13207 ``(B) for a period that is longer than 5 years, if

13208 the longer period is necessary to meet the objectives of

13209 the program, as determined by the Secretary.

13210 ``(2) Renewal.--A partnership agreement may be renewed under

13211 subsection (e)(5) for a period not to exceed 5 years.

13212 ``(3) Extension.--A partnership agreement, or any renewal of

13213 a partnership agreement, may each be extended 1 time for a

13214 period not longer than 12 months, as determined by the

13215 Secretary.'';

13216 (2) in subsection (c)--

13217 (A) in paragraph (1)--

13218 (i) in subparagraph (A)--

13219 (I) by redesignating clauses (iii)

13220 and (iv) as clauses (iv) and (v),

13221 respectively; and

13222 (II) by striking clauses (i) and

13223 (ii) and inserting the following:

13224 ``(i) 1 or more conservation benefits that the

13225 project shall achieve;

13226 ``(ii) the eligible activities on eligible

13227 land to be conducted under the project to achieve

13228 conservation benefits;

13229 ``(iii) the implementation timeline for

13230 carrying out the project, including any interim

13231 milestones;'';

13232 (ii) in subparagraph (D), by striking

13233 ``funds'' and inserting ``contributions''; and

13234 (iii) in subparagraph (E), by striking ``of

13235 the project's effects; and'' and inserting the

13236 following: ``of--

13237 ``(i) the progress made by the project in

13238 achieving each conservation benefit defined in the

13239 partnership agreement, including in a quantified

13240 form to the extent practicable; and

13241 ``(ii) as appropriate, other outcomes of the

13242 project; and''; and

13243 (B) in paragraph (2)--

13244 (i) by striking ``An eligible'' and inserting

13245 the following:

13246 ``(A) In general.--An eligible''; and

13247 (ii) by adding at the end the following:

13248 ``(B) Form.--A contribution of an eligible partner

13249 under this paragraph may be in the form of--

13250 ``(i) direct funding;

13251 ``(ii) in-kind support; or

13252 ``(iii) a combination of direct funding and

13253 in-kind support.

13254

13255[[Page 132 STAT. 4595]]

13256

13257 ``(C) Treatment.--Any amounts expended during the

13258 period beginning on the date on which the Secretary

13259 announces the approval of an application under

13260 subsection (e) and ending on the day before the

13261 effective date of the partnership agreement by an

13262 eligible partner for staff salaries or development of

13263 the partnership agreement may be considered to be a part

13264 of the contribution of the eligible partner under this

13265 paragraph.'';

13266 (3) by redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (e);

13267 (4) by inserting after subsection (c) the following:

13268

13269 ``(d) Duties of Secretary.--The Secretary shall--

13270 ``(1) establish a timeline for carrying out the duties of

13271 the Secretary under a partnership agreement, including--

13272 ``(A) entering into program contracts with

13273 producers;

13274 ``(B) providing financial assistance to producers;

13275 and

13276 ``(C) in the case of a partnership agreement that is

13277 funded through an alternative funding arrangement or

13278 grant agreement under section 1271C(d), providing the

13279 payments to the eligible partner for carrying out

13280 eligible activities;

13281 ``(2) identify in each State a program coordinator for the

13282 State, who shall be responsible for providing assistance to

13283 eligible partners under the program;

13284 ``(3) establish guidance to assist eligible partners with

13285 carrying out the assessment required under subsection (c)(1)(E);

13286 ``(4) provide to each eligible partner that has entered into

13287 a partnership agreement that is not funded through an

13288 alternative funding arrangement or grant agreement under section

13289 1271C(d)--

13290 ``(A) a semiannual report describing the status of

13291 each pending and obligated contract under the project of

13292 the eligible partner; and

13293 ``(B) an annual report describing how the Secretary

13294 used amounts reserved by the Secretary for that year for

13295 technical assistance under section 1271D(f); and

13296 ``(5) ensure that any eligible activity effectively achieves

13297 the conservation benefits identified in the partnership

13298 agreement under subsection (c)(1)(A)(i).'';

13299 (5) in subsection (e) (as redesignated by paragraph (3))--

13300 (A) in paragraph (1), by inserting ``simplified''

13301 after ``conduct a'';

13302 (B) in paragraph (3)--

13303 (i) by striking the paragraph designation and

13304 heading and all that follows through ``description

13305 of--'' and inserting the following:

13306 ``(3) Contents.--The Secretary shall develop a simplified

13307 application that includes a description of--'';

13308 (ii) in subparagraph (C), by striking ``,

13309 including the covered programs to be used''; and

13310 (iii) in subparagraph (D), by striking

13311 ``financial'';

13312 (C) in paragraph (4)--

13313 (i) by striking subparagraph (D);

13314 (ii) by redesignating subparagraphs (E) and

13315 (F) as subparagraphs (G) and (H), respectively;

13316 and

13317 (iii) by inserting after subparagraph (C) the

13318 following:

13319

13320[[Page 132 STAT. 4596]]

13321

13322 ``(D) build new partnerships with local, State, and

13323 private entities to include a diversity of stakeholders

13324 in the project;

13325 ``(E) deliver a high percentage of applied

13326 conservation--

13327 ``(i) to achieve conservation benefits; or

13328 ``(ii) in the case of a project in a critical

13329 conservation area under section 1271F, to address

13330 the priority resource concern for that critical

13331 conservation area;

13332 ``(F) implement the project consistent with existing

13333 watershed, habitat, or other area restoration plans;'';

13334 and

13335 (D) by adding at the end the following:

13336 ``(5) Renewals.--If the Secretary determines that a project

13337 that is the subject of a partnership agreement has met or

13338 exceeded the objectives of the project, the Secretary may renew

13339 the partnership agreement through an expedited noncompetitive

13340 process if the 1 or more eligible partners that are parties to

13341 the partnership agreement request the renewal in order--

13342 ``(A) to continue to implement the project under a

13343 renewal of the partnership agreement; or

13344 ``(B) to expand the scope of the project under a

13345 renewal of the partnership agreement, as long as the

13346 expansion is within the objectives and purposes of the

13347 original partnership agreement.''; and

13348 (6) by adding at the end the following:

13349

13350 ``(f) Nonapplicability of Adjusted Gross Income Limitation.--The

13351adjusted gross income limitation described in section 1001D(b)(1) shall

13352not apply to an eligible partner under the program.''.

13353SEC. 2704. ASSISTANCE TO PRODUCERS.

13354

13355 Section 1271C of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871c) is

13356amended--

13357 (1) by striking subsections (a) and (b) and inserting the

13358 following:

13359

13360 ``(a) In General.--A producer may receive financial or technical

13361assistance to conduct eligible activities on eligible land through a

13362program contract entered into with the Secretary.

13363 ``(b) Program Contracts.--

13364 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall establish a program

13365 contract to be entered into with a producer to conduct eligible

13366 activities on eligible land, subject to such terms and

13367 conditions as the Secretary may establish.

13368 ``(2) Application bundles.--

13369 ``(A) In general.--An eligible partner may submit to

13370 the Secretary, on behalf of producers, a bundle of

13371 applications for assistance under the program through

13372 program contracts to address a substantial portion of

13373 the conservation benefits to be achieved by the project,

13374 as defined in the partnership agreement.

13375 ``(B) Priority.--The Secretary may give priority to

13376 applications described in subparagraph (A).'';

13377 (2) in subsection (c)--

13378 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``In accordance

13379 with statutory requirements of the covered programs

13380 involved, the Secretary may make payments to a

13381 producer'' and inserting ``Subject to section 1271D, the

13382 Secretary may make payments to a producer''; and

13383

13384[[Page 132 STAT. 4597]]

13385

13386 (B) in paragraph (3), by striking ``participating'';

13387 and

13388 (3) by adding at the end the following:

13389

13390 ``(d) Funding Through Alternative Funding Arrangements or Grant

13391Agreements.--

13392 ``(1) In general.--A partnership agreement entered into with

13393 an eligible partner may be funded through an alternative funding

13394 arrangement or grant in accordance with this subsection.

13395 ``(2) Duties of the secretary.--The Secretary shall--

13396 ``(A) under a funding agreement under paragraph

13397 (1)--

13398 ``(i) use funding made available to carry out

13399 this subtitle to provide funding directly to the

13400 eligible partner; and

13401 ``(ii) provide technical and administrative

13402 assistance, as mutually agreed by the parties; and

13403 ``(B) enter into not more than 15 alternative

13404 funding arrangements or grant agreements with 1 or more

13405 eligible partners each fiscal year.

13406 ``(3) Duties of eligible partners.--Under a funding

13407 agreement under paragraph (1), the eligible partner shall--

13408 ``(A) carry out eligible activities on eligible land

13409 in agreement with producers to achieve conservation

13410 benefits on a regional or watershed scale, such as--

13411 ``(i) infrastructure investments relating to

13412 agricultural or nonindustrial private forest

13413 production that would--

13414 ``(I) benefit multiple producers;

13415 and

13416 ``(II) address natural resource

13417 concerns such as drought, wildfire, or

13418 water quality impairment on the land

13419 covered by the project;

13420 ``(ii) projects addressing natural resources

13421 concerns in coordination with producers, including

13422 the development and implementation of watershed,

13423 habitat, or other area restoration plans;

13424 ``(iii) projects that use innovative

13425 approaches to leveraging the Federal investment in

13426 conservation with private financial mechanisms, in

13427 conjunction with agricultural production or forest

13428 resource management, such as--

13429 ``(I) the provision of performance-

13430 based payments to producers; and

13431 ``(II) support for an environmental

13432 market; or

13433 ``(iv) other projects for which the Secretary

13434 determines that the goals and objectives of the

13435 program would be easier to achieve through the

13436 funding agreement under paragraph (1); and

13437 ``(B) submit to the Secretary, in addition to any

13438 information that the Secretary requires to prepare the

13439 report under section 1271E(b), an annual report that

13440 describes the status of the project, including a

13441 description of--

13442 ``(i) the use of the funds awarded under

13443 paragraph (1);

13444 ``(ii) any subcontracts awarded;

13445 ``(iii) the producers receiving funding

13446 through the funding agreement under paragraph (1);

13447

13448[[Page 132 STAT. 4598]]

13449

13450 ``(iv)(I) the progress made by the project in

13451 addressing each natural resource concern defined

13452 in the funding agreement under paragraph (1),

13453 including in a quantified form to the extent

13454 practicable; and

13455 ``(II) as appropriate, other outcomes of the

13456 project; and

13457 ``(v) any other reporting data the Secretary

13458 determines are necessary to ensure compliance with

13459 the program rules.''.

13460SEC. 2705. FUNDING.

13461

13462 Section 1271D of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871d) is

13463amended--

13464 (1) in subsection (a)--

13465 (A) by striking ``$100,000,000'' and inserting

13466 ``$300,000,000''; and

13467 (B) by striking ``2014 through 2018'' and inserting

13468 ``2019 through 2023'';

13469 (2) by striking subsection (c);

13470 (3) by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections

13471 (c) and (d), respectively;

13472 (4) in subsection (c) (as so redesignated)--

13473 (A) in the matter preceding paragraph (1)--

13474 (i) by striking ``and acres''; and

13475 (ii) by striking ``and reserved for the

13476 program under subsection (c)'';

13477 (B) in paragraph (1)--

13478 (i) by striking ``25 percent of the funds and

13479 acres to projects based on a State competitive

13480 process administered by the State Conservationist,

13481 with the advice of the State technical committee''

13482 and inserting ``50 percent of the funds to

13483 projects based on a State or multistate

13484 competitive process administered by the Secretary

13485 at the local level with the advice of the

13486 applicable State technical committees''; and

13487 (ii) by adding ``and'' after the semicolon;

13488 (C) by striking paragraph (2);

13489 (D) by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (2);

13490 and

13491 (E) in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated), by

13492 striking ``35 percent of the funds and acres'' and

13493 inserting ``50 percent of the funds'';

13494 (5) in subsection (d) (as so redesignated)--

13495 (A) by striking ``None of the funds made available

13496 or reserved for the program'' and inserting the

13497 following:

13498 ``(1) In general.--Except as provided in paragraph (2), none

13499 of the funds made available for the program, including for a

13500 partnership agreement funded through an alternative funding

13501 arrangement or grant agreement under section 1271C(d),''; and

13502 (B) by adding at the end the following:

13503 ``(2) Project development and outreach.--Under a partnership

13504 agreement that is not funded through an alternative funding

13505 arrangement or grant agreement under section 1271C(d), the

13506 Secretary may advance reasonable amounts of funding for not

13507 longer than 90 days for technical assistance

13508

13509[[Page 132 STAT. 4599]]

13510

13511 to eligible partners to conduct project development and outreach

13512 activities in a project area, including--

13513 ``(A) providing outreach and education to producers

13514 for potential participation in the project;

13515 ``(B) establishing baseline metrics to support the

13516 development of the assessment required under section

13517 1271B(c)(1)(E); or

13518 ``(C) providing technical assistance to

13519 producers.''; and

13520 (6) by adding at the end the following:

13521

13522 ``(e) Technical Assistance.--

13523 ``(1) In general.--At the time of project selection, the

13524 Secretary shall identify and make publicly available the amount

13525 that the Secretary shall use to provide technical assistance

13526 under the terms of the partnership agreement.

13527 ``(2) Limitation.--The Secretary shall limit costs of the

13528 Secretary for technical assistance to costs specific and

13529 necessary to carry out the objectives of the program.

13530 ``(3) Third-party providers.--The Secretary shall develop

13531 and implement strategies to encourage third-party technical

13532 service providers to provide technical assistance to eligible

13533 partners pursuant to a partnership agreement.''.

13534SEC. 2706. ADMINISTRATION.

13535

13536 Section 1271E of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871e) is

13537amended--

13538 (1) in subsection (a), by striking ``1271B(d)'' each place

13539 it appears and inserting ``1271B(e)'';

13540 (2) in subsection (b)--

13541 (A) in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by

13542 striking ``December 31, 2014'' and inserting ``December

13543 31, 2019'';

13544 (B) by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (4) as

13545 paragraphs (2) through (5), respectively;

13546 (C) by inserting before paragraph (2) (as so

13547 redesignated) the following:

13548 ``(1) a summary of--

13549 ``(A) the progress made towards achieving the

13550 conservation benefits defined for the projects; and

13551 ``(B) any other related outcomes of the projects;'';

13552 (D) in paragraph (4) (as so redesignated), by

13553 striking ``and'' at the end;

13554 (E) in paragraph (5) (as so redesignated)--

13555 (i) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A),

13556 by striking ``1271C(b)(2)'' and inserting

13557 ``1271C(d)''; and

13558 (ii) in subparagraph (C), by striking the

13559 period at the end and inserting ``; and''; and

13560 (F) by adding at the end the following:

13561 ``(6) in the case of a project within a critical

13562 conservation area under section 1271F, the status of each

13563 priority resource concern for each designated critical

13564 conservation area, including--

13565 ``(A) the priority resource concerns for which each

13566 critical conservation area is designated;

13567 ``(B) conservation goals and outcomes sufficient to

13568 demonstrate that progress is being made to address the

13569 priority resource concerns;

13570 ``(C) the partnership agreements selected to address

13571 each conservation goal and outcome; and

13572

13573[[Page 132 STAT. 4600]]

13574

13575 ``(D) the extent to which each conservation goal and

13576 outcome is being addressed by the partnership

13577 agreements.''; and

13578 (3) by adding at the end the following:

13579

13580 ``(c) Compliance With Certain Requirements.--The Secretary may not

13581provide assistance under the program to a producer unless the producer

13582agrees, during the program year for which the assistance is provided--

13583 ``(1) to comply with applicable conservation requirements

13584 under subtitle B; and

13585 ``(2) to comply with applicable wetland protection

13586 requirements under subtitle C.

13587

13588 ``(d) Historically Underserved Producers.--To the maximum extent

13589practicable, in carrying out the program, the Secretary and eligible

13590partners shall conduct outreach to beginning farmers and ranchers,

13591veteran farmers and ranchers, socially disadvantaged farmers and

13592ranchers, and limited resource farmers and ranchers to encourage

13593participation by those producers in a project subject to a partnership

13594agreement or funding agreement under 1271C(d).

13595 ``(e) Regulations.--The Secretary shall issue regulations to carry

13596out the program.''.

13597SEC. 2707. CRITICAL CONSERVATION AREAS.

13598

13599 Section 1271F of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871f) is

13600amended--

13601 (1) by redesignating subsections (a), (b), and (c) as

13602 subsections (b), (c), and (e), respectively;

13603 (2) by inserting before subsection (b) (as so redesignated)

13604 the following:

13605

13606 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

13607 ``(1) Critical conservation area.--The term `critical

13608 conservation area' means a geographical area that contains a

13609 critical conservation condition that can be addressed through

13610 the program.

13611 ``(2) Priority resource concern.--The term `priority

13612 resource concern' means a natural resource concern located in a

13613 critical conservation area that can be addressed through--

13614 ``(A) water quality improvement, including through

13615 reducing erosion, promoting sediment control, and

13616 addressing nutrient management activities affecting

13617 large bodies of water of regional, national, or

13618 international significance;

13619 ``(B) water quantity improvement, including

13620 improvement relating to--

13621 ``(i) drought;

13622 ``(ii) groundwater, surface water, aquifer, or

13623 other water sources; or

13624 ``(iii) water retention and flood prevention;

13625 ``(C) wildlife habitat restoration to address

13626 species of concern at a Federal, State, or local level;

13627 and

13628 ``(D) other natural resource improvements, as

13629 determined by the Secretary, within the critical

13630 conservation area.'';

13631 (3) in subsection (b) (as so redesignated)--

13632 (A) by striking ``(b) In General.--'' and inserting

13633 the following:

13634

13635 ``(b) Applications.--'';

13636

13637[[Page 132 STAT. 4601]]

13638

13639 (B) by striking ``1271D(d)(3)'' and inserting

13640 ``1271D(d)(2)'';

13641 (C) by striking ``producer'' and inserting

13642 ``program''; and

13643 (D) by inserting ``that address 1 or more priority

13644 resource concerns for which the critical conservation

13645 area is designated'' before the period at the end;

13646 (4) in subsection (c) (as so redesignated)--

13647 (A) by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (3) as

13648 paragraphs (2) through (4), respectively;

13649 (B) by inserting before paragraph (2) (as so

13650 redesignated) the following:

13651 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall identify 1 or more

13652 priority resource concerns that apply to each critical

13653 conservation area designated under this section after the date

13654 of enactment of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law 113-79;

13655 128 Stat. 649), including the conservation goals and outcomes

13656 sufficient to demonstrate that progress is being made to address

13657 the priority resource concern.'';

13658 (C) in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated)--

13659 (i) by striking subparagraphs (C) and (D) and

13660 inserting the following:

13661 ``(C) contains 1 or more priority resource concerns;

13662 or''; and

13663 (ii) by redesignating subparagraph (E) as

13664 subparagraph (D); and

13665 (D) by striking paragraph (3) (as so redesignated)

13666 and inserting the following:

13667 ``(3) Review and withdrawal.--The Secretary may--

13668 ``(A) review designations of critical conservation

13669 areas under this section not more frequently than once

13670 every 5 years; and

13671 ``(B) withdraw designation of a critical

13672 conservation area only if the Secretary determines that

13673 the area is no longer a critical conservation area.'';

13674 (5) by inserting after subsection (c) (as so redesignated)

13675 the following:

13676

13677 ``(d) Outreach to Eligible Partners and Producers.--The Secretary

13678shall provide outreach and education to eligible partners and producers

13679in critical conservation areas designated under this section to

13680encourage the development of projects to address each priority resource

13681concern identified by the Secretary for that critical conservation

13682area.''; and

13683 (6) in subsection (e) (as so redesignated)--

13684 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``producer'' and

13685 inserting ``program''; and

13686 (B) by striking paragraph (3).

13690 Subtitle H--Repeals and Technical Amendments

13691

13692 PART I--REPEALS

13693

13694SEC. 2811. REPEAL OF CONSERVATION CORRIDOR DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM.

13695

13696 (a) In General.--Subtitle G of title II of the Farm Security and

13697Rural Investment Act of 2002 (16 U.S.C. 3801 note; Public Law 107-171)

13698is repealed.

13699 (b) Conforming Amendment.--Section 5059 of the Water Resources

13700Development Act of 2007 (16 U.S.C. 3801 note; Public Law 110-114) is

13701repealed.

13702SEC. 2812. REPEAL OF CRANBERRY ACREAGE RESERVE PROGRAM.

13703

13704 Section 10608 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002

13705(16 U.S.C. 3801 note; Public Law 107-171) is repealed.

13706SEC. 2813. REPEAL OF NATIONAL NATURAL RESOURCES FOUNDATION.

13707

13708 Subtitle F of title III of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and

13709Reform Act of 1996 (16 U.S.C. 5801 et seq.) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 5801 and

13710note, 5802-5809.&gt;&gt; is repealed.

13711SEC. 2814. REPEAL OF FLOOD RISK REDUCTION.

13712

13713 Section 385 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of

137141996 (7 U.S.C. 7334) is repealed.

13715SEC. 2815. REPEAL OF STUDY OF LAND USE FOR EXPIRING CONTRACTS AND

13716 EXTENSION OF AUTHORITY.

13717

13718 Section 1437 of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act

13719of 1990 (16 U.S.C. 3831 note; Public Law 101-624) is repealed.

13720SEC. 2816. REPEAL OF INTEGRATED FARM MANAGEMENT PROGRAM OPTION.

13721

13722 Section 1451 of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act

13723of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5822) is repealed.

13725 LANDS.

13726

13727 Section 325 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of

137281996 (Public Law 104-127; 110 Stat. 992) is repealed.

13741 Health and Human Services''.

13745``National Resources Conservation Service'' and inserting ``Natural

13746Resources Conservation Service''.

13748[[Page 132 STAT. 4603]]

13749

13751Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3831b(b)(2)(A)(i)) is amended by adding

13752a semicolon at the end.

13754and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (16 U.S.C. 3839bb-6) is amended--

13757 (B) by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (1);

13758 and

13759 (C) by adding at the end the following:

13760 ``(2) No additional funds.--

13761 ``(A) In general.--Nothing in this section

13762 authorizes any additional funds to carry out this

13763 section.

13765 available to carry out this section before the date of

13766 enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 may

13767 remain available until expended.''; and

13768 (2) by adding at the end the following:

13771section shall terminate on October 1, 2023.''.

13772 (e) Delivery of Technical Assistance.--Section 1242 of the Food

13773Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3842) is amended by striking ``third

13774party'' each place it appears and inserting ``third-party''.

137761244(b)(4)(B) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3844(b)(4)(B))

13795amended to read as follows:

13796 ``(g) Labeling of Assistance.--Agricultural commodities and other

13797assistance provided under this title shall, to the extent practicable,

13798be clearly identified with appropriate markings on the package or

13799container of such agricultural commodities or food procured outside of

13800the United States, or on printed material that accompanies other

13801assistance, in the language of the locality in which such commodities

13802and other assistance are distributed, as being furnished by the people

13803of the United States of America.''.

13864 (a) Inclusion of All Modalities.--Section 403(a) of the Food for

13865Peace Act (7 U.S.C. 1733(a)) is amended--

13871 cash transfer for food'' after ``agricultural commodity'';

13873 provision of an agricultural commodity,'' before ``adequate'';

13884 transfers for food,'' after ``agricultural commodities''; and

13886 agricultural commodities''.
