13896and inserting ``2023''.

13897SEC. 3112. ANNUAL REPORT REGARDING FOOD AID PROGRAMS AND

13898 ACTIVITIES.

13899

13900 (a) In General.--Section 407(f) of the Food for Peace Act (7 U.S.C.

139011736a(f)) is amended to read as follows:

13902 ``(f) Annual Report Regarding Food Aid Programs and Activities.--

13903 ``(1) Annual report.--Not later than April 1 of each fiscal

13904 year, the Administrator and the Secretary shall jointly, or each

13905 separately, prepare and submit to the appropriate committees of

13906 Congress a report regarding each program and activity carried

13907 out under this Act by the Administrator, the Secretary, or both,

13908 as applicable, during the prior fiscal year.

13909 ``(2) Contents.--An annual report described in paragraph (1)

13910 shall include, with respect to the prior fiscal year, the

13911 following:

13912 ``(A) A list that contains a description of each

13913 country and organization that receives food and other

13914 assistance under this Act (including the quantity of

13915 food and assistance provided to each country and

13916 organization).

13917 ``(B) A general description of each project and

13918 activity implemented under this Act (including each

13919 activity funded through the use of local currencies) and

13920 the total number of beneficiaries of the project.

13921 ``(C) A statement describing the quantity of

13922 agricultural commodities made available to, and the

13923 total number of beneficiaries in, each country pursuant

13924 to--

13925 ``(i) this Act;

13926 ``(ii) section 416(b) of the Agricultural Act

13927 of 1949 (7 U.S.C. 1431(b));

13928 ``(iii) the Food for Progress Act of 1985 (7

13929 U.S.C. 1736o); and

13930

13931[[Page 132 STAT. 4606]]

13932

13933 ``(iv) the McGovern-Dole International Food

13934 for Education and Child Nutrition Program

13935 established by section 3107 of the Farm Security

13936 and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 1736o-

13937 1).

13938 ``(D) An assessment of the progress made through

13939 programs under this Act towards reducing food insecurity

13940 in the populations receiving food assistance from the

13941 United States.

13942 ``(E) A description of efforts undertaken by the

13943 Food Aid Consultative Group under section 205 to achieve

13944 an integrated and effective food assistance program.

13945 ``(F) An assessment of--

13946 ``(i) each program oversight, monitoring, and

13947 evaluation system implemented under section

13948 207(f); and

13949 ``(ii) the impact of each program oversight,

13950 monitoring, and evaluation system on the

13951 effectiveness and efficiency of assistance

13952 provided under this title.

13953 ``(G) An assessment of the progress made by the

13954 Administrator in addressing issues relating to quality

13955 with respect to the provision of food assistance.

13956 ``(H) A statement of the amount of funds (including

13957 funds for administrative costs, indirect cost recovery,

13958 internal transportation, storage and handling, and

13959 associated distribution costs) provided to each eligible

13960 organization that received assistance under this Act,

13961 that further describes the following:

13962 ``(i) How such funds were used by the eligible

13963 organization.

13964 ``(ii) The actual rate of return for each

13965 commodity made available under this Act, including

13966 factors that influenced the rate of return, and,

13967 for the commodity, the costs of bagging or further

13968 processing, ocean transportation, inland

13969 transportation in the recipient country, storage

13970 costs, and any other information that the

13971 Administrator and the Secretary determine to be

13972 necessary.

13973 ``(iii) For each instance in which a commodity

13974 was made available under this Act at a rate of

13975 return less than 70 percent, the reasons for the

13976 rate of return realized.

13977 ``(I) For funds expended for purposes of section

13978 202(e), 406(b)(6), and 407(c)(1)(B), a detailed

13979 accounting of the expenditures and purposes of such

13980 expenditures with respect to each such section.

13981 ``(3) Rate of return described.--For purposes of applying

13982 subparagraph (H) of paragraph (2), the rate of return for a

13983 commodity shall be equal to the proportion that--

13984 ``(A) the proceeds the implementing partners

13985 generate through monetization; bears to

13986 ``(B) the cost to the Federal Government to procure

13987 and ship the commodity to a recipient country for

13988 monetization.''.

13989

13990 (b) Conforming Repeal.--Subsection (m) of section 403 of the Food

13991for Peace Act (7 U.S.C. 1733) is repealed.

13992

13993[[Page 132 STAT. 4607]]

13994

13995SEC. 3113. DEADLINE FOR AGREEMENTS TO FINANCE SALES OR TO PROVIDE

13996 OTHER ASSISTANCE.

13997

13998 Section 408 of the Food for Peace Act (7 U.S.C. 1736b) is amended by

13999striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

14000SEC. 3114. MINIMUM LEVEL OF NONEMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE.

14001

14002 Section 412(e) of the Food for Peace Act (7 U.S.C. 1736f(e)) is

14003amended to read as follows:

14004 ``(e) Minimum Level of Nonemergency Food Assistance.--

14005 ``(1) In general.--For each of fiscal years 2019 through

14006 2023, not less than $365,000,000 of the amounts made available

14007 to carry out emergency and nonemergency food assistance programs

14008 under title II, nor more than 30 percent of such amounts, shall

14009 be expended for nonemergency food assistance programs under such

14010 title.

14011 ``(2) Community development funds.--Funds appropriated each

14012 year to carry out part I of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

14013 (22 U.S.C. 2151 et seq.) that are made available through grants

14014 or cooperative agreements to strengthen food security in

14015 developing countries and that are consistent with section

14016 202(e)(1)(C) may be considered amounts expended for nonemergency

14017 food assistance programs for purposes of paragraph (1).

14018 ``(3) Farmer-to-farmer program.--In determining the amount

14019 expended for a fiscal year for nonemergency food assistance

14020 programs under paragraph (1), amounts expended for that year to

14021 carry out programs under section 501 may be considered amounts

14022 expended for nonemergency food assistance programs.''.

14023SEC. 3115. TERMINATION DATE FOR MICRONUTRIENT FORTIFICATION

14024 PROGRAMS.

14025

14026 Section 415(c) of the Food for Peace Act (7 U.S.C. 1736g-2(c)) is

14027amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

14028SEC. 3116. JOHN OGONOWSKI AND DOUG BEREUTER FARMER-TO-FARMER

14029 PROGRAM.

14030

14031 Section 501 of the Food for Peace Act (7 U.S.C. 1737) is amended--

14032 (1) in subsection (b)--

14033 (A) in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by

14034 inserting ``section 1342 of title 31, United States

14035 Code, or'' after ``Notwithstanding'';

14036 (B) in paragraph (1) by inserting ``technical''

14037 before ``assistance''; and

14038 (C) in paragraph (2)--

14039 (i) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A),

14040 by inserting ``employees or staff of a State

14041 cooperative institution (as such term is defined

14042 in paragraph 18 of section 1404 of the National

14043 Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching

14044 Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103), except that

14045 subparagraphs (E), (F), and (G) of such paragraph

14046 shall not apply),'' after ``private

14047 corporations,''; and

14048 (ii) in subparagraph (A)--

14049 (I) by striking ``; and'' at the end

14050 of clause (viii); and

14051

14052[[Page 132 STAT. 4608]]

14053

14054 (II) by striking clause (ix) and

14055 inserting the following:

14056 ``(ix) agricultural education and extension;

14057 ``(x) selection of seed varieties and plant

14058 stocks;

14059 ``(xi) knowledge of insecticide and sanitation

14060 procedures to prevent crop destruction;

14061 ``(xii) use and maintenance of agricultural

14062 equipment and irrigation systems; and

14063 ``(xiii) selection of fertilizers and methods

14064 of soils treatment; and'';

14065 (2) in subsection (d), in the matter preceding paragraph

14066 (1), by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023'';

14067 (3) in subsection (e)(1), in the matter preceding

14068 subparagraph (A), by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023'';

14069 and

14070 (4) by adding at the end the following:

14071

14072 ``(f) Grant Program to Create New Partners and Innovation.--

14073 ``(1) In general.--The Administrator of the Agency for

14074 International Development shall develop a grant program to be

14075 carried out in fiscal years 2019 through 2023 to facilitate new

14076 and innovative partnerships and activities under this title.

14077 ``(2) Use of funds.--A grant recipient under this subsection

14078 shall use funds received under this subsection to--

14079 ``(A) prioritize new implementing partners;

14080 ``(B) develop innovative volunteer models;

14081 ``(C) develop, improve, or maintain strategic

14082 partnerships with other United States development

14083 programs; and

14084 ``(D) expand the footprint and impact of the

14085 programs and activities under this title, and diversity

14086 among program participants, including land-grant

14087 colleges and universities and cooperative extension

14088 services (as such terms are defined in section 1404 of

14089 the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and

14090 Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103)).''.

14091

14092 Subtitle B--Agricultural Trade Act of 1978

14093

14094SEC. 3201. AGRICULTURAL TRADE PROMOTION AND FACILITATION.

14095

14096 (a) In General.--Section 203 of the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978

14097(7 U.S.C. 5623) is amended to read as follows:

14098``SEC. 203. AGRICULTURAL TRADE PROMOTION AND FACILITATION.

14099

14100 ``(a) Establishment.--The Secretary shall carry out activities under

14101this section--

14102 ``(1) to access, develop, maintain, and expand markets for

14103 United States agricultural commodities; and

14104 ``(2) to promote cooperation and the exchange of

14105 information.

14106

14107 ``(b) Market Access Program.--

14108 ``(1) Definition of eligible trade organization.--In this

14109 subsection, the term `eligible trade organization' means--

14110 ``(A) a United States agricultural trade

14111 organization or regional State-related organization that

14112 promotes the export and sale of United States

14113 agricultural commodities and that does not stand to

14114 profit directly from specific sales of United States

14115 agricultural commodities;

14116

14117[[Page 132 STAT. 4609]]

14118

14119 ``(B) a cooperative organization or State agency

14120 that promotes the sale of United States agricultural

14121 commodities; or

14122 ``(C) a private organization that promotes the

14123 export and sale of United States agricultural

14124 commodities if the Secretary determines that such

14125 organization would significantly contribute to United

14126 States export market development.

14127 ``(2) In general.--The Commodity Credit Corporation shall

14128 establish and carry out a program, to be known as the `Market

14129 Access Program', to encourage the development, maintenance, and

14130 expansion of commercial export markets for United States

14131 agricultural commodities (including commodities that are

14132 organically produced (as defined in section 2103 of the Organic

14133 Foods Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6502))) through cost-

14134 share assistance to eligible trade organizations that implement

14135 a foreign market development program.

14136 ``(3) Participation requirements.--

14137 ``(A) Marketing plan and other requirements.--To be

14138 eligible for cost-share assistance under this

14139 subsection, an eligible trade organization shall--

14140 ``(i) prepare and submit a marketing plan to

14141 the Secretary that meets the guidelines governing

14142 such a marketing plan specified in this paragraph

14143 or otherwise established by the Secretary;

14144 ``(ii) meet any other requirements established

14145 by the Secretary; and

14146 ``(iii) enter into an agreement with the

14147 Secretary.

14148 ``(B) Purpose of marketing plan.--A marketing plan

14149 submitted under this paragraph shall describe the

14150 advertising or other market oriented export promotion

14151 activities to be carried out by the eligible trade

14152 organization with respect to which assistance under this

14153 subsection is being requested.

14154 ``(C) Specific elements.--To be approved by the

14155 Secretary, a marketing plan submitted under this

14156 paragraph shall--

14157 ``(i) specifically describe the manner in

14158 which assistance received by the eligible trade

14159 organization, in conjunction with funds and

14160 services provided by the eligible trade

14161 organization, will be expended in implementing the

14162 marketing plan;

14163 ``(ii) establish specific market goals to be

14164 achieved under the marketing plan; and

14165 ``(iii) contain whatever additional

14166 requirements are determined by the Secretary to be

14167 necessary.

14168 ``(D) Branded promotion.--A marketing plan approved

14169 by the Secretary may provide for the use of branded

14170 advertising to promote the sale of United States

14171 agricultural commodities in a foreign country under such

14172 terms and conditions as may be established by the

14173 Secretary.

14174 ``(E) Amendments.--An approved marketing plan may be

14175 amended by the eligible trade organization at any time,

14176 subject to the approval of the amendment by the

14177 Secretary.

14178 ``(4) Level of assistance and cost-share requirements.--

14179

14180[[Page 132 STAT. 4610]]

14181

14182 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall justify in

14183 writing the level of assistance to be provided to an

14184 eligible trade organization under this subsection and

14185 the level of cost sharing required of the organization.

14186 ``(B) Limitation on branded promotion.--Assistance

14187 provided under this subsection for activities described

14188 in paragraph (3)(D) shall not exceed 50 percent of the

14189 cost of implementing the marketing plan, except that the

14190 Secretary may determine not to apply such limitation in

14191 the case of United States agricultural commodities with

14192 respect to which there has been a favorable decision by

14193 the United States Trade Representative under section 301

14194 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2411). Criteria used

14195 by the Secretary for determining that the limitation

14196 shall not apply shall be consistent and documented.

14197 ``(5) Other terms and conditions.--

14198 ``(A) Multiyear basis.--The Secretary may provide

14199 assistance under this subsection on a multiyear basis,

14200 subject to annual review by the Secretary for compliance

14201 with the approved marketing plan.

14202 ``(B) Termination of assistance.--The Secretary may

14203 terminate any assistance made, or to be made, available

14204 under this subsection if the Secretary determines that--

14205 ``(i) the eligible trade organization is not

14206 adhering to the terms and conditions applicable to

14207 the provision of the assistance;

14208 ``(ii) the eligible trade organization is not

14209 implementing the approved marketing plan or is not

14210 adequately meeting the established goals of the

14211 plan;

14212 ``(iii) the eligible trade organization is not

14213 adequately contributing its own resources to the

14214 implementation of the plan; or

14215 ``(iv) the Secretary determines that

14216 termination of assistance in a particular instance

14217 is in the best interests of the Market Access

14218 Program.

14219 ``(C) Evaluations.--Beginning not later than 15

14220 months after the initial provision of assistance under

14221 this subsection to an eligible trade organization, the

14222 Secretary shall monitor the expenditures by the eligible

14223 trade organization of such assistance, including the

14224 following:

14225 ``(i) An evaluation of the effectiveness of

14226 the marketing plan of the eligible trade

14227 organization in developing or maintaining markets

14228 for United States agricultural commodities.

14229 ``(ii) An evaluation of whether assistance

14230 provided under this subsection is necessary to

14231 maintain such markets.

14232 ``(iii) A thorough accounting of the

14233 expenditure by the eligible trade organization of

14234 the assistance provided under this subsection.

14235 ``(6) Restrictions on use of funds.--Assistance provided

14236 under this subsection to an eligible trade organization may not

14237 be used--

14238 ``(A) to provide direct assistance to any foreign

14239 for-profit corporation for the corporation's use in

14240 promoting foreign-produced products; or

14241

14242[[Page 132 STAT. 4611]]

14243

14244 ``(B) to provide direct assistance to any for-profit

14245 corporation that is not recognized as a small business

14246 concern (as described in section 3(a) of the Small

14247 Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632(a))), excluding--

14248 ``(i) a cooperative;

14249 ``(ii) an association described in the first

14250 section of the Act entitled `An Act To authorize

14251 association of producers of agricultural

14252 products', approved February 18, 1922 (7 U.S.C.

14253 291); or

14254 ``(iii) a nonprofit trade association.

14255 ``(7) Permissive use of funds.--Assistance provided under

14256 this subsection to a United States agricultural trade

14257 association, cooperative, or small business may be used for

14258 individual branded promotional activity related to a United

14259 States branded product, if the beneficiaries of the activity

14260 have provided funds for the activity in an amount that is at

14261 least equivalent to the amount of such assistance.

14262 ``(8) Priority.--In providing assistance for branded

14263 promotion, the Secretary should give priority to small-sized

14264 entities.

14265 ``(9) Contribution level.--

14266 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary should require a

14267 minimum contribution level of 10 percent from an

14268 eligible trade organization that receives assistance for

14269 nonbranded promotion.

14270 ``(B) Increases in contribution level.--The

14271 Secretary may increase the contribution level in any

14272 subsequent year that an eligible trade organization

14273 receives assistance for nonbranded promotion.

14274 ``(10) Additionality.--The Secretary should require each

14275 participant in the Market Access Program to certify that any

14276 Federal funds received supplement, but do not supplant, private

14277 or third party participant funds or other contributions to

14278 Program activities.

14279 ``(11) Independent audits.--If as a result of an evaluation

14280 or audit of activities of a participant under the Market Access

14281 Program, the Secretary determines that a further review is

14282 justified in order to ensure compliance with the requirements of

14283 the Program, the Secretary should require the participant to

14284 contract for an independent audit of the Program activities,

14285 including activities of any subcontractor.

14286 ``(12) Tobacco.--No funds made available under the Market

14287 Access Program may be used for activities to develop, maintain,

14288 or expand foreign markets for tobacco.

14289

14290 ``(c) Foreign Market Development Cooperator Program.--

14291 ``(1) Definition of eligible trade organization.--In this

14292 subsection, the term `eligible trade organization' means a

14293 United States trade organization that--

14294 ``(A) promotes the export of 1 or more United States

14295 agricultural commodities; and

14296 ``(B) does not have a business interest in or

14297 receive remuneration from specific sales of agricultural

14298 commodities.

14299 ``(2) Establishment.--The Secretary shall establish and, in

14300 cooperation with eligible trade organizations, carry out a

14301 program to be known as the `Foreign Market Development

14302

14303[[Page 132 STAT. 4612]]

14304

14305 Cooperator Program' to maintain and develop foreign markets for

14306 United States agricultural commodities.

14307 ``(3) Use of funds.--Funds made available to carry out this

14308 subsection shall be used only to provide--

14309 ``(A) cost-share assistance to an eligible trade

14310 organization under a contract or agreement with the

14311 eligible trade organization; and

14312 ``(B) assistance for other costs that are

14313 appropriate to carry out the Foreign Market Development

14314 Cooperator Program, including contingent liabilities

14315 that are not otherwise funded.

14316

14317 ``(d) E (Kika) De La Garza Emerging Markets Program.--

14318 ``(1) Definition of emerging market.--In this subsection,

14319 the term `emerging market' means any country, foreign territory,

14320 customs union, or other economic market that the Secretary

14321 determines--

14322 ``(A) is taking steps toward a market-oriented

14323 economy through the food, agriculture, or rural business

14324 sectors of its economy; and

14325 ``(B) has the potential to provide a viable and

14326 significant market for United States agricultural

14327 commodities.

14328 ``(2) Establishment.--The Secretary shall establish and

14329 carry out a program, to be known as the `E (Kika) de la Garza

14330 Emerging Markets Program'--

14331 ``(A) to develop agricultural markets in emerging

14332 markets; and

14333 ``(B) to promote cooperation and exchange of

14334 information between agricultural institutions and

14335 agribusinesses in the United States and emerging

14336 markets.

14337 ``(3) Development of agricultural systems.--

14338 ``(A) In general.--

14339 ``(i) Implementation.--To develop, maintain,

14340 or expand markets for exports of United States

14341 agricultural commodities, the Secretary shall make

14342 available to emerging markets the expertise of the

14343 United States--

14344 ``(I) to make assessments of food

14345 and rural business systems needs;

14346 ``(II) to make recommendations on

14347 measures necessary to enhance the

14348 effectiveness of the food and rural

14349 business systems described in subclause

14350 (I), including potential reductions in

14351 trade barriers; and

14352 ``(III) to identify and carry out

14353 specific opportunities and projects to

14354 enhance the effectiveness of the food

14355 and rural business systems described in

14356 subclause (I).

14357 ``(ii) Extent of program.--The Secretary shall

14358 implement this subparagraph with respect to at

14359 least 3 emerging markets in each fiscal year.

14360 ``(B) Experts from the united states.--The Secretary

14361 may implement subparagraph (A) by providing--

14362 ``(i) assistance to teams (consisting

14363 primarily of agricultural consultants,

14364 agricultural producers, other persons from the

14365 private sector, and government officials expert in

14366 assessing the food and rural business systems of

14367 other countries) to enable those teams to

14368

14369[[Page 132 STAT. 4613]]

14370

14371 conduct the assessments, make the recommendations,

14372 and identify the opportunities and projects

14373 described in subparagraph (A)(i) in emerging

14374 markets;

14375 ``(ii) for necessary subsistence and

14376 transportation expenses of--

14377 ``(I) United States food and rural

14378 business system experts, including

14379 United States agricultural producers and

14380 other United States individuals

14381 knowledgeable in agricultural and

14382 agribusiness matters, to enable such

14383 United States food and rural business

14384 system experts to assist in transferring

14385 knowledge and expertise to entities from

14386 emerging markets; and

14387 ``(II) individuals designated by

14388 emerging markets to enable such

14389 designated individuals to consult with

14390 such United States experts to enhance

14391 food and rural business systems of such

14392 emerging markets and to transfer

14393 knowledge and expertise to such emerging

14394 markets.

14395 ``(C) Cost-sharing.--The Secretary shall encourage

14396 the nongovernmental experts described in subparagraph

14397 (B) to share the costs of, and otherwise assist in, the

14398 participation of those experts in the E (Kika) de la

14399 Garza Emerging Markets Program.

14400 ``(D) Technical assistance.--The Secretary is

14401 authorized to provide, or pay the necessary costs for,

14402 technical assistance (including the establishment of

14403 extension services) to enable individuals or other

14404 entities to carry out recommendations, projects, and

14405 opportunities in emerging markets, including

14406 recommendations, projects, and opportunities described

14407 in subclauses (II) and (III) of subparagraph (A)(i).

14408 ``(E) Reports to secretary.--A team that receives

14409 assistance under subparagraph (B)(i) shall prepare and

14410 submit to the Secretary such reports as the Secretary

14411 may require.

14412 ``(F) Advisory committee.--To provide the Secretary

14413 with information that may be useful to the Secretary in

14414 carrying out this subsection, the Secretary may

14415 establish an advisory committee composed of

14416 representatives of the various sectors of the food and

14417 rural business systems of the United States.

14418 ``(G) Effect.--The authority provided under this

14419 subsection shall be in addition to and not in place of

14420 any other authority of the Secretary or the Commodity

14421 Credit Corporation.

14422

14423 ``(e) Technical Assistance for Specialty Crops.--

14424 ``(1) Establishment.--The Secretary of Agriculture shall

14425 establish an export assistance program, in this subsection

14426 referred to as the `program', to address existing or potential

14427 unique barriers that prohibit or threaten the export of United

14428 States specialty crops.

14429 ``(2) Purpose.--The program shall provide direct assistance

14430 through public and private sector projects and technical

14431 assistance, including through the program under section 2(e) of

14432 the Competitive, Special, and Facilities Research Grant Act (7

14433 U.S.C. 3157(e)), to remove, resolve, or mitigate existing or

14434

14435[[Page 132 STAT. 4614]]

14436

14437 potential sanitary, phytosanitary, and technical barriers to

14438 trade.

14439 ``(3) Priority.--The program shall address time sensitive

14440 and strategic market access projects based on--

14441 ``(A) trade effect on market retention, market

14442 access, and market expansion; and

14443 ``(B) trade impact.

14444 ``(4) Multiyear projects.--The Secretary may provide

14445 assistance under the program to a project for longer than a 5-

14446 year period if the Secretary determines that further assistance

14447 would effectively support the purpose described in paragraph

14448 (2).

14449 ``(5) Outreach and technical assistance.--The Secretary

14450 shall--

14451 ``(A) conduct outreach to inform eligible

14452 organizations of the requirements of the program and the

14453 process by which such organizations may submit proposals

14454 for funding;

14455 ``(B) provide technical assistance to eligible

14456 organizations to assist in developing proposals and

14457 complying with the requirements of the program; and

14458 ``(C) solicit input from eligible organizations on

14459 improvements to streamline and facilitate the provision

14460 of assistance under this subsection.

14461 ``(6) Regulations and procedures.--

14462 ``(A) In general.--Not later than 1 year after the

14463 date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

14464 2018, the Secretary shall review program regulations,

14465 procedures, and guidelines for assistance under this

14466 subsection and make revisions to streamline, improve,

14467 and clarify the application, approval and compliance

14468 processes for such assistance, including revisions to

14469 implement the requirements of paragraph (5).

14470 ``(B) Considerations.--In reviewing and making

14471 revisions under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall

14472 consider--

14473 ``(i) establishing accountability standards

14474 that are appropriate for the size and scope of a

14475 project; and

14476 ``(ii) establishing streamlined application

14477 and approval processes, including for smaller-

14478 scale projects or projects to address time-

14479 sensitive trade barriers.

14480 ``(7) Annual report.--Each year, the Secretary shall submit

14481 to the appropriate committees of Congress a report that

14482 contains, for the period covered by the report, a description

14483 of--

14484 ``(A) each factor that affects the export of

14485 specialty crops, including each factor relating to any--

14486 ``(i) significant sanitary or phytosanitary

14487 issue;

14488 ``(ii) trade barrier; or

14489 ``(iii) emerging sanitary or phytosanitary

14490 issue or trade barrier; and

14491 ``(B)(i) any funds provided under subsection

14492 (f)(3)(A)(iv) that were not obligated in a fiscal year;

14493 and

14494 ``(ii) the reason such funds were not obligated.

14495

14496 ``(f) Funding and Administration.--

14497

14498[[Page 132 STAT. 4615]]

14499

14500 ``(1) Commodity credit corporation.--The Secretary shall use

14501 the funds, facilities, and authorities of the Commodity Credit

14502 Corporation to carry out this section.

14503 ``(2) Funding amount.--For each of fiscal years 2019 through

14504 2023, of the funds of, or an equal value of commodities owned

14505 by, the Commodity Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall use to

14506 carry out this section $255,000,000, to remain available until

14507 expended.

14508 ``(3) Allocation.--

14509 ``(A) In general.--For each of fiscal years 2019

14510 through 2023, the Secretary shall allocate funds to

14511 carry out this section in accordance with the following:

14512 ``(i) Market access program.--For market

14513 access activities authorized under subsection (b),

14514 of the funds of, or an equal value of commodities

14515 owned by, the Commodity Credit Corporation, not

14516 less than $200,000,000 for each fiscal year.

14517 ``(ii) Foreign market development cooperator

14518 program.--To carry out subsection (c), of the

14519 funds of, or an equal value of commodities owned

14520 by, the Commodity Credit Corporation, not less

14521 than $34,500,000 for each fiscal year.

14522 ``(iii) E (kika) de la garza emerging markets

14523 program.--To provide assistance under subsection

14524 (d), of the funds of, or an equal value of

14525 commodities owned by, the Commodity Credit

14526 Corporation, not more than $8,000,000 for each

14527 fiscal year.

14528 ``(iv) Technical assistance for specialty

14529 crops.--To carry out subsection (e), of the funds

14530 of, or an equal value of the commodities owned by,

14531 the Commodity Credit Corporation, $9,000,000 for

14532 each fiscal year.

14533 ``(v) Priority trade fund.--

14534 ``(I) In general.--In addition to

14535 the amounts allocated under clauses (i)

14536 through (iv), and notwithstanding any

14537 limitations in those clauses, as

14538 determined by the Secretary, for 1 or

14539 more programs under this section for

14540 authorized activities to access,

14541 develop, maintain, and expand markets

14542 for United States agricultural

14543 commodities, $3,500,000 for each fiscal

14544 year.

14545 ``(II) Considerations.--In

14546 allocating funds made available under

14547 subclause (I), the Secretary may

14548 consider providing a greater allocation

14549 to 1 or more programs under this section

14550 for which the amounts requested under

14551 applications exceed available funding

14552 for the 1 or more programs.

14553 ``(B) Reallocation.--Any funds allocated under

14554 clauses (i) through (iv) of subparagraph (A) that remain

14555 unobligated one year after the end of the fiscal year in

14556 which they are first made available shall be reallocated

14557 to the priority trade fund under subparagraph (A)(v). To

14558 the maximum extent practicable, the Secretary shall

14559 allocate such reallocated funds to support exports of

14560 those types of United States agricultural commodities

14561 eligible for assistance under the program for which the

14562 funds were originally allocated under subparagraph (A).

14563

14564[[Page 132 STAT. 4616]]

14565

14566 ``(4) Cuba.--Notwithstanding section 908 of the Trade

14567 Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000 (22 U.S.C.

14568 7207) or any other provision of law, funds made available under

14569 this section may be used to carry out the programs authorized

14570 under subsections (b) and (c) in Cuba. Funds may not be used as

14571 described in the previous sentence in contravention with

14572 directives set forth under the National Security Presidential

14573 Memorandum entitled `Strengthening the Policy of the United

14574 States Toward Cuba' issued by the President on June 16, 2017,

14575 during the period in which that memorandum is in effect.

14576 ``(5) Authorization of appropriations.--In addition to any

14577 other amounts provided under this subsection, there are

14578 authorized to be appropriated such sums as are necessary to

14579 carry out the programs and authorities under paragraph (3)(A)(v)

14580 and subsections (b) through (e).''.

14581

14582 (b) Conforming Amendments.--

14583 (1) Market access program.--

14584 (A) Section 211 of the Agricultural Trade Act of

14585 1978 (7 U.S.C. 5641) is amended by striking subsection

14586 (c).

14587 (B) Section 402(a)(1) of the Agricultural Trade Act

14588 of 1978 (7 U.S.C. 5662(a)(1)) is amended by striking

14589 ``203'' and inserting ``203(b)''.

14590 (C) Section 282(f)(2)(C) of the Agricultural

14591 Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1638a(f)(2)(C)) is

14592 amended by striking ``section 203 of the Agricultural

14593 Trade Act of 1978 (7 U.S.C. 5623)'' and inserting

14594 ``section 203(b) of the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978

14595 (7 U.S.C. 5623(b))''.

14596 (D) Section 718 of the Agriculture, Rural

14597 Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related

14598 Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999 (7 U.S.C. 5623 note;

14599 Public Law 105-277) is amended by striking ``section 203

14600 of the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978 (7 U.S.C. 5623)''

14601 and inserting ``section 203(b) of the Agricultural Trade

14602 Act of 1978 (7 U.S.C. 5623(b)''.

14603 (E) Section 1302 of the Omnibus Budget

14604 Reconciliation Act of 1993 &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 5623 note.&gt;&gt;

14605 is repealed.

14606 (2) Foreign market development cooperator program.--Title

14607 VII of the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978 (7 U.S.C. 5721 et

14608 seq.) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 5721-5723.&gt;&gt; is repealed.

14609 (3) E (kika) de la garza emerging markets program.--

14610 (A) Section 1542 of the Food, Agriculture,

14611 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C 5622 note;

14612 Public Law 101-624) is amended--

14613 (i) by striking subsection (d);

14614 (ii) by redesignating subsections (e) and (f)

14615 as subsections (d) and (e), respectively; and

14616 (iii) in subsection (e) (as so redesignated)--

14617 (I) in the matter preceding

14618 paragraph (1), by striking ``country''

14619 and inserting ``country, foreign

14620 territory, customs union, or other

14621 economic market''; and

14622 (II) in paragraph (1), by striking

14623 ``the economy of the country'' and

14624 inserting ``its economy''.

14625 (B) Section 1543(b)(5) of the Food, Agriculture,

14626 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C.

14627 3293(b)(5))

14628

14629[[Page 132 STAT. 4617]]

14630

14631 is amended by striking ``section 1542(f)'' and inserting

14632 ``section 1542(e)''.

14633 (C) Section 1543A(c)(2) of the Food, Agriculture,

14634 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C.

14635 5679(c)(2)) is amended by inserting ``and section 203(d)

14636 of the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978'' after ``section

14637 1542''.

14638 (4) Technical assistance for specialty crops.--Section 3205

14639 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C.

14640 5680) is repealed.

14654SEC. 3302. FOOD FOR PROGRESS ACT OF 1985.

14655

14656 Section 1110 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (also known as the

14657Food for Progress Act of 1985 (7 U.S.C. 1736o)) is amended--

14658 (1) by striking ``President'' each place it appears and

14659 inserting ``Secretary'';

14660 (2) in subsection (b)--

14661 (A) in paragraph (5)--

14662 (i) by striking ``and'' at the end of

14663 subparagraph (E);

14664 (ii) by redesignating subparagraph (F) as

14665 subparagraph (G); and

14666 (iii) by inserting after subparagraph (E) the

14667 following new subparagraph:

14668 ``(F) a college or university (as such terms are

14669 defined in section 1404(4) of the Food and Agriculture

14670 Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103(4)); and''; and

14671 (B) by adding at the end the following new

14672 paragraphs:

14673 ``(10) Rate of return.--For purposes of applying subsection

14674 (j)(3), the rate of return for an eligible commodity shall be

14675 equal to the proportion that--

14676 ``(A) the proceeds eligible entities generate

14677 through monetization of such commodity, bears to

14678 ``(B) the cost to the Federal Government to procure

14679 and ship the commodity to the country where it is

14680 monetized.

14681 ``(11) Secretary.--The term `Secretary' means the Secretary

14682 of Agriculture.'';

14683 (3) in subsection (f)(3), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

14684 ``2023'';

14685 (4) in subsection (g), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

14686 ``2023'';

14687 (5) in subsection (j)(3)--

14688 (A) by striking ``December 1'' and inserting ``April

14689 1'';

14690 (B) by striking ``of the Senate a list of programs''

14691 and inserting ``of the Senate--

14692

14693[[Page 132 STAT. 4618]]

14694

14695 ``(A) a list of programs'';

14696 (C) by striking ``approved to date for the fiscal

14697 year'' and inserting ``approved during the prior fiscal

14698 year'';

14699 (D) by striking the period at the end and inserting

14700 a semicolon; and

14701 (E) by adding at the end the following new

14702 subparagraphs:

14703 ``(B) a description of the actual rate of return for

14704 each commodity made available under this section for the

14705 previous fiscal year including--

14706 ``(i) factors that influenced the rate of

14707 return; and

14708 ``(ii) with respect to the commodity, the

14709 costs of bagging or further processing, ocean

14710 transportation, inland transportation, storage

14711 costs, and any other information that the

14712 Secretary determines to be necessary; and

14713 ``(C) for each instance in which a commodity was

14714 made available under this section at a rate of return

14715 less than 70 percent, an explanation for the rate of

14716 return realized.''.

14717 (6) in subsection (k), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

14718 ``2023'';

14719 (7) in subsection (l)(1), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

14720 ``2023'';

14721 (8) in the heading of subsection (m), by striking

14722 ``Presidential'' and inserting ``Secretarial'';

14723 (9) in subsection (o), by striking ``(acting through the

14724 Secretary)'';

14725 (10) in subsection (o)(1), by striking ``subparagraphs (C)

14726 and (F)'' and inserting ``subparagraphs (C) and (G)''; and

14727 (11) by adding at the end the following new subsection:.

14728

14729 ``(p) Pilot Agreements.--

14730 ``(1) In general.--For each of fiscal years 2019 through

14731 2023, subject to the availability of appropriations pursuant to

14732 the authorization in paragraph (3), the Secretary shall enter

14733 into 1 or more pilot agreements with 1 or more eligible entities

14734 through which the Secretary shall provide financial assistance

14735 to the eligible entities to carry out activities consistent with

14736 subsection (l)(4)(A).

14737 ``(2) Report required.--In each of fiscal years 2020 through

14738 2024, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture

14739 of the House of Representatives and Committee on Agriculture,

14740 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report describing, with

14741 respect to the previous fiscal year--

14742 ``(A) the amount provided to eligible entities under

14743 each pilot agreement pursuant to paragraph (1) and how

14744 the funds were used;

14745 ``(B) the activities carried out under each pilot

14746 agreement;

14747 ``(C) the number of direct and indirect

14748 beneficiaries of those activities; and

14749 ``(D) the effectiveness of the pilot agreements,

14750 including as applicable the impact on food security and

14751 agricultural productivity.

14752 ``(3) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized

14753 to be appropriated to carry out pilot agreements pursuant to

14754 this subsection $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019

14755 through 2023.''.

14772SEC. 3305. COCHRAN FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM.

14775of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 3293) is amended--

14780 country that the Secretary determines--

14781 ``(A) has sufficient scientific and technical

14782 facilities;

14783 ``(B) has established a partnership with at least

14784 one college or university in the United States; and

14786 members of the United States college or university in

14788 instruction under the fellowship.'';

14791 include agricultural extension services)'' after

14796 ``(A) trade'';

14798 striking the period at the end and inserting ``;

14799 or''; and

14802 United States and regulatory systems governing sanitary

14803 and phytosanitary standards for agricultural products

14804 that--

14805 ``(i) may enter the United States; and

14806 ``(ii) may pose risks to human, animal, or

14807 plant life or health.''; and

14818SEC. 3306. BORLAUG INTERNATIONAL AGRICULTURAL SCIENCE AND

14832 services in eligible countries.''; and

14837 (B) by adding at the end the following:

14839 purposes and programs under this section, the Secretary shall

14840 encourage ongoing engagement with fellowship recipients who have

14841 completed training under the program to provide advice

14842 regarding, and participate in, new or ongoing agricultural

14843 development projects, with a priority for capacity-building

14844 projects.''.

14845SEC. 3307. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 3295.&gt;&gt; INTERNATIONAL AGRICULTURAL

14846 EDUCATION FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM.

14847

14848 (a) Fellowship Program Establishment.--The Secretary shall establish

14849a fellowship program to be known as the International Agricultural

14850Education Fellowship Program to provide fellowships to citizens of the

14851United States to assist eligible countries in developing school-based

14852agricultural education and youth extension programs.

14853 (b) Eligible Country Described.--For purposes of this section, an

14854eligible country is a developing country, as determined by the Secretary

14855using a gross national income per capita test selected by the Secretary.

14856 (c) Purpose of Fellowships.--The goals of providing a fellowship

14857under this section are to--

14858 (1) develop globally minded United States agriculturists

14859 with experience living abroad;

14860 (2) focus on meeting the food and fiber needs of the

14861 domestic population of eligible countries; and

14862 (3) strengthen and enhance trade linkages between eligible

14863 countries and the United States agricultural industry.

14864

14865 (d) Eligible Candidates.--The Secretary may provide fellowships to

14866citizens of the United States who--

14867 (1) hold at least a bachelors degree in an agricultural

14868 related field of study; and

14869 (2) have an understanding of United States school-based

14870 agricultural education and youth extension programs, as

14871 determined by the Secretary.

14872

14873 (e) Candidate Identification.--The Secretary shall consult with the

14874National FFA Organization, the National 4-H Council, and other entities

14875as the Secretary determines are appropriate to identify candidates for

14876fellowships.

14877

14878[[Page 132 STAT. 4621]]

14879

14880 (f) Program Implementation.--The Secretary shall provide for the

14881management, coordination, evaluation, and monitoring of the Fellowship

14882Program, except that the Secretary may contract out the management of

14883the fellowship program to an outside organization with experience in

14884implementing fellowship programs focused on building capacity for

14885school-based agricultural education and youth extension programs in

14886developing countries.

14887 (g) Authorization of Appropriations.--

14888 (1) In general.--There are authorized to be appropriated

14889 $5,000,000 to carry out this section for each of fiscal years

14890 2019 through 2023.

14891 (2) Duration.--Any funds made available under this

14892 subsection shall remain available until expended.

14893SEC. 3308. INTERNATIONAL FOOD SECURITY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.

14894

14895 The Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 is

14896amended by inserting after section 1543A (7 U.S.C. 5679) the following:

14897``SEC. 1543B. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1736dd.&gt;&gt; INTERNATIONAL FOOD SECURITY

14898 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.

14899

14900 ``(a) Definition of International Food Security.--In this section,

14901the term `international food security' means access by any person at any

14902time to food and nutrition that is sufficient for a healthy and

14903productive life.

14904 ``(b) Collection of Information.--The Secretary of Agriculture

14905(referred to in this section as the `Secretary') shall compile

14906information from appropriate mission areas of the Department of

14907Agriculture (including the Food, Nutrition, and Consumer Services

14908mission area) relating to the improvement of international food

14909security.

14910 ``(c) Public Availability.--To benefit programs for the improvement

14911of international food security, the Secretary shall organize the

14912information described in subsection (b) and make the information

14913available in a format suitable for--

14914 ``(1) public education; and

14915 ``(2) use by--

14916 ``(A) a Federal, State, or local agency;

14917 ``(B) an agency or instrumentality of the government

14918 of a foreign country;

14919 ``(C) a domestic or international organization,

14920 including a domestic or international nongovernmental

14921 organization; and

14922 ``(D) an intergovernmental organization.

14923

14924 ``(d) Technical Assistance.--On request by an entity described in

14925subsection (c)(2), the Secretary may provide technical assistance to the

14926entity to implement a program for the improvement of international food

14927security.

14928 ``(e) Program Priority.--In carrying out this section, the Secretary

14929shall give priority to programs relating to the development of food and

14930nutrition safety net systems with a focus on food insecure countries.

14931 ``(f) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be

14932appropriated to carry out this section $1,000,000 for each of fiscal

14933years 2019 through 2023.''.

14934

14935[[Page 132 STAT. 4622]]

14936

14941(7 U.S.C. 1736o-1) is amended--

14944 following: ``that--

14945 ``(1) is'';

14947 the period at the end and inserting ``; or''; and

14948 (C) by adding at the end the following:

14949 ``(2)(A) is produced in and procured from--

14950 ``(i) a developing country that is a recipient

14951 country; or

14952 ``(ii) a developing country in the same region as a

14953 recipient country; and

14954 ``(B) at a minimum, meets each nutritional, quality, and

14955 labeling standard of the recipient country, as determined by the

14956 Secretary.'';

14957 (2) in subsection (c)(2)(A)--

14958 (A) in clause (v)(IV), by striking ``and'' at the

14959 end;

14960 (B) by redesignating clause (vi) as clause (vii);

14961 and

14968 country; and'';

14975 assistance--

14977 timely manner; and

14978 ``(ii) is available when needed throughout the

14979 applicable school year;''; and

14982 inserting ``2023''; and

14983 (B) by adding at the end the following:

14984 ``(4) Purchase of commodities.--Of the funds made available

14985 to carry out this section, not more than 10 percent shall be

14986 used to purchase agricultural commodities described in

14987 subsection (a)(2).''.

14988SEC. 3310. GLOBAL CROP DIVERSITY TRUST.

14989

14991U.S.C. 2220a note; Public Law 110-246) is amended--

14992 (1) by amending subsection (b) to read as follows:

14993

14994 ``(b) United States Contribution Limit.--

14995 ``(1) In general.--The aggregate contributions of funds of

14996 the Federal Government provided to the Trust shall not exceed--

14997

14998[[Page 132 STAT. 4623]]

14999

15000 ``(A) for the period of fiscal years 2014 through

15001 2018, 25 percent of the total amount of funds

15002 contributed to the Trust from all sources; and

15003 ``(B) subject to paragraph (2), effective beginning

15004 with fiscal year 2019, 33 percent of the total amount of

15005 funds contributed to the Trust from all sources.

15006 ``(2) Annual limitation.--The contributions of funds of the

15007 Federal Government provided to the Trust shall not exceed

15008 $5,500,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.''; and

15009 (2) in subsection (c), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

15010 ``2023''.

15011SEC. 3311. LOCAL AND REGIONAL FOOD AID PROCUREMENT PROJECTS.

15012

15013 Section 3206(e)(1) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008

15014(7 U.S.C. 1726c(e)(1)) is amended--

15019SEC. 3312. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 5608.&gt;&gt; FOREIGN TRADE MISSIONS.

15020

15021 (a) Tribal Representation on Trade Missions.--

15022 (1) In general.--The Secretary, in consultation with the

15023 Tribal Advisory Committee established under subsection (b)(2) of

15024 section 309 of the Federal Crop Insurance Reform and Department

15025 of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6921(b)(2))

15026 (as added by section 12303(2)) (referred to in this section as

15027 the ``Advisory Committee''), shall seek--

15028 (A) to support the greater inclusion of Tribal

15029 agricultural and food products in Federal trade-related

15030 activities; and

15031 (B) to increase the collaboration between Federal

15032 trade promotion efforts and other Federal trade-related

15033 activities in support of the greater inclusion sought

15034 under subparagraph (A).

15035 (2) Interdepartmental coordination.--In carrying out

15036 activities to increase the collaboration described in paragraph

15037 (1)(B), the Secretary shall coordinate with--

15038 (A) the Secretary of Commerce;

15039 (B) the Secretary of State;

15040 (C) the Secretary of the Interior; and

15041 (D) the heads of any other relevant Federal

15042 agencies.

15043

15044 (b) Report; Goals.--

15045 (1) Report.--Not later than 2 years after the date of

15046 enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit a report

15047 describing the efforts of the Department of Agriculture and

15048 other Federal agencies under this section to--

15049 (A) the Advisory Committee;

15050 (B) the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

15051 Representatives;

15052 (C) the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the

15053 House of Representatives;

15054 (D) the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and

15055 Forestry of the Senate;

15056 (E) the Committee on Commerce, Science, and

15057 Transportation of the Senate; and

15058 (F) the Committee on Indian Affairs of the Senate.

15059

15060[[Page 132 STAT. 4624]]

15061

15062 (2) Goals.--Not later than 90 days after the date of

15063 enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall establish goals for

15064 measuring, in an objective and quantifiable format, the extent

15065 to which Indian Tribes and Tribal agricultural and food products

15066 are included in the trade-related activities of the Department

15067 of Agriculture.

15068

15071 Subtitle A--Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program

150762008 (7 U.S.C. 2012(o)(1)) is amended by striking ``or house-to-house

15077trade route'' and inserting ``, house-to-house trade route, or online

15078entity''.

15079 (b) Acceptance of Benefits.--Section 7(k) of the Food and Nutrition

15080Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2016(k)) is amended--

15081 (1) by striking the heading and inserting ``Acceptance of

15082 Program Benefits Through Online Transactions'',

15083 (2) in paragraph (4) by striking subparagraph (C), and

15084 (3) by striking paragraph (5).

15085SEC. 4002. RE-EVALUATION OF THRIFTY FOOD PLAN.

15086

15087 Section 3(u) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

150882012(u)) is amended by inserting after the 1st sentence the following:

15089``By 2022 and at 5-year intervals thereafter, the Secretary shall re-

15090evaluate and publish the market baskets of the thrifty food plan based

15091on current food prices, food composition data, consumption patterns, and

15092dietary guidance.''.

15093SEC. 4003. FOOD DISTRIBUTION PROGRAM ON INDIAN RESERVATIONS.

15094

15095 (a) In General.--Section 4(b) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008

15096(7 U.S.C. 2013(b)) is amended--

15097 (1) by striking paragraph (4) and inserting the following:

15098 ``(4) Administrative costs.--

15099 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), the

15100 Secretary shall pay not less than 80 percent of

15101 administrative costs and distribution costs on Indian

15102 reservations as the Secretary determines necessary for

15103 effective administration of such distribution by a State

15104 agency or tribal organization.

15105 ``(B) Waiver.--The Secretary shall waive up to 100

15106 percent of the non-Federal share of the costs described

15107 in subparagraph (A) if the Secretary determines that--

15108 ``(i) the tribal organization is financially

15109 unable to provide a greater non-Federal share of

15110 the costs; or

15111 ``(ii) providing a greater non-Federal share

15112 of the costs would be a substantial burden for the

15113 tribal organization.

15114 ``(C) Limitation.--The Secretary may not reduce any

15115 benefits or services under the food distribution program

15116 on Indian reservations under this subsection to any

15117 tribal

15118

15119[[Page 132 STAT. 4625]]

15120

15121 organization that is granted a waiver under subparagraph

15122 (B).

15123 ``(D) Tribal contribution.--The Secretary may allow

15124 a tribal organization to use funds provided to the

15125 tribal organization through a Federal agency or other

15126 Federal benefit to satisfy all or part of the non-

15127 Federal share of the costs described in subparagraph (A)

15128 if that use is otherwise consistent with the purpose of

15129 the funds.'',

15130 (2) in paragraph (6)--

15131 (A) in the heading by striking ``locally-grown'' and

15132 inserting ``locally- and regionally-grown'',

15133 (B) in subparagraph (A) by striking ``locally-

15134 grown'' and inserting ``locally- and regionally-grown'',

15135 (C) in subparagraph (C)--

15136 (i) in the heading by striking ``locally

15137 grown'' and inserting ``locally- and regionally-

15138 grown'', and

15139 (ii) by striking ``locally-grown'' and

15140 inserting ``locally- and regionally-grown'',

15141 (D) by amending subparagraph (D) to read as follows:

15142 ``(D) Purchase of foods.--In carrying out this

15143 paragraph, the Secretary shall purchase or offer to

15144 purchase those traditional foods that may be procured

15145 cost-effectively.'',

15146 (E) by striking subparagraph (E), and

15147 (F) in subparagraph (F)--

15148 (i) by striking ``(F)'' and inserting ``(E)'',

15149 and

15150 (ii) by striking ``2018'' and inserting

15151 ``2023'', and

15152 (3) by adding at the end the following:

15153 ``(7) Availability of funds.--

15154 ``(A) In general.--Funds made available for a fiscal

15155 year to carry out this subsection shall remain available

15156 for obligation for a period of 2 fiscal years.

15157 ``(B) Administrative costs.--Funds made available

15158 for a fiscal year to carry out paragraph (4) shall

15159 remain available for obligation by the State agency or

15160 tribal organization for a period of 2 fiscal years.''.

15161

15162 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2013 note.&gt;&gt; Demonstration Project for Tribal

15163Organizations.--

15164 (1) Definitions.--In this subsection:

15165 (A) Demonstration project.--The term ``demonstration

15166 project'' means the demonstration project established

15167 under paragraph (2).

15168 (B) Food distribution program.--The term ``food

15169 distribution program'' means the food distribution

15170 program on Indian reservations carried out under section

15171 4(b) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

15172 2013(b)).

15173 (C) Indian reservation.--The term ``Indian

15174 reservation'' has the meaning given the term

15175 ``reservation'' in section 3 of the Food and Nutrition

15176 Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012).

15177 (D) Indian tribe.--The term ``Indian tribe'' has the

15178 meaning given the term in section 4 of the Indian Self-

15179 Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C.

15180 5304).

15181 (E) Self-determination contract.--The term ``self-

15182 determination contract'' has the meaning given the term

15183 in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and

15184 Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304).

15185

15186[[Page 132 STAT. 4626]]

15187

15188 (F) Tribal organization.--The term ``tribal

15189 organization'' has the meaning given the term in section

15190 3 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012).

15191 (2) Establishment.--Subject to the availability of

15192 appropriations, the Secretary shall establish a demonstration

15193 project under which 1 or more tribal organizations may enter

15194 into self-determination contracts to purchase agricultural

15195 commodities under the food distribution program for the Indian

15196 reservation of that tribal organization.

15197 (3) Eligibility.--

15198 (A) Consultation.--The Secretary shall consult with

15199 the Secretary of the Interior and Indian tribes to

15200 determine the process and criteria under which a tribal

15201 organization may participate in the demonstration

15202 project.

15203 (B) Criteria.--The Secretary shall select for

15204 participation in the demonstration project tribal

15205 organizations that--

15206 (i) are successfully administering the food

15207 distribution program of the tribal organization

15208 under section 4(b)(2)(B) of the Food and Nutrition

15209 Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2013(b)(2)(B)),

15210 (ii) have the capacity to purchase

15211 agricultural commodities in accordance with

15212 paragraph (4) for the food distribution program of

15213 the tribal organization, and

15214 (iii) meet any other criteria determined by

15215 the Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary

15216 of the Interior and Indian tribes.

15217 (4) Procurement of agricultural commodities.--Any

15218 agricultural commodities purchased by a tribal organization

15219 under the demonstration project shall--

15220 (A) be domestically produced,

15221 (B) supplant, not supplement, the type of

15222 agricultural commodities in existing food packages for

15223 that tribal organization,

15224 (C) be of similar or higher nutritional value as the

15225 type of agricultural commodities that would be

15226 supplanted in the existing food package for that tribal

15227 organization, and

15228 (D) meet any other criteria determined by the

15229 Secretary.

15230 (5) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date on which

15231 funds are appropriated under paragraph (6) and annually

15232 thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on

15233 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on

15234 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report

15235 describing the activities carried out under the demonstration

15236 project during the preceding year.

15237 (6) Funding.--

15238 (A) Authorization of appropriations.--There is

15239 authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry

15240 out this subsection $5,000,000, to remain available

15241 until expended.

15242 (B) Appropriations in advance.--Only funds

15243 appropriated under subparagraph (A) in advance

15244 specifically to carry out this subsection shall be

15245 available to carry out this subsection.

15246

15247[[Page 132 STAT. 4627]]

15248

15249 (c) Conforming Amendment.--Section 3(v) of the Food and Nutrition

15250Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012(v)) is amended by striking ``the Indian Self-

15251Determination Act (25 U.S.C. 450b(b))'' and inserting ``section 4 of the

15252Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C.

152535304)''.

15254SEC. 4004. SIMPLIFIED HOMELESS HOUSING COSTS.

15255

15256 Section 5(e)(6)(D) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

152572014(e)(6)(D)) is amended--

15258 (1) by redesignating clause (ii) as clause (iii), and

15259 (2) by striking clause (i) and inserting the following:

15260 ``(i) Alternative deduction.--The State agency

15261 shall allow a deduction of $143 a month for

15262 households--

15263 ``(I) in which all members are

15264 homeless individuals;

15265 ``(II) that are not receiving free

15266 shelter throughout the month; and

15267 ``(III) that do not opt to claim an

15268 excess shelter expense deduction under

15269 subparagraph (A).

15270 ``(ii) Adjustment.--For fiscal year 2019 and

15271 each subsequent fiscal year the amount of the

15272 homeless shelter deduction specified in clause (i)

15273 shall be adjusted to reflect changes for the 12-

15274 month period ending the preceding November 30 in

15275 the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers

15276 published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the

15277 Department of Labor.''.

15278SEC. 4005. EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING FOR SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION

15279 ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.

15280

15281 (a) Employment and Training Programs That Meet State and Local

15282Workforce Needs.--Section 6(d)(4) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008

15283(7 U.S.C. 2015(d)(4)) is amended--

15284 (1) in subparagraph (A)--

15285 (A) in clause (i)--

15286 (i) by inserting ``, in consultation with the

15287 State workforce development board, or, if the

15288 State demonstrates that consultation with private

15289 employers or employer organizations would be more

15290 effective or efficient, in consultation with

15291 private employers or employer organizations,''

15292 after ``designed by the State agency'', and

15293 (ii) by striking ``that will increase their

15294 ability to obtain regular employment.'' and

15295 inserting the following: ``that will--

15296 ``(I) increase the ability of the

15297 household members to obtain regular

15298 employment; and

15299 ``(II) meet State or local workforce

15300 needs.'', and

15301 (B) in clause (ii) by inserting ``and implemented to

15302 meet the purposes of clause (i)'' after ``under this

15303 paragraph'',

15304 (2) in subparagraph (B)--

15305 (A) in the matter preceding clause (i), by inserting

15306 ``case management services such as comprehensive intake

15307

15308[[Page 132 STAT. 4628]]

15309

15310 assessments, individualized service plans, progress

15311 monitoring, or coordination with service providers and''

15312 after ``contains'',

15313 (B) in clause (iv) by redesignating subclauses (I)

15314 and (II) as items (aa) and (bb), respectively, and

15315 indenting appropriately,

15316 (C) by redesignating clauses (i) through (vii) and

15317 clause (viii) as subclauses (I) through (VII) and

15318 subclause (IX), respectively, and indenting

15319 appropriately,

15320 (D) by striking subclause (I), as so redesignated,

15321 and inserting the following:

15322 ``(I) Supervised job search programs

15323 that occur at State-approved locations

15324 at which the activities of participants

15325 shall be directly supervised and the

15326 timing and activities of participants

15327 tracked in accordance with guidelines

15328 issued by the State.'',

15329 (E) in subclause (II), as so redesignated, by

15330 striking ``jobs skills assessments, job finding clubs,

15331 training in techniques for'' and inserting

15332 ``employability assessments, training in techniques to

15333 increase'',

15334 (F) in subclause (IV), as so redesignated, in the

15335 first sentence, by inserting ``, including subsidized

15336 employment and apprenticeships'' before the period at

15337 the end,

15338 (G) in subclause (VII), as so redesignated, by

15339 inserting ``not less than 30 days but'' after ``period

15340 of'',

15341 (H) by inserting after subclause (VII), as so

15342 redesignated, the following:

15343 ``(VIII) Programs and activities

15344 under clause (iv) of section 16(h)(1)(F)

15345 that the Secretary determines, based on

15346 results from the independent evaluations

15347 conducted under clause (vii)(I) of such

15348 section, have the most demonstrable

15349 impact on the ability of participants to

15350 find and retain employment that leads to

15351 increased household income and reduced

15352 reliance on public assistance.'',

15353 (I) in the matter preceding subclause (I), as so

15354 redesignated--

15355 (i) by striking ``this subparagraph'' and

15356 inserting ``this clause'', and

15357 (ii) by striking ``(B) For purposes of this

15358 Act, an'' and inserting the following:

15359 ``(B) Definitions.--In this Act:

15360 ``(i) Employment and training program.--The

15361 term'', and

15362 (J) by adding at the end the following:

15363 ``(ii) Workforce partnership.--

15364 ``(I) In general.--The term

15365 `workforce partnership' means a program

15366 that--

15367 ``(aa) is operated by--

15368 ``(AA) a private

15369 employer, an organization

15370 representing private

15371 employers, or a nonprofit

15372 organization providing

15373 services relating to

15374 workforce development; or

15375 ``(BB) an entity

15376 identified as an eligible

15377 provider of training

15378 services under section

15379 122(d) of the Workforce

15380 Innovation and Opportunity

15381 Act (29 U.S.C. 3152(d));

15382

15383[[Page 132 STAT. 4629]]

15384

15385 ``(bb) the Secretary

15386 certifies, or the State agency

15387 certifies to the Secretary--

15388 ``(AA) subject to

15389 subparagraph (N)(ii), would

15390 assist participants who are

15391 members of households

15392 participating in the

15393 supplemental nutrition

15394 assistance program in

15395 gaining high-quality, work-

15396 relevant skills, training,

15397 work, or experience that

15398 will increase the ability of

15399 the participants to obtain

15400 regular employment;

15401 ``(BB) subject to

15402 subparagraph (N)(ii), would

15403 provide participants with

15404 not less than 20 hours per

15405 week of training, work, or

15406 experience under subitem

15407 (AA);

15408 ``(CC) would not use any

15409 funds authorized to be

15410 appropriated by this Act;

15411 ``(DD) would provide

15412 sufficient information, on

15413 request by the State agency,

15414 for the State agency to

15415 determine that participants

15416 who are members of

15417 households participating in

15418 the supplemental nutrition

15419 assistance program are

15420 fulfilling any applicable

15421 work requirement under this

15422 subsection or subsection

15423 (o);

15424 ``(EE) would be willing

15425 to serve as a reference for

15426 participants who are members

15427 of households participating

15428 in the supplemental

15429 nutrition assistance program

15430 for future employment or

15431 work-related programs; and

15432 ``(FF) meets any other

15433 criteria established by the

15434 Secretary, on the condition

15435 that the Secretary shall not

15436 establish any additional

15437 criteria that would impose

15438 significant paperwork

15439 burdens on the workforce

15440 partnership; and

15441 ``(cc) is in compliance with

15442 the Fair Labor Standards Act of

15443 1938 (29 U.S.C. 201 et seq.), if

15444 applicable.

15445 ``(II) Inclusion.--The term

15446 `workforce partnership' includes a

15447 multistate program.'',

15448 (3) in subparagraph (E)--

15449 (A) in the second sentence, by striking ``Such

15450 requirements'' and inserting the following:

15451 ``(ii) Variation.--The requirements under

15452 clause (i)'',

15453 (B) by striking ``(E) Each State'' and inserting the

15454 following:

15455 ``(E) Requirements for participation for certain

15456 individuals.--

15457 ``(i) In general.--Each State'', and

15458 (C) by adding at the end the following:

15459 ``(iii) Application to workforce

15460 partnerships.--To the extent that a State agency

15461 requires an individual to participate in an

15462 employment and training program, the State agency

15463 shall consider an individual participating in a

15464 workforce partnership to be in

15465

15466[[Page 132 STAT. 4630]]

15467

15468 compliance with the employment and training

15469 requirements.'',

15470 (4) in subparagraph (H), by striking ``(B)(v)'' and

15471 inserting ``(B)(i)(V)'', and

15472 (5) by adding at the end the following:

15473 ``(N) Workforce partnerships.--

15474 ``(i) Certification.--In certifying that a

15475 program meets the requirements of subitems (AA)

15476 and (BB) of subparagraph (B)(ii)(I)(bb) to be

15477 certified as a workforce partnership, the

15478 Secretary or the State agency shall require that

15479 the program submit to the Secretary or State

15480 agency sufficient information that describes--

15481 ``(I) the services and activities of

15482 the program that would provide

15483 participants with not less than 20 hours

15484 per week of training, work, or

15485 experience under those subitems; and

15486 ``(II) how the program would provide

15487 services and activities described in

15488 subclause (I) that would directly

15489 enhance the employability or job

15490 readiness of the participant.

15491 ``(ii) Supplement, not supplant.--A State

15492 agency may use a workforce partnership to

15493 supplement, not to supplant, the employment and

15494 training program of the State agency.

15495 ``(iii) Participation.--A State agency--

15496 ``(I) shall--

15497 ``(aa) maintain a list of

15498 workforce partnerships certified

15499 under subparagraph

15500 (B)(ii)(I)(bb); and

15501 ``(bb) not less frequently

15502 than at certification and

15503 recertification, provide to a

15504 household member subject to work

15505 requirements under subsection

15506 (d)(1) or subsection (o),

15507 electronically or by other

15508 means, the list described in

15509 item (aa); but

15510 ``(II) may not require any member of

15511 a household participating in the

15512 supplemental nutrition assistance

15513 program to participate in a workforce

15514 partnership.

15515 ``(iv) Effect.--

15516 ``(I) In general.--A workforce

15517 partnership shall not replace the

15518 employment or training of an individual

15519 not participating in the workforce

15520 partnership.

15521 ``(II) Selection.--Nothing in this

15522 subsection or subsection (o) affects the

15523 criteria or screening process for

15524 selecting participants by a workforce

15525 partnership.

15526 ``(v) Limitation on reporting requirements.--

15527 In carrying out this subparagraph, the Secretary

15528 and each applicable State agency shall limit the

15529 reporting requirements of a workforce partnership

15530 to--

15531 ``(I) on notification that an

15532 individual is receiving supplemental

15533 nutrition assistance program benefits,

15534 notifying the applicable State

15535

15536[[Page 132 STAT. 4631]]

15537

15538 agency that the individual is

15539 participating in the workforce

15540 partnership;

15541 ``(II) identifying participants who

15542 have completed or are no longer

15543 participating in the workforce

15544 partnership;

15545 ``(III) identifying changes to the

15546 workforce partnership that result in the

15547 workforce partnership no longer meeting

15548 the certification requirements of the

15549 Secretary or the State agency under

15550 subparagraph (B)(ii)(I)(bb); and

15551 ``(IV) providing sufficient

15552 information, on request by the State

15553 agency, for the State agency to verify

15554 that a participant is fulfilling any

15555 applicable work requirements under this

15556 subsection or subsection (o).

15557 ``(O) Referral of certain individuals.--

15558 ``(i) In general.--In accordance with such

15559 regulations as may be issued by the Secretary,

15560 with respect to any individual who is not eligible

15561 for an exemption under paragraph (2) and who is

15562 determined by the operator of an employment and

15563 training program component to be ill-suited to

15564 participate in that employment and training

15565 program component, the State agency shall--

15566 ``(I) refer the individual to an

15567 appropriate employment and training

15568 program component;

15569 ``(II) refer the individual to an

15570 appropriate workforce partnership, if

15571 available;

15572 ``(III) reassess the physical and

15573 mental fitness of the individual under

15574 paragraph (1)(A); or

15575 ``(IV) to the maximum extent

15576 practicable, coordinate with other

15577 Federal, State, or local workforce or

15578 assistance programs to identify work

15579 opportunities or assistance for the

15580 individual.

15581 ``(ii) Process.--In carrying out clause (i),

15582 the State agency shall ensure that an individual

15583 undergoing and complying with the process

15584 established under that clause shall not be found

15585 to have refused without good cause to participate

15586 in an employment and training program.''.

15587

15588 (b) Work Requirements.--Section 6(o) of the Food and Nutrition Act

15589of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)) is amended--

15590 (1) in paragraph (1)--

15591 (A) in subparagraph (B) by striking ``and'' at the

15592 end,

15593 (B) in subparagraph (C) by striking ``job search

15594 program or a job search training program.'' and

15595 inserting ``supervised job search program or job search

15596 training program;'', and

15597 (C) by adding at the end the following:

15598 ``(D) a program of employment and training for

15599 veterans operated by the Department of Labor or the

15600 Department of Veterans Affairs, and approved by the

15601 Secretary; and

15602 ``(E) a workforce partnership under subsection

15603 (d)(4)(N).'',

15604 (2) in paragraph (4)(A) by inserting ``and with the support

15605 of the chief executive officer of the State'' after ``agency'',

15606 and

15607

15608[[Page 132 STAT. 4632]]

15609

15610 (3) in paragraph (6)--

15612 exemption'' and inserting ``Exemptions'',

15613 (B) in subparagraph (B) by striking ``(G)'' and

15614 inserting ``(H)'',

15615 (C) in subparagraph (C) by striking ``(E) and (G)''

15620 through 2019'',

15628 as subparagraphs (F), (G), and (H), respectively, and

15630 following:

15632 subparagraphs (F) through (H), for fiscal year 2020 and

15633 each subsequent fiscal year, a State agency may provide

15634 a number of exemptions such that the average monthly

15635 number of exemptions in effect during the fiscal year

15636 does not exceed 12 percent of the number of covered

15637 individuals in the State, as estimated by the Secretary

15638 under subparagraph (C), adjusted by the Secretary to

15639 reflect changes in the State's caseload and the

15640 Secretary's estimate of changes in the proportion of

15641 members of households that receive supplemental

15642 nutrition assistance program benefits covered by waivers

15643 granted under paragraph (4).''.

15644

15645 (c) State Plans.--Section 11 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008

15646(7 U.S.C. 2020) is amended--

15650 and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3111 et seq.),'' before ``and the

15651 basis,'', and
