15653

15654 ``(w) For households containing at least one adult, with no elderly

15655or disabled members and with no earned income at their last

15656certification or required report, a State agency shall, at the time of

15657recertification, be required to advise members of the household not

15658exempt under section 6(d)(2) regarding available employment and training

15659services.''.

15660 (d) Funding of Employment and Training Programs.--Section 16(h) of

15661the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(h)) is amended--

15662 (1) in paragraph (1)--

15663 (A) in subparagraph (A) by striking ``$90,000,000''

15664 and inserting ``$103,900,000'',

15665 (B) in subparagraph (C)--

15666 (i) in clause (i) by inserting ``, subject to

15667 clauses (ii) through (v),'' after ``(B), the

15668 Secretary'', and

15669 (ii) by adding at the end the following:

15670

15671[[Page 132 STAT. 4633]]

15672

15673 ``(iv) Priority.--The Secretary shall

15674 reallocate funds under this subparagraph as

15675 follows:

15676 ``(I)(aa) Subject to items (bb) and

15677 (cc), not less than 50 percent shall be

15678 reallocated to State agencies requesting

15679 such funds to conduct employment and

15680 training programs and activities for

15681 which such State agencies had previously

15682 received funding under subparagraph

15683 (F)(viii) that the Secretary determines

15684 have the most demonstrable impact on the

15685 ability of participants to find and

15686 retain employment that leads to

15687 increased household income and reduced

15688 reliance on public assistance.

15689 ``(bb) The Secretary shall base the

15690 determination under item (aa) on--

15691 ``(AA) project results from

15692 the independent evaluations

15693 conducted under subparagraph

15694 (F)(vii)(I); or

15695 ``(BB) if the project

15696 results from the independent

15697 evaluations conducted under

15698 subparagraph (F)(vii)(I) are not

15699 yet available, the reports under

15700 subparagraph (F)(vii)(II) or

15701 other information relating to

15702 performance of the programs and

15703 activities funded under

15704 subparagraph (F)(viii).

15705 ``(cc) Employment and training

15706 activities funded under this subclause

15707 are not subject to subparagraph

15708 (F)(vii), but are subject to monitoring

15709 under paragraph (h)(5).

15710 ``(II) Not less than 30 percent

15711 shall be reallocated to State agencies

15712 requesting such funds to implement or

15713 continue employment and training

15714 programs and activities under section

15715 6(d)(4)(B)(i) that the Secretary

15716 determines have the most demonstrable

15717 impact on the ability of participants to

15718 find and retain employment that leads to

15719 increased household income and reduced

15720 reliance on public assistance, including

15721 programs and activities that are

15722 targeted to--

15723 ``(aa) individuals 50 years

15724 of age or older;

15725 ``(bb) formerly incarcerated

15726 individuals;

15727 ``(cc) individuals

15728 participating in a substance

15729 abuse treatment program;

15730 ``(dd) homeless individuals;

15731 ``(ee) people with

15732 disabilities seeking to enter

15733 the workforce;

15734 ``(ff) other individuals

15735 with substantial barriers to

15736 employment; or

15737 ``(gg) households facing

15738 multi-generational poverty, to

15739 support employment and workforce

15740 participation through an

15741 integrated and family-focused

15742 approach in providing supportive

15743 services.

15744 ``(III) The Secretary shall

15745 reallocate any remaining funds available

15746 under this subparagraph, to State

15747 agencies requesting such funds to use

15748 for employment and training programs and

15749

15750[[Page 132 STAT. 4634]]

15751

15752 activities that the Secretary determines

15753 have the most demonstrable impact on the

15754 ability of participants to find and

15755 retain employment that leads to

15756 increased household income and reduced

15757 reliance on public assistance under

15758 section 6(d)(4)(B)(i).

15759 ``(v) Consideration.--In reallocating funds

15760 under this subparagraph, a State agency that

15761 receives reallocated funds under clause (iv)(I)

15762 may also be considered for reallocated funding

15763 under clause (iv)(II).'', and

15764 (C) in subparagraph (D) by striking ``$50,000'' and

15765 inserting ``$100,000'', and

15766 (2) in paragraph (5)(B) by adding at the end the following:

15767 ``(v) State option.--The State agency may

15768 report relevant data from a workforce partnership

15769 carried out under section 6(d)(4)(N) to

15770 demonstrate the number of program participants

15771 served by the workforce partnership.''.

15774of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2026(b)) is amended--

15775 (1) by striking paragraph (2), and

15776 (2) by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (2).

15777SEC. 4006. IMPROVEMENTS TO ELECTRONIC BENEFIT TRANSFER SYSTEM.

15778

15779 (a) EBT Portability.--Section 7(f)(5) of the Food and Nutrition Act

15780of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2016(f)(5)) is amended by adding at the end the

15781following:

15782 ``(C) Operation of individual point of sale device

15783 by farmers' markets and direct marketing farmers.--A

15784 farmers' market or direct marketing farmer that is

15785 exempt under paragraph (2)(B)(i) shall be allowed to

15786 operate an individual electronic benefit transfer point

15787 of sale device at more than 1 location under the same

15788 supplemental nutrition assistance program authorization,

15789 if--

15790 ``(i) the farmers' market or direct marketing

15791 farmer provides to the Secretary information on

15792 location and hours of operation at each location;

15793 and

15794 ``(ii)(I) the point of sale device used by the

15795 farmers' market or direct marketing farmer is

15796 capable of providing location information of the

15797 device through the electronic benefit transfer

15798 system; or

15799 ``(II) if the Secretary determines that the

15800 technology is not available for a point of sale

15801 device to meet the requirement under subclause

15802 (I), the farmers' market or direct marketing

15803 farmer provides to the Secretary any other

15804 information, as determined by the Secretary,

15805 necessary to ensure the integrity of transactions

15806 processed using the point of sale device.''.

15807

15808 (b) Modernization of Electronic Benefit Transfer Regulations.--The

158091st sentence of section 7(h)(2) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7

15810U.S.C. 2016(h)(2)) is amended by inserting ``and shall periodically

15811review such regulations and modify such regulations to take into account

15812evolving technology and comparable industry standards'' before the

15813period at the end.

15814 (c) Benefit Recovery.--Section 7(h)(12) of the Food and Nutrition

15815Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2016(h)(12)) is amended--

15816

15817[[Page 132 STAT. 4635]]

15818

15819 (1) in subparagraph (A) by inserting ``, or due to the death

15820 of all members of the household'' after ``inactivity'', and

15821 (2) by striking subparagraphs (B) and (C) and inserting the

15822 following:

15823 ``(B) Benefit storage.--

15824 ``(i) In general.--A State agency may store

15825 recovered electronic benefits off-line in

15826 accordance with clause (ii), if the household has

15827 not accessed the account after 3 months.

15828 ``(ii) Notice of benefit storage.--A State

15829 agency shall--

15830 ``(I) send notice to a household the

15831 benefits of which are stored under

15832 clause (i); and

15833 ``(II) not later than 48 hours after

15834 request by the household, make the

15835 stored benefits available to the

15836 household.

15837 ``(C) Benefit expunging.--

15838 ``(i) In general.--Subject to clause (ii), a

15839 State agency shall expunge benefits that have not

15840 been accessed by a household after a period of 9

15841 months, or upon verification that all members of

15842 the household are deceased.

15843 ``(ii) Notice of benefit expunging.--Not later

15844 than 30 days before benefits are to be expunged

15845 under clause (i), a State agency shall--

15846 ``(I) provide sufficient notice to

15847 the household that benefits will be

15848 expunged due to inactivity, and the date

15849 upon which benefits will be expunged;

15850 ``(II) for benefits stored off-line

15851 in accordance with subparagraph (B),

15852 provide the household an opportunity to

15853 request that such benefits be restored

15854 to the household; and

15855 ``(III) not later than 48 hours

15856 after request by the household, make the

15857 benefits available to the household.''.

15858

15859 (d) Prohibited Fees.--Section 7 of the Food and Nutrition Act of

158602008 (7 U.S.C. 2016) is amended--

15861 (1) by amending subsection (h)(13) to read as follows:

15862 ``(13) Fees.--

15863 ``(A) Interchange fees.--No interchange fees shall

15864 apply to electronic benefit transfer transactions under

15865 this subsection.

15866 ``(B) Other fees.--Effective through fiscal year

15867 2023, neither a State, nor any agent, contractor, or

15868 subcontractor of a State who facilitates the provision

15869 of supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits in

15870 such State may impose a fee for switching (as defined in

15871 subsection (j)(1)(H)) or routing such benefits.'', and

15872 (2) by amending subsection (j)(1)(H) to read as follows:

15873 ``(H) Switching.--The term `switching' means the

15874 routing of an intrastate or interstate transaction that

15875 consists of transmitting the details of a transaction

15876 electronically recorded through the use of an electronic

15877 benefit transfer card in one State to the issuer of the

15878 card that may be in the same or different State.''.

15879

15880 (e) Mobile Technologies.--Section 7(h)(14) of the Food and Nutrition

15881Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2016(h)(14)) is amended--

15882

15883[[Page 132 STAT. 4636]]

15884

15885 (1) by amending subparagraph (A) to read as follows:

15886 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), the

15887 Secretary shall authorize the use of mobile technologies

15888 for the purpose of accessing supplemental nutrition

15889 assistance program benefits.'',

15890 (2) in subparagraph (B)--

15891 (A) by striking the heading and inserting

15892 ``Demonstration projects on access of benefits through

15893 mobile technologies'',

15894 (B) by amending clause (i) to read as follows:

15895 ``(i) Demonstration projects.--Before

15896 authorizing implementation of subparagraph (A) in

15897 all States, the Secretary shall approve not more

15898 than 5 demonstration project proposals submitted

15899 by State agencies that will pilot the use of

15900 mobile technologies for supplemental nutrition

15901 assistance program benefits access.'',

15902 (C) in clause (ii)--

15903 (i) in the heading by striking ``Demonstration

15904 projects'' and inserting ``Project requirements'',

15905 (ii) by striking ``retail food store'' the

15906 first place it appears and inserting ``State

15907 agency'',

15908 (iii) by striking ``includes'',

15909 (iv) by striking subclauses (I), (II), (III),

15910 and (IV), and inserting the following:

15911 ``(I) provides recipient protections

15912 regarding privacy, ease of use,

15913 household access to benefits, and

15914 support similar to the protections

15915 provided under existing methods;

15916 ``(II) ensures that all recipients,

15917 including those without access to mobile

15918 payment technology and those who shop

15919 across State borders, have a means of

15920 benefit access;

15921 ``(III) requires retail food stores,

15922 unless exempt under section 7(f)(2)(B),

15923 to bear the costs of acquiring and

15924 arranging for the implementation of

15925 point-of-sale equipment and supplies for

15926 the redemption of benefits that are

15927 accessed through mobile technologies;

15928 ``(IV) requires that foods purchased

15929 with benefits issued under this section

15930 through mobile technologies are

15931 purchased at a price not higher than the

15932 price of the same food purchased by

15933 other methods used by the retail food

15934 store, as determined by the Secretary;

15935 ``(V) ensures adequate documentation

15936 for each authorized transaction,

15937 adequate security measures to deter

15938 fraud, and adequate access to retail

15939 food stores that accept benefits

15940 accessed through mobile technologies, as

15941 determined by the Secretary;

15942 ``(VI) provides for an evaluation of

15943 the demonstration project, including,

15944 but not limited to, an evaluation of

15945 household access to benefits;

15946 ``(VII) requires that the State

15947 demonstration projects are voluntary for

15948 all retail food stores

15949

15950[[Page 132 STAT. 4637]]

15951

15952 and that all recipients are able to use

15953 benefits in non-participating retail

15954 food stores; and

15955 ``(VIII) meets other criteria as

15956 established by the Secretary.'',

15957 (D) by amending clause (iii) to read as follows:

15958 ``(iv) Date of project approval.--The

15959 Secretary shall solicit and approve the qualifying

15960 demonstration projects required under subparagraph

15961 (B)(i) not later than January 1, 2021.'', and

15962 (E) by inserting after clause (ii) the following:

15963 ``(iii) Priority.--The Secretary may

15964 prioritize demonstration project proposals that

15965 would--

15966 ``(I) reduce fraud;

15967 ``(II) encourage positive

15968 nutritional outcomes; and

15969 ``(III) meet such other criteria as

15970 determined by the Secretary.'', and

15971 (3) in subparagraph (C)(i)--

15972 (A) by striking ``2017'' and inserting ``2022'', and

15973 (B) by inserting ``requires further study by way of

15974 an extended pilot period or'' after ``States'' the 2d

15975 place it appears.

15976

15993 information through the electronic benefit

15994 transfer system to minimize the risk of fraudulent

15995 transactions; and

16031SEC. 4007. REVIEW OF SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM

16032 OPERATIONS.

16033

16034 Section 9 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2018) is

16035amended by adding at the end the following:

16036 ``(i) Review of Program Operations.--

16037 ``(1) Review by the secretary.--The Secretary--

16038 ``(A) shall review a representative sample of

16039 currently authorized facilities referred to in section

16040 3(k)(3) to determine whether benefits are properly used

16041 by or on behalf of participating households residing in

16042 such facilities and whether such facilities are using

16043 more than 1 source of Federal or State funding to meet

16044 the food needs of residents;

16045 ``(B) may carry out similar reviews for currently

16046 participating residential drug and alcohol treatment and

16047 rehabilitation programs, and group living arrangements

16048 for the blind and disabled, referred to in section 3(k);

16049 ``(C) shall gather information, and such facilities,

16050 programs, and arrangements shall be required to submit

16051 information deemed necessary for a full and thorough

16052 review; and

16053 ``(D) shall report the results of these reviews to

16054 the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

16055 Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

16056 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate not later than 18

16057 months after the date of the enactment of the

16058 Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, along with

16059 recommendations regarding--

16060 ``(i) any additional requirements or oversight

16061 that would be appropriate for such facilities,

16062 programs, and arrangements; and

16063 ``(ii) whether such facilities, programs, and

16064 arrangements should continue to be authorized to

16065 participate in the supplemental nutrition

16066 assistance program.

16067 ``(2) Limitation.--Nothing in this subsection shall

16068 authorize the Secretary to deny any application for continued

16069 authorization, any application for authorization, or any request

16070 to withdraw the authorization of any such facility, program, or

16071 arrangement based on a determination that residents of any such

16072 facility or entity are residents of an institution for

16073

16074[[Page 132 STAT. 4639]]

16075

16076 a period of 18 months from the date of enactment of the

16077 Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018.''.

16078SEC. 4008. RETAIL INCENTIVES.

16079

16080 Section 9 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2018), as

16081amended by section 4007, is amended by adding at the end the following:

16082 ``(j) Incentives.--

16083 ``(1) Definition of eligible incentive food.--In this

16084 subsection, the term `eligible incentive food' means--

16085 ``(A) a staple food that is identified for increased

16086 consumption, consistent with the most recent dietary

16087 recommendations; and

16088 ``(B) a fruit, vegetable, dairy, whole grain, or

16089 product thereof.

16090 ``(2) Guidance.--

16091 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall issue

16092 guidance to clarify the process by which an approved

16093 retail food store may seek a waiver to offer an

16094 incentive, which may be used only for the purchase of an

16095 eligible incentive food at the point of purchase, to a

16096 household purchasing food with benefits issued under

16097 this Act.

16098 ``(B) Guidance.--The guidance under subparagraph (A)

16099 shall establish a process under which an approved retail

16100 food store, prior to carrying out an incentive program

16101 under this subsection, shall provide to the Secretary

16102 information describing the incentive program,

16103 including--

16104 ``(i) the types of incentives that will be

16105 offered;

16106 ``(ii) the types of foods that will be

16107 incentivized for purchase; and

16108 ``(iii) an explanation of how the incentive

16109 program intends to support meeting dietary intake

16110 goals.

16111 ``(3) No limitation on benefits.--A waiver granted under

16112 this subsection shall not be used to carry out any activity that

16113 limits the use of benefits under this Act or any other Federal

16114 nutrition law.

16115 ``(4) Effect.--Guidance provided under this subsection shall

16116 not affect any requirements under section 4405 of the Food,

16117 Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 7517), including

16118 the eligibility of a retail food store to participate in a

16119 project funded under such section.

16120 ``(5) Report.--The Secretary shall submit to the Committee

16121 on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee

16122 on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate an annual

16123 report describing the types of incentives approved under this

16124 subsection.''.

16125SEC. 4009. REQUIRED ACTION ON DATA MATCH INFORMATION.

16126

16127 Section 11(e) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

161282020(e)) is amended--

16129 (1) in paragraph (24) by striking ``and'' after the

16130 semicolon,

16131 (2) in paragraph (25) by striking the period at the end and

16132 inserting ``; and'', and

16133 (3) by adding at the end the following:

16134 ``(26) that for a household participating in the

16135 supplemental nutrition assistance program, the State agency

16136 shall pursue clarification and verification, if applicable, of

16137 information relating to the circumstances of the household

16138 received from

16139

16140[[Page 132 STAT. 4640]]

16141

16142 data matches for the purpose of ensuring an accurate eligibility

16143 and benefit determination, only if the information--

16144 ``(A) appears to present significantly conflicting

16145 information from the information that was used by the

16146 State agency at the time of certification of the

16147 household;

16148 ``(B) is obtained from data matches carried out

16149 under subsection (q), (r), or (x); or

16150 ``(C)(i) is less than 60 days old relative to the

16151 current month of participation of the household; and

16152 ``(ii) if accurate, would have been required to be

16153 reported by the household based on the reporting

16154 requirements assigned to the household by the State

16155 agency under section 6(c).''.

161592020(t)) is amended--

16161 Simplified Application and Eligibility Determination Systems and

16162 Improved Access to Benefits'',

16163 (2) in paragraph (1) by striking ``implement--'' and all

16164 that follows through the period at the end, and inserting

16165 ``implement supplemental nutrition assistance program simplified

16166 application and eligibility determination systems.'', and

16167 (3) in paragraph (2)--

16168 (A) by amending subparagraph (B) to read as follows:

16169 ``(B) establishing enhanced technological methods

16170 that improve the administrative infrastructure used in

16171 processing applications and determining eligibility;

16172 or'',

16173 (B) by striking subparagraphs (C) and (D), and

16174 (C) by redesignating subparagraph (E) as

16175 subparagraph (C).

16176SEC. 4011. INTERSTATE DATA MATCHING TO PREVENT MULTIPLE ISSUANCES.

16177

16178 Section 11 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2020), as

16179amended by section 4005(c), is amended by adding at the end the

16180following:

16181 ``(x) National Accuracy Clearinghouse.--

16182 ``(1) Definition of indication of multiple issuance.--In

16183 this subsection, the term `indication of multiple issuance'

16184 means an indication, based on a computer match, that

16185 supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits are being

16186 issued to an individual by more than 1 State agency

16187 simultaneously.

16188 ``(2) Establishment.--

16189 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall establish an

16190 interstate data system, to be known as the `National

16191 Accuracy Clearinghouse', to prevent multiple issuances

16192 of supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits to

16193 an individual by more than 1 State agency

16194 simultaneously.

16195 ``(B) Data matching.--The Secretary shall require

16196 that State agencies make available to the National

16197 Accuracy Clearinghouse only such information as is

16198 necessary for the purpose described in subparagraph (A).

16199 ``(C) Data protection.--The information made

16200 available by State agencies under subparagraph (B)--

16201 ``(i) shall be used only for the purpose

16202 described in subparagraph (A);

16203

16204[[Page 132 STAT. 4641]]

16205

16206 ``(ii) shall be exempt from the disclosure

16207 requirements of section 552(a) of title 5 of the

16208 United States Code pursuant to section 552(b)(3)

16209 of title 5 of the United States Code, to the

16210 extent such information is obtained or received by

16211 the Secretary;

16212 ``(iii) shall not be retained for longer than

16213 is necessary to accomplish the purpose in

16214 subparagraph (A);

16215 ``(iv) shall be used in a manner that protects

16216 the identity and location of a vulnerable

16217 individual (including a victim of domestic

16218 violence) that is an applicant for, or recipient

16219 of, supplemental nutrition assistance program

16220 benefits; and

16221 ``(v) shall meet security standards as

16222 determined by the Secretary.

16223 ``(3) Issuance of interim final regulations.--Not later than

16224 18 months after the date of enactment of the Agriculture

16225 Improvement Act of 2018, the Secretary shall promulgate

16226 regulations (which shall include interim final regulations) to

16227 carry out this subsection that--

16228 ``(A) incorporate best practices and lessons learned

16229 from the pilot program under section 4032(c) of the

16230 Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 2036c(c));

16231 ``(B) require a State agency to take appropriate

16232 action, as determined by the Secretary, with respect to

16233 each indication of multiple issuance of supplemental

16234 nutrition assistance program benefits, or each

16235 indication that an individual receiving such benefits in

16236 1 State has applied to receive such benefits in another

16237 State, while ensuring timely and fair service to

16238 applicants for, and recipients of, such benefits;

16239 ``(C) establish standards to limit and protect the

16240 information submitted through or retained by the

16241 National Accuracy Clearinghouse consistent with

16242 paragraph (2)(C);

16243 ``(D) establish safeguards to protect--

16244 ``(i) the information submitted through or

16245 retained by the National Accuracy Clearinghouse,

16246 including by limiting the period of time that

16247 information is retained to the period necessary to

16248 accomplish the purpose described in paragraph

16249 (2)(A); and

16250 ``(ii) the privacy of information that is

16251 submitted through or retained by the National

16252 Accuracy Clearinghouse consistent with subsection

16253 (e)(8); and

16254 ``(E) include such other rules and standards the

16255 Secretary determines appropriate to carry out this

16256 subsection.

16257 ``(4) Timing.--The initial match and corresponding actions

16258 required by paragraph (3)(B) shall occur within 3 years after

16259 the date of the enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

16260 2018.''.

16261SEC. 4012. REQUIREMENT OF LIVE-PRODUCTION ENVIRONMENTS FOR CERTAIN

16262 PILOT PROJECTS RELATING TO COST SHARING

16263 FOR COMPUTERIZATION.

16264

16265 Section 16(g)(1) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

162662025(g)(1)) is amended--

16267 (1) in subparagraph (F) by redesignating clauses (i) and

16268 (ii) as subclauses (I) and (II), respectively, and indenting

16269 appropriately;

16270

16271[[Page 132 STAT. 4642]]

16272

16273 (2) by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (F) as

16274 clauses (i) through (vi), respectively, and indenting

16275 appropriately;

16276 (3) in the matter preceding clause (i), as so redesignated--

16277 (A) by striking ``paragraphs (2) and (3)'' and

16278 inserting ``paragraph (2)''; and

16279 (B) by striking ``in the planning'' and inserting

16280 the following: ``in the--

16281 ``(A) planning'',

16282 (4) in clause (v), as so redesignated, of subparagraph (A),

16283 as so designated, by striking ``implementation, including

16284 through pilot projects in limited areas for major systems

16285 changes as determined under rules promulgated by the Secretary,

16286 data from which'' and inserting the following: ``implementation,

16287 including a requirement that--

16288 ``(I) such testing shall be

16289 accomplished through pilot projects in

16290 limited areas for major systems changes

16291 (as determined under rules promulgated

16292 by the Secretary);

16293 ``(II) each pilot project described

16294 in subclause (I) that is carried out

16295 before the implementation of a system

16296 shall be conducted in a live-production

16297 environment; and

16298 ``(III) the data resulting from each

16299 pilot project carried out under this

16300 clause'';

16301 (5) in clause (vi), as so redesignated, by striking the

16302 period at end and inserting ``; and'', and

16303 (6) by adding at the end the following:

16304 ``(B) operation of 1 or more automatic data

16305 processing and information retrieval systems that the

16306 Secretary determines may continue to be operated in

16307 accordance with clauses (i) through (vii) of

16308 subparagraph (A).''.

16309SEC. 4013. QUALITY CONTROL IMPROVEMENTS.

16310

16311 (a) Records.--Section 11(a)(3)(B) of the Food and Nutrition Act of

163122008 (7 U.S.C. 2020(a)(3)(B)) is amended--

16313 (1) by striking ``Records described'' and inserting ``All

16314 records, and the entire information systems in which records are

16315 contained, that are covered'', and

16316 (2) by amending clause (i) to read as follows:

16317 ``(i) be made available for inspection and

16318 audit by the Secretary, subject to data and

16319 security protocols agreed to by the State agency

16320 and Secretary;''.

16321

16322 (b) Quality Control System.--Section 16(c)(1)(B) of the Food and

16323Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(c)(1)(B)) is amended to read as

16324follows:

16325 ``(B) Quality control system integrity.--

16326 ``(i) In general.--Not later than 180 days

16327 after the date of enactment of the Agriculture

16328 Improvement Act of 2018, the Secretary shall issue

16329 interim final regulations that--

16330 ``(I) ensure that the quality

16331 control system established under this

16332 subsection produces valid statistical

16333 results;

16334 ``(II) provide for oversight of

16335 contracts entered into by a State agency

16336 for the purpose of improving payment

16337 accuracy;

16338

16339[[Page 132 STAT. 4643]]

16340

16341 ``(III) ensure the accuracy of data

16342 collected under the quality control

16343 system established under this

16344 subsection; and

16345 ``(IV) for each fiscal year, to the

16346 maximum extent practicable, provide for

16347 the evaluation of the integrity of the

16348 quality control process of not fewer

16349 than 2 State agencies, selected in

16350 accordance with criteria determined by

16351 the Secretary.

16352 ``(ii) Debarment.--In accordance with the

16353 nonprocurement debarment procedures under part 417

16354 of title 2, Code of Federal Regulations, or

16355 successor regulations, the Secretary shall debar

16356 any person that, in carrying out the quality

16357 control system established under this subsection,

16358 knowingly submits, or causes to be submitted,

16359 false information to the Secretary.''.

16360

16361 (c) Reporting Requirements.--The 1st sentence of section 16(c)(4) of

16362the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(c)(4)) is amended by

16363inserting ``, including providing access to applicable State records and

16364the entire information systems in which the records are contained,''

16365after ``necessary''.

16366 (d) State Performance Indicators.--Section 16(d) of the Food and

16367Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(d)) is amended--

16368 (1) by striking the heading and inserting ``State

16369 Performance Indicators'',

16370 (2) in paragraph (2)--

16371 (A) in the heading by striking ``and thereafter''

16372 and inserting ``through 2017'',

16373 (B) in subparagraph (A) by striking ``and each

16374 fiscal year thereafter'' and inserting ``through fiscal

16375 year 2017'', and

16376 (C) in subparagraph (B) by striking ``and each

16377 fiscal year thereafter'' and inserting ``through fiscal

16378 year 2017'', and

16379 (3) by adding at the end the following:

16380 ``(6) Fiscal year 2018 and fiscal years thereafter.--

16381 ``(A) With respect to fiscal year 2018 and each

16382 fiscal year thereafter, the Secretary shall establish,

16383 by regulation, performance criteria relating to--

16384 ``(i) actions taken to correct errors, reduce

16385 rates of error, and improve eligibility

16386 determinations; and

16387 ``(ii) other indicators of effective

16388 administration determined by the Secretary.

16389 ``(B) The Secretary shall not award performance

16390 bonus payments to State agencies in fiscal year 2019 for

16391 fiscal year 2018 performance.''.

16392

16393 (e) Cost Sharing for Computerization.--Section 16(g)(1)(A) of the

16394Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(g)(1)(A)), as amended by

16395section 4012, is amended--

16396 (1) in clause (v)(III) by striking ``and'', and

16397 (2) by adding at the end the following:

16399 for inspection and audit under section

16400 11(a)(3)(B); and''.

16401SEC. 4014. EVALUATION OF CHILD SUPPORT ENFORCEMENT COOPERATION

16402 REQUIREMENTS.

16403

16404 Section 17 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2026) is

16405amended by adding at the end the following:

16406

16407[[Page 132 STAT. 4644]]

16408

16409 ``(m) Evaluation of Child Support Enforcement Cooperation

16410Requirements.--

16411 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary, in consultation with the

16412 Secretary of Health and Human Services, shall conduct an

16413 independent evaluation of a representative sample of States--

16414 ``(A) to assess the implementation and impact of the

16415 eligibility requirements described in subsections (l)

16416 through (n) of section 6 in States that have formerly

16417 implemented or continue to implement those requirements,

16418 and the feasibility of implementing those requirements

16419 in other States;

16420 ``(B) to assess the factors that contributed to the

16421 decision of States that formerly implemented the

16422 eligibility requirements described in each of

16423 subsections (l) through (n) of section 6 to cease such

16424 implementation;

16425 ``(C) to review alternatives to the eligibility

16426 requirements described in each of subsections (l)

16427 through (n) of section 6 that are used by other States

16428 to assist participants in the supplemental nutrition

16429 assistance program to make or receive child support

16430 payments and the effectiveness of those alternatives;

16431 and

16432 ``(D) to evaluate the costs and benefits to

16433 households and to State agencies, of requiring State

16434 agencies to implement each of the eligibility

16435 requirements described in subsections (l) through (n) of

16436 section 6.

16437 ``(2) Evaluation.--The evaluation under paragraph (1) shall

16438 include, to the maximum extent practicable, an assessment of--

16439 ``(A) the manner in which applicable State agencies

16440 implement and enforce the eligibility requirements

16441 described in subparagraph (A) of such paragraph,

16442 including--

16443 ``(i) the procedures used by each State to

16444 determine cooperation, to sanction participants

16445 for failure to cooperate, and to determine good

16446 cause for noncooperation under each of subsections

16447 (l) through (n) of section 6; and

16448 ``(ii) the manner in which each State aligns

16449 the procedures for implementing those eligibility

16450 requirements with procedures for implementing

16451 other Federal programs that require cooperation

16452 with child support enforcement, including the

16453 program of block grants to States for temporary

16454 assistance for needy families established under

16455 part A of title IV of the Social Security Act (42

16456 U.S.C. 601 et seq.), the Medicaid program under

16457 title XIX of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C.

16458 1396 et seq.), and programs carried out under the

16459 Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990

16460 (42 U.S.C. 9857 et seq.);

16461 ``(B) the Federal, State, and local costs associated

16462 with implementing those eligibility requirements,

16463 including costs incurred under this Act and by child

16464 support enforcement agencies for personnel, technology

16465 upgrades, and other costs;

16466 ``(C) the effect of those eligibility requirements

16467 on the establishment of new child support orders, the

16468 establishment of paternity, changes in child support

16469 payments to

16470

16471[[Page 132 STAT. 4645]]

16472

16473 custodial households, and changes in arrears owed on

16474 child support orders;

16475 ``(D) with respect to the eligibility requirements

16476 under each of subsections (l) through (n) of section 6--

16477 ``(i) the number of individuals subject to

16478 those requirements;

16479 ``(ii) the number of individuals in each State

16480 who meet those requirements; and

16481 ``(iii) the number of individuals in each

16482 State who fail to meet those requirements;

16483 ``(E) the number of individuals in each State for

16484 whom good cause for noncooperation has been found under

16485 section 6(l)(2);

16486 ``(F) the impact of those eligibility requirements

16487 on the supplemental nutrition assistance program

16488 eligibility, benefit levels, food security, income, and

16489 economic stability of--

16490 ``(i) individuals subject to those

16491 requirements;

16492 ``(ii) the household members of those

16493 individuals, including children; and

16494 ``(iii) households with nontraditional family

16495 structures, including a household in which a

16496 grandparent is the primary caretaker of a

16497 grandchild of the grandparent.

16498 ``(3) State agency cooperation.--Each State agency selected

16499 under paragraph (1) shall provide information to the Secretary

16500 necessary to conduct the evaluation under such paragraph.

16501 ``(4) Report.--Not later than 3 years after the date of

16502 enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, the

16503 Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the

16504 House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

16505 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report describing the

16506 findings from the evaluation conducted under paragraph (1).''.

16507SEC. 4015. LONGITUDINAL DATA FOR RESEARCH.

16508

16509 (a) Longitudinal Data.--Section 17 of the Food and Nutrition Act of

165102008 (7 U.S.C. 2026), as amended by section 4014, is amended by adding

16511at the end the following:

16512 ``(n) Longitudinal Data for Research.--

16513 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraphs (3) through (5), a

16514 State agency may, on approval by the Secretary, establish a

16515 longitudinal database that contains information about households

16516 and members of households that receive benefits under the

16517 supplemental nutrition assistance program in the State.

16518 ``(2) Purpose.--Each longitudinal database established under

16519 paragraph (1) shall be used solely to conduct research on

16520 participation in and the operation of the supplemental nutrition

16521 assistance program, including duration of participation in the

16522 program.

16523 ``(3) Requirements for databases.--Prior to the approval of

16524 State agencies to establish longitudinal databases under

16525 paragraph (1), the Secretary shall--

16526

16527[[Page 132 STAT. 4646]]

16528

16529 ``(A) identify features that shall be standard

16530 across States such as database format to facilitate use

16531 of longitudinal databases established under paragraph

16532 (1) for research purposes;

16533 ``(B) identify features of longitudinal databases

16534 established under paragraph (1) that may vary across

16535 States;

16536 ``(C) identify a procedure for States operating

16537 longitudinal databases under paragraph (1) to use a

16538 unique identifier to provide relevant information on

16539 household members who receive benefits under the

16540 supplemental nutrition assistance program for the

16541 purpose of comparing participation data in multiple

16542 participating States over time while protecting

16543 participant privacy;

16544 ``(D) establish the manner in which data security

16545 and privacy protections, as required by Federal law and

16546 consistent with other appropriate practices, shall be

16547 implemented and maintained;

16548 ``(E) provide direction to State agencies on the

16549 responsibilities of and funding arrangements for State

16550 agencies and any State contractors (including entities

16551 providing technical assistance) relating to the

16552 establishment and operation of a longitudinal database;

16553 ``(F) provide a description of the documentation

16554 that States shall submit to the Secretary prior to

16555 allowing researchers access to a longitudinal database;

16556 ``(G) consult with other Federal research agencies,

16557 including the Bureau of the Census;

16558 ``(H) consult with States that have already

16559 established databases used for purposes similar to the

16560 purposes outlined in this subsection; and

16561 ``(I) identify any other requirements determined

16562 appropriate by the Secretary.

16563 ``(4) Included data.--

16564 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), each

16565 longitudinal database established under paragraph (1)--

16566 ``(i) shall include monthly information about

16567 households and members of households that receive

16568 benefits under the supplemental nutrition

16569 assistance program in the participating State

16570 taken from existing information collected by the

16571 State agency including, if available,--

16572 ``(I) demographic characteristics;

16573 ``(II) income and financial

16574 resources (as described in section

16575 5(g));

16576 ``(III) employment status;

16577 ``(IV) household circumstances, such

16578 as deductible expenses; and

16579 ``(V) the amount of the monthly

16580 allotment received under the

16581 supplemental nutrition assistance

16582 program; and

16583 ``(ii) may include information from other

16584 State data sources such as--

16585 ``(I) earnings and employment data

16586 from the State department of labor;

16587 ``(II) health insurance program

16588 data; or

16589 ``(III) data from participation in

16590 other programs administered by the

16591 State.

16592

16593[[Page 132 STAT. 4647]]

16594

16595 ``(B) Data protection.--Any State that establishes a

16596 longitudinal database under paragraph (1) shall, in

16597 accordance with all applicable Federal and State privacy

16598 standards and requirements--

16599 ``(i) protect the privacy of information about

16600 each member of each household that receives

16601 benefits under the supplemental nutrition

16602 assistance program in such State by ensuring that

16603 no personally identifiable information (including

16604 social security number, home address, or contact

16605 information) is included in the longitudinal

16606 database; and

16607 ``(ii) make the data under this paragraph

16608 available to researchers and the Secretary.

16609 ``(5) Approval.--The Secretary shall approve the

16610 establishment of longitudinal databases under paragraph (1) in

16611 States that--

16612 ``(A) meet the requirements for databases under

16613 paragraph (3) and (4)(B);

16614 ``(B) reflect a range of participant numbers,

16615 demographics, operational structures, and geographic

16616 regions; and

16617 ``(C) have the capacity to provide on a periodic and

16618 ongoing basis household and participant data derived

16619 from the eligibility system and other data sources of

16620 the State.

16621 ``(6) Grants.--

16622 ``(A) In general.--In carrying out this subsection,

16623 the Secretary may provide grants to States that have

16624 been approved by the Secretary in accordance with

16625 paragraph (5) out of funds made available under

16626 paragraph (9).

16627 ``(B) Method of awarding grants.--Grants awarded

16628 under this paragraph shall be made in such amounts and

16629 under such terms and conditions as the Secretary

16630 determines necessary to carry out the purposes of this

16631 subsection.

16632 ``(7) Report.--

16633 ``(A) In general.--Not later than 4 years after the

16634 effective date of this subsection, the Secretary shall

16635 submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

16636 Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

16637 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report on the

16638 feasibility of expanding implementation of longitudinal

16639 databases to every State.

16640 ``(B) Contents.--The report required under

16641 subparagraph (A) shall describe--

16642 ``(i) the cost of expanding implementation of

16643 longitudinal databases with consistent data to

16644 every State;

16645 ``(ii) the challenges and benefits of using

16646 State longitudinal databases with consistent data;

16647 and

16648 ``(iii) alternatives to expanding

16649 implementation of longitudinal databases with

16650 consistent data to every State that may achieve

16651 similar research outcomes and the advantages and

16652 disadvantages of those alternatives.

16653 ``(8) Effect.--Nothing in this subsection shall be construed

16654 to prevent or limit the ability of State agencies to establish

16655

16656[[Page 132 STAT. 4648]]

16657

16658 or continue operating databases used for purposes similar to the

16659 purposes outlined in this subsection.

16660 ``(9) Funding.--Of the funds made available under section

16661 18, the Secretary shall use to carry out this subsection--

16662 ``(A) $20,000,000 for fiscal year 2019 to remain

16663 available through fiscal year 2021; and

16664 ``(B) $5,000,000 for fiscal year 2022 and each

16665 fiscal year thereafter.''.

16666

16667 (b) Conforming Amendment.--The 1st sentence of section 16(a) of the

16668Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 is amended--

16669 (1) by striking ``and (8)'' and inserting ``(8)''; and

16670 (2) by inserting ``, and (9) establishing and operating a

16671 longitudinal database in accordance with section 17(n)'' before

16672 ``: Provided''.

16673SEC. 4016. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

16674

16675 The 1st sentence of section 18(a)(1) of the Food and Nutrition Act

16676of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2027(a)(1)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and

16677inserting ``2023''.

16678SEC. 4017. ASSISTANCE FOR COMMUNITY FOOD PROJECTS.

16679

16680 Section 25(b)(2) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

166812034(b)(2)) is amended--

16682 (1) in subparagraph (B) by striking ``and'' at the end,

16683 (2) in subparagraph (C) by striking ``fiscal year 2015 and

16684 each fiscal year thereafter.'' and inserting ``each of fiscal

16685 years 2015 through 2018; and'', and

16686 (3) by adding at the end the following:

16687 ``(D) $5,000,000 for fiscal year 2019 and each

16688 fiscal year thereafter.''.

16689SEC. 4018. EMERGENCY FOOD ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.

16690

16691 (a) State Plan.--Section 202A(b) of the Emergency Food Assistance

16692Act of 1983 (7 U.S.C. 7503(b)) is amended--

16693 (1) in paragraph (3), by striking ``and'' after the

16694 semicolon;

16695 (2) in paragraph (4), by striking the period at the end and

16696 inserting a semicolon; and

16697 (3) by adding at the end the following:

16698 ``(5) at the option of the State agency, describe a plan of

16699 operation for 1 or more projects in partnership with 1 or more

16700 emergency feeding organizations located in the State to harvest,

16701 process, package, or transport donated commodities received

16702 under section 203D(d); and

16703 ``(6) describe a plan, which may include the use of a State

16704 advisory board established under subsection (c), that provides

16705 emergency feeding organizations or eligible recipient agencies

16706 within the State an opportunity to provide input on the

16707 commodity preferences and needs of the emergency feeding

16708 organization or eligible recipient agency.''.

16709

16710 (b) State and Local Supplementation of Commodities.--Section 203D of

16711the Emergency Food Assistance Act of 1983 (7 U.S.C. 7507) is amended by

16712adding at the end the following:

16713 ``(d) Projects to Harvest, Process, Package, or Transport Donated

16714Commodities.--

16715 ``(1) Definition of project.--In this subsection, the term

16716 `project' means the harvesting, processing, packaging, or

16717 transportation of unharvested, unprocessed, or unpackaged

16718 commodities donated by agricultural producers, processors, or

16719

16720[[Page 132 STAT. 4649]]

16721

16722 distributors for use by emergency feeding organizations under

16723 subsection (a).

16724 ``(2) Federal funding for projects.--

16725 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraphs (B) and

16726 (C) and paragraph (3), using funds made available under

16727 paragraph (5), the Secretary may provide funding to

16728 States to pay for the costs of carrying out a project.

16729 ``(B) Federal share.--The Federal share of the cost

16730 of a project under subparagraph (A) shall not exceed 50

16731 percent of the total cost of the project.

16732 ``(C) Allocation.--

16733 ``(i) In general.--Each fiscal year, the

16734 Secretary shall allocate the funds made available

16735 under subparagraph (A), based on a formula

16736 determined by the Secretary, to States that have

16737 submitted a State plan describing a plan of

16738 operation for a project under section 202A(b)(5).

16739 ``(ii) Reallocation.--If the Secretary

16740 determines that a State will not expend all of the

16741 funds allocated to the State for a fiscal year

16742 under clause (i), the Secretary shall reallocate

16743 the unexpended funds to other States that have

16744 submitted under section 202A(b)(5) a State plan

16745 describing a plan of operation for a project

16746 during that fiscal year or the subsequent fiscal

16747 year, as the Secretary determines appropriate.

16748 ``(iii) Reports.--Each State to which funds

16749 are allocated for a fiscal year under this

16750 subparagraph shall, on a regular basis, submit to

16751 the Secretary financial reports describing the use

16752 of the funds.

16753 ``(3) Project purposes.--A State may only use Federal funds

16754 received under paragraph (2) for a project the purposes of which

16755 are--

16756 ``(A) to reduce food waste at the agricultural

16757 production, processing, or distribution level through

16758 the donation of food;

16759 ``(B) to provide food to individuals in need; and

16760 ``(C) to build relationships between agricultural

16761 producers, processors, and distributors and emergency

16762 feeding organizations through the donation of food.

16763 ``(4) Cooperative agreements.--The Secretary may encourage a

16764 State agency that carries out a project using Federal funds

16765 received under paragraph (2) to enter into cooperative

16766 agreements with State agencies of other States under section

16767 203B(d) to maximize the use of commodities donated under the

16768 project.

16769 ``(5) Funding.--Out of funds not otherwise appropriated, the

16770 Secretary of the Treasury shall transfer to the Secretary to

16771 carry out this subsection $4,000,000 for each of fiscal years

16772 2019 through 2023, to remain available until the end of the

16773 subsequent fiscal year.''.

16774

16775 (c) Food Waste.--Section 203D of the Emergency Food Assistance Act

16776of 1983 (7 U.S.C. 7507), as amended by subsection (b), is amended by

16777adding at the end the following:

16778 ``(e) Food Waste.--The Secretary shall issue guidance outlining best

16779practices to minimize the food waste of the commodities donated under

16780subsection (a).''.

16781

16782[[Page 132 STAT. 4650]]

16783

16784 (d) Emergency Food Program Infrastructure Grants.--Section 209(d) of

16785the Emergency Food Assistance Act of 1983 (7 U.S.C. 7511a(d)) is amended

16786by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

16787 (e) Availability of Commodities for the Emergency Food Assistance

16788Program.--Section 27(a) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

167892036(a)) is amended--

16790 (1) in paragraph (1), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

16791 ``2023''; and

16792 (2) in paragraph (2)--

16793 (A) in subparagraph (C), by striking ``2018'' and

16794 inserting ``2023'';

16795 (B) in subparagraph (D)--

16796 (i) in the matter preceding clause (i), by

16797 striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023'';

16798 (ii) in clause (iii), by striking ``and''

16799 after the semicolon;

16800 (iii) in clause (iv), by striking ``and''

16801 after the semicolon;

16802 (iv) by adding at the end the following:

16803 ``(v) for fiscal year 2019, $23,000,000;

16804 ``(vi) for fiscal year 2020, $35,000,000;

16805 ``(vii) for fiscal year 2021, $35,000,000;

16806 ``(viii) for fiscal year 2022, $35,000,000;

16807 and

16808 ``(ix) for fiscal year 2023, $35,000,000;

16809 and''; and

16810 (C) in subparagraph (E)--

16811 (i) by striking ``2019'' and inserting

16812 ``2024'';

16814 ``(D)(ix)''; and

16815 (iii) by striking ``June 30, 2017'' and

16816 inserting ``June 30, 2023''.

16817SEC. 4019. NUTRITION EDUCATION.

16818

16819 Section 28(c) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

168202036a(c)) is amended--

16821 (1) in paragraph (2)--

16822 (A) in subparagraph (B)--

16823 (i) in the matter preceding clause (i), by

16824 striking ``Except as provided in subparagraph (C),

16825 a'' and inserting ``A'',

16826 (ii) in clause (ii) by striking ``and'' after

16827 the semicolon,

16828 (iii) by redesignating clause (iii) as clause

16829 (iv), and

16830 (iv) by inserting after clause (ii) the

16831 following:

16832 ``(iii) describe how the State agency shall

16833 use an electronic reporting system to--

16834 ``(I) measure and evaluate the

16835 projects; and

16836 ``(II) account for the allowable

16837 State agency administrative costs

16838 including for--

16839 ``(aa) salaries and benefits

16840 of State agency personnel;

16841 ``(bb) office supplies and

16842 equipment;

16843 ``(cc) travel costs;

16844 ``(dd) development and

16845 production of nutrition

16846 education materials;

16847 ``(ee) memberships,

16848 subscriptions, and professional

16849 activities;

16850

16851[[Page 132 STAT. 4651]]

16852

16853 ``(ff) lease or rental

16854 costs;

16855 ``(gg) maintenance and

16856 repair expenses;

16857 ``(hh) indirect costs; and

16858 ``(ii) cost of using

16859 publicly-owned building space;

16860 and'', and

16861 (B) by striking subparagraph (C),

16862 (2) in paragraph (3)(B) in the matter preceding clause (i),

16863 by inserting ``, the Director of the National Institute of Food

16864 and Agriculture,'' before ``and outside stakeholders'',

16865 (3) in paragraph (5) by inserting ``the expanded food and

16866 nutrition education program or'' before ``other health

16867 promotion'', and

16868 (4) by adding at the end the following:

16869 ``(6) Information clearinghouse.--The Secretary shall

16870 establish an online clearinghouse that makes available to State

16871 agencies, local agencies, institutions of higher education, and

16872 community organizations best practices for planning,

16873 implementing, and evaluating nutrition education and obesity

16874 prevention services to ensure that projects carried out with

16875 funds received under this section are appropriate for the target

16876 population.

16877 ``(7) Technical assistance.--The Secretary shall provide

16878 technical assistance to a State agency in developing and

16879 implementing a nutrition education State plan, including--

16880 ``(A) by identifying common challenges faced by

16881 entities described in paragraph (6) that participate in

16882 projects carried out with funds received under this

16883 section;

16884 ``(B) by coordinating efforts to address those

16885 common challenges;

16886 ``(C) by collecting and disseminating information on

16887 evidence-based practices relating to nutrition education

16888 and obesity prevention;

16889 ``(D) by facilitating communication between and

16890 among grantees and subgrantees of funds received under

16891 this section;

16892 ``(E) by assisting State agencies in creating or

16893 maintaining systems to compile program data; and

16894 ``(F) by performing or assisting with other

16895 activities, as determined by the Secretary.

16896 ``(8) Annual state report.--Each State agency that delivers

16897 nutrition education and obesity prevention services under this

16898 subsection shall submit to the Secretary an annual report, which

16899 shall be made publicly available by the Secretary, that

16900 includes--

16901 ``(A) the use of funds on the State agency's

16902 program, including for each category of allowable State

16903 agency administrative costs identified in paragraph

16904 (2)(B)(iii)(II);

16905 ``(B) a description of each project carried out by

16906 that agency under this subsection, including, with

16907 respect to the project, the target population,

16908 interventions, educational materials used, key

16909 performance indicators used, and evaluations made;

16910 ``(C) a comprehensive analysis of the impacts and

16911 outcomes--

16912 ``(i) of the project, including with respect

16913 to the elements described in subparagraph (A); and

16914

16915[[Page 132 STAT. 4652]]

16916

16917 ``(ii) to the extent practicable, of completed

16918 multiyear projects; and

16919 ``(D) the status of any ongoing multiyear project.

16920 ``(9) Annual federal report.--The Administrator of the Food

16921 and Nutrition Service, in consultation with the Director of the

16922 National Institute of Food and Agriculture, shall annually

16923 submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

16924 Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and

16925 Forestry of the Senate a report that--

16926 ``(A) evaluates the level of coordination between--

16927 ``(i) the nutrition education and obesity

16928 prevention grant program under this section;

16929 ``(ii) the expanded food and nutrition

16930 education program under section 1425 of the

16931 National Agricultural Research, Extension, and

16932 Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3175); and

16933 ``(iii) any other nutrition education program

16934 administered by the Department of Agriculture; and

16935 ``(B) includes the use of funds on such programs

16936 including State agency administrative costs reported by

16937 States under paragraph (8)(A).''.

16938SEC. 4020. RETAIL FOOD STORE AND RECIPIENT TRAFFICKING.

16939

16940 Section 29(c)(1) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

169412036b(c)(1)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

16942SEC. 4021. PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIPS.

16943

16944 The Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.) is

16945amended by adding at the end the following:

16946``SEC. 30. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2036d.&gt;&gt; PILOT PROJECTS TO ENCOURAGE THE

16947 USE OF PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIPS COMMITTED

16948 TO ADDRESSING FOOD INSECURITY.

16949

16950 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary may, on application of eligible

16951entities, approve not more than 10 pilot projects to support public-

16952private partnerships that address food insecurity and poverty.

16953 ``(b) Definitions.--For purposes of this section--

16954 ``(1) the term `eligible entity' means--

16955 ``(A) a nonprofit organization;

16956 ``(B) a community-based organization;

16957 ``(C) an institution of higher education; or

16958 ``(D) a private entity, as determined by the

16959 Secretary; and

16960 ``(2) the term `public agency' means a department, agency,

16961 other unit, or instrumentality of Federal, State, or local

16962 government.

16963

16964 ``(c) Project Requirements.--Projects approved under this section

16965shall--

16966 ``(1) be limited to 2 years in length; and

16967 ``(2) include a collaboration between one or more public

16968 agencies and one or more eligible entities that--

16969 ``(A) improves the effectiveness and impact of the

16970 supplemental nutrition assistance program;

16971 ``(B) develops food security solutions that are

16972 specific to the needs of a community or region; and

16973 ``(C) strengthens the capacity of communities to

16974 address food insecurity and poverty.

16975

16976[[Page 132 STAT. 4653]]

16977

16978 ``(d) Evaluation.--The Secretary shall provide for an independent

16979evaluation of pilot projects approved under this section that includes--

16980 ``(1) a summary of the activities conducted under the pilot

16981 projects;

16982 ``(2) an assessment of the effectiveness of the pilot

16983 projects; and

16984 ``(3) best practices regarding the use of public-private

16985 partnerships to improve the effectiveness of public benefit

16986 programs to address food insecurity and poverty.

16987

16988 ``(e) Funding.--

16989 ``(1) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized

16990 to be appropriated to carry out this section $5,000,000 to

16991 remain available until expended.

16992 ``(2) Appropriation in advance.--Only funds appropriated

16993 under paragraph (1) in advance specifically to carry out this

16994 section shall be available to carry out this section.''.

16996

16997 The Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.) is

16998amended--

16999 (1) in section 3--

17000 (A) in subsections (d) and (i) by striking ``7(i)''

17001 and inserting ``7(h)'', and

17002 (B) in subsection (o)(1)(A) by striking ``(r)(1)''

17003 and inserting ``(q)(1)'',

17004 (2) in section 5(a) by striking ``and section'' each place

17005 it appears and all that follows through ``households'' the

17006 respective next place it appears, and inserting ``and section

17007 3(m)(4), households'',

17008 (3) in subsections (e)(1) and (f)(1)(A)(i) of section 8 by

17009 striking ``3(n)(5)'' and inserting ``3(m)(5)'',

17010 (4) in the 1st sentence of section 10--

17011 (A) by striking ``or the Federal Savings and Loan

17012 Insurance Corporation'' each place it appears, and

17013 (B) by striking ``3(p)(4)'' and inserting

17014 ``3(o)(4)'',

17015 (5) in section 11--

17016 (A) in subsection (a)(2) by striking ``3(t)(1)'' and

17017 inserting ``3(s)(1)'', and

17018 (B) in subsection (d)--

17019 (i) by striking ``3(t)(1)'' each place it

17020 appears and inserting ``3(s)(1)'', and

17021 (ii) by striking ``3(t)(2)'' each place it

17022 appears and inserting ``3(s)(2)'', and

17023 (C) in subsection (e)--

17024 (i) in paragraph (17) by striking ``3(t)(1)''

17025 inserting ``3(s)(1)'', and

17026 (ii) in paragraph (23) by striking

17027 ``Simplified Supplemental Nutrition Assistance

17028 Program'' and inserting ``simplified supplemental

17029 nutrition assistance program'',

17030 (6) in section 15(e) by striking ``exchange'' and all that

17031 follows through ``anything'', and inserting ``exchange for

17032 benefits, or anything'',

17033 (7) in section 17(b)(1)(B)(iv)(III)(aa) by striking ``3(n)''

17034 and inserting ``3(m)'',

17035

17036[[Page 132 STAT. 4654]]

17037

17038 (8) in section 25(a)(1)(B)(i)(I) by striking the 2d

17039 semicolon at the end, and

17040 (9) in section 26(b) by striking ``out'' and all that

17041 follows through ``(referred'', and inserting ``out a simplified

17042 supplemental nutrition assistance program (referred''.

17043

17044 Subtitle B--Commodity Distribution Programs

17045

17046SEC. 4101. COMMODITY DISTRIBUTION PROGRAM.

17047

17048 The 1st sentence of section 4(a) of the Agriculture and Consumer

17049Protection Act of 1973 (7 U.S.C. 612c note) is amended by striking

17050``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

17051SEC. 4102. COMMODITY SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD PROGRAM.

17052

17053 Section 5 of the Agriculture and Consumer Protection Act of 1973 (7

17054U.S.C. 612c note; Public Law 93-86) is amended--

17055 (1) in subsection (a)--

17056 (A) in paragraph (1) by striking ``2018'' and

17057 inserting ``2023'', and

17058 (B) in paragraph (2)(B), in the matter preceding

17059 clause (i), by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023'',

17060 (2) in subsection (d)(2), in the 1st sentence, by striking

17061 ``2018'' and inserting ``2023'', and

17062 (3) in subsection (g)--

17063 (A) by striking ``Except'' and inserting the

17064 following:

17065 ``(1) In general.--Except'', and

17066 (B) by adding at the end the following:

17067 ``(2) Certification.--

17068 ``(A) Definition of certification period.--In this

17069 paragraph, the term `certification period' means the

17070 period during which a participant in the commodity

17071 supplemental food program in a State may continue to

17072 receive benefits under the commodity supplemental food

17073 program without a formal review of the eligibility of

17074 the participant.

17075 ``(B) Minimum certification period.--Subject to

17076 subparagraphs (C) and (D), a State shall establish for

17077 the commodity supplemental food program of the State a

17078 certification period of--

17079 ``(i) not less than 1 year; but

17080 ``(ii) not more than 3 years.

17081 ``(C) Temporary certification.--An eligible

17082 applicant for the commodity supplemental food program in

17083 a State may be provided with a temporary monthly

17084 certification to fill any caseload slot resulting from

17085 nonparticipation by certified participants.

17086 ``(D) Approvals.--A certification period of more

17087 than 1 year established by a State under subparagraph

17088 (B) shall be subject to the approval of the Secretary,

17089 who shall approve such a certification period on the

17090 condition that, with respect to each participant

17091 receiving benefits under the commodity supplemental food

17092 program of the State, the local agency in the State

17093 administering the commodity supplemental food program,

17094 on an annual basis during the certification period

17095 applicable to the participant--

17096

17097[[Page 132 STAT. 4655]]

17098

17099 ``(i) verifies the address and continued

17100 interest of the participant; and

17101 ``(ii) has sufficient reason to determine that

17102 the participant still meets the income eligibility

17103 standards under paragraph (1), which may include a

17104 determination that the participant has a fixed

17105 income.''.

17106SEC. 4103. DISTRIBUTION OF SURPLUS COMMODITIES TO SPECIAL

17107 NUTRITION PROJECTS.

17108

17109 Section 1114(a)(2)(A) of the Agriculture and Food Act of 1981 (7

17110U.S.C. 1431e(a)(2)(A)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

17111``2023''.

17112SEC. 4104. FOOD DONATION STANDARDS.

17113

17114 Section 203D of the Emergency Food Assistance Act of 1983 (7 U.S.C.

171157507), as amended by section 4018(c), is amended by adding at the end

17116the following:

17117 ``(f) Food Donation Standards.--

17118 ``(1) Definitions.--In this subsection:

17119 ``(A) Apparently wholesome food.--The term

17120 `apparently wholesome food' has the meaning given the

17121 term in section 22(b) of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966

17122 (42 U.S.C. 1791(b)).

17123 ``(B) Institution of higher education.--The term

17124 `institution of higher education' has the meaning given

17125 the term in section 102 of the Higher Education Act of

17126 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1002).

17127 ``(C) Qualified direct donor.--The term `qualified

17128 direct donor' means a retail food store, wholesaler,

17129 agricultural producer, restaurant, caterer, school food

17130 authority, or institution of higher education.

17131 ``(2) Guidance.--

17132 ``(A) In general.--Not later than 180 days after the

17133 date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

17134 2018, the Secretary shall issue guidance to promote

17135 awareness of donations of apparently wholesome food

17136 protected under section 22(c) of the Child Nutrition Act

17137 of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1791(c)) by qualified direct donors

17138 in compliance with applicable State and local health,

17139 food safety, and food handling laws (including

17140 regulations).

17141 ``(B) Issuance.--The Secretary shall encourage State

17142 agencies and emergency feeding organizations to share

17143 the guidance issued under subparagraph (A) with

17144 qualified direct donors.''.

17145

17146 Subtitle C--Miscellaneous

17147

171512002 (7 U.S.C. 3007(a)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

17152``2023''.

171582002 (7 U.S.C. 612c-4(b)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

17159``2023''.

17166is amended--

17168 (2) by inserting ``, a State, a county or county equivalent,

17169 a local educational agency, and an entity or person authorized

17170 to facilitate the donation, storage, preparation, or serving of

17171 traditional food by the operator of a food service program''

17172 after ``organization'', and

17173 (3) by inserting ``storage, preparation, or'' after

17174 ``donation to or''.

171781994 (7 U.S.C. 6953) is amended--
