17180 after ``retailers'';

17181 (2) in subsection (b)(3)(B)(iii), by inserting ``and

17182 enterprises'' after ``retailers''; and

17183 (3) in subsection (c)(2)(B)(ii), by inserting ``as

17184 applicable,'' before ``to accept''.

17185SEC. 4205. THE GUS SCHUMACHER NUTRITION INCENTIVE PROGRAM.

17186

17187 (a) Amendment to Program.--Section 4405 of the Food, Conservation,

17188and Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 7517) is amended--

17189 (1) by striking the heading and inserting ``the gus

17190 schumacher nutrition incentive program'',

17191 (2) in subsection (a)--

17192 (A) by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

17193 ``(1) Eligible entity.--The term `eligible entity' means a

17194 governmental agency or nonprofit organization.'',

17195 (B) in paragraph (3) by striking ``means the'' and

17196 all that follows through the period at the end, and

17197 inserting the following:

17198 ``means--

17199 ``(A) the supplemental nutrition assistance program

17200 established under the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7

17201 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.); and

17202 ``(B) the programs for nutrition assistance under

17203 section 19 of such Act (7 U.S.C. 2028).'', and

17204 (C) by adding at the end the following:

17205 ``(4) Healthcare partner.--The term `healthcare partner'

17206 means a healthcare provider, including--

17207 ``(A) a hospital;

17208 ``(B) a Federally-qualified health center (as

17209 defined in section 1905(l) of the Social Security Act

17210 (42 U.S.C. 1396d(l)));

17211 ``(C) a hospital or clinic operated by the Secretary

17212 of Veterans Affairs; or

17213 ``(D) a healthcare provider group.

17214 ``(5) Member.--The term `member' means, as determined by the

17215 applicable eligible entity or healthcare partner carrying out a

17216 project under subsection (c) in accordance with procedures

17217 established by the Secretary--

17218 ``(A) an individual eligible for--

17219 ``(i) benefits under the Food and Nutrition

17220 Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.); or

17221

17222[[Page 132 STAT. 4657]]

17223

17224 ``(ii) medical assistance under a State plan

17225 or a waiver of such a plan under title XIX of the

17226 Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396 et seq.) and

17227 enrolled under such plan or waiver; and

17228 ``(B) a member of a low-income household that

17229 suffers from, or is at risk of developing, a diet-

17230 related health condition.'',

17231 (3) in subsection (b)--

17232 (A) in paragraph (1)--

17233 (i) in subparagraph (B) by striking ``The''

17234 and inserting ``Except as provided in subparagraph

17235 (D)(iii), the'',

17236 (ii) in subparagraph (C) by adding at the end

17237 the following:

17238 ``(iii) Tribal agencies.--The Secretary may

17239 allow a Tribal agency to use funds provided to the

17240 Indian Tribe of the Tribal agency through a

17241 Federal agency (including the Indian Health

17242 Service) or other Federal benefit to satisfy all

17243 or part of the non-Federal share described in

17244 clause (i) if such use is otherwise consistent

17245 with the purpose of such funds.'',

17246 (iii) by redesignating subparagraphs (B) and

17247 (C) as subparagraphs (C) and (D), and

17248 (iv) by inserting after subparagraph (A) the

17249 following:

17250 ``(B) Partners and collaborators.--An eligible

17251 entity that receives a grant under this subsection may

17252 partner with, or make subgrants to, public, private,

17253 nonprofit, or for-profit entities, including--

17254 ``(i) an emergency feeding organization;

17255 ``(ii) an agricultural cooperative;

17256 ``(iii) a producer network or association;

17257 ``(iv) a community health organization;

17258 ``(v) a public benefit corporation;

17259 ``(vi) an economic development corporation;

17260 ``(vii) a farmers' market;

17261 ``(viii) a community-supported agriculture

17262 program;

17263 ``(ix) a buying club;

17264 ``(x) a retail food store participating in the

17265 supplemental nutrition assistance program;

17266 ``(xi) a State, local, or tribal agency;

17267 ``(xii) another eligible entity that receives

17268 a grant under this subsection; and

17269 ``(xiii) any other entity the Secretary

17270 designates.'',

17271 (B) in paragraph (2)--

17272 (i) by amending subparagraph (A) to read as

17273 follows:

17274 ``(A) In general.--To receive a grant under this

17275 subsection, an eligible entity shall--

17276 ``(i) meet the application criteria set forth

17277 by the Secretary; and

17278 ``(ii) propose a project that, at a minimum--

17279 ``(I) has the support of the State

17280 agency administering the supplemental

17281 nutrition assistance program;

17282 ``(II) would increase the purchase

17283 of fruits and vegetables by low-income

17284 households participating

17285

17286[[Page 132 STAT. 4658]]

17287

17288 in the supplemental nutrition assistance

17289 program by providing an incentive for

17290 the purchase of fruits and vegetables at

17291 the point of purchase to a household

17292 purchasing food with supplemental

17293 nutrition assistance program benefits;

17294 ``(III) except in the case of

17295 projects receiving $100,000 or less over

17296 1 year, would measure the purchase of

17297 fruits and vegetables by low-income

17298 households participating in the

17299 supplemental nutrition assistance

17300 program;

17301 ``(IV) ensures that the same terms

17302 and conditions apply to purchases made

17303 by individuals with benefits issued

17304 under the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008

17305 and incentives provided for in this

17306 subsection as apply to purchases made by

17307 individuals who are not members of

17308 households receiving benefits, such as

17309 provided for in section 278.2(b) of

17310 title 7, Code of Federal Regulations (or

17311 a successor regulation);

17312 ``(V) has adequate plans to collect

17313 data for reporting and agrees to provide

17314 that information for the report

17315 described in subsection (e)(2)(B)(iii);

17316 and

17317 ``(VI) would share information with

17318 the Nutrition Incentive Program

17319 Training, Technical Assistance,

17320 Evaluation, and Information Centers

17321 established under subsection (e).'',

17322 (ii) in subparagraph (B)--

17323 (I) by striking clause (v),

17324 (II) by redesignating clause (vi) as

17325 clause (x), and

17326 (III) by inserting after clause (iv)

17327 the following:

17328 ``(v) include a project design--

17329 ``(I) that provides incentives when

17330 fruits or vegetables are purchased using

17331 supplemental nutrition assistance

17332 program benefits; and

17333 ``(II) in which the incentives

17334 earned may be used only to purchase

17335 fruits or vegetables;

17336 ``(vi) have demonstrated the ability to

17337 provide services to underserved communities;

17338 ``(vii) include coordination with multiple

17339 stakeholders, such as farm organizations,

17340 nutrition education programs, cooperative

17341 extension services, public health departments,

17342 health providers, private and public health

17343 insurance agencies, cooperative grocers, grocery

17344 associations, and community-based and

17345 nongovernmental organizations;

17346 ``(viii) offer supplemental services in high-

17347 need communities, including online ordering,

17348 transportation between home and store, and

17349 delivery services;

17350 ``(ix) include food retailers that are open--

17351 ``(I) for extended hours; and

17352 ``(II) most or all days of the year;

17353 or'', and

17354 (C) by striking paragraphs (3) and (4),

17355 (4) in subsection (c)--

17356 (A) in paragraph (1) by striking ``subsection (b)

17357 $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2014 through 2018''

17358

17359[[Page 132 STAT. 4659]]

17360

17361 and inserting ``this section $5,000,000 for each of

17362 fiscal years 2014 through 2023'', and

17363 (B) in paragraph (2)--

17364 (i) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A),

17365 by striking ``subsection (b)'' and inserting

17366 ``this section'',

17367 (ii) in subparagraph (B) by striking ``and''

17368 at the end,

17369 (iii) in subparagraph (C) by striking the

17370 period at the end and inserting a semicolon, and

17371 (iv) by adding at the end the following:

17372 ``(C) $45,000,000 for fiscal year 2019;

17373 ``(D) $48,000,000 for fiscal year 2020;

17374 ``(E) $48,000,000 for fiscal year 2021;

17375 ``(F) $53,000,000 for fiscal year 2022; and

17376 ``(G) $56,000,000 for fiscal year 2023 and each

17377 fiscal year thereafter.

17378 ``(3) Use of funds.--With respect to funds made available

17379 under this section for fiscal years 2019 through 2023--

17380 ``(A) for each fiscal year the Secretary shall use

17381 not more than 10 percent of such funds available for

17382 such fiscal year for the produce prescription program

17383 described in subsection (c);

17384 ``(B) for each fiscal year not more than 8 percent

17385 of such funds available for such fiscal year shall be

17386 used by the National Institute of Food and Agriculture

17387 and the Food and Nutrition Service for administration;

17388 and

17389 ``(C) the Secretary shall use for the Nutrition

17390 Incentive Program Training, Technical Assistance,

17391 Evaluation, and Information Centers established under

17392 subsection (e) not more than--

17393 ``(i) $17,000,000 in the aggregate for fiscal

17394 years 2019 and 2020; and

17395 ``(ii) $7,000,000 for each of the fiscal years

17396 2021 through 2023.'',

17397 (5) by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (f), and

17398 (6) by inserting after subsection (b) the following:

17399

17400 ``(c) Produce Prescription Program.--

17401 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall establish a grant

17402 program under which the Secretary shall award grants to eligible

17403 entities to conduct projects that demonstrate and evaluate the

17404 impact of the projects on--

17405 ``(A) the improvement of dietary health through

17406 increased consumption of fruits and vegetables;

17407 ``(B) the reduction of individual and household food

17408 insecurity; and

17409 ``(C) the reduction in healthcare use and associated

17410 costs.

17411 ``(2) Healthcare partners.--In carrying out a project using

17412 a grant received under paragraph (1), an eligible entity shall

17413 partner with 1 or more healthcare partners.

17414 ``(3) Grant applications.--

17415 ``(A) In general.--To be eligible to receive a grant

17416 under paragraph (1), an eligible entity--

17417 ``(i) shall--

17418 ``(I) prescribe fresh fruits and

17419 vegetables to members;

17420

17421[[Page 132 STAT. 4660]]

17422

17423 ``(II) submit to the Secretary an

17424 application containing such information

17425 as the Secretary may require, including

17426 the information described in

17427 subparagraph (B); and

17428 ``(ii) may--

17429 ``(I) provide financial or non-

17430 financial incentives for members to

17431 purchase or procure fresh fruits and

17432 vegetables;

17433 ``(II) provide educational resources

17434 on nutrition to members; and

17435 ``(III) establish additional

17436 accessible locations for members to

17437 procure fresh fruits and vegetables.

17438 ``(B) Application.--An application shall--

17439 ``(i) identify the 1 or more healthcare

17440 partners with which the eligible entity is

17441 partnering under paragraph (2); and

17442 ``(ii) include--

17443 ``(I) a description of the methods

17444 by which an eligible entity shall--

17445 ``(aa) screen and verify

17446 eligibility for members for

17447 participation in a produce

17448 prescription project, in

17449 accordance with procedures

17450 established under subsection

17451 (a)(5);

17452 ``(bb) implement an

17453 effective produce prescription

17454 project, including the role of

17455 each healthcare partner in

17456 implementing the produce

17457 prescription project;

17458 ``(cc) evaluate members

17459 participating in a produce

17460 prescription project with

17461 respect to the matters described

17462 in subparagraphs (A) through (C)

17463 of paragraph (1);

17464 ``(dd) provide educational

17465 opportunities relating to

17466 nutrition to members

17467 participating in a produce

17468 prescription project; and

17469 ``(ee) inform members of the

17470 availability of the produce

17471 prescription project, including

17472 locations at which produce

17473 prescriptions may be redeemed;

17474 ``(II) a description of any

17475 additional nonprofit or emergency

17476 feeding organizations that shall be

17477 involved in the project and the role of

17478 each additional nonprofit or emergency

17479 feeding organization in implementing and

17480 evaluating an effective produce

17481 prescription project;

17482 ``(III) documentation of a

17483 partnership agreement with a relevant

17484 State Medicaid agency or other

17485 appropriate entity, as determined by the

17486 Secretary, to evaluate the effectiveness

17487 of the produce prescription project in

17488 reducing healthcare use and associated

17489 costs;

17490 ``(IV) adequate plans to collect

17491 data for reporting and agreement to

17492 provide that information for the report

17493 described in subsection (e)(2)(B)(iii);

17494 and

17495 ``(V) agreement to share information

17496 with the Nutrition Incentive Program

17497 Training, Technical

17498

17499[[Page 132 STAT. 4661]]

17500

17501 Assistance, Evaluation, and Information

17502 Centers established under subsection

17503 (e).

17504 ``(4) Coordination.--In carrying out the grant program

17505 established under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall coordinate

17506 with the Secretary of Health and Human Services and the heads of

17507 other appropriate Federal agencies that carry out activities

17508 relating to healthcare partners.

17509 ``(5) Partnerships.--

17510 ``(A) In general.--In carrying out the grant program

17511 under paragraph (1), the Secretary may enter into 1 or

17512 more memoranda of understanding with a Federal agency, a

17513 State, or a private entity to ensure the effective

17514 implementation and evaluation of each project.

17515 ``(B) Memorandum of understanding.--A memorandum of

17516 understanding entered into under subparagraph (A) shall

17517 include--

17518 ``(i) a description of a plan to provide

17519 educational opportunities relating to nutrition to

17520 members participating in produce prescription

17521 projects;

17522 ``(ii) a description of the role of the

17523 Federal agency, State, or private entity, as

17524 applicable, in implementing and evaluating an

17525 effective produce prescription project; and

17526 ``(iii) documentation of a partnership

17527 agreement with a relevant State Medicaid agency or

17528 other appropriate entity, as determined by the

17529 Secretary.

17530

17531 ``(d) Applicability.--

17532 ``(1) In general.--The value of any benefit provided to a

17533 participant in any activity funded under subsections (b) or (c)

17534 shall be treated as supplemental nutrition benefits under

17535 section 8(b) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

17536 2017(b)).

17537 ``(2) Prohibition on collection of sales taxes.--Each State

17538 shall ensure that no State or local tax is collected on a

17539 purchase of food with assistance provided under subsections (b)

17540 and (c).

17541 ``(3) No limitation on benefits.--Grants made available

17542 under subsections (b) and (c) shall not be used to carry out any

17543 project that limits the use of benefits under the Food and

17544 Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.) or any other

17545 Federal nutrition law.

17546 ``(4) Household allotment.--Assistance provided under

17547 subsections (b) and (c) to households receiving benefits under

17548 the supplemental nutrition assistance program shall not--

17549 ``(A) be considered part of the supplemental

17550 nutrition assistance program benefits of the household;

17551 or

17552 ``(B) be used in the collection or disposition of

17553 claims under section 13 of the Food and Nutrition Act of

17554 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2022).

17555

17556 ``(e) Nutrition Incentive Program Training, Technical Assistance,

17557Evaluation, and Information Centers.--

17558 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall--

17559 ``(A) establish 1 or more Nutrition Incentive

17560 Program Training, Technical Assistance, Evaluation, and

17561 Information Centers, in consultation with the Director

17562 of the National Institute of Food and Agriculture; and

17563

17564[[Page 132 STAT. 4662]]

17565

17566 ``(B) to the extent practicable, consult on the

17567 design and scope of such Centers with grocers, farmers,

17568 health professionals, researchers, incentive program

17569 managers, and employees of the Department of Agriculture

17570 with direct experience with implementation of existing

17571 incentive programs or projects.

17572 ``(2) Establishment.--The Centers shall be capable of

17573 providing services related to grants under subsections (b) and

17574 (c), including--

17575 ``(A) offering incentive program training and

17576 technical assistance to applicants and grantees to the

17577 extent practicable, including--

17578 ``(i) collecting and providing information on

17579 best practices that may include communications,

17580 signage, record-keeping, incentive instruments,

17581 development and integration of point of sale

17582 systems, and reporting;

17583 ``(ii) disseminating information and assisting

17584 with collaboration among grantee projects,

17585 applicable State agencies, and nutrition education

17586 programs;

17587 ``(iii) facilitating communication between

17588 grantees and the Department of Agriculture and

17589 applicable State agencies; and

17590 ``(iv) providing support for the development

17591 of best practices for produce prescription

17592 projects and the sharing of information among

17593 eligible entities and healthcare providers that

17594 participate in a produce prescription project

17595 under subsection (c); and

17596 ``(v) other services identified by the

17597 Secretary; and

17598 ``(B) creating a system to collect and compile core

17599 data sets from eligible entities that--

17600 ``(i) uses standard metrics with consideration

17601 of outcome measures for existing projects;

17602 ``(ii) includes to the extent practicable

17603 grocers, farmers, health professionals,

17604 researchers, incentive program managers, and

17605 employees of the Department of Agriculture with

17606 direct experience with implementation of existing

17607 incentive programs in the design of the instrument

17608 through which data will be collected and the

17609 mechanism for reporting;

17610 ``(iii) compiles project data from grantees,

17611 and beginning in fiscal year 2020 generates an

17612 annual report to Congress on grant outcomes,

17613 including--

17614 ``(I) the results of the project;

17615 and

17616 ``(II) the amount of grant funds

17617 used for the project; and

17618 ``(iv) creates and maintains a publicly

17619 accessible online site that makes annual reports

17620 and incentive program information available in an

17621 anonymized format that protects confidential,

17622 personal, or other sensitive data.

17623 ``(3) Cooperative agreement.--

17624 ``(A) In general.--To carry out paragraph (1), the

17625 Secretary may, on a competitive basis, enter into 1 or

17626 more cooperative agreements with 1 or more organizations

17627 with expertise in developing outcome-based reporting, at

17628

17629[[Page 132 STAT. 4663]]

17630

17631 least 1 of which has expertise in the food insecurity

17632 nutrition incentive program and at least 1 of which has

17633 expertise in produce prescription projects.

17634 ``(B) Inclusion.--The organizations referred to in

17635 subparagraph (A) may include--

17636 ``(i) nongovernmental organizations;

17637 ``(ii) State cooperative extension services;

17638 ``(iii) regional food system centers;

17639 ``(iv) Federal, State, or Tribal agencies;

17640 ``(v) institutions of higher education (as

17641 defined in section 101(a) of the Higher Education

17642 Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001(a))); or

17643 ``(vi) other appropriate entities as

17644 determined by the Secretary.''.

17645

17646 (b) Conforming Amendment.--The table of contents of the Food,

17647Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (Public Law 113-188) is amended by

17648striking the item relating to section 4405 and inserting the following:

17649

17650``Sec. 4405. The Gus Schumacher nutrition incentive program.''.

17651

17652SEC. 4206. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 7518.&gt;&gt; MICRO-GRANTS FOR FOOD SECURITY.

17653

17654 (a) Purpose.--The purpose of this section is to increase the

17655quantity and quality of locally grown food through small-scale

17656gardening, herding, and livestock operations in food insecure

17657communities in areas of the United States that have significant levels

17658of food insecurity and import a significant quantity of food.

17659 (b) Definitions.--In this section:

17660 (1) Eligible entity.--The term ``eligible entity'' means an

17661 entity that--

17662 (A) is--

17663 (i) an individual;

17664 (ii) an Indian tribe or tribal organization,

17665 as defined in section 4 of the Indian Self-

17666 Determination and Education Assistance Act (25

17667 U.S.C. 5304);

17668 (iii) a nonprofit organization engaged in

17669 increasing food security, as determined by the

17670 Secretary, including--

17671 (I) a religious organization;

17672 (II) a food bank; or

17673 (III) a food pantry;

17674 (iv) a federally funded educational facility,

17675 including--

17676 (I) a Head Start program or an Early

17677 Head Start program carried out under the

17678 Head Start Act (42 U.S.C. 9831 et seq.);

17679 (II) a public elementary school or

17680 public secondary school;

17681 (III) a public institution of higher

17682 education (as defined in section 101 of

17683 the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20

17684 U.S.C. 1001));

17685 (IV) a Tribal College or University

17686 (as defined in section 316(b) of the

17687 Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C.

17688 1059c(b))); or

17689 (V) a job training program; or

17690 (v) a local or Tribal government that may not

17691 levy local taxes under State or Federal law; and

17692 (B) is located in an eligible State.

17693

17694[[Page 132 STAT. 4664]]

17695

17696 (2) Eligible state.--The term ``eligible State'' means--

17697 (A) the State of Alaska;

17698 (B) the State of Hawaii;

17699 (C) American Samoa;

17700 (D) the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana

17701 Islands;

17702 (E) the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico;

17703 (F) the Federated States of Micronesia;

17704 (G) Guam;

17705 (H) the Republic of the Marshall Islands;

17706 (I) the Republic of Palau; and

17707 (J) the United States Virgin Islands.

17708

17709 (c) Establishment.--The Secretary shall distribute funds to the

17710agricultural department or agency of each eligible State for the

17711competitive distribution of subgrants to eligible entities to increase

17712the quantity and quality of locally grown food in food insecure

17713communities, including through small-scale gardening, herding, and

17714livestock operations.

17715 (d) Distribution of Funds.--

17716 (1) In general.--Of the amount made available under

17717 subsection (g), the Secretary shall distribute--

17718 (A) 40 percent to the State of Alaska;

17719 (B) 40 percent to the State of Hawaii; and

17720 (C) 2.5 percent to each eligible State described in

17721 any of subparagraphs (C) through (J) of subsection

17722 (b)(2).

17723 (2) Carryover of funds.--Funds distributed under paragraph

17724 (1) shall remain available until expended.

17725 (3) Administrative funds.--An eligible State that receives

17726 funds under paragraph (1) may use not more than 3 percent of

17727 those funds--

17728 (A) to administer the competition for providing

17729 subgrants to eligible entities in that eligible State;

17730 (B) to provide oversight of the subgrant recipients

17731 in that eligible State; and

17732 (C) to collect data and submit a report to the

17733 Secretary under subsection (f)(2).

17734

17735 (e) Subgrants to Eligible Entities.--

17736 (1) Amount of subgrants.--

17737 (A) In general.--The amount of a subgrant to an

17738 eligible entity under this section shall be--

17739 (i) in the case of an eligible entity that is

17740 an individual, not greater than $5,000 per year;

17741 and

17742 (ii) in the case of an eligible entity

17743 described in any of clauses (ii) through (v) of

17744 subsection (b)(1)(A), not greater than $10,000 per

17745 year.

17746 (B) Matching requirement.--As a condition of

17747 receiving a subgrant under this section, an eligible

17748 entity shall provide funds equal to 10 percent of the

17749 amount received by the eligible entity under the

17750 subgrant, to be derived from non-Federal sources. A

17751 State may waive the matching requirement for an

17752 individual who otherwise meets the requirements to

17753 receive a subgrant by the eligible State.

17754 (C) Project period.--Funds received by an eligible

17755 entity that is awarded a subgrant under this section

17756 shall remain available for expenditure not later than 3

17757 years after the date the funds are received.

17758

17759[[Page 132 STAT. 4665]]

17760

17761 (2) Priority.--In carrying out the competitive distribution

17762 of subgrants under subsection (c), an eligible State may give

17763 priority to an eligible entity that--

17764 (A) has not previously received a subgrant under

17765 this section; or

17766 (B) is located in a community or region in that

17767 eligible State with the highest degree of food

17768 insecurity, as determined by the agricultural department

17769 or agency of the eligible State.

17770 (3) Projects.--An eligible State may provide subgrants to 2

17771 or more eligible entities to carry out the same project.

17772 (4) Use of subgrant funds by eligible entities.--An eligible

17773 entity that receives a subgrant under this section shall use the

17774 funds to engage in activities that will increase the quantity

17775 and quality of locally grown food for food insecure individuals,

17776 families, neighborhoods, and communities, including by--

17777 (A) purchasing gardening tools or equipment, soil,

17778 soil amendments, seeds, plants, animals, canning

17779 equipment, refrigeration, or other items necessary to

17780 grow and store food;

17781 (B) purchasing or building composting units;

17782 (C) purchasing or building towers designed to grow

17783 leafy green vegetables;

17784 (D) expanding an area under cultivation or engaging

17785 in other activities necessary to be eligible to receive

17786 funding under the environmental quality incentives

17787 program established under chapter 4 of subtitle D of

17788 title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

17789 3839aa et seq.) for a high tunnel;

17790 (E) engaging in an activity that extends the growing

17791 season;

17792 (F) starting or expanding hydroponic and aeroponic

17793 farming of any scale;

17794 (G) building, buying, erecting, or repairing fencing

17795 for livestock, poultry, or reindeer;

17796 (H) purchasing and equipping a slaughter and

17797 processing facility approved by the Secretary;

17798 (I) traveling to participate in agricultural

17799 education provided by--

17800 (i) a State cooperative extension service;

17801 (ii) a land-grant college or university (as

17802 defined in section 1404 of the National

17803 Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching

17804 Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103));

17805 (iii) a Tribal College or University (as

17806 defined in section 316(b) of the Higher Education

17807 Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1059c(b)));

17808 (iv) an Alaska Native-serving institution or a

17809 Native Hawaiian-serving institution (as such terms

17810 are defined in section 317(b) of the Higher

17811 Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1059d(b))); or

17812 (v) a Federal or State agency;

17813 (J) paying for shipping of purchased items relating

17814 to growing or raising food for local consumption or

17815 purchase;

17816 (K) creating or expanding avenues for--

17817

17818[[Page 132 STAT. 4666]]

17819

17820 (i) the sale of food commodities, specialty

17821 crops, and meats that are grown by the eligible

17822 entity for sale in the local community; or

17823 (ii) increasing the availability of fresh,

17824 locally grown, and nutritious food; and

17825 (L) engaging in other activities relating to

17826 increasing food security (including subsistence), as

17827 determined by the Secretary.

17828 (5) Eligibility for other financial assistance.--An eligible

17829 entity shall not be ineligible to receive financial assistance

17830 under another program administered by the Secretary as a result

17831 of receiving a subgrant under this section.

17832

17833 (f) Reporting Requirement.--

17834 (1) Subgrant recipients.--As a condition of receiving a

17835 subgrant under this section, an eligible entity shall agree to

17836 submit to the eligible State in which the eligible entity is

17837 located a report--

17838 (A) not later than 60 days after the end of the

17839 project funded by the subgrant; and

17840 (B) that describes the use of the subgrants by

17841 eligible entities, the quantity of food grown through

17842 small-scale gardening, herding, and livestock

17843 operations, and the number of food insecure individuals

17844 fed as a result of the subgrant.

17845 (2) Report to the secretary.--Not later than 120 days after

17846 the date on which an eligible State receives a report from each

17847 eligible entity in that State under paragraph (1), the eligible

17848 State shall submit to the Secretary a report that describes, in

17849 the aggregate, the information and data contained in the reports

17850 received from those eligible entities.

17851

17852 (g) Funding.--

17853 (1) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized to

17854 be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this section

17855 $10,000,000 for fiscal year 2019 and each fiscal year

17856 thereafter, to remain available until expended.

17857 (2) Appropriations in advance.--Only funds appropriated

17858 under paragraph (1) in advance specifically to carry out this

17859 section shall be available to carry out this section.

17860SEC. 4207. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 42 USC 1760 note.&gt;&gt; BUY AMERICAN REQUIREMENTS.

17861

17862 (a) Enforcement.--Not later than 180 days after the date of the

17863enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture shall--

17864 (1) enforce full compliance with the requirements of section

17865 12(n) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42

17866 U.S.C. 1760(n)) for purchases of agricultural commodities,

17867 including fish, meats, vegetables, and fruits, and the products

17868 thereof, and

17869 (2) ensure that States and school food authorities fully

17870 understand their responsibilities under such Act.

17871

17872 (b) Requirement.--The products of the agricultural commodities

17873described in subsection (a)(1) shall be processed in the United States

17874and substantially contain--

17875 (1) meats, vegetables, fruits, and other agricultural

17876 commodities produced in--

17877 (A) a State,

17878 (B) the District of Columbia,

17879 (C) the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, or

17880

17881[[Page 132 STAT. 4667]]

17882

17883 (D) any territory or possession of the United

17884 States, or

17885 (2) fish harvested--

17886 (A) within the Exclusive Economic Zone of the United

17887 States, as described in Presidential Proclamation 5030

17888 (48 Fed. Reg. 10605; March 10, 1983), or

17889 (B) by a United States flagged vessel.

17890

17891 (c) Report.--Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment

17892of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report on the

17893actions the Secretary has taken, and plans to take, to comply with this

17894section.

17895SEC. 4208. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2026a note.&gt;&gt; HEALTHY FLUID MILK

17896 INCENTIVES PROJECTS.

17897

17898 (a) Definition of Fluid Milk.--In this section the term ``fluid

17899milk'' means all varieties of pasteurized cow's milk that--

17900 (1) is without flavoring or sweeteners,

17901 (2) is consistent with the most recent dietary

17902 recommendations,

17903 (3) is packaged in liquid form, and

17904 (4) contains vitamins A and D at levels consistent with the

17905 Food and Drug Administration, State, and local standards for

17906 fluid milk.

17907

17908 (b) Projects.--The Secretary of Agriculture shall carry out, under

17909such terms and conditions as the Secretary considers to be appropriate,

17910healthy fluid milk incentive projects to develop and test methods to

17911increase the purchase and consumption of fluid milk by members of

17912households that receive supplemental nutrition assistance program

17913benefits by providing an incentive for the purchase of fluid milk at the

17914point of purchase to members of households purchasing food with

17915supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits.

17916 (c) Grants or Cooperative Agreements.--

17917 (1) In general.--To carry out this section, the Secretary,

17918 on a competitive basis, shall enter into cooperative agreements

17919 with, or provide grants to, governmental entities or nonprofit

17920 organizations for projects that meet the purpose and selection

17921 criteria specified in this subsection.

17922 (2) Application.--To be eligible to enter into a cooperative

17923 agreement or receive a grant under this subsection, a government

17924 entity or nonprofit organization shall submit to the Secretary

17925 an application containing such information as the Secretary may

17926 require.

17927 (3) Selection criteria.--Projects proposed in applications

17928 shall be evaluated against publicly disseminated criteria that

17929 shall incorporate a scientifically based strategy that is

17930 designed to improve diet quality and nutritional outcomes

17931 through the increased purchase of fluid milk by members of

17932 households that participate in the supplemental nutrition

17933 assistance program.

17934 (4) Use of funds.--Funds made available to carry out this

17935 section shall not be used for any project that limits the use of

17936 benefits provided under the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008.

17937

17938 (d) Evaluation and Reporting.--

17939 (1) Evaluation.--

17940 (A) Independent evaluation.--

17941

17942[[Page 132 STAT. 4668]]

17943

17944 (i) In general.--The Secretary shall provide

17945 for an independent evaluation of projects selected

17946 under this section that measures, to the maximum

17947 extent practicable, the impact on health and

17948 nutrition.

17949 (ii) Requirement.--The independent evaluation

17950 under this subparagraph shall use rigorous

17951 methodologies, particularly random assignment or

17952 other methods that are capable of producing

17953 scientifically valid information regarding which

17954 activities are effective.

17955 (B) Costs.--The Secretary may use funds not to

17956 exceed 7 percent of the funding provided to carry out

17957 this section to pay costs associated with evaluating the

17958 outcomes of the healthy fluid milk incentive projects.

17959 (2) Reporting.--Not later than December 31 of 2020, and

17960 biennially thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the

17961 Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

17962 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

17963 a report that includes a description of--

17964 (A) the status of each healthy fluid milk incentives

17965 project, and

17966 (B) the results of any completed evaluation that--

17967 (i) include, to the maximum extent

17968 practicable, the impact of the healthy fluid milk

17969 incentive projects on health and nutrition

17970 outcomes among households participating in such

17971 projects, and

17972 (ii) have not been submitted in a previous

17973 report under this paragraph.

17974 (3) Public dissemination.--In addition to the reporting

17975 requirements under paragraph (2), evaluation results shall be

17976 shared publicly to promote wide use of successful strategies.

17977

17978 (e) Funding.--

17979 (1) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized to

17980 be appropriated $20,000,000 to carry out and evaluate the

17981 outcomes of projects under this section, to remain available

17982 until expended.

17983 (2) Appropriations in advance.--Only funds appropriated

17984 under paragraph (1) in advance specifically to carry out this

17985 section shall be available to carry out this section.

17986

17987 TITLE V--CREDIT

17988

17989 Subtitle A--Farm Ownership Loans

17990

17991SEC. 5101. MODIFICATION OF THE 3-YEAR EXPERIENCE ELIGIBILITY

17992 REQUIREMENT FOR FARM OWNERSHIP LOANS.

17993

17994 Section 302(b) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

17995U.S.C. 1922(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

17996 ``(4) Waiver authority.--In the case of a qualified

17997 beginning farmer or rancher, the Secretary may--

17998 ``(A) reduce the 3-year requirement in paragraph (1)

17999 to 1 or 2 years, if the farmer or rancher has--

18000 ``(i) not less than 16 credit hours of post-

18001 secondary education in a field related to

18002 agriculture;

18003 ``(ii) successfully completed a farm

18004 management curriculum offered by a cooperative

18005 extension service,

18006

18007[[Page 132 STAT. 4669]]

18008

18009 a community college, an adult vocational

18010 agriculture program, a nonprofit organization, or

18011 a land-grant college or university;

18012 ``(iii) at least 1 year of experience as hired

18013 farm labor with substantial management

18014 responsibilities;

18015 ``(iv) successfully completed a farm

18016 mentorship, apprenticeship, or internship program

18017 with an emphasis on management requirements and

18018 day-to-day farm management decisions;

18019 ``(v) significant business management

18020 experience;

18021 ``(vi) been honorably discharged from the

18022 armed forces of the United States;

18023 ``(vii) successfully repaid a youth loan made

18024 under section 311(b); or

18025 ``(viii) an established relationship with an

18026 individual who has experience in farming or

18027 ranching, or is a retired farmer or rancher, and

18028 is participating as a counselor in a Service Corps

18029 of Retired Executives program authorized under

18030 section 8(b)(1)(B) of the Small Business Act (15

18031 U.S.C. 637(b)(1)(B)), or with a local farm or

18032 ranch operator or organization, approved by the

18033 Secretary, that is committed to mentoring the

18034 farmer or rancher; or

18035 ``(B) waive the 3-year requirement in paragraph (1)

18036 if the farmer or rancher meets the requirements of

18037 clauses (iii) and (viii) of subparagraph (A).''.

18038SEC. 5102. CONSERVATION LOAN AND LOAN GUARANTEE PROGRAM.

18039

18040 Section 304(h) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

18041U.S.C. 1924(h)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

18042SEC. 5103. LIMITATIONS ON AMOUNT OF FARM OWNERSHIP LOANS.

18043

18044 Section 305 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

18045U.S.C. 1925) is amended--

18046 (1) in subsection (a)(2)--

18047 (A) by striking ``$300,000'' and inserting

18048 ``$600,000'';

18049 (B) by striking ``$700,000'' and inserting

18050 ``$1,750,000''; and

18051 (C) by striking ``2000'' and inserting ``2019''; and

18052 (2) in subsection (c)--

18053 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``August'' and

18054 inserting ``July''; and

18055 (B) in paragraph (2), by striking ``ending on August

18056 31, 1996'' and inserting ``that immediately precedes the

18057 12-month period described in paragraph (1)''.

18058SEC. 5104. RELENDING PROGRAM TO RESOLVE OWNERSHIP AND SUCCESSION

18059 ON FARMLAND.

18060

18061 Subtitle A of title III of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

18062Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1922 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end

18063the following:

18064``SEC. 310I. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1936c.&gt;&gt; RELENDING PROGRAM TO RESOLVE

18065 OWNERSHIP AND SUCCESSION ON FARMLAND.

18066

18067 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary may make loans to eligible entities

18068described in subsection (b) so that the eligible entities

18069

18070[[Page 132 STAT. 4670]]

18071

18072may relend the funds to individuals and entities for the purposes

18073described in subsection (c).

18074 ``(b) Eligible Entities.--Entities eligible for loans described in

18075subsection (a) are cooperatives, credit unions, and nonprofit

18076organizations with--

18077 ``(1) certification under section 1805.201 of title 12, Code

18078 of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), to operate as

18079 a lender;

18080 ``(2) experience assisting socially disadvantaged farmers

18081 and ranchers (as defined in subsection (a) of section 2501 of

18082 the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7

18083 U.S.C. 2279)) or limited resource or new and beginning farmers

18084 and ranchers, rural businesses, cooperatives, or credit unions,

18085 including experience in making and servicing agricultural and

18086 commercial loans; and

18087 ``(3) the ability to provide adequate assurance of the

18088 repayment of a loan.

18089

18090 ``(c) Eligible Purposes.--The proceeds from loans made by the

18091Secretary pursuant to subsection (a) shall be re-lent by eligible

18092entities for projects that assist heirs with undivided ownership

18093interests to resolve ownership and succession on farmland that has

18094multiple owners.

18095 ``(d) Preference.--In making loans under subsection (a), the

18096Secretary shall give preference to eligible entities--

18097 ``(1) with not less than 10 years of experience serving

18098 socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers; and

18099 ``(2) in States that have adopted a statute consisting of an

18100 enactment or adoption of the Uniform Partition of Heirs Property

18101 Act, as approved and recommended for enactment in all States by

18102 the National Conference of Commissioners on Uniform State Laws

18103 in 2010, that relend to owners of heirs property (as defined in

18104 that Act).

18105

18106 ``(e) Loan Terms and Conditions.--The following terms and conditions

18107shall apply to loans made under this section:

18108 ``(1) The interest rate at which intermediaries may borrow

18109 funds under this section shall be determined by the Secretary.

18110 ``(2) The rates, terms, and payment structure for borrowers

18111 to which intermediaries lend shall be--

18112 ``(A) determined by the intermediary in an amount

18113 sufficient to cover the cost of operating and sustaining

18114 the revolving loan fund; and

18115 ``(B) clearly and publicly disclosed to qualified

18116 ultimate borrowers.

18117 ``(3) Borrowers to which intermediaries lend shall be--

18118 ``(A) required to complete a succession plan as a

18119 condition of the loan; and

18120 ``(B) be offered the opportunity to borrow

18121 sufficient funds to cover costs associated with the

18122 succession plan under subparagraph (A) and other

18123 associated legal and closing costs.

18124

18125 ``(f) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of

18126this section, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture

18127of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

18128Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report describing the operation

18129and outcomes of the program under this section, with recommendations on

18130how to strengthen the program.

18131

18132[[Page 132 STAT. 4671]]

18133

18134 ``(g) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be

18135appropriated to carry out this section $10,000,000 for each of fiscal

18136years 2019 through 2023.''.

18137

18146 ``$400,000'';

18147 (B) by striking ``$700,000'' and inserting

18148 ``$1,750,000''; and

18149 (C) by striking ``2000'' and inserting ``2019''; and

18150 (2) in subsection (b)--

18151 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``August'' and

18152 inserting ``July''; and

18153 (B) in paragraph (2), by striking ``ending on August

18154 31, 1996'' and inserting ``that immediately precedes the

18155 12-month period described in paragraph (1)''.

18174``2023''.

18175SEC. 5302. LOAN AUTHORIZATION LEVELS.

18176

18177 Section 346(b)(1) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act

18178(7 U.S.C. 1994(b)(1)) is amended--

18179 (1) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking

18180 ``$4,226,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2008 through 2018''

18181 and inserting ``$10,000,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019

18182 through 2023''; and

18183 (2) by striking subparagraphs (A) and (B) and inserting the

18184 following:

18185 ``(A) $3,000,000,000 shall be for direct loans, of

18186 which--

18187 ``(i) $1,500,000,000 shall be for farm

18188 ownership loans under subtitle A; and

18189 ``(ii) $1,500,000,000 shall be for operating

18190 loans under subtitle B; and

18191 ``(B) $7,000,000,000 shall be for guaranteed loans,

18192 of which--

18193

18194[[Page 132 STAT. 4672]]

18195

18196 ``(i) $3,500,000,000 shall be for farm

18197 ownership loans under subtitle A; and

18198 ``(ii) $3,500,000,000 shall be for operating

18199 loans under subtitle B.''.

18200SEC. 5303. LOAN FUND SET-ASIDES.

18203Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1994(b)(2)(A)(ii)(III)) is amended by striking

18204``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

18205SEC. 5304. USE OF ADDITIONAL FUNDS FOR DIRECT OPERATING MICROLOANS

18206 UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS.

18207

18208 Section 346(b) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

18209U.S.C. 1994(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

18210 ``(5) Use of additional funds for direct operating

18211 microloans under certain conditions.--

18212 ``(A) In general.--If the Secretary determines that

18213 the amount needed for a fiscal year for direct operating

18214 loans (including microloans) under subtitle B is greater

18215 than the aggregate principal amount authorized for that

18216 fiscal year by this Act, an appropriations Act, or any

18217 other provision of law, the Secretary shall make

18218 additional microloans under subtitle B using amounts

18219 made available under subparagraph (C).

18220 ``(B) Notice.--Not later than 15 days before the

18221 date on which the Secretary uses the authority under

18222 subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall submit a notice of

18223 the use of that authority to--

18224 ``(i) the Committee on Appropriations of the

18225 House of Representatives;

18226 ``(ii) the Committee on Appropriations of the

18227 Senate;

18228 ``(iii) the Committee on Agriculture of the

18229 House of Representatives; and

18230 ``(iv) the Committee on Agriculture,

18231 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate.

18232 ``(C) Authorization of appropriations.--There is

18233 authorized to be appropriated to carry out this

18234 paragraph $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019

18235 through 2023.''.

18236SEC. 5305. EQUITABLE RELIEF.

18237

18238 The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended by

18239inserting after section 365 (7 U.S.C. 2008) the following:

18240``SEC. 366. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2008a.&gt;&gt; EQUITABLE RELIEF.

18241

18242 ``(a) In General.--Subject to subsection (b), the Secretary may

18243provide a form of relief described in subsection (c) to any farmer or

18244rancher who--

18245 ``(1) received a direct farm ownership, operating, or

18246 emergency loan under this title; and

18247 ``(2) the Secretary determines is not in compliance with the

18248 requirements of this title with respect to the loan.

18249

18250 ``(b) Limitation.--The Secretary may only provide relief to a farmer

18251or rancher under subsection (a) if the Secretary determines that the

18252farmer or rancher--

18253 ``(1) acted in good faith; and

18254

18255[[Page 132 STAT. 4673]]

18256

18257 ``(2) relied on an action of, or the advice of, the

18258 Secretary (including any authorized representative of the

18259 Secretary) to the detriment of the farming or ranching operation

18260 of the farmer or rancher.

18261

18262 ``(c) Forms of Relief.--The Secretary may provide to a farmer or

18263rancher under subsection (a) any of the following forms of relief:

18264 ``(1) The farmer or rancher may retain loans or other

18265 benefits received in association with the loan with respect to

18266 which the farmer or rancher was determined to be noncompliant

18267 under subsection (a)(2).

18268 ``(2) The farmer or rancher may receive such other equitable

18269 relief as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.

18270

18271 ``(d) Condition.--As a condition of receiving relief under this

18272section, the Secretary may require the farmer or rancher to take actions

18273designed to remedy the noncompliance.

18274 ``(e) Administrative Appeal; Judicial Review.--A determination or

18275action of the Secretary under this section--

18276 ``(1) shall be final; and

18277 ``(2) shall not be subject to administrative appeal or

18278 judicial review under chapter 7 of title 5, United States

18279 Code.''.

18280SEC. 5306. SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND RANCHERS; QUALIFIED

18281 BEGINNING FARMERS AND RANCHERS.

18282

18283 The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended by

18284inserting after section 366 (as added by section 5305) the following:

18285``SEC. 367. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2008b.&gt;&gt; SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS

18286 AND RANCHERS; QUALIFIED BEGINNING FARMERS

18287 AND RANCHERS.

18288

18289 ``In the case of a loan guaranteed by the Secretary under subtitle A

18290or B to a socially disadvantaged farmer or rancher (as defined in

18291section 355(e)) or a qualified beginning farmer or rancher, the

18292Secretary may provide for a standard guarantee plan, which shall cover

18293an amount equal to 95 percent of the outstanding principal of the

18294loan.''.

18295SEC. 5307. EMERGENCY LOAN ELIGIBILITY.

18296

18297 Section 373(b)(2)(B) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development

18298Act (7 U.S.C. 2008h(b)(2)(B)) is amended--

18299 (1) by redesignating clauses (i) and (ii) as subclauses (I)

18300 and (II), respectively, and indenting appropriately;

18301 (2) in the matter preceding subclause (I) (as so

18302 redesignated), by striking ``The Secretary'' and inserting the

18303 following:

18304 ``(i) In general.--The Secretary''; and

18305 (3) by adding at the end the following:

18306 ``(ii) Restructured loans.--For purposes of

18307 clause (i), a borrower who was restructured with a

18308 write-down or restructuring under section 353

18309 shall not be considered to have received debt

18310 forgiveness on a loan made or guaranteed under

18311 this title.''.

18312

18313[[Page 132 STAT. 4674]]

18314

18315 Subtitle D--Miscellaneous

18316

18317SEC. 5401. TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS TO THE CONSOLIDATED FARM AND

18318 RURAL DEVELOPMENT ACT.

18319

18320 (a)(1) Section 321(a) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development

18321Act (7 U.S.C. 1961(a)) is amended in the second sentence by striking

18322``and limited liability companies'' and inserting ``limited liability

18323companies, and such other legal entities''.

18324 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1961 note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by this

18325subsection shall take effect as if included in the enactment of section

183265201(2)(C) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law 113-79) in lieu

18327of the amendment made by such section.

18328

18329 (b)(1) Section 331D(e) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

18330Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1981d(e)) is amended by inserting after

18331``within 60 days after receipt of the notice required in this section''

18332the following: ``or, in extraordinary circumstances as determined by the

18333applicable State director, after the 60-day period''.

18334 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1981d note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by this

18335subsection shall take effect as if included in the enactment of section

1833610 of the Agricultural Credit Improvement Act of 1992 (Public Law 102-

18337554).

18338

18339 (c)(1) Section 333A(f)(1)(A) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

18340Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1983a(f)(1)(A)) is amended by striking ``114''

18341and inserting ``339''.

18342 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1983a note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by this

18343subsection shall take effect as if included in the enactment of section

1834414 of the Agricultural Credit Improvement Act of 1992 (Public Law 102-

18345554).

18346

18347 (d) Section 339(d)(3) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development

18348Act (7 U.S.C.1989(d)(3)) is amended by striking ``preferred certified

18349lender'' and inserting ``Preferred Certified Lender''.

18350 (e)(1) Section 343(a)(11)(C) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

18351Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1991(a)(11)(C)) is amended by striking ``or

18352joint operators'' and inserting ``joint operator, or owners''.

18353 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1991 note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by this

18354subsection shall take effect as of the effective date of section

183555303(a)(2) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law 113-79).

18356

18357 (f)(1) Section 343(b) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development

18358Act (7 U.S.C. 1991(b)) is amended by striking ``307(e)'' and inserting

18359``307(d)''.

18360 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1901 note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by paragraph (1)

18361shall take effect as of the date of enactment of the Agricultural Act of

183622014 (Public Law 113-79).

18363

18364 (g) Section 346(a) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development

18365Act (7 U.S.C.1994(a)) is amended by striking the last comma.

18366SEC. 5402. STATE AGRICULTURAL MEDIATION PROGRAMS.

18367

18368 (a) Issues Covered by State Mediation Programs.--Section 501(c) of

18369the Agricultural Credit Act of 1987 (7 U.S.C. 5101(c)) is amended--

18370 (1) in paragraph (1)--

18371 (A) in subparagraph (B)--

18372 (i) in the matter preceding clause (i), by

18373 striking ``under the jurisdiction of the

18374 Department of Agriculture'';

18375 (ii) in clause (ii), by inserting ``and the

18376 national organic program established under the

18377 Organic Foods

18378

18379[[Page 132 STAT. 4675]]

18380

18381 Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6501 et seq.)''

18382 before the period at the end; and

18383 (iii) by striking clause (vii) and inserting

18384 the following:

18385 ``(vii) Lease issues, including land leases

18386 and equipment leases.

18387 ``(viii) Family farm transition.

18388 ``(ix) Farmer-neighbor disputes.

18389 ``(x) Such other issues as the Secretary or

18390 the head of the department of agriculture of each

18391 participating State considers appropriate for

18392 better serving the agricultural community and

18393 persons eligible for mediation.''; and

18394 (B) by adding at the end the following:

18395 ``(C) Mediation services.--Funding provided for the

18396 mediation program of a qualifying State may also be used

18397 to provide credit counseling to persons described in

18398 paragraph (2)--

18399 ``(i) prior to the initiation of any mediation

18400 involving the Department of Agriculture; or

18401 ``(ii) unrelated to any ongoing dispute or

18402 mediation in which the Department of Agriculture

18403 is a party.'';

18404 (2) in paragraph (2)(A)--

18405 (A) in clause (ii), by striking ``and'' after the

18406 semicolon;

18407 (B) in clause (iii), by striking the period at the

18408 end and inserting ``; and''; and

18409 (C) by adding at the end the following:

18410 ``(iv) any other persons involved in an issue

18411 for which mediation services are provided by a

18412 mediation program described in paragraph

18413 (1)(B).''; and

18414 (3) in paragraph (3)(F), by striking ``that persons'' and

18415 inserting the following: ``that--

18416 ``(i) the Department of Agriculture receives

18417 adequate notification of those issues; and

18418 ``(ii) persons''.

18419

18420 (b) Report Required.--Section 505 of the Agricultural Credit Act of

184211987 (7 U.S.C. 5105) is amended to read as follows:

18422``SEC. 505. REPORT.

18423

18424 ``Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of the

18425Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, the Secretary shall submit to

18426Congress a report describing--

18427 ``(1) the effectiveness of the State mediation programs

18428 receiving matching grants under this subtitle;

18429 ``(2) recommendations for improving the delivery of

18430 mediation services to producers;

18431 ``(3) the steps being taken to ensure that State mediation

18432 programs receive timely funding under this subtitle; and

18433 ``(4) the savings to the States as a result of having a

18434 mediation program.''.

18435

18436 (c) Authorization of Appropriations.--Section 506 of the

18437Agricultural Credit Act of 1987 (7 U.S.C. 5106) is amended by striking

18438``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

18439SEC. 5403. COMPENSATION OF BANK DIRECTORS.

18440

18441 Section 4.21 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C. 2209) is

18442repealed.

18443

18444[[Page 132 STAT. 4676]]

18445

18446SEC. 5404. SHARING OF PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.

18447

18448 Section 5.19 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C. 2254) is

18449amended by adding at the end the following:

18450 ``(e) Sharing of Privileged and Confidential Information.--A System

18451institution shall not be considered to have waived the confidentiality

18452of a privileged communication with an attorney or an accountant if the

18453System institution provides the content of the communication to the Farm

18454Credit Administration pursuant to the supervisory or regulatory

18455authorities of the Farm Credit Administration.''.

18456SEC. 5405. FACILITY HEADQUARTERS.

18457

18458 Section 5.16 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C. 2251) is

18459amended by striking all that precedes ``to the rental of quarters'' and

18460inserting the following:

18461``SEC. 5.16. QUARTERS AND FACILITIES FOR THE FARM CREDIT

18462 ADMINISTRATION.

18463

18464 ``(a) The Farm Credit Administration shall maintain its principal

18465office within the Washington D.C.-Maryland-Virginia standard

18466metropolitan statistical area, and such other offices within the United

18467States as in its judgment are necessary.

18468 ``(b) As an alternate''.

18469SEC. 5406. REMOVAL AND PROHIBITION AUTHORITY; INDUSTRY-WIDE

18470 PROHIBITION.

18471

18472 Part C of title V of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 is amended by

18473inserting after section 5.29 (12 U.S.C. 2265) the following:

18474``SEC. 5.29A. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 12 USC 2265a.&gt;&gt; REMOVAL AND PROHIBITION

18475 AUTHORITY; INDUSTRY-WIDE PROHIBITION.

18476

18477 ``(a) Definition of Person.--In this section, the term `person'

18478means--

18479 ``(1) an individual; and

18480 ``(2) in the case of a specific determination by the Farm

18481 Credit Administration, a legal entity.

18482

18483 ``(b) Industry-wide Prohibition.--Except as provided in subsection

18484(c), any person who, pursuant to an order issued under section 5.28 or

184855.29, has been removed or suspended from office at a System institution

18486or prohibited from participating in the conduct of the affairs of a

18487System institution shall not, during the period of effectiveness of the

18488order, continue or commence to hold any office in, or participate in any

18489manner in the conduct of the affairs of--

18490 ``(1) any insured depository institution subject to section

18491 8(e)(7)(A)(i) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C.

18492 1818(e)(7)(A)(i));

18493 ``(2) any institution subject to section 8(e)(7)(A)(ii) of

18494 the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1818(e)(7)(A)(ii));

18495 ``(3) any insured credit union under the Federal Credit

18496 Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1751 et seq.);

18497 ``(4) any Federal home loan bank;

18498 ``(5) any institution chartered under this Act;

18499 ``(6) any appropriate Federal financial institutions

18500 regulatory agency (as defined in section 8(e)(7)(D) of the

18501 Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1818(e)(7)(D)));

18502 ``(7) the Federal Housing Finance Agency; or

18503

18504[[Page 132 STAT. 4677]]

18505

18506 ``(8) the Farm Credit Administration.

18507

18508 ``(c) Exception for Institution-affiliated Party That Receives

18509Written Consent.--

18510 ``(1) In general.--

18511 ``(A) Affiliated parties.--If, on or after the date

18512 on which an order described in subsection (b) is issued

18513 that removes or suspends an institution-affiliated party

18514 from office at a System institution or prohibits an

18515 institution-affiliated party from participating in the

18516 conduct of the affairs of a System institution, that

18517 party receives written consent described in subparagraph

18518 (B), subsection (b) shall not apply to that party--

18519 ``(i) to the extent provided in the written

18520 consent received; and

18521 ``(ii) with respect to the institution

18522 described in each written consent.

18523 ``(B) Written consent described.--The written

18524 consent referred to in subparagraph (A) is written

18525 consent received from--

18526 ``(i) the Farm Credit Administration; and

18527 ``(ii) each appropriate Federal financial

18528 institutions regulatory agency (as defined in

18529 section 8(e)(7)(D) of the Federal Deposit

18530 Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1818(e)(7)(D))) of the

18531 applicable institution described in any of

18532 paragraphs (1), (2), (3), or (4) of subsection (b)

18533 with respect to which the party proposes to be

18534 become an affiliated party.

18535 ``(2) Disclosure.--Any agency described in clause (i) or

18536 (ii) of paragraph (1)(B) that provides a written consent under

18537 that paragraph shall--

18538 ``(A) report the action to the Farm Credit

18539 Administration; and

18540 ``(B) publicly disclose the action.

18541 ``(3) Consultation between agencies.--The agencies described

18542 in clauses (i) and (ii) of paragraph (1)(B) shall consult with

18543 each other before providing any written consent under that

18544 paragraph.

18545

18546 ``(d) Violations.--A violation of subsection (b) by any person who

18547is subject to an order described in that subsection shall be treated as

18548violation of that order.''.

18549SEC. 5407. JURISDICTION OVER INSTITUTION-AFFILIATED PARTIES.

18550

18551 Part C of title V of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 is amended by

18552inserting after section 5.31 (12 U.S.C. 2267) the following:

18553``SEC. 5.31A. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 12 USC 2267a.&gt;&gt; JURISDICTION OVER

18554 INSTITUTION-AFFILIATED PARTIES.

18555

18556 ``(a) In General.--For purposes of sections 5.25, 5.26, and 5.32,

18557the jurisdiction of the Farm Credit Administration over parties, and the

18558authority of the Farm Credit Administration to initiate actions, shall

18559include enforcement authority over institution-affiliated parties.

18560 ``(b) Effect of Separation on Jurisdiction and Authority.--Subject

18561to subsection (c), the resignation, termination of employment or

18562participation, or separation of an institution-affiliated party

18563(including a separation caused by the merger, consolidation,

18564conservatorship, or receivership of a Farm Credit System institution)

18565shall not affect the jurisdiction and authority of the Farm Credit

18566

18567[[Page 132 STAT. 4678]]

18568

18569Administration to issue any notice or order and proceed under this part

18570against that party.

18571 ``(c) Limitation.--To proceed against a party under subsection (b),

18572the notice or order described in that subsection shall be served not

18573later than 6 years after the date on which the party ceased to be an

18574institution-affiliated party with respect to the applicable Farm Credit

18575System institution.

18576 ``(d) Applicability.--The date on which a party ceases to be an

18577institution-affiliated party described in subsection (c) may occur

18578before, on, or after the date of enactment of this section.''.

18579SEC. 5408. DEFINITION OF INSTITUTION-AFFILIATED PARTY.

18580

18581 Section 5.35 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C. 2271) is

18582amended--

18583 (1) in paragraph (3), by striking ``and'' at the end;

18584 (2) by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and

18585 (3) by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

18586 ``(4) the term `institution-affiliated party' means--

18587 ``(A) a director, officer, employee, shareholder, or

18588 agent of a System institution;

18589 ``(B) an independent contractor (including an

18590 attorney, appraiser, or accountant) who knowingly or

18591 recklessly participates in--

18592 ``(i) a violation of law (including

18593 regulations) that is associated with the

18594 operations and activities of 1 or more System

18595 institutions;

18596 ``(ii) a breach of fiduciary duty; or

18597 ``(iii) an unsafe practice that causes or is

18598 likely to cause more than a minimum financial loss

18599 to, or a significant adverse effect on, a System

18600 institution; and

18601 ``(C) any other person, as determined by the Farm

18602 Credit Administration (by regulation or on a case-by-

18603 case basis) who participates in the conduct of the

18604 affairs of a System institution; and''.

18605SEC. 5409. PROHIBITION ON USE OF FUNDS.

18606

18607 Section 5.65 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C. 2277a-14) is

18608amended by adding at the end the following:

18609 ``(e) Prohibition on Uses of Funds Related to Federal Agricultural

18610Mortgage Corporation.--No funds from administrative accounts or from the

18611Farm Credit System Insurance Fund may be used by the Corporation to

18612provide assistance to the Federal Agricultural Mortgage Corporation or

18613to support any activities related to the Federal Agricultural Mortgage

18614Corporation.''.

18615SEC. 5410. EXPANSION OF ACREAGE EXCEPTION TO LOAN AMOUNT

18616 LIMITATION.

18617

18618 (a) In General.--Section 8.8(c)(2) of the Farm Credit Act of 1971

18619(12 U.S.C. 2279aa-8(c)(2)) is amended by striking ``1,000'' and

18620inserting ``2,000''.

18621 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 12 USC 2279aa-8 note.&gt;&gt; Effective Date.--The amendment

18622made by subsection (a) shall take effect 1 year after the date a report

18623submitted in accordance with section 5414 of this Act indicates that it

18624is feasible to increase the acreage limitation in section 8.8(c)(2) of

18625the Farm Credit Act of 1971 to 2,000 acres.

18626

18627[[Page 132 STAT. 4679]]

18641associations, the Federal Farm Credit Banks Funding Corporation, the

18646Administration.''.

18863 (31) Section 5.19 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18864 2254) is amended--

18869 (ii) by striking the second sentence; and

18870 (B) in subsection (b)--

18871 (i) by striking ``(b)(1) Each'' and inserting

18872 ``(b) Each'';

18873 (ii) in the matter preceding paragraph (2) (as

18874 so designated)--

18875

18876[[Page 132 STAT. 4683]]

18877

18878 (I) in the second sentence, by

18879 striking ``, except with respect to any

18880 actions taken by any banks of the System

18881 under section 4.8(b),''; and

18882 (II) by striking the third sentence;

18883 and

18884 (iii) by striking paragraphs (2) and (3).

18885 (32) Section 5.31 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18886 2267) is amended in the second sentence by striking ``4.14A(i)''

18887 and inserting ``4.14A(h)''.

18888 (33) Section 5.32(h) of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12

18889 U.S.C. 2268(h)) is amended by striking ``4.14A(i)'' and

18890 inserting ``4.14A(h)''.

18891 (34) Section 5.35 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18892 2271) is amended in paragraph (5) (as redesignated by section

18893 5408(2))--

18894 (A) in subparagraph (A), by adding ``and'' at the

18895 end;

18896 (B) by striking subparagraph (B);

18897 (C) by redesignating subparagraph (C) as

18898 subparagraph (B); and

18899 (D) in subparagraph (B) (as so redesignated)--

18900 (i) by striking ``after December 31, 1992,'';

18901 and

18902 (ii) by striking ``by the Farm Credit System

18903 Assistance Board under section 6.6 or''.

18904 (35) Section 5.38 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18906 through ``land bank'' and inserting ``a Farm Credit Bank board,

18907 officer, or employee shall not remove any director or officer of

18908 any''.

18909 (36) Section 5.44 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18910 2275) is repealed.

18911 (37) Section 5.58(2) of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12

18912 U.S.C. 2277a-7(2)) is amended by striking the second sentence.

18913 (38) Section 5.60 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18918 following:

18922 Fund to--'' in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) and

18923 all that follows through ``ensure'' in subparagraph (B)

18924 and inserting ``Insurance Fund to ensure''.

18925 (39) Title VI of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18927 11.&gt;&gt; is repealed.

18929 2279c-2) is amended by striking subsection (c).

18934 the amount by which the total capital of the institution exceeds

18935 6 percent of the assets;''.

18936 (42) Section 8.0 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18937 2279aa) is amended--

18940 through the period at the end of the undesignated matter

18941

18943

18944 following subparagraph (B) and inserting ``means the

18945 board of directors established under section 8.2.'';

18946 (B) by striking paragraphs (6) and (8);

18947 (C) by redesignating paragraphs (7), (9), and (10)

18948 as paragraphs (6), (7), and (8), respectively; and

18949 (D) in subparagraph (B)(i) of paragraph (7) (as so

18950 redesignated), by striking ``(b) through (d)'' and

18951 inserting ``(b) and (c)''.

18952 (43) Section 8.2 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

18953 2279aa-2) is amended--

18956 designation and heading and all that follows through the

18959

18961 ``(1) Establishment.--The Corporation shall be under the

18962 management of the board of directors.'';

18963 (C) in subsection (a) (as so designated)--

18965 it appears and inserting ``Board'';

18969 and

18973 (b).

18974 (44) Section 8.4(a)(1) of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12

18975 U.S.C. 2279aa-4(a)(1)) is amended--

18976 (A) in the sixth sentence--

18977 (i) by striking ``Class B'' and inserting the

18978 following:

18979 ``(iii) Class b stock.--Class B''; and

18980 (ii) by striking ``8.2(b)(2)(B)'' and

18982 (B) in the fifth sentence--

18984 following:

18985 ``(ii) Class a stock.--Class A''; and

18986 (ii) by striking ``8.2(b)(2)(A)'' and

18987 inserting ``8.2(a)(2)(A)'';

18988 (C) in the fourth sentence, by striking ``The

18989 stock'' and inserting the following:

18990 ``(D) Classes of stock.--

18991 ``(i) In general.--The stock'';

18992 (D) by striking the third sentence and inserting the

18993 following:

18994 ``(C) Offers.--

18995 ``(i) In general.--The Board shall offer the

18996 voting common stock to banks, other financial

18997 institutions, insurance companies, and System

18998 institutions under such terms and conditions as

18999 the Board may adopt.

19000 ``(ii) Requirements.--The voting common stock

19001 shall be fairly and broadly offered to ensure

19002 that--

19003 ``(I) no institution or institutions

19004 acquire a disproportionate share of the

19005 total quantity of the

19006

19007[[Page 132 STAT. 4685]]

19008

19009 voting common stock outstanding of a

19010 class of stock; and

19011 ``(II) capital contributions and

19012 issuances of voting common stock for the

19013 contributions are fairly distributed

19014 between entities eligible to hold class

19015 A stock and class B stock.'';

19016 (E) in the second sentence, by striking ``Each

19017 share'' and inserting the following:

19018 ``(B) Number of votes.--Each share''; and

19019 (F) in the first sentence, by striking ``The

19020 Corporation'' and inserting the following:

19021 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation''.

19022 (45) Section 8.6 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

19023 2279aa-6) is amended--

19024 (A) by striking subsection (d);

19025 (B) by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection

19026 (d); and

19027 (C) in paragraph (2) of subsection (d) (as so

19028 redesignated), by striking ``8.0(9))'' and inserting

19029 ``8.0)''.

19030 (46) Section 8.9 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

19031 2279aa-9) is amended by striking ``4.14C,'' each place it

19032 appears.

19033 (47) Section 8.11(e) of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12

19034 U.S.C. 2279aa-11(e)) is amended by striking ``8.0(7))'' and

19035 inserting ``8.0)''.

19036 (48) Section 8.32(a) of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12

19037 U.S.C. 2279bb-1(a)) is amended--

19038 (A) in the first sentence of the matter preceding

19039 paragraph (1), by striking ``Not sooner than the

19040 expiration of the 3-year period beginning on the date of

19041 enactment of the Farm Credit System Reform Act of 1996,

19042 the'' and inserting ``The''; and

19044 and inserting ``8.0(7)(C)''.

19045 (49) Section 8.33(b)(2)(A) of the Farm Credit Act of 1971

19046 (12 U.S.C. 2279bb-2(b)(2)(A)) is amended by striking ``8.6(e)''

19047 and inserting ``8.6(d)''.

19048 (50) Section 8.35 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

19049 2279bb-4) is amended by striking subsection (e).

19050 (51) Section 8.38 of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 (12 U.S.C.

19051 2279bb-7) is repealed.

19052 (52) Section 4 of the Agricultural Marketing Act (12 U.S.C.

19053 1141b) is repealed.

19054 (53) Section 5 of the Agricultural Marketing Act (12 U.S.C.

19055 1141c) is repealed.

19057 1141d) is repealed.

19059 1141e) is repealed.

19068

19074 1148b) is repealed.

19075 (62) Section 33 of the Farm Credit Act of 1937 (12 U.S.C.

19076 1148c) is repealed.

19077 (63) Section 34 of the Farm Credit Act of 1937 (12 U.S.C.

19078 1148d) is repealed.

19080 chapter 70; 12 U.S.C. 1401 et seq.), is repealed.

19081SEC. 5412. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 12 USC 2277a-10c.&gt;&gt; CORPORATION AS CONSERVATOR

19082 OR RECEIVER; CERTAIN OTHER POWERS.

19083

19084 Part E of title V of the Farm Credit Act of 1971 is amended by

19085inserting after section 5.61B (12 U.S.C. 2277a-10b) the following:

19086``SEC. 5.61C. CORPORATION AS CONSERVATOR OR RECEIVER; CERTAIN

19087 OTHER POWERS.

19088

19089 ``(a) Definition of Institution.--In this section, the term

19090`institution' includes any System institution for which the Corporation

19091has been appointed as conservator or receiver.

19092 ``(b) Certain Powers and Duties of Corporation as Conservator or

19093Receiver.--In addition to the powers inherent in the express grant of

19094corporate authority under section 5.58(9), and other powers exercised by

19095the Corporation under this part, the Corporation shall have the

19096following express powers to act as a conservator or receiver:

19097 ``(1) Rulemaking authority of corporation.--The Corporation

19098 may prescribe such regulations as the Corporation determines to

19099 be appropriate regarding the conduct of conservatorships or

19100 receiverships.

19101 ``(2) General powers.--

19102 ``(A) Successor to system institution.--The

19103 Corporation shall, as conservator or receiver, and by

19104 operation of law, succeed to--

19105 ``(i) all rights, titles, powers, and

19106 privileges of the System institution, and of any

19107 stockholder, member, officer, or director of such

19108 System institution with respect to the System

19109 institution and the assets of the System

19110 institution; and

19111 ``(ii) title to the books, records, and assets

19112 of any previous conservator or other legal

19113 custodian of such System institution.

19114 ``(B) Operate the system institution.--The

19115 Corporation may, as conservator or receiver--

19116 ``(i) take over the assets of and operate the

19117 System institution with all the powers of the

19118 stockholders or members, the directors, and the

19119 officers of the System institution and conduct all

19120 business of the System institution;

19121 ``(ii) collect all obligations and money due

19122 the System institution;

19123 ``(iii) perform all functions of the System

19124 institution in the name of the System institution

19125 which are consistent with the appointment as

19126 conservator or receiver;

19127 ``(iv) preserve and conserve the assets and

19128 property of such System institution; and

19129

19130[[Page 132 STAT. 4687]]

19131

19132 ``(v) provide by contract for assistance in

19133 fulfilling any function, activity, action, or duty

19134 of the Corporation as conservator or receiver.

19135 ``(C) Functions of system institution's officers,

19136 directors, members, and stockholders.--The Corporation

19137 may, by regulation or order, provide for the exercise of

19138 any function by any stockholder, member, director, or

19139 officer of any System institution for which the

19140 Corporation has been appointed conservator or receiver.

19141 ``(D) Powers as conservator.--Subject to any Farm

19142 Credit Administration approvals required under this Act,

19143 the Corporation may, as conservator, take such action as

19144 may be--

19145 ``(i) necessary to put the System institution

19146 in a sound and solvent condition; and

19147 ``(ii) appropriate to carry on the business of

19148 the System institution and preserve and conserve

19149 the assets and property of the System institution.

19150 ``(E) Additional powers as receiver.--The

19151 Corporation may, as receiver, liquidate the System

19152 institution and proceed to realize upon the assets of

19153 the System institution, in such manner as the

19154 Corporation determines to be appropriate.

19155 ``(F) Organization of new system bank.--The

19156 Corporation may, as receiver with respect to any System

19157 bank, organize a bridge System bank under subsection

19158 (h).

19159 ``(G) Merger; transfer of assets and liabilities.--

19160 ``(i) In general.--Subject to clause (ii), the

19161 Corporation may, as conservator or receiver--

19162 ``(I) merge the System institution

19163 with another System institution; and

19164 ``(II) transfer or sell any asset or

19165 liability of the System institution in

19166 default without any approval,

19167 assignment, or consent with respect to

19168 such transfer.

19169 ``(ii) Approval.--No merger or transfer under

19170 clause (i) may be made to another System

19171 institution (other than a bridge System bank under

19172 subsection (h)) without the approval of the Farm

19173 Credit Administration.

19174 ``(H) Payment of valid obligations.--The

19175 Corporation, as conservator or receiver, shall, to the

19176 extent that proceeds are realized from the performance
