19177 of contracts or the sale of the assets of a System

19178 institution, pay all valid obligations of the System

19179 institution in accordance with the prescriptions and

19180 limitations of this section.

19181 ``(I) Incidental powers.--

19182 ``(i) In general.--The Corporation may, as

19183 conservator or receiver--

19184 ``(I) exercise all powers and

19185 authorities specifically granted to

19186 conservators or receivers, respectively,

19187 under this section and such incidental

19188 powers as shall be necessary to carry

19189 out such powers; and

19190 ``(II) take any action authorized by

19191 this section, which the Corporation

19192 determines is in the best interests of--

19193

19194[[Page 132 STAT. 4688]]

19195

19196 ``(aa) the System

19197 institution in receivership or

19198 conservatorship;

19199 ``(bb) System institutions;

19200 ``(cc) System institution

19201 stockholders or investors; or

19202 ``(dd) the Corporation.

19203 ``(ii) Termination of rights and claims.--

19204 ``(I) In general.--Except as

19205 provided in subclause (II),

19206 notwithstanding any other provision of

19207 law, the appointment of the Corporation

19208 as receiver for a System institution and

19209 the succession of the Corporation, by

19210 operation of law, to the rights, titles,

19211 powers, and privileges described in

19212 subparagraph (A) shall terminate all

19213 rights and claims that the stockholders

19214 and creditors of the System institution

19215 may have, arising as a result of their

19216 status as stockholders or creditors,

19217 against the assets or charter of the

19218 System institution or the Corporation.

19219 ``(II) Exceptions.--Subclause (I)

19220 shall not terminate the right to

19221 payment, resolution, or other

19222 satisfaction of the claims of

19223 stockholders and creditors described in

19224 that subclause, as permitted under

19225 paragraphs (10) and (11) and subsection

19226 (d).

19227 ``(iii) Charter.--Notwithstanding any other

19228 provision of law, for purposes of this section,

19229 the charter of a System institution shall not be

19230 considered to be an asset of the System

19231 institution.

19232 ``(J) Utilization of private sector.--In carrying

19233 out its responsibilities in the management and

19234 disposition of assets from System institutions, as

19235 conservator, receiver, or in its corporate capacity, the

19236 Corporation may utilize the services of private persons,

19237 including real estate and loan portfolio asset

19238 management, property management, auction marketing,

19239 legal, and brokerage services, if the Corporation

19240 determines utilization of such services is practicable,

19241 efficient, and cost effective.

19242 ``(3) Authority of receiver to determine claims.--

19243 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation may, as receiver,

19244 determine claims in accordance with the requirements of

19245 this subsection and regulations prescribed under

19246 paragraph (4).

19247 ``(B) Notice requirements.--The receiver, in any

19248 case involving the liquidation or winding up of the

19249 affairs of a closed System institution, shall--

19250 ``(i) promptly publish a notice to the System

19251 institution's creditors to present their claims,

19252 together with proof, to the receiver by a date

19253 specified in the notice which shall be not less

19254 than 90 days after the publication of such notice;

19255 and

19256 ``(ii) republish such notice approximately 1

19257 month and 2 months, respectively, after the

19258 publication under clause (i).

19259 ``(C) Mailing required.--The receiver shall mail a

19260 notice similar to the notice published under

19261 subparagraph

19262

19263[[Page 132 STAT. 4689]]

19264

19265 (B)(i) at the time of such publication to any creditor

19266 shown on the System institution's books--

19267 ``(i) at the creditor's last address appearing

19268 in such books; or

19269 ``(ii) upon discovery of the name and address

19270 of a claimant not appearing on the System

19271 institution's books within 30 days after the

19272 discovery of such name and address.

19273 ``(4) Rulemaking authority relating to determination of

19274 claims.--The Corporation may prescribe regulations regarding the

19275 allowance or disallowance of claims by the receiver and

19276 providing for administrative determination of claims and review

19277 of such determination.

19278 ``(5) Procedures for determination of claims.--

19279 ``(A) Determination period.--

19280 ``(i) In general.--Before the end of the 180-

19281 day period beginning on the date any claim against

19282 a System institution is filed with the Corporation

19283 as receiver, the Corporation shall determine

19284 whether to allow or disallow the claim and shall

19285 notify the claimant of any determination with

19286 respect to such claim.

19287 ``(ii) Extension of time.--The period

19288 described in clause (i) may be extended by a

19289 written agreement between the claimant and the

19290 Corporation.

19291 ``(iii) Mailing of notice sufficient.--The

19292 requirements of clause (i) shall be deemed to be

19293 satisfied if the notice of any determination with

19294 respect to any claim is mailed to the last address

19295 of the claimant which appears--

19296 ``(I) on the System institution's

19297 books;

19298 ``(II) in the claim filed by the

19299 claimant; or

19300 ``(III) in documents submitted in

19301 proof of the claim.

19302 ``(iv) Contents of notice of disallowance.--If

19303 any claim filed under clause (i) is disallowed,

19304 the notice to the claimant shall contain--

19305 ``(I) a statement of each reason for

19306 the disallowance; and

19307 ``(II) the procedures available for

19308 obtaining agency review of the

19309 determination to disallow the claim or

19310 judicial determination of the claim.

19311 ``(B) Allowance of proven claims.--The receiver

19312 shall allow any claim received on or before the date

19313 specified in the notice published under paragraph

19314 (3)(B)(i) by the receiver from any claimant which is

19315 proved to the satisfaction of the receiver.

19316 ``(C) Disallowance of claims filed after end of

19317 filing period.--

19318 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

19319 clause (ii), claims filed after the date specified

19320 in the notice published under paragraph (3)(B)(i)

19321 shall be disallowed and such disallowance shall be

19322 final.

19323 ``(ii) Certain exceptions.--Clause (i) shall

19324 not apply with respect to any claim filed by any

19325 claimant after the date specified in the notice

19326 published under paragraph (3)(B)(i) and such claim

19327 may be considered by the receiver if--

19328

19329[[Page 132 STAT. 4690]]

19330

19331 ``(I) the claimant did not receive

19332 notice of the appointment of the

19333 receiver in time to file such claim

19334 before such date; and

19335 ``(II) such claim is filed in time

19336 to permit payment of such claim.

19337 ``(D) Authority to disallow claims.--

19338 ``(i) In general.--The receiver may disallow

19339 any portion of any claim by a creditor or claim of

19340 security, preference, or priority which is not

19341 proved to the satisfaction of the receiver.

19342 ``(ii) Payments to less than fully secured

19343 creditors.--In the case of a claim of a creditor

19344 against a System institution which is secured by

19345 any property or other asset of such System

19346 institution, any receiver appointed for any System

19347 institution--

19348 ``(I) may treat the portion of such

19349 claim which exceeds an amount equal to

19350 the fair market value of such property

19351 or other asset as an unsecured claim

19352 against the System institution; and

19353 ``(II) may not make any payment with

19354 respect to such unsecured portion of the

19355 claim other than in connection with the

19356 disposition of all claims of unsecured

19357 creditors of the System institution.

19358 ``(iii) Exceptions.--No provision of this

19359 paragraph shall apply with respect to--

19360 ``(I) any extension of credit from

19361 any Federal Reserve bank or the United

19362 States Treasury to any System

19363 institution; or

19364 ``(II) any security interest in the

19365 assets of the System institution

19366 securing any such extension of credit.

19367 ``(E) No judicial review of determination pursuant

19368 to subparagraph (d).--No court may review the

19369 Corporation's determination pursuant to subparagraph (D)

19370 to disallow a claim.

19371 ``(F) Legal effect of filing.--

19372 ``(i) Statute of limitation tolled.--For

19373 purposes of any applicable statute of limitations,

19374 the filing of a claim with the receiver shall

19375 constitute a commencement of an action.

19376 ``(ii) No prejudice to other actions.--Subject

19377 to paragraph (12) and the determination of claims

19378 by a receiver, the filing of a claim with the

19379 receiver shall not prejudice any right of the

19380 claimant to continue any action which was filed

19381 before the appointment of the receiver.

19382 ``(6) Provision for judicial determination of claims.--

19383 ``(A) In general.--Before the end of the 60-day

19384 period beginning on the earlier of--

19385 ``(i) the end of the period described in

19386 paragraph (5)(A)(i) with respect to any claim

19387 against a System institution for which the

19388 Corporation is receiver; or

19389 ``(ii) the date of any notice of disallowance

19390 of such claim pursuant to paragraph (5)(A)(i),

19391 the claimant may request administrative review of the

19392 claim in accordance with paragraph (7) or file suit on

19393 such claim (or continue an action commenced before the

19394

19395[[Page 132 STAT. 4691]]

19396

19397 appointment of the receiver) in the district or

19398 territorial court of the United States for the district

19399 within which the System institution's principal place of

19400 business is located or the United States District Court

19401 for the District of Columbia (and such court shall have

19402 jurisdiction to hear such claim).

19403 ``(B) Statute of limitations.--If any claimant fails

19404 to file suit on such claim (or continue an action

19405 commenced before the appointment of the receiver),

19406 before the end of the 60-day period described in

19407 subparagraph (A), the claim shall be deemed to be

19408 disallowed (other than any portion of such claim which

19409 was allowed by the receiver) as of the end of such

19410 period, such disallowance shall be final, and the

19411 claimant shall have no further rights or remedies with

19412 respect to such claim.

19413 ``(7) Review of claims; administrative hearing.--If any

19414 claimant requests review under this paragraph in lieu of filing

19415 or continuing any action under paragraph (6) and the Corporation

19416 agrees to such request, the Corporation shall consider the claim

19417 after opportunity for a hearing on the record. The final

19418 determination of the Corporation with respect to such claim

19419 shall be subject to judicial review under chapter 7 of title 5,

19420 United States Code.

19421 ``(8) Expedited determination of claims.--

19422 ``(A) Establishment required.--The Corporation shall

19423 establish a procedure for expedited relief outside of

19424 the routine claims process established under paragraph

19425 (5) for claimants who--

19426 ``(i) allege the existence of legally valid

19427 and enforceable or perfected security interests in

19428 assets of any System institution for which the

19429 Corporation has been appointed receiver; and

19430 ``(ii) allege that irreparable injury will

19431 occur if the routine claims procedure is followed.

19432 ``(B) Determination period.--Before the end of the

19433 90-day period beginning on the date any claim is filed

19434 in accordance with the procedures established pursuant

19435 to subparagraph (A), the Corporation shall--

19436 ``(i) determine--

19437 ``(I) whether to allow or disallow

19438 such claim; or

19439 ``(II) whether such claim should be

19440 determined pursuant to the procedures

19441 established pursuant to paragraph (5);

19442 and

19443 ``(ii) notify the claimant of the

19444 determination, and if the claim is disallowed,

19445 provide a statement of each reason for the

19446 disallowance and the procedure for obtaining

19447 agency review or judicial determination.

19448 ``(C) Period for filing or renewing suit.--Any

19449 claimant who files a request for expedited relief shall

19450 be permitted to file a suit, or to continue a suit filed

19451 before the appointment of the receiver, seeking a

19452 determination of the claimant's rights with respect to

19453 such security interest after the earlier of--

19454 ``(i) the end of the 90-day period beginning

19455 on the date of the filing of a request for

19456 expedited relief; or

19457

19458[[Page 132 STAT. 4692]]

19459

19460 ``(ii) the date the Corporation denies the

19461 claim.

19462 ``(D) Statute of limitations.--If an action

19463 described in subparagraph (C) is not filed, or the

19464 motion to renew a previously filed suit is not made,

19465 before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the

19466 date on which such action or motion may be filed in

19467 accordance with subparagraph (B), the claim shall be

19468 deemed to be disallowed as of the end of such period

19469 (other than any portion of such claim which was allowed

19470 by the receiver), such disallowance shall be final, and

19471 the claimant shall have no further rights or remedies

19472 with respect to such claim.

19473 ``(E) Legal effect of filing.--

19474 ``(i) Statute of limitation tolled.--For

19475 purposes of any applicable statute of limitations,

19476 the filing of a claim with the receiver shall

19477 constitute a commencement of an action.

19478 ``(ii) No prejudice to other actions.--Subject

19479 to paragraph (12), the filing of a claim with the

19480 receiver shall not prejudice any right of the

19481 claimant to continue any action which was filed

19482 before the appointment of the receiver.

19483 ``(9) Agreement as basis of claim.--

19484 ``(A) Requirements.--Except as provided in

19485 subparagraph (B), any agreement which does not meet the

19486 requirements set forth in section 5.61(d) shall not form

19487 the basis of, or substantially comprise, a claim against

19488 the receiver or the Corporation.

19489 ``(B) Exception to contemporaneous execution

19490 requirement.--Notwithstanding section 5.61(d), any

19491 agreement relating to an extension of credit between a

19492 Federal Reserve bank or the United States Treasury and

19493 any System institution which was executed before such

19494 extension of credit to such System institution shall be

19495 treated as having been executed contemporaneously with

19496 such extension of credit for purposes of subparagraph

19497 (A).

19498 ``(10) Payment of claims.--

19499 ``(A) In general.--The receiver may, in the

19500 receiver's discretion and to the extent funds are

19501 available from the assets of the System institution, pay

19502 creditor claims which are allowed by the receiver,

19503 approved by the Corporation pursuant to a final

19504 determination pursuant to paragraph (7) or (8), or

19505 determined by the final judgment of any court of

19506 competent jurisdiction in such manner and amounts as are

19507 authorized under this Act.

19508 ``(B) Liquidation payments.--The receiver may, in

19509 the receiver's sole discretion, pay from the assets of

19510 the System institution portions of proved claims at any

19511 time, and no liability shall attach to the Corporation

19512 (in such Corporation's corporate capacity or as

19513 receiver), by reason of any such payment, for failure to

19514 make payments to a claimant whose claim is not proved at

19515 the time of any such payment.

19516 ``(C) Rulemaking authority of corporation.--The

19517 Corporation may prescribe such rules, including

19518 definitions of terms, as it deems appropriate to

19519 establish a single uniform interest rate for or to make

19520 payments of post insolvency interest to creditors

19521 holding proven claims

19522

19523[[Page 132 STAT. 4693]]

19524

19525 against the receivership estates of System institutions

19526 following satisfaction by the receiver of the principal

19527 amount of all creditor claims.

19528 ``(11) Priority of expenses and claims.--

19529 ``(A) In general.--Amounts realized from the

19530 liquidation or other resolution of any System

19531 institution by any receiver appointed for such System

19532 institution shall be distributed to pay claims (other

19533 than secured claims to the extent of any such security)

19534 in the following order of priority:

19535 ``(i) Administrative expenses of the receiver.

19536 ``(ii) If authorized by the Corporation,

19537 wages, salaries, or commissions, including

19538 vacation, severance, and sick leave pay earned by

19539 an individual--

19540 ``(I) in an amount that is not more

19541 than $11,725 for each individual (as

19542 indexed for inflation, by regulation of

19543 the Corporation); and

19544 ``(II) that is earned 180 days or

19545 fewer before the date of appointment of

19546 the Corporation as receiver.

19547 ``(iii) In the case of the resolution of a

19548 System bank, all claims of holders of consolidated

19549 and System-wide bonds and all claims of the other

19550 System banks arising from the payments of the

19551 System banks pursuant to--

19552 ``(I) section 4.4 on consolidated

19553 and System-wide bonds issued under

19554 subsection (c) or (d) of section 4.2; or

19555 ``(II) an agreement, in writing and

19556 approved by the Farm Credit

19557 Administration, among the System banks

19558 to reallocate the payments.

19559 ``(iv) In the case of the resolution of a

19560 production credit association or other association

19561 making direct loans under section 7.6, all claims

19562 of a System bank based on the financing agreement

19563 between the association and the System bank--

19564 ``(I) including interest accrued

19565 before and after the appointment of the

19566 receiver; and

19567 ``(II) not including any setoff for

19568 stock or other equity of that System

19569 bank owned by the association, on that

19570 condition that, prior to making that

19571 setoff, that System bank shall obtain

19572 the approval of the Farm Credit

19573 Administration Board for the retirement

19574 of that stock or equity.

19575 ``(v) Any general or senior liability of the

19576 System institution (which is not a liability

19577 described in clause (vi) or (vii)).

19578 ``(vi) Any obligation subordinated to general

19579 creditors (which is not an obligation described in

19580 clause (vii)).

19581 ``(vii) Any obligation to stockholders or

19582 members arising as a result of their status as

19583 stockholders or members.

19584 ``(B) Payment of claims.--

19585 ``(i) In general.--

19586

19587[[Page 132 STAT. 4694]]

19588

19589 ``(I) Payment.--All claims of each

19590 priority described in clauses (i)

19591 through (vii) of subparagraph (A) shall

19592 be paid in full, or provisions shall be

19593 made for that payment, prior to the

19594 payment of any claim of a lesser

19595 priority.

19596 ``(II) Insufficient funds.--If there

19597 are insufficient funds to pay in full

19598 all claims in any priority described

19599 clauses (i) through (vii) of

19600 subparagraph (A), distribution on that

19601 priority of claims shall be made on a

19602 pro rata basis.

19603 ``(ii) Distribution of remaining assets.--

19604 Following the payment of all claims in accordance

19605 with subparagraph (A), the receiver shall

19606 distribute the remainder of the assets of the

19607 System institution to the owners of stock,

19608 participation certificates, and other equities in

19609 accordance with the priorities for impairment

19610 under the bylaws of the System institution.

19611 ``(iii) Eligible borrower stock.--

19612 Notwithstanding subparagraph (C) or any other

19613 provision of this section, eligible borrower stock

19614 shall be retired in accordance with section 4.9A.

19615 ``(C) Effect of state law.--

19616 ``(i) In general.--The provisions of

19617 subparagraph (A) shall not supersede the law of

19618 any State except to the extent such law is

19619 inconsistent with the provisions of such

19620 subparagraph, and then only to the extent of the

19621 inconsistency.

19622 ``(ii) Procedure for determination of

19623 inconsistency.--Upon the Corporation's own motion

19624 or upon the request of any person with a claim

19625 described in subparagraph (A) or any State which

19626 is submitted to the Corporation in accordance with

19627 procedures which the Corporation shall prescribe,

19628 the Corporation shall determine whether any

19629 provision of the law of any State is inconsistent

19630 with any provision of subparagraph (A) and the

19631 extent of any such inconsistency.

19632 ``(iii) Judicial review.--The final

19633 determination of the Corporation under clause (ii)

19634 shall be subject to judicial review under chapter

19635 7 of title 5, United States Code.

19636 ``(D) Accounting report.--Any distribution by the

19637 Corporation in connection with any claim described in

19638 subparagraph (A)(vii) shall be accompanied by the

19639 accounting report required under paragraph (15)(B).

19640 ``(12) Suspension of legal actions.--

19641 ``(A) In general.--After the appointment of a

19642 conservator or receiver for a System institution, the

19643 conservator or receiver may request a stay for a period

19644 not to exceed--

19645 ``(i) 45 days, in the case of any conservator;

19646 and

19647 ``(ii) 90 days, in the case of any receiver,

19648 in any judicial action or proceeding to which such

19649 System institution is or becomes a party.

19650 ``(B) Grant of stay by all courts required.--Upon

19651 receipt of a request by any conservator or receiver

19652 pursuant to subparagraph (A) for a stay of any judicial

19653 action or proceeding in any court with jurisdiction of

19654 such action

19655

19656[[Page 132 STAT. 4695]]

19657

19658 or proceeding, the court shall grant such stay as to all

19659 parties.

19660 ``(13) Additional rights and duties.--

19661 ``(A) Prior final adjudication.--The Corporation

19662 shall abide by any final unappealable judgment of any

19663 court of competent jurisdiction which was rendered

19664 before the appointment of the Corporation as conservator

19665 or receiver.

19666 ``(B) Rights and remedies of conservator or

19667 receiver.--In the event of any appealable judgment, the

19668 Corporation as conservator or receiver shall--

19669 ``(i) have all the rights and remedies

19670 available to the System institution (before the

19671 appointment of such conservator or receiver) and

19672 the Corporation in its corporate capacity,

19673 including removal to Federal court and all

19674 appellate rights; and

19675 ``(ii) not be required to post any bond in

19676 order to pursue such remedies.

19677 ``(C) No attachment or execution.--No attachment or

19678 execution may issue by any court on--

19679 ``(i) assets in the possession of the

19680 receiver; or

19681 ``(ii) the charter of a System institution for

19682 which the Corporation has been appointed receiver.

19683 ``(D) Limitation on judicial review.--Except as

19684 otherwise provided in this subsection, no court shall

19685 have jurisdiction over--

19686 ``(i) any claim or action for payment from, or

19687 any action seeking a determination of rights with

19688 respect to, the assets of any System institution

19689 for which the Corporation has been appointed

19690 receiver, including assets which the Corporation

19691 may acquire from itself as such receiver; or

19692 ``(ii) any claim relating to any act or

19693 omission of such System institution or the

19694 Corporation as receiver.

19695 ``(E) Disposition of assets.--In exercising any

19696 right, power, privilege, or authority as receiver in

19697 connection with any sale or disposition of assets of any

19698 System institution for which the Corporation is acting

19699 as receiver, the Corporation shall, to the maximum

19700 extent practicable, conduct its operations in a manner

19701 which--

19702 ``(i) maximizes the net present value return

19703 from the sale or disposition of such assets;

19704 ``(ii) minimizes the amount of any loss

19705 realized in the resolution of cases;

19706 ``(iii) ensures adequate competition and fair

19707 and consistent treatment of offerors;

19708 ``(iv) prohibits discrimination on the basis

19709 of race, sex, or ethnic groups in the solicitation

19710 and consideration of offers; and

19711 ``(v) mitigates the potential for serious

19712 adverse effects to the rest of the System.

19713 ``(14) Statute of limitations for actions brought by

19714 conservator or receiver.--

19715 ``(A) In general.--Notwithstanding any provision of

19716 any contract, the applicable statute of limitations with

19717

19718[[Page 132 STAT. 4696]]

19719

19720 regard to any action brought by the Corporation as

19721 conservator or receiver shall be--

19722 ``(i) in the case of any contract claim, the

19723 longer of--

19724 ``(I) the 6-year period beginning on

19725 the date the claim accrues; or

19726 ``(II) the period applicable under

19727 State law; and

19728 ``(ii) in the case of any tort claim, the

19729 longer of--

19730 ``(I) the 3-year period beginning on

19731 the date the claim accrues; or

19732 ``(II) the period applicable under

19733 State law.

19734 ``(B) Determination of the date on which a claim

19735 accrues.--For purposes of subparagraph (A), the date on

19736 which the statute of limitations begins to run on any

19737 claim described in such subparagraph shall be the later

19738 of--

19739 ``(i) the date of the appointment of the

19740 Corporation as conservator or receiver; or

19741 ``(ii) the date on which the cause of action

19742 accrues.

19743 ``(C) Revival of expired state causes of action.--

19744 ``(i) In general.--In the case of any tort

19745 claim described in clause (ii) for which the

19746 statute of limitation applicable under State law

19747 with respect to such claim has expired not more

19748 than 5 years before the appointment of the

19749 Corporation as conservator or receiver, the

19750 Corporation may bring an action as conservator or

19751 receiver on such claim without regard to the

19752 expiration of the statute of limitation applicable

19753 under State law.

19754 ``(ii) Claims described.--A tort claim

19755 referred to in clause (i) is a claim arising from

19756 fraud, intentional misconduct resulting in unjust

19757 enrichment, or intentional misconduct resulting in

19758 substantial loss to the System institution.

19759 ``(15) Accounting and recordkeeping requirements.--

19760 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation as conservator or

19761 receiver shall, consistent with the accounting and

19762 reporting practices and procedures established by the

19763 Corporation, maintain a full accounting of each

19764 conservatorship and receivership or other disposition of

19765 System institutions in default.

19766 ``(B) Annual accounting or report.--With respect to

19767 each conservatorship or receivership to which the

19768 Corporation was appointed, the Corporation shall make an

19769 annual accounting or report, as appropriate, available

19770 to the Farm Credit Administration Board.

19771 ``(C) Availability of reports.--Any report prepared

19772 pursuant to subparagraph (B) shall be made available by

19773 the Corporation upon request to any stockholder of the

19774 System institution for which the Corporation was

19775 appointed conservator or receiver or any other member of

19776 the public.

19777 ``(D) Recordkeeping requirement.--

19778 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

19779 clause (ii), after the end of the 6-year period

19780 beginning on the date the Corporation is appointed

19781 as receiver of a System institution, the

19782 Corporation may destroy any

19783

19784[[Page 132 STAT. 4697]]

19785

19786 records of such System institution which the

19787 Corporation, in the Corporation's discretion,

19788 determines to be unnecessary unless directed not

19789 to do so by a court of competent jurisdiction or

19790 governmental agency, or prohibited by law.

19791 ``(ii) Old records.--Notwithstanding clause

19792 (i), the Corporation may destroy records of a

19793 System institution which are at least 10 years old

19794 as of the date on which the Corporation is

19795 appointed as the receiver of such System

19796 institution in accordance with clause (i) at any

19797 time after such appointment is final, without

19798 regard to the 6-year period of limitation

19799 contained in clause (i).

19800 ``(16) Fraudulent transfers.--

19801 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation, as conservator

19802 or receiver for any System institution, may avoid a

19803 transfer of any interest of a System institution-

19804 affiliated party, or any person who the Corporation

19805 determines is a debtor of the System institution, in

19806 property, or any obligation incurred by such party or

19807 person, that was made within 5 years of the date on

19808 which the Corporation was appointed conservator or

19809 receiver if such party or person voluntarily or

19810 involuntarily made such transfer or incurred such

19811 liability with the intent to hinder, delay, or defraud

19812 the System institution, the Farm Credit Administration,

19813 or the Corporation.

19814 ``(B) Right of recovery.--To the extent a transfer

19815 is avoided under subparagraph (A), the Corporation may

19816 recover, for the benefit of the System institution, the

19817 property transferred, or, if a court so orders, the

19818 value of such property (at the time of such transfer)

19819 from--

19820 ``(i) the initial transferee of such transfer

19821 or the System institution-affiliated party or

19822 person for whose benefit such transfer was made;

19823 or

19824 ``(ii) any immediate or mediate transferee of

19825 any such initial transferee.

19826 ``(C) Rights of transferee or obligee.--The

19827 Corporation may not recover under subparagraph (B)

19828 from--

19829 ``(i) any transferee that takes for value,

19830 including satisfaction or securing of a present or

19831 antecedent debt, in good faith; or

19832 ``(ii) any immediate or mediate good faith

19833 transferee of such transferee.

19834 ``(D) Rights under this paragraph.--The rights under

19835 this paragraph of the Corporation shall be superior to

19836 any rights of a trustee or any other party (other than

19837 any party which is a Federal agency) under title 11,

19838 United States Code.

19839 ``(17) Attachment of assets and other injunctive relief.--

19840 Subject to paragraph (18), any court of competent jurisdiction

19841 may, at the request of the Corporation (in the Corporation's

19842 capacity as conservator or receiver for any System institution

19843 or in the Corporation's corporate capacity with respect to any

19844 asset acquired or liability assumed by the Corporation under

19845 section 5.61), issue an order in accordance with Rule 65 of the

19846 Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, including an order placing the

19847 assets of any person designated by the

19848

19849[[Page 132 STAT. 4698]]

19850

19851 Corporation under the control of the court and appointing a

19852 trustee to hold such assets.

19853 ``(18) Standards.--

19854 ``(A) Showing.--Rule 65 of the Federal Rules of

19855 Civil Procedure shall apply with respect to any

19856 proceeding under paragraph (17) without regard to the

19857 requirement of such rule that the applicant show that

19858 the injury, loss, or damage is irreparable and

19859 immediate.

19860 ``(B) State proceeding.--If, in the case of any

19861 proceeding in a State court, the court determines that

19862 rules of civil procedure available under the laws of

19863 such State provide substantially similar protections to

19864 such party's right to due process as Rule 65 (as

19865 modified with respect to such proceeding by subparagraph

19866 (A)), the relief sought by the Corporation pursuant to

19867 paragraph (17) may be requested under the laws of such

19868 State.

19869 ``(19) Treatment of claims arising from breach of contracts

19870 executed by the receiver or conservator.--Notwithstanding any

19871 other provision of this subsection, any final and unappealable

19872 judgment for monetary damages entered against a receiver or

19873 conservator for a System institution for the breach of an

19874 agreement executed or approved by such receiver or conservator

19875 after the date of its appointment shall be paid as an

19876 administrative expense of the receiver or conservator. Nothing

19877 in this paragraph shall be construed to limit the power of a

19878 receiver or conservator to exercise any rights under contract or

19879 law, including terminating, breaching, canceling, or otherwise

19880 discontinuing such agreement.

19881

19882 ``(c) Provisions Relating to Contracts Entered Into Before

19883Appointment of Conservator or Receiver.--

19884 ``(1) Authority to repudiate contracts.--In addition to any

19885 other rights a conservator or receiver may have, the conservator

19886 or receiver for a System institution may disaffirm or repudiate

19887 any contract or lease--

19888 ``(A) to which such System institution is a party;

19889 ``(B) the performance of which the conservator or

19890 receiver, in the conservator's or receiver's discretion,

19891 determines to be burdensome; and

19892 ``(C) the disaffirmance or repudiation of which the

19893 conservator or receiver determines, in the conservator's

19894 or receiver's discretion, will promote the orderly

19895 administration of the System institution's affairs.

19896 ``(2) Timing of repudiation.--The Corporation as conservator

19897 or receiver for any System institution shall determine whether

19898 or not to exercise the rights of repudiation under this

19899 subsection within a reasonable period following such

19900 appointment.

19901 ``(3) Claims for damages for repudiation.--

19902 ``(A) In general.--Except as otherwise provided in

19903 subparagraph (C) and paragraphs (4), (5), and (6), the

19904 liability of the conservator or receiver for the

19905 disaffirmance or repudiation of any contract pursuant to

19906 paragraph (1) shall be--

19907 ``(i) limited to actual direct compensatory

19908 damages; and

19909 ``(ii) determined as of--

19910

19911[[Page 132 STAT. 4699]]

19912

19913 ``(I) the date of the appointment of

19914 the conservator or receiver; or

19915 ``(II) in the case of any contract

19916 or agreement referred to in paragraph

19917 (8), the date of the disaffirmance or

19918 repudiation of such contract or

19919 agreement.

19920 ``(B) No liability for other damages.--For purposes

19921 of subparagraph (A), the term `actual direct

19922 compensatory damages' does not include--

19923 ``(i) punitive or exemplary damages;

19924 ``(ii) damages for lost profits or

19925 opportunity; or

19926 ``(iii) damages for pain and suffering.

19927 ``(C) Measure of damages for repudiation of

19928 financial contracts.--In the case of any qualified

19929 financial contract or agreement to which paragraph (8)

19930 applies, compensatory damages shall be--

19931 ``(i) deemed to include normal and reasonable

19932 costs of cover or other reasonable measures of

19933 damages utilized in the industries for such

19934 contract and agreement claims; and

19935 ``(ii) paid in accordance with this subsection

19936 and subsection (j), except as otherwise

19937 specifically provided in this section.

19938 ``(4) Leases under which the system institution is the

19939 lessee.--

19940 ``(A) In general.--If the conservator or receiver

19941 disaffirms or repudiates a lease under which the System

19942 institution was the lessee, the conservator or receiver

19943 shall not be liable for any damages (other than damages

19944 determined pursuant to subparagraph (B)) for the

19945 disaffirmance or repudiation of such lease.

19946 ``(B) Payments of rent.--Notwithstanding

19947 subparagraph (A), the lessor under a lease to which such

19948 subparagraph applies shall--

19949 ``(i) be entitled to the contractual rent

19950 accruing before the later of the date--

19951 ``(I) the notice of disaffirmance or

19952 repudiation is mailed; or

19953 ``(II) the disaffirmance or

19954 repudiation becomes effective, unless

19955 the lessor is in default or breach of

19956 the terms of the lease; and

19957 ``(ii) have no claim for damages under any

19958 acceleration clause or other penalty provision in

19959 the lease; and

19960 ``(iii) have a claim for any unpaid rent,

19961 subject to all appropriate offsets and defenses,

19962 due as of the date of the appointment, which shall

19963 be paid in accordance with this subsection and

19964 subsection (j).

19965 ``(5) Leases under which the system institution is the

19966 lessor.--

19967 ``(A) In general.--If the conservator or receiver

19968 repudiates an unexpired written lease of real property

19969 of the System institution under which the System

19970 institution is the lessor and the lessee is not, as of

19971 the date of such repudiation, in default, the lessee

19972 under such lease may either--

19973

19974[[Page 132 STAT. 4700]]

19975

19976 ``(i) treat the lease as terminated by such

19977 repudiation; or

19978 ``(ii) remain in possession of the leasehold

19979 interest for the balance of the term of the lease,

19980 unless the lessee defaults under the terms of the

19981 lease after the date of such repudiation.

19982 ``(B) Provisions applicable to lessee remaining in

19983 possession.--If any lessee under a lease described in

19984 subparagraph (A) remains in possession of a leasehold

19985 interest pursuant to clause (ii) of such subparagraph--

19986 ``(i) the lessee--

19987 ``(I) shall continue to pay the

19988 contractual rent pursuant to the terms

19989 of the lease after the date of the

19990 repudiation of such lease; and

19991 ``(II) may offset against any rent

19992 payment which accrues after the date of

19993 the repudiation of the lease, any

19994 damages which accrue after such date due

19995 to the nonperformance of any obligation

19996 of the System institution under the

19997 lease after such date; and

19998 ``(ii) the conservator or receiver shall not

19999 be liable to the lessee for any damages arising

20000 after such date as a result of the repudiation,

20001 other than the amount of any offset allowed under

20002 clause (i)(II).

20003 ``(6) Contracts for the sale of real property.--

20004 ``(A) In general.--If the conservator or receiver

20005 repudiates any contract that meets the requirements of

20006 paragraphs (1) through (4) of section 5.61(d) for the

20007 sale of real property, and the purchaser of such real

20008 property under such contract is in possession and is

20009 not, as of the date of such repudiation, in default,

20010 such purchaser may either--

20011 ``(i) treat the contract as terminated by such

20012 repudiation; or

20013 ``(ii) remain in possession of such real

20014 property.

20015 ``(B) Provisions applicable to purchaser remaining

20016 in possession.--If any purchaser of real property under

20017 any contract described in subparagraph (A) remains in

20018 possession of such property pursuant to clause (ii) of

20019 such subparagraph--

20020 ``(i) the purchaser--

20021 ``(I) shall continue to make all

20022 payments due under the contract after

20023 the date of the repudiation of the

20024 contract; and

20025 ``(II) may offset against any such

20026 payments any damages which accrue after

20027 such date due to the nonperformance

20028 (after such date) of any obligation of

20029 the System institution under the

20030 contract; and

20031 ``(ii) the conservator or receiver shall--

20032 ``(I) not be liable to the purchaser

20033 for any damages arising after that date

20034 as a result of the repudiation, other

20035 than the amount of any offset allowed

20036 under clause (i)(II);

20037 ``(II) deliver title to the

20038 purchaser in accordance with the

20039 contract; and

20040

20041[[Page 132 STAT. 4701]]

20042

20043 ``(III) have no obligation under the

20044 contract, other than the performance

20045 required under subclause (II).

20046 ``(C) Assignment and sale allowed.--

20047 ``(i) In general.--No provision of this

20048 paragraph shall be construed as limiting the right

20049 of the conservator or receiver to assign the

20050 contract described in subparagraph (A) and sell

20051 the property subject to the contract and this

20052 paragraph.

20053 ``(ii) No liability after assignment and

20054 sale.--If an assignment and sale described in

20055 clause (i) is consummated, the Corporation, acting

20056 as conservator or receiver, shall have no further

20057 liability under the applicable contract described

20058 in subparagraph (A) or with respect to the real

20059 property which was the subject of such contract.

20060 ``(7) Provisions applicable to service contracts.--

20061 ``(A) Services performed before appointment.--In the

20062 case of any contract for services between any person and

20063 any System institution for which the Corporation has

20064 been appointed conservator or receiver, any claim of

20065 such person for services performed before the

20066 appointment of the conservator or the receiver shall

20067 be--

20068 ``(i) a claim to be paid in accordance with

20069 subsections (b) and (d); and

20070 ``(ii) deemed to have arisen as of the date

20071 the conservator or receiver was appointed.

20072 ``(B) Services performed after appointment and prior

20073 to repudiation.--If, in the case of any contract for

20074 services described in subparagraph (A), the conservator

20075 or receiver accepts performance by the other person

20076 before the conservator or receiver makes any

20077 determination to exercise the right of repudiation of

20078 such contract under this section--

20079 ``(i) the other party shall be paid under the

20080 terms of the contract for the services performed;

20081 and

20082 ``(ii) the amount of such payment shall be

20083 treated as an administrative expense of the

20084 conservatorship or receivership.

20085 ``(C) Acceptance of performance no bar to subsequent

20086 repudiation.--The acceptance by any conservator or

20087 receiver of services referred to in subparagraph (B) in

20088 connection with a contract described in such

20089 subparagraph shall not affect the right of the

20090 conservator or receiver, to repudiate such contract

20091 under this section at any time after such performance.

20092 ``(8) Certain qualified financial contracts.--

20093 ``(A) Definitions.--In this paragraph:

20094 ``(i) Commodity contract.--The term `commodity

20095 contract' means--

20096 ``(I) with respect to a futures

20097 commission merchant, a contract for the

20098 purchase or sale of a commodity for

20099 future delivery on, or subject to the

20100 rules of, a contract market or board of

20101 trade;

20102 ``(II) with respect to a foreign

20103 futures commission merchant, a foreign

20104 future;

20105

20106[[Page 132 STAT. 4702]]

20107

20108 ``(III) with respect to a leverage

20109 transaction merchant, a leverage

20110 transaction;

20111 ``(IV) with respect to a clearing

20112 organization, a contract for the

20113 purchase or sale of a commodity for

20114 future delivery on, or subject to the

20115 rules of, a contract market or board of

20116 trade that is cleared by such clearing

20117 organization, or commodity option traded

20118 on, or subject to the rules of, a

20119 contract market or board of trade that

20120 is cleared by such clearing

20121 organization;

20122 ``(V) with respect to a commodity

20123 options dealer, a commodity option;

20124 ``(VI) any other agreement or

20125 transaction that is similar to any

20126 agreement or transaction referred to in

20127 this clause;

20128 ``(VII) any combination of the

20129 agreements or transactions referred to

20130 in this clause;

20131 ``(VIII) any option to enter into

20132 any agreement or transaction referred to

20133 in this clause;

20134 ``(IX) a master agreement that

20135 provides for an agreement or transaction

20136 referred to in any of subclauses (I)

20137 through (VIII), together with all

20138 supplements to any such master

20139 agreement, without regard to whether the

20140 master agreement provides for an

20141 agreement or transaction that is not a

20142 commodity contract under this clause,

20143 except that the master agreement shall

20144 be considered to be a commodity contract

20145 under this clause only with respect to

20146 each agreement or transaction under the

20147 master agreement that is referred to in

20148 subclause (I), (II), (III), (IV), (V),

20149 (VI), (VII), or (VIII); or

20150 ``(X) any security agreement or

20151 arrangement or other credit enhancement

20152 related to any agreement or transaction

20153 referred to in this clause, including

20154 any guarantee or reimbursement

20155 obligation in connection with any

20156 agreement or transaction referred to in

20157 this clause.

20158 ``(ii) Forward contract.--The term `forward

20159 contract' means--

20160 ``(I) a contract (other than a

20161 commodity contract) for the purchase,

20162 sale, or transfer of a commodity or any

20163 similar good, article, service, right,

20164 or interest which is presently or in the

20165 future becomes the subject of dealing in

20166 the forward contract trade, or product

20167 or byproduct thereof, with a maturity

20168 date more than 2 days after the date the

20169 contract is entered into, including a

20170 repurchase or reverse repurchase

20171 transaction (whether or not such

20172 repurchase or reverse repurchase

20173 transaction is a repurchase agreement),

20174 consignment, lease, swap, hedge

20175 transaction, deposit, loan, option,

20176 allocated transaction, unallocated

20177 transaction, or any other similar

20178 agreement;

20179 ``(II) any combination of agreements

20180 or transactions referred to in

20181 subclauses (I) and (III);

20182

20183[[Page 132 STAT. 4703]]

20184

20185 ``(III) any option to enter into any

20186 agreement or transaction referred to in

20187 subclause (I) or (II);

20188 ``(IV) a master agreement that

20189 provides for an agreement or transaction

20190 referred to in subclauses (I) through

20191 (III), together with all supplements to

20192 any such master agreement, without

20193 regard to whether the master agreement

20194 provides for an agreement or transaction

20195 that is not a forward contract under

20196 this clause, except that the master

20197 agreement shall be considered to be a

20198 forward contract under this clause only

20199 with respect to each agreement or

20200 transaction under the master agreement

20201 that is referred to in subclause (I),

20202 (II), or (III); or

20203 ``(V) any security agreement or

20204 arrangement or other credit enhancement

20205 related to any agreement or transaction

20206 referred to in subclause (I), (II),

20207 (III), or (IV), including any guarantee

20208 or reimbursement obligation in

20209 connection with any agreement or

20210 transaction referred to in any such

20211 subclause.

20212 ``(iii) Person.--The term `person'--

20213 ``(I) has the meaning given the term

20214 in section 1 of title 1, United States

20215 Code; and

20216 ``(II) includes any governmental

20217 entity.

20218 ``(iv) Qualified financial contract.--The term

20219 `qualified financial contract' means any

20220 securities contract, commodity contract, forward

20221 contract, repurchase agreement, swap agreement,

20222 and any similar agreement that the Corporation

20223 determines by regulation, resolution, or order to

20224 be a qualified financial contract for purposes of

20225 this paragraph.

20226 ``(v) Repurchase agreement.--

20227 ``(I) In general.--The term

20228 `repurchase agreement' (including with

20229 respect to a reverse repurchase

20230 agreement)--

20231 ``(aa) means--

20232 ``(AA) an agreement,

20233 including related terms,

20234 which provides for the

20235 transfer of one or more

20236 certificates of deposit,

20237 mortgage-related securities

20238 (as such term is defined in

20239 section 3(a) of the

20240 Securities Exchange Act of

20241 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78c(a))),

20242 mortgage loans, interests in

20243 mortgage-related securities

20244 or mortgage loans, eligible

20245 bankers' acceptances,

20246 qualified foreign government

20247 securities or securities

20248 that are direct obligations

20249 of, or that are fully

20250 guaranteed by, the United

20251 States or any agency of the

20252 United States against the

20253 transfer of funds by the

20254 transferee of such

20255 certificates of deposit,

20256 eligible bankers'

20257 acceptances, securities,

20258 mortgage loans, or interests

20259 with a simultaneous

20260 agreement by such transferee

20261 to transfer to the

20262 transferor thereof

20263 certificates of deposit,

20264 eligible bankers'

20265 acceptances,

20266

20267[[Page 132 STAT. 4704]]

20268

20269 securities, mortgage loans,

20270 or interests as described

20271 above, at a date certain not

20272 later than 1 year after such

20273 transfers or on demand,

20274 against the transfer of

20275 funds, or any other similar

20276 agreement;

20277 ``(BB) any combination

20278 of agreements or

20279 transactions referred to in

20280 subitems (AA) and (CC);

20281 ``(CC) any option to

20282 enter into any agreement or

20283 transaction referred to in

20284 subitem (AA) or (BB);

20285 ``(DD) a master

20286 agreement that provides for

20287 an agreement or transaction

20288 referred to in subitem (AA),

20289 (BB), or (CC), together with

20290 all supplements to any such

20291 master agreement, without

20292 regard to whether the master

20293 agreement provides for an

20294 agreement or transaction

20295 that is not a repurchase

20296 agreement under this item,

20297 except that the master

20298 agreement shall be

20299 considered to be a

20300 repurchase agreement under

20301 this item only with respect

20302 to each agreement or

20303 transaction under the master

20304 agreement that is referred

20305 to in subitem (AA), (BB), or

20306 (CC); and

20307 ``(EE) any security

20308 agreement or arrangement or

20309 other credit enhancement

20310 related to any agreement or

20311 transaction referred to in

20312 any of subitems (AA) through

20313 (DD), including any

20314 guarantee or reimbursement

20315 obligation in connection

20316 with any agreement or

20317 transaction referred to in

20318 any such subitem; and

20319 ``(bb) does not include any

20320 repurchase obligation under a

20321 participation in a commercial

20322 mortgage, loan unless the

20323 Corporation determines by

20324 regulation, resolution, or order

20325 to include any such

20326 participation within the meaning

20327 of such term.

20328 ``(II) Related definition.--For

20329 purposes of subclause (I)(aa), the term

20330 `qualified foreign government security'

20331 means a security that is a direct

20332 obligation of, or that is fully

20333 guaranteed by, the central government of

20334 a member of the Organization for

20335 Economic Cooperation and Development (as

20336 determined by regulation or order

20337 adopted by the appropriate Federal

20338 banking authority).

20339 ``(vi) Securities contract.--The term

20340 `securities contract'--

20341 ``(I) means--

20342 ``(aa) a contract for the

20343 purchase, sale, or loan of a

20344 security, a certificate of

20345 deposit, a mortgage loan, any

20346 interest in a mortgage loan, a

20347 group or index of securities,

20348 certificates of deposit, or

20349 mortgage loans or interests

20350

20351[[Page 132 STAT. 4705]]

20352

20353 therein (including any interest

20354 therein or based on the value

20355 thereof) or any option on any of

20356 the foregoing, including any

20357 option to purchase or sell any

20358 such security, certificate of

20359 deposit, mortgage loan,

20360 interest, group or index, or

20361 option, and including any

20362 repurchase or reverse repurchase

20363 transaction on any such

20364 security, certificate of

20365 deposit, mortgage loan,

20366 interest, group or index, or

20367 option (whether or not the

20368 repurchase or reverse repurchase

20369 transaction is a repurchase

20370 agreement);

20371 ``(bb) any option entered

20372 into on a national securities

20373 exchange relating to foreign

20374 currencies;

20375 ``(cc) the guarantee

20376 (including by novation) by or to

20377 any securities clearing agency

20378 of any settlement of cash,

20379 securities, certificates of

20380 deposit, mortgage loans or

20381 interests therein, group or

20382 index of securities,

20383 certificates of deposit, or

20384 mortgage loans or interests

20385 therein (including any interest

20386 therein or based on the value

20387 thereof) or option on any of the

20388 foregoing, including any option

20389 to purchase or sell any such

20390 security, certificate of

20391 deposit, mortgage loan,

20392 interest, group or index, or

20393 option (whether or not the

20394 settlement is in connection with

20395 any agreement or transaction

20396 referred to in any of items

20397 (aa), (bb), and (dd) through

20398 (kk));

20399 ``(dd) any margin loan;

20400 ``(ee) any extension of

20401 credit for the clearance or

20402 settlement of securities

20403 transactions;

20404 ``(ff) any loan transaction

20405 coupled with a securities collar

20406 transaction, any prepaid

20407 securities forward transaction,

20408 or any total return swap

20409 transaction coupled with a

20410 securities sale transaction;

20411 ``(gg) any other agreement

20412 or transaction that is similar

20413 to any agreement or transaction

20414 referred to in this subclause;

20415 ``(hh) any combination of

20416 the agreements or transactions

20417 referred to in this subclause;

20418 ``(ii) any option to enter

20419 into any agreement or

20420 transaction referred to in this

20421 subclause;

20422 ``(jj) a master agreement

20423 that provides for an agreement

20424 or transaction referred to in

20425 any of items (aa) through (ii),

20426 together with all supplements to

20427 any such master agreement,

20428 without regard to whether the

20429 master agreement provides for an

20430 agreement or transaction that is

20431 not a securities contract under

20432 this subclause, except that the

20433 master agreement shall be

20434 considered to be a securities

20435 contract under this subclause

20436 only with respect to each

20437 agreement or transaction under

20438 the master agreement that is

20439 referred

20440

20441[[Page 132 STAT. 4706]]

20442

20443 to in item (aa), (bb), (cc),

20444 (dd), (ee), (ff), (gg), (hh), or

20445 (ii); and

20446 ``(kk) any security

20447 agreement or arrangement or

20448 other credit enhancement related

20449 to any agreement or transaction

20450 referred to in this subclause,

20451 including any guarantee or

20452 reimbursement obligation in

20453 connection with any agreement or

20454 transaction referred to in this

20455 subclause; and

20456 ``(II) does not include any

20457 purchase, sale, or repurchase obligation

20458 under a participation in a commercial

20459 mortgage loan unless the Corporation

20460 determines by regulation, resolution, or

20461 order to include any such agreement

20462 within the meaning of such term.

20463 ``(vii) Swap agreement.--The term `swap

20464 agreement' means--

20465 ``(I) any agreement, including the

20466 terms and conditions incorporated by

20467 reference in any such agreement, that

20468 is--

20469 ``(aa) an interest rate

20470 swap, option, future, or forward

20471 agreement, including a rate

20472 floor, rate cap, rate collar,

20473 cross-currency rate swap, and

20474 basis swap;

20475 ``(bb) a spot, same day-

20476 tomorrow, tomorrow-next,

20477 forward, or other foreign

20478 exchange precious metals or

20479 other commodity agreement;

20480 ``(cc) a currency swap,

20481 option, future, or forward

20482 agreement;

20483 ``(dd) an equity index or

20484 equity swap, option, future, or

20485 forward agreement;

20486 ``(ee) a debt index or debt

20487 swap, option, future, or forward

20488 agreement;

20489 ``(ff) a total return,

20490 credit spread or credit swap,

20491 option, future, or forward

20492 agreement;

20493 ``(gg) a commodity index or

20494 commodity swap, option, future,

20495 or forward agreement;

20496 ``(hh) a weather swap,

20497 option, future, or forward

20498 agreement;

20499 ``(ii) an emissions swap,

20500 option, future, or forward

20501 agreement; or

20502 ``(jj) an inflation swap,

20503 option, future, or forward

20504 agreement;

20505 ``(II) any agreement or transaction

20506 that is similar to any other agreement

20507 or transaction referred to in this

20508 clause and that is of a type that has

20509 been, is presently, or in the future

20510 becomes, the subject of recurrent

20511 dealings in the swap or other

20512 derivatives markets (including terms and

20513 conditions incorporated by reference in

20514 such agreement) and that is a forward,

20515 swap, future, option or spot transaction

20516 on one or more rates, currencies,

20517 commodities, equity securities or other

20518 equity instruments, debt securities or

20519 other debt instruments, quantitative

20520 measures associated with an occurrence,

20521 extent of an occurrence, or

20522

20523[[Page 132 STAT. 4707]]

20524

20525 contingency associated with a financial,

20526 commercial, or economic consequence, or

20527 economic or financial indices or

20528 measures of economic or financial risk

20529 or value;

20530 ``(III) any combination of

20531 agreements or transactions referred to

20532 in this clause;

20533 ``(IV) any option to enter into any

20534 agreement or transaction referred to in

20535 this clause;

20536 ``(V) a master agreement that

20537 provides for an agreement or transaction

20538 referred to in any of subclauses (I)

20539 through (IV), together with all

20540 supplements to any such master

20541 agreement, without regard to whether the

20542 master agreement contains an agreement

20543 or transaction that is not a swap

20544 agreement under this clause, except that

20545 the master agreement shall be considered

20546 to be a swap agreement under this clause

20547 only with respect to each agreement or

20548 transaction under the master agreement

20549 that is referred to in subclause (I),

20550 (II), (III), or (IV); and

20551 ``(VI) any security agreement or

20552 arrangement or other credit enhancement

20553 related to any agreements or

20554 transactions referred to in any of

20555 subclauses (I) through (V), including

20556 any guarantee or reimbursement

20557 obligation in connection with any

20558 agreement or transaction referred to in

20559 any such subclause.

20560 ``(viii) Transfer.--The term `transfer' means

20561 every mode, direct or indirect, absolute or

20562 conditional, voluntary or involuntary, of

20563 disposing of or parting with property or with an

20564 interest in property, including retention of title

20565 as a security interest and foreclosure of the

20566 equity of redemption of a System institution.

20567 ``(ix) Treatment of master agreement as 1

20568 agreement.--For purposes of this subparagraph--

20569 ``(I) any master agreement for any

20570 contract or agreement described in this

20571 subparagraph (or any master agreement

20572 for such a master agreement or

20573 agreements), together with all

20574 supplements to the master agreement,

20575 shall be treated as a single agreement

20576 and a single qualified financial

20577 contact; and

20578 ``(II) if a master agreement

20579 contains provisions relating to

20580 agreements or transactions that are not

20581 qualified financial contracts, the

20582 master agreement shall be deemed to be a

20583 qualified financial contract only with

20584 respect to those transactions that are

20585 themselves qualified financial

20586 contracts.

20587 ``(B) Rights of parties to contracts.--Subject to

20588 paragraphs (9) and (10), and notwithstanding any other

20589 provision of this Act (other than subsection (b)(9) and

20590 section 5.61(d)) or any other Federal or State law, no

20591 person shall be stayed or prohibited from exercising--

20592 ``(i) any right such person has to cause the

20593 termination, liquidation, or acceleration of any

20594 qualified financial contract with a System

20595 institution which arises upon the appointment of

20596 the Corporation as

20597

20598[[Page 132 STAT. 4708]]

20599

20600 receiver for such System institution at any time

20601 after such appointment;

20602 ``(ii) any right under any security agreement

20603 or arrangement or other credit enhancement related

20604 to one or more qualified financial contracts

20605 described in clause (i); or

20606 ``(iii) any right to offset or net out any

20607 termination value, payment amount, or other

20608 transfer obligation arising under, or in

20609 connection with, 1 or more contracts and

20610 agreements described in clause (i), including any

20611 master agreement for such contracts or agreements.

20612 ``(C) Applicability of other provisions.--Subsection

20613 (b)(12) shall apply in the case of any judicial action

20614 or proceeding brought against any receiver referred to

20615 in subparagraph (A), or the System institution for which

20616 such receiver was appointed, by any party to a contract

20617 or agreement described in subparagraph (B)(i) with such

20618 System institution.

20619 ``(D) Certain transfers not avoidable.--

20620 ``(i) In general.--Notwithstanding paragraph

20621 (11) or any other Federal or State law relating to

20622 the avoidance of preferential or fraudulent

20623 transfers, the Corporation, whether acting as such

20624 or as conservator or receiver of a System

20625 institution, may not avoid any transfer of money

20626 or other property in connection with any qualified

20627 financial contract with a System institution.

20628 ``(ii) Exception for certain transfers.--

20629 Clause (i) shall not apply to any transfer of

20630 money or other property in connection with any

20631 qualified financial contract with a System

20632 institution if the Corporation determines that the

20633 transferee had actual intent to hinder, delay, or

20634 defraud such System institution, the creditors of

20635 such System institution, or any conservator or

20636 receiver appointed for such System institution.

20637 ``(E) Certain protections in event of appointment of

20638 conservator.--Notwithstanding any other provision of

20639 this Act (other than subparagraph (G), paragraph (10),

20640 subsection (b)(9), and section 5.61(d)) or any other

20641 Federal or State law, no person shall be stayed or

20642 prohibited from exercising--

20643 ``(i) any right such person has to cause the

20644 termination, liquidation, or acceleration of any

20645 qualified financial contract with a System

20646 institution in a conservatorship based upon a

20647 default under such financial contract which is

20648 enforceable under applicable noninsolvency law;

20649 ``(ii) any right under any security agreement

20650 or arrangement or other credit enhancement related

20651 to one or more qualified financial contracts

20652 described in clause (i); and

20653 ``(iii) any right to offset or net out any

20654 termination values, payment amounts, or other

20655 transfer obligations arising under or in

20656 connection with such qualified financial

20657 contracts.

20658

20659[[Page 132 STAT. 4709]]

20660

20661 ``(F) Clarification.--No provision of law shall be

20662 construed as limiting the right or power of the

20663 Corporation, or authorizing any court or agency to limit

20664 or delay, in any manner, the right or power of the

20665 Corporation to transfer any qualified financial contract

20666 in accordance with paragraphs (9) and (10) or to

20667 disaffirm or repudiate any such contract in accordance

20668 with paragraph (1).

20669 ``(G) Walkaway clauses not effective.--

20670 ``(i) Definition of walkaway clause.--In this

20671 subparagraph, the term `walkaway clause' means any

20672 provision in a qualified financial contract that

20673 suspends, conditions, or extinguishes a payment

20674 obligation of a party, in whole or in part, or

20675 does not create a payment obligation of a party

20676 that would otherwise exist--

20677 ``(I) solely because of--

20678 ``(aa) the status of the

20679 party as a nondefaulting party

20680 in connection with the

20681 insolvency of a System

20682 institution that is a party to

20683 the contract; or

20684 ``(bb) the appointment of,

20685 or the exercise of rights or

20686 powers by, the Corporation as a

20687 conservator or receiver of the

20688 System institution; and

20689 ``(II) not as a result of the

20690 exercise by a party of any right to

20691 offset, setoff, or net obligations that

20692 exist under--

20693 ``(aa) the contract;

20694 ``(bb) any other contract

20695 between those parties; or

20696 ``(cc) applicable law.

20697 ``(ii) Treatment.--Notwithstanding the

20698 provisions of subparagraphs (B) and (E), no

20699 walkaway clause shall be enforceable in a

20700 qualified financial contract of a System

20701 institution in default.

20702 ``(iii) Limited suspension of certain

20703 obligations.--In the case of a qualified financial

20704 contract referred to in clause (ii), any payment

20705 or delivery obligations otherwise due from a party

20706 pursuant to the qualified financial contract shall

20707 be suspended from the time the receiver is

20708 appointed until the earlier of--

20709 ``(I) the time such party receives

20710 notice that such contract has been

20711 transferred pursuant to subparagraph

20712 (B); or

20713 ``(II) 5:00 p.m. (eastern time) on

20714 the business day following the date of

20715 the appointment of the receiver.

20716 ``(H) Recordkeeping requirements.--The Corporation,

20717 in consultation with the Farm Credit Administration, may

20718 prescribe regulations requiring more detailed

20719 recordkeeping by any System institution with respect to

20720 qualified financial contracts (including market

20721 valuations), only if such System institution is subject

20722 to subclause (I), (III), or (IV) of section

20723 5.61B(a)(1)(A)(ii).

20724 ``(9) Transfer of qualified financial contracts.--

20725 ``(A) Definitions.--In this paragraph:

20726

20727[[Page 132 STAT. 4710]]

20728

20729 ``(i) Clearing organization.--The term

20730 `clearing organization' has the meaning given the

20731 term in section 402 of the Federal Deposit

20732 Insurance Corporation Improvement Act of 1991 (12

20733 U.S.C. 4402).

20734 ``(ii) Financial institution.--The term

20735 `financial institution' means a System

20736 institution, a broker or dealer, a depository

20737 institution, a futures commission merchant, or any

20738 other institution, as determined by the

20739 Corporation by regulation to be a financial

20740 institution.

20741 ``(B) Requirement.--In making any transfer of assets

20742 or liabilities of a System institution in default which

20743 includes any qualified financial contract, the

20744 conservator or receiver for such System institution

20745 shall either--

20746 ``(i) transfer to one financial institution,

20747 other than a financial institution for which a

20748 conservator, receiver, trustee in bankruptcy, or

20749 other legal custodian has been appointed, or that

20750 is otherwise the subject of a bankruptcy or

20751 insolvency proceeding--

20752 ``(I) all qualified financial

20753 contracts between any person or any

20754 affiliate of such person and the System

20755 institution in default;

20756 ``(II) all claims of such person or

20757 any affiliate of such person against

20758 such System institution under any such

20759 contract (other than any claim which,

20760 under the terms of any such contract, is

20761 subordinated to the claims of general

20762 unsecured creditors of such System

20763 institution);

20764 ``(III) all claims of such System

20765 institution against such person or any

20766 affiliate of such person under any such

20767 contract; and

20768 ``(IV) all property securing or any

20769 other credit enhancement for any

20770 contract described in subclause (I) or

20771 any claim described in subclause (II) or

20772 (III) under any such contract; or

20773 ``(ii) transfer none of the qualified

20774 financial contracts, claims, property or other

20775 credit enhancement referred to in clause (i) (with

20776 respect to such person and any affiliate of such

20777 person).

20778 ``(C) Transfer to foreign bank, foreign financial

20779 institution, or branch or agency of a foreign bank or

20780 financial institution.--In transferring any qualified

20781 financial contracts and related claims and property

20782 under subparagraph (B)(i), the conservator or receiver

20783 for the System institution shall not make such transfer

20784 to a foreign bank, financial institution organized under

20785 the laws of a foreign country, or a branch or agency of

20786 a foreign bank or financial institution unless, under

20787 the law applicable to such bank, financial institution,

20788 branch or agency, to the qualified financial contracts,

20789 and to any netting contract, any security agreement or

20790 arrangement or other credit enhancement related to one

20791 or more qualified financial contracts, the contractual

20792 rights of the parties to such qualified financial

20793 contracts, netting contracts, security agreements or

20794 arrangements, or other credit enhancements are

20795 enforceable substantially to the same extent as

20796 permitted under this section.

20797

20798[[Page 132 STAT. 4711]]

20799

20800 ``(D) Transfer of contracts subject to the rules of

20801 a clearing organization.--In the event that a

20802 conservator or receiver transfers any qualified

20803 financial contract and related claims, property, and

20804 credit enhancements pursuant to subparagraph (B)(i) and

20805 such contract is cleared by or subject to the rules of a

20806 clearing organization, the clearing organization shall

20807 not be required to accept the transferee as a member by

20808 virtue of the transfer.

20809 ``(10) Notification of transfer.--

20810 ``(A) Definition of business day.--In this

20811 paragraph, the term `business day' means any day other

20812 than any Saturday, Sunday, or any day on which either

20813 the New York Stock Exchange or the Federal Reserve Bank

20814 of New York is closed.

20815 ``(B) Notification.--If--

20816 ``(i) the conservator or receiver for a System

20817 institution in default makes any transfer of the

20818 assets and liabilities of such System institution;

20819 and

20820 ``(ii) the transfer includes any qualified

20821 financial contract, the conservator or receiver

20822 shall notify any person who is a party to any such

20823 contract of such transfer by 5:00 p.m. (eastern

20824 time) on the business day following the date of

20825 the appointment of the receiver in the case of a

20826 receivership, or the business day following such

20827 transfer in the case of a conservatorship.

20828 ``(C) Certain rights not enforceable.--

20829 ``(i) Receivership.--A person who is a party

20830 to a qualified financial contract with a System

20831 institution may not exercise any right that such

20832 person has to terminate, liquidate, or net such

20833 contract under paragraph (8)(B) of this

20834 subsection, solely by reason of or incidental to

20835 the appointment of a receiver for the System

20836 institution (or the insolvency or financial

20837 condition of the System institution for which the

20838 receiver has been appointed)--

20839 ``(I) until 5:00 p.m. (eastern time)

20840 on the business day following the date

20841 of the appointment of the receiver; or

20842 ``(II) after the person has received

20843 notice that the contract has been

20844 transferred pursuant to paragraph

20845 (9)(B).

20846 ``(ii) Conservatorship.--A person who is a

20847 party to a qualified financial contract with a

20848 System institution may not exercise any right that

20849 such person has to terminate, liquidate, or net

20850 such contract under paragraph (8)(E) of this

20851 subsection, solely by reason of or incidental to

20852 the appointment of a conservator for the System

20853 institution (or the insolvency or financial

20854 condition of the System institution for which the

20855 conservator has been appointed).

20856 ``(iii) Notice.--For purposes of this

20857 paragraph, the Corporation as receiver or

20858 conservator of a System institution shall be

20859 deemed to have notified a person who is a party to

20860 a qualified financial contract with such System

20861 institution if the Corporation has taken

20862

20863[[Page 132 STAT. 4712]]

20864

20865 steps reasonably calculated to provide notice to

20866 such person by the time specified in subparagraph

20867 (B).

20868 ``(D) Treatment of bridge system institutions.--The

20869 following System institutions shall not be considered to

20870 be a financial institution for which a conservator,

20871 receiver, trustee in bankruptcy, or other legal

20872 custodian has been appointed or which is otherwise the

20873 subject of a bankruptcy or insolvency proceeding for

20874 purposes of paragraph (9):

20875 ``(i) A bridge System bank.

20876 ``(ii) A System institution organized by the

20877 Corporation or the Farm Credit Administration, for

20878 which a conservator is appointed either--

20879 ``(I) immediately upon the

20880 organization of the System institution;

20881 or

20882 ``(II) at the time of a purchase and

20883 assumption transaction between the

20884 System institution and the Corporation

20885 as receiver for a System institution in

20886 default.

20887 ``(11) Disaffirmance or repudiation of qualified financial

20888 contracts.--In exercising the rights of disaffirmance or

20889 repudiation of a conservator or receiver with respect to any

20890 qualified financial contract to which a System institution is a

20891 party, the conservator or receiver for such System institution

20892 shall either--

20893 ``(A) disaffirm or repudiate all qualified financial

20894 contracts between--

20895 ``(i) any person or any affiliate of such

20896 person; and

20897 ``(ii) the System institution in default; or

20898 ``(B) disaffirm or repudiate none of the qualified

20899 financial contracts referred to in subparagraph (A)

20900 (with respect to such person or any affiliate of such

20901 person).

20902 ``(12) Certain security interests not avoidable.--No

20903 provision of this subsection shall be construed as permitting

20904 the avoidance of any legally enforceable or perfected security

20905 interest in any of the assets of any System institution except

20906 where such an interest is taken in contemplation of the System

20907 institution's insolvency or with the intent to hinder, delay, or

20908 defraud the System institution or the creditors of such System

20909 institution.

20910 ``(13) Authority to enforce contracts.--

20911 ``(A) In general.--The conservator or receiver may

20912 enforce any contract, other than a director's or

20913 officer's liability insurance contract or a System

20914 institution bond, entered into by the System institution

20915 notwithstanding any provision of the contract providing

20916 for termination, default, acceleration, or exercise of

20917 rights upon, or solely by reason of, insolvency or the

20918 appointment of or the exercise of rights or powers by a

20919 conservator or receiver.

20920 ``(B) Certain rights not affected.--No provision of

20921 this paragraph may be construed as impairing or

20922 affecting any right of the conservator or receiver to

20923 enforce or recover under a director's or officer's

20924 liability insurance contract or institution bond under

20925 other applicable law.

20926 ``(C) Consent requirement.--

20927

20928[[Page 132 STAT. 4713]]

20929

20930 ``(i) In general.--Except as otherwise

20931 provided by this section, no person may exercise

20932 any right or power to terminate, accelerate, or

20933 declare a default under any contract to which the

20934 System institution is a party, or to obtain

20935 possession of or exercise control over any

20936 property of the System institution or affect any

20937 contractual rights of the System institution,

20938 without the consent of the conservator or

20939 receiver, as appropriate, during the 45-day period

20940 beginning on the date of the appointment of the

20941 conservator, or during the 90-day period beginning

20942 on the date of the appointment of the receiver, as

20943 applicable.

20944 ``(ii) Certain exceptions.--No provision of

20945 this subparagraph shall apply to a director or

20946 officer liability insurance contract or an

20947 institution bond, to the rights of parties to

20948 certain qualified financial contracts pursuant to

20949 paragraph (8), or shall be construed as permitting

20950 the conservator or receiver to fail to comply with

20951 otherwise enforceable provisions of such contract.

20952 ``(14) Exception for federal reserve and the united states

20953 treasury.--No provision of this subsection shall apply with

20954 respect to--

20955 ``(A) any extension of credit from any Federal

20956 Reserve bank or the United States Treasury to any System

20957 institution; or

20958 ``(B) any security interest in the assets of the

20959 System institution securing any such extension of

20960 credit.

20961 ``(15) Savings clause.--The meanings of terms used in this

20962 subsection--

20963 ``(A) are applicable for purposes of this subsection

20964 only; and

20965 ``(B) shall not be construed or applied so as to
