20966 challenge or affect the characterization, definition, or

20967 treatment of any similar terms under any other law,

20968 regulation, or rule, including--

20969 ``(i) the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (12 U.S.C.

20970 1811 note; Public Law 106-102);

20971 ``(ii) the Legal Certainty for Bank Products

20972 Act of 2000 (7 U.S.C. 27 et seq.);

20973 ``(iii) the securities laws (as that term is

20974 defined in section 3(a) of the Securities Exchange

20975 Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78c(a))); and

20976 ``(iv) the Commodity Exchange Act (7 U.S.C. 1

20977 et seq.).

20978

20979 ``(d) Valuation of Claims in Default.--

20980 ``(1) In general.--Notwithstanding any other provision of

20981 Federal law or the law of any State and regardless of the method

20982 which the Corporation determines to utilize with respect to a

20983 System institution in default or in danger of default, including

20984 transactions authorized under subsection (h) and section

20985 5.61(a), this subsection shall govern the rights of the

20986 creditors of such System institution.

20987 ``(2) Maximum liability.--The maximum liability of the

20988 Corporation, acting as receiver or in any other capacity, to any

20989 person having a claim against the receiver or the System

20990 institution for which such receiver is appointed shall equal

20991

20992[[Page 132 STAT. 4714]]

20993

20994 the amount such claimant would have received if the Corporation

20995 had liquidated the assets and liabilities of such System

20996 institution without exercising the Corporation's authority under

20997 subsection (h) or section 5.61(a).

20998 ``(3) Additional payments authorized.--

20999 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation may, in its

21000 discretion and in the interests of minimizing its

21001 losses, use its own resources to make additional

21002 payments or credit additional amounts to or with respect

21003 to or for the account of any claimant or category of

21004 claimants. Notwithstanding any other provision of

21005 Federal or State law, or the constitution of any State,

21006 the Corporation shall not be obligated, as a result of

21007 having made any such payment or credited any such amount

21008 to or with respect to or for the account of any claimant

21009 or category of claimants, to make payments to any other

21010 claimant or category of claimants.

21011 ``(B) Manner of payment.--The Corporation may make

21012 the payments or credit the amounts specified in

21013 subparagraph (A) directly to the claimants or may make

21014 such payments or credit such amounts to an open System

21015 institution to induce such System institution to accept

21016 liability for such claims.

21017

21018 ``(e) Limitation on Court Action.--Except as provided in this

21019section, no court may take any action, except at the written request of

21020the Board of Directors, to restrain or affect the exercise of powers or

21021functions of the Corporation as a conservator or a receiver.

21022 ``(f) Liability of Directors and Officers.--

21023 ``(1) In general.--A director or officer of a System

21024 institution may be held personally liable for monetary damages

21025 in any civil action--

21026 ``(A) brought by, on behalf of, or at the request or

21027 direction of the Corporation;

21028 ``(B) prosecuted wholly or partially for the benefit

21029 of the Corporation--

21030 ``(i) acting as conservator or receiver of

21031 that System institution;

21032 ``(ii) acting based on a suit, claim, or cause

21033 of action purchased from, assigned by, or

21034 otherwise conveyed by that receiver or

21035 conservator; or

21036 ``(iii) acting based on a suit, claim, or

21037 cause of action purchased from, assigned by, or

21038 otherwise conveyed in whole or in part by a System

21039 institution or an affiliate of a System

21040 institution in connection with assistance provided

21041 under section 5.61(a); and

21042 ``(C) for, as determined under the applicable State

21043 law--

21044 ``(i) gross negligence; or

21045 ``(ii) any similar conduct, including conduct

21046 that demonstrates a greater disregard of a duty of

21047 care than gross negligence, such as intentional

21048 tortious conduct.

21049 ``(2) Effect.--Nothing in paragraph (1) impairs or affects

21050 any right of the Corporation under any other applicable law.

21051

21052 ``(g) Damages.--In any proceeding related to any claim against a

21053System institution's director, officer, employee, agent, attorney,

21054accountant, appraiser, or any other party employed by or providing

21055

21056[[Page 132 STAT. 4715]]

21057

21058services to a System institution, recoverable damages determined to

21059result from the improvident or otherwise improper use or investment of

21060any System institution's assets shall include principal losses and

21061appropriate interest.

21062 ``(h) Bridge Farm Credit System Banks.--

21063 ``(1) Organization.--

21064 ``(A) Purpose.--

21065 ``(i) In general.--When 1 or more System banks

21066 are in default, or when the Corporation

21067 anticipates that 1 or more System banks may become

21068 in default, the Corporation may, in its

21069 discretion, organize, and the Farm Credit

21070 Administration may, in its discretion, charter, 1

21071 or more System banks, with the powers and

21072 attributes of System banks, subject to the

21073 provisions of this subsection, to be referred to

21074 as `bridge System banks'.

21075 ``(ii) Intent of congress.--It is the intent

21076 of the Congress that, in order to prevent

21077 unnecessary hardship or losses to the customers of

21078 any System bank in default with respect to which a

21079 bridge System bank is chartered, the Corporation

21080 should--

21081 ``(I) continue to honor commitments

21082 made by the System bank in default to

21083 creditworthy customers; and

21084 ``(II) not interrupt or terminate

21085 adequately secured loans which are

21086 transferred under this subsection and

21087 are being repaid by the debtor in

21088 accordance with the terms of the loan

21089 instrument.

21090 ``(B) Authorities.--Once chartered by the Farm

21091 Credit Administration, the bridge System bank may--

21092 ``(i) assume such liabilities of the System

21093 bank or banks in default or in danger of default

21094 as the Corporation may, in its discretion,

21095 determine to be appropriate;

21096 ``(ii) purchase such assets of the System bank

21097 or banks in default or in danger of default as the

21098 Corporation may, in its discretion, determine to

21099 be appropriate; and

21100 ``(iii) perform any other temporary function

21101 which the Corporation may, in its discretion,

21102 prescribe in accordance with this Act.

21103 ``(C) Articles of association.--The articles of

21104 association and organization certificate of a bridge

21105 System bank as approved by the Corporation shall be

21106 executed by 3 representatives designated by the

21107 Corporation.

21108 ``(D) Interim directors.--A bridge System bank shall

21109 have an interim board of directors consisting of not

21110 fewer than 5 nor more than 10 members appointed by the

21111 Corporation.

21112 ``(2) Chartering.--

21113 ``(A) Conditions.--The Farm Credit Administration

21114 may charter a bridge System bank only if the Board of

21115 Directors determines that--

21116 ``(i) the amount which is reasonably necessary

21117 to operate such bridge System bank will not exceed

21118 the amount which is reasonably necessary to save

21119 the cost of liquidating 1 or more System banks in

21120 default or

21121

21122[[Page 132 STAT. 4716]]

21123

21124 in danger of default with respect to which the

21125 bridge System bank is chartered;

21126 ``(ii) the continued operation of such System

21127 bank or banks in default or in danger of default

21128 with respect to which the bridge System bank is

21129 chartered is essential to provide adequate farm

21130 credit services in the 1 or more communities where

21131 each such System bank in default or in danger of

21132 default is or was providing those farm credit

21133 services; or

21134 ``(iii) the continued operation of such System

21135 bank or banks in default or in danger of default

21136 with respect to which the bridge System bank is

21137 chartered is in the best interest of the Farm

21138 Credit System or the public.

21139 ``(B) Bridge system bank treated as being in default

21140 for certain purposes.--A bridge System bank shall be

21141 treated as being in default at such times and for such

21142 purposes as the Corporation may, in its discretion,

21143 determine.

21144 ``(C) Management.--A bridge System bank, upon the

21145 granting of its charter, shall be under the management

21146 of a board of directors consisting of not fewer than 5

21147 nor more than 10 members appointed by the Corporation,

21148 in consultation with the Farm Credit Administration.

21149 ``(D) Bylaws.--The board of directors of a bridge

21150 System bank shall adopt such bylaws as may be approved

21151 by the Corporation.

21152 ``(3) Transfer of assets and liabilities.--

21153 ``(A) Transfer upon grant of charter.--Upon the

21154 granting of a charter to a bridge System bank pursuant

21155 to this subsection, the Corporation, as receiver, may

21156 transfer any assets and liabilities of the System bank

21157 to the bridge System bank in accordance with paragraph

21158 (1).

21159 ``(B) Subsequent transfers.--At any time after a

21160 charter is granted to a bridge System bank, the

21161 Corporation, as receiver, may transfer any assets and

21162 liabilities of such System bank in default as the

21163 Corporation may, in its discretion, determine to be

21164 appropriate in accordance with paragraph (1).

21165 ``(C) Effective without approval.--The transfer of

21166 any assets or liabilities of a System bank in default or

21167 danger of default transferred to a bridge System bank

21168 shall be effective without any further approval under

21169 Federal or State law, assignment, or consent with

21170 respect thereto.

21171 ``(4) Powers of bridge system banks.--Each bridge System

21172 bank chartered under this subsection shall, to the extent

21173 described in the charter of the System bank in default with

21174 respect to which the bridge System bank is chartered, have all

21175 corporate powers of, and be subject to the same provisions of

21176 law as, any System bank, except that--

21177 ``(A) the Corporation may--

21178 ``(i) remove the interim directors and

21179 directors of a bridge System bank;

21180 ``(ii) fix the compensation of members of the

21181 interim board of directors and the board of

21182 directors and senior

21183

21184[[Page 132 STAT. 4717]]

21185

21186 management, as determined by the Corporation in

21187 its discretion, of a bridge System bank; and

21188 ``(iii) waive any requirement established

21189 under Federal or State law which would otherwise

21190 be applicable with respect to directors of a

21191 bridge System bank, on the condition that the

21192 waiver of any requirement established by the Farm

21193 Credit Administration shall require the

21194 concurrence of the Farm Credit Administration;

21195 ``(B) the Corporation may indemnify the

21196 representatives for purposes of paragraph (1)(B) and the

21197 interim directors, directors, officers, employees, and

21198 agents of a bridge System bank on such terms as the

21199 Corporation determines to be appropriate;

21200 ``(C) no requirement under any provision of law

21201 relating to the capital of a System institution shall

21202 apply with respect to a bridge System bank;

21203 ``(D) the Farm Credit Administration Board may

21204 establish a limitation on the extent to which any person

21205 may become indebted to a bridge System bank without

21206 regard to the amount of the bridge System bank's capital

21207 or surplus;

21208 ``(E)(i) the board of directors of a bridge System

21209 bank shall elect a chairperson who may also serve in the

21210 position of chief executive officer, except that such

21211 person shall not serve either as chairperson or as chief

21212 executive officer without the prior approval of the

21213 Corporation; and

21214 ``(ii) the board of directors of a bridge System

21215 bank may appoint a chief executive officer who is not

21216 also the chairperson, except that such person shall not

21217 serve as chief executive officer without the prior

21218 approval of the Corporation;

21219 ``(F) the Farm Credit Administration may waive any

21220 requirement for a fidelity bond with respect to a bridge

21221 System bank at the request of the Corporation;

21222 ``(G) any judicial action to which a bridge System

21223 bank becomes a party by virtue of its acquisition of any

21224 assets or assumption of any liabilities of a System bank

21225 in default shall be stayed from further proceedings for

21226 a period of up to 45 days at the request of the bridge

21227 System bank;

21228 ``(H) no agreement which tends to diminish or defeat

21229 the right, title or interest of a bridge System bank in

21230 any asset of a System bank in default acquired by it

21231 shall be valid against the bridge System bank unless

21232 such agreement--

21233 ``(i) is in writing;

21234 ``(ii) was executed by such System bank in

21235 default and the person or persons claiming an

21236 adverse interest thereunder, including the

21237 obligor, contemporaneously with the acquisition of

21238 the asset by such System bank in default;

21239 ``(iii) was approved by the board of directors

21240 of such System bank in default or its loan

21241 committee, which approval shall be reflected in

21242 the minutes of said board or committee; and

21243

21244[[Page 132 STAT. 4718]]

21245

21246 ``(iv) has been, continuously from the time of

21247 its execution, an official record of such System

21248 bank in default;

21249 ``(I) notwithstanding subsection 5.61(d)(2), any

21250 agreement relating to an extension of credit between a

21251 System bank, Federal Reserve bank, or the United States

21252 Treasury and any System institution which was executed

21253 before the extension of credit by such lender to such

21254 System institution shall be treated as having been

21255 executed contemporaneously with such extension of credit

21256 for purposes of subparagraph (H); and

21257 ``(J) except with the prior approval of the

21258 Corporation and the concurrence of the Farm Credit

21259 Administration, a bridge System bank may not, in any

21260 transaction or series of transactions, issue capital

21261 stock or be a party to any merger, consolidation,

21262 disposition of substantially all of the assets or

21263 liabilities of the bridge System bank, sale or exchange

21264 of capital stock, or similar transaction, or change its

21265 charter.

21266 ``(5) Capital.--

21267 ``(A) No capital required.--The Corporation shall

21268 not be required to--

21269 ``(i) issue any capital stock on behalf of a

21270 bridge System bank chartered under this

21271 subsection; or

21272 ``(ii) purchase any capital stock of a bridge

21273 System bank, except that notwithstanding any other

21274 provision of Federal or State law, the Corporation

21275 may purchase and retain capital stock of a bridge

21276 System bank in such amounts and on such terms as

21277 the Corporation, in its discretion, determines to

21278 be appropriate.

21279 ``(B) Operating funds in lieu of capital.--Upon the

21280 organization of a bridge System bank, and thereafter, as

21281 the Corporation may, in its discretion, determine to be

21282 necessary or advisable, the Corporation may make

21283 available to the bridge System bank, upon such terms and

21284 conditions and in such form and amounts as the

21285 Corporation may in its discretion determine, funds for

21286 the operation of the bridge System bank in lieu of

21287 capital.

21288 ``(C) Authority to issue capital stock.--Whenever

21289 the Farm Credit Administration Board determines it is

21290 advisable to do so, the Corporation shall cause capital

21291 stock of a bridge System bank to be issued and offered

21292 for sale in such amounts and on such terms and

21293 conditions as the Corporation may, in its discretion,

21294 determine.

21295 ``(6) Employee status.--Representatives for purposes of

21296 paragraph (1)(C), interim directors, directors, officers,

21297 employees, or agents of a bridge System bank are not, solely by

21298 virtue of service in any such capacity, officers or employees of

21299 the United States. Any employee of the Corporation, the Farm

21300 Credit Administration, or any Federal instrumentality who serves

21301 at the request of the Corporation as a representative for

21302 purposes of paragraph (1)(C), interim director, director,

21303 officer, employee, or agent of a bridge System bank shall not--

21304 ``(A) solely by virtue of service in any such

21305 capacity lose any existing status as an officer or

21306 employee of the United States for purposes of any

21307 provision of law; or

21308

21309[[Page 132 STAT. 4719]]

21310

21311 ``(B) receive any salary or benefits for service in

21312 any such capacity with respect to a bridge System bank

21313 in addition to such salary or benefits as are obtained

21314 through employment with the Corporation or such Federal

21315 instrumentality.

21316 ``(7) Assistance authorized.--The Corporation may, in its

21317 discretion, provide assistance under section 5.61(a) to

21318 facilitate any merger or consolidation of a bridge System bank

21319 in the same manner and to the same extent as such assistance may

21320 be provided to a qualifying insured System bank (as defined in

21321 section 5.61(a)(2)(B)) or to facilitate a bridge System bank's

21322 acquisition of any assets or the assumption of any liabilities

21323 of a System bank in default or in danger of default.

21324 ``(8) Duration of bridge system banks.--Subject to

21325 paragraphs (10) and (11), the status of a bridge System bank as

21326 such shall terminate at the end of the 2-year period following

21327 the date it was granted a charter. The Farm Credit

21328 Administration Board may, in its discretion, extend the status

21329 of the bridge System bank as such for 3 additional 1-year

21330 periods.

21331 ``(9) Termination of bridge system banks status.--The status

21332 of any bridge System bank as such shall terminate upon the

21333 earliest of--

21334 ``(A) the merger or consolidation of the bridge

21335 System bank with a System institution that is not a

21336 bridge System bank, on the condition that the merger or

21337 consolidation shall be subject to the approval of the

21338 Farm Credit Administration;

21339 ``(B) at the election of the Corporation and with

21340 the approval of the Farm Credit Administration, the sale

21341 of a majority or all of the capital stock of the bridge

21342 System bank to a System institution or another bridge

21343 System bank;

21344 ``(C) at the election of the Corporation, and with

21345 the approval of the Farm Credit Administration, either

21346 the assumption of all or substantially all of the

21347 liabilities of the bridge System bank, or the

21348 acquisition of all or substantially all of the assets of

21349 the bridge System bank, by a System institution that is

21350 not a bridge System bank or other entity as permitted

21351 under applicable law; and

21352 ``(D) the expiration of the period provided in

21353 paragraph (8), or the earlier dissolution of the bridge

21354 System bank as provided in paragraph (11).

21355 ``(10) Effect of termination events.--

21356 ``(A) Merger or consolidation.--A bridge System bank

21357 that participates in a merger or consolidation as

21358 provided in paragraph (9)(A) shall be for all purposes a

21359 System institution, with all the rights, powers, and

21360 privileges thereof, and such merger or consolidation

21361 shall be conducted in accordance with, and shall have

21362 the effect provided in, the provisions of applicable

21363 law.

21364 ``(B) Charter conversion.--Following the sale of a

21365 majority or all of the capital stock of the bridge

21366 System bank as provided in paragraph (9)(B), the Farm

21367 Credit Administration Board may amend the charter of the

21368 bridge System bank to reflect the termination of the

21369 status of the bridge System bank as such, whereupon the

21370 System bank shall remain a System bank, with all of the

21371 rights,

21372

21373[[Page 132 STAT. 4720]]

21374

21375 powers, and privileges thereof, subject to all laws and

21376 regulations applicable thereto.

21377 ``(C) Assumption of liabilities and sale of

21378 assets.--Following the assumption of all or

21379 substantially all of the liabilities of the bridge

21380 System bank, or the sale of all or substantially all of

21381 the assets of the bridge System bank, as provided in

21382 paragraph (9)(C), at the election of the Corporation,

21383 the bridge System bank may retain its status as such for

21384 the period provided in paragraph (8).

21385 ``(D) Amendments to charter.--Following the

21386 consummation of a transaction described in subparagraph

21387 (A), (B), or (C) of paragraph (9), the charter of the

21388 resulting System institution shall be amended by the

21389 Farm Credit Administration to reflect the termination of

21390 bridge System bank status, if appropriate.

21391 ``(11) Dissolution of bridge system bank.--

21392 ``(A) In general.--Notwithstanding any other

21393 provision of State or Federal law, if the bridge System

21394 bank's status as such has not previously been terminated

21395 by the occurrence of an event specified in subparagraph

21396 (A), (B), or (C) of paragraph (9)--

21397 ``(i) the Corporation, after consultation with

21398 the Farm Credit Administration, may, in its

21399 discretion, dissolve a bridge System bank in

21400 accordance with this paragraph at any time; and

21401 ``(ii) the Corporation, after consultation

21402 with the Farm Credit Administration, shall

21403 promptly commence dissolution proceedings in

21404 accordance with this paragraph upon the expiration

21405 of the 2-year period following the date the bridge

21406 System bank was chartered, or any extension

21407 thereof, as provided in paragraph (8).

21408 ``(B) Procedures.--The Farm Credit Administration

21409 Board shall appoint the Corporation as receiver for a

21410 bridge System bank upon determining to dissolve the

21411 bridge System bank. The Corporation as such receiver

21412 shall wind up the affairs of the bridge System bank in

21413 conformity with the provisions of law relating to the

21414 liquidation of closed System banks. With respect to any

21415 such bridge System bank, the Corporation as such

21416 receiver shall have all the rights, powers, and

21417 privileges and shall perform the duties related to the

21418 exercise of such rights, powers, or privileges granted

21419 by law to a receiver of any insured System bank and,

21420 notwithstanding any other provision of law in the

21421 exercise of such rights, powers, and privileges, the

21422 Corporation shall not be subject to the direction or

21423 supervision of any State agency or other Federal agency.

21424 ``(12) Multiple bridge system banks.--The Corporation may,

21425 in the Corporation's discretion, organize, and the Farm Credit

21426 Administration may, in its discretion, charter, 2 or more bridge

21427 System banks under this subsection to assume any liabilities and

21428 purchase any assets of a single System institution in default.

21429

21430 ``(i) Certain Sales of Assets Prohibited.--

21431 ``(1) Persons who engaged in improper conduct with, or

21432 caused losses to, system institutions.--The Corporation shall

21433 prescribe regulations which, at a minimum, shall prohibit

21434

21435[[Page 132 STAT. 4721]]

21436

21437 the sale of assets of a failed System institution by the

21438 Corporation to--

21439 ``(A) any person who--

21440 ``(i) has defaulted, or was a member of a

21441 partnership or an officer or director of a

21442 corporation that has defaulted, on 1 or more

21443 obligations the aggregate amount of which exceed

21444 $1,000,000, to such failed System institution;

21445 ``(ii) has been found to have engaged in

21446 fraudulent activity in connection with any

21447 obligation referred to in clause (i); and

21448 ``(iii) proposes to purchase any such asset in

21449 whole or in part through the use of the proceeds

21450 of a loan or advance of credit from the

21451 Corporation or from any System institution for

21452 which the Corporation has been appointed as

21453 conservator or receiver;

21454 ``(B) any person who participated, as an officer or

21455 director of such failed System institution or of any

21456 affiliate of such System institution, in a material way

21457 in transactions that resulted in a substantial loss to

21458 such failed System institution;

21459 ``(C) any person who has been removed from, or

21460 prohibited from participating in the affairs of, such

21461 failed System institution pursuant to any final

21462 enforcement action by the Farm Credit Administration;

21463 ``(D) any person who has demonstrated a pattern or

21464 practice of defalcation regarding obligations to such

21465 failed System institution; or

21466 ``(E) any person who is in default on any loan or

21467 other extension of credit from such failed System

21468 institution which, if not paid, will cause substantial

21469 loss to the System institution or the Corporation.

21470 ``(2) Defaulted debtors.--Except as provided in paragraph

21471 (3), any person who is in default on any loan or other extension

21472 of credit from the System institution, which, if not paid, will

21473 cause substantial loss to the System institution or the

21474 Corporation, may not purchase any asset from the conservator or

21475 receiver.

21476 ``(3) Settlement of claims.--Paragraph (1) shall not apply

21477 to the sale or transfer by the Corporation of any asset of any

21478 System institution to any person if the sale or transfer of the

21479 asset resolves or settles, or is part of the resolution or

21480 settlement, of--

21481 ``(A) 1 or more claims that have been, or could have

21482 been, asserted by the Corporation against the person; or

21483 ``(B) obligations owed by the person to any System

21484 institution, or the Corporation.

21485 ``(4) Definition of default.--For purposes of this

21486 subsection, the term `default' means a failure to comply with

21487 the terms of a loan or other obligation to such an extent that

21488 the property securing the obligation is foreclosed upon.

21489

21490 ``(j) Expedited Procedures for Certain Claims.--

21491 ``(1) Time for filing notice of appeal.--The notice of

21492 appeal of any order, whether interlocutory or final, entered in

21493 any case brought by the Corporation against a System

21494 institution's director, officer, employee, agent, attorney,

21495 accountant, or appraiser or any other person employed by or

21496

21497[[Page 132 STAT. 4722]]

21498

21499 providing services to a System institution shall be filed not

21500 later than 30 days after the date of entry of the order. The

21501 hearing of the appeal shall be held not later than 120 days

21502 after the date of the notice of appeal. The appeal shall be

21503 decided not later than 180 days after the date of the notice of

21504 appeal.

21505 ``(2) Scheduling.--A court of the United States shall

21506 expedite the consideration of any case brought by the

21507 Corporation against a System institution's director, officer,

21508 employee, agent, attorney, accountant, or appraiser or any other

21509 person employed by or providing services to a System

21510 institution. As far as practicable the court shall give such

21511 case priority on its docket.

21512 ``(3) Judicial discretion.--The court may modify the

21513 schedule and limitations stated in paragraphs (1) and (2) in a

21514 particular case, based on a specific finding that the ends of

21515 justice that would be served by making such a modification would

21516 outweigh the best interest of the public in having the case

21517 resolved expeditiously.

21518

21519 ``(k) Bond Not Required; Agents; Fee.--The Corporation as

21520conservator or receiver of a System institution shall not be required to

21521furnish bond and may appoint an agent or agents to assist in its duties

21522as such conservator or receiver. All fees, compensation, and expenses of

21523liquidation and administration shall be fixed by the Corporation and may

21524be paid by it out of funds coming into its possession as such

21525conservator or receiver.

21526 ``(l) Consultation Regarding Conservatorships and Receiverships.--To

21527the extent practicable--

21528 ``(1) the Farm Credit Administration shall consult with the

21529 Corporation prior to taking a preresolution action concerning a

21530 System institution that may result in a conservatorship or

21531 receivership; and

21532 ``(2) the Corporation, acting in the capacity of the

21533 Corporation as a conservator or receiver, shall consult with the

21534 Farm Credit Administration prior to taking any significant

21535 action impacting System institutions or service to System

21536 borrowers.

21537

21538 ``(m) Applicability.--This section shall become applicable with

21539respect to the power of the Corporation to act as a conservator or

21540receiver on the date on which the Farm Credit Administration appoints

21541the Corporation as a conservator or receiver under section 4.12 or

215428.41.''.

21543SEC. 5413. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2008w.&gt;&gt; REPORTING.

21544

21545 (a) Definition of Farm Loan.--In this section, the term ``farm

21546loan'' means--

21547 (1) a farm ownership loan under subtitle A of the

21548 Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1922 et

21549 seq.); and

21550 (2) an operating loan under subtitle B of that Act (7 U.S.C.

21551 1941 et seq.).

21552

21553 (b) Reports.--

21554 (1) Preparation.--For each fiscal year, the Secretary shall

21555 prepare a report that includes--

21556 (A) aggregate data based on a review of each

21557 outstanding farm loan made or guaranteed by the

21558 Secretary describing, for the United States and for each

21559 State and county in the United States--

21560 (i) the age of the recipient producer;

21561

21562[[Page 132 STAT. 4723]]

21563

21564 (ii) the duration that the recipient producer

21565 has engaged in agricultural production;

21566 (iii) the size of the farm or ranch of the

21567 recipient producer;

21568 (iv) the race, ethnicity, and gender of the

21569 recipient producer;

21570 (v) the agricultural commodity or commodities,

21571 or type of enterprise, for which the loan was

21572 secured;

21573 (vi) the amount of the farm loan made or

21574 guaranteed;

21575 (vii) the type of the farm loan made or

21576 guaranteed; and

21577 (viii) the default rate of the farm loan made

21578 or guaranteed;

21579 (B) for each State and county in the United States,

21580 data demonstrating the number of outstanding farm loans

21581 made or guaranteed, according to loan size cohort; and

21582 (C) an assessment of actual loans made or guaranteed

21583 as measured against target participation rates for

21584 beginning and socially disadvantaged farmers, broken

21585 down by State, as described in sections 346(b)(2) and

21586 355 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act

21587 (7 U.S.C. 1994(b)(2), 2003).

21588 (2) Submission of report.--The report described in paragraph

21589 (1) shall be--

21590 (A) submitted--

21591 (i) to--

21592 (I) the Committee on Agriculture of

21593 the House of Representatives;

21594 (II) the Committee on Appropriations

21595 of the House of Representatives;

21596 (III) the Committee on Agriculture,

21597 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate;

21598 and

21599 (IV) the Committee on Appropriations

21600 of the Senate; and

21601 (ii) not later than December 30, 2019, and

21602 annually thereafter; and

21603 (B) made publicly available not later than 90 days

21604 after the date described in subparagraph (A)(ii).

21605

21606 (c) Comprehensive Review.--

21607 (1) In general.--Not later than 4 years after the date of

21608 enactment of this Act (and every 5 years thereafter), the

21609 Secretary shall--

21610 (A) prepare a comprehensive review of all reports

21611 submitted under subsection (b)(2);

21612 (B) identify trends within data outlined in

21613 subsection (b)(1), including the extent to which target

21614 annual participation rates for beginning and socially

21615 disadvantaged farmers (as defined by the Secretary) are

21616 being met for each loan type; and

21617 (C) provide specific actions the Department will

21618 take to improve the performance of direct and guaranteed

21619 loans with respect to underserved producers and any

21620 recommendations the Secretary may make for further

21621 congressional action.

21622 (2) Submission of comprehensive review.--The comprehensive

21623 review described in paragraph (1) shall be--

21624

21625[[Page 132 STAT. 4724]]

21626

21627 (A) submitted to--

21628 (i) the Committee on Agriculture of the House

21629 of Representatives;

21630 (ii) the Committee on Appropriations of the

21631 House of Representatives;

21632 (iii) the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition,

21633 and Forestry of the Senate; and

21634 (iv) the Committee on Appropriations of the

21635 Senate; and

21636 (B) made publicly available not later than 90 days

21637 after the date of submission under subparagraph (A).

21638

21639 (d) Privacy.--In preparing any report or review under this section,

21640the Secretary shall aggregate or de-identify the data in a manner

21641sufficient to ensure that the identity of a recipient producer

21642associated with the data cannot be ascertained.

21643SEC. 5414. STUDY ON LOAN RISK.

21644

21645 (a) Study.--The Farm Credit Administration shall conduct a study

21646that--

21647 (1) analyzes and compares the financial risks inherent in

21648 loans made, held, securitized, or purchased by Farm Credit

21649 banks, associations, and the Federal Agricultural Mortgage

21650 Corporation and how such risks are required to be capitalized

21651 under statute and regulations in effect as of the date of the

21652 enactment of this Act; and

21653 (2) assesses the feasibility of increasing the acreage

21654 exception provided in section 8.8(c)(2) of the Farm Credit Act

21655 of 1971 to 2,000 acres.

21656

21657 (b) Timeline.--The Farm Credit Administration shall provide the

21658results of the study required by subsection (a) to the Committee on

21659Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on

21660Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate no later than 180

21661days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

21662SEC. 5415. GAO REPORT ON ABILITY OF THE FARM CREDIT SYSTEM TO MEET

21663 THE AGRICULTURAL CREDIT NEEDS OF INDIAN

21664 TRIBES AND THEIR MEMBERS.

21665

21666 (a) In General.--The Comptroller General of the United States

21667shall--

21668 (1) study the agricultural credit needs of farms, ranches,

21669 and related agricultural businesses that are owned or operated

21670 by--

21671 (A) Indian tribes on tribal lands; or

21672 (B) enrolled members of Indian tribes on Indian

21673 allotments; and

21674 (2) determine whether the institutions of the Farm Credit

21675 System have sufficient authority and resources to meet the

21676 needs.

21677

21678 (b) Definition of Indian Tribe.--In subsection (a), the term

21679``Indian tribe'' means an Indian tribal entity that is eligible for

21680funding and services from the Bureau of Indian Affairs by virtue of the

21681status of the entity as an Indian tribe.

21682 (c) Report to the Congress.--Within 90 days after the date of the

21683enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States

21684shall prepare and submit to the Committees on Agriculture and on Natural

21685Resources of the House of Representatives a written report that contains

21686the findings of the study conducted under subsection (a). If the

21687Comptroller General finds that the institutions

21688

21689[[Page 132 STAT. 4725]]

21690

21691of the Farm Credit System do not have sufficient authority or resources

21692to meet the needs referred to in subsection (a), the report shall

21693include such legislative and other recommendations as the Comptroller

21694General determines would result in a system under which the needs are

21695met in an equitable and effective manner.

21696SEC. 5416. GAO REPORT ON CREDIT SERVICE TO SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED

21697 FARMERS AND RANCHERS.

21698

21699 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

21700 (1) Agricultural credit provider.--The term ``agricultural

21701 credit provider'' means--

21702 (A) a Farm Credit System institution;

21703 (B) a commercial bank;

21704 (C) the Federal Agricultural Mortgage Corporation;

21705 (D) a life insurance company; and

21706 (E) any other individual or entity, as determined by

21707 the Comptroller General of the United States.

21708 (2) Socially disadvantaged farmer or rancher.--The term

21709 ``socially disadvantaged farmer or rancher'' has the meaning

21710 given the term in section 355(e) of the Consolidated Farm and

21711 Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 2003(e)).

21712

21713 (b) Study.--The Comptroller General of the United States shall--

21714 (1) conduct a study--

21715 (A) to assess the credit and related services

21716 provided by agricultural credit providers to socially

21717 disadvantaged farmers and ranchers;

21718 (B) to review the overall participation of socially

21719 disadvantaged farmers and ranchers in the services

21720 described in subparagraph (A); and

21721 (C) to identify barriers that limit the availability

21722 of agricultural credit to socially disadvantaged farmers

21723 and ranchers; and

21724 (2) provide recommendations on how agricultural credit

21725 providers may improve outreach to socially disadvantaged farmers

21726 and ranchers relating to the availability of credit and related

21727 services.

21728

21729 (c) Report.--Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of

21730this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall prepare and

21731submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives

21732and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

21733a report that contains the findings of the study conducted under

21734subsection (b)(1) and the recommendations described in subsection

21735(b)(2).

21736

21737 TITLE VI--RURAL DEVELOPMENT

21738

21739 Subtitle A--Improving Health Outcomes in Rural America

21740

21741SEC. 6101. COMBATING SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER IN RURAL AMERICA;

21742 PRIORITIZATIONS.

21743

21744 (a) Combating Substance Use Disorder in Rural America.--

21745

21746[[Page 132 STAT. 4726]]

21747

21748 (1) Prioritizations.--The Secretary shall make the following

21749 prioritizations and set asides for fiscal years 2019 through

21750 2025:

21751 (A) Distance learning and telemedicine.--

21752 (i) Substance use disorder set-aside.--Subject

21753 to clause (ii), the Secretary shall make available

21754 not less than 20 percent of amounts made available

21755 under section 2335A of the Food, Agriculture,

21756 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C.

21757 950aaa-2) for financial assistance under chapter 1

21758 of subtitle D of title XXIII of such Act for

21759 telemedicine projects that provide substance use

21760 disorder treatment services.

21761 (ii) Exception.--In the case of a fiscal year

21762 for which the Secretary determines that there are

21763 not sufficient qualified applicants to receive

21764 financial assistance for projects providing

21765 substance use disorder treatment services to reach

21766 the 20-percent requirement under clause (i), the

21767 Secretary may make available less than 20 percent

21768 of amounts made available under such section 2335A

21769 for those services.

21770 (B) Community facilities direct loans and grants.--

21771 (i) Substance use disorder selection

21772 priority.--In selecting recipients of direct loans

21773 or grants for the development of essential

21774 community facilities under section 306(a) of the

21775 Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

21776 U.S.C. 1926(a)), the Secretary shall give priority

21777 to entities eligible for those direct loans or

21778 grants--

21779 (I) to develop facilities to provide

21780 substance use disorder (including opioid

21781 substance use disorder)--

21782 (aa) prevention services;

21783 (bb) treatment services;

21784 (cc) recovery services; or

21785 (dd) any combination of

21786 those services; and

21787 (II) that employ staff that have

21788 appropriate expertise and training in

21789 how to identify and treat individuals

21790 with substance use disorders.

21791 (ii) Use of funds.--An eligible entity

21792 described in clause (i) that receives a direct

21793 loan or grant described in that clause may use the

21794 direct loan or grant funds for the development of

21795 telehealth facilities and systems to provide

21796 telehealth services for substance use disorder

21797 treatment.

21798 (C) Rural health and safety education programs;

21799 substance use disorder selection priority.--In making

21800 grants under section 502(i) of the Rural Development Act

21801 of 1972 (7 U.S.C. 2662(i)), the Secretary shall give

21802 priority to an applicant that will use the grant for

21803 substance use disorder education and treatment and the

21804 prevention of substance use disorder.

21805 (2) Limitation on other reprioritizations.--For fiscal years

21806 2019 through 2025, the Secretary shall not make any national

21807 reprioritizations within the Rural Health and Safety Education

21808 Programs, the Community Facilities direct loan and

21809

21810[[Page 132 STAT. 4727]]

21811

21812 grant programs, or the Distance Learning and Telemedicine

21813 programs under section 608 of the Rural Development Act of 1972.

21814 (3) Technical amendments.--Title V of the Rural Development

21815 Act of 1972 (7 U.S.C. 2661 et seq.) is amended--

21816 (A) in section 502, &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2662.&gt;&gt; in the

21817 matter preceding subsection (a), by inserting

21818 ``(referred to in this title as the `Secretary')'' after

21819 ``Agriculture''; and

21820 (B) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2662.&gt;&gt; by striking ``Secretary

21821 of Agriculture'' each place it appears (other than in

21822 section 502 in the matter preceding subsection (a)) and

21823 inserting ``Secretary''.

21824

21825 (b) Temporary Prioritization of Rural Health Assistance.--Title VI

21826of the Rural Development Act of 1972 (7 U.S.C. 2204a-2204b) is amended

21827by adding at the end the following:

21828``SEC. 608. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2204b-2.&gt;&gt; TEMPORARY PRIORITIZATION OF

21829 RURAL HEALTH ASSISTANCE.

21830

21831 ``(a) Authority to Temporarily Prioritize Certain Rural Development

21832Applications.--Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the

21833Secretary, after consultation with such public health officials as may

21834be necessary, may announce through a Federal Register notice pursuant to

21835section 553(b)(3)(B) of title 5, United States Code, a temporary

21836reprioritization, on a national or multistate basis, for certain rural

21837development loan and grant applications to assist rural communities in

21838responding to a significant public health disruption.

21839 ``(b) Public Health Disruption.--For the purposes of this section,

21840the term `public health disruption' means an unanticipated increase in

21841mortality or morbidity in rural communities, when compared to non-rural

21842communities, caused by identifiable events, actions, or behavioral

21843trends, which can be remediated by the programs of the Rural Development

21844mission area. When measuring a public health disruption, the Secretary

21845may analyze data on a national or multi-state basis.

21846 ``(c) Content of Announcement.--In the announcement, the Secretary

21847shall--

21848 ``(1) describe the nature of the public health disruption,

21849 including the causes, effects, affected populations, and

21850 affected States;

21851 ``(2) explain how the programs of the Department of

21852 Agriculture will work in remedying the public health disruption;

21853 ``(3) identify the services, treatments, or infrastructure

21854 best suited to address the public health disruption;

21855 ``(4) establish--

21856 ``(A) the start and end dates of the

21857 reprioritization;

21858 ``(B) the programs subject to reprioritization and

21859 the modifications to the application process;

21860 ``(C) the process for making reprioritizations for

21861 applicable programs;

21862 ``(D) the amount of funds set-aside for applicable

21863 programs, except that a set-aside for such a program

21864 shall not be greater than 20 percent of the amounts

21865 appropriated for the program for the fiscal year

21866 involved; and

21867 ``(E) the region in which the reprioritization is in

21868 effect; and

21869

21870[[Page 132 STAT. 4728]]

21871

21872 ``(5) instruct program administrators to implement the

21873 reprioritization during the application window or announcement

21874 after the announcement takes effect.

21875

21876 ``(d) Limitations on Reprioritizations.--When announcing the

21877reprioritization, the Secretary shall--

21878 ``(1) establish an initial total time period of less than 4

21879 years, except as provided for in subsection (e);

21880 ``(2) implement only 1 nationally applicable

21881 reprioritization at a time;

21882 ``(3) implement only 1 regionally applicable

21883 reprioritization per State at a time; and

21884 ``(4) not use reprioritizations to allocate additional funds

21885 to an affected State.

21886

21887 ``(e) Extension.--The Secretary may extend an announcement under

21888subsection (a) for no more than 6 years in total, except that nothing

21889shall prevent the Secretary from renewing reprioritizations by making a

21890new announcement under subsection (a).

21891 ``(f) Rescinding the Announcement.--The Secretary may rescind a

21892reprioritization announcement made under subsection (a) at any time the

21893Secretary determines that the temporary reprioritizations are no longer

21894needed or effective.

21895 ``(g) Notice.--Not later than 48 hours after making, extending, or

21896rescinding an announcement under this section, the Secretary shall

21897submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives

21898and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate,

21899and transmit to the Secretary of Health and Human Services, a written

21900notice of the declaration, extension, or rescission.''.

21901SEC. 6102. DISTANCE LEARNING AND TELEMEDICINE.

21902

21903 (a) Authorization of Appropriations.--Section 2335A of the Food,

21904Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 950aaa-5) is

21905amended by striking ``$75,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2014 through

219062018'' and inserting ``$82,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through

219072023''.

21908 (b) Conforming Amendment.--Section 1(b) of Public Law 102-551 (7

21909U.S.C. 950aaa note) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

21910``2023''.

21911SEC. 6103. REFINANCING OF CERTAIN RURAL HOSPITAL DEBT.

21912

21913 Subtitle D of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

21914U.S.C. 1981 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 341 the

21915following:

21916``SEC. 342. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1990a.&gt;&gt; REFINANCING OF CERTAIN RURAL

21917 HOSPITAL DEBT.

21918

21919 ``Assistance under section 306(a) for a community facility, or under

21920section 310B, may include the refinancing of a debt obligation of a

21921rural hospital as an eligible loan or loan guarantee purpose if the

21922assistance would help preserve access to a health service in a rural

21923community, meaningfully improve the financial position of the hospital,

21924and otherwise meet the financial feasibility and adequacy of security

21925requirements of the Rural Development Agency.''.

21926

21927[[Page 132 STAT. 4729]]

21928

21929 Subtitle B--Connecting Rural Americans to High Speed Broadband

21930

21931SEC. 6201. ACCESS TO BROADBAND TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES IN

21932 RURAL AREAS.

21933

21934 Section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C.

21935950bb) is amended--

21936 (1) in subsection (a), by striking ``provide loans and loan

21937 guarantees'' and inserting ``provide grants, provide loans, and

21938 provide loan guarantees'';

21939 (2) in subsection (b)(3)(A)(ii), by inserting ``in the case

21940 of a grant or direct loan,'' before ``a city'';

21941 (3) in subsection (c)--

21942 (A) in the subsection heading, by striking ``Loans

21943 and'' and inserting ``Grants, Loans, and'';

21944 (B) in paragraph (1), by striking ``shall make or

21945 guarantee loans'' and inserting ``shall make grants,

21946 shall make loans, and shall guarantee loans'';

21947 (C) by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the

21948 following:

21949 ``(2) Priority.--

21950 ``(A) In general.--In making grants, making loans,

21951 and guaranteeing loans under paragraph (1), the

21952 Secretary shall--

21953 ``(i) give the highest priority to

21954 applications for projects to provide broadband

21955 service to unserved rural communities that do not

21956 have any residential broadband service of at

21957 least--

21958 ``(I) a 10-Mbps downstream

21959 transmission capacity; and

21960 ``(II) a 1-Mbps upstream

21961 transmission capacity;

21962 ``(ii) give priority to applications for

21963 projects to provide the maximum level of broadband

21964 service to the greatest proportion of rural

21965 households in the proposed service area identified

21966 in the application;

21967 ``(iii) provide equal consideration to all

21968 eligible entities, including those that have not

21969 previously received grants, loans, or loan

21970 guarantees under paragraph (1); and

21971 ``(iv) with respect to 2 or more applications

21972 that are given the same priority under clause (i),

21973 give priority to an application that requests less

21974 grant funding than loan funding.

21975 ``(B) Other.--After giving priority to the

21976 applications described in clauses (i) and (ii) of

21977 subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall then give priority

21978 to applications--

21979 ``(i) for projects to provide broadband

21980 service to rural communities--

21981 ``(I) with a population of less than

21982 10,000 permanent residents;

21983 ``(II) that are experiencing

21984 outmigration and have adopted a

21985 strategic community investment plan

21986 under section 379H(d) that includes

21987 considerations for improving and

21988 expanding broadband service;

21989

21990[[Page 132 STAT. 4730]]

21991

21992 ``(III) with a high percentage of

21993 low income families or persons (as

21994 defined in section 501(b) of the Housing

21995 Act of 1949 (42 U.S.C. 1471(b));

21996 ``(IV) that are isolated from other

21997 significant population centers; or

21998 ``(V) that provide rapid and

21999 expanded deployment of fixed and mobile

22000 broadband on cropland and ranchland

22001 within a service territory for use in

22002 various applications of precision

22003 agriculture; and

22004 ``(ii) that were developed with the

22005 participation of, and will receive a substantial

22006 portion of the funding for the project from, 2 or

22007 more stakeholders, including--

22008 ``(I) State, local, and tribal

22009 governments;

22010 ``(II) nonprofit institutions;

22011 ``(III) community anchor

22012 institutions, such as--

22013 ``(aa) public libraries;

22014 ``(bb) elementary schools

22015 and secondary schools (as

22016 defined in section 8101 of the

22017 Elementary and Secondary

22018 Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C.

22019 7801));

22020 ``(cc) institutions of

22021 higher education; and

22022 ``(dd) health care

22023 facilities;

22024 ``(IV) private entities;

22025 ``(V) philanthropic organizations;

22026 and

22027 ``(VI) cooperatives.

22028 ``(3) Grant amounts.--

22029 ``(A) Definition of development costs.--In this

22030 paragraph, the term `development costs' means costs of--

22031 ``(i) construction, including labor and

22032 materials;

22033 ``(ii) project applications; and

22034 ``(iii) other development activities, as

22035 determined by the Secretary.

22036 ``(B) Eligibility.--To be eligible for a grant under

22037 this section, in addition to the requirements of

22038 subsection (d), the project that is the subject of the

22039 grant shall--

22040 ``(i) be carried out in a proposed service

22041 territory in which not less than 90 percent of the

22042 households are unserved; and

22043 ``(ii) not concurrently receive any other

22044 broadband grant administered by the Rural

22045 Utilities Service.

22046 ``(C) Maximum.--Except as provided in subparagraph

22047 (D), the amount of any grant made under this section

22048 shall not exceed--

22049 ``(i) 75 percent of the total project cost

22050 with respect to an area with a density of fewer

22051 than 7 people per square mile;

22052 ``(ii) 50 percent of the total project cost

22053 with respect to an area with a density of 7 or

22054 more and fewer than 12 people per square mile; and

22055 ``(iii) 25 percent of the total project cost

22056 with respect to an area with a density of 12 or

22057 more and 20 or fewer people per square mile.

22058 ``(D) Secretarial authority to adjust.--The

22059 Secretary may--

22060

22061[[Page 132 STAT. 4731]]

22062

22063 ``(i) make grants of up to 75 percent of the

22064 development costs of the project for which the

22065 grant is provided to an eligible entity if the

22066 Secretary determines that the project serves--

22067 ``(I) an area of rural households

22068 described in paragraph (2)(A)(i); or

22069 ``(II) a rural community described

22070 in any of subclauses (I) through (IV) of

22071 paragraph (2)(B)(i); and

22072 ``(ii) make modifications of the density

22073 thresholds described in subparagraph (C), in order

22074 to ensure that funds provided under this section

22075 are best utilized to provide broadband service in

22076 communities that are the most rural in character.

22077 ``(E) Applications.--The Secretary shall establish

22078 an application process for grants under this section

22079 that--

22080 ``(i) permits a single application for a grant

22081 and a loan under title I, II, or this title that

22082 is associated with such grant; and

22083 ``(ii) provides a single decision to award

22084 such grant and such loan.

22085 ``(F) Density determinations.--When determining

22086 population density under this section, the Secretary

22087 shall prescribe a calculation method which--

22088 ``(i) utilizes publicly available data; and

22089 ``(ii) includes only those areas in which the

22090 applicant is able to meet the service requirements

22091 under this section, as determined by the

22092 Secretary.

22093 ``(4) Fees.--In the case of loan guarantees issued or

22094 modified under this section, the Secretary shall charge and

22095 collect from the lender fees in such amounts as to bring down

22096 the costs of subsidies for guaranteed loans, except that such

22097 fees shall not act as a bar to participation in the programs nor

22098 be inconsistent with current practices in the marketplace.'';

22099 (4) in subsection (d)--

22100 (A) in paragraph (1)--

22101 (i) in subparagraph (A)--

22102 (I) in the matter preceding clause

22103 (i), by striking ``loan or'' and

22104 inserting ``grant, loan, or'';

22105 (II) by striking clause (i) and

22106 inserting the following:

22107 ``(i) demonstrate the ability to furnish or

22108 improve service in order to meet the broadband

22109 buildout requirements established under subsection

22110 (e)(4) in all or part of an unserved or

22111 underserved rural area;''.

22112 (III) in clause (ii), by striking

22113 ``a loan application'' and inserting

22114 ``an application''; and

22115 (IV) in clause (iii)--

22116 (aa) by striking ``service''

22117 and inserting

22118 ``infrastructure'';

22119 (bb) by striking ``loan''

22120 the first place it appears;

22121 (cc) by striking ``3'' and

22122 inserting ``5''; and

22123 (dd) by striking ``proceeds

22124 from the loan made or guaranteed

22125 under this section are'' and

22126 inserting ``assistance under

22127 this section is''; and

22128

22129[[Page 132 STAT. 4732]]

22130

22131 (ii) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``(k)''

22132 and inserting ``(j)''; and

22133 (B) in paragraph (2)(A)--

22134 (i) in the matter preceding clause (i)--

22135 (I) by striking ``the proceeds of a

22136 loan made or guaranteed'' and inserting

22137 ``assistance''; and

22138 (II) by striking ``for the loan or

22139 loan guarantee'' and inserting ``of the

22140 eligible entity''; and

22141 (ii) in clause (i)--

22142 (I) by striking ``15 percent'' and

22143 inserting ``50 percent (in the case of

22144 loans or loan guarantees provided in

22145 accordance with subsection (g)(1)(A))'';

22146 and

22147 (II) by striking ``level of

22148 broadband service'' and inserting

22149 ``level of fixed broadband service,

22150 whether terrestrial or wireless,'';

22151 (C) in paragraph (3)(A), by striking ``loan or'' and

22152 inserting ``grant, loan, or'';

22153 (D) in paragraph (4), by striking ``a loan or loan

22154 guarantee'' and inserting ``assistance''; and

22155 (E) by striking paragraphs (5) through (10) and

22156 inserting the following:

22157 ``(5) Technical assistance and training.--

22158 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary may provide to

22159 eligible entities described in paragraph (1) that are

22160 applying for assistance under this section for a project

22161 described in subsection (c)(2)(A)(i) technical

22162 assistance and training--

22163 ``(i) to prepare reports and surveys necessary

22164 to request grants, loans, and loan guarantees

22165 under this section for broadband deployment;

22166 ``(ii) to improve management, including

22167 financial management, relating to the proposed

22168 broadband deployment;

22169 ``(iii) to prepare applications for grants,

22170 loans, and loan guarantees under this section; or

22171 ``(iv) to assist with other areas of need

22172 identified by the Secretary.

22173 ``(B) Funding.--Not less than 3 percent and not more

22174 than 5 percent of amounts appropriated to carry out this

22175 section for a fiscal year shall be used for technical

22176 assistance and training under this paragraph.'';

22177 (5) in subsection (e)--

22178 (A) in paragraph (1)--

22179 (i) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``4-

22180 Mbps'' and inserting ``25-Mbps''; and

22181 (ii) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``1-

22182 Mbps'' and inserting ``3-Mbps'';

22183 (B) in paragraph (2)--

22184 (i) by--

22185 (I) striking the following:

22186 ``(2) Adjustments.--

22187 ``(A) In general.--At''; and

22188 (II) inserting the following:

22189 ``(2) Adjustments.--At'';

22190 (ii) by inserting ``and broadband buildout

22191 requirements under paragraph (4)'' after ``(1)'';

22192 and

22193

22194[[Page 132 STAT. 4733]]

22195

22196 (iii) by striking subparagraph (B); and

22197 (C) by adding at the end the following:

22198 ``(4) Broadband buildout requirements.--

22199 ``(A) In general.--The term `broadband buildout

22200 requirement' means the level of internet service an

22201 applicant receiving assistance under this section must

22202 agree, at the time the application is finalized, to

22203 provide for the duration of any project-related

22204 agreement between the applicant and the Department.

22205 ``(B) Broadband buildout requirements further

22206 defined.--Subject to subparagraph (C), the Secretary

22207 shall establish broadband buildout requirements for

22208 projects with agreement lengths of--

22209 ``(i) 5 to 10 years;

22210 ``(ii) 11 to 15 years;

22211 ``(iii) 16 to 20 years; and

22212 ``(iv) more than 20 years.

22213 ``(C) Requirements.--In establishing the broadband

22214 buildout requirements under subparagraph (B), the

22215 Secretary shall--

22216 ``(i) utilize the same metrics used to define

22217 the minimum acceptable level of broadband service

22218 under paragraph (1);

22219 ``(ii) establish such requirements to

22220 reasonably ensure--

22221 ``(I) the repayment of all loans and

22222 loan guarantees; and

22223 ``(II) the financed network is

22224 technically capable of providing

22225 broadband service for the lifetime of

22226 any project-related agreement.

22227 ``(D) Substitute service standards for unique

22228 service territories.--If an applicant shows that it

22229 would be cost prohibitive to meet the broadband buildout

22230 requirements established under this paragraph for the

22231 entirety of a proposed service territory due to the

22232 unique characteristics of the proposed service

22233 territory, the Secretary and the applicant may agree to

22234 utilize substitute standards for any unserved portion of

22235 the project. Any substitute service standards should

22236 continue to consider the best technology available to

22237 meet the needs of the residents in the unserved area.'';

22238 (6) in subsection (f), by striking ``make a loan or loan

22239 guarantee'' and inserting ``provide assistance'';

22240 (7) in subsection (g), by striking paragraph (2) and

22241 redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (2);

22242 (8) by striking subsections (i) and (j) and inserting the

22243 following:

22244

22245 ``(i) Payment Assistance for Certain Loan and Grant Recipients.--

22246 ``(1) Use of grant funds.--The Secretary may use the funds

22247 appropriated for a grant under this title for the cost (as

22248 defined by section 502 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974)

22249 of providing assistance under paragraph (2).

22250 ``(2) Payment assistance.--When providing a grant under this

22251 title, the Secretary, at the sole discretion of the Secretary,

22252 may make--

22253

22254[[Page 132 STAT. 4734]]

22255

22256 ``(A) a subsidized loan, which shall bear a reduced

22257 interest rate at such a rate as the Secretary determines

22258 appropriate to meet the objectives of the program; or

22259 ``(B) a payment assistance loan, which shall--

22260 ``(i) require no interest and principal

22261 payments while the borrower is--

22262 ``(I) in material compliance with

22263 the loan agreement; and

22264 ``(II) meeting the milestones and

22265 objectives of the project agreed to

22266 under paragraph (3); and

22267 ``(ii) require such nominal periodic payments

22268 as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.

22269 ``(3) Agreement on milestones and objectives.--With respect

22270 to payment assistance provided under paragraph (2), before

22271 entering into the agreement under which the payment assistance

22272 will be provided, the applicant and the Secretary shall agree to

22273 milestones and objectives of the project.

22274 ``(4) Amendment of milestones and objectives.--The Secretary

22275 and the applicant may jointly agree to amend the milestones and

22276 objectives agreed to under paragraph (3).

22277 ``(5) Considerations.--When deciding to utilize the payment

22278 assistance authority under paragraph (2) the Secretary shall

22279 consider whether or not the payment assistance will--

22280 ``(A) improve the compliance of the grantee with any

22281 commitments made through the grant agreement;

22282 ``(B) promote the completion of the broadband

22283 project;

22284 ``(C) protect taxpayer resources; and

22285 ``(D) support the integrity of the broadband

22286 programs administered by the Secretary.

22287 ``(6) Limitations on payment assistance.--The Secretary may

22288 not make a payment assistance loan under paragraph (2)(B) to an

22289 entity receiving a grant under this section that is also the

22290 recipient of a loan under title I or II that is associated with

22291 such grant.'';

22292 (9) in subsection (k)(1)--

22293 (A) by striking ``$25,000,000'' and inserting

22294 ``$350,000,000''; and

22295 (B) by striking ``2008 through 2018'' and inserting

22296 ``2019 through 2023'';

22297 (10) in subsection (l)--

22298 (A) by striking ``loan or'' and inserting ``grant,

22299 or loan, or''; and

22300 (B) by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''; and

22301 (11) by redesignating subsections (k) and (l) as subsections

22302 (j) and (k), respectively.

22303SEC. 6202. EXPANSION OF MIDDLE MILE INFRASTRUCTURE INTO RURAL

22304 AREAS.

22305

22306 Section 602 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C.

22307950bb-1) is amended to read as follows:

22308``SEC. 602. EXPANSION OF MIDDLE MILE INFRASTRUCTURE INTO RURAL

22309 AREAS.

22310

22311 ``(a) Purpose.--The purpose of this section is to encourage the

22312expansion and extension of middle mile broadband infrastructure to

22313connect underserved rural areas to the backbone of the Internet.

22314

22315[[Page 132 STAT. 4735]]

22316

22317 ``(b) Middle Mile Infrastructure.--For the purposes of this section,

22318the term `middle mile infrastructure' means any broadband infrastructure

22319that does not connect directly to end-user locations (including anchor

22320institutions) and may include interoffice transport, backhaul, Internet

22321connectivity, data centers, or special access transport to rural areas.

22322 ``(c) Grants, Loans, and Loan Guarantees.--The Secretary shall make

22323grants, loans, and loan guarantees to eligible applicants described in

22324subsection (d) to provide funds for the construction, improvement, or

22325acquisition of middle mile infrastructure to serve rural areas.

22326 ``(d) Eligibility.--

22327 ``(1) Eligible applicants.--

22328 ``(A) In general.--To be eligible to obtain

22329 assistance under this section, an eligible entity

22330 shall--

22331 ``(i) submit to the Secretary an application

22332 at such time, in such manner, and containing such

22333 information as the Secretary may require;

22334 ``(ii) agree to complete build-out of the

22335 middle mile infrastructure described in the

22336 application by not later than 5 years after the

22337 initial date on which proceeds from the assistance

22338 provided under this section are made available;

22339 and

22340 ``(iii) submit to the Secretary a plan to

22341 ensure the viability of the project by--

22342 ``(I) connecting, assisting with

22343 connecting, or enabling the connection

22344 of retail broadband systems that serve

22345 rural areas within the proposed service

22346 territory to the middle mile

22347 infrastructure project in an affordable

22348 and economically competitive manner;

22349 ``(II) leasing or selling sufficient

22350 capacity prior to project approval; and

22351 ``(III) complying with any other

22352 requirements imposed by the Secretary.

22353 ``(B) Additional end user broadband programs.--

22354 Entities that receive assistance to construct, improve,

22355 or acquire middle mile infrastructure under this section

22356 shall be eligible to apply for additional funds under

22357 this title to provide for retail broadband service to

22358 end users.

22359 ``(2) Eligible service territories.--The proceeds of

22360 assistance provided under this section may be used to carry out

22361 a project in a proposed service territory only if, as of the

22362 date the application for assistance under this section is

22363 submitted, there is not adequate middle mile infrastructure

22364 available to support broadband service for eligible rural

22365 communities that would be provided access to the middle mile

22366 infrastructure.

22367 ``(3) Eligible projects.--A project shall be eligible for

22368 assistance under this section if at the time of the

22369 application--

22370 ``(A) at least 75 percent of the interconnection

22371 points serve such eligible rural areas; and

22372 ``(B) the Secretary determines that the proposed

22373 middle mile network will be capable of supporting retail

22374 broadband service meeting the maximum broadband buildout

22375 requirement established under section 601(e)(4) for the

22376 residents within the proposed service territory.

22377

22378[[Page 132 STAT. 4736]]

22379

22380 ``(e) Limitation on Grants.--In making grants under this section,

22381the Secretary shall--

22382 ``(1) not provide any grant in excess of 20 percent of the

22383 total project cost; and

22384 ``(2) provide grants only to those projects which serve

22385 rural areas where population density or geographic

22386 characteristics make it infeasible to construct middle mile

22387 broadband systems without grant assistance.

22388

22389 ``(f) Terms, Conditions, and Adequacy of Security.--All loans and

22390loan guarantees provided under this section shall be made subject to

22391such terms, conditions, and adequacy of security requirements as may be

22392imposed by the Secretary. If the middle mile infrastructure would not

22393provide adequate security due to long-term leasing arrangements, the

22394Secretary shall require substitute security in such form and substance

22395as are acceptable to the Secretary.

22396 ``(g) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be

22397appropriated to carry out this section $10,000,000 for each of fiscal

22398years 2018 through 2023.''.

22399SEC. 6203. MODIFICATIONS TO THE RURAL GIGABIT PROGRAM.

22400

22401 Section 603 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C.

22402950bb-2) is amended--

22403 (1) in the section heading, by striking ``rural gigabit

22404 network pilot'' and inserting ``innovative broadband

22405 advancement'';

22406 (2) in subsection (d), by striking ``2014 through 2018'' and

22407 inserting ``2019 through 2023'';

22408 (3) by redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (e); and

22409 (4) by striking subsections (a) through (c) and inserting

22410 the following:

22411

22412 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary shall establish a program to be

22413known as the `Innovative Broadband Advancement Program', under which the

22414Secretary may provide a grant, a loan, or both to an eligible entity for

22415the purpose of demonstrating innovative broadband technologies or

22416methods of broadband deployment that significantly decrease the cost of

22417broadband deployment, and provide substantially faster broadband speeds

22418than are available, in a rural area.

22419 ``(b) Rural Area.--In this section, the term `rural area' has the

22420meaning provided in section 601(b)(3).

22421 ``(c) Eligibility.--To be eligible to obtain assistance under this

22422section for a project, an entity shall--

22423 ``(1) submit to the Secretary an application--

22424 ``(A) that describes a project designed to decrease

22425 the cost of broadband deployment, and substantially

22426 increase broadband speed to not less than the maximum

22427 broadband buildout requirements established under

22428 section 601(e)(4), in a rural area to be served by the

22429 project; and

22430 ``(B) at such time, in such manner, and containing

22431 such other information as the Secretary may require;

22432 ``(2) demonstrate that the entity is able to carry out the

22433 project; and

22434 ``(3) agree to complete the project build-out within 5 years

22435 after the date the assistance is first provided for the project.

22436

22437[[Page 132 STAT. 4737]]

22438

22439 ``(d) Prioritization.--In awarding assistance under this section,

22440the Secretary shall give priority to proposals for projects that--

22441 ``(1) involve partnerships between or among multiple

22442 entities;

22443 ``(2) would provide broadband service to the greatest number

22444 of rural entities at or above the broadband requirements

22445 referred to in subsection (c)(1)(A); and

22446 ``(3) the Secretary determines could be replicated in rural

22447 areas described in paragraph (2).''.

22448SEC. 6204. COMMUNITY CONNECT GRANT PROGRAM.

22449

22450 Title VI of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950bb et

22451seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

22452``SEC. 604. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950bb-3.&gt;&gt; COMMUNITY CONNECT GRANT

22453 PROGRAM.

22454

22455 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

22456 ``(1) Eligible broadband service.--The term `eligible

22457 broadband service' means broadband service that has the

22458 capability to transmit data at a speed specified by the

22459 Secretary, which may not be less than the applicable minimum

22460 download and upload speeds established by the Federal

22461 Communications Commission in defining the term `advanced

22462 telecommunications capability' for purposes of section 706 of

22463 the Telecommunications Act of 1996 (47 U.S.C. 1302).

22464 ``(2) Eligible service area.--The term `eligible service

22465 area' means an area in which broadband service capacity is less

22466 than--

22467 ``(A) a 10-Mbps downstream transmission capacity;

22468 and

22469 ``(B) a 1-Mbps upstream transmission capacity.

22470 ``(3) Eligible entity.--

22471 ``(A) In general.--The term `eligible entity' means

22472 a legally organized entity that--

22473 ``(i) is--

22474 ``(I) an incorporated organization;

22475 ``(II) an Indian Tribe or Tribal

22476 organization;

22477 ``(III) a State;

22478 ``(IV) a unit of local government;

22479 or

22480 ``(V) any other legal entity,

22481 including a cooperative, a private

22482 corporation, or a limited liability

22483 company, that is organized on a for-

22484 profit or a not-for-profit basis; and

22485 ``(ii) has the legal capacity and authority to

22486 enter into a contract, to comply with applicable

22487 Federal laws, and to own and operate broadband

22488 facilities, as proposed in the application

22489 submitted by the entity for a grant under the

22490 Program.

22491 ``(B) Exclusions.--The term `eligible entity' does

22492 not include--

22493 ``(i) an individual; or

22494 ``(ii) a partnership.

22495 ``(4) Rural area.--The term `rural area' has the meaning

22496 given the term in section 601(b)(3)(A).

22497

22498 ``(b) Establishment.--The Secretary shall establish a program, to be

22499known as the `Community Connect Grant Program', to provide grants to

22500eligible entities to finance broadband transmission in rural areas.

22501

22502[[Page 132 STAT. 4738]]

22503

22504 ``(c) Eligible Projects.--An eligible entity that receives a grant

22505under the Program shall use the grant to carry out a project that--

22506 ``(1) provides eligible broadband service to, within the

22507 proposed eligible service area described in the application

22508 submitted by the eligible entity--

22509 ``(A) each essential community facility as defined

22510 pursuant to section 306(a) of the Consolidated Farm and

22511 Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1926(a)); and

22512 ``(B) any required facilities necessary to offer

22513 that eligible broadband service to each residential and

22514 business customer within such proposed eligible service

22515 area; and

22516 ``(2) for not less than 2 years--

22517 ``(A) furnishes free eligible broadband service to a

22518 community center described in subsection (d)(1)(B);

22519 ``(B) provides not fewer than 2 computer access

22520 points for that free eligible broadband service; and

22521 ``(C) covers the cost of bandwidth to provide free

22522 eligible broadband service to each essential community

22523 facility that requests broadband services within the

22524 proposed eligible service area described in the

22525 application submitted by the eligible entity.

22526

22527 ``(d) Uses of Grant Funds.--

22528 ``(1) In general.--An eligible entity that receives a grant

22529 under the Program may use the grant for--

22530 ``(A) the construction, acquisition, or leasing of

22531 facilities (including spectrum), land, or buildings to

22532 deploy eligible broadband service; and

22533 ``(B) the improvement, expansion, construction, or

22534 acquisition of a community center within the proposed

22535 eligible service area described in the application

22536 submitted by the eligible entity.

22537 ``(2) Ineligible uses.--An eligible entity that receives a

22538 grant under the Program shall not use the grant for--

22539 ``(A) the duplication of any existing eligible

22540 broadband service provided by another entity in the

22541 eligible service area; or

22542 ``(B) operating expenses, except as provided in--

22543 ``(i) subsection (c)(2)(C) with respect to

22544 free eligible broadband service; and

22545 ``(ii) paragraph (1)(A) with respect to

22546 spectrum.

22547 ``(3) Free access for community centers.--Of the amounts

22548 provided to an eligible entity under a grant under the Program,

22549 the eligible entity shall use to carry out paragraph (1)(B) not

22550 greater than the lesser of--

22551 ``(A) 10 percent; and

22552 ``(B) $150,000.

22553

22554 ``(e) Matching Funds.--

22555 ``(1) In general.--An eligible entity that receives a grant

22556 under the Program shall provide a cash contribution in an amount

22557 that is not less than 15 percent of the amount of the grant.

22558 ``(2) Requirements.--A cash contribution described in

22559 paragraph (1)--

22560 ``(A) shall be used solely for the project for which

22561 the eligible entity receives a grant under the Program;

22562 and

22563

22564[[Page 132 STAT. 4739]]

22565

22566 ``(B) shall not include any Federal funds, unless a

22567 Federal statute specifically provides that those Federal

22568 funds may be considered to be from a non-Federal source.

22569

22570 ``(f) Applications.--

22571 ``(1) In general.--To be eligible to receive a grant under

22572 the Program, an eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary an

22573 application at such time, in such manner, and containing such

22574 information as the Secretary may require.

22575 ``(2) Requirement.--An application submitted by an eligible

22576 entity under paragraph (1) shall include documentation

22577 sufficient to demonstrate the availability of funds to satisfy

22578 the requirement of subsection (e).

22579

22580 ``(g) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be

22581appropriated to carry out this section $50,000,000 for each of fiscal

22582years 2019 through 2023.''.

22583SEC. 6205. OUTDATED BROADBAND SYSTEMS.

22584
