22585 (a) In General.--Title VI of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936

22586(7 U.S.C. 950bb et seq.) is further amended by adding at the end the

22587following:

22588``SEC. 605. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950bb-4.&gt;&gt; OUTDATED BROADBAND SYSTEMS.

22589

22590 ``(a) In General.--Except as provided in subsection (b), the

22591Secretary shall consider any portion of a service territory that is

22592subject to an outstanding grant agreement between the Secretary and a

22593broadband provider to be unserved for the purposes of all broadband

22594assistance programs under this Act, if the broadband service in that

22595portion of a service territory is less than 10 Mbps downstream

22596transmission capacity or less than 1 Mbps upstream transmission

22597capacity.

22598 ``(b) Exception.--The Secretary shall not consider a portion of a

22599service territory described in subsection (a) to be unserved if the

22600broadband service provider has constructed or begun to construct

22601broadband facilities that meet the minimum acceptable level of service

22602established under section 601(e), in that portion of the service

22603territory.''.

22604 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950bb-4 note.&gt;&gt; Effective Date.--The amendment

22605made by this section shall not take effect until October 1, 2020.

22606SEC. 6206. DEFAULT AND DEOBLIGATION; DEFERRAL.

22607

22608 Title VI of such Act (7 U.S.C. 950bb et seq.) is further amended by

22609adding at the end the following:

22610``SEC. 606. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950bb-5.&gt;&gt; DEFAULT AND DEOBLIGATION;

22611 DEFERRAL.

22612

22613 ``(a) Default and Deobligation.--In addition to other authority

22614under applicable law, the Secretary shall establish written procedures

22615for all broadband programs so that, to the maximum extent practicable,

22616the programs are administered to--

22617 ``(1) recover funds from loan and grant defaults;

22618 ``(2) deobligate any awards, less allowable costs that

22619 demonstrate an insufficient level of performance (including

22620 metrics determined by the Secretary) or fraudulent spending, to

22621 the extent funds with respect to the award are available in the

22622 account relating to the program established by this title;

22623 ``(3) award those funds, on a competitive basis, to new or

22624 existing applicants consistent with this title; and

22625 ``(4) minimize overlap among the programs.

22626

22627[[Page 132 STAT. 4740]]

22628

22629 ``(b) Deferral Period.--In determining the terms and conditions of

22630assistance provided under this title, the Secretary may establish a

22631deferral period of not shorter than the buildout period established for

22632the project involved in order to support the financial feasibility and

22633long-term sustainability of the project.''.

22634SEC. 6207. PUBLIC NOTICE, ASSESSMENTS, AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.

22635

22636 The Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 901 et seq.) is

22637amended by adding at the end the following new title:

22638

22639 ``TITLE VII--GENERAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS

22640

22641``SEC. 701. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950cc.&gt;&gt; PUBLIC NOTICE, ASSESSMENTS,

22642 AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.

22643

22644 ``(a) Notice Requirements.--The Secretary shall promptly make

22645available to the public, a fully searchable database on the website of

22646the Rural Utilities Service that contains information on all retail

22647broadband projects provided assistance or for which assistance is sought

22648that are administered by the Secretary, including, at a minimum--

22649 ``(1) notice of each application for assistance describing

22650 the application, including--

22651 ``(A) the identity of the applicant;

22652 ``(B) a description of each application, including--

22653 ``(i) a map of the proposed service area of

22654 the applicant; and

22655 ``(ii) the amount and type of support

22656 requested by each applicant;

22657 ``(C) the status of each application; and

22658 ``(D) the estimated number and proportion of service

22659 points in the proposed service territory without fixed

22660 broadband service, whether terrestrial or wireless;

22661 ``(2) notice of each entity receiving assistance

22662 administered by the Secretary, including--

22663 ``(A) the name of the entity;

22664 ``(B) the type of assistance being received;

22665 ``(C) the purpose for which the entity is receiving

22666 the assistance; and

22667 ``(D) each annual report submitted under subsection

22668 (c) (redacted to protect any proprietary information in

22669 the report); and

22670 ``(3) such other information as is sufficient to allow the

22671 public to understand assistance provided.

22672

22673 ``(b) Service Area Assessment.--

22674 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall, with respect to a

22675 retail broadband application for assistance, which is outside an

22676 area in which the applicant receives Federal universal service

22677 support--

22678 ``(A) after giving notice required by subsection

22679 (a)(1), afford service providers not less than 45 days

22680 to voluntarily submit information required by the

22681 Secretary onto the agency's online mapping tool with

22682 respect to areas that are coterminous with the proposed

22683 service area of the application (or any parts thereof),

22684 such that the Secretary

22685

22686[[Page 132 STAT. 4741]]

22687

22688 may assess whether the application submitted meets the

22689 eligibility requirements under this title; and

22690 ``(B) if no broadband service provider submits

22691 information under paragraph (1), consider the number of

22692 providers in the proposed service area to be established

22693 by using any other data regarding the availability of

22694 broadband service that the Secretary may collect or

22695 obtain through reasonable efforts.

22696 ``(2) Assessment of unserved communities.--In the case of an

22697 application given the highest priority under section

22698 601(c)(2)(A)(i), the Secretary shall confirm that each unserved

22699 rural community identified in the application is eligible for

22700 funding by--

22701 ``(A) conferring with, and obtaining data from, the

22702 Chair of the Federal Communications Commission and the

22703 Administrator of the National Telecommunications and

22704 Information Administration with respect to the service

22705 level in the service area proposed in the application;

22706 ``(B) reviewing any other source that is relevant to

22707 service data validation, as determined by the Secretary;

22708 and

22709 ``(C) performing site-specific testing to verify the

22710 unavailability of any retail broadband service.

22711 ``(3) FOIA exemption.--For purposes of section 552 of title

22712 5, United States Code, information received by the Secretary

22713 pursuant to paragraph (1)(A) of this subsection shall be exempt

22714 from disclosure pursuant to subsection (b)(2)(B) of such section

22715 552.

22716

22717 ``(c) Reporting Broadband Improvements to USDA.--

22718 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall require any entity

22719 receiving assistance for a project which provides retail

22720 broadband service to submit an annual report for 3 years after

22721 completion of the project, in a format specified by the

22722 Secretary, that describes--

22723 ``(A) the use by the entity of the assistance,

22724 including new equipment and capacity enhancements that

22725 support high-speed broadband access for educational

22726 institutions, health care providers, and public safety

22727 service providers (including the estimated number of end

22728 users who are currently using or forecasted to use the

22729 new or upgraded infrastructure); and

22730 ``(B) the progress towards fulfilling the objectives

22731 for which the assistance was granted, including--

22732 ``(i) the number of service points that will

22733 receive new broadband service, existing network

22734 service improvements, and facility upgrades

22735 resulting from the Federal assistance;

22736 ``(ii) the speed of broadband service;

22737 ``(iii) the average price of the most

22738 subscribed tier of broadband service in a proposed

22739 service area;

22740 ``(iv) new subscribers generated from the

22741 project; and

22742 ``(v) any metrics the Secretary determines to

22743 be appropriate.

22744 ``(2) Additional reporting.--

22745

22746[[Page 132 STAT. 4742]]

22747

22748 ``(A) Broadband buildout data.--As a condition of

22749 receiving assistance under section 601, a recipient of

22750 assistance shall provide to the Secretary complete,

22751 reliable, and precise geolocation information that

22752 indicates the location of new broadband service that is

22753 being provided or upgraded within the service territory

22754 supported by the grant, loan, or loan guarantee not

22755 later than 30 days after the earlier of--

22756 ``(i) the date of completion of any project

22757 milestone established by the Secretary; or

22758 ``(ii) the date of completion of the project.

22759 ``(B) Reporting for middle mile projects.--The

22760 Secretary shall require any entity receiving assistance

22761 under section 602 to submit a semiannual report for 5

22762 years after completion of the project, in a format

22763 specified by the Secretary, that describes--

22764 ``(i) the use by the entity of the assistance

22765 to construct, improve, or acquire middle mile

22766 infrastructure;

22767 ``(ii) the progress towards meeting the end-

22768 user connection plan submitted under section

22769 602(d)(1)(A)(iii); and

22770 ``(iii) any additional metrics the Secretary

22771 determines to be appropriate.

22772 ``(C) Additional reporting.--The Secretary may

22773 require any additional reporting and information by any

22774 recipient of any broadband assistance under this act so

22775 as to ensure compliance with this section.

22776

22777 ``(d) Annual Report on Broadband Projects and Service to Congress.--

22778Each year, the Secretary shall submit to the Congress a report that

22779describes the extent of participation in the broadband assistance

22780programs administered by the Secretary for the preceding fiscal year,

22781including a description of--

22782 ``(1) the number of applications received and accepted,

22783 including any special loan terms or conditions for which the

22784 Secretary provided additional assistance to unserved areas;

22785 ``(2)(A) the communities proposed to be served in each

22786 application submitted for the fiscal year; and

22787 ``(B) the communities served by projects funded by broadband

22788 assistance programs;

22789 ``(3) the period of time required to approve each loan

22790 application under broadband programs;

22791 ``(4) any outreach activities carried out by the Secretary

22792 to encourage entities in rural areas without broadband service

22793 to submit applications under this Act;

22794 ``(5) the method by which the Secretary determines that a

22795 service enables a subscriber to originate and receive high-

22796 quality voice, data, graphics, and video for purposes of

22797 providing broadband service under this Act;

22798 ``(6) each broadband service, including the type and speed

22799 of broadband service, for which assistance was sought, and each

22800 broadband service for which assistance was provided, under this

22801 Act; and

22802 ``(7) the overall progress towards fulfilling the goal of

22803 improving the quality of rural life by expanding rural broadband

22804 access, as demonstrated by metrics, including--

22805 ``(A) the number of residences and businesses

22806 receiving new broadband services;

22807

22808[[Page 132 STAT. 4743]]

22809

22810 ``(B) network improvements, including facility

22811 upgrades and equipment purchases;

22812 ``(C) average broadband speeds and prices on a local

22813 and statewide basis;

22814 ``(D) any changes in broadband adoption rates; and

22815 ``(E) any specific activities that increased high

22816 speed broadband access for educational institutions,

22817 health care providers, and public safety service

22818 providers.

22819

22820 ``(e) Limitations on Reservation of Funds.--Not less than 3 but not

22821more than 5 percent of program level amounts available pursuant to

22822amounts appropriated to carry out title VI shall be set aside to be used

22823for--

22824 ``(1) conducting oversight under such title;

22825 ``(2) implementing accountability measures and related

22826 activities authorized under such title; and

22827 ``(3) carrying out this section.''.

22828SEC. 6208. ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEWS.

22829

22830 Title VII of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936, as added by

22831section 6207 of this Act, is amended by adding at the end the following:

22832``SEC. 702. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950cc-1.&gt;&gt; ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEWS.

22833

22834 ``The Secretary may obligate, but not disperse, funds under this Act

22835before the completion of otherwise required environmental, historical,

22836or other types of reviews if the Secretary determines that a subsequent

22837site-specific review shall be adequate and easily accomplished for the

22838location of towers, poles, or other broadband facilities in the service

22839area of the borrower without compromising the project or the required

22840reviews.''.

22841SEC. 6209. USE OF LOAN PROCEEDS TO REFINANCE LOANS FOR DEPLOYMENT

22842 OF BROADBAND SERVICE.

22843

22844 Title VII of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936, as added by

22845section 6207 and amended by section 6208 of this Act, is amended by

22846adding at the end the following:

22847``SEC. 703. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950cc-2.&gt;&gt; USE OF LOAN PROCEEDS TO

22848 REFINANCE LOANS FOR DEPLOYMENT OF

22849 BROADBAND SERVICE.

22850

22851 ``Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, the proceeds of

22852any loan made or guaranteed by the Secretary under this Act may be used

22853by the recipient of the loan for the purpose of refinancing an

22854outstanding obligation of the recipient on another telecommunications

22855loan made under this Act, or on any other loan if that loan would have

22856been for an eligible telecommunications purpose under this Act.''.

22857SEC. 6210. SMART UTILITY AUTHORITY FOR BROADBAND.

22858

22859 (a) Section 331 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act

22860(7 U.S.C. 1981) is amended by adding at the end the following:

22861 ``(e)(1) Except as provided in paragraph (2), the Secretary may

22862allow a recipient of a grant, loan, or loan guarantee provided by the

22863Office of Rural Development under this title to use not more than 10

22864percent of the amount so provided--

22865 ``(A) for any activity for which assistance may be provided

22866 under section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936; or

22867

22868[[Page 132 STAT. 4744]]

22869

22870 ``(B) to construct other broadband infrastructure.

22871

22872 ``(2) Paragraph (1) of this subsection shall not apply to a

22873recipient who is seeking to provide retail broadband service in any area

22874where retail broadband service is available at the minimum broadband

22875speeds, as defined under section 601(e) of the Rural Electrification Act

22876of 1936.

22877 ``(3) The Secretary shall not provide funding under paragraph (1) if

22878the funding would result in competitive harm to any grant, loan, or loan

22879guarantee provided under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936.''.

22880 (b) Title I of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 901-

22881918a) is amended by inserting after section 7 the following:

22882``SEC. 8. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 908.&gt;&gt; LIMITATIONS ON USE OF ASSISTANCE.

22883

22884 ``(a) Subject to subsections (b) and (c) of this section, the

22885Secretary may allow a recipient of a grant, loan, or loan guarantee

22886under this title to set aside not more than 10 percent of the amount so

22887received to provide retail broadband service.

22888 ``(b) A recipient who sets aside funds under subsection (a) of this

22889section may use the funds only in an area that is not being provided

22890with the minimum acceptable level of broadband service established under

22891section 601(e), unless the recipient meets the requirements of section

22892601(d).

22893 ``(c) Nothing in this section shall be construed to limit the

22894ability of any borrower to finance or deploy services authorized under

22895this Act.

22896 ``(d) The Secretary shall not provide funding under subsection (a)

22897if the funding would result in competitive harm to any grant, loan, or

22898loan guarantee referred to in subsection (a).''.

22899SEC. 6211. REFINANCING OF TELEPHONE LOANS.

22900

22901 Section 201 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 922)

22902is amended, in the fifth sentence, by striking ``furnishing telephone

22903service in rural areas:'' and all that follows through ``40 per centum

22904of any loan made under this title.'' and inserting ``furnishing

22905telephone service in rural areas, including indebtedness of recipients

22906on another telecommunications loan made under this Act.''.

22907SEC. 6212. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950bb-6.&gt;&gt; FEDERAL BROADBAND PROGRAM

22908 COORDINATION.

22909

22910 (a) Consultation Between USDA and NTIA.--The Secretary shall consult

22911with the Assistant Secretary to assist in the verification of

22912eligibility of the broadband loan and grant programs of the Department

22913of Agriculture. In providing assistance under the preceding sentence,

22914the Assistant Secretary shall make available the broadband assessment

22915and mapping capabilities of the National Telecommunications and

22916Information Administration.

22917 (b) Consultation Between USDA and FCC.--

22918 (1) By usda.--The Secretary shall consult with the

22919 Commission before providing broadband assistance for a project

22920 to serve an area with respect to which another entity is

22921 receiving Connect America Fund or Mobility Fund support under

22922 the Federal universal service support mechanisms established

22923 under section 254 of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C.

22924 254).

22925 (2) By fcc.--The Commission shall consult with the Secretary

22926 before offering or providing Connect America Fund or Mobility

22927 Fund support under the Federal universal service

22928

22929[[Page 132 STAT. 4745]]

22930

22931 support mechanisms established under section 254 of the

22932 Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 254) to serve an area with

22933 respect to which another entity has received broadband

22934 assistance under a loan or grant program of the Department of

22935 Agriculture.

22936

22937 (c) Report to Congress.--Not later than 1 year after the date of the

22938enactment of this Act, the Secretary, the Commission, and the Assistant

22939Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture and the Committee

22940on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives and the Committee

22941on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry and the Committee on Commerce,

22942Science, and Transportation of the Senate a report on how best to

22943coordinate federally supported broadband programs and activities in

22944order to achieve the following objectives:

22945 (1) Promote high-quality broadband service that meets the

22946 long-term needs of rural residents and businesses, by evaluating

22947 the broadband service needs in rural areas for each decade

22948 through 2050.

22949 (2) Support the long-term viability, sustainability, and

22950 utility of federally supported rural broadband infrastructure,

22951 by analyzing the technical capabilities of the technologies

22952 currently available and reasonably expected to be available by

22953 2035 to meet the broadband service needs of rural residents

22954 identified under paragraph (1), including by analyzing the

22955 following:

22956 (A) The real-world performance of such technologies,

22957 including data rates, latency, data usage restrictions,

22958 and other aspects of service quality, as defined by the

22959 Commission.

22960 (B) The suitability of each such technology for

22961 residential, agricultural, educational, healthcare,

22962 commercial, and industrial purposes in rural areas.

22963 (C) The cost to deploy and support such technologies

22964 in several rural geographies.

22965 (D) The costs associated with online platforms,

22966 specifically the resulting constraints on rural network

22967 bandwidth.

22968 (3) Identify and quantify the availability of broadband

22969 service and ongoing broadband deployment in rural areas,

22970 including ways to do the following:

22971 (A) Harmonize broadband notification and reporting

22972 requirements and develop common verification procedures

22973 across all federally supported broadband programs.

22974 (B) Consolidate and utilize the existing broadband

22975 service data.

22976 (C) Collect and share data on those projects in

22977 rural areas where Federal programs are currently

22978 supporting broadband deployment, including areas with

22979 respect to which an entity is receiving--

22980 (i) support under a broadband assistance

22981 program of the Department of Agriculture; or

22982 (ii) Connect America Fund or Mobility Fund

22983 support under the Federal universal service

22984 support mechanisms established under section 254

22985 of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 254).

22986 (D) Leverage support technologies and services from

22987 online platforms for providers of broadband service in

22988 rural areas.

22989

22990[[Page 132 STAT. 4746]]

22991

22992 (d) Definitions.--In this section:

22993 (1) Assistant secretary.--The term ``Assistant Secretary''

22994 means the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and

22995 Information.

22996 (2) Commission.--The term ``Commission'' means the Federal

22997 Communications Commission.

22998 (3) Rural area.--The term ``rural area'' has the meaning

22999 given the term in section 601(b)(3) of the Rural Electrification

23000 Act of 1936.

23001SEC. 6213. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 950bb note.&gt;&gt; TRANSITION RULE.

23002

23003 For the period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act

23004and ending on the date that is one year after such date of enactment,

23005with respect to the implementation of the rural broadband access program

23006under section 601 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C.

23007950bb) and the Community Connect Grant Program under section 604 of such

23008Act, as added by section 6204 of this Act, the Secretary shall use the

23009regulations in existence as of the day before the date of enactment of

23010this Act that are applicable to the program involved, until the

23011Secretary issues a final rule implementing the provisions of, and

23012amendments made by, this title that apply to that program.

23013SEC. 6214. RURAL BROADBAND INTEGRATION WORKING GROUP.

23014

23015 (a) In General.--

23016 (1) Establishment.--There is established the Rural Broadband

23017 Integration Working Group (referred to in this subsection as the

23018 ``Working Group'').

23019 (2) Membership.--The membership of the Working Group shall

23020 be composed of the heads, or their designees, of--

23021 (A) the Department of Agriculture, acting through

23022 the Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service;

23023 (B) the Department of Commerce, acting through the

23024 Assistant Secretary for Communications and Information;

23025 (C) the Department of Defense;

23026 (D) the Department of State;

23027 (E) the Department of the Interior;

23028 (F) the Department of Labor;

23029 (G) the Department of Health and Human Services;

23030 (H) the Department of Homeland Security;

23031 (I) the Department of Housing and Urban Development;

23032 (J) the Department of Justice;

23033 (K) the Department of Transportation;

23034 (L) the Department of the Treasury;

23035 (M) the Department of Energy;

23036 (N) the Department of Education;

23037 (O) the Department of Veterans Affairs;

23038 (P) the Environmental Protection Agency;

23039 (Q) the General Services Administration;

23040 (R) the Small Business Administration;

23041 (S) the Institute of Museum and Library Services;

23042 (T) the National Science Foundation;

23043 (U) the Council on Environmental Quality;

23044 (V) the Office of Science and Technology Policy;

23045 (W) the Office of Management and Budget;

23046 (X) the Council of Economic Advisers;

23047 (Y) the Domestic Policy Council;

23048

23049[[Page 132 STAT. 4747]]

23050

23051 (Z) the National Economic Council; and

23052 (AA) such other Federal agencies or entities as are

23053 determined appropriate by the co-chairs.

23054 (3) Co-chairs.--The following individuals, or their

23055 designees, shall serve as co-chairs of the Working Group:

23056 (A) The Administrator of the Rural Utilities

23057 Service.

23058 (B) The Assistant Secretary for Communications and

23059 Information.

23060 (C) The Director of the National Economic Council.

23061 (D) The Director of the Office of Science and

23062 Technology Policy.

23063 (4) Consultation; coordination.--The Working Group shall

23064 consult, as appropriate, with other relevant agencies, including

23065 the Federal Communications Commission. The Working Group shall

23066 coordinate with existing Federal working groups and committees

23067 involved with broadband.

23068 (5) Membership changes.--The Director of the National

23069 Economic Council and the Director of the Office of Science and

23070 Technology Policy shall review, on a periodic basis, the

23071 membership of the Working Group to ensure that the Working

23072 Group--

23073 (A) includes necessary Federal Government entities;

23074 and

23075 (B) is an effective mechanism for coordinating among

23076 agencies on the policy described in subsection (b).

23077

23078 (b) Functions of Working Group.--

23079 (1) Consultation.--The Working Group shall consult with

23080 State, local, Tribal, and territorial governments,

23081 telecommunications companies, utilities, trade associations,

23082 philanthropic entities, policy experts, and other interested

23083 parties to identify, assess, and determine possible actions

23084 relating to barriers and opportunities for broadband deployment

23085 in rural areas.

23086 (2) Point of contact.--Not later than 15 days after the date

23087 of enactment of this Act, each member of the Working Group

23088 shall--

23089 (A) designate a representative to serve as the main

23090 point of contact for matters relating to the Working

23091 Group; and

23092 (B) notify the co-chairs of the Working Group of

23093 that designee.

23094 (3) Survey.--Not later than 60 days after the date of

23095 enactment of this Act, based on information provided by the

23096 members of the Working Group, the Working Group shall publish a

23097 comprehensive survey of--

23098 (A) Federal programs, including the allocated

23099 funding amounts, that currently support or could

23100 reasonably be modified to support broadband deployment

23101 and adoption; and

23102 (B) all Federal agency-specific policies and rules

23103 with the direct or indirect effect of facilitating or

23104 regulating investment in, or deployment of, wired and

23105 wireless broadband networks.

23106 (4) List of actions.--Not later than 120 days after the date

23107 of enactment of this Act, the members of the Working Group shall

23108 submit to the Working Group an initial list of actions that each

23109 of the agencies could take to identify and

23110

23111[[Page 132 STAT. 4748]]

23112

23113 address regulatory barriers to, incentivize investment in,

23114 promote best practices within, align funding decisions with

23115 respect to, and otherwise support, wired broadband deployment

23116 and adoption.

23117 (5) Report.--Not later than 150 days after the date of

23118 enactment of this Act, the Working Group shall submit to the

23119 President an agreed-to and prioritized list of recommendations

23120 of the Working Group on actions that Federal agencies can take

23121 to support broadband deployment and adoption, including--

23122 (A) a list of priority actions and rulemakings; and

23123 (B) timelines to complete the priority actions and

23124 rulemakings.

23125

23126 Subtitle C--Miscellaneous

23127

23128SEC. 6301. EXCLUSION OF CERTAIN POPULATIONS FROM DEFINITION OF

23129 RURAL AREA.

23130

23131 (a) In General.--Section 343(a)(13) of the Consolidated Farm and

23132Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1991(a)(13)) is amended--

23133 (1) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``(G)'' and inserting

23134 ``(I)''; and

23135 (2) by adding at the end the following:

23136 ``(H) Exclusion of incarcerated populations.--

23137 Populations of individuals incarcerated on a long-term

23138 or regional basis shall not be included in determining

23139 whether an area is `rural' or a `rural area'.

23140 ``(I) Limited exclusion of military base

23141 populations.--The first 1,500 individuals who reside in

23142 housing located on a military base shall not be included

23143 in determining whether an area is `rural' or a `rural

23144 area'.''.

23145

23146 (b) Broadband.--Section 601(b)(3) of the Rural Electrification Act

23147of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950bb(b)(3)) is amended by adding at the end the

23148following:

23149 ``(C) Exclusion of certain populations.--Such term

23150 does not include any population described in

23151 subparagraph (H) or (I) of section 343(a)(13) of the

23152 Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C.

23153 1991(a)(13)).''.

23154

23155 (c) Distance Learning and Telemedicine Loans and Grants.--Section

231562332 of the Food Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7

23157U.S.C. 950aaa-1) is amended by adding at the end the following:

23158 ``(4) Rural area.--The term `rural area' has the meaning

23159 given the term in section 601(b)(3) of the Rural Electrification

23160 Act of 1936.''.

23161SEC. 6302. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2671.&gt;&gt; ESTABLISHMENT OF TECHNICAL

23162 ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.

23163

23164 (a) Definition.--In this section, the term `tribally designated

23165housing entity' has the meaning given the term in section 4 of the

23166Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996

23167(25 U.S.C. 4103).

23168 (b) In General.--The Secretary shall, in coordination with the

23169Office of Tribal Relations established under section 309 of the

23170Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6921),

23171provide technical assistance to improve access by Tribal entities to

23172rural development programs funded by the Department

23173

23174[[Page 132 STAT. 4749]]

23175

23176of Agriculture through available cooperative agreement authorities of

23177the Secretary.

23178 (c) Technical Assistance.--Technical assistance provided under

23179subsection (b) shall address the unique challenge of Tribal governments,

23180Tribal producers, Tribal businesses, Tribal business entities, and

23181tribally designated housing entities in accessing Department of

23182Agriculture-supported rural infrastructure, rural cooperative

23183development, rural business and industry, rural housing, and other rural

23184development activities.

23185SEC. 6303. RURAL ENERGY SAVINGS PROGRAM.

23186

23187 Section 6407 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002

23188(7 U.S.C. 8107a) is amended--

23189 (1) in subsection (b)(2), by striking ``efficiency.'' and

23190 inserting ``efficiency (including cost-effective on- or off-grid

23191 renewable energy or energy storage systems).'';

23192 (2) in subsection (c)--

23193 (A) by redesignating paragraphs (4) through (7) as

23194 paragraphs (5) through (8), respectively;

23195 (B) by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

23196 ``(4) Eligibility for other loans.--The Secretary shall not

23197 include any debt incurred by a borrower under this section in

23198 the calculation of the debt-equity ratio of the borrower for

23199 purposes of eligibility for loans under the Rural

23200 Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 901 et seq.).'';

23201 (C) in subparagraph (B) of paragraph (5) (as so

23202 redesignated), by striking ``(6)'' and inserting

23203 ``(7)''; and

23204 (D) by adding at the end the following:

23205 ``(9) Accounting.--The Secretary shall take appropriate

23206 steps to streamline the accounting requirements on borrowers

23207 under this section while maintaining adequate assurances of the

23208 repayment of the loans.'';

23209 (3) in subsection (d)(1)--

23210 (A) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``3 percent''

23211 and inserting ``5 percent''; and

23212 (B) in subparagraph (D), by striking ``electric''

23213 and inserting ``recurring service'';

23214 (4) by redesignating subsection (h) as subsection (i);

23215 (5) by inserting after subsection (g) the following:

23216

23217 ``(h) Publication.--Not later than 120 days after the end of each

23218fiscal year, the Secretary shall publish a description of--

23219 ``(1) the number of applications received under this section

23220 for that fiscal year;

23221 ``(2) the number of loans made to eligible entities under

23222 this section for that fiscal year; and

23223 ``(3) the recipients of the loans described in paragraph

23224 (2).''; and

23225 (6) in subsection (i) (as so redesignated), by striking

23226 ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

23227SEC. 6304. NORTHERN BORDER REGIONAL COMMISSION REAUTHORIZATION.

23228

23229 (a) Administrative Expenses of Regional Commissions.--Section

2323015304(c)(3)(A) of title 40, United States Code, is amended by striking

23231``unanimous'' and inserting ``majority''.

23232 (b) Economic and Infrastructure Development Grants.--Section 15501

23233of title 40, United States Code, is amended--

23234 (1) in subsection (a)--

23235

23236[[Page 132 STAT. 4750]]

23237

23238 (A) in paragraph (7), by striking ``and'' at the

23239 end;

23240 (B) by redesignating paragraph (8) as paragraph (9);

23241 and

23242 (C) by inserting after paragraph (7) the following:

23243 ``(8) to grow the capacity for successful community economic

23244 development in its region; and'';

23245 (2) in subsection (b), by striking ``paragraphs (1) through

23246 (3)'' and inserting ``paragraph (1), (2), (3), or (7)''; and

23247 (3) in subsection (f), by striking the period at the end and

23248 inserting ``, except that financial assistance may be used as

23249 otherwise authorized by this subtitle to attract businesses to

23250 the region from outside the United States.''.

23251

23252 (c) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 40 USC 15501 note.&gt;&gt; State Capacity Building Grant

23253Program.--

23254 (1) Definitions.--In this subsection:

23255 (A) Commission.--The term ``Commission'' means the

23256 Northern Border Regional Commission established by

23257 section 15301(a)(3) of title 40, United States Code.

23258 (B) Commission state.--The term ``Commission State''

23259 means each of the States of Maine, New Hampshire, New

23260 York, and Vermont.

23261 (C) Eligible county.--The term ``eligible county''

23262 means a county described in section 15733 of title 40,

23263 United States Code.

23264 (D) Program.--The term ``program'' means the State

23265 capacity building grant program established under

23266 paragraph (2).

23267 (2) Establishment.--Not later than 180 days after the date

23268 of enactment of this Act, the Commission shall establish a State

23269 capacity building grant program to provide grants to Commission

23270 States to carry out the purpose under paragraph (3).

23271 (3) Purpose.--The purpose of the program is to support the

23272 efforts of the Commission--

23273 (A) to better support business retention and

23274 expansion in eligible counties;

23275 (B) to create programs to encourage job creation and

23276 workforce development in eligible counties;

23277 (C) to prepare economic and infrastructure plans for

23278 eligible counties;

23279 (D) to expand access to high-speed broadband in

23280 eligible counties;

23281 (E) to provide technical assistance that results in

23282 Commission investments in transportation, water,

23283 wastewater, and other critical infrastructure;

23284 (F) to create initiatives to increase the

23285 effectiveness of local development districts in eligible

23286 counties; and

23287 (G) to implement new or innovative economic

23288 development practices that will better position the

23289 eligible counties of Commission States to compete in the

23290 global economy.

23291 (4) Use of funds.--

23292 (A) In general.--Funds from a grant under the

23293 program may be used to support a project, program, or

23294 related expense of the Commission State in an eligible

23295 county.

23296 (B) Limitation.--Funds from a grant under the

23297 program shall not be used for--

23298 (i) the purchase of furniture, fixtures, or

23299 equipment;

23300

23301[[Page 132 STAT. 4751]]

23302

23303 (ii) the compensation of--

23304 (I) any State member of the

23305 Commission (as described in section

23306 15301(b)(1)(B) of title 40, United

23307 States Code); or

23308 (II) any State alternate member of

23309 the Commission (as described in section

23310 15301(b)(2)(B) of title 40, United

23311 States Code); or

23312 (iii) the cost of supplanting existing State

23313 programs.

23314 (5) Annual work plan.--

23315 (A) In general.--For each fiscal year, before

23316 providing a grant under the program, each Commission

23317 State shall provide to the Commission an annual work

23318 plan that includes the proposed use of the grant.

23319 (B) Approval.--No grant under the program shall be

23320 provided to a Commission State unless the Commission has

23321 approved the annual work plan of the State.

23322 (6) Amount of grant.--

23323 (A) In general.--The amount of a grant provided to a

23324 Commission State under the program for a fiscal year

23325 shall be based on the proportion that--

23326 (i) the amount paid by the Commission State

23327 (including any amounts paid on behalf of the

23328 Commission State by a nonprofit organization) for

23329 administrative expenses for the applicable fiscal

23330 year (as determined under section 15304(c) of

23331 title 40, United States Code); bears to

23332 (ii) the amount paid by all Commission States

23333 (including any amounts paid on behalf of a

23334 Commission State by a nonprofit organization) for

23335 administrative expenses for that fiscal year (as

23336 determined under that section).

23337 (B) Requirement.--To be eligible to receive a grant

23338 under the program for a fiscal year, a Commission State

23339 (or a nonprofit organization on behalf of the Commission

23340 State) shall pay the amount of administrative expenses

23341 of the Commission State for the applicable fiscal year

23342 (as determined under section 15304(c) of title 40,

23343 United States Code).

23344 (C) Approval.--For each fiscal year, a grant

23345 provided under the program shall be approved and made

23346 available as part of the approval of the annual budget

23347 of the Commission.

23348 (7) Grant availability.--Funds from a grant under the

23349 program shall be available only during the fiscal year for which

23350 the grant is provided.

23351 (8) Report.--Each fiscal year, each Commission State shall

23352 submit to the Commission and make publicly available a report

23353 that describes the use of the grant funds and the impact of the

23354 program in the State.

23355 (9) Funding.--

23356 (A) In general.--There is authorized to be

23357 appropriated to carry out this subsection $5,000,000 for

23358 each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.

23359 (B) Supplement, not supplant.--Funds made available

23360 to carry out this subsection shall supplement and

23361

23362[[Page 132 STAT. 4752]]

23363

23364 not supplant funds made available for the Commission and

23365 other activities of the Commission.

23366

23367 (d) Northern Border Regional Commission.--Section 15733 of title 40,

23368United States Code, is amended--

23369 (1) in paragraph (2)--

23370 (A) by inserting ``Belknap,'' before ``Carroll,'';

23371 and

23372 (B) by inserting ``Cheshire,'' before ``Coos,'';

23373 (2) by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following

23374 new paragraph:

23375 ``(3) New york.--The counties of Cayuga, Clinton, Essex,

23376 Franklin, Fulton, Genesee, Greene, Hamilton, Herkimer,

23377 Jefferson, Lewis, Livingston, Madison, Montgomery, Niagara,

23378 Oneida, Orleans, Oswego, Rensselaer, Saratoga, Schenectady,

23379 Seneca, St. Lawrence, Sullivan, Washington, Warren, Wayne, and

23380 Yates in the State of New York.''; and

23381 (3) in paragraph (4)--

23382 (A) by inserting ``Addison, Bennington,'' before

23383 ``Caledonia,'';

23384 (B) by inserting ``Chittenden,'' before ``Essex,'';

23385 (C) by striking ``and'' and inserting ``Orange,''

23386 and

23387 (D) by inserting ``, Rutland, Washington, Windham,

23388 and Windsor'' after ``Orleans''.

23389

23390 (e) Authorization of Appropriations.--Section 15751(a) of title 40,

23391United States Code, is amended by striking ``$30,000,000 for each of

23392fiscal years 2008 through 2018'' and inserting ``$33,000,000 for each of

23393fiscal years 2019 through 2023''.

23394 (f) Vacancies.--Section 15301 of title 40, United States Code, is

23395amended by adding at the end the following:

23396 ``(f) Succession.--Subject to the time limitations under section

233973346 of title 5, the Federal Cochairperson may designate a Federal

23398employee of the Commission to perform the functions and duties of the

23399office of the Federal Cochairperson temporarily in an acting capacity if

23400both the Federal Cochairperson and the alternate Federal Cochairperson

23401die, resign, or otherwise are unable to perform the functions and duties

23402of their offices.''.

23403 (g) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 40 USC 15101 prec., 15301 prec., 15501 prec., 15701

23404prec.&gt;&gt; Technical Amendments.--Chapters 1, 2, 3, and 4 of subtitle V of

23405title 40, United States Code, are redesignated as chapters 151, 153,

23406155, and 157, respectively.

23407SEC. 6305. DEFINITION OF RURAL AREA FOR PURPOSES OF THE HOUSING

23408 ACT OF 1949.

23409

23410 The second sentence of section 520 of the Housing Act of 1949 (42

23411U.S.C. 1490) is amended--

23412 (1) by striking ``or 2010 decennial census'' and inserting

23413 ``2010, or 2020 decennial census'';

23414 (2) by striking ``December 31, 2010,'' and inserting

23415 ``December 31, 2020,'' ; and

23416 (3) by striking ``year 2020'' and inserting ``year 2030''.

23417SEC. 6306. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2204b-3.&gt;&gt; COUNCIL ON RURAL COMMUNITY

23418 INNOVATION AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.

23419

23420 (a) Purpose.--The purpose of this section is to enhance the efforts

23421of the Federal Government to address the needs of rural areas in the

23422United States by--

23423 (1) establishing a council to better coordinate Federal

23424 programs directed to rural communities;

23425

23426[[Page 132 STAT. 4753]]

23427

23428 (2) maximizing the impact of Federal investment to promote

23429 economic prosperity and quality of life in rural communities in

23430 the United States; and

23431 (3) using innovation to resolve local and regional

23432 challenges faced by rural communities.

23433

23434 (b) Establishment.--

23435 (1) There is established a Council on Rural Community

23436 Innovation and Economic Development (referred to in this section

23437 as the ``Council'').

23438 (2) The Council shall be the successor to the Interagency

23439 Task Force on Agriculture and Rural Prosperity established by

23440 Executive Order 13790.

23441

23442 (c) Membership.--

23443 (1) In general.--The membership of the Council shall be

23444 composed of the heads of the following executive branch

23445 departments, agencies, and offices:

23446 (A) The Department of Agriculture.

23447 (B) The Department of the Treasury.

23448 (C) The Department of Defense.

23449 (D) The Department of Justice.

23450 (E) The Department of the Interior.

23451 (F) The Department of Commerce.

23452 (G) The Department of Labor.

23453 (H) The Department of Health and Human Services.

23454 (I) The Department of Housing and Urban Development.

23455 (J) The Department of Transportation.

23456 (K) The Department of Energy.

23457 (L) The Department of Education.

23458 (M) The Department of Veterans Affairs.

23459 (N) The Department of Homeland Security.

23460 (O) The Environmental Protection Agency.

23461 (P) The Federal Communications Commission.

23462 (Q) The Office of Management and Budget.

23463 (R) The Office of Science and Technology Policy.

23464 (S) The Office of National Drug Control Policy.

23465 (T) The Council of Economic Advisers.

23466 (U) The Domestic Policy Council.

23467 (V) The National Economic Council.

23468 (W) The Small Business Administration.

23469 (X) The Council on Environmental Quality.

23470 (Y) The White House Office of Public Engagement.

23471 (Z) The White House Office of Cabinet Affairs.

23472 (AA) Such other executive branch departments,

23473 agencies, and offices as the President or the Secretary

23474 may, from time to time, designate.

23475 (2) Chair.--The Secretary shall serve as the Chair of the

23476 Council.

23477 (3) Designees.--A member of the Council may designate, to

23478 perform the Council functions of the member, a senior-level

23479 official who is--

23480 (A) part of the department, agency, or office of the

23481 member; and

23482 (B) a full-time officer or employee of the Federal

23483 Government.

23484 (4) Administration.--The Council shall coordinate policy

23485 development through the rural development mission area.

23486

23487[[Page 132 STAT. 4754]]

23488

23489 (d) Funding.--The Secretary shall provide funding and administrative

23490support for the Council to the extent permitted by law and within

23491existing appropriations.

23492 (e) Mission and Function of the Council.--The Council shall work

23493across executive departments, agencies, and offices to coordinate

23494development of policy recommendations--

23495 (1) to maximize the impact of Federal investment on rural

23496 communities;

23497 (2) to promote economic prosperity and quality of life in

23498 rural communities; and

23499 (3) to use innovation to resolve local and regional

23500 challenges faced by rural communities.

23501

23502 (f) Duties.--The Council shall--

23503 (1) make recommendations to the President, acting through

23504 the Director of the Domestic Policy Council and the Director of

23505 the National Economic Council, on streamlining and leveraging

23506 Federal investments in rural areas, where appropriate, to

23507 increase the impact of Federal dollars and create economic

23508 opportunities to improve the quality of life in rural areas in

23509 the United States;

23510 (2) coordinate and increase the effectiveness of Federal

23511 engagement with rural stakeholders, including agricultural

23512 organizations, small businesses, education and training

23513 institutions, health-care providers, telecommunications services

23514 providers, electric service providers, transportation providers,

23515 research and land grant institutions, law enforcement, State,

23516 local, and tribal governments, and nongovernmental organizations

23517 regarding the needs of rural areas in the United States;

23518 (3) coordinate Federal efforts directed toward the growth

23519 and development of rural geographic regions that encompass both

23520 metropolitan and nonmetropolitan areas;

23521 (4) identify and facilitate rural economic opportunities

23522 associated with energy development, outdoor recreation, and

23523 other conservation related activities; and

23524 (5) identify common economic and social challenges faced by

23525 rural communities that could be served through--

23526 (A) better coordination of existing Federal and non-

23527 Federal resources; and

23528 (B) innovative solutions utilizing governmental and

23529 nongovernmental resources.

23530

23531 (g) Executive Departments and Agencies.--

23532 (1) In general.--The heads of executive departments and

23533 agencies shall assist and provide information to the Council,

23534 consistent with applicable law, as may be necessary to carry out

23535 the functions of the Council.

23536 (2) Expenses.--Each executive department or agency shall be

23537 responsible for paying any expenses of the executive department

23538 or agency for participating in the Council.

23539

23540 (h) Council Working Groups.--

23541 (1) In general.--The Council may establish, in addition to

23542 the working groups established under paragraph (3), such other

23543 working groups as necessary.

23544 (2) Membership.--The Secretary shall include as members of

23545 each working group such Council members, other heads of Federal

23546 agencies (or their designees as defined in (d)(3)), and non-

23547 Federal partners as determined appropriate to the subject

23548 matter.

23549

23550[[Page 132 STAT. 4755]]

23551

23552 (3) Required working groups.--The working groups specified

23553 in this paragraph are each of the following:

23554 (A) The rural smart communities working group.--

23555 (i) Establishment.--The Council shall

23556 establish a Rural Smart Communities Working Group.

23557 (ii) Duties.--The Rural Smart Communities

23558 Working Group shall--

23559 (I) not later than 1 year after the

23560 establishment of such Working Group,

23561 submit to Congress a report describing

23562 efforts of rural areas to integrate

23563 smart technology into their communities

23564 to solve challenges relating to

23565 governance, economic development,

23566 quality of life, or other relevant rural

23567 issues, as determined by the Secretary;

23568 and

23569 (II) create, publish, and maintain a

23570 resource guide designed to assist States

23571 and other rural communities in

23572 developing and implementing rural smart

23573 community programs.

23574 (iii) Smart community defined.--For the

23575 purposes of this subparagraph, the term ``smart

23576 community'' means a community that has the ability

23577 to integrate multiple technological solutions, in

23578 a secure fashion, to manage a community's assets,

23579 including local government information systems,

23580 schools, libraries, transportation systems,

23581 hospitals, power plants, law enforcement, and

23582 other community services with the goal of

23583 promoting quality of life through the use of

23584 technology in ways that improve the efficiency of

23585 services and meet residents' needs.

23586 (B) Jobs accelerator working group.--

23587 (i) Establishment.--The Council shall

23588 establish a Jobs Accelerator Working Group.

23589 (ii) Goals.--The Jobs Accelerator Working

23590 Group shall support rural jobs accelerators (as

23591 defined in section 379I(a)(4) of the Consolidated

23592 Farm and Rural Development Act)--

23593 (I) to improve the ability of rural

23594 communities to create high-wage jobs,

23595 accelerate the formation of new

23596 businesses with high-growth potential,

23597 and strengthen regional economies,

23598 including by helping to build capacity

23599 in the applicable region to achieve

23600 those goals; and

23601 (II) to help rural communities

23602 identify and maximize local assets and

23603 connect to regional opportunities,

23604 networks, and industry clusters that

23605 demonstrate high growth potential.

23606 (iii) Duties.--The Jobs Accelerator Working

23607 Group shall--

23608 (I) provide the public with

23609 available information and technical

23610 assistance on Federal resources relevant

23611 to a project and region;

23612 (II) establish a Federal support

23613 team comprised of staff from

23614 participating agencies in the working

23615 group that shall provide coordinated and

23616 dedicated support services to rural jobs

23617 accelerators; and

23618

23619[[Page 132 STAT. 4756]]

23620

23621 (III) provide opportunities for

23622 rural jobs accelerators to share best

23623 practices and further collaborate with

23624 one another.

23625

23626 Subtitle D--Additional Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural

23627 Development Act

23628

23629SEC. 6401. STRATEGIC ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT.

23630

23631 Section 379H of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

23632U.S.C. 2008v) is amended to read as follows:

23633``SEC. 379H. STRATEGIC ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT.

23634

23635 ``(a) In General.--In the case of any program under this title or

23636administered by the Secretary, acting through the rural development

23637mission area, as determined by the Secretary (referred to in this

23638section as a `covered program'), the Secretary shall give priority to an

23639application for a project that, as determined and approved by the

23640Secretary--

23641 ``(1) meets the applicable eligibility requirements of this

23642 title or the other applicable authorizing law;

23643 ``(2) will be carried out in a rural area; and

23644 ``(3) supports the implementation of a strategic community

23645 investment plan described in subsection (d) on a multisectoral

23646 and multijurisdictional basis, to include considerations for

23647 improving and expanding broadband services as needed.

23648

23649 ``(b) Reserve.--

23650 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (2), the Secretary

23651 shall reserve not more than 15 percent of the funds made

23652 available for a fiscal year for covered programs for projects

23653 that support the implementation of a strategic community

23654 investment plan described in subsection (d) on a multisectoral

23655 and multijurisdictional basis.

23656 ``(2) Period.--Any funds reserved under paragraph (1) shall

23657 only be reserved for the 1-year period beginning on the date on

23658 which the funds were first made available, as determined by the

23659 Secretary.

23660

23661 ``(c) Approved Applications.--

23662 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (2), any applicant

23663 who submitted an application under a covered program that was

23664 approved before the date of enactment of this section may amend

23665 the application to qualify for the funds reserved under

23666 subsection (b).

23667 ``(2) Rural utilities.--Any applicant who submitted an

23668 application under paragraph (2), (14), or (24) of section

23669 306(a), or section 306A or 310B(b), that was approved by the

23670 Secretary before the date of enactment of this section shall be

23671 eligible for the funds reserved under subsection (b)--

23672 ``(A) on the same basis as an application submitted

23673 under this section; and

23674 ``(B) until September 30, 2019.

23675

23676 ``(d) Strategic Community Investment Plans.--

23677 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall provide assistance to

23678 rural communities in developing strategic community investment

23679 plans.

23680

23681[[Page 132 STAT. 4757]]

23682

23683 ``(2) Plans.--A strategic community investment plan

23684 described in paragraph (1) shall include--

23685 ``(A) a variety of activities designed to facilitate

23686 the vision of a rural community for the future,

23687 including considerations for improving and expanding

23688 broadband services as needed;

23689 ``(B) participation by multiple stakeholders,

23690 including local and regional partners;

23691 ``(C) leverage of applicable regional resources;

23692 ``(D) investment from strategic partners, such as--

23693 ``(i) private organizations;

23694 ``(ii) cooperatives;

23695 ``(iii) other government entities;

23696 ``(iv) Indian Tribes; and

23697 ``(v) philanthropic organizations;

23698 ``(E) clear objectives with the ability to establish

23699 measurable performance metrics;

23700 ``(F) action steps for implementation; and

23701 ``(G) any other elements necessary to ensure that

23702 the plan results in a comprehensive and strategic

23703 approach to rural economic development, as determined by

23704 the Secretary.

23705 ``(3) Coordination.--The Secretary shall coordinate with

23706 Indian Tribes and local, State, regional, and Federal partners

23707 to develop strategic community investment plans under this

23708 subsection.

23709 ``(4) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized

23710 to be appropriated to carry out this subsection $5,000,000 for

23711 each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023, to remain available

23712 until expended.''.

23713SEC. 6402. EXPANDING ACCESS TO CREDIT FOR RURAL COMMUNITIES.

23714

23715 (a) Certain Programs Under the Consolidated Farm and Rural

23716Development Act.--Section 343(a)(13) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

23717Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1991(a)(13)) is amended--

23718 (1) in subparagraph (B)--

23719 (A) in the heading, by striking ``and guaranteed'';

23720 and

23721 (B) in the text--

23722 (i) by striking ``and guaranteed''; and

23723 (ii) by striking ``(1), (2), and (24)'' and

23724 inserting ``(1) and (2)''; and

23725 (2) in subparagraph (C)--

23726 (A) by striking ``and guaranteed''; and

23727 (B) by striking ``(21), and (24)'' and inserting

23728 ``and (21)''.

23729

23730 (b) Population Caps for Guaranteed Lending.--Section 306(a)(24) of

23731such Act (7 U.S.C. 1926(a)(24)) is amended by adding at the end the

23732following:

23733 ``(D) Priority.--

23734 ``(i) Water or waste facility.--The Secretary

23735 shall prioritize water and waste facility projects

23736 under this paragraph in rural areas with a

23737 population of not more than 10,000 people.

23738 ``(ii) Community facility.--Of the funds made

23739 available to carry out this paragraph for

23740 community

23741

23742[[Page 132 STAT. 4758]]

23743

23744 facility loan guarantees for a fiscal year the

23745 following amounts shall be reserved for projects

23746 in rural areas with a population of not more than

23747 20,000 inhabitants:

23748 ``(I) 100 percent of the first

23749 $200,000,000 so made available;

23750 ``(II) 50 percent of the next

23751 $200,000,000 so made available; and

23752 ``(III) 25 percent of all amounts

23753 exceeding $400,000,000 so made

23754 available,

23755 except that, to the extent that the Secretary

23756 demonstrates that the funds so reserved are not

23757 needed to finance a community facility project in

23758 such a rural area, the Secretary may use the funds

23759 for other community facility projects in

23760 accordance with this paragraph.''.

23761SEC. 6403. WATER, WASTE DISPOSAL, AND WASTEWATER FACILITY GRANTS.

23764Act (7 U.S.C. 1926(a)(2)(B)) is amended--

23766 appears and inserting ``$200,000''; and

23767 (2) in clause (vii), by striking ``$30,000,000 for each of

23768 fiscal years 2008 through 2018'' and inserting ``$15,000,000 for

23769 each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023''.

23770SEC. 6404. RURAL WATER AND WASTEWATER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND

23771 TRAINING PROGRAMS.

23772

23774Act (7 U.S.C. 1926(a)(14)) is amended--

23775 (1) in subparagraph (A)--

23776 (A) in clause (ii), by striking ``and'' at the end;

23777 (B) in clause (iii), by striking the period and

23778 inserting a semicolon; and

23779 (C) by adding at the end the following:

23780 ``(iv) identify options to enhance the long-

23781 term sustainability of rural water and waste

23782 systems, including operational practices, revenue

23783 enhancements, partnerships, consolidation,

23784 regionalization, or contract services; and

23785 ``(v) address the contamination of drinking

23786 water and surface water supplies by emerging

23787 contaminants, including per- and polyfluoroalkyl

23788 substances.''; and

23789 (2) in subparagraph (C)--

23790 (A) by striking ``1 nor more than 3'' and inserting

23791 ``3 percent and not more than 5''; and

23792 (B) by striking ``1 per centum'' and inserting ``3

23793 percent''.

23797Act (7 U.S.C. 1926(a)(22)(B)) is amended by striking ``$20,000,000 for

23798fiscal year 2014 and each fiscal year thereafter'' and inserting

23799``$25,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023''.

23800

23801[[Page 132 STAT. 4759]]

23802

23804 FACILITIES.

23805

23807Act (7 U.S.C. 1926(a)(25)(C)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and

23808inserting ``2023''.

23809SEC. 6407. EMERGENCY AND IMMINENT COMMUNITY WATER ASSISTANCE GRANT

23810 PROGRAM.

23811

23812 (a) In General.--Section 306A of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

23813Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1926a) is amended--

23814 (1) in subsection (b)(1), by striking ``; and'' and

23815 inserting the following: ``, particularly to projects to address

23816 contamination that--

23817 ``(A) poses a threat to human health or the

23818 environment; and

23819 ``(B) was caused by circumstances beyond the control

23820 of the applicant for a grant, including circumstances

23821 that occurred over a period of time; and'';

23822 (2) in subsection (d)(1)(D), by inserting ``, other than

23823 those covered above for not to exceed 120 days when a more

23824 permanent solution is not feasible in a shorter time frame.

23825 Where drinking water supplies are inadequate due to an event, as

23826 determined by the Secretary, including drought, severe weather,

23827 or contamination, the Secretary may provide potable water for an

23828 additional period of time not to exceed an additional 120 days

23829 in order to protect public health'' before the period;

23830 (3) in subsection (e)(1)(B), by striking ``according to the

23831 most recent decennial census of the United States'';

23832 (4) in subsection (f)(1), by striking ``$500,000'' and

23833 inserting ``$1,000,000''; and

23834 (5) in subsection (i)--

23835 (A) in paragraph (1)--

23836 (i) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``3 nor

23837 more than 5'' and inserting ``5 percent and not

23838 more than 7''; and

23839 (ii) by striking subparagraph (B) and

23840 inserting the following:

23841 ``(B) Release.--

23842 ``(i) In general.--Funds reserved under

23843 subparagraph (A) for a fiscal year shall be

23844 reserved only until July 1 of the fiscal year.

23845 ``(ii) Exception.--Notwithstanding clause (i),

23846 in response to an eligible community where the

23847 drinking water supplies are inadequate, as

23848 determined by the Secretary, due to an event,

23849 including drought, severe weather, or

23850 contamination, the Secretary may use funds

23851 described in subparagraph (A) from July 1 through

23852 September 30 each fiscal year to provide potable

23853 water under this section in order to protect

23854 public health.''; and

23855 (B) in paragraph (2), by striking ``$35,000,000 for

23856 each of fiscal years 2008 through 2018'' and inserting

23857 ``$50,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through

23858 2023''.

23859

23860 (b) Interagency Task Force on Rural Water Quality.--

23861 (1) In general.--Not later than 90 days after the date of

23862 enactment of this section, the Secretary shall coordinate

23863

23864[[Page 132 STAT. 4760]]

23865

23866 an interagency task force to examine drinking water and surface

23867 water contamination in rural communities, particularly rural

23868 communities that are in close proximity to active or

23869 decommissioned military installations in the United States.

23870 (2) Membership.--The interagency task force shall consist

23871 of--

23872 (A) the Secretary;

23873 (B) the Secretary of the Army, acting through the

23874 Chief of Engineers;

23875 (C) the Secretary of Health and Human Services,

23876 acting through--

23877 (i) the Director of the Agency for Toxic

23878 Substances and Disease Registry; and

23879 (ii) the Director of the Centers for Disease

23880 Control and Prevention;

23881 (D) the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development;

23882 (E) the Secretary of the Interior, acting through--

23883 (i) the Director of the United States Fish and

23884 Wildlife Service; and

23885 (ii) the Director of the United States

23886 Geological Survey;

23887 (F) the Administrator of the Environmental

23888 Protection Agency; and

23889 (G) representatives from rural drinking and

23890 wastewater entities, State and community regulators, and

23891 appropriate scientific experts that reflect a diverse

23892 cross-section of the rural communities described in

23893 paragraph (1).

23894 (3) Report.--

23895 (A) In general.--Not later than 360 days after the

23896 date of enactment of this section, the task force shall

23897 submit to the committees described in subparagraph (B) a

23898 report that--

23899 (i) examines, and identifies issues relating

23900 to, water contamination in rural communities,

23901 particularly rural communities that are in close

23902 proximity to active or decommissioned military

23903 installations in the United States;

23904 (ii) reviews the extent to which Federal,

23905 State, and local government agencies coordinate

23906 with one another to address the issues identified

23907 under clause (i);

23908 (iii) recommends how Federal, State, and local

23909 government agencies can work together in the most

23910 effective, efficient, and cost-effective manner

23911 practicable, to address the issues identified

23912 under clause (i); and

23913 (iv) recommends changes to existing statutory

23914 requirements, regulatory requirements, or both, to

23915 improve interagency coordination and

23916 responsiveness to address the issues identified

23917 under clause (i).

23918 (B) Committees described.--The committees referred

23919 to in subparagraph (A) are--

23920 (i) the Committee on Agriculture of the House

23921 of Representatives;

23922 (ii) the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition,

23923 and Forestry of the Senate;

23924

23925[[Page 132 STAT. 4761]]

23926

23927 (iii) the Committee on Energy and Commerce of

23928 the House of Representatives;

23929 (iv) the Committee on Environment and Public

23930 Works of the Senate;

23931 (v) the Committee on Armed Services of the

23932 House of Representatives; and

23933 (vi) the Committee on Armed Services of the

23934 Senate.

23935SEC. 6408. WATER SYSTEMS FOR RURAL AND NATIVE VILLAGES IN ALASKA.

23936

23937 Section 306D of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

23938U.S.C. 1926d) is amended--

23939 (1) in subsection (a), by striking ``Alaska for'' and

23940 inserting ``Alaska, a consortium formed pursuant to section 325

23941 of the Department of the Interior and Related Agencies

23942 Appropriations Act, 1998 (Public Law 105-83; 111 Stat. 1597),

23943 and Native villages (as defined in section 3 of the Alaska

23944 Native Claims Settlement Act (43 U.S.C. 1602)) for'';

23945 (2) in subsection (b), by inserting ``for any grant awarded

23946 under subsection (a)'' before the period at the end; and

23947 (3) in subsection (d)--

23948 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``2018'' and

23949 inserting ``2023''; and

23950 (B) in paragraph (2), by striking ``Alaska'' and

23951 inserting ``Alaska, and not more than 2 percent of the

23952 amount made available under paragraph (1) for a fiscal

23953 year may be used by a consortium formed pursuant to

23954 section 325 of the Department of the Interior and

23955 Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1998 (Public Law

23956 105-83; 111 Stat. 1597),''.

23957SEC. 6409. RURAL DECENTRALIZED WATER SYSTEMS.

23958

23959 Section 306E of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

23960U.S.C. 1926e) is amended--

23961 (1) by striking the section heading and inserting ``rural

23962 decentralized water systems'';

23963 (2) in subsection (a), by striking ``100'' and inserting

23964 ``60'';

23965 (3) in subsection (b)--

23966 (A) in paragraph (1)--

23967 (i) by inserting ``and subgrants'' after

23968 ``loans''; and

23969 (ii) by inserting ``and individually owned

23970 household decentralized wastewater systems'' after

23971 ``well systems'';

23972 (B) by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the

23973 following:

23974 ``(2) Terms and amounts.--

23975 ``(A) Terms of loans.--A loan made with grant funds

23976 under this section--

23977 ``(i) shall have an interest rate of 1

23978 percent; and

23979 ``(ii) shall have a term not to exceed 20

23980 years.

23981 ``(B) Amounts.--A loan or subgrant made with grant

23982 funds under this section shall not exceed $15,000 for

23983 each water well system or decentralized wastewater

23984 system described in paragraph (1).''; and

23985 (C) by adding at the end the following:

23986 ``(4) Ground well water contamination.--In the event of

23987 ground well water contamination, the Secretary shall allow a

23988 loan or subgrant to be made with grant funds under this

23989

23990[[Page 132 STAT. 4762]]

23991

23992 section for the installation of water treatment where needed

23993 beyond the point of entry, with or without the installation of a

23994 new water well system.'';

23995 (4) in subsection (c), by striking ``productive use of

23996 individually-owned household water well systems'' and inserting

23997 ``effective use of individually owned household water well

23998 systems, individually owned household decentralized wastewater

23999 systems,''; and

24000 (5) in subsection (d)--

24001 (A) by striking ``$5,000,000'' and inserting

24002 ``$20,000,000''; and

24003 (B) by striking ``2014 through 2018'' and inserting

24004 ``2019 through 2023''.

24046SEC. 6416. INTEMEDIARY RELENDING PROGRAM.

24047

24048 Section 310H of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

24049U.S.C. 1936b) is amended--

24050 (1) by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection (i);

24051 (2) by inserting after subsection (d) the following:

24052

24053[[Page 132 STAT. 4763]]

24054

24055 ``(e) Limitation on Loan Amounts.--The maximum amount of a loan by

24056an eligible entity described in subsection (b) to individuals and

24057entities for a project under subsection (c), including the unpaid

24058balance of any existing loans, shall be the lesser of--

24059 ``(1) $400,000; and

24060 ``(2) 50 percent of the loan to the eligible entity under

24061 subsection (a).

24062

24063 ``(f) Applications.--

24064 ``(1) In general.--To be eligible to receive a loan or loan

24065 guarantee under subsection (a), an eligible entity described in

24066 subsection (b) shall submit to the Secretary an application at

24067 such time, in such manner, and containing such information as

24068 the Secretary may require.

24069 ``(2) Evaluation.--In evaluating applications submitted

24070 under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall--

24071 ``(A)(i) take into consideration the previous

24072 performance of an eligible entity in carrying out

24073 projects under subsection (c); and

24074 ``(ii) in the case of satisfactory performance under

24075 clause (i), require the eligible entity to contribute

24076 less equity for subsequent loans without modifying the

24077 priority given to subsequent applications; and

24078 ``(B) in assigning priorities to applications,

24079 require an eligible entity to demonstrate that it has a

24080 governing or advisory board made up of business, civic,

24081 and community leaders who are representative of the

24082 communities of the service area, without limitation to

24083 the size of the service area.

24084

24085 ``(g) Return of Equity.--The Secretary shall establish a schedule

24086that is consistent with the amortization schedules of the portfolio of

24087loans made or guaranteed under subsection (a) for the return of any

24088equity contribution made under this section by an eligible entity

24089described in subsection (b), if the eligible entity is--

24090 ``(1) current on all principal and interest payments; and

24091 ``(2) in compliance with loan covenants.

24092

24093 ``(h) Regulations.--The Secretary shall promulgate regulations and

24094establish procedures reducing the administrative requirements on

24095eligible entities described in subsection (b), including regulations to

24096carry out the amendments made to this section by the Agriculture

24097Improvement Act of 2018.''; and

24098 (3) in subsection (i) (as so redesignated), by striking

24099 ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

24100SEC. 6417. ACCESS TO INFORMATION TO VERIFY INCOME FOR PARTICIPANTS

24101 IN CERTAIN RURAL HOUSING PROGRAMS.

24102

24103 Section 331 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

24104U.S.C. 1981), as amended by section 6210(a) of this Act, is amended by

24105adding at the end the following:

24106 ``(f) Access to Information to Verify Income for Participants in

24107Certain Rural Housing Programs.--The Secretary and the designees of the

24108Secretary are hereby granted the same access to information and subject

24109to the same requirements applicable to the Secretary of Housing and

24110Urban Development as provided in section 453 of the Social Security Act

24111(42 U.S.C. 653) and section 6103(l)(7)(D)(ix) of the Internal Revenue

24112Code of 1986 (26 U.S.C. 6103(l)(7)(D)(ix)) to verify income for

24113individuals participating in

24114

24115[[Page 132 STAT. 4764]]

24116

24117sections 502, 504, 521, and 542 of the Housing Act of 1949 (42 U.S.C.

241181472, 1474, 1490a, and 1490r), notwithstanding section 453(l) of the

24119Social Security Act.''.

24120SEC. 6418. PROVIDING FOR ADDITIONAL FEES FOR GUARANTEED LOANS

24121 UNDER THE CONSOLIDATED FARM AND RURAL

24122 DEVELOPMENT ACT.

24125U.S.C. 1983) is amended--

24128 inserting ``; and''; and

24129 (3) by adding at the end the following:

24131 modified under section 306(a), charge and collect from the

24132 lender fees in such amounts as to bring down the costs of

24133 subsidies for the insured or guaranteed loan, except that the

24134 fees shall not act as a bar to participation in the programs nor

24135 be inconsistent with current practices in the marketplace.''.

24136SEC. 6419. RURAL BUSINESS-COOPERATIVE SERVICE PROGRAMS TECHNICAL

24137 ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING.

24138

24139 The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended by

24140inserting after section 367, as added by section 5306 of this Act, the

24141following:

24142``SEC. 368. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2008c.&gt;&gt; RURAL BUSINESS-COOPERATIVE

24143 SERVICE PROGRAMS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND

24144 TRAINING.

24145

24146 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary may make grants to public bodies,

24147private nonprofit corporations, economic development authorities,

24148institutions of higher education, federally recognized Indian Tribes,

24149and rural cooperatives for the purpose of providing or obtaining

24150technical assistance and training to support funding applications for

24151programs carried out by the Secretary, acting through the Administrator

24152of the Rural Business-Cooperative Service.

24153 ``(b) Purposes.--A grant under subsection (a) may be used--

24154 ``(1) to assist communities in identifying and planning for

24155 business and economic development needs;

24156 ``(2) to identify public and private resources to finance

24157 business and small and emerging business needs;

24158 ``(3) to prepare reports and surveys necessary to request

24159 financial assistance for businesses in rural communities; and

24160 ``(4) to prepare applications for financial assistance.

24161

24162 ``(c) Selection Priority.--In selecting recipients of grants under

24163this section, the Secretary shall give priority to grants serving

24164persistent poverty counties and high poverty communities, as determined

24165by the Secretary.

24166 ``(d) Funding.--

24167 ``(1) In general.--There is authorized to be appropriated to

24168 carry out this section $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019

24169 through 2023, to remain available until expended.

24170 ``(2) Availability.--Any amounts authorized to be

24171 appropriated under paragraph (1) for any fiscal year that are

24172 not appropriated for that fiscal year may be appropriated for

24173 the immediately succeeding fiscal year.''.

24174

24175[[Page 132 STAT. 4765]]

24176
