24213SEC. 6424. RURAL INNOVATION STRONGER ECONOMY GRANT PROGRAM.

24214

24215 Subtitle D of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

24216U.S.C. 1981 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

24217``SEC. 379I. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2008w.&gt;&gt; RURAL INNOVATION STRONGER

24218 ECONOMY GRANT PROGRAM.

24219

24220 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

24221 ``(1) Eligible entity.--The term `eligible entity' means a

24222 rural jobs accelerator partnership established after the date of

24223 enactment of this section that--

24224 ``(A) organizes key community and regional

24225 stakeholders into a working group that--

24226 ``(i) focuses on the shared goals and needs of

24227 the industry clusters that are objectively

24228 identified as existing, emerging, or declining;

24229 ``(ii) represents a region defined by the

24230 partnership in accordance with subparagraph (B);

24231 ``(iii) includes 1 or more representatives

24232 of--

24233 ``(I) an institution of higher

24234 education (as defined in section 101 of

24235 the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20

24236 U.S.C. 1001));

24237

24238[[Page 132 STAT. 4766]]

24239

24240 ``(II) a private entity; or

24241 ``(III) a government entity; and

24242 ``(iv) has, as a lead applicant--

24243 ``(I) a District Organization (as

24244 defined in section 300.3 of title 13,

24245 Code of Federal Regulations (or a

24246 successor regulation));

24247 ``(II) an Indian tribe (as defined

24248 in section 4 of the Indian Self-

24249 Determination and Education Assistance

24250 Act (25 U.S.C. 5304)), or a consortium

24251 of Indian tribes;

24252 ``(III) a State or a political

24253 subdivision of a State, including a

24254 special purpose unit of a State or local

24255 government engaged in economic

24256 development activities, or a consortium

24257 of political subdivisions;

24258 ``(IV) an institution of higher

24259 education (as defined in section 101 of

24260 the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20

24261 U.S.C. 1001)) or a consortium of

24262 institutions of higher education; or

24263 ``(V) a public or private nonprofit

24264 organization; and

24265 ``(B) subject to approval by the Secretary, may--

24266 ``(i) serve a region that is--

24267 ``(I) a single jurisdiction; or

24268 ``(II) if the region is a rural

24269 area, multijurisdictional; and

24270 ``(ii) define the region that the partnership

24271 represents, if the region--

24272 ``(I) is large enough to contain

24273 critical elements of the industry

24274 cluster prioritized by the partnership;

24275 ``(II) is small enough to enable

24276 close collaboration among members of the

24277 partnership;

24278 ``(III) includes a majority of

24279 communities that are located in--

24280 ``(aa) a nonmetropolitan

24281 area that qualifies as a low-

24282 income community (as defined in

24283 section 45D(e) of the Internal

24284 Revenue Code of 1986); and

24285 ``(bb) an area that has

24286 access to or has a plan to

24287 achieve broadband service

24288 (within the meaning of title VI

24289 of the Rural Electrification Act

24290 of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 950bb et

24291 seq.)); and

24292 ``(IV)(aa) has a population of

24293 50,000 or fewer inhabitants; or

24294 ``(bb) for a region with a

24295 population of more than 50,000

24296 inhabitants, is the subject of a

24297 positive determination by the Secretary

24298 with respect to a rural-in-character

24299 petition, including such a petition

24300 submitted concurrently with the

24301 application of the partnership for a

24302 grant under this section.

24303 ``(2) Industry cluster.--The term `industry cluster' means a

24304 broadly defined network of interconnected firms and supporting

24305 institutions in related industries that accelerate innovation,

24306 business formation, and job creation by taking advantage of

24307 assets and strengths of a region in the business environment.

24308

24309[[Page 132 STAT. 4767]]

24310

24311 ``(3) High-wage job.--The term `high-wage job' means a job

24312 that provides a wage that is greater than the median wage for

24313 the applicable region, as determined by the Secretary.

24314 ``(4) Jobs accelerator.--The term `jobs accelerator' means a

24315 jobs accelerator center or program located in or serving a low-

24316 income rural community that may provide co-working space, in-

24317 demand skills training, entrepreneurship support, and any other

24318 services described in subsection (d)(1)(B).

24319 ``(5) Small and disadvantaged business.--The term `small and

24320 disadvantaged business' has the meaning given the term `small

24321 business concern owned and controlled by socially and

24322 economically disadvantaged individuals' in section 8(d)(3)(C) of

24323 the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 637(d)(3)(C)).

24324

24325 ``(b) Establishment.--

24326 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall establish a grant

24327 program under which the Secretary shall award grants, on a

24328 competitive basis, to eligible entities to establish jobs

24329 accelerators, including related programming, that--

24330 ``(A) improve the ability of distressed rural

24331 communities to create high-wage jobs, accelerate the

24332 formation of new businesses with high-growth potential,

24333 and strengthen regional economies, including by helping

24334 to build capacity in the applicable region to achieve

24335 those goals; and

24336 ``(B) help rural communities identify and maximize

24337 local assets and connect to regional opportunities,

24338 networks, and industry clusters that demonstrate high

24339 growth potential.

24340 ``(2) Cost-sharing.--

24341 ``(A) In general.--The Federal share of the cost of

24342 any activity carried out using a grant made under

24343 paragraph (1) shall be not greater than 80 percent.

24344 ``(B) In-kind contributions.--The non-Federal share

24345 of the total cost of any activity carried out using a

24346 grant made under paragraph (1) may be in the form of

24347 donations or in-kind contributions of goods or services

24348 fairly valued.

24349 ``(3) Selection criteria.--In selecting eligible entities to

24350 receive grants under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall

24351 consider--

24352 ``(A) the commitment of participating core

24353 stakeholders in the jobs accelerator partnership,

24354 including a demonstration that--

24355 ``(i) investment organizations, including

24356 venture development organizations, venture capital

24357 firms, revolving loan funders, angel investment

24358 groups, community lenders, community development

24359 financial institutions, rural business investment

24360 companies, small business investment companies (as

24361 defined in section 103 of the Small Business

24362 Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 662)),

24363 philanthropic organizations, and other

24364 institutions focused on expanding access to

24365 capital, are committed partners in the jobs

24366 accelerator partnership and willing to potentially

24367 invest in projects emerging from the jobs

24368 accelerator; and

24369 ``(ii) institutions of higher education,

24370 applied research institutions, workforce

24371 development entities, and community-based

24372 organizations are willing to partner with the jobs

24373 accelerator to provide workers

24374

24375[[Page 132 STAT. 4768]]

24376

24377 with skills relevant to the industry cluster needs

24378 of the region, with an emphasis on the use of on-

24379 the-job training, registered apprenticeships,

24380 customized training, classroom occupational

24381 training, or incumbent worker training;

24382 ``(B) the ability of the eligible entity to provide

24383 the non-Federal share as required under paragraph (2);

24384 ``(C) the identification of a targeted industry

24385 cluster;

24386 ``(D) the ability of the partnership to link rural

24387 communities to markets, networks, industry clusters, and

24388 other regional opportunities and assets;

24389 ``(E) other grants or loans of the Secretary and

24390 other Federal agencies that the jobs accelerator would

24391 be able to leverage; and

24392 ``(F) prospects for the proposed center and related

24393 programming to have sustainability beyond the full

24394 maximum length of assistance under this subsection,

24395 including the maximum number of renewals.

24396 ``(4) Grant term and renewals.--

24397 ``(A) Term.--The initial term of a grant under

24398 paragraph (1) shall be 4 years.

24399 ``(B) Renewal.--The Secretary may extend the term of

24400 a grant under paragraph (1) for an additional period of

24401 not longer than 2 years if the Secretary is satisfied,

24402 using the evaluation under subsection (e)(2), that the

24403 grant recipient has successfully established a jobs

24404 accelerator and related programming.

24405 ``(5) Geographic distribution.--To the maximum extent

24406 practicable, the Secretary shall provide grants under paragraph

24407 (1) for jobs accelerators and related programming in not fewer

24408 than 25 States at any time.

24409

24410 ``(c) Grant Amount.--A grant awarded under subsection (b) may be in

24411an amount equal to--

24412 ``(1) not less than $500,000; and

24413 ``(2) not more than $2,000,000.

24414

24415 ``(d) Use of Funds.--

24416 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (2), funds from a

24417 grant awarded under subsection (b) may be used--

24418 ``(A) to construct, purchase, or equip a building to

24419 serve as an innovation center;

24420 ``(B) to support programs to be carried out at, or

24421 in direct partnership with, the jobs accelerator that

24422 support the objectives of the jobs accelerator,

24423 including--

24424 ``(i) linking rural communities and

24425 entrepreneurs to markets, networks, industry

24426 clusters, and other regional opportunities to

24427 support high-wage job creation, new business

24428 formation, business expansion, and economic

24429 growth;

24430 ``(ii) integrating small businesses into a

24431 supply chain;

24432 ``(iii) creating or expanding

24433 commercialization activities for new business

24434 formation;

24435 ``(iv) identifying and building assets in

24436 rural communities that are crucial to supporting

24437 regional economies;

24438 ``(v) facilitating the repatriation of high-

24439 wage jobs to the United States;

24440

24441[[Page 132 STAT. 4769]]

24442

24443 ``(vi) supporting the deployment of innovative

24444 processes, technologies, and products;

24445 ``(vii) enhancing the capacity of small

24446 businesses in regional industry clusters,

24447 including small and disadvantaged businesses;

24448 ``(viii) increasing United States exports and

24449 business interaction with international buyers and

24450 suppliers;

24451 ``(ix) developing the skills and expertise of

24452 local workforces, entrepreneurs, and institutional

24453 partners to meet the needs of employers and

24454 prepare workers for high-wage jobs in the

24455 identified industry clusters, including the

24456 upskilling of incumbent workers;

24457 ``(x) ensuring rural communities have the

24458 capacity and ability to carry out projects

24459 relating to housing, community facilities,

24460 infrastructure, or community and economic

24461 development to support regional industry cluster

24462 growth; or

24463 ``(xi) any other activities that the Secretary

24464 may determine to be appropriate.

24465 ``(2) Requirement.--

24466 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), not

24467 more than 10 percent of a grant awarded under subsection

24468 (b) shall be used for indirect costs associated with

24469 administering the grant.

24470 ``(B) Increase.--The Secretary may increase the

24471 percentage described in subparagraph (A) on a case-by-

24472 case basis.

24473

24474 ``(e) Annual Activity Report and Evaluation.--Not later than 1 year

24475after receiving a grant under this section, and annually thereafter for

24476the duration of the grant, an eligible entity shall--

24477 ``(1) report to the Secretary on the activities funded with

24478 the grant; and

24479 ``(2)(A) evaluate the progress that the eligible entity has

24480 made toward the strategic objectives identified in the

24481 application for the grant; and

24482 ``(B) measure that progress using performance measures

24483 during the project period, which may include--

24484 ``(i) high-wage jobs created;

24485 ``(ii) high-wage jobs retained;

24486 ``(iii) private investment leveraged;

24487 ``(iv) businesses improved;

24488 ``(v) new business formations;

24489 ``(vi) new products or services commercialized;

24490 ``(vii) improvement of the value of existing

24491 products or services under development;

24492 ``(viii) regional collaboration, as measured by such

24493 metrics as--

24494 ``(I) the number of organizations actively

24495 engaged in the industry cluster;

24496 ``(II) the number of symposia held by the

24497 industry cluster, including organizations that are

24498 not located in the immediate region defined by the

24499 partnership; and

24500 ``(III) the number of further cooperative

24501 agreements;

24502

24503[[Page 132 STAT. 4770]]

24504

24505 ``(ix) the number of education and training

24506 activities relating to innovation;

24507 ``(x) the number of jobs relocated from outside of

24508 the United States to the region;

24509 ``(xi) the amount and number of new equity

24510 investments in industry cluster firms;

24511 ``(xii) the amount and number of new loans to

24512 industry cluster firms;

24513 ``(xiii) the dollar increase in exports resulting

24514 from the project activities;

24515 ``(xiv) the percentage of employees for which

24516 training was provided;

24517 ``(xv) improvement in sales of participating

24518 businesses;

24519 ``(xvi) improvement in wages paid at participating

24520 businesses;

24521 ``(xvii) improvement in income of participating

24522 workers; or

24523 ``(xviii) any other measure the Secretary determines

24524 to be appropriate.

24525

24526 ``(f) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be

24527appropriated to carry out this section $10,000,000 for each of fiscal

24528years 2019 through 2023.''.

24529SEC. 6425. DELTA REGIONAL AUTHORITY.

24530

24531 (a) Authorization of Appropriations.--Section 382M(a) of the

24532Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 2009aa-12(a)) is

24533amended by striking ``2008 through 2018'' and inserting ``2019 through

245342023''.

24535 (b) Termination of Authority.--Section 382N of such Act (7 U.S.C.

245362009aa-13) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

24537SEC. 6426. RURAL BUSINESS INVESTMENT PROGRAM.

24538

24539 (a) Definitions.--Section 384A of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

24540Development Act (7 U.S.C. 2009cc) is amended--

24541 (1) in paragraph (2)--

24542 (A) in the paragraph heading, by striking

24543 ``venture''; and

24544 (B) by striking ``venture''; and

24545 (2) by striking paragraph (4) and inserting the following:

24546 ``(4) Equity capital.--The term `equity capital' means--

24547 ``(A) common or preferred stock or a similar

24548 instrument, including subordinated debt with equity

24549 features; and

24550 ``(B) any other type of equity-like financing that

24551 might be necessary to facilitate the purposes of this

24552 Act, excluding financing such as senior debt or other

24553 types of financing that competes with routine loanmaking

24554 of commercial lenders.''.

24555

24556 (b) Purposes.--Section 384B of such Act (7 U.S.C. 2009cc-1) is

24557amended--

24558 (1) in paragraph (1), by striking ``venture''; and

24559 (2) in paragraph (2)--

24560 (A) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by

24561 striking ``venture''; and

24562 (B) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``venture''.

24563

24564 (c) Selection of Rural Business Investment Companies.--Section

24565384D(b)(1) of such Act (7 U.S.C. 2009cc-3(b)(1)) is amended by striking

24566``developmental venture'' and inserting ``developmental''.

24567

24568[[Page 132 STAT. 4771]]

24569

24570 (d) Fees.--Section 384G of such Act (7 U.S.C. 2009cc-6) is amended--

24571 (1) in subsections (a) and (b), by striking ``a fee that

24572 does not exceed $500'' each place it appears and inserting

24573 ``such fees as the Secretary considers appropriate, so long as

24574 those fees are proportionally equal for each rural business

24575 investment company,''; and

24576 (2) in subsection (c)(2)--

24577 (A) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``solely to

24578 cover the costs of licensing examinations'' and

24579 inserting ``as the Secretary considers appropriate'';

24580 and

24581 (B) by striking subparagraph (C) and inserting the

24582 following:

24583 ``(C) shall be in such amounts as the Secretary

24584 considers appropriate.''.

24585

24586 (e) Limitation on Rural Business Investment Companies Controlled by

24587Farm Credit System Institutions.--Section 384J(c) of such Act (7 U.S.C.

245882009cc-9(c)) is amended by striking ``25'' and inserting ``50''.

24589 (f) Flexibility on Sources of Investment or Capital.--Section

24590384J(a) of such Act (7 U.S.C. 2009cc-9(a)) is amended--

24591 (1) by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as subparagraphs

24592 (A) and (B), respectively, and indenting appropriately;

24593 (2) by striking the subsection designation and heading and

24594 all that follows through ``Except as'' in the matter preceding

24595 subparagraph (A) (as so redesignated) and inserting the

24596 following:

24597

24598 ``(a) Investment.--

24599 ``(1) In general.--Except as''; and

24600 (3) by adding at the end the following:

24601 ``(2) Limitation on requirements.--The Secretary may not

24602 require that an entity described in paragraph (1) provide

24603 investment or capital that is not required of other companies

24604 eligible to apply to operate as a rural business investment

24605 company under section 384D(a).''.

24606SEC. 6427. RURAL BUSINESS INVESTMENT PROGRAM.

24607

24608 Section 384S of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

24609U.S.C. 2009cc-18) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

24610``2023''.

24612 Subtitle E--Additional Amendments to the Rural Electrification Act of

24613 1936

24614

24615SEC. 6501. AMENDMENTS TO SECTION 2 OF THE RURAL ELECTRIFICATION

24616 ACT OF 1936.

24617

24618 (a) Electric Loan Refinancing.--Section 2(a) of the Rural

24619Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 902(a)) is amended by striking

24620``loans in'' and inserting ``loans, or refinance loans made by the

24621Secretary under this Act, in''.

24622 (b) Technical Assistance for Rural Electrification Loans.--Section 2

24623of such Act (7 U.S.C. 902) is amended by adding at the end the

24624following:

24625 ``(c) Technical Assistance.--Not later than 180 days after the date

24626of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall enter into a

24627memorandum of understanding with the Secretary of Energy

24628

24629[[Page 132 STAT. 4772]]

24630

24631under which the Secretary of Energy shall provide technical assistance

24632to the Rural Utilities Service on loans to be made under subsection (a)

24633of this section and section 4(a).''.

24634SEC. 6502. LOANS FOR TELEPHONE SERVICE.

24635

24636 Section 201 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 922)

24637is amended--

24638 (1) by striking the section designation and all that follows

24639 through ``From such sums'' and inserting the following:

24640``SEC. 201. LOANS FOR TELEPHONE SERVICE.

24641

24642 ``From such sums'';

24643 (2) in the second sentence, by striking ``associations:''

24644 and all that follows through ``same subscribers.'' and inserting

24645 ``associations.''; and

24646 (3) in the sixth sentence, by striking ``, nor shall such

24647 loan be made in any State'' and all that follows through

24648 ``writing)'' in the seventh sentence and inserting the

24649 following: ``and''.

24650SEC. 6503. CUSHION OF CREDIT PAYMENTS PROGRAM.

24651

24652 Section 313(a) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C.

24653940c(a)) is amended--

24654 (1) in paragraph (1)--

24655 (A) by striking ``(1) In general.--The'' and

24656 inserting the following:

24657 ``(1) In general.--

24658 ``(A) Development and promotion of program.--The'';

24659 and

24660 (B) by adding after and below the end the following:

24661 ``(B) Termination.--Effective on the date of

24662 enactment of this subparagraph, no deposits may be made

24663 under subparagraph (A).'';

24664 (2) in paragraph (2)--

24665 (A) by striking ``(2) Interest.--Amounts'' and

24666 inserting the following:

24667 ``(2) Interest.--

24668 ``(A) In general.--Amounts''; and

24669 (B) by adding after and below the end the following:

24670 ``(B) Reduction.--Notwithstanding subparagraph (A),

24671 amounts in each cushion of credit account shall accrue

24672 interest to the borrower at a rate equal to--

24673 ``(i) 4 percent per annum in fiscal year 2021;

24674 and

24675 ``(ii) the then applicable 1-year Treasury

24676 rate thereafter.''; and

24677 (3) in paragraph (3)--

24678 (A) by striking ``(3) Balance.--A'' and inserting

24679 the following:

24680 ``(3) Balance.--

24681 ``(A) In general.--A''; and

24682 (B) by after and below the end the following:

24683 ``(B) Prepayment.--Notwithstanding subparagraph (A)

24684 and subject to subparagraph (C), beginning on the date

24685 of the enactment of this subparagraph and ending with

24686 September 30, 2020, a borrower may, at the sole

24687 discretion of the borrower, reduce the balance of its

24688 cushion of credit account if the amount obtained from

24689 the reduction is used to prepay loans made or guaranteed

24690 under this Act.

24691

24692[[Page 132 STAT. 4773]]

24693

24694 ``(C) No prepayment premium.--Notwithstanding any

24695 other provision of this Act, no prepayment premium shall

24696 be imposed or collected with respect to that portion of

24697 a loan that is prepaid by a borrower in accordance with

24698 subparagraph (B).

24699 ``(D) Mandatory funding.--Notwithstanding section

24700 504 of the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990, out of any

24701 funds in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, the

24702 Secretary of the Treasury shall make available such sums

24703 as necessary to cover any loan modification costs as

24704 defined in section 502 of such Act.''.

24705SEC. 6504. EXTENSION OF THE RURAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LOAN AND

24706 GRANT PROGRAM.

24707

24708 (a) Section 12(b)(3)(D) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7

24709U.S.C. 912(b)(3)(D)) is amended by striking ``313(b)(2)(A)'' and

24710inserting ``313(b)(2)''.

24711 (b) Section 313(b)(2) of such Act (7 U.S.C. 940c(b)(2)) is amended--

24712 (1) by striking all that precedes ``shall maintain'' and

24713 inserting the following:

24714 ``(2) Rural economic development subaccount.--The

24715 Secretary''; and

24716 (2) by striking ``the 5 percent'' and all that follows

24717 through subparagraph (E) and inserting ``5 percent.''.

24718

24719 (c) Title III of such Act (7 U.S.C. 931-940h) is amended by

24720inserting after section 313A the following:

24721``SEC. 313B. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 940c-2.&gt;&gt; RURAL DEVELOPMENT LOANS AND

24722 GRANTS.

24723

24724 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary shall provide grants or zero

24725interest loans to borrowers under this Act for the purpose of promoting

24726rural economic development and job creation projects, including funding

24727for project feasibility studies, start-up costs, incubator projects, and

24728other reasonable expenses for the purpose of fostering rural

24729development.

24730 ``(b) Repayments.--In the case of zero interest loans, the Secretary

24731shall establish such reasonable repayment terms as will encourage

24732borrower participation.

24733 ``(c) Proceeds.--All proceeds from the repayment of such loans made

24734under this section shall be returned to the subaccount that the

24735Secretary shall maintain in accordance with sections 313(b)(2) and

24736313B(f).

24737 ``(d) Number of Grants.--Loans and grants required under this

24738section shall be made to the full extent of the amounts made available

24739under subsection (e).

24740 ``(e) Funding.--

24741 ``(1) Discretionary funding.--In addition to other funds

24742 that are available to carry out this section, there is

24743 authorized to be appropriated not more than $10,000,000 for each

24744 of fiscal years 2019 through 2023 to carry out this section, to

24745 remain available until expended.

24746 ``(2) Mandatory funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity

24747 Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall credit to the subaccount

24748 to use for the cost of grants and loans under this section

24749 $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 and 2023, to remain

24750 available until expended.

24751 ``(3) Other funds.--In addition to the funds described in

24752 paragraphs (1) and (2), the Secretary shall use, without

24753

24754[[Page 132 STAT. 4774]]

24755

24756 fiscal year limitation, to provide grants and loans under this

24757 section--

24758 ``(A) the interest differential sums credited to the

24759 subaccount described in subsection (c); and

24760 ``(B) subject to section 313A(e)(2), the fees

24761 described in subsection (c)(4) of such section.

24762

24763 ``(f) Maintenance of Account.--The Secretary shall maintain the

24764subaccount described in section 313(b)(2), as in effect in fiscal year

247652017, for purposes of carrying out this section.''.

24766 (d) Section 313A of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C.

24767940c-1) is amended--

24768 (1) in subsection (c)(4)--

24769 (A) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``maintained

24770 under section 313(b)(2)(A)'' and inserting ``that shall

24771 be maintained as required by sections 313(b)(2) and

24772 313B(f)''; and

24773 (B) in subparagraph (B), by striking

24774 ``313(b)(2)(B)'' and inserting ``313(b)(2)''; and

24775 (2) in subsection (e)(2), by striking ``maintained under

24776 section 313(b)(2)(A)'' and inserting ``required to be maintained

24777 by sections 313(b)(2) and 313B(f)''.

24778

24779 (e)(1) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 940c-2 note.&gt;&gt; Subject to section 313B(e) of

24780the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (as added by this section), the

24781Secretary of Agriculture shall carry out the loan and grant program

24782required under such section in the same manner as the loan and grant

24783program under section 313(b)(2) of such Act is carried out on the day

24784before the date of the enactment of this Act, until such time as any

24785regulations necessary to carry out the amendments made by this section

24786are fully implemented.

24787

24788 (2) Paragraph (1) shall take effect on the date of the enactment of

24789this Act.

24790SEC. 6505. GUARANTEES FOR BONDS AND NOTES ISSUED FOR

24791 ELECTRIFICATION OR TELEPHONE PURPOSES.

24792

24793 (a) In General.--Section 313A of the Rural Electrification Act of

247941936 (7 U.S.C. 940c-1) is amended--

24795 (1) in subsection (a)--

24796 (A) by striking ``Subject to'' and inserting the

24797 following:

24798 ``(1) Guarantees.--Subject to'';

24799 (B) in paragraph (1) (as so designated), by striking

24800 ``basis'' and all that follows through the period at the

24801 end and inserting ``basis, if the proceeds of the bonds

24802 or notes are used to make utility infrastructure loans,

24803 or refinance bonds or notes issued for those purposes,

24804 to a borrower that has at any time received, or is

24805 eligible to receive, a loan under this Act.''; and

24806 (C) by adding at the end the following:

24807 ``(2) Terms.--A bond or note guaranteed under this section

24808 shall, by agreement between the Secretary and the borrower--

24809 ``(A) be for a term of 30 years (or another term of

24810 years that the Secretary determines is appropriate); and

24811 ``(B) be repaid by the borrower--

24812 ``(i) in periodic installments of principal

24813 and interest;

24814 ``(ii) in periodic installments of interest

24815 and, at the end of the term of the bond or note,

24816 as applicable, by the repayment of the outstanding

24817 principal; or

24818

24819[[Page 132 STAT. 4775]]

24820

24821 ``(iii) through a combination of the methods

24822 described in clauses (i) and (ii).'';

24823 (2) in subsection (b)--

24824 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking

24825 ``electrification'' and all that follows through the

24826 period at the end and inserting ``purposes described in

24827 subsection (a)(1).'';

24828 (B) by striking paragraph (2);

24829 (C) by redesignating paragraphs (3) and (4) as

24830 paragraphs (2) and (3), respectively; and

24831 (D) in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated)--

24832 (i) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``for

24833 electrification or telephone purposes'' and

24834 inserting ``for eligible purposes described in

24835 subsection (a)(1)''; and

24836 (ii) in subparagraph (C), by striking

24837 ``subsection (a)'' and inserting ``subsection

24838 (a)(1)''; and

24839 (3) in subsection (f), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

24840 ``2023''.

24841

24842 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 940c-1 note.&gt;&gt; Administration.--Beginning on the

24843date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, the

24844Secretary shall continue to carry out section 313A of the Rural

24845Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 940c-1) (as amended by subsection

24846(a)) under a Notice of Solicitation of Applications until the date on

24847which any regulations necessary to carry out the amendments made by

24848subsection (a) are fully implemented.

24849SEC. 6506. EXPANSION OF 911 ACCESS.

24850

24851 Section 315 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 940e)

24852is amended--

24853 (1) in subsection (a)(2), by striking ``commercial or

24854 transportation'' and inserting ``critical transportation-

24855 related''; and

24856 (2) in subsection (d), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

24857 ``2023''.

24858SEC. 6507. CYBERSECURITY AND GRID SECURITY IMPROVEMENTS.

24859

24860 Title III of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 931 et

24861seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

24862``SEC. 319. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 940i.&gt;&gt; CYBERSECURITY AND GRID SECURITY

24863 IMPROVEMENTS.

24864

24865 ``(a) Definition of Cybersecurity and Grid Security Improvements.--

24866In this section, the term `cybersecurity and grid security improvements'

24867means investment in the development, expansion, and modernization of

24868rural utility infrastructure that addresses known cybersecurity and grid

24869security risks.

24870 ``(b) Loans and Loan Guarantees.--The Secretary may make or

24871guarantee loans under this title and title I for cybersecurity and grid

24872security improvements.''.

24873

24896Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 940d) is hereby repealed.

25010 Subtitle G--Technical Corrections

25011

25012SEC. 6701. CORRECTIONS RELATING TO THE CONSOLIDATED FARM AND RURAL

25013 DEVELOPMENT ACT.

25014

25015 (a)(1) Section 306(a)(19)(A) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

25016Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1926(a)(19)(A)) is amended by inserting after

25017``nonprofit corporations'' the following: ``, Indian Tribes (as defined

25018in section 4(e) of the Indian Self-Determination and Education

25019Assistance Act)''.

25020 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1926 note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by this

25021subsection shall take effect as if included in section 773 of the

25022Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and

25023Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001 (H.R. 5426 of the 106th

25024Congress, as enacted by Public Law 106-387 (114 Stat. 1549A-45)) in lieu

25025of the amendment made by such section.

25026

25027 (b)(1) Section 309A(b) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

25028Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1929a(b)) is amended by striking ``and section

25029308''.

25030 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1929a note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by this

25031subsection shall take effect as if included in the enactment of section

25032661(c)(2) of the Federal Agricultural Improvement and Reform Act of 1996

25033(Public Law 104-127).

25034

25035 (c) Section 310B(c)(3)(A)(v) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

25036Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1932(c)(3)(A)(v)) is amended by striking

25037``and'' after the semicolon and inserting ``or''.

25038 (d)(1) Section 310B(e)(5)(F) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

25039Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1932(e)(5)(F)) is amended by inserting ``,

25040except that the Secretary shall not require non-Federal financial

25041support in an amount that is greater than 5 percent in the case of a

250421994 institution (as defined in section 532 of the Equity in Educational

25043Land-Grant Status Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 301 note; Public Law 103-382))''

25044before the period at the end.

25045 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1932 note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by this

25046subsection shall take effect as if included in the enactment of section

250476015 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (Public Law

25048107-171).

25049

25050 (e)(1) Section 381E(d)(3) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

25051Development Act (7 U.S.C. 2009d(d)(3)) is amended by striking

25052subparagraph (A) and redesignating subparagraphs (B) and (C) as

25053subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively.

25054 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2009d note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by paragraph (1)

25055shall take effect as if included in the enactment of section 6012(b) of

25056the Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law 113-79).

25057

25058 (f)(1) Section 382A of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development

25059Act (7 U.S.C. 2009aa) is amended by adding at the end the following:

25060 ``(4) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the State

25061 of Alabama shall be a full member of the Delta Regional

25062 Authority and shall be entitled to all rights and privileges

25063 that said membership affords to all other participating States

25064 in the Delta Regional Authority.''.

25065

25066 (2) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2009aa note.&gt;&gt; The amendment made by this

25067subsection shall take effect as if included in the enactment of section

25068153(b) of division B of H.R. 5666, as introduced in the 106th Congress,

25069and as enacted by section 1(4) of the Consolidated Appropriations Act,

250702001 (Appendix D of Public Law 106-554; 114 Stat. 2763A-252).

25071

25072[[Page 132 STAT. 4779]]

25073

25074 (g) Section 382E(a)(1)(B) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

25075Development Act (7 U.S.C.2009aa-4(a)(1)(B)) is amended by moving clause

25076(iv) 2 ems to the right.

25077 (h) Section 383G(c) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development

25078Act (7 U.S.C. 2009bb-5(c)) is amended--

25079 (1) in the subsection heading by striking

25080 ``Telecommunication Renewable Energy,,'' and inserting

25081 ``Telecommunication, Renewable Energy,''; and

25082 (2) in the text, by striking ``,,'' and inserting a comma.

25083SEC. 6702. CORRECTIONS RELATING TO THE RURAL ELECTRIFICATION ACT

25084 OF 1936.

25085

25086 Section 201 of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 (7 U.S.C. 922)

25087is amended--

25088 (1) in the 3rd sentence by striking ``wildest'' and

25089 inserting ``widest''; and

25090 (2) in the 6th sentence, by striking ``centifies'' and

25091 inserting ``certifies''.

25093 TITLE VII--RESEARCH, EXTENSION, AND RELATED MATTERS

25094

25095 Subtitle A--National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching

25096 Policy Act of 1977

25097

25098SEC. 7101. PURPOSES OF AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH, EXTENSION, AND

25099 EDUCATION.

25100

25101 Section 1402 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and

25102Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3101) is amended--

25103 (1) in paragraph (7), by striking ``and'' at the end;

25104 (2) in paragraph (8), by striking the period at the end and

25105 inserting ``; and''; and

25106 (3) by adding at the end the following:

25107 ``(9) support international collaboration that leverages

25108 resources and advances priority food and agricultural interests

25109 of the United States, such as--

25110 ``(A) addressing emerging plant and animal diseases;

25111 ``(B) improving crop varieties and animal breeds;

25112 and

25113 ``(C) developing safe, efficient, and nutritious

25114 food systems.''.

25115SEC. 7102. MATTERS RELATED TO CERTAIN SCHOOL DESIGNATIONS AND

25116 DECLARATIONS.

25117

25118 (a) In General.--Section 1404(14) of the National Agricultural

25119Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103(14))

25120is amended--

25121 (1) by amending subparagraph (A) to read as follows:

25122 ``(A) In general.--

25123 ``(i) Definition.--The terms `NLGCA

25124 Institution' and `non-land-grant college of

25125 agriculture' mean a public college or university

25126 offering a baccalaureate or higher degree in the

25127 study of agricultural sciences, forestry, or both

25128 in any area of study specified in clause (ii).

25129

25130[[Page 132 STAT. 4780]]

25131

25132 ``(ii) Clarification.--For purposes of clause

25133 (i), an area of study specified in this clause is

25134 any of the following:

25135 ``(I) Agriculture.

25136 ``(II) Agricultural business and

25137 management.

25138 ``(III) Agricultural economics.

25139 ``(IV) Agricultural mechanization.

25140 ``(V) Agricultural production

25141 operations.

25142 ``(VI) Aquaculture.

25143 ``(VII) Agricultural and food

25144 products processing.

25145 ``(VIII) Agricultural and domestic

25146 animal services.

25147 ``(IX) Equestrian or equine studies.

25148 ``(X) Applied horticulture or

25149 horticulture operations.

25150 ``(XI) Ornamental horticulture.

25151 ``(XII) Greenhouse operations and

25152 management.

25153 ``(XIII) Turf and turfgrass

25154 management.

25155 ``(XIV) Plant nursery operations and

25156 management.

25157 ``(XV) Floriculture or floristry

25158 operations and management.

25159 ``(XVI) International agriculture.

25160 ``(XVII) Agricultural public

25161 services.

25162 ``(XVIII) Agricultural and extension

25163 education services.

25164 ``(XIX) Agricultural communication

25165 or agricultural journalism.

25166 ``(XX) Animal sciences.

25167 ``(XXI) Food science.

25168 ``(XXII) Plant sciences.

25169 ``(XXIII) Soil sciences.

25170 ``(XXIV) Forestry.

25171 ``(XXV) Forest sciences and biology.

25172 ``(XXVI) Natural resources or

25173 conservation.

25174 ``(XXVII) Natural resources

25175 management and policy.

25176 ``(XXVIII) Natural resource

25177 economics.

25178 ``(XXIX) Urban forestry.

25179 ``(XXX) Wood science and wood

25180 products or pulp or paper technology.

25181 ``(XXXI) Range science and

25182 management.

25183 ``(XXXII) Agricultural engineering.

25184 ``(XXXIII) Any other area, as

25185 determined appropriate by the

25186 Secretary.''; and

25187 (2) in subparagraph (C)--

25188 (A) in the matter preceding clause (i), by inserting

25189 ``any institution designated under'' after ``include'';

25190 (B) by striking clause (i); and

25191 (C) in clause (ii)--

25192 (i) by striking ``(ii) any institution

25193 designated under--'';

25194 (ii) by striking subclause (IV);

25195 (iii) in subclause (II), by adding ``or'' at

25196 the end;

25197

25198[[Page 132 STAT. 4781]]

25199

25200 (iv) in subclause (III), by striking ``; or''

25201 at the end and inserting a period; and

25202 (v) by redesignating subclauses (I), (II), and

25203 (III) (as so amended) as clauses (i), (ii), and

25204 (iii), respectively, and by moving the margins of

25205 such clauses (as so redesignated) two ems to the

25206 left.

25207

25208 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 3103 note.&gt;&gt; Designation Review.--

25209 (1) In general.--Not later than 90 days after the date of

25210 the enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall establish a

25211 process to review each designated NLGCA Institution (as defined

25212 in section 1404(14)(A) of the National Agricultural Research,

25213 Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C.

25214 3103(14)(A))) to ensure compliance with such section, as amended

25215 by this subsection.

25216 (2) Revocation.--An NLGCA Institution that the Secretary

25217 determines under subparagraph (A) to be not in compliance shall

25218 have the designation of such institution revoked.

25219SEC. 7103. NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH, EXTENSION, EDUCATION,

25220 AND ECONOMICS ADVISORY BOARD.

25221

25222 Section 1408 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and

25223Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3123) is amended--

25224 (1) in subsection (b)--

25225 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``25'' and

25226 inserting ``15''; and

25227 (B) by amending paragraph (3) to read as follows:

25228 ``(3) Membership categories.--The Advisory Board shall

25229 consist of members from each of the following categories:

25230 ``(A) 3 members representing national farm or

25231 producer organizations, which may include members--

25232 ``(i) representing farm cooperatives;

25233 ``(ii) who are producers actively engaged in

25234 the production of a food animal commodity and who

25235 are recommended by a coalition of national

25236 livestock organizations;

25237 ``(iii) who are producers actively engaged in

25238 the production of a plant commodity and who are

25239 recommended by a coalition of national crop

25240 organizations; or

25241 ``(iv) who are producers actively engaged in

25242 aquaculture and who are recommended by a coalition

25243 of national aquacultural organizations.

25244 ``(B) 2 members representing academic or research

25245 societies, which may include members representing--

25246 ``(i) a national food animal science society;

25247 ``(ii) a national crop, soil, agronomy,

25248 horticulture, plant pathology, or weed science

25249 society;

25250 ``(iii) a national food science organization;

25251 ``(iv) a national human health association; or

25252 ``(v) a national nutritional science society.

25253 ``(C) 5 members representing agricultural research,

25254 extension, and education, which shall include each of

25255 the following:

25256 ``(i) 1 member representing the land-grant

25257 colleges and universities eligible to receive

25258 funds under the Act of July 2, 1862 (7 U.S.C. 301

25259 et seq.).

25260

25261[[Page 132 STAT. 4782]]

25262

25263 ``(ii) 1 member representing the land-grant

25264 colleges and universities eligible to receive

25265 funds under the Act of August 30, 1890 (7 U.S.C.

25266 321 et seq.), including Tuskegee University.

25267 ``(iii) 1 member representing the 1994

25268 Institutions (as defined in section 532 of the

25269 Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of

25270 1994 (7 U.S.C. 301 note; Public Law 103-382)).

25271 ``(iv) 1 member representing NLGCA

25272 Institutions or Hispanic-serving institutions.

25273 ``(v) 1 member representing American colleges

25274 of veterinary medicine.

25275 ``(D) 5 members representing industry, consumer, or

25276 rural interests, including members representing--

25277 ``(i) entities engaged in transportation of

25278 food and agricultural products to domestic and

25279 foreign markets;

25280 ``(ii) food retailing and marketing interests;

25281 ``(iii) food and fiber processors;

25282 ``(iv) rural economic development interests;

25283 ``(v) a national consumer interest group;

25284 ``(vi) a national forestry group;

25285 ``(vii) a national conservation or natural

25286 resource group;

25287 ``(viii) a national social science

25288 association;

25289 ``(ix) private sector organizations involved

25290 in international development; or

25291 ``(x) a national association of agricultural

25292 economists.'';

25293 (2) in subsection (c)--

25294 (A) in paragraph (1)--

25295 (i) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A),

25296 by striking ``review and'' and inserting ``make

25297 recommendations, review, and'';

25298 (ii) by striking subparagraph (A) and

25299 inserting the following new subparagraph:

25300 ``(A) long-term and short-term national policies and

25301 priorities consistent with the--

25302 ``(i) purposes specified in section 1402 for

25303 agricultural research, extension, education, and

25304 economics; and

25305 ``(ii) priority areas of the Agriculture and

25306 Food Research Initiative specified in subsection

25307 (b)(2) of the Competitive, Special, and Facilities

25308 Research Grant Act (7 U.S.C. 3157(b)(2));''; and

25309 (iii) by amending subparagraph (B) to read as

25310 follows:

25311 ``(B) the annual establishment of national

25312 priorities that are in accordance with the priority

25313 areas of the Agriculture and Food Research Initiative

25314 specified in subsection (b)(2) of the Competitive,

25315 Special, and Facilities Research Grant Act (7 U.S.C.

25316 3157(b)(2)).'';

25317 (B) in paragraph (2), by inserting ``and make

25318 recommendations to the Secretary based on such

25319 evaluation'' after ``priorities''; and

25320 (C) in paragraph (4), by inserting ``and make

25321 recommendations on'' after ``review''; and

25322

25323[[Page 132 STAT. 4783]]

25324

25325 (3) in subsection (h), by striking ``2018'' and inserting

25326 ``2023''.

25390SEC. 7110. NEXT GENERATION AGRICULTURE TECHNOLOGY CHALLENGE.

25391

25392 Subtitle C of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and

25393Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3151 et seq.) is amended by adding

25394at the end the following:

25395``SEC. 1419C. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 3158.&gt;&gt; NEXT GENERATION AGRICULTURE

25396 TECHNOLOGY CHALLENGE.

25397

25398 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary shall establish a next generation

25399agriculture technology challenge competition to provide an incentive for

25400the development of innovative mobile technology that removes barriers to

25401entry in the marketplace for beginning farmers and ranchers (as defined

25402in subsection (a) of section 2501 of the Food, Agriculture,

25403Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279)).

25404 ``(b) Amount.--The Secretary may award not more than $1,000,000 in

25405the aggregate to 1 or more winners of the competition under subsection

25406(a).''.

25407SEC. 7111. LAND-GRANT DESIGNATION.

25408

25409 Subtitle C of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and

25410Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3151 et seq.), as amended by

25411section 7110, is further amended by adding at the end the following new

25412section:

25413``SEC. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 3159.&gt;&gt; 1419D. LAND-GRANT DESIGNATION.

25414

25415 ``(a) Prohibition on Designation.--

25416 ``(1) In general.--Notwithstanding any other provision of

25417 law and except as provided in paragraphs (2) and (3), beginning

25418 on the date of the enactment of this section, no additional

25419 entity may be designated as eligible to receive funds under a

25420 covered program.

25421 ``(2) 1994 institutions.--The prohibition under paragraph

25422 (1) with respect to the designation of an entity eligible to

25423 receive funds under a covered program shall not apply in the

25424 case of the certification of a 1994 Institution under section 2

25425 of Public Law 87-788 (commonly known as the ``McIntire-Stennis

25426 Cooperative Forestry Act'') (16 U.S.C. 582a-1).

25427 ``(3) Extraordinary circumstances.--In the case of

25428 extraordinary circumstances or a situation that would lead to an

25429 inequitable result, as determined by the Secretary, the

25430 Secretary may determine that an entity designated after the date

25431 of enactment of this section is eligible to receive funds under

25432 a covered program.

25433

25434 ``(b) State Funding.--No State shall receive an increase in funding

25435under a covered program as a result of the State's designation of

25436additional entities as eligible to receive such funding.

25437 ``(c) Covered Program Defined.--For purposes of this section, the

25438term `covered program' means agricultural research, extension,

25439education, and related programs or grants established or available under

25440any of the following:

25441 ``(1) Subsections (b), (c), and (d) of section 3 of the

25442 Smith-Lever Act (7 U.S.C. 343).

25443 ``(2) The Hatch Act of 1887 (7 U.S.C. 361a et seq.).

25444 ``(3) Sections 1444, 1445, and 1447.

25445 ``(4) Public Law 87-788 (commonly known as the McIntire-

25446 Stennis Cooperative Forestry Act; 16 U.S.C. 582a et seq.).

25447

25448[[Page 132 STAT. 4785]]

25449

25450 ``(d) Rule of Construction.--Nothing in this section shall be

25451construed as limiting eligibility for a capacity and infrastructure

25452program specified in section 251(f)(1)(C) of the Department of

25453Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6971(f)(1)(C)) that is

25454not a covered program.''.

25455SEC. 7112. NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAM.

25458Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3175) is amended--

25459 (1) by redesignating subsection (f) as subsection (g);

25460 (2) by inserting after subsection (e) the following:

25461

25462 ``(f) Coordination.--Projects carried out with funds made available

25463under section 3(d) of the Act of May 8, 1914 (7 U.S.C. 343(d)), to carry

25464out the program established under subsection (b) may be coordinated with

25465the nutrition education and obesity prevention grant program under

25466section 28 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2036a) or

25467another health promotion or nutrition improvement strategy, whether

25468publicly or privately funded, as determined by the Secretary.''; and

25469 (3) in subsection (g) (as so redesignated), by striking

25470 ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

25480and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3221(a)) is amended by

25481striking paragraph (4).

25482SEC. 7115. EXTENSION AND AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH AT 1890 LAND-GRANT

25483 COLLEGES, INCLUDING TUSKEGEE UNIVERSITY.

25484

25485 (a) Extension.--Section 1444(b) of the National Agricultural

25486Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3221(b))

25487is amended--

25488 (1) in the undesignated matter following paragraph (2)(B)--

25489 (A) by striking ``paragraph (2) of this subsection''

25490 and inserting ``this paragraph''; and

25491 (B) by striking ``In computing'' and inserting the

25492 following:

25493 ``(C) In computing'';

25494 (2) in paragraph (2)--

25495 (A) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``Of the

25496 remainder'' and inserting ``Except as provided in

25497 paragraph (4), of the remainder''; and

25498 (B) by striking ``(2) any funds'' and inserting the

25499 following:

25500 ``(3) Additional amount.--Any funds'';

25501 (3) in paragraph (1)--

25502 (A) by striking ``are allocated'' and inserting

25503 ``were allocated''; and

25504 (B) by striking ``; and'' and inserting ``, as so

25505 designated as of that date.'';

25506

25507[[Page 132 STAT. 4786]]

25508

25509 (4) by striking ``(b) Beginning'' in the matter preceding

25510 paragraph (1) and all that follows through ``any funds'' in

25511 paragraph (1) and inserting the following:

25512

25513 ``(b) Distribution of Funds.--

25514 ``(1) In general.--Funds made available under this section

25515 shall be distributed among eligible institutions in accordance

25516 with this subsection.

25517 ``(2) Base amount.--Any funds''; and

25518 (5) by adding at the end the following:

25519 ``(4) Special amounts.--

25520 ``(A) Definitions.--In this paragraph:

25521 ``(i) Covered fiscal year.--The term `covered

25522 fiscal year' means the fiscal year for which the

25523 qualified eligible institution first received an

25524 allocation of $3,000,000 under subparagraph

25525 (B)(i).

25526 ``(ii) Other eligible institution.--The term

25527 `other eligible institution' means an eligible

25528 institution, other than the qualified eligible

25529 institution, receiving an allocation of funds

25530 under this section.

25531 ``(iii) Qualified eligible institution.--The

25532 term `qualified eligible institution' means the

25533 eligible institution described in subparagraph

25534 (B)(i).

25535 ``(B) Fiscal year 2019, 2020, 2021, or 2022.--

25536 ``(i) In general.--Subject to clause (ii), for

25537 1 of fiscal year 2019, 2020, 2021, or 2022, if the

25538 calculation under paragraph (3)(B) would result in

25539 a distribution for a fiscal year of less than

25540 $3,000,000 to an eligible institution that first

25541 received funds under this section on a date

25542 occurring after the date of enactment of the

25543 Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law 113-79; 128

25544 Stat. 649) and before September 30, 2018, that

25545 institution shall receive an allocation of

25546 $3,000,000 for that fiscal year.

25547 ``(ii) Limitation.--Clause (i) shall apply

25548 only if amounts are appropriated under this

25549 section in an amount sufficient to provide that

25550 each other eligible institution receiving an

25551 allocation of funds under this section for fiscal

25552 year 2019, 2020, 2021, or 2022, as applicable,

25553 receives not less than the amount of funds

25554 received by that other eligible institution under

25555 this section for the preceding fiscal year.

25556 ``(C) Subsequent fiscal years.--

25557 ``(i) Minimum additional funding amounts.--

25558 Subject to clauses (ii) and (iii), for each fiscal

25559 year following the covered fiscal year--

25560 ``(I) the qualified eligible

25561 institution shall receive an allocation

25562 under this subsection of at least

25563 $3,000,000; and

25564 ``(II) each other eligible

25565 institution shall receive an allocation

25566 under this subsection of at least the

25567 amount received by such other eligible

25568 institution under this subsection for

25569 the covered fiscal year.

25570 ``(ii) Shortfall of special amounts.--

25571 ``(I) Applicability.--This clause

25572 shall apply to any fiscal year following

25573 the covered fiscal year and for which

25574 the total amount appropriated under

25575

25576[[Page 132 STAT. 4787]]

25577

25578 this section is insufficient to provide

25579 for the minimum additional funding

25580 amounts described in clause (i).

25581 ``(II) Reductions in allocations.--

25582 In the case of a fiscal year to which

25583 this clause applies, reductions in

25584 allocations shall be made proportionally

25585 from the qualified eligible institution

25586 and from each other eligible institution

25587 based on the increased amounts (if any)

25588 that the qualified eligible institution

25589 and each other eligible institution were

25590 allocated for the covered fiscal year as

25591 compared to the fiscal year immediately

25592 preceding the covered fiscal year.

25593 ``(iii) Effect of census.--Clauses (i) and

25594 (ii) shall not apply in any fiscal year for which

25595 a shortfall in the minimum additional funding

25596 amounts described in clause (i) is attributable to

25597 the incorporation of new census data into the

25598 calculation under paragraph (3), as determined by

25599 the Secretary.''.

25600

25601 (b) Research.--Section 1445(b) of the National Agricultural

25602Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3222(b))

25603is amended--

25604 (1) in paragraph (2)--

25605 (A) by adding at the end the following:

25606 ``(D) Special amounts.--

25607 ``(i) Definitions.--In this subparagraph:

25608 ``(I) Covered fiscal year.--The term

25609 `covered fiscal year' means the fiscal

25610 year for which the qualified eligible

25611 institution first received an allocation

25612 of $3,000,000 under clause (ii)(I).

25613 ``(II) Other eligible institution.--

25614 The term `other eligible institution'

25615 means an eligible institution, other

25616 than the qualified eligible institution,

25617 receiving an allocation of funds under

25618 this section.

25619 ``(III) Qualified eligible

25620 institution.--The term `qualified

25621 eligible institution' means the eligible

25622 institution described in clause (ii)(I).

25623 ``(ii) Fiscal year 2019, 2020, 2021, or

25624 2022.--

25625 ``(I) In general.--Subject to

25626 subclause (II), for 1 of fiscal year

25627 2019, 2020, 2021, or 2022, if the

25628 calculation under subparagraph (C) would

25629 result in a distribution for a fiscal

25630 year of less than $3,000,000 to an

25631 eligible institution that first received

25632 funds under this section on a date

25633 occurring after the date of enactment of

25634 the Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law

25635 113-79; 128 Stat. 649) and before

25636 September 30, 2018, that institution

25637 shall receive an allocation of

25638 $3,000,000 for that fiscal year.

25639 ``(II) Limitation.--Subclause (I)

25640 shall apply only if amounts are

25641 appropriated under this section in an

25642 amount sufficient to provide that each

25643 other eligible institution receiving an

25644 allocation of funds under this section

25645 for fiscal year 2019, 2020, 2021, or

25646 2022, as applicable, receives not less

25647 than the amount of funds received by

25648 that other eligible

25649

25650[[Page 132 STAT. 4788]]

25651

25652 institution under this section for the

25653 preceding fiscal year.

25654 ``(iii) Subsequent fiscal years.--

25655 ``(I) Minimum additional funding

25656 amounts.--Subject to subclauses (II) and

25657 (III), for each fiscal year following

25658 the covered fiscal year--

25659 ``(aa) the qualified

25660 eligible institution shall

25661 receive an allocation under this

25662 paragraph of at least

25663 $3,000,000; and

25664 ``(bb) each other eligible

25665 institution shall receive an

25666 allocation under this paragraph

25667 of at least the amount received

25668 by such other eligible

25669 institution under this

25670 subsection for the covered

25671 fiscal year.

25672 ``(II) Shortfall of special

25673 amounts.--

25674 ``(aa) Applicability.--This

25675 subclause shall apply to any

25676 fiscal year following the

25677 covered fiscal year and for

25678 which the total amount

25679 appropriated under this

25680 subsection is insufficient to

25681 provide for the minimum

25682 additional funding amounts

25683 described in subclause (I).

25684 ``(bb) Reductions in

25685 allocations.--In the case of a

25686 fiscal year to which this

25687 subclause applies, reductions in

25688 allocations shall be made

25689 proportionally from the

25690 qualified eligible institution

25691 and from each other eligible

25692 institution based on the

25693 increased amounts (if any) that

25694 the qualified eligible

25695 institution and each other

25696 eligible institution were

25697 allocated for the covered fiscal

25698 year as compared to the fiscal

25699 year immediately preceding the

25700 covered fiscal year.

25701 ``(III) Effect of census.--

25702 Subclauses (I) and (II) shall not apply

25703 in any fiscal year for which a shortfall

25704 in the minimum additional funding

25705 amounts described in subclause (I) is

25706 attributable to the incorporation of new

25707 census data into the calculation under

25708 paragraph (3)(C), as determined by the

25709 Secretary.'';

25710 (B) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``(B) Of

25711 funds'' and inserting the following:

25712 ``(C) Additional amount.--Except as provided in

25713 subparagraph (D), of funds'';

25714 (C) in subparagraph (A)--

25715 (i) by striking ``are allocated'' and

25716 inserting ``were allocated'';

25717 (ii) by inserting ``, as so designated as of

25718 that date'' before the period at the end; and

25719 (iii) by striking ``(A) Funds'' and inserting

25720 the following:

25721 ``(B) Base amount.--Funds''; and

25722 (D) in the matter preceding subparagraph (B) (as so

25723 designated), by striking ``(2) The'' and all that

25724 follows through ``follows:'' and inserting the

25725 following:

25726 ``(3) Distributions.--

25727

25728[[Page 132 STAT. 4789]]

25729

25730 ``(A) In general.--After allocating amounts under

25731 paragraph (2), the remainder shall be allotted among the

25732 eligible institutions in accordance with this

25733 paragraph.'';

25734 (2) in paragraph (1), by striking ``(1) Three per centum''

25735 and inserting the following:

25736 ``(2) Administration.--3 percent''; and

25737 (3) in the matter preceding paragraph (2) (as so

25738 designated), by striking ``(b) Beginning'' and all that follows

25739 through ``follows:'' and inserting the following:

25740

25741 ``(b) Distribution of Funds.--

25742 ``(1) In general.--Funds made available under this section

25743 shall be distributed among eligible institutions in accordance

25744 with this subsection.''.

25745SEC. 7116. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2207d.&gt;&gt; REPORTS ON DISBURSEMENT OF

25746 FUNDS FOR AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH AND

25747 EXTENSION AT 1862 AND 1890 LAND-GRANT

25748 COLLEGES, INCLUDING TUSKEGEE UNIVERSITY.

25749

25750 Not later than September 30, 2019, and each year thereafter, the

25751Secretary shall annually submit to Congress a report describing the

25752allocations made to, and matching funds received by, 1890 Institutions

25753and 1862 Institutions (as those terms are defined in section 2 of the

25754Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998 (7

25755U.S.C. 7601) for each of the agricultural research, extension,

25756education, and related programs established under--

25757 (1) section 1444 of the National Agricultural Research,

25758 Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3221);

25759 (2) section 1445 of the National Agricultural Research,

25760 Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3222);

25761 (3) subsections (b) and (c) of section 3 of the Smith-Lever

25762 Act (7 U.S.C. 343); and

25763 (4) the Hatch Act of 1887 (7 U.S.C. 361a et seq.).

25764SEC. 7117. SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS AT 1890 INSTITUTIONS.

25765

25766 Subtitle G of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and

25767Teaching Policy Act of 1977 is amended by inserting after section 1445

25768(7 U.S.C. 3222) the following new section:

25769``SEC. 1446. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 3222a.&gt;&gt; SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS AT

25770 1890 INSTITUTIONS.

25771

25772 ``(a) In General.--

25773 ``(1) Scholarship grant program established.--The Secretary

25774 shall make grants to each college or university eligible to

25775 receive funds under the Act of August 30, 1890 (commonly known

25776 as the Second Morrill Act; 7 U.S.C. 322 et seq.), including

25777 Tuskegee University, for purposes of awarding scholarships to

25778 individuals who--

25779 ``(A) have been accepted for admission at such

25780 college or university;

25781 ``(B) will be enrolled at such college or university

25782 not later than one year after the date of such

25783 acceptance; and

25784 ``(C) intend to pursue a career in the food and

25785 agricultural sciences, including a career in--

25786 ``(i) agribusiness;

25787 ``(ii) energy and renewable fuels; or

25788 ``(iii) financial management.

25789

25790[[Page 132 STAT. 4790]]

25791

25792 ``(2) Condition.--The Secretary may only award a grant under

25793 this subsection to a college or university described in

25794 paragraph (1) if the Secretary determines that such college or

25795 university has established a competitive scholarship awards

25796 process for the award of scholarships to individuals described

25797 in such paragraph.

25798 ``(3) Annual limitation.--Of the funds made available under

25799 subsection (b)(1), the Secretary may use not more than

25800 $10,000,000 to award grants under this subsection for the

25801 academic year beginning on July 1, 2020, and each of the three

25802 succeeding academic years.

25803 ``(4) Amount of grant.--Each grant made under this section

25804 shall be in an amount of not less than $500,000.

25805

25806 ``(b) Funding.--

25807 ``(1) Mandatory funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity

25808 Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall make available to carry

25809 out this section $40,000,000 not later than October 1, 2019, to

25810 remain available until expended.

25811 ``(2) Discretionary funding.--In addition to amounts made

25812 available under paragraph (1), there is authorized to be

25813 appropriated to carry out this section $10,000,000 for each of

25814 fiscal years 2020 through 2023.

25815 ``(3) Administrative expenses.--Of the funds made available

25816 under paragraphs (1) and (2) to carry out this section for a

25817 fiscal year, not more than 4 percent may be used for expenses

25818 related to administering the program under this section.

25819

25820 ``(c) Report.--Beginning on the date that is two years after the

25821date on which the first grant is awarded under subsection (a), and every

25822two years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on

25823Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on

25824Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report detailing--

25825 ``(1) the amount of funds provided to each eligible college

25826 or university under this section;

25827 ``(2) the number of scholarships awarded under each grant

25828 each fiscal year; and

25829 ``(3) the amount of each such scholarship.''.

25830SEC. 7118. GRANTS TO UPGRADE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD SCIENCES

25832 INCLUDING TUSKEGEE UNIVERSITY.

25835and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3222b(b)) is amended by

25836striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

25837SEC. 7119. GRANTS TO UPGRADE AGRICULTURE AND FOOD SCIENCES

25838 FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT AT INSULAR AREA

25839 LAND-GRANT INSTITUTIONS.

25840
