27817SEC. 7505. EXTENSION DESIGN AND DEMONSTRATION INITIATIVE.

27818

27819 (a) In General.--The Competitive, Special, and Facilities Research

27820Grant Act (7 U.S.C. 3157) is amended by inserting after subsection (c)

27821the following:

27822 ``(d) Extension Design and Demonstration Initiative.--

27823 ``(1) Purpose.--The purpose of this subsection is to

27824 encourage the design of adaptive prototype systems for improving

27825 extension and education that seek to advance the application,

27826 translation, and demonstration of scientific discoveries and

27827 other agricultural research for the adoption and understanding

27828 of food, agricultural, and natural resources practices,

27829 techniques, methods, and technologies using digital or other

27830 novel platforms.

27831 ``(2) Grants.--The Secretary shall award grants each fiscal

27832 year on a competitive basis--

27833 ``(A) for the design of 1 or more extension and

27834 education prototype systems--

27835 ``(i) that leverage digital platforms or other

27836 novel means of translating, delivering, or

27837 demonstrating agricultural research; and

27838 ``(ii) to adapt, apply, translate, or

27839 demonstrate scientific findings, data, technology,

27840 and other research outcomes to producers, the

27841 agricultural industry, and other interested

27842 persons or organizations; and

27843

27844[[Page 132 STAT. 4823]]

27845

27846 ``(B) to demonstrate, by incorporating analytics and

27847 specific metrics, the value, impact, and return on the

27848 Federal investment of a prototype system designed under

27849 subparagraph (A) as a model for use by other eligible

27850 entities described in paragraph (3) for improving,

27851 modernizing, and adapting applied research,

27852 demonstration, and extension services.

27853 ``(3) Eligible entities.--An entity that is eligible to

27854 receive a grant under paragraph (2) is--

27855 ``(A) a State agricultural experiment station (as

27856 defined in section 1404 of the National Agricultural

27857 Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7

27858 U.S.C. 3103));

27859 ``(B) a cooperative extension service (as defined in

27860 such section); and

27861 ``(C) a land-grant college or university (as defined

27862 in such section) .

27863 ``(4) Requirement.--The Secretary shall award grants under

27864 paragraph (2) to not fewer than 2 and not more than 5 eligible

27865 entities described in paragraph (3) that represent a diversity

27866 of regions, commodities, and agricultural or food production

27867 issues.

27868 ``(5) Term.--The term of a grant awarded under paragraph (2)

27869 shall be not longer than 5 years.

27870 ``(6) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized

27871 to be appropriated to carry out this subsection $5,000,000 for

27872 each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023, to remain available

27873 until expended.''.

27874

27875 (b) Technical and Conforming Amendments.--The Competitive, Special,

27876and Facilities Research Grant Act (7 U.S.C. 3157) is amended--

27877 (1) in subsection (c)(2), in the matter preceding

27878 subparagraph (A), by striking ``subsection--'' and all that

27879 follows through ``for the planning'' in subparagraph (B) and

27880 inserting ``subsection for the planning''; and

27881 (2) in subsection (h), by inserting ``, (d),'' after

27882 ``subsections (b)''.

27884

27886(7 U.S.C. 3101 note; Public Law 107-171) is repealed.

27893 end;

27898 ``(i) is intended for permanent sequestration

27899 or utilization; and

27900 ``(ii) is a byproduct of the production of the

27901 products described in subparagraphs (A) and

27902 (B).'';

27930 described in subsection (a)(1)(C).''; and

27935 OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

27938Postsecondary Education Reorganization Act (Public Law 93-471; sec. 38-

279391202.09(c), D.C. Official Code) is amended by inserting after the first

27940sentence the following: ``Such sums may be used to pay not more than \1/

279412\ of the total cost of providing such extension work.''.

27942 (b) Effective Date.--The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take

27943effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.

27965 Subtitle F--Other Matters

27966

27967SEC. 7601. ENHANCED USE LEASE AUTHORITY PROGRAM.

27968

27969 (a) Transition to Permanent Program.--Section 308 of the Federal

27970Crop Insurance Reform and Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act

27971of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 3125a note) is amended--

27972 (1) in the section heading, by striking ``pilot''; and

27973 (2) in subsection (a), by striking ``pilot''.

27974

27975 (b) Termination of Authority Extended.--Section 308(b)(6)(A) of the

27976Federal Crop Insurance Reform and Department of Agriculture

27977Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 3125a note) is amended by striking

27978``on the date that is 10 years after the date of enactment of this

27979section'' and inserting ``on September 30, 2023''.

27980 (c) Reports.--Section 308(d)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Reform

27981and Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 3125a

27982note) is amended by striking ``Not later than 6, 8, and 10 years after

27983the date of enactment of this section'' and inserting ``Not later than

27984September 30, 2021''.

27985SEC. 7602. TRANSFER OF ADMINISTRATIVE JURISDICTION OVER PORTION OF

27986 HENRY A. WALLACE BELTSVILLE AGRICULTURAL

27987 RESEARCH CENTER, BELTSVILLE, MARYLAND.

27988

27989 (a) Transfer Authorized.--Subject to subsection (e), the Secretary

27990may transfer to the Secretary of the Treasury administrative

27991jurisdiction over a parcel of real property at the Henry A. Wallace

27992Beltsville Agricultural Research Center consisting of approximately 100

27993acres, which was originally acquired by the United States through land

27994acquisitions in 1910 and 1925, and is generally located off of Poultry

27995Road lying between Powder Mill Road and Odell Road in Beltsville,

27996Maryland, for the purpose of facilitating the establishment of Bureau of

27997Engraving and Printing facilities on the parcel.

27998 (b) Legal Description and Map.--

27999 (1) Preparation.--The Secretary shall prepare a legal

28000 description and map of the parcel of real property to be

28001 transferred under subsection (a).

28002 (2) Force of law.--The legal description and map prepared

28003 under paragraph (1) shall have the same force and effect as if

28004 included in this Act, except that the Secretary may correct

28005 errors in the legal description and map.

28006

28007 (c) Terms and Conditions.--The transfer of administrative

28008jurisdiction under subsection (a) shall be subject to easements, valid

28009existing rights, and such other reservations, terms, and conditions as

28010the Secretary considers to be necessary.

28011 (d) Waiver.--The parcel of real property under subsection (a) is

28012exempt from Federal screening for other possible use due to an

28013identified Federal need for the parcel as the site of Bureau of

28014Engraving and Printing facilities.

28015 (e) Conditions for Transfer.--As a condition of the transfer of

28016administrative jurisdiction under subsection (a) with respect to the

28017parcel described in such subsection--

28018 (1) the Secretary of the Treasury shall agree to pay the

28019 Secretary the costs incurred to carry out such transfer,

28020 including the costs for--

28021

28022[[Page 132 STAT. 4826]]

28023

28024 (A) any environmental or administrative analysis

28025 required by law with respect to the parcel to be so

28026 transferred;

28027 (B) a survey of such parcel, if necessary; and

28028 (C) any hazardous substances assessment of the

28029 parcel to be so transferred; and

28030 (2) except as provided in subsection (d), the Secretary

28031 shall enter into a binding memorandum of agreement with the

28032 Secretary of the Treasury regarding the responsibilities,

28033 including financial responsibilities, of each party for

28034 evaluating and, if necessary, remediating or otherwise

28035 addressing hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants

28036 found at the parcel described in subsection (a).

28037

28038 (f) Hazardous Materials.--Nothing in this section, or the amendments

28039made by this section, amends, alters, or affects the relevant Federal

28040and State environmental laws, including the Comprehensive Environmental

28041Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 (42 U.S.C. 9601 et

28042seq.), or the application of such laws to the parcel of real property

28043transferred under subsection (a).

28044SEC. 7603. FOUNDATION FOR FOOD AND AGRICULTURE RESEARCH.

28045

28046 Section 7601 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 5939) is

28047amended--

28048 (1) in subsection (d)(1)--

28049 (A) in subparagraph (B)--

28050 (i) in clause (ii), by striking ``conflicts;''

28051 and inserting ``conflicts, specifically at the

28052 Department of Agriculture; and''; and

28053 (ii) by adding at the end the following new

28054 clause:

28056 include a summary of the results in the annual

28057 report required in subsection (f)(3)(B)''; and

28058 (B) in subparagraph (D), by inserting ``and

28059 agriculture stakeholders'' after ``community'';

28060 (2) in subsection (e)--

28061 (A) in paragraph (2)(C)(ii)(I), by inserting

28062 ``agriculture or'' before ``agricultural research''; and

28063 (B) in paragraph (4)(A)--

28064 (i) in clause (iii), by striking ``and'' at

28065 the end;

28067 (v); and

28068 (iii) by inserting after clause (iii) the

28069 following:

28071 gifts, grants, devises, or bequests of real or

28072 personal property made to the Foundation,

28073 including from private entities; and'';

28076 and

28085 activities align to the challenges

28086 identified in the strategic plan under

28087 clause (iv);'';

28088

28089[[Page 132 STAT. 4827]]

28090

28092 period at the end and inserting ``;

28093 and''; and

28097 available agricultural research

28098 programs and priorities for the

28099 upcoming fiscal year.''; and

28100 (ii) by adding at the end the following:

28101 ``(iii) Stakeholder notice.--The Foundation

28102 shall publish an annual notice with a description

28103 of agricultural research priorities under this

28104 section for the upcoming fiscal year, including--

28105 ``(I) a schedule for funding

28106 competitions;

28107 ``(II) a discussion of how

28108 applications for funding will be

28109 evaluated; and

28110 ``(III) how the Foundation will

28111 communicate information about funded

28112 awards to the public to ensure that

28113 grantees and partners understand the

28114 objectives of the Foundation.

28115 ``(iv) Strategic plan.--Not later than 1 year

28116 after the date of enactment of the Agriculture

28117 Improvement Act of 2018, the Foundation shall

28118 submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the

28119 House of Representatives and the Committee on

28120 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

28121 a strategic plan describing a path for the

28122 Foundation to become self-sustaining, including--

28123 ``(I) a forecast of major

28124 agricultural challenge opportunities

28125 identified by the scientific advisory

28126 councils of the Foundation and approved

28127 by the Board, including short- and long-

28128 term objectives;

28129 ``(II) an overview of the efforts

28130 that the Foundation will take to be

28131 transparent in each of the processes of

28132 the Foundation, including--

28133 ``(aa) processes relating to

28134 grant awards, including the

28135 selection, review, and

28136 notification processes;

28137 ``(bb) communication of

28138 past, current, and future

28139 research priorities; and

28140 ``(cc) plans to solicit and

28141 respond to public input on the

28142 opportunities identified in the

28143 strategic plan;

28144 ``(III) a description of financial

28145 goals and benchmarks for the next 10

28146 years, including a detailed plan for--

28147 ``(aa) raising funds in

28148 amounts greater than the amounts

28149 required under subsection

28150 (g)(1)(B);

28151 ``(bb) soliciting additional

28152 resources pursuant to

28153 subsections (e)(4)(A)(iv) and

28154 (f)(2)(A)(iii); and

28155 ``(cc) managing and

28156 leveraging such resources

28157 pursuant to subsection

28158 (f)(2)(A)(vii); and

28159 ``(IV) other related issues, as

28160 determined by the Board.''; and

28161 (4) in subsection (g)(1)--

28162

28163[[Page 132 STAT. 4828]]

28164

28165 (A) in the paragraph heading, by striking

28166 ``Mandatory funding'' and inserting ``Funding'';

28167 (B) in subparagraph (A)--

28168 (i) by striking ``On the date'' and inserting

28169 the following:

28171 and

28172 (ii) by adding at the end the following:

28176 Commodity Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall

28177 transfer to the Foundation to carry out this

28178 section $185,000,000, to remain available until

28179 expended.''; and

28180 (C) in subparagraph (B)--

28187 powers''; and

28193 research, and information program''; and

28194 (iii) by adding at the end the following:

28196 requires the Foundation to require a matching

28198 condition of receiving a grant under this

28199 section.''.

28200SEC. 7604. ASSISTANCE FOR FORESTRY RESEARCH UNDER THE MCINTIRE-

28204Stennis Cooperative Forestry Act'') (16 U.S.C. 582a-1) is amended in the

28205second sentence--

28208 section 532 of the Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act

28209 of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 301 note; Public Law 103-382)) that offer an

28210 associate's degree or a baccalaureate degree in forestry,''

28211 before ``and (b)''.

28212SEC. 7605. LEGITIMACY OF INDUSTRIAL HEMP RESEARCH.

28213

28215U.S.C. 5940) is amended--

28217 (b) and (a), respectively, and moving the subsections so as to

28218 appear in alphabetical order;

28219 (2) in subsection (a) (as so redesignated)--

28220 (A) by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (4);

28221 and

28222 (B) by inserting after paragraph (2) the following:

28223 ``(3) State.--The term `State' has the meaning given such

28224 term in section 297A of the Agricultural Marketing Act of

28225 1946.'';

28226

28227[[Page 132 STAT. 4829]]

28228

28229 (3) in subsection (b) (as so redesignated), in the

28230 subsection heading, by striking ``In General'' and inserting

28231 ``Industrial Hemp Research''; and

28232 (4) by adding at the end the following:

28233

28234 ``(c) Study and Report.--

28235 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall conduct a study of

28236 agricultural pilot programs--

28237 ``(A) to determine the economic viability of the

28238 domestic production and sale of industrial hemp; and

28239 ``(B) that shall include a review of--

28240 ``(i) each agricultural pilot program; and

28241 ``(ii) any other agricultural or academic

28242 research relating to industrial hemp.

28243 ``(2) Report.--Not later than 12 months after the date of

28244 enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall submit to

28245 Congress a report describing the results of the study conducted

28246 under paragraph (1).''.

28247

28248 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 5940 note.&gt;&gt; Repeal.--Effective on the date that

28249is 1 year after the date on which the Secretary establishes a plan under

28250section 297C of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946, section 7606 of

28251the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 5940) is repealed.

28252SEC. 7606. COLLECTION OF DATA RELATING TO BARLEY AREA PLANTED AND

28253 HARVESTED.

28254

28255 For all acreage reports published after the date of enactment of

28256this Act, the Secretary, acting through the Administrator of the

28257National Agricultural Statistics Service, shall include the State of New

28258York in the States surveyed to produce the table entitled ``Barley Area

28259Planted and Harvested'' in those reports.

28260SEC. 7607. COLLECTION OF DATA RELATING TO THE SIZE AND LOCATION OF

28261 DAIRY FARMS.

28262

28263 (a) In General.--Not later than 60 days after the date on which the

282642017 Census of Agriculture is released, the Secretary, acting through

28265the Administrator of the Economic Research Service, shall update the

28266report entitled ``Changes in the Size and Location of US Dairy Farms''

28267contained in the report of the Economic Research Service entitled

28268``Profits, Costs, and the Changing Structure of Dairy Farming'' and

28269published in September 2007.

28270 (b) Requirement.--In updating the report described in subsection

28271(a), the Secretary shall, to the maximum extent practicable, use the

28272same unit of measurement for reporting the full range of herd sizes in

28273Table 1 and Table 2 of the report while maintaining confidentiality of

28274individual producers.

28322SEC. 7610. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 7632 note.&gt;&gt; MECHANIZATION AND

28323 AUTOMATION FOR SPECIALTY CROPS.

28324

28325 (a) In General.--Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment

28326of this Act, the Secretary shall conduct a review of the programs of the

28327Department of Agriculture that affect the production or processing of

28328specialty crops.

28329 (b) Requirements.--The review under subsection (a) shall identify--

28330 (1) programs that currently are, or previously have been,

28331 effectively used to accelerate the development and use of

28332 automation or mechanization in the production or processing of

28333 specialty crops; and

28334 (2) programs that may be more effectively used to accelerate

28335 the development and use of automation or mechanization in the

28336 production or processing of specialty crops.

28337

28338 (c) Strategy.--With respect to programs identified under subsection

28339(b), the Secretary shall develop and implement a strategy to accelerate

28340the development and use of automation and mechanization in the

28341production or processing of specialty crops.

28468SEC. 7613. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 343 note.&gt;&gt; REVIEW OF LAND-GRANT TIME

28469 AND EFFORT REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.

28470

28471 (a) In General.--The Secretary, in consultation with the Office of

28472Management and Budget, shall review and revise current reporting

28473requirements related to compensation charges, documentation of personnel

28474expenses, and other requirements that are commonly referred to as time

28475and effort reporting for entities that receive funds under a program

28476referred to in clause (iii), (iv), (vii), (viii), or (xii) of section

28477251(f)(1)(C) of the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994

28478(7 U.S.C. 6971(f)(1)(C)).

28479 (b) Revisions.--The Secretary shall ensure that any revision made

28480pursuant to subsection (a)--

28481

28482[[Page 132 STAT. 4833]]

28483

28484 (1) is developed in collaboration with entities described in

28485 subsection (a); and

28486 (2) reduces the amount of paperwork and time required by the

28487 requirements referred to in such subsection, as such

28488 requirements are in effect on the date of the enactment of this

28489 Act.

28490SEC. 7614. MATCHING FUNDS REQUIREMENT.

28491

28492 (a) Repeal.--Subtitle P of the National Agricultural Research,

28493Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3371) is repealed.

28494 (b) Conforming Amendments.--

28495 (1) National agricultural research, extension, and teaching

28496 policy act of 1977.--

28497 (A) Grants to enhance research capacity in schools

28498 of veterinary medicine.--Section 1415(a) of the National

28499 Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy

28500 Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3151(a)) is amended--

28501 (i) by striking ``The Secretary'' and

28502 inserting the following:

28503 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary''; and

28504 (ii) by adding at the end the following:

28505 ``(2) Matching requirement.--A State receiving a grant under

28506 paragraph (1) shall provide State matching funds equal to not

28507 less than the amount of the grant.''.

28508 (B) Aquaculture assistance grant program.--Section

28509 1475(b) of the National Agricultural Research,

28510 Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C.

28511 3322(b)) is amended by striking ``The Secretary'' and

28512 all that follows through the period at the end and

28513 inserting the following:

28514 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (3), the Secretary

28515 may make competitive grants to entities eligible for grants

28516 under paragraph (2) for research and extension to facilitate or

28517 expand promising advances in the production and marketing of

28518 aquacultural food species and products and to enhance the safety

28519 and wholesomeness of those species and products, including the

28520 development of reliable supplies of seed stock and therapeutic

28521 compounds.

28522 ``(2) Eligible entities.--The Secretary may make a

28523 competitive grant under paragraph (1) to--

28524 ``(A) a land-grant or seagrant college or

28525 university;

28526 ``(B) a State agricultural experiment station;

28527 ``(C) a college, university, or Federal laboratory

28528 having a demonstrable capacity to conduct aquacultural

28529 research, as determined by the Secretary; or

28530 ``(D) a nonprofit private research institution.

28531 ``(3) Matching state grants.--

28532 ``(A) In general.--Except as provided in

28533 subparagraph (B), the Secretary shall not make a grant

28534 under paragraph (1) unless the State in which the grant

28535 recipient is located makes a grant to that recipient in

28536 an amount equal to not less than the amount of the grant

28537 under paragraph (1) (of which State amount an in-kind

28538 contribution shall not exceed 50 percent).

28539 ``(B) Federal laboratories.--Subparagraph (A) shall

28540 not apply to a grant to a Federal laboratory.''.

28541

28542[[Page 132 STAT. 4834]]

28543

28544 (C) Rangeland research.--Section 1480 of the

28545 National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching

28546 Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3333) is amended--

28547 (i) by striking ``The Secretary'' and

28548 inserting ``(a) In General.--The Secretary''; and

28549 (ii) by adding at the end the following new

28550 subsection:

28551

28552 ``(b) Matching Requirements.--

28553 ``(1) In general.--Except as provided in paragraph (2), this

28554 grant program shall be based on a matching formula of 50 percent

28555 Federal and 50 percent non-Federal funding (including funding

28556 from an agricultural commodity promotion, research, and

28557 information program).

28558 ``(2) Exception.--Paragraph (1) shall not apply to a grant

28559 to a Federal laboratory or a grant under subsection (a)(2).''.

28560 (2) Food, agriculture, conservation, and trade act of

28561 1990.--

28562 (A) Federal-state matching grant program.--Section

28563 1623(d)(2) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and

28564 Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5813(d)(2)) is amended by

28565 striking the second sentence.

28566 (B) Agricultural genome initiative.--Section 1671 of

28567 the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of

28568 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5924) (as amended by section 7208) is

28569 amended--

28570 (i) by redesignating subsection (f) as

28571 subsection (g); and

28572 (ii) by inserting after subsection (e) the

28573 following:

28574

28575 ``(f) Matching Funds Requirement.--

28576 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (3), with respect to

28577 a grant or cooperative agreement under this section that

28578 provides a particular benefit to a specific agricultural

28579 commodity, the recipient of funds under the grant or cooperative

28580 agreement shall provide non-Federal matching funds (including

28581 funds from an agricultural commodity promotion, research, and

28582 information program) equal to not less than the amount provided

28583 under the grant or cooperative agreement.

28584 ``(2) In-kind support.--Non-Federal matching funds described

28585 in paragraph (1) may include in-kind support.

28586 ``(3) Waiver.--The Secretary may waive the matching funds

28587 requirement under paragraph (1) with respect to a research

28588 project if the Secretary determines that--

28589 ``(A) the results of the project are of a particular

28590 benefit to a specific agricultural commodity, but those

28591 results are likely to be applicable to agricultural

28592 commodities generally; or

28593 ``(B)(i) the project--

28594 ``(I) involves a minor commodity; and

28595 ``(II) deals with scientifically important

28596 research; and

28597 ``(ii) the recipient is unable to satisfy the

28598 matching funds requirement.''.

28599 (C) High-priority research and extension

28600 initiatives.--Section 1672(a) of the Food, Agriculture,

28601 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5925(a))

28602 is amended--

28603 (i) by striking ``The Secretary of

28604 Agriculture'' and inserting the following:

28605

28606[[Page 132 STAT. 4835]]

28607

28608 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary of Agriculture'';

28609 (ii) in paragraph (1) (as so designated), in

28610 the second sentence, by striking ``The Secretary

28611 shall'' and inserting the following:

28612 ``(3) Consultation.--The Secretary shall''; and

28613 (iii) by inserting after paragraph (1) the

28614 following:

28615 ``(2) Matching funds requirement.--

28616 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (C), an

28617 entity receiving a grant under paragraph (1) shall

28618 provide non-Federal matching funds (including funds from

28619 an agricultural commodity promotion, research, and

28620 information program) equal to not less than the amount

28621 of the grant.

28622 ``(B) In-kind support.--Non-Federal matching funds

28623 described in subparagraph (A) may include in-kind

28624 support.

28625 ``(C) Waiver.--The Secretary may waive the matching

28626 funds requirement under subparagraph (A) with respect to

28627 a research project if the Secretary determines that--

28628 ``(i) the results of the project are of a

28629 particular benefit to a specific agricultural

28630 commodity, but those results are likely to be

28631 applicable to agricultural commodities generally;

28632 or

28633 ``(ii)(I) the project--

28634 ``(aa) involves a minor commodity;

28635 and

28636 ``(bb) deals with scientifically

28637 important research; and

28638 ``(II) the recipient is unable to satisfy the

28639 matching funds requirement.''.

28640 (D) Organic agriculture research and extension

28641 initiative.--Section 1672B of the Food, Agriculture,

28642 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5925b) (as

28643 amended by section 7210) is amended--

28644 (i) by redesignating subsections (c), (d), and

28645 (e) as subsections (d), (e), and (f),

28646 respectively; and

28647 (ii) by inserting after subsection (b) the

28648 following:

28649

28650 ``(c) Matching Requirement.--

28651 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (3), an entity

28652 receiving a grant under subsection (a) shall provide non-Federal

28653 matching funds (including funds from an agricultural commodity

28654 promotion, research, and information program) equal to not less

28655 than the amount of the grant.

28656 ``(2) In-kind support.--Non-Federal matching funds described

28657 in paragraph (1) may include in-kind support.

28658 ``(3) Waiver.--The Secretary may waive the matching funds

28659 requirement under paragraph (1) with respect to a research

28660 project if the Secretary determines that--

28661 ``(A) the results of the project are of a particular

28662 benefit to a specific agricultural commodity, but those

28663 results are likely to be applicable to agricultural

28664 commodities generally; or

28665 ``(B)(i) the project--

28666 ``(I) involves a minor commodity; and

28667 ``(II) deals with scientifically important

28668 research; and

28669 ``(ii) the recipient is unable to satisfy the

28670 matching funds requirement.''.

28671 (3) Agricultural research, extension, and education reform

28672 act of 1998.--

28673

28674[[Page 132 STAT. 4836]]

28675

28676 (A) Integrated research, education, and extension

28677 competitive grants program.--Section 406 of the

28678 Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform

28679 Act of 1998 (7 U.S.C. 7626) is amended--

28680 (i) by redesignating subsections (d) and (e)

28681 as subsections (e) and (f), respectively; and

28682 (ii) by inserting after subsection (c) the

28683 following:

28684

28685 ``(d) Matching Funds Requirement.--

28686 ``(1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (3), with respect to

28687 a grant under this section that provides a particular benefit to

28688 a specific agricultural commodity, the recipient of the grant

28689 shall provide non-Federal matching funds (including funds from

28690 an agricultural commodity promotion, research, and information

28691 program) equal to not less than the amount of the grant.

28692 ``(2) In-kind support.--Non-Federal matching funds described

28693 in paragraph (1) may include in-kind support.

28694 ``(3) Waiver.--The Secretary may waive the matching funds

28695 requirement under paragraph (1) with respect to a grant if the

28696 Secretary determines that--

28697 ``(A) the results of the grant are of a particular

28698 benefit to a specific agricultural commodity, but those

28699 results are likely to be applicable to agricultural

28700 commodities generally; or

28701 ``(B)(i) the grant--

28702 ``(I) involves a minor commodity; and

28703 ``(II) deals with scientifically important

28704 research; and

28705 ``(ii) the recipient is unable to satisfy the

28706 matching funds requirement.''.

28707 (B) Specialty crop research initiative.--Section

28708 412(g) of the Agricultural Research, Extension, and

28709 Education Reform Act of 1998 (7 U.S.C. 7632(g)) is

28710 amended--

28711 (i) by redesignating paragraph (3) as

28712 paragraph (4); and

28713 (ii) by inserting after paragraph (2) the

28714 following:

28715 ``(3) Matching requirement.--

28716 ``(A) In general.--An entity receiving a grant under

28717 this section shall provide non-Federal matching funds

28718 (including funds from an agricultural commodity

28719 promotion, research, and information program) equal to

28720 not less than the amount of the grant.

28721 ``(B) In-kind support.--Non-Federal matching funds

28722 described in subparagraph (A) may include in-kind

28723 support.''.

28724 (4) Other laws.--

28725 (A) Sun grant program.--Section 7526(c)(1)(C)(iv) of

28726 the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C.

28727 8114(c)(1)(C)(iv)) is amended by striking subclause

28728 (IV).

28729 (B) Agriculture and food research initiative.--

28730 Subsection (b)(9) of the Competitive, Special, and

28731 Facilities Research Grant Act (7 U.S.C. 3157(b)(9)) is

28732 amended--

28733 (i) in subparagraph (A), by striking clause

28734 (iii);

28735 (ii) in subparagraph (B)--

28736 (I) in clause (i), by striking

28737 ``clauses (ii) and (iii),'' and

28738 inserting ``clause (ii),''; and

28739 (II) by striking clause (iii); and

28740 (iii) by adding at the end the following:

28741

28742[[Page 132 STAT. 4837]]

28743

28744 ``(C) Applied research.--An entity receiving a grant

28745 under paragraph (5)(B) for applied research that is

28746 commodity-specific and not of national scope shall

28747 provide non-Federal matching funds equal to not less

28748 than the amount of the grant.''.

28749

28750 (c) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 3151 note.&gt;&gt; Application of Amendments.--

28751 (1) Awards made after date of enactment.--The amendments

28752 made by subsections (a) and (b) shall apply with respect to

28753 grants, cooperative agreements, or other awards described in

28754 subsection (b) that are made after the date of the enactment of

28755 this Act.

28756 (2) Awards made on or before date of enactment.--

28757 Notwithstanding the amendments made by subsections (a) and (b),

28758 a matching funds requirement in effect on the day before the

28759 date of enactment of this Act under a provision of law amended

28760 by subsection (a) or (b) shall continue to apply to a grant,

28761 cooperative agreement, or other award described in subsection

28762 (b) that is made on or before the date of the enactment of this

28763 Act.

28764

28765 TITLE VIII--FORESTRY

28766

28767 Subtitle A--Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978

28768

28769SEC. 8101. SUPPORT FOR STATE ASSESSMENTS AND STRATEGIES FOR FOREST

28770 RESOURCES.

28771

28772 Section 2A(f)(1) of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978

28773(16 U.S.C. 2101a(f)(1)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

28774``2023''.

28775SEC. 8102. STATE AND PRIVATE FOREST LANDSCAPE-SCALE RESTORATION

28776 PROGRAM.

28777

28778 (a) In General.--Section 13A of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance

28779Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2109a) is amended to read as follows:

28780``SEC. 13A. STATE AND PRIVATE FOREST LANDSCAPE-SCALE RESTORATION

28781 PROGRAM.

28782

28783 ``(a) Purpose.--The purpose of this section is to encourage

28784collaborative, science-based restoration of priority forest landscapes.

28785 ``(b) Definitions.--In this section:

28786 ``(1) Indian tribe.--The term `Indian tribe' has the meaning

28787 given the term in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and

28788 Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304).

28789 ``(2) Nonindustrial private forest land.--The term

28790 `nonindustrial private forest land' means land that--

28791 ``(A) is rural, as determined by the Secretary;

28792 ``(B) has existing tree cover or is suitable for

28793 growing trees; and

28794 ``(C) is owned by any private individual, group,

28795 association, corporation, Indian tribe, or other private

28796 legal entity.

28797 ``(3) State forest land.--The term `State forest land' means

28798 land that--

28799 ``(A) is rural, as determined by the Secretary; and

28800

28801[[Page 132 STAT. 4838]]

28802

28803 ``(B) is under State or local governmental ownership

28804 and considered to be non-Federal forest land.

28805

28806 ``(c) Establishment.--The Secretary, in consultation with State

28807foresters or appropriate State agencies, shall establish a competitive

28808grant program to provide financial and technical assistance to encourage

28809collaborative, science-based restoration of priority forest landscapes.

28810 ``(d) Eligibility.--To be eligible to receive a grant under this

28811section, an applicant shall submit to the Secretary, through the State

28812forester or appropriate State agency, a State and private forest

28813landscape-scale restoration proposal based on a restoration strategy

28814that--

28815 ``(1) is complete or substantially complete;

28816 ``(2) is for a multiyear period;

28817 ``(3) covers nonindustrial private forest land or State

28818 forest land;

28819 ``(4) is accessible by wood-processing infrastructure; and

28820 ``(5) is based on the best available science.

28821

28822 ``(e) Plan Criteria.--A State and private forest landscape-scale

28823restoration proposal submitted under this section shall include plans--

28824 ``(1) to reduce the risk of uncharacteristic wildfires;

28825 ``(2) to improve fish and wildlife habitats, including the

28826 habitats of threatened and endangered species;

28827 ``(3) to maintain or improve water quality and watershed

28828 function;

28829 ``(4) to mitigate invasive species, insect infestation, and

28830 disease;

28831 ``(5) to improve important forest ecosystems;

28832 ``(6) to measure ecological and economic benefits, including

28833 air quality and soil quality and productivity; and

28834 ``(7) to take other relevant actions, as determined by the

28835 Secretary.

28836

28837 ``(f) Priorities.--In making grants under this section, the

28838Secretary shall give priority to plans that--

28839 ``(1) further a statewide forest assessment and resource

28840 strategy;

28841 ``(2) promote cross boundary landscape collaboration; and

28842 ``(3) leverage public and private resources.

28843

28844 ``(g) Collaboration and Consultation.--The Chief of the Forest

28845Service, the Chief of the Natural Resources Conservation Service, and

28846relevant stakeholders shall collaborate and consult on an ongoing basis

28847regarding--

28848 ``(1) administration of the program established under this

28849 section; and

28850 ``(2) identification of other applicable resources for

28851 landscape-scale restoration.

28852

28853 ``(h) Matching Funds Required.--As a condition of receiving a grant

28854under this section, the Secretary shall require the recipient of the

28855grant to provide funds or in-kind support from non-Federal sources in an

28856amount that is at least equal to the amount of Federal funds.

28857 ``(i) Coordination and Proximity Encouraged.--In making grants under

28858this section, the Secretary may consider coordination with and proximity

28859to other landscape-scale projects on other land under the jurisdiction

28860of the Secretary, the Secretary of the Interior, or a Governor of a

28861State, including under--

28862

28863[[Page 132 STAT. 4839]]

28864

28865 ``(1) the Collaborative Forest Landscape Restoration Program

28866 established under section 4003 of the Omnibus Public Land

28867 Management Act of 2009 (16 U.S.C. 7303);

28868 ``(2) landscape areas designated for insect and disease

28869 treatments under section 602 of the Healthy Forests Restoration

28870 Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6591a);

28871 ``(3) good neighbor authority under section 19;

28872 ``(4) stewardship end result contracting projects authorized

28873 under section 604 of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003

28874 (16 U.S.C. 6591c);

28875 ``(5) appropriate State-level programs; and

28876 ``(6) other relevant programs, as determined by the

28877 Secretary.

28878

28879 ``(j) Regulations.--The Secretary shall promulgate such regulations

28880as the Secretary determines necessary to carry out this section.

28881 ``(k) Report.--Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of

28882this section, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture

28883of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

28884Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report on--

28885 ``(1) the status of development, execution, and

28886 administration of selected projects;

28887 ``(2) the accounting of program funding expenditures; and

28888 ``(3) specific accomplishments that have resulted from

28889 landscape-scale projects.

28890

28891 ``(l) Fund.--

28892 ``(1) In general.--There is established in the Treasury a

28893 fund, to be known as the `State and Private Forest Landscape-

28894 Scale Restoration Fund' (referred to in this subsection as the

28895 `Fund'), to be used by the Secretary to make grants under this

28896 section.

28897 ``(2) Contents.--The Fund shall consist of such amounts as

28898 are appropriated to the Fund under paragraph (3).

28899 ``(3) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized

28900 to be appropriated to the Fund $20,000,000 for each fiscal year

28901 beginning with the first full fiscal year after the date of

28902 enactment of this subsection through fiscal year 2023, to remain

28903 available until expended.''.

28904

28905 (b) Conforming Amendments.--

28906 (1) Section 13B of the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act

28907 of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2109b) is repealed.

28908 (2) Section 19(a)(4)(C) of the Cooperative Forestry

28909 Assistance Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2113(a)(4)(C)) is amended by

28910 striking ``sections 13A and 13B'' and inserting ``section 13A''.

28911

28912 Subtitle B--Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Research Act of

28913 1978

28914

28915SEC. 8201. REPEAL OF RECYCLING RESEARCH.

28916

28917 Section 9 of the Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Research

28918Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 1648) is repealed.

28919SEC. 8202. REPEAL OF FORESTRY STUDENT GRANT PROGRAM.

28920

28921 Section 10 of the Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Research

28922Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 1649) is repealed.

28923

28924[[Page 132 STAT. 4840]]

28925

28926 Subtitle C--Global Climate Change Prevention Act of 1990

28927

28928SEC. 8301. REPEALS RELATING TO BIOMASS.

28929

28930 (a) Biomass Energy Demonstration Projects.--Section 2410 of the

28931Global Climate Change Prevention Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6708) is

28932repealed.

28933 (b) Interagency Cooperation to Maximize Biomass Growth.--Section

289342411 of the Global Climate Change Prevention Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6709)

28935is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by striking ``to--''

28936and all that follows through ``such forests and lands'' in paragraph (2)

28937and inserting ``to develop a program to manage forests and land on

28938Department of Defense military installations''.

28939

28940 Subtitle D--Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003

28941

28942SEC. 8401. PROMOTING CROSS-BOUNDARY WILDFIRE MITIGATION.

28943

28944 Section 103 of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16

28945U.S.C. 6513) is amended by adding at the end the following:

28946 ``(e) Cross-boundary Hazardous Fuel Reduction Projects.--

28947 ``(1) Definitions.--In this subsection:

28948 ``(A) Hazardous fuel reduction project.--The term

28949 `hazardous fuel reduction project' means a hazardous

28950 fuel reduction project described in paragraph (2).

28951 ``(B) Non-federal land.--The term `non-Federal land'

28952 includes--

28953 ``(i) State land;

28954 ``(ii) county land;

28955 ``(iii) Tribal land;

28956 ``(iv) private land; and

28957 ``(v) other non-Federal land.

28958 ``(2) Grants.--The Secretary may make grants to State

28959 foresters to support hazardous fuel reduction projects that

28960 incorporate treatments in landscapes across ownership boundaries

28961 on Federal and non-Federal land, particularly in areas

28962 identified as priorities in applicable State-wide forest

28963 resource assessments or strategies under section 2A(a) of the

28964 Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C.

28965 2101a(a)), as mutually agreed to by the State forester and the

28966 Regional Forester.

28967 ``(3) Land treatments.--To conduct and fund treatments for

28968 hazardous fuel reduction projects carried out by State foresters

28969 using grants under paragraph (2), the Secretary may use the

28970 authorities of the Secretary relating to cooperation and

28971 technical and financial assistance, including the good neighbor

28972 authority under--

28973 ``(A) section 8206 of the Agricultural Act of 2014

28974 (16 U.S.C. 2113a); and

28975 ``(B) section 331 of the Department of the Interior

28976 and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001 (16 U.S.C.

28977 1011 note; Public Law 106-291).

28978

28979[[Page 132 STAT. 4841]]

28980

28981 ``(4) Cooperation.--In carrying out a hazardous fuel

28982 reduction project using a grant under paragraph (2) on non-

28983 Federal land, the State forester, in consultation with the

28984 Secretary--

28985 ``(A) shall consult with any applicable owners of

28986 the non-Federal land; and

28987 ``(B) shall not implement the hazardous fuel

28988 reduction project on non-Federal land without the

28989 consent of the owner of the non-Federal land.

28990 ``(5) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized

28991 to be appropriated to carry out this subsection $20,000,000 for

28992 each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.''.

28993SEC. 8402. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS FOR HAZARDOUS FUEL

28994 REDUCTION ON FEDERAL LAND.

28995

28996 Section 108 of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16

28997U.S.C. 6518) is amended by striking ``$760,000,000 for each fiscal

28998year'' and inserting ``$660,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019

28999through 2023''.

29000SEC. 8403. REPEAL OF BIOMASS COMMERCIAL UTILIZATION GRANT PROGRAM.

29001

29002 (a) In General.--Section 203 of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act

29003of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6531) is repealed.

29004 (b) Conforming Amendment.--The table of contents for the Healthy

29005Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6501 note; Public Law 108-

29006148) is amended by striking the item relating to section 203.

29007SEC. 8404. WATER SOURCE PROTECTION PROGRAM.

29008

29009 (a) In General.--Title III of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of

290102003 (16 U.S.C. 6541 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the

29011following:

29012``SEC. 303. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 6542.&gt;&gt; WATER SOURCE PROTECTION

29013 PROGRAM.

29014

29015 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

29016 ``(1) End water user.--The term `end water user' means a

29017 non-Federal entity, including--

29018 ``(A) a State;

29019 ``(B) a political subdivision of a State;

29020 ``(C) an Indian tribe;

29021 ``(D) a utility;

29022 ``(E) a municipal water system;

29023 ``(F) an irrigation district;

29024 ``(G) a nonprofit organization; and

29025 ``(H) a corporation.

29026 ``(2) Forest management activity.--The term `forest

29027 management activity' means a project carried out by the

29028 Secretary on National Forest System land.

29029 ``(3) Forest plan.--The term `forest plan' means a land

29030 management plan prepared by the Forest Service for a unit of the

29031 National Forest System pursuant to section 6 of the Forest and

29032 Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 (16 U.S.C.

29033 1604).

29034 ``(4) Non-federal partner.--The term `non-Federal partner'

29035 means an end water user with whom the Secretary has entered into

29036 a partnership agreement under subsection (c)(1).

29037

29038[[Page 132 STAT. 4842]]

29039

29040 ``(5) Program.--The term `Program' means the Water Source

29041 Protection Program established under subsection (b).

29042 ``(6) Secretary.--The term `Secretary' means the Secretary

29043 of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service.

29044 ``(7) Water source management plan.--The term `water source

29045 management plan' means the water source management plan

29046 developed under subsection (d)(1).

29047

29048 ``(b) Establishment.--The Secretary shall establish and maintain a

29049program, to be known as the `Water Source Protection Program', to carry

29050out watershed protection and restoration projects on National Forest

29051System land.

29052 ``(c) Water Source Investment Partnerships.--

29053 ``(1) In general.--In carrying out the Program, the

29054 Secretary may enter into water source investment partnership

29055 agreements with end water users to protect and restore the

29056 condition of National Forest watersheds that provide water to

29057 the end water users.

29058 ``(2) Form.--A partnership agreement described in paragraph

29059 (1) may take the form of--

29060 ``(A) a memorandum of understanding;

29061 ``(B) a cost-share or collection agreement;

29062 ``(C) a long-term funding matching commitment; or

29063 ``(D) another appropriate instrument, as determined

29064 by the Secretary.

29065

29066 ``(d) Water Source Management Plan.--

29067 ``(1) In general.--In carrying out the Program, the

29068 Secretary, in cooperation with the non-Federal partners and

29069 applicable State, local, and Tribal governments, may develop a

29070 water source management plan that describes the proposed

29071 implementation of watershed protection and restoration projects

29072 under the Program.

29073 ``(2) Requirement.--A water source management plan shall be

29074 conducted in a manner consistent with the forest plan applicable

29075 to the National Forest System land on which the watershed

29076 protection and restoration project is carried out.

29077 ``(3) Environmental analysis.--The Secretary may conduct a

29078 single environmental impact statement or similar analysis

29079 required under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42

29080 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.)--

29081 ``(A) for each watershed protection and restoration

29082 project included in the water source management plan; or

29083 ``(B) as part of the development of, or after the

29084 finalization of, the water source management plan.

29085

29086 ``(e) Forest Management Activities.--

29087 ``(1) In general.--To the extent that forest management

29088 activities are necessary to protect, maintain, or enhance water

29089 quality, and in accordance with paragraph (2), the Secretary

29090 shall carry out forest management activities as part of

29091 watershed protection and restoration projects carried out on

29092 National Forest System land, with the primary purpose of--

29093 ``(A) protecting a municipal water supply system;

29094 ``(B) restoring forest health from insect

29095 infestations and disease; or

29096 ``(C) any combination of the purposes described in

29097 subparagraphs (A) and (B).

29098

29099[[Page 132 STAT. 4843]]

29100

29101 ``(2) Compliance.--The Secretary shall carry out forest

29102 management activities under paragraph (1) in accordance with--

29103 ``(A) this Act;

29104 ``(B) the applicable water source management plan;

29105 ``(C) the applicable forest plan; and

29106 ``(D) other applicable laws.

29107

29108 ``(f) Endangered Species Act of 1973.--In carrying out the Program,

29109the Secretary may use the Manual on Adaptive Management of the

29110Department of the Interior, including any associated guidance, to comply

29111with the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1531 et seq.).

29112 ``(g) Funds and Services.--

29113 ``(1) In general.--In carrying out the Program, the

29114 Secretary may accept and use funding, services, and other forms

29115 of investment and assistance from non-Federal partners to

29116 implement the water source management plan.

29117 ``(2) Matching funds required.--The Secretary shall require

29118 the contribution of funds or in-kind support from non-Federal

29119 partners to be in an amount that is at least equal to the amount

29120 of Federal funds.

29121 ``(3) Manner of use.--The Secretary may accept and use

29122 investments described in paragraph (1) directly or indirectly

29123 through the National Forest Foundation.

29124 ``(4) Water source protection fund.--

29125 ``(A) In general.--Subject to the availability of

29126 appropriations, the Secretary may establish a Water

29127 Source Protection Fund to match funds or in-kind support

29128 contributed by non-Federal partners under paragraph (1).

29129 ``(B) Use of appropriated funds.--There is

29130 authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section

29131 $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.

29132 ``(C) Partnership agreements.--The Secretary may

29133 make multiyear commitments, if necessary, to implement 1

29134 or more partnership agreements under subsection (c).''.

29135

29136 (b) Conforming Amendment.--The table of contents for the Healthy

29137Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6501 note; Public Law 108-

29138148) is amended by striking the item relating to section 303 and

29139inserting the following:

29140

29141``Sec. 303. Water Source Protection Program.''.

29142

29143SEC. 8405. WATERSHED CONDITION FRAMEWORK.

29144

29145 (a) In General.--Title III of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of

291462003 (16 U.S.C. 6541 et seq.) (as amended by section 8404(a)) is amended

29147by adding at the end the following:

29148``SEC. 304. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 6543.&gt;&gt; WATERSHED CONDITION FRAMEWORK.

29149

29150 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the

29151Chief of the Forest Service (referred to in this section as the

29152`Secretary'), may establish and maintain a Watershed Condition Framework

29153for National Forest System land--

29154 ``(1) to evaluate and classify the condition of watersheds,

29155 taking into consideration--

29156 ``(A) water quality and quantity;

29157 ``(B) aquatic habitat and biota;

29158 ``(C) riparian and wetland vegetation;

29159 ``(D) the presence of roads and trails;

29160

29161[[Page 132 STAT. 4844]]

29162

29163 ``(E) soil type and condition;

29164 ``(F) groundwater-dependent ecosystems;

29165 ``(G) relevant terrestrial indicators, such as fire

29166 regime, risk of catastrophic fire, forest and rangeland

29167 vegetation, invasive species, and insects and disease;

29168 and

29169 ``(H) other significant factors, as determined by

29170 the Secretary;

29171 ``(2) to identify for protection and restoration up to 5

29172 priority watersheds in each National Forest, and up to 2

29173 priority watersheds in each national grassland, taking into

29174 consideration the impact of the condition of the watershed

29175 condition on--

29176 ``(A) wildfire behavior;

29177 ``(B) flood risk;

29178 ``(C) fish and wildlife;

29179 ``(D) drinking water supplies;

29180 ``(E) irrigation water supplies;

29181 ``(F) forest-dependent communities; and

29182 ``(G) other significant impacts, as determined by

29183 the Secretary;

29184 ``(3) to develop a watershed protection and restoration

29185 action plan for each priority watershed that--

29186 ``(A) takes into account existing restoration

29187 activities being implemented in the watershed; and

29188 ``(B) includes, at a minimum--

29189 ``(i) the major stressors responsible for the

29190 impaired condition of the watershed;

29191 ``(ii) a set of essential projects that, once

29192 completed, will address the identified stressors

29193 and improve watershed conditions;

29194 ``(iii) a proposed implementation schedule;

29195 ``(iv) potential partners and funding sources;

29196 and

29197 ``(v) a monitoring and evaluation program;

29198 ``(4) to prioritize protection and restoration activities

29199 for each watershed restoration action plan;

29200 ``(5) to implement each watershed protection and restoration

29201 action plan; and

29202 ``(6) to monitor the effectiveness of protection and

29203 restoration actions and indicators of watershed health.

29204

29205 ``(b) Coordination.--In carrying out subsection (a), the Secretary

29206shall--

29207 ``(1) coordinate with interested non-Federal landowners and

29208 State, Tribal, and local governments within the relevant

29209 watershed; and

29210 ``(2) provide for an active and ongoing public engagement

29211 process.

29212

29213 ``(c) Emergency Designation.--Notwithstanding paragraph (2) of

29214subsection (a), the Secretary may identify a watershed as a priority for

29215rehabilitation in the Watershed Condition Framework without using the

29216process described in that subsection if a Forest Supervisor determines

29217that--

29218 ``(1) a wildfire has significantly diminished the condition

29219 of the watershed; and

29220 ``(2) the emergency stabilization activities of the Burned

29221 Area Emergency Response Team are insufficient to return the

29222 watershed to proper function.''.

29223

29224 (b) Conforming Amendment.--The table of contents for the Healthy

29225Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6501 note;

29226

29227[[Page 132 STAT. 4845]]

29228

29229Public Law 108-148) (as amended by section 8404(b)) is amended by

29230inserting after the item relating to section 303 the following:

29231

29232``Sec. 304. Watershed Condition Framework.''.

29233

29234SEC. 8406. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS TO COMBAT INSECT

29235 INFESTATIONS AND RELATED DISEASES.

29236

29237 (a) In General.--Section 406 of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act

29238of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6556) is amended to read as follows:

29239``SEC. 406. TERMINATION OF EFFECTIVENESS.

29240

29241 ``The authority provided by this title terminates effective October

292421, 2023.''.

29243 (b) Conforming Amendment.--The table of contents for the Healthy

29244Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6501 note; Public Law 108-

29245148) is amended by striking the item relating to section 406 and

29246inserting the following:

29247

29248``Sec. 406. Termination of effectiveness.''.

29249

29250SEC. 8407. HEALTHY FORESTS RESTORATION ACT OF 2003 AMENDMENTS.

29251

29252 (a) Healthy Forests Reserve Program.--

29253 (1) Additional purpose of program.--Section 501(a) of the

29254 Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6571(a)) is

29255 amended--

29256 (A) by striking ``and'' at the end of paragraph (2);

29257 (B) by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (4);

29258 and

29259 (C) by inserting after paragraph (2) the following

29260 new paragraph:

29261 ``(3) to conserve forest land that provides habitat for

29262 species described in section 502(b); and''.

29263 (2) Eligibility for enrollment.--Subsection (b) of section

29264 502 of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C.

29265 6572) is amended to read as follows:

29266

29267 ``(b) Eligibility.--To be eligible for enrollment in the healthy

29268forests reserve program, land shall be private forest land, or private

29269land being restored to forest land, the enrollment of which will

29270maintain, restore, enhance, or otherwise measurably--

29271 ``(1) increase the likelihood of recovery of a species that

29272 is listed as endangered or threatened under section 4 of the

29273 Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1533); or

29274 ``(2) improve the well-being of a species that--

29275 ``(A) is--

29276 ``(i) not listed as endangered or threatened

29277 under such section; and

29278 ``(ii) a candidate for such listing, a State-

29279 listed species, or a special concern species; or

29280 ``(B) is deemed a species of greatest conservation

29281 need by a State wildlife action plan.''.

29282 (3) Other enrollment considerations.--Section 502(c) of the

29283 Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6572(c)) is

29284 amended--

29285 (A) by striking ``and'' at the end of paragraph (1);

29286 (B) by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3);

29287 and

29288 (C) by inserting after paragraph (1) the following

29289 new paragraph:

29290

29291[[Page 132 STAT. 4846]]

29292

29293 ``(2) conserve forest land that provides habitat for species

29294 described in subsection (b); and''.

29295 (4) Elimination of limitation on use of easements.--Section

29296 502(e) of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C.

29297 6572(e)) is amended by striking paragraph (2) and redesignating

29298 paragraph (3) as paragraph (2).

29299 (5) Enrollment of acreage owned by an indian tribe.--

29300 Paragraph (2) of section 502(e) of the Healthy Forests

29301 Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6572(e)) (as redesignated by

29302 paragraph (4)) is amended, in subparagraph (B), by striking

29303 clauses (ii) and (iii) and inserting the following new clauses:

29304 ``(ii) a 10-year cost-share agreement;

29305 ``(iii) a permanent easement; or

29306 ``(iv) any combination of the options

29307 described in clauses (i) through (iii).''.

29308 (6) Enrollment priority.--Section 502(f)(1)(B) of the

29309 Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C.

29310 6572(f)(1)(B)) is amended by striking clause (ii) and inserting

29311 the following:

29312 ``(ii)(I) are candidates for such listing,

29313 State-listed species, or special concern species;

29314 or

29315 ``(II) are deemed a species of greatest

29316 conservation need under a State wildlife action

29317 plan.''.

29318 (7) Restoration plans.--Subsection (b) of section 503 of the

29319 Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6573) is

29320 amended to read as follows:

29321

29322 ``(b) Practices.--The restoration plan shall require such

29323restoration practices and measures as are necessary to restore and

29324enhance habitat for species described in section 502(b), including the

29325following:

29326 ``(1) Land management practices.

29327 ``(2) Vegetative treatments.

29328 ``(3) Structural practices and measures.

29329 ``(4) Practices to increase carbon sequestration.

29330 ``(5) Practices to improve biological diversity.

29331 ``(6) Other practices and measures.''.

29332 (8) Funding.--Section 508(b) of the Healthy Forests

29333 Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6578(b)) is amended--

29334 (A) in the subsection heading, by striking ``Fiscal

29335 Years 2014 Through 2018'' and inserting ``Authorization

29336 of Appropriations''; and

29337 (B) by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

29338 (9) Technical correction.--Section 503(a) of the Healthy

29339 Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6573(a)) is amended

29340 by striking ``Secretary of Interior'' and inserting ``Secretary

29341 of the Interior''.

29342

29343 (b) Insect and Disease Infestation.--

29344 (1) Treatment of areas.--Section 602(d)(1) of the Healthy

29345 Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6591a(d)(1)) is

29346 amended by striking ``subsection (b) to reduce the risk or

29347 extent of, or increase the resilience to, insect or disease

29348 infestation in the areas.'' and inserting the following:

29349 ``subsection (b)--

29350 ``(A) to reduce the risk or extent of, or increase

29351 the resilience to, insect or disease infestation; or

29352 ``(B) to reduce hazardous fuels.''.

29353

29354[[Page 132 STAT. 4847]]

29355

29356 (2) Extension of authority.--Section 602(d)(2) of the

29357 Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6591a(d)(2))

29358 is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''.

29359SEC. 8408. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS FOR DESIGNATION OF

29360 TREATMENT AREAS.

29361

29362 Section 602 of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16

29363U.S.C. 6591a) is amended by striking subsection (f).

29377through 2023''.

29381Foundation Act (16 U.S.C. 583j-3(b)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and

29391

29392 Subtitle F--Forest Management

29393

29394SEC. 8601. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 580d note.&gt;&gt; DEFINITION OF NATIONAL

29395 FOREST SYSTEM.

29396

29397 In this subtitle, the term ``National Forest System'' has the

29398meaning given the term in section 11(a) of the Forest and Rangeland

29399Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 (16 U.S.C. 1609(a)).

29400

29401PART I--EXPEDITED ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSIS AND AVAILABILITY OF CATEGORICAL

29402 EXCLUSIONS TO EXPEDITE FOREST MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES

29403

29404SEC. 8611. CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION FOR GREATER SAGE-GROUSE AND MULE

29405 DEER HABITAT.

29406

29407 (a) In General.--Title VI of the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of

294082003 (16 U.S.C. 6591 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the

29409following:

29410

29411[[Page 132 STAT. 4848]]

29412

29413``SEC. 606. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 6591e.&gt;&gt; CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION FOR

29414 GREATER SAGE-GROUSE AND MULE DEER HABITAT.

29415

29416 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

29417 ``(1) Covered vegetation management activity.--

29418 ``(A) In general.--The term `covered vegetation

29419 management activity' means any activity described in

29420 subparagraph (B) that--

29421 ``(i)(I) is carried out on National Forest

29422 System land administered by the Forest Service; or

29423 ``(II) is carried out on public land

29424 administered by the Bureau of Land Management;

29425 ``(ii) with respect to public land, meets the

29426 objectives of the order of the Secretary of the

29427 Interior numbered 3336 and dated January 5, 2015;

29428 ``(iii) conforms to an applicable forest plan

29429 or land use plan;

29430 ``(iv) protects, restores, or improves greater

29431 sage-grouse or mule deer habitat in a sagebrush

29432 steppe ecosystem as described in--

29433 ``(I) Circular 1416 of the United

29434 States Geological Survey entitled

29435 `Restoration Handbook for Sagebrush

29436 Steppe Ecosystems with Emphasis on

29437 Greater Sage-Grouse Habitat--Part 1.

29438 Concepts for Understanding and Applying

29439 Restoration' (2015); or

29440 ``(II) the habitat guidelines for

29441 mule deer published by the Mule Deer

29442 Working Group of the Western Association

29443 of Fish and Wildlife Agencies;

29444 ``(v) will not permanently impair--

29445 ``(I) the natural state of the

29446 treated area;

29447 ``(II) outstanding opportunities for

29448 solitude;

29449 ``(III) outstanding opportunities

29450 for primitive, unconfined recreation;

29451 ``(IV) economic opportunities

29452 consistent with multiple-use management;

29453 or

29454 ``(V) the identified values of a

29455 unit of the National Landscape

29456 Conservation System;

29457 ``(vi)(I) restores native vegetation following

29458 a natural disturbance;

29459 ``(II) prevents the expansion into greater

29460 sage-grouse or mule deer habitat of--

29461 ``(aa) juniper, pinyon pine, or

29462 other associated conifers; or

29463 ``(bb) nonnative or invasive

29464 vegetation;

29465 ``(III) reduces the risk of loss of greater

29466 sage-grouse or mule deer habitat from wildfire or

29467 any other natural disturbance; or

29468 ``(IV) provides emergency stabilization of

29469 soil resources after a natural disturbance; and

29470 ``(vii) provides for the conduct of

29471 restoration treatments that--

29472 ``(I) maximize the retention of old-

29473 growth and large trees, as appropriate

29474 for the forest type;

29475 ``(II) consider the best available

29476 scientific information to maintain or

29477 restore the ecological integrity,

29478 including maintaining or restoring

29479 structure, function, composition, and

29480 connectivity;

29481

29482[[Page 132 STAT. 4849]]

29483

29484 ``(III) are developed and

29485 implemented through a collaborative

29486 process that--

29487 ``(aa) includes multiple

29488 interested persons representing

29489 diverse interests; and

29490 ``(bb)(AA) is transparent

29491 and nonexclusive; or

29492 ``(BB) meets the

29493 requirements for a resource

29494 advisory committee under

29495 subsections (c) through (f) of

29496 section 205 of the Secure Rural

29497 Schools and Community Self-

29498 Determination Act of 2000 (16

29499 U.S.C. 7125); and

29500 ``(IV) may include the

29501 implementation of a proposal that

29502 complies with the eligibility

29503 requirements of the Collaborative Forest

29504 Landscape Restoration Program under

29505 section 4003(b) of the Omnibus Public

29506 Land Management Act of 2009 (16 U.S.C.

29507 7303(b)).

29508 ``(B) Description of activities.--An activity

29509 referred to in subparagraph (A) is--

29510 ``(i) manual cutting and removal of juniper

29511 trees, pinyon pine trees, other associated

29512 conifers, or other nonnative or invasive

29513 vegetation;

29514 ``(ii) mechanical mastication, cutting, or

29515 mowing, mechanical piling and burning, chaining,

29516 broadcast burning, or yarding;

29517 ``(iii) removal of cheat grass, medusa head

29518 rye, or other nonnative, invasive vegetation;

29519 ``(iv) collection and seeding or planting of

29520 native vegetation using a manual, mechanical, or

29521 aerial method;

29522 ``(v) seeding of nonnative, noninvasive,

29523 ruderal vegetation only for the purpose of

29524 emergency stabilization;

29525 ``(vi) targeted use of an herbicide, subject

29526 to the condition that the use shall be in

29527 accordance with applicable legal requirements,

29528 Federal agency procedures, and land use plans;

29529 ``(vii) targeted livestock grazing to mitigate

29530 hazardous fuels and control noxious and invasive

29531 weeds;

29532 ``(viii) temporary removal of wild horses or

29533 burros in the area in which the activity is being

29534 carried out to ensure treatment objectives are

29535 met;

29536 ``(ix) in coordination with the affected

29537 permit holder, modification or adjustment of

29538 permissible usage under an annual plan of use of a

29539 grazing permit issued by the Secretary concerned

29540 to achieve restoration treatment objectives;

29541 ``(x) installation of new, or modification of

29542 existing, fencing or water sources intended to

29543 control use or improve wildlife habitat; or

29544 ``(xi) necessary maintenance of, repairs to,

29545 rehabilitation of, or reconstruction of an

29546 existing permanent road or construction of

29547 temporary roads to accomplish the activities

29548 described in this subparagraph.

29549 ``(C) Exclusions.--The term `covered vegetation

29550 management activity' does not include--

29551

29552[[Page 132 STAT. 4850]]

29553

29554 ``(i) any activity conducted in a wilderness

29555 area or wilderness study area;

29556 ``(ii) any activity for the construction of a

29557 permanent road or permanent trail;

29558 ``(iii) any activity conducted on Federal land

29559 on which, by Act of Congress or Presidential

29560 proclamation, the removal of vegetation is

29561 restricted or prohibited;

29562 ``(iv) any activity conducted in an area in

29563 which activities under subparagraph (B) would be

29564 inconsistent with the applicable land and resource

29565 management plan; or

29566 ``(v) any activity conducted in an inventoried

29567 roadless area.

29568 ``(2) Secretary concerned.--The term `Secretary concerned'

29569 means--

29570 ``(A) the Secretary of Agriculture, with respect to

29571 National Forest System land; and

29572 ``(B) the Secretary of the Interior, with respect to

29573 public land.

29574 ``(3) Temporary road.--The term `temporary road' means a

29575 road that is--

29576 ``(A) authorized--

29577 ``(i) by a contract, permit, lease, other

29578 written authorization; or

29579 ``(ii) pursuant to an emergency operation;

29580 ``(B) not intended to be part of the permanent

29581 transportation system of a Federal department or agency;

29582 ``(C) not necessary for long-term resource

29583 management;

29584 ``(D) designed in accordance with standards

29585 appropriate for the intended use of the road, taking

29586 into consideration--

29587 ``(i) safety;

29588 ``(ii) the cost of transportation; and

29589 ``(iii) impacts to land and resources; and

29590 ``(E) managed to minimize--

29591 ``(i) erosion; and

29592 ``(ii) the introduction or spread of invasive

29593 species.

29594

29595 ``(b) Categorical Exclusion.--

29596 ``(1) In general.--Not later than 1 year after the date of

29597 enactment of this section, the Secretary concerned shall develop

29598 a categorical exclusion (as defined in section 1508.4 of title

29599 40, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation)) for

29600 covered vegetation management activities carried out to protect,

29601 restore, or improve habitat for greater sage-grouse or mule

29602 deer.

29603 ``(2) Administration.--In developing and administering the

29604 categorical exclusion under paragraph (1), the Secretary

29605 concerned shall--

29606 ``(A) comply with the National Environmental Policy

29607 Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.);

29608 ``(B) with respect to National Forest System land,

29609 apply the extraordinary circumstances procedures under

29610 section 220.6 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations

29611 (or successor regulations), in determining whether to

29612 use the categorical exclusion;

29613 ``(C) with respect to public land, apply the

29614 extraordinary circumstances procedures under section

29615 46.215 of

29616

29617[[Page 132 STAT. 4851]]

29618

29619 title 43, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor

29620 regulations), in determining whether to use the

29621 categorical exclusion; and

29622 ``(D) consider--

29623 ``(i) the relative efficacy of landscape-scale

29624 habitat projects;

29625 ``(ii) the likelihood of continued declines in

29626 the populations of greater sage-grouse and mule

29627 deer in the absence of landscape-scale vegetation

29628 management; and

29629 ``(iii) the need for habitat restoration

29630 activities after wildfire or other natural

29631 disturbances.

29632

29633 ``(c) Implementation of Covered Vegetative Management Activities

29634Within the Range of Greater Sage-grouse and Mule Deer.--If the

29635categorical exclusion developed under subsection (b) is used to

29636implement a covered vegetative management activity in an area within the

29637range of both greater sage-grouse and mule deer, the covered vegetative

29638management activity shall protect, restore, or improve habitat

29639concurrently for both greater sage-grouse and mule deer.

29640 ``(d) Long-term Monitoring and Maintenance.--Before commencing any

29641covered vegetation management activity that is covered by the

29642categorical exclusion under subsection (b), the Secretary concerned

29643shall develop a long-term monitoring and maintenance plan, covering at

29644least the 20-year period beginning on the date of commencement, to

29645ensure that management of the treated area does not degrade the habitat

29646gains secured by the covered vegetation management activity.

29647 ``(e) Disposal of Vegetative Material.--Subject to applicable local

29648restrictions, any vegetative material resulting from a covered

29649vegetation management activity that is covered by the categorical

29650exclusion under subsection (b) may be--

29651 ``(1) used for--

29652 ``(A) fuel wood; or

29653 ``(B) other products; or

29654 ``(2) piled or burned, or both.

29655

29656 ``(f) Treatment for Temporary Roads.--

29657 ``(1) In general.--Notwithstanding subsection (a)(1)(B)(xi),

29658 any temporary road constructed in carrying out a covered

29659 vegetation management activity that is covered by the

29660 categorical exclusion under subsection (b)--

29661 ``(A) shall be used by the Secretary concerned for

29662 the covered vegetation management activity for not more

29663 than 2 years; and

29664 ``(B) shall be decommissioned by the Secretary

29665 concerned not later than 3 years after the earlier of

29666 the date on which--

29667 ``(i) the temporary road is no longer needed;

29668 and

29669 ``(ii) the project is completed.

29670 ``(2) Requirement.--A treatment under paragraph (1) shall

29671 include reestablishing native vegetative cover--

29672 ``(A) as soon as practicable; but

29673 ``(B) not later than 10 years after the date of

29674 completion of the applicable covered vegetation

29675 management activity.

29676

29677 ``(g) Limitations.--

29678

29679[[Page 132 STAT. 4852]]

29680

29681 ``(1) Project size.--A covered vegetation management

29682 activity that is covered by the categorical exclusion under

29683 subsection (b) may not exceed 4,500 acres.

29684 ``(2) Location.--A covered vegetation management activity

29685 carried out on National Forest System land that is covered by

29686 the categorical exclusion under subsection (b) shall be limited

29687 to areas designated under section 602(b), as of the date of

29688 enactment of this section.''.

29689

29690 (b) Conforming Amendments.--The table of contents for the Healthy

29691Forests Restoration Act of 2003 (16 U.S.C. 6501 note; Public Law 108-

29692148) is amended by adding at the end of the items relating to title VI

29693the following:

29694

29695``Sec. 602. Designation of treatment areas.

29696``Sec. 603. Administrative review.

29697``Sec. 604. Stewardship end result contracting projects.

29698``Sec. 605. Wildfire resilience projects.

29699``Sec. 606. Categorical exclusion for greater sage-grouse and mule deer

29700 habitat.''.

29701

29702 PART II--MISCELLANEOUS FOREST MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES

29703

29704SEC. 8621. ADDITIONAL AUTHORITY FOR SALE OR EXCHANGE OF SMALL

29705 PARCELS OF NATIONAL FOREST SYSTEM LAND.

29706

29707 (a) Increase in Maximum Value of Small Parcels.--Section 3 of Public

29708Law 97-465 (commonly known as the ``Small Tract Act of 1983'') (16

29709U.S.C. 521e) is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by

29710striking ``$150,000'' and inserting ``$500,000''.

29711 (b) Additional Conveyance Purposes.--Section 3 of Public Law 97-465

29712(16 U.S.C. 521e) (as amended by subsection (a)) is amended--

29713 (1) in paragraph (2), by striking ``; or'' and inserting a

29714 semicolon;

29715 (2) in paragraph (3), by striking the period at the end and

29716 inserting a semicolon; and

29717 (3) by adding at the end the following:

29718 ``(4) parcels of 40 acres or less that are determined by the

29719 Secretary--

29720 ``(A) to be physically isolated from other Federal

29721 land;

29722 ``(B) to be inaccessible; or

29723 ``(C) to have lost National Forest character;

29724 ``(5) parcels of 10 acres or less that are not eligible for

29725 conveyance under paragraph (2) but are encroached on by a

29726 permanent habitable improvement for which there is no evidence

29727 that the encroachment was intentional or negligent; or

29728 ``(6) parcels used as a cemetery (including a parcel of not

29729 more than 1 acre adjacent to the parcel used as a cemetery), a

29730 landfill, or a sewage treatment plant under a special use

29731 authorization issued or otherwise authorized by the

29732 Secretary.''.

29733

29734 (c) Disposition of Proceeds.--Section 2 of Public Law 97-465 (16

29735U.S.C. 521d) is amended--

29736 (1) in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking ``The

29737 Secretary is authorized'' and inserting the following:

29738

29739 ``(a) Conveyance Authority; Consideration.--The Secretary is

29740authorized'';

29741 (2) in paragraph (2), in the second sentence, by striking

29742 ``The Secretary shall insert'' and inserting the following:

29743

29744[[Page 132 STAT. 4853]]

29745

29746 ``(b) Inclusion of Terms, Covenants, Conditions, and Reservations.--

29747 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall insert'';

29748 (3) in subsection (b) (as so designated)--

29749 (A) by striking ``convenants'' and inserting

29750 ``covenants''; and

29751 (B) in the second sentence by striking ``The

29752 preceding sentence shall not'' and inserting the

29753 following:

29754 ``(2) Limitation.--Paragraph (1) shall not''; and

29755 (4) by adding at the end the following:

29756

29757 ``(c) Disposition of Proceeds.--

29758 ``(1) Deposit in sisk fund.--The net proceeds derived from

29759 any sale or exchange conducted under paragraph (4), (5), or (6)

29760 of section 3 shall be deposited in the fund established under

29761 Public Law 90-171 (commonly known as the `Sisk Act') (16 U.S.C.

29762 484a).

29763 ``(2) Use.--Amounts deposited under paragraph (1) shall be

29764 available to the Secretary until expended for--

29765 ``(A) the acquisition of land or interests in land

29766 for administrative sites for the National Forest System

29767 in the State from which the amounts were derived;

29768 ``(B) the acquisition of land or interests in land

29769 for inclusion in the National Forest System in that

29770 State, including land or interests in land that enhance

29771 opportunities for recreational access; or

29772 ``(C) the reimbursement of the Secretary for costs

29773 incurred in preparing a sale conducted under the

29774 authority of section 3 if the sale is a competitive

29775 sale.''.

29776SEC. 8622. FOREST SERVICE PARTICIPATION IN ACES PROGRAM.

29777

29778 Section 8302 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (16 U.S.C. 3851a) is

29779amended--

29780 (1) by striking ``The Secretary'' and inserting the

29781 following:

29782

29783 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary''; and

29784 (2) by adding at the end the following:

29785
