29786 ``(b) Termination of Effectiveness.--The authority provided to the

29787Secretary to carry out this section terminates effective October 1,

297882023.''.

29789SEC. 8623. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 580d note.&gt;&gt; AUTHORIZATION FOR LEASE OF

29790 FOREST SERVICE SITES.

29791

29792 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

29793 (1) Administrative site.--

29794 (A) In general.--The term ``administrative site''

29795 means--

29796 (i) any facility or improvement, including

29797 curtilage, that was acquired or is used

29798 specifically for purposes of administration of the

29799 National Forest System;

29800 (ii) any Federal land that--

29801 (I) is associated with a facility or

29802 improvement described in clause (i) that

29803 was acquired or is used specifically for

29804 purposes of administration of Forest

29805 Service activities; and

29806 (II) underlies or abuts the facility

29807 or improvement; and

29808 (iii) for each fiscal year, not more than 10

29809 isolated, undeveloped parcels of not more than 40

29810 acres each.

29811 (B) Exclusions.--The term ``administrative site''

29812 does not include--

29813

29814[[Page 132 STAT. 4854]]

29815

29816 (i) any land within a unit of the National

29817 Forest System that is exclusively designated for

29818 natural area or recreational purposes;

29819 (ii) any land within--

29820 (I) a component of the National

29821 Wilderness Preservation System;

29822 (II) a component of the National

29823 Wild and Scenic Rivers System; or

29824 (III) a National Monument; or

29825 (iii) any Federal land that the Secretary

29826 determines--

29827 (I) is needed for resource

29828 management purposes or to provide access

29829 to other land or water; or

29830 (II) would be in the public interest

29831 not to lease.

29832 (2) Facility or improvement.--The term ``facility or

29833 improvement'' includes--

29834 (A) a forest headquarters;

29835 (B) a ranger station;

29836 (C) a research station or laboratory;

29837 (D) a dwelling;

29838 (E) a warehouse;

29839 (F) a scaling station;

29840 (G) a fire-retardant mixing station;

29841 (H) a fire-lookout station;

29842 (I) a guard station;

29843 (J) a storage facility;

29844 (K) a telecommunication facility; and

29845 (L) any other administrative installation for

29846 conducting Forest Service activities.

29847 (3) Market analysis.--The term ``market analysis'' means the

29848 identification and study of the market for a particular economic

29849 good or service.

29850

29851 (b) Authorization.--The Secretary may lease an administrative site

29852that is under the jurisdiction of the Secretary in accordance with this

29853section.

29854 (c) Identification of Eligible Sites.--A regional forester, in

29855consultation with forest supervisors in the region, may submit to the

29856Secretary a recommendation for administrative sites in the region that

29857the regional forester considers eligible for leasing under this section.

29858 (d) Consultation With Local Government and Public Notice.--Before

29859making an administrative site available for lease under this section,

29860the Secretary shall--

29861 (1) consult with government officials of the community and

29862 of the State in which the administrative site is located; and

29863 (2) provide public notice of the proposed lease.

29864

29865 (e) Lease Requirements.--

29866 (1) Size.--An administrative site or compound of

29867 administrative sites under a single lease under this section may

29868 not exceed 40 acres.

29869 (2) Configuration of administrative sites.--

29870 (A) In general.--To facilitate the lease of an

29871 administrative site under this section, the Secretary

29872 may configure the administrative site--

29873

29874[[Page 132 STAT. 4855]]

29875

29876 (i) to maximize the marketability of the

29877 administrative site; and

29878 (ii) to achieve management objectives.

29879 (B) Separate treatment of facility or improvement.--

29880 A facility or improvement on an administrative site to

29881 be leased under this section may be severed from the

29882 land and leased under a separate lease under this

29883 section.

29884 (3) Consideration.--

29885 (A) In general.--A person to which a lease of an

29886 administrative site is made under this section shall

29887 provide to the Secretary consideration described in

29888 subparagraph (B) in an amount that is not less than the

29889 market value of the administrative site, as determined

29890 in accordance with subparagraph (C).

29891 (B) Form of consideration.--The consideration

29892 referred to in subparagraph (A) may be--

29893 (i) cash;

29894 (ii) in-kind, including--

29895 (I) the construction of new

29896 facilities or improvements, the title to

29897 which shall be transferred by the lessee

29898 to the Secretary;

29899 (II) the maintenance, repair,

29900 improvement, or restoration of existing

29901 facilities or improvements; and

29902 (III) other services relating to

29903 activities that occur on the

29904 administrative site, as determined by

29905 the Secretary; or

29906 (iii) any combination of the consideration

29907 described in clauses (i) and (ii).

29908 (C) Determination of market value.--

29909 (i) In general.--The Secretary shall determine

29910 the market value of an administrative site to be

29911 leased under this section--

29912 (I) by conducting an appraisal in

29913 accordance with--

29914 (aa) the Uniform Appraisal

29915 Standards for Federal Land

29916 Acquisitions established in

29917 accordance with the Uniform

29918 Relocation Assistance and Real

29919 Property Acquisition Policies

29920 Act of 1970 (42 U.S.C. 4601 et

29921 seq.); and

29922 (bb) the Uniform Standards

29923 of Professional Appraisal

29924 Practice; or

29925 (II) by competitive lease.

29926 (ii) In-kind consideration.--The Secretary

29927 shall determine the market value of any in-kind

29928 consideration under subparagraph (B)(ii).

29929 (4) Conditions.--The lease of an administrative site under

29930 this section shall be subject to such conditions, including

29931 bonding, as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.

29932 (5) Right of first refusal.--Subject to terms and conditions

29933 that the Secretary determines to be necessary, the Secretary

29934 shall offer to lease an administrative site to the municipality

29935 or county in which the administrative site is located before

29936 seeking to lease the administrative site to any other person.

29937

29938 (f) Relation to Other Laws.--

29939

29940[[Page 132 STAT. 4856]]

29941

29942 (1) Federal property disposal.--Chapter 5 of title 40,

29943 United States Code, shall not apply to the lease of an

29944 administrative site under this section.

29945 (2) Lead-based paint and asbestos abatement.--

29946 (A) In general.--Notwithstanding any provision of

29947 law relating to the mitigation or abatement of lead-

29948 based paint or asbestos-containing building materials,

29949 the Secretary shall not be required to mitigate or abate

29950 lead-based paint or asbestos-containing building

29951 materials with respect to an administrative site to be

29952 leased under this section.

29953 (B) Procedures.--With respect to an administrative

29954 site to be leased under this section that has lead-based

29955 paint or asbestos-containing building materials, the

29956 Secretary shall--

29957 (i) provide notice to the person to which the

29958 administrative site will be leased of the presence

29959 of the lead-based paint or asbestos-containing

29960 building material; and

29961 (ii) obtain written assurance from that person

29962 that the person will comply with applicable

29963 Federal, State, and local laws relating to the

29964 management of lead-based paint and asbestos-

29965 containing building materials.

29966 (3) Environmental review.--The National Environmental Policy

29967 Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) shall apply to the lease of

29968 an administrative site under this section, except that, in any

29969 environmental review or analysis required under that Act for the

29970 lease of an administrative site under this section, the

29971 Secretary shall be required only--

29972 (A) to analyze the most reasonably foreseeable use

29973 of the administrative site, as determined through a

29974 market analysis;

29975 (B) to determine whether to include any conditions

29976 under subsection (e)(4); and

29977 (C) to evaluate the alternative of not leasing the

29978 administrative site in accordance with the National

29979 Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et

29980 seq.).

29981 (4) Compliance with local laws.--A person that leases an

29982 administrative site under this section shall comply with all

29983 applicable State and local zoning laws, building codes, and

29984 permit requirements for any construction activities that occur

29985 on the administrative site.

29986

29987 (g) Prohibition.--No agency of the Federal Government shall make any

29988cash payments to a leaseholder relating to the use or occupancy of any

29989administrative site or facility that has been improved under this

29990section.

29991 (h) Congressional Notifications.--

29992 (1) Anticipated use of authority.--As part of the annual

29993 budget justification documents provided to the Committee on

29994 Appropriations of the House of Representatives and the Committee

29995 on Appropriations of the Senate, the Secretary shall include--

29996 (A) a list of the anticipated leases to be made,

29997 including the anticipated revenue that may be obtained,

29998 under this section;

29999

30000[[Page 132 STAT. 4857]]

30001

30002 (B) a description of the intended use of any revenue

30003 obtained under a lease under this section, including a

30004 list of any projects that cost more than $500,000; and

30005 (C) a description of accomplishments during previous

30006 years using the authority of the Secretary under this

30007 section.

30008 (2) Changes to lease list.--If the Secretary desires to

30009 lease an administrative site under this section that is not

30010 included on a list provided under paragraph (1)(A), the

30011 Secretary shall submit to the congressional committees described

30012 in paragraph (3) a notice of the proposed lease, including the

30013 anticipated revenue that may be obtained from the lease.

30014 (3) Use of authority.--Not less frequently than once each

30015 year, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on

30016 Agriculture, the Committee on Appropriations, and the Committee

30017 on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives and the

30018 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry, the Committee

30019 on Appropriations, and the Committee on Energy and Natural

30020 Resources of the Senate a report describing each lease made by

30021 the Secretary under this section during the period covered by

30022 the report.

30023

30024 (i) Expiration of Authority.--

30025 (1) In general.--The authority of the Secretary to make a

30026 lease of an administrative site under this section expires on

30027 October 1, 2023.

30028 (2) Effect on lease agreement.--Paragraph (1) shall not

30029 affect the authority of the Secretary to carry out this section

30030 in the case of any lease agreement that was entered into by the

30031 Secretary before October 1, 2023.

30032SEC. 8624. GOOD NEIGHBOR AUTHORITY.

30033

30034 (a) Inclusion of Indian Tribes.--Section 8206(a) of the Agricultural

30035Act of 2014 (16 U.S.C. 2113a(a)) is amended--

30036 (1) in paragraph (1)(A), by striking ``land and non-Federal

30037 land'' and inserting ``land, non-Federal land, and land owned by

30038 an Indian tribe'';

30039 (2) in paragraph (5), by inserting ``or Indian tribe'' after

30040 ``affected State'';

30041 (3) by redesignating paragraphs (6) through (8) as

30042 paragraphs (7) through (9), respectively; and

30043 (4) by inserting after paragraph (5) (as so redesignated)

30044 the following:

30045 ``(6) Indian tribe.--The term `Indian tribe' has the meaning

30046 given the term in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and

30047 Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304).''.

30048

30049 (b) Inclusion of Counties.--Section 8206 of the Agricultural Act of

300502014 (16 U.S.C. 2113a) is amended--

30051 (1) in subsection (a)--

30052 (A) in paragraph (1)(B), by inserting ``or county,

30053 as applicable,'' after ``Governor'';

30054 (B) by redesignating paragraphs (2) through (9) (as

30055 amended by subsection (a)) as paragraphs (3) through

30056 (10), respectively;

30057 (C) by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

30058 ``(2) County.--The term `county' means--

30059 ``(A) the appropriate executive official of an

30060 affected county; or

30061

30062[[Page 132 STAT. 4858]]

30063

30064 ``(B) in any case in which multiple counties are

30065 affected, the appropriate executive official of a

30066 compact of the affected counties.''; and

30067 (D) in paragraph (5) (as so redesignated), by

30068 inserting ``or county, as applicable,'' after

30069 ``Governor''; and

30070 (2) in subsection (b)--

30071 (A) in paragraph (1)(A), by inserting ``or county''

30072 after ``Governor'';

30073 (B) in paragraph (2)(A), by striking ``cooperative

30074 agreement or contract entered into under subsection

30075 (a)'' and inserting ``good neighbor agreement'';

30076 (C) in paragraph (3), by inserting ``or county''

30077 after ``Governor''; and

30078 (D) by adding at the end the following:

30079 ``(4) Receipts.--Notwithstanding any other provision of law,

30080 any payment made by a county to the Secretary under a project

30081 conducted under a good neighbor agreement shall not be

30082 considered to be monies received from National Forest System

30083 land or Bureau of Land Management land, as applicable.''.

30084

30085 (c) Treatment of Revenue From Timber Sale Contracts.--Section

300868206(b)(2) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (16 U.S.C. 2113a(b)(2)) is

30087amended by adding at the end the following:

30088 ``(C) Treatment of revenue.--

30089 ``(i) In general.--Funds received from the

30090 sale of timber by a Governor of a State under a

30091 good neighbor agreement shall be retained and used

30092 by the Governor--

30093 ``(I) to carry out authorized

30094 restoration services on Federal land

30095 under the good neighbor agreement; and

30096 ``(II) if there are funds remaining

30097 after carrying out subclause (I), to

30098 carry out authorized restoration

30099 services on Federal land within the

30100 State under other good neighbor

30101 agreements.

30102 ``(ii) Termination of effectiveness.--The

30103 authority provided by this subparagraph terminates

30104 effective October 1, 2023.''.

30105SEC. 8625. CHATTAHOOCHEE-OCONEE NATIONAL FOREST LAND ADJUSTMENT.

30106

30107 (a) Findings.--Congress finds that--

30108 (1) certain National Forest System land in the State of

30109 Georgia consists of isolated tracts that are inefficient to

30110 manage or have lost their principal value for National Forest

30111 purposes;

30112 (2) the disposal of that National Forest System land would

30113 be in the public interest; and

30114 (3) proceeds from the sale of National Forest System land

30115 under subsection (b)(1) would be used best by the Forest Service

30116 to purchase land for National Forest purposes in the State of

30117 Georgia.

30118

30119 (b) Land Conveyance Authority.--

30120 (1) In general.--Under such terms and conditions as the

30121 Secretary may prescribe, the Secretary may sell or exchange any

30122 or all rights, title, and interest of the United States in and

30123 to the National Forest System land described in paragraph

30124 (2)(A).

30125

30126[[Page 132 STAT. 4859]]

30127

30128 (2) Land authorized for disposal.--

30129 (A) In general.--The National Forest System land

30130 referred to in paragraph (1) is the 30 tracts of land

30131 totaling approximately 3,841 acres that are generally

30132 depicted on the 2 maps entitled ``Priority Land

30133 Adjustments, State of Georgia, U.S. Forest Service-

30134 Southern Region, Oconee and Chattahoochee National

30135 Forests, U.S. Congressional Districts-8, 9, 10 &amp; 14''

30136 and dated September 24, 2013.

30137 (B) Maps.--The maps described in subparagraph (A)

30138 shall be on file and available for public inspection in

30139 the Office of the Forest Supervisor, Chattahoochee-

30140 Oconee National Forest, until such time as the land is

30141 sold or exchanged.

30142 (C) Modification of boundaries.--The Secretary may

30143 modify the boundaries of the National Forest System land

30144 described in subparagraph (A) based on land management

30145 considerations.

30146 (3) Form of conveyance.--

30147 (A) Quitclaim deed.--The Secretary shall convey

30148 National Forest System land sold or exchanged under

30149 paragraph (1) by quitclaim deed.

30150 (B) Reservations.--The Secretary may reserve any

30151 rights-of-way or other rights or interests in National

30152 Forest System land sold or exchanged under paragraph (1)

30153 that the Secretary considers necessary for management

30154 purposes or to protect the public interest.

30155 (4) Valuation.--

30156 (A) Market value.--The Secretary may not sell or

30157 exchange National Forest System land under paragraph (1)

30158 for less than market value, as determined by appraisal

30159 or through competitive bid.

30160 (B) Appraisal requirements.--Any appraisal under

30161 subparagraph (A) shall be--

30162 (i) consistent with the Uniform Appraisal

30163 Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions or the

30164 Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal

30165 Practice; and

30166 (ii) subject to the approval of the Secretary.

30167 (5) Consideration.--

30168 (A) Cash.--Consideration for a sale of National

30169 Forest System land or equalization of an exchange under

30170 paragraph (1) shall be paid in cash.

30171 (B) Exchange.--Notwithstanding section 206(b) of the

30172 Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43

30173 U.S.C. 1716(b)), the Secretary may accept a cash

30174 equalization payment in excess of 25 percent of the

30175 value of any National Forest System land exchanged under

30176 paragraph (1).

30177 (6) Method of sale.--

30178 (A) Options.--The Secretary may sell National Forest

30179 System land under paragraph (1) at public or private

30180 sale, including competitive sale by auction, bid, or

30181 otherwise, in accordance with such terms, conditions,

30182 and procedures as the Secretary determines are in the

30183 best interest of the United States.

30184 (B) Solicitations.--The Secretary may--

30185

30186[[Page 132 STAT. 4860]]

30187

30188 (i) make public or private solicitations for

30189 the sale or exchange of National Forest System

30190 land under paragraph (1); and

30191 (ii) reject any offer that the Secretary

30192 determines is not adequate or not in the public

30193 interest.

30194 (7) Brokers.--The Secretary may--

30195 (A) use brokers or other third parties in the sale

30196 or exchange of National Forest System land under

30197 paragraph (1); and

30198 (B) from the proceeds of a sale, pay reasonable

30199 commissions or fees.

30200

30201 (c) Treatment of Proceeds.--

30202 (1) Deposit.--Subject to subsection (b)(7)(B), the Secretary

30203 shall deposit the proceeds of a sale or a cash equalization

30204 payment received from the sale or exchange of National Forest

30205 System land under subsection (b)(1) in the fund established

30206 under Public Law 90-171 (commonly known as the ``Sisk Act'') (16

30207 U.S.C. 484a).

30208 (2) Availability.--Subject to paragraph (3), amounts

30209 deposited under paragraph (1) shall be available to the

30210 Secretary until expended, without further appropriation, for the

30211 acquisition of land for National Forest purposes in the State of

30212 Georgia.

30213 (3) Private property protection.--Nothing in this section

30214 authorizes the use of funds deposited under paragraph (1) to be

30215 used to acquire land without the written consent of the owner of

30216 the land.

30217SEC. 8626. TENNESSEE WILDERNESS.

30218

30219 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

30220 (1) Map.--The term ``Map'' means the map entitled ``Proposed

30221 Wilderness Areas and Additions-Cherokee National Forest'' and

30222 dated January 20, 2010.

30223 (2) State.--The term ``State'' means the State of Tennessee.

30224

30225 (b) Additions to Cherokee National Forest.--

30226 (1) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 1132 note.&gt;&gt; Designation of

30227 wilderness.--In accordance with the Wilderness Act (16 U.S.C.

30228 1131 et seq.), the following parcels of Federal land in the

30229 Cherokee National Forest in the State are designated as

30230 wilderness and as additions to the National Wilderness

30231 Preservation System:

30232 (A) Certain land comprising approximately 9,038

30233 acres, as generally depicted as the ``Upper Bald River

30234 Wilderness'' on the Map and which shall be known as the

30235 ``Upper Bald River Wilderness''.

30236 (B) Certain land comprising approximately 348 acres,

30237 as generally depicted as the ``Big Frog Addition'' on

30238 the Map and which shall be incorporated in, and shall be

30239 considered to be a part of, the Big Frog Wilderness.

30240 (C) Certain land comprising approximately 630 acres,

30241 as generally depicted as the ``Little Frog Mountain

30242 Addition NW'' on the Map and which shall be incorporated

30243 in, and shall be considered to be a part of, the Little

30244 Frog Mountain Wilderness.

30245 (D) Certain land comprising approximately 336 acres,

30246 as generally depicted as the ``Little Frog Mountain

30247 Addition NE'' on the Map and which shall be incorporated

30248 in, and

30249

30250[[Page 132 STAT. 4861]]

30251

30252 shall be considered to be a part of, the Little Frog

30253 Mountain Wilderness.

30254 (E) Certain land comprising approximately 2,922

30255 acres, as generally depicted as the ``Sampson Mountain

30256 Addition'' on the Map and which shall be incorporated

30257 in, and shall be considered to be a part of, the Sampson

30258 Mountain Wilderness.

30259 (F) Certain land comprising approximately 4,446

30260 acres, as generally depicted as the ``Big Laurel Branch

30261 Addition'' on the Map and which shall be incorporated

30262 in, and shall be considered to be a part of, the Big

30263 Laurel Branch Wilderness.

30264 (G) Certain land comprising approximately 1,836

30265 acres, as generally depicted as the ``Joyce Kilmer-

30266 Slickrock Addition'' on the Map and which shall be

30267 incorporated in, and shall be considered to be a part

30268 of, the Joyce Kilmer-Slickrock Wilderness.

30269 (2) Maps and legal descriptions.--

30270 (A) In general.--As soon as practicable after the

30271 date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall file

30272 maps and legal descriptions of the wilderness areas

30273 designated by paragraph (1) with the appropriate

30274 committees of Congress.

30275 (B) Public availability.--The maps and legal

30276 descriptions filed under subparagraph (A) shall be on

30277 file and available for public inspection in the office

30278 of the Chief of the Forest Service and the office of the

30279 Supervisor of the Cherokee National Forest.

30280 (C) Force of law.--The maps and legal descriptions

30281 filed under subparagraph (A) shall have the same force

30282 and effect as if included in this Act, except that the

30283 Secretary may correct typographical errors in the maps

30284 and descriptions.

30285 (3) Administration.--

30286 (A) In general.--Subject to valid existing rights,

30287 the Federal land designated as wilderness by paragraph

30288 (1) shall be administered by the Secretary in accordance

30289 with the Wilderness Act (16 U.S.C. 1131 et seq.), except

30290 that any reference in that Act to the effective date of

30291 that Act shall be deemed to be a reference to the date

30292 of enactment of this Act.

30293 (B) Fish and wildlife management.--In accordance

30294 with section 4(d)(7) of the Wilderness Act (16 U.S.C.

30295 1133(d)(7)), nothing in this section affects the

30296 jurisdiction of the State with respect to fish and

30297 wildlife management, including the regulation of

30298 hunting, fishing, and trapping, in the wilderness areas

30299 designated by paragraph (1).

30300SEC. 8627. KISATCHIE NATIONAL FOREST LAND CONVEYANCE.

30301

30302 (a) Finding.--Congress finds that it is in the public interest to

30303authorize the conveyance of certain Federal land in the Kisatchie

30304National Forest in the State of Louisiana for market value

30305consideration.

30306 (b) Definitions.--In this section:

30307 (1) Collins camp properties.--The term ``Collins Camp

30308 Properties'' means Collins Camp Properties, Inc., a corporation

30309 incorporated under the laws of the State.

30310

30311[[Page 132 STAT. 4862]]

30312

30313 (2) State.--The term ``State'' means the State of Louisiana.

30314

30315 (c) Authorization of Conveyances, Kisatchie National Forest,

30316Louisiana.--

30317 (1) Authorization.--

30318 (A) In general.--Subject to valid existing rights

30319 and paragraph (2), the Secretary may convey the Federal

30320 land described in subparagraph (B) by quitclaim deed at

30321 public or private sale, including competitive sale by

30322 auction, bid, or other methods.

30323 (B) Description of land.--The Federal land referred

30324 to in subparagraph (A) consists of--

30325 (i) all Federal land within sec. 9, T. 10 N.,

30326 R. 5 W., Winn Parish, Louisiana; and

30327 (ii) a 2.16-acre parcel of Federal land

30328 located in the SW\1/4\ of sec. 4, T. 10 N., R. 5

30329 W., Winn Parish, Louisiana, as depicted on a

30330 certificate of survey dated March 7, 2007, by Glen

30331 L. Cannon, P.L.S. 4436.

30332 (2) First right of purchase.--Subject to valid existing

30333 rights and subsection (e), during the 1-year period beginning on

30334 the date of enactment of this Act, on the provision of

30335 consideration by the Collins Camp Properties to the Secretary,

30336 the Secretary shall convey, by quitclaim deed, to Collins Camp

30337 Properties all right, title, and interest of the United States

30338 in and to--

30339 (A) the not more than 47.92 acres of Federal land

30340 comprising the Collins Campsites within sec. 9, T. 10

30341 N., R. 5 W., in Winn Parish, Louisiana, as generally

30342 depicted on a certificate of survey dated February 28,

30343 2007, by Glen L. Cannon, P.L.S. 4436; and

30344 (B) the parcel of Federal land described in

30345 paragraph (1)(B)(ii).

30346 (3) Terms and conditions.--The Secretary may--

30347 (A) configure the Federal land to be conveyed under

30348 this section--

30349 (i) to maximize the marketability of the

30350 conveyance; or

30351 (ii) to achieve management objectives; and

30352 (B) establish any terms and conditions for the

30353 conveyances under this section that the Secretary

30354 determines to be in the public interest.

30355 (4) Consideration.--Consideration for a conveyance of

30356 Federal land under this section shall be--

30357 (A) in the form of cash; and

30358 (B) in an amount equal to the market value of the

30359 Federal land being conveyed, as determined under

30360 paragraph (5).

30361 (5) Market value.--The market value of the Federal land

30362 conveyed under this section shall be determined--

30363 (A) in the case of Federal land conveyed under

30364 paragraph (2), by an appraisal that is--

30365 (i) conducted in accordance with the Uniform

30366 Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions;

30367 and

30368 (ii) approved by the Secretary; or

30369 (B) if conveyed by a method other than the methods

30370 described in paragraph (2), by competitive sale.

30371 (6) Hazardous substances.--

30372

30373[[Page 132 STAT. 4863]]

30374

30375 (A) In general.--In any conveyance of Federal land

30376 under this section, the Secretary shall meet disclosure

30377 requirements for hazardous substances, but shall

30378 otherwise not be required to remediate or abate the

30379 substances.

30380 (B) Effect.--Except as provided in subparagraph (A),

30381 nothing in this subsection affects the application of

30382 the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation,

30383 and Liability Act of 1980 (42 U.S.C. 9601 et seq.) to

30384 the conveyances of Federal land.

30385

30386 (d) Proceeds From the Sale of Land.--The Secretary shall deposit the

30387proceeds of a conveyance of Federal land under subsection (c) in the

30388fund established under Public Law 90-171 (commonly known as the ``Sisk

30389Act'') (16 U.S.C. 484a).

30390 (e) Administration.--

30391 (1) Costs.--As a condition of a conveyance of Federal land

30392 to Collins Camp Properties under subsection (c), the Secretary

30393 shall require Collins Camp Properties to pay at closing--

30394 (A) reasonable appraisal costs; and

30395 (B) the cost of any administrative and environmental

30396 analyses required by law (including regulations).

30397 (2) Permits.--

30398 (A) In general.--An offer by Collins Camp Properties

30399 for the acquisition of the Federal land under subsection

30400 (c) shall be accompanied by a written statement from

30401 each holder of a Forest Service special use

30402 authorization with respect to the Federal land that

30403 specifies that the holder agrees to relinquish the

30404 special use authorization on the conveyance of the

30405 Federal land to Collins Camp Properties.

30406 (B) Special use authorizations.--If any holder of a

30407 special use authorization described in subparagraph (A)

30408 fails to provide a written authorization in accordance

30409 with that subparagraph, the Secretary shall require, as

30410 a condition of the conveyance, that Collins Camp

30411 Properties administer the special use authorization

30412 according to the terms of the special use authorization

30413 until the date on which the special use authorization

30414 expires.

30415SEC. 8628. PURCHASE OF NATURAL RESOURCES CONSERVATION SERVICE

30416 PROPERTY, RIVERSIDE COUNTY, CALIFORNIA.

30417

30418 (a) Findings.--Congress finds as follows:

30419 (1) Since 1935, the United States has owned a parcel of land

30420 in Riverside, California, consisting of approximately 8.75

30421 acres, more specifically described in subsection (b)(1) (in this

30422 section referred to as the ``property'').

30423 (2) The property is under the jurisdiction of the Department

30424 of Agriculture and has been variously used for research and

30425 plant materials purposes.

30426 (3) Since 1998, the property has been administered by the

30427 Natural Resources Conservation Service of the Department of

30428 Agriculture.

30429 (4) Since 2002, the property has been co-managed under a

30430 cooperative agreement between the Natural Resources Conservation

30431 Service and the Riverside Corona Resource Conservation District,

30432 which is a legal subdivision of the State of California under

30433 section 9003 of the California Public Resources Code.

30434

30435[[Page 132 STAT. 4864]]

30436

30437 (5) The Conservation District wishes to purchase the

30438 property and use it for conservation, environmental, and related

30439 educational purposes.

30440 (6) As provided in subsection (b), the purchase of the

30441 property by the Conservation District would promote the

30442 conservation education and related activities of the

30443 Conservation District and result in savings to the Federal

30444 Government.

30445

30446 (b) Land Purchase, Natural Resources Conservation Service Property,

30447Riverside County, California.--

30448 (1) Purchase authorized.--The Secretary shall sell and

30449 quitclaim to the Riverside Corona Resource Conservation District

30450 (in this section referred to as the ``Conservation District'')

30451 all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to a

30452 parcel of real property, including improvements thereon, that is

30453 located at 4500 Glenwood Drive in Riverside, California,

30454 consists of approximately 8.75 acres, and is administered by the

30455 Natural Resources Conservation Service of the Department of

30456 Agriculture. As necessary or desirable to facilitate the

30457 purchase of the property under this subsection, the Secretary or

30458 the Conservation District may survey all or portions of the

30459 property.

30460 (2) Consideration.--As consideration for the purchase of the

30461 property under this subsection, the Conservation District shall

30462 pay to the Secretary an amount equal to the appraised value of

30463 the property.

30464 (3) Prohibition on reservation of interest.--The Secretary

30465 shall not reserve any future interest in the property to be

30466 conveyed under this subsection, except such interest as may be

30467 acceptable to the Conservation District.

30468 (4) Hazardous substances.--Notwithstanding section 120(h) of

30469 the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and

30470 Liability Act of 1980 (42 U.S.C. 9620(h)) or the Solid Waste

30471 Disposal Act (42 U.S.C. 6901 et seq.), in the case of the

30472 property purchased by the Conservation District under this

30473 subsection, the Secretary shall be only required to meet the

30474 disclosure requirements for hazardous substances, pollutants, or

30475 contaminants, but shall otherwise not be required to remediate

30476 or abate any such releases of hazardous substances, pollutants,

30477 or contaminants, including petroleum and petroleum derivatives.

30478 (5) Cooperative authority.--

30479 (A) Leases, contracts, and cooperative agreements

30480 authorized.--In conjunction with, or in addition to, the

30481 purchase of the property by the Conservation District

30482 under this subsection, the Secretary may enter into

30483 leases, contracts and cooperative agreements with the

30484 Conservation District.

30485 (B) Sole source.--Notwithstanding sections 3105,

30486 3301, and 3303 to 3305 of title 41, United States Code,

30487 or any other provision of law, the Secretary may lease

30488 real property from the Conservation District on a

30489 noncompetitive basis.

30490 (C) Non-exclusive authority.--The authority provided

30491 by this subsection is in addition to any other authority

30492 of the Secretary.

30493

30494[[Page 132 STAT. 4865]]

30495

30496SEC. 8629. COLLABORATIVE FOREST LANDSCAPE RESTORATION PROGRAM.

30497

30498 (a) Waiver Authority.--Section 4003(d) of the Omnibus Public Land

30499Management Act of 2009 (16 U.S.C. 7303(d)) is amended by adding at the

30500end the following:

30501 ``(4) Waiver.--

30502 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B),

30503 after consulting with the advisory panel established

30504 under subsection (e), if the Secretary determines that a

30505 proposal that has been selected under paragraph (1) and

30506 is being carried out continues to meet the eligibility

30507 criteria established by subsection (b), the Secretary,

30508 on a case-by-case basis, may issue for the proposal a 1-

30509 time extension of the 10-year period requirement under

30510 paragraph (1)(B) of that subsection.

30511 ``(B) Limitation.--The extension described in

30512 subparagraph (A)--

30513 ``(i) shall be for the shortest period of time

30514 practicable to complete implementation of the

30515 proposal, as determined by the Secretary; and

30516 ``(ii) shall not exceed 10 years.''.

30517

30518 (b) Waiver Limitation.--Section 4003(f)(4) of the Omnibus Public

30519Land Management Act of 2009 (16 U.S.C. 7303(f)(4)) is amended by adding

30520at the end the following:

30521 ``(C) Exception.--The limitation described in

30522 subparagraph (B)(i) shall not apply to a proposal for

30523 which a 1-time extension is granted under subsection

30524 (d)(4).''.

30525

30526 (c) Reauthorization.--Section 4003(f)(6) of the Omnibus Public Land

30527Management Act of 2009 (16 U.S.C. 7303(f)(6)) is amended by striking

30528``$40,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009 through 2019'' and inserting

30529``$80,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023''.

30530 (d) Reporting Requirements.--Section 4003(h) of the Omnibus Public

30531Land Management Act of 2009 (16 U.S.C. 7303(h)) is amended--

30532 (1) in paragraph (3), by striking ``and'' after the

30533 semicolon;

30534 (2) in paragraph (4), by striking the period at the end and

30535 inserting ``; and'';

30536 (3) by redesignating paragraphs (3) and (4) as paragraphs

30537 (4) and (5), respectively;

30538 (4) by inserting after paragraph (2) the following:

30539 ``(3) the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

30540 of the Senate;''; and

30541 (5) by adding at the end the following:

30542 ``(6) the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

30543 Representatives.''.

30544SEC. 8630. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 43 USC 1772 note.&gt;&gt; UTILITY INFRASTRUCTURE

30545 RIGHTS-OF-WAY VEGETATION MANAGEMENT

30546 PILOT PROGRAM.

30547

30548 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

30549 (1) National forest system land.--

30550 (A) In general.--The term ``National Forest System

30551 land'' means land within the National Forest System, as

30552 defined in section 11(a) of the Forest and Rangeland

30553 Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974 (16 U.S.C.

30554 1609(a)).

30555

30556[[Page 132 STAT. 4866]]

30557

30558 (B) Exclusions.--The term ``National Forest System

30559 land'' does not include--

30560 (i) a National Grassland; or

30561 (ii) a land utilization project on land

30562 designated as a National Grassland and

30563 administered pursuant to sections 31, 32, and 33

30564 of the Bankhead-Jones Farm Tenant Act (7 U.S.C.

30565 1010, 1011, 1012).

30566 (2) Passing wildfire.--The term ``passing wildfire'' means a

30567 wildfire that originates outside of a right-of-way.

30568 (3) Pilot program.--The term ``pilot program'' means the

30569 pilot program established by the Secretary under subsection (b).

30570 (4) Right-of-way.--The term ``right-of-way'' means a special

30571 use authorization issued by the Forest Service allowing the

30572 placement of utility infrastructure.

30573 (5) Utility infrastructure.--The term ``utility

30574 infrastructure'' means electric transmission lines, natural gas

30575 infrastructure, or related structures.

30576

30577 (b) Establishment.--

30578 (1) In general.--To encourage owners or operators of rights-

30579 of-way on National Forest System land to partner with the Forest

30580 Service to voluntarily conduct vegetation management projects on

30581 a proactive basis to better protect utility infrastructure from

30582 potential passing wildfires, the Secretary may establish a

30583 limited, voluntary pilot program, in the manner described in

30584 this section, to conduct vegetation management projects on

30585 National Forest System land adjacent to those rights-of-way.

30586 (2) Application.--The pilot program shall not apply in a

30587 right-of-way described in paragraph (1).

30588

30589 (c) Eligible Participants.--

30590 (1) In general.--A participant in the pilot program shall be

30591 the owner or operator of a right-of-way on National Forest

30592 System land.

30593 (2) Selection priority.--In selecting participants for the

30594 pilot program, the Secretary shall give priority to an owner or

30595 operator of a right-of-way that has developed the utility

30596 infrastructure protection prescriptions of the owner or operator

30597 in coordination with Forest Service fire scientists or fire

30598 managers.

30599

30600 (d) Vegetation Management Projects.--

30601 (1) In general.--A vegetation management project conducted

30602 under the pilot program shall involve only limited vegetation

30603 management activities that--

30604 (A) shall create the least ground disturbance and

30605 least disturbance to wildlife reasonably necessary to

30606 protect utility infrastructure from passing wildfires

30607 based on applicable models, including Forest Service

30608 fuel models;

30609 (B) may include thinning and treatment of surface

30610 fuels, ladder fuels, and activity fuels to create or

30611 maintain shaded fuel breaks or other appropriate

30612 measures recommended by Forest Service fire scientists

30613 or fire managers;

30614 (C)(i) shall only be conducted on National Forest

30615 System land; and

30616 (ii) shall not--

30617

30618[[Page 132 STAT. 4867]]

30619

30620 (I) extend for more than 150 feet from the

30621 electric transmission line for which the

30622 applicable participant has a right-of-way; or

30623 (II) comprise an overall width, for both sides

30624 of that electric transmission line, that totals

30625 more than 200 feet; and

30626 (D) shall not be conducted on--

30627 (i) a component of the National Wilderness

30628 Preservation System;

30629 (ii) a designated wilderness study area;

30630 (iii) an inventoried roadless area; or

30631 (iv) Federal land on which, by Act of Congress

30632 or Presidential proclamation, the removal of

30633 vegetation is restricted or prohibited.

30634 (2) Approval.--Each vegetation management project described

30635 in paragraph (1) shall be subject to approval by the Forest

30636 Service in accordance with this section.

30637 (3) Fire prevention.--In carrying out a vegetation

30638 management project under the pilot program, a participant shall

30639 adhere to--

30640 (A) Forest Service regulations relating to spark

30641 arresting devices;

30642 (B) Forest Service regulations limiting and

30643 prohibiting certain activities conducted by contractors

30644 in an area, based on weather conditions and fire danger;

30645 (C) Forest Service regulations that apply to

30646 contractors removing vegetation on National Forest

30647 System land pursuant to a timber sale or stewardship

30648 contract, including regulations relating to--

30649 (i) protection of residual trees and timber

30650 damaged by contractors;

30651 (ii) protection measures needed for plants,

30652 animals, cultural resources, and cave resources;

30653 (iii) streamcourse protection and erosion

30654 control;

30655 (iv) fire plans, precautions, and

30656 precautionary periods;

30657 (v) fire suppression costs; and

30658 (vi) employment of eligible workers; and

30659 (D) State regulations relating to the prevention of

30660 wildfires and contractors removing vegetation.

30661 (4) Treatment of slash.--In carrying out a vegetation

30662 management project under the pilot program, a participant shall

30663 treat any activity fuels in a manner that--

30664 (A) is satisfactory to the Forest Service;

30665 (B) does not result in a fire hazard; and

30666 (C) reduces the risk of an insect or disease

30667 outbreak.

30668

30669 (e) Project Costs.--

30670 (1) In general.--Except as provided in paragraph (2) and

30671 subsection (f)(2), a participant in the pilot program shall be

30672 responsible for all costs, as determined by the Secretary,

30673 incurred in participating in the pilot program.

30674 (2) Federal funding.--The Secretary may contribute funds for

30675 a vegetation management project conducted under the pilot

30676 program if the Secretary determines that the contribution is in

30677 the public interest.

30678

30679 (f) Liability.--

30680

30681[[Page 132 STAT. 4868]]

30682

30683 (1) Activities within rights-of-way.--Participation in the

30684 pilot program shall not affect any legal obligations or

30685 liability standards that arise under the right-of-way for

30686 activities in the right-of-way.

30687 (2) Wildfires.--

30688 (A) Operations fires.--

30689 (i) In general.--With respect to fire

30690 suppression costs for a wildfire caused by the

30691 operations of a participant in the pilot program

30692 (other than an operation or activity of a

30693 participant described in subparagraph (B) or (C)),

30694 the participant shall reimburse the Forest Service

30695 for those costs, subject to a maximum dollar

30696 amount to which the Forest Service and the

30697 participant shall agree prior to the commencement

30698 of the project.

30699 (ii) Credit for actions by participants.--

30700 (I) In general.--If a participant in

30701 the pilot program provides actions,

30702 supplies, or equipment for use to

30703 suppress a wildfire described in clause

30704 (i) or at the request of the Forest

30705 Service, the cost of those actions,

30706 supplies, or equipment shall be credited

30707 toward the maximum dollar amount

30708 described in that clause.

30709 (II) Reimbursement.--If the actual

30710 cost of a participant described in

30711 subclause (I) exceeds the maximum dollar

30712 amount described in clause (i), the

30713 Forest Service shall reimburse the

30714 participant for the excess.

30715 (B) Negligent fires.--

30716 (i) In general.--Subject to clause (ii), if a

30717 wildfire is caused by the negligence of a

30718 participant in the pilot program, or an agent of

30719 the participant, including a wildfire caused by

30720 smoking by persons engaged in the operations of

30721 the participant, the participant shall bear the

30722 cost of damages to Forest Service resources and

30723 the fire suppression costs resulting from the

30724 wildfire.

30725 (ii) Limitation.--Except as provided in clause

30726 (iii), the costs borne by a participant under

30727 clause (i) shall not exceed $500,000.

30728 (iii) Failure to comply.--If the start or

30729 spread of a wildfire described in clause (i) is

30730 caused by the failure of the participant to comply

30731 with specific safety requirements expressly

30732 imposed by the Forest Service as a condition of

30733 conducting a vegetation management project under

30734 the pilot program or by this section, the

30735 participant shall bear the cost of damages to

30736 Forest Service resources and the fire suppression

30737 costs resulting from the wildfire.

30738 (C) Exceptions.--This paragraph shall not apply in

30739 the case of a wildfire caused by the felling of a tree

30740 by a participant in the pilot program, or an agent of

30741 the participant, onto an electric transmission line.

30742 (3) Effect.--Nothing in this subsection relieves a

30743 participant in the pilot program of any liabilities to which the

30744 participant is subject--

30745 (A) under State laws; or

30746

30747[[Page 132 STAT. 4869]]

30748

30749 (B) with regard to damages to property other than

30750 Forest Service property.

30751

30752 (g) Implementation.--

30753 (1) In general.--Except as provided in paragraph (3), the

30754 Secretary shall use the authority of the Secretary under other

30755 laws (including regulations) to carry out the pilot program.

30756 (2) Compliance with existing laws.--Except as provided in

30757 paragraph (3), a vegetation management project under the pilot

30758 program shall be--

30759 (A) consistent with the applicable land management

30760 plan for the area in which the project is located; and

30761 (B) carried out in accordance with all applicable

30762 laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act of

30763 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.).

30764 (3) Modification of regulations.--In order to implement the

30765 pilot program in an efficient and expeditious manner, the

30766 Secretary may waive or modify specific provisions of the Federal

30767 Acquisition Regulation, including waivers or modifications to

30768 allow for the formation of contracts or agreements on a

30769 noncompetitive basis.

30770

30771 (h) Treatment of Proceeds.--Notwithstanding any other provision of

30772law, the Secretary may--

30773 (1) retain any funds provided to the Forest Service by a

30774 participant in the pilot program; and

30775 (2) use funds retained under paragraph (1), in such amounts

30776 as may be appropriated, to carry out the pilot program.

30777

30778 (i) Report to Congress.--Not later than December 31, 2020, and 2

30779years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit a report describing the

30780status of the pilot program and vegetation management projects conducted

30781under the pilot program to--

30782 (1) the Committees on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

30783 and Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate; and

30784 (2) the Committees on Agriculture and Natural Resources of

30785 the House of Representatives.

30786

30787 (j) Duration.--The authority to carry out the pilot program,

30788including any vegetation management project conducted under the pilot

30789program, expires on October 1, 2023.

30790SEC. 8631. OKHISSA LAKE RURAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LAND

30791 CONVEYANCE.

30792

30793 (a) Definition of Alliance.--In this section, the term ``Alliance''

30794means the Scenic Rivers Development Alliance.

30795 (b) Request.--Subject to the requirements of this section, if the

30796Alliance submits a written request for conveyance by not later than 180

30797days after the date of enactment of this Act and the Secretary

30798determines that it is in the public interest to convey the National

30799Forest System Land described in subsection (c), the Secretary shall

30800convey to the Alliance all right, title, and interest of the United

30801States in and to the National Forest System land described in subsection

30802(c) by quitclaim deed through a public or private sale, including a

30803competitive sale by auction or bid.

30804 (c) Description of National Forest System Land.--

30805 (1) In general.--Subject to paragraph (2), the National

30806 Forest System land referred to in subsection (b) is the

30807 approximately 150 acres of real property located in sec. 6, T. 5

30808 N. R. 4 E., Franklin County, Mississippi, and further described

30809 as--

30810

30811[[Page 132 STAT. 4870]]

30812

30813 (A) the portion of the NW\1/4\ NW\1/4\ lying south

30814 of the south boundary of Berrytown Road;

30815 (B) the portion of the W\1/2\ NE\1/4\ NW\1/4\ lying

30816 south of the south boundary of Berrytown Road;

30817 (C) the portion of the SW\1/4\ NW\1/4\ lying east of

30818 the east boundary of U.S. Highway 98;

30819 (D) the W\1/2\ SE\1/4\ NW\1/4\;

30820 (E) the portion of the NW\1/4\ SW\1/4\ lying east of

30821 the east boundary of U.S. Highway 98;

30822 (F) the portion of the NE\1/4\ SW\1/4\ commencing at

30823 the southwest corner of the NE\1/4\ SW\1/4\, said point

30824 being the point of beginning, thence running east 330

30825 feet along the south boundary of the NE\1/4\ SW\1/4\ to

30826 a point in Lake Okhissa, thence running northeasterly to

30827 a point in Lake Okhissa on the east boundary of the

30828 NE\1/4\ SW\1/4\ 330 feet south of the northeast corner

30829 thereof, thence running north 330 feet along the east

30830 boundary of the NE\1/4\ SW\1/4\ to the northeast corner

30831 thereof, thence running west along the north boundary of

30832 the NE\1/4\ SW\1/4\ to the NW corner thereof; thence

30833 running south along the west boundary of the NE\1/4\

30834 SW\1/4\ to the point of beginning; and

30835 (G) the portion of the SE\1/4\ SE\1/4\ NW\1/4\

30836 commencing at the southeast corner of the SE\1/4\ NW\1/

30837 4\, said point being the point of beginning, and running

30838 northwesterly to the northwest corner of the SE\1/4\

30839 SE1\1/4\ NW\1/4\, thence running south along the west

30840 boundary of the SE\1/4\ SE\1/4\ NW\1/4\ to the southwest

30841 corner thereof, thence running east along the south

30842 boundary of the SE\1/4\ SE\1/4\ NW\1/4\ to the point of

30843 beginning.

30844 (2) Survey.--The exact acreage and legal description of the

30845 National Forest System land to be conveyed under this section

30846 shall be determined by a survey satisfactory to the Secretary.

30847

30848 (d) Consideration.--

30849 (1) In general.--The consideration for the conveyance of any

30850 National Forest System land under this section shall be--

30851 (A) provided in the form of cash; and

30852 (B) in an amount equal to the fair market value of

30853 the National Forest System land being conveyed, as

30854 determined under paragraph (2).

30855 (2) Fair market value determination.--The fair market value

30856 of the National Forest System land conveyed under this section

30857 shall be determined--

30858 (A) in the case of a method of conveyance described

30859 in subsection (b), by an appraisal that is--

30860 (i) conducted in accordance with the Uniform

30861 Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions;

30862 and

30863 (ii) approved by the Secretary; or

30864 (B) in the case of a conveyance by a method other

30865 than a method described in subsection (b), by

30866 competitive sale.

30867

30868 (e) Terms and Conditions.--The conveyance under this section shall

30869be subject to--

30870 (1) valid existing rights; and

30871

30872[[Page 132 STAT. 4871]]

30873

30874 (2) such other terms and conditions as the Secretary

30875 considers to be appropriate to protect the interests of the

30876 United States.

30877

30878 (f) Proceeds From Sale.--The Secretary shall deposit the proceeds of

30879the conveyance of any National Forest System land under this section in

30880the fund established under Public Law 90-171 (commonly known as the

30881``Sisk Act'') (16 U.S.C. 484a).

30882 (g) Costs.--As a condition for the conveyance under this section,

30883the Secretary shall require the Alliance to pay at closing--

30884 (1) any reasonable appraisal costs; and

30885 (2) the costs of any administrative or environmental

30886 analysis required by applicable law (including regulations).

30887SEC. 8632. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 1642 note.&gt;&gt; REMOTE SENSING

30888 TECHNOLOGIES.

30889

30890 The Chief of the Forest Service shall--

30891 (1) continue to find efficiencies in the operations of the

30892 forest inventory and analysis program under section 3(e) of the

30893 Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Research Act of 1978

30894 (16 U.S.C. 1642(e)) through the improved use and integration of

30895 advanced remote sensing technologies to provide estimates for

30896 State- and national-level inventories, where appropriate; and

30897 (2) partner with States and other interested stakeholders to

30898 carry out the program described in paragraph (1).

30899

30900 PART III--TIMBER INNOVATION

30901

30902SEC. 8641. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 7655c note.&gt;&gt; DEFINITIONS.

30903

30904 In this part:

30905 (1) Innovative wood product.--The term ``innovative wood

30906 product'' means a type of building component or system that uses

30907 large panelized wood construction, including mass timber.

30908 (2) Mass timber.--The term ``mass timber'' includes--

30909 (A) cross-laminated timber;

30910 (B) nail laminated timber;

30911 (C) glue laminated timber;

30912 (D) laminated strand lumber; and

30913 (E) laminated veneer lumber.

30914 (3) Secretary.--The term ``Secretary'' means the Secretary,

30915 acting through the Research and Development deputy area and the

30916 State and Private Forestry deputy area of the Forest Service.

30917 (4) Tall wood building.--The term ``tall wood building''

30918 means a building designed to be--

30919 (A) constructed with mass timber; and

30920 (B) more than 85 feet in height.

30921SEC. 8642. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 7655c.&gt;&gt; CLARIFICATION OF RESEARCH AND

30922 DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM FOR WOOD BUILDING

30923 CONSTRUCTION.

30924

30925 (a) In General.--The Secretary shall conduct performance-driven

30926research and development, education, and technical assistance for the

30927purpose of facilitating the use of innovative wood products in wood

30928building construction in the United States.

30929 (b) Activities.--In carrying out subsection (a), the Secretary

30930shall--

30931

30932[[Page 132 STAT. 4872]]

30933

30934 (1) after receipt of input and guidance from, and

30935 collaboration with, the wood products industry, conservation

30936 organizations, and institutions of higher education, conduct

30937 research and development, education, and technical assistance at

30938 the Forest Products Laboratory or through the State and Private

30939 Forestry deputy area that meets measurable performance goals for

30940 the achievement of the priorities described in subsection (c);

30941 and

30942 (2) after coordination and collaboration with the wood

30943 products industry and conservation organizations, make

30944 competitive grants to institutions of higher education to

30945 conduct research and development, education, and technical

30946 assistance that meets measurable performance goals for the

30947 achievement of the priorities described in subsection (c).

30948

30949 (c) Priorities.--The research and development, education, and

30950technical assistance conducted under subsection (a) shall give priority

30951to--

30952 (1) ways to improve the commercialization of innovative wood

30953 products;

30954 (2) analyzing the safety of tall wood building materials;

30955 (3) calculations by the Forest Products Laboratory of the

30956 lifecycle environmental footprint, from extraction of raw

30957 materials through the manufacturing process, of tall wood

30958 building construction;

30959 (4) analyzing methods to reduce the lifecycle environmental

30960 footprint of tall wood building construction;

30961 (5) analyzing the potential implications of the use of

30962 innovative wood products in building construction on wildlife;

30963 and

30964 (6) 1 or more other research areas identified by the

30965 Secretary, in consultation with conservation organizations,

30966 institutions of higher education, and the wood products

30967 industry.

30968

30969 (d) Timeframe.--To the maximum extent practicable, the measurable

30970performance goals for the research and development, education, and

30971technical assistance conducted under subsection (a) shall be achievable

30972within a 5-year timeframe.

30973SEC. 8643. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 7655d.&gt;&gt; WOOD INNOVATION GRANT PROGRAM.

30974

30975 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

30976 (1) Eligible entity.--The term ``eligible entity'' means--

30977 (A) an individual;

30978 (B) a public or private entity (including a center

30979 of excellence that consists of 1 or more partnerships

30980 between forestry, engineering, architecture, or business

30981 schools at 1 or more institutions of higher education);

30982 or

30983 (C) a State, local, or Tribal government.

30984 (2) Secretary.--The term ``Secretary'' means the Secretary,

30985 acting through the Chief of the Forest Service.

30986

30987 (b) Grant Program.--

30988 (1) In general.--The Secretary, in carrying out the wood

30989 innovation grant program of the Secretary described in the

30990 notice of the Secretary entitled ``Request for Proposals: 2016

30991 Wood Innovations Funding Opportunity'' (80 Fed. Reg. 63498

30992 (October 20, 2015)), may make a wood innovation grant to 1 or

30993 more eligible entities each year for the purpose of advancing

30994 the use of innovative wood products.

30995 (2) Proposals.--To be eligible to receive a grant under this

30996 subsection, an eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary

30997

30998[[Page 132 STAT. 4873]]

30999

31000 a proposal at such time, in such manner, and containing such

31001 information as the Secretary may require.

31002

31003 (c) Incentivizing Use of Existing Milling Capacity.--In selecting

31004among proposals of eligible entities under subsection (b)(2), the

31005Secretary shall give priority to proposals that include the use or

31006retrofitting (or both) of existing sawmill facilities located in

31007counties in which the average annual unemployment rate exceeded the

31008national average unemployment rate by more than 1 percent in the

31009previous calendar year.

31010 (d) Matching Requirement.--As a condition of receiving a grant under

31011subsection (b), an eligible entity shall provide funds equal to the

31012amount received by the eligible entity under the grant, to be derived

31013from non-Federal sources.

31014SEC. 8644. COMMUNITY WOOD ENERGY AND WOOD INNOVATION PROGRAM.

31015

31016 Section 9013 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002

31017(7 U.S.C. 8113) is amended to read as follows:

31018``SEC. 9013. COMMUNITY WOOD ENERGY AND WOOD INNOVATION PROGRAM.

31019

31020 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

31021 ``(1) Community wood energy system.--

31022 ``(A) In general.--The term `community wood energy

31023 system' means an energy system that--

31024 ``(i) produces thermal energy or combined

31025 thermal energy and electricity where thermal is

31026 the primary energy output;

31027 ``(ii) services public facilities owned or

31028 operated by State or local governments (including

31029 schools, town halls, libraries, and other public

31030 buildings) or private or nonprofit facilities

31031 (including commercial and business facilities,

31032 such as hospitals, office buildings, apartment

31033 buildings, and manufacturing and industrial

31034 buildings); and

31035 ``(iii) uses woody biomass, including

31036 residuals--

31037 ``(I) that have not been adulterated

31038 with glue or other chemical treatments

31039 from wood processing facilities, as the

31040 primary fuel; and

31041 ``(II) for which the use of that

31042 biomass for energy production does not

31043 cause conversion of forests to nonforest

31044 use.

31045 ``(B) Inclusions.--The term `community wood energy

31046 system' includes single-facility central heating,

31047 district heating systems serving multiple buildings,

31048 combined heat and electric systems where thermal energy

31049 is the primary energy output, and other related biomass

31050 energy systems.

31051 ``(2) Innovative wood product facility.--The term

31052 `innovative wood product facility' means a manufacturing or

31053 processing plant or mill that produces--

31054 ``(A) building components or systems that use large

31055 panelized wood construction, including mass timber;

31056 ``(B) wood products derived from nanotechnology or

31057 other new technology processes, as determined by the

31058 Secretary; or

31059 ``(C) other innovative wood products that use low-

31060 value, low-quality wood, as determined by the Secretary.

31061 ``(3) Mass timber.--The term `mass timber' includes--

31062

31063[[Page 132 STAT. 4874]]

31064

31065 ``(A) cross-laminated timber;

31066 ``(B) nail-laminated timber;

31067 ``(C) glue-laminated timber;

31068 ``(D) laminated strand lumber; and

31069 ``(E) laminated veneer lumber.

31070 ``(4) Program.--The term `Program' means the Community Wood

31071 Energy and Wood Innovation Program established under subsection

31072 (b).

31073

31074 ``(b) Competitive Grant Program.--The Secretary, acting through the

31075Chief of the Forest Service, shall establish a competitive grant program

31076to be known as the `Community Wood Energy and Wood Innovation Program'.

31077 ``(c) Matching Grants.--

31078 ``(1) In general.--Under the Program, the Secretary shall

31079 make grants to cover not more than 35 percent of the capital

31080 cost for installing a community wood energy system or building

31081 an innovative wood product facility.

31082 ``(2) Special circumstances.--The Secretary may establish

31083 special circumstances, such as in the case of a community wood

31084 energy system project or innovative wood product facility

31085 project involving a school or hospital in a low-income

31086 community, under which grants under the Program may cover up to

31087 50 percent of the capital cost.

31088 ``(3) Source of matching funds.--Matching funds required

31089 pursuant to this subsection from a grant recipient shall be

31090 derived from non-Federal funds.

31091

31092 ``(d) Project Cap.--The total amount of grants under the Program for

31093a community wood energy system project or innovative wood product

31094facility project may not exceed--

31095 ``(1) in the case of grants under the general authority

31096 provided under subsection (c)(1), $1,000,000; and

31097 ``(2) in the case of grants for which the special

31098 circumstances apply under subsection (c)(2), $1,500,000.

31099

31100 ``(e) Selection Criteria.--In selecting applicants for grants under

31101the Program, the Secretary shall consider the following:

31102 ``(1) The energy efficiency of the proposed community wood

31103 energy system or innovative wood product facility.

31104 ``(2) The cost effectiveness of the proposed community wood

31105 energy system or innovative wood product facility.

31106 ``(3) The extent to which the proposed community wood energy

31107 system or innovative wood product facility represents the best

31108 available commercial technology.

31109 ``(4) The extent to which the proposed community wood energy

31110 system uses the most stringent control technology that has been

31111 required or achieved in practice for a wood-fired boiler of

31112 similar size and type.

31113 ``(5)(A) The extent to which the proposed community wood

31114 energy system will displace conventional fossil fuel generation.

31115 ``(B) Whether the proposed community wood energy system

31116 minimizes emission increases to the greatest extent possible.

31117 ``(6) The extent to which the proposed community wood energy

31118 system will increase delivered thermal efficiency of the systems

31119 replaced.

31120 ``(7) The extent to which the applicant has demonstrated a

31121 high likelihood of project success by completing detailed

31122 engineering and design work in advance of the grant application.

31123

31124[[Page 132 STAT. 4875]]

31125

31126 ``(8) Other technical, economic, conservation, and

31127 environmental criteria that the Secretary considers appropriate.

31128

31129 ``(f) Grant Priorities.--In selecting applicants for grants under

31130the Program, the Secretary shall give priority to proposals that use the

31131most stringent control technology that has been required or achieved in

31132practice for a wood-fired boiler and--

31133 ``(1) would be carried out in a location where markets are

31134 needed for the low-value, low-quality wood;

31135 ``(2) would be carried out in a location with limited access

31136 to natural gas pipelines;

31137 ``(3) would include the use or retrofitting (or both) of

31138 existing sawmill facilities located in a location where the

31139 average annual unemployment rate exceeded the national average

31140 unemployment rate by more than 1 percent during the previous

31141 calendar year; or

31142 ``(4) would be carried out in a location where the project

31143 will aid with forest restoration.

31144

31145 ``(g) Limitations.--

31146 ``(1) Capacity of community wood energy systems.--A

31147 community wood energy system acquired with grant funds under the

31148 Program shall not exceed nameplate capacity of 5 megawatts of

31149 thermal energy or combined thermal and electric energy.

31150 ``(2) Funding for innovative wood product facilities.--Not

31151 more than 25 percent of funds provided as grants under the

31152 Program for a fiscal year may go to applicants proposing

31153 innovative wood product facilities, unless the Secretary has

31154 received an insufficient number of qualified proposals for

31155 community wood energy systems.

31156

31157 ``(h) Funding.--There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out

31158the Program $25,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.''.

31159

31160 Subtitle G--Other Matters

31161

31162SEC. 8701. RURAL REVITALIZATION TECHNOLOGIES.

31163

31164 Section 2371(d)(2) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade

31165Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6601(d)(2)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and

31166inserting ``2023''.

31167SEC. 8702. RESOURCE ADVISORY COMMITTEES.

31168

31169 Section 205 of the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-

31170Determination Act of 2000 (16 U.S.C. 7125) is amended--

31171 (1) in subsection (d)--

31172 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``Each'' and

31173 inserting ``Except as provided in paragraph (6), each'';

31174 (B) in paragraph (2), in the matter preceding

31175 subparagraph (A), by striking ``Committee'' and

31176 inserting ``Except as provided in paragraph (6),

31177 committee''; and

31178 (C) by adding at the end the following:

31179 ``(6) Committee composition waiver authority.--

31180 ``(A) Notice.--On notice from the applicable

31181 regional forester that an adequate number of qualified

31182 candidates are not interested or available to serve on a

31183 resource advisory committee, the Secretary concerned

31184 shall publish

31185

31186[[Page 132 STAT. 4876]]

31187

31188 a notice in the Federal Register seeking candidates for

31189 the resource advisory committee.

31190 ``(B) Modification of membership requirements.--If,

31191 by the date that is 30 days after the date of

31192 publication of notice under subparagraph (A), an

31193 inadequate number of qualified candidates have applied

31194 to serve on a resource advisory committee, the Secretary

31195 concerned may reduce--

31196 ``(i) the membership requirement under

31197 paragraph (1) to not fewer than 9; and

31198 ``(ii) the membership requirements under

31199 subparagraphs (A), (B), and (C) of paragraph (2)

31200 to 3 in each category described in that paragraph,

31201 except that where a vacancy exists on a resource

31202 advisory committee, the Secretary concerned may

31203 not reject a qualified applicant from any

31204 category.

31205 ``(C) Termination of authority.--The authority

31206 provided under this paragraph terminates on October 1,

31207 2023.''; and

31208 (2) by adding at the end the following:

31209

31210 ``(g) Regional Appointment Pilot Program.--

31211 ``(1) Definition of applicable designee.--In this

31212 subsection, the term `applicable designee' means the applicable

31213 regional forester.

31214 ``(2) Pilot program.--The Secretary concerned shall carry

31215 out a pilot program (referred to in this subsection as the

31216 `pilot program') to allow an applicable designee to appoint

31217 members of resource advisory committees.

31218 ``(3) Geographic limitation.--The pilot program shall only

31219 apply to resource advisory committees chartered in--

31220 ``(A) the State of Montana; and

31221 ``(B) the State of Arizona.

31222 ``(4) Responsibilities of applicable designee.--

31223 ``(A) Review.--Before appointing a member of a

31224 resource advisory committee under the pilot program, an

31225 applicable designee shall conduct the review and

31226 analysis that would otherwise be conducted for an

31227 appointment to a resource advisory committee if the

31228 pilot program was not in effect, including any review

31229 and analysis with respect to civil rights and budgetary

31230 requirements.

31231 ``(B) Savings clause.--Nothing in this subsection

31232 relieves an applicable designee from any requirement

31233 developed by the Secretary concerned for making an

31234 appointment to a resource advisory committee that is in

31235 effect on the date of enactment of this subsection,

31236 including any requirement for advertising a vacancy.

31237 ``(5) Termination of effectiveness.--The authority provided

31238 under this subsection terminates on October 1, 2023.

31239 ``(6) Report to congress.--Not later than the date that is

31240 180 days after the date described in paragraph (5), the

31241 Secretary concerned shall submit to Congress a report that

31242 includes--

31243 ``(A) with respect to appointments made under the

31244 pilot program compared to appointments to resource

31245 advisory committees not made under the pilot program, a

31246 description of the extent to which--

31247 ``(i) appointments were faster or slower; and

31248

31249[[Page 132 STAT. 4877]]

31250

31251 ``(ii) the requirements described in paragraph

31252 (4) differ; and

31253 ``(B) a recommendation with respect to whether

31254 Congress should terminate, continue, modify, or expand

31255 the pilot program.''.

31256SEC. 8703. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 25 USC 3115b.&gt;&gt; TRIBAL FOREST MANAGEMENT

31257 DEMONSTRATION PROJECT.

31258

31259 (a) In General.--The Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary may

31260carry out demonstration projects by which federally recognized Indian

31261Tribes or Tribal organizations may contract to perform administrative,

31262management, and other functions of programs of the Tribal Forest

31263Protection Act of 2004 (25 U.S.C. 3115a et seq.) through contracts

31264entered into under the Indian Self-Determination and Education

31265Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304 et seq.).

31266 (b) Requirements.--With respect to any contract or project carried

31267out under subsection (a)--

31268 (1) on National Forest System land, the Secretary shall

31269 carry out all functions delegated to the Secretary of the

31270 Interior under the Indian Self-Determination and Education

31271 Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304 et seq.);

31272 (2) the Secretary or the Secretary of the Interior, as

31273 applicable, shall make any decisions required to be made under--

31274 (A) the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969

31275 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.); and

31276 (B) the Tribal Forest Protection Act of 2004 (25

31277 U.S.C. 3115a et seq.); and

31278 (3) the contract or project shall be entered into under, and

31279 in accordance with, section 403(b)(2) of the Indian Self-

31280 Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C.

31281 5363(b)(2)).

31282SEC. 8704. TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS.

31285Act.--

31293 Act''.

31295 amendments made by paragraph (1) shall take effect as if enacted

31296 as part of the Wildfire Suppression Funding and Forest

31297 Management Activities Act (Public Law 115-141).

31300Act of 2014 (16 U.S.C. 2113a(a)) (as amended by section 8624(b)) is
