31309[[Page 132 STAT. 4878]]

31310

31311SEC. 8705. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 43 USC 1761a.&gt;&gt; STREAMLINING THE FOREST

31312 SERVICE PROCESS FOR CONSIDERATION OF

31313 COMMUNICATIONS FACILITY LOCATION

31314 APPLICATIONS.

31315

31316 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

31317 (1) Communications facility.--The term ``communications

31318 facility'' includes--

31319 (A) any infrastructure, including any transmitting

31320 device, tower, or support structure, and any equipment,

31321 switches, wiring, cabling, power sources, shelters, or

31322 cabinets, associated with the licensed or permitted

31323 unlicensed wireless or wireline transmission of

31324 writings, signs, signals, data, images, pictures, and

31325 sounds of all kinds; and

31326 (B) any antenna or apparatus that--

31327 (i) is designed for the purpose of emitting

31328 radio frequency;

31329 (ii) is designed to be operated, or is

31330 operating, from a fixed location pursuant to

31331 authorization by the Federal Communications

31332 Commission or is using duly authorized devices

31333 that do not require individual licenses; and

31334 (iii) is added to a tower, building, or other

31335 structure.

31336 (2) Communications site.--The term ``communications site''

31337 means an area of covered land designated for communications

31338 uses.

31339 (3) Communications use.--The term ``communications use''

31340 means the placement and operation of a communications facility.

31341 (4) Communications use authorization.--The term

31342 ``communications use authorization'' means an easement, right-

31343 of-way, lease, license, or other authorization to locate or

31344 modify a communications facility on covered land by the Forest

31345 Service for the primary purpose of authorizing the occupancy and

31346 use of the covered land for communications use.

31347 (5) Covered land.--The term ``covered land'' means National

31348 Forest System land.

31349 (6) Forest service.--The term ``Forest Service'' means the

31350 United States Forest Service of the Department of Agriculture.

31351 (7) Organizational unit.--The term ``organizational unit''

31352 means, within the Forest Service--

31353 (A) a regional office;

31354 (B) the headquarters;

31355 (C) a management unit; or

31356 (D) a ranger district office.

31357

31358 (b) Regulations.--Notwithstanding section 6409 of the Middle Class

31359Tax Relief and Job Creation Act of 2012 (47 U.S.C. 1455) or section 606

31360of the Repack Airwaves Yielding Better Access for Users of Modern

31361Services Act of 2018 (Public Law 115-141), not later than 1 year after

31362the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue

31363regulations--

31364 (1) to streamline the process for considering applications

31365 to locate or modify communications facilities on covered land;

31366 (2) to ensure, to the maximum extent practicable, that the

31367 process is uniform and standardized across the organizational

31368 units of the Forest Service; and

31369

31370[[Page 132 STAT. 4879]]

31371

31372 (3) to require that the applications described in paragraph

31373 (1) be considered and granted on a competitively neutral,

31374 technology neutral, and non-discriminatory basis.

31375

31376 (c) Requirements.--The regulations issued under subsection (b) shall

31377include the following:

31378 (1) Procedures for the tracking of applications described in

31379 subsection (b)(1), including--

31380 (A) identifying the number of applications--

31381 (i) received;

31382 (ii) approved; and

31383 (iii) denied;

31384 (B) in the case of an application that is denied,

31385 describing the reasons for the denial; and

31386 (C) describing the amount of time between the

31387 receipt of an application and the issuance of a final

31388 decision on an application.

31389 (2) Provision for minimum lease terms of not less than 15

31390 years for leases with respect to the location of communications

31391 facilities on covered land.

31392 (3) A structure of fees for--

31393 (A) submitting an application described in

31394 subsection (b)(1), based on the cost to the Forest

31395 Service of considering such an application; and

31396 (B) issuing communications use authorizations, based

31397 on the cost to the Forest Service of any maintenance or

31398 other activities required to be performed by the Forest

31399 Service as a result of the location or modification of

31400 the communications facility.

31401 (4) Provision for prioritization or streamlining of the

31402 consideration of applications to locate or modify communications

31403 facilities on covered land in a previously disturbed right-of-

31404 way.

31405

31406 (d) Additional Considerations.--In issuing regulations under

31407subsection (b), the Secretary shall consider--

31408 (1) how discrete reviews in considering an application

31409 described in subsection (b)(1) can be conducted simultaneously,

31410 rather than sequentially, by any organizational units of the

31411 Forest Service that must approve the location or modification;

31412 and

31413 (2) how to eliminate overlapping requirements among the

31414 organizational units of the Forest Service with respect to the

31415 location or modification of a communications facility on covered

31416 land administered by those organizational units.

31417

31418 (e) Communication of Streamlined Process to Organizational Units.--

31419The Secretary shall, with respect to the regulations issued under

31420subsection (b)--

31421 (1) communicate the regulations to the organizational units

31422 of the Forest Service; and

31423 (2) ensure that the organizational units of the Forest

31424 Service follow the regulations.

31425

31426 (f) Deposit and Availability of Fees.--

31427 (1) Special account.--The Secretary of the Treasury shall

31428 establish a special account in the Treasury for the Forest

31429 Service for the deposit of fees collected by the Forest Service

31430 under subsection (c)(3) for communications use authorizations on

31431 covered land granted, issued, or executed by the Forest Service.

31432

31433[[Page 132 STAT. 4880]]

31434

31435 (2) Requirements for fees collected.--Fees collected by the

31436 Forest Service under subsection (c)(3) shall be--

31437 (A) based on the costs described in subsection

31438 (c)(3); and

31439 (B) competitively neutral, technology neutral, and

31440 nondiscriminatory with respect to other users of the

31441 communications site.

31442 (3) Deposit of fees.--Fees collected by the Forest Service

31443 under subsection (c)(3) shall be deposited in the special

31444 account established for the Forest Service under paragraph (1).

31445 (4) Availability of fees.--Amounts deposited in the special

31446 account for the Forest Service shall be available, to the extent

31447 and in such amounts as are provided in advance in appropriation

31448 Acts, to the Secretary to cover costs incurred by the Forest

31449 Service described in subsection (c)(3), including the following:

31450 (A) Preparing needs assessments or other

31451 programmatic analyses necessary to designate

31452 communications sites and issue communications use

31453 authorizations.

31454 (B) Developing management plans for communications

31455 sites.

31456 (C) Training for management of communications sites.

31457 (D) Obtaining or improving access to communications

31458 sites.

31459 (5) No additional appropriations authorized.--Except as

31460 provided in paragraph (4), no other amounts are authorized to be

31461 appropriated to carry out this section.

31462

31463 (g) Savings Provisions.--

31464 (1) Real property authorities.--Nothing in this section, or

31465 the amendments made by this section, shall be construed as

31466 providing any executive agency with any new leasing or other

31467 real property authorities not existing prior to the date of

31468 enactment of this Act.

31469 (2) Effect on other laws.--Nothing in this section, or the

31470 amendments made by this section, and no actions taken pursuant

31471 to this section, or the amendments made by this section, shall

31472 impact a decision or determination by any executive agency to

31473 sell, dispose of, declare excess or surplus, lease, reuse, or

31474 redevelop any Federal real property pursuant to title 40, United

31475 States Code, the Federal Assets Sale and Transfer Act of 2016

31476 (40 U.S.C. 1303 note; Public Law 114-287), or any other law

31477 governing real property activities of the Federal Government. No

31478 agreement entered into pursuant to this section, or the

31479 amendments made by this section, may obligate the Federal

31480 Government to hold, control, or otherwise retain or use real

31481 property that may otherwise be deemed as excess, surplus, or

31482 that could otherwise be sold, leased, or redeveloped.

31483SEC. 8706. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 43 USC 1748d.&gt;&gt; REPORT ON WILDFIRE, INSECT

31484 INFESTATION, AND DISEASE PREVENTION ON

31485 FEDERAL LAND.

31486

31487 Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act

31488and every year thereafter, the Secretary and the Secretary of Interior

31489shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

31490Representatives, the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of

31491Representatives, the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

31492of the Senate, and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the

31493Senate a jointly written report on--

31494

31495[[Page 132 STAT. 4881]]

31496

31497 (1) the number of acres of Federal land treated by the

31498 Secretary or the Secretary of the Interior for wildfire, insect

31499 infestation, or disease prevention;

31500 (2) the number of acres of Federal land categorized as a

31501 high or extreme fire risk;

31502 (3) the total timber production from Federal land;

31503 (4) the number of acres and average fire intensity of

31504 wildfires affecting Federal land treated for wildfire, insect

31505 infestation, or disease prevention;

31506 (5) the number of acres and average fire intensity of

31507 wildfires affecting Federal land not treated for wildfire,

31508 insect infestation, or disease prevention;

31509 (6) the Federal response time for each fire on greater than

31510 25,000 acres;

31511 (7) the number of miles of roads and trails on Federal land

31512 in need of maintenance;

31513 (8) the number of miles of roads on Federal land in need of

31514 decommissioning;

31515 (9) the maintenance backlog, as of the date of the report,

31516 for roads, trails, and recreational facilities on Federal land;

31517 (10) other measures needed to maintain, improve, or restore

31518 water quality on Federal land; and

31519 (11) other measures needed to improve ecosystem function or

31520 resiliency on Federal land.

31521SEC. 8707. WEST FORK FIRE STATION.

31522

31523 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

31524 (1) County.--The term ``County'' means Dolores County,

31525 Colorado.

31526 (2) West fork fire station conveyance parcel.--The term

31527 ``West Fork Fire Station Conveyance Parcel'' means the parcel of

31528 approximately 3.61 acres of National Forest System land in the

31529 County, as depicted on the map entitled ``Map for West Fork Fire

31530 Station Conveyance Parcel'' and dated November 21, 2017.

31531

31532 (b) Conveyance of West Fork Fire Station Conveyance Parcel, Dolores

31533County, Colorado.--

31534 (1) In general.--On receipt of a request from the County and

31535 subject to such terms and conditions as are mutually

31536 satisfactory to the Secretary and the County, including such

31537 additional terms as the Secretary determines to be necessary,

31538 the Secretary shall convey to the County without consideration

31539 all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to

31540 the West Fork Fire Station Conveyance Parcel.

31541 (2) Costs.--Any costs relating to the conveyance under

31542 paragraph (1), including processing and transaction costs, shall

31543 be paid by the County.

31544 (3) Use of land.--The land conveyed to the County under

31545 paragraph (1) shall be used by the County only for a fire

31546 station, related infrastructure, and roads to facilitate access

31547 to and through the West Fork Fire Station Conveyance Parcel.

31548 (4) Reversion.--If any portion of the land conveyed under

31549 paragraph (1) is used in a manner that is inconsistent with the

31550 use described in paragraph (3), the land shall, at the

31551 discretion of the Secretary, revert to the United States.

31552

31553[[Page 132 STAT. 4882]]

31554

31555SEC. 8708. COMPETITIVE FORESTRY, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND

31556 ENVIRONMENTAL GRANTS PROGRAM.

31557

31558 Section 1232 of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act

31559of 1990 (16 U.S.C. 582a-8) is amended--

31560 (1) in subsection (a) by inserting ``or forest restoration''

31561 after ``research''; and

31562 (2) by amending subsection (c) to read as follows:

31563

31564 ``(c) Priorities.--

31565 ``(1) Research.--In awarding the initial grants under

31566 subsection (a) the Secretary shall give priority to applicants

31567 who will use such grants for research concerning--

31568 ``(A) the biology of forest organisms, including

31569 physiology, genetic mechanisms, and biotechnology;

31570 ``(B) ecosystem function and management, including

31571 forest ecosystem research, biodiversity, forest

31572 productivity, pest management, water resources, and

31573 alternative silvicultural systems;

31574 ``(C) wood as a raw material, including forest

31575 products and harvesting;

31576 ``(D) human forest interactions, including outdoor

31577 recreation, public policy formulation, economics,

31578 sociology, and administrative behavior;

31579 ``(E) international trade, competition, and

31580 cooperation related to forest products;

31581 ``(F) alternative native crops, products, and

31582 services that can be produced from renewable natural

31583 resources associated with privately held forest lands;

31584 ``(G) viable economic production and marketing

31585 systems for alternative natural resource products and

31586 services;

31587 ``(H) economic and environmental benefits of various

31588 conservation practices on forest lands;

31589 ``(I) genetic tree improvement; and

31590 ``(J) market expansion.

31591 ``(2) Forest restoration.--Grants may be used to support

31592 programs that restore forest tree species native to American

31593 forests that may have suffered severe levels of mortality caused

31594 by non-native insects, plant pathogens, or others pests.

31595 ``(A) Required component of forest restoration

31596 strategy.--To receive a grant under this subsection, an

31597 eligible institution shall demonstrate that it offers a

31598 program with a forest restoration strategy that

31599 incorporates not less than one of the following

31600 components:

31601 ``(i) Collection and conservation of native

31602 tree genetic material.

31603 ``(ii) Production of propagules of native

31604 trees in numbers large enough for landscape scale

31605 restoration.

31606 ``(iii) Site preparation of former of native

31607 tree habitat.

31608 ``(iv) Planting of native tree seedlings.

31609 ``(v) Post-planting maintenance of native

31610 trees.

31611 ``(B) Award of grants.--The Secretary shall award

31612 competitive grants under this subsection based on the

31613 degree to which the applicant addresses the following

31614 criteria:

31615 ``(i) Risk posed to the forests of that State

31616 by non-native pests, as measured by such factors

31617 as the number of such pests present in the State.

31618

31619[[Page 132 STAT. 4883]]

31620

31621 ``(ii) The proportion of the State's forest

31622 composed of species vulnerable to non-native pests

31623 present in the United States.

31624 ``(iii) The pests' rate of spread via natural

31625 or human-assisted means.''.

31626

31627 TITLE IX--ENERGY

31628

31629SEC. 9001. DEFINITIONS.

31630

31631 Section 9001 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002

31632(7 U.S.C. 8101) is amended--

31633 (1) in paragraph (4)(A), by striking ``agricultural

31634 materials'' and inserting ``agricultural materials, renewable

31635 chemicals,'';

31636 (2) in paragraph (7)(A), by striking ``into biofuels and

31637 biobased products; and'' and inserting the following: ``or an

31638 intermediate ingredient or feedstock of renewable biomass into

31639 any 1 or more, or a combination, of--

31640 ``(i) biofuels;

31641 ``(ii) renewable chemicals; or

31642 ``(iii) biobased products; and''; and

31643 (3) in paragraph (16)--

31644 (A) in subparagraph (A)--

31645 (i) in the matter preceding clause (i), by

31646 striking ``(B)'' and inserting ``(C)''; and

31647 (ii) by striking ``that--'' in the matter

31648 preceding clause (i) and all that follows through

31649 the period at the end of clause (ii) and inserting

31650 ``that produces usable energy from a renewable

31651 energy source.'';

31652 (B) by redesignating subparagraph (B) as

31653 subparagraph (C); and

31654 (C) by inserting after subparagraph (A) the

31655 following:

31656 ``(B) Inclusions.--The term `renewable energy

31657 system' includes--

31658 ``(i) distribution components necessary to

31659 move energy produced by a system described in

31660 subparagraph (A) to the initial point of sale; and

31661 ``(ii) other components and ancillary

31662 infrastructure of a system described in

31663 subparagraph (A), such as a storage system.''.

31664SEC. 9002. BIOBASED MARKETS PROGRAM.

31665

31666 Section 9002 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002

31667(7 U.S.C. 8102) is amended--

31668 (1) in subsection (b)(2)(A), by adding at the end the

31669 following:

31670 ``(iii) Renewable chemicals.--Not later than

31671 180 days after the date of enactment of this

31672 clause, the Secretary shall update the criteria

31673 issued under clause (i) to provide criteria for

31674 determining which renewable chemicals may qualify

31675 to receive the label under paragraph (1).'';

31676 (2) by amending subsection (f) to read as follows:

31677

31678 ``(f) Manufacturers of Renewable Chemicals and Biobased Products.--

31679

31680[[Page 132 STAT. 4884]]

31681

31682 ``(1) NAICS codes.--The Secretary and the Secretary of

31683 Commerce shall jointly develop North American Industry

31684 Classification System codes for--

31685 ``(A) renewable chemicals manufacturers; and

31686 ``(B) biobased products manufacturers.

31687 ``(2) National testing center registry.--The Secretary shall

31688 establish a national registry of testing centers for biobased

31689 products that will serve biobased product manufacturers.'';

31690 (3) by redesignating subsections (h) through (j) as

31691 subsections (j) through (l), respectively;

31692 (4) by inserting after subsection (g) the following:

31693

31694 ``(h) Streamlining.--

31695 ``(1) In general.--Not later than 1 year after the date of

31696 enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall establish

31697 guidelines for an integrated process under which biobased

31698 products may be, in 1 expedited approval process--

31699 ``(A) determined to be eligible for a Federal

31700 procurement preference under subsection (a); and

31701 ``(B) approved to use the `USDA Certified Biobased

31702 Product' label under subsection (b).

31703 ``(2) Initiation.--The Secretary shall ensure that a review

31704 of a biobased product under the integrated qualification process

31705 established pursuant to paragraph (1) may be initiated on

31706 receipt of a recommendation or petition from a manufacturer,

31707 vendor, or other interested party.

31708 ``(3) Product designations.--The Secretary may issue a

31709 product designation pursuant to subsection (a)(3)(B), or approve

31710 the use of the `USDA Certified Biobased Product' label under

31711 subsection (b), through streamlined procedures, which shall not

31712 be subject to chapter 7 of title 5, United States Code.

31713

31714 ``(i) Requirement of Procuring Agencies.--A procuring agency (as

31715defined in subsection (a)(1)) shall not establish regulations, guidance,

31716or criteria regarding the procurement of biobased products, pursuant to

31717this section or any other law, that impose limitations on that

31718procurement that are more restrictive than the limitations established

31719by the Secretary under the regulations to implement this section.'';

31720 (5) in subsection (k) (as so redesignated)--

31721 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``2018'' and

31722 inserting ``2023''; and

31723 (B) in paragraph (2), by striking ``$2,000,000 for

31724 each of fiscal years 2014 through 2018'' and inserting

31725 ``$3,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through

31726 2023''; and

31727 (6) by adding at the end the following:

31728

31729 ``(m) Rural Development Mission Area.--In carrying out this section,

31730except as provided in subsection (g), the Secretary shall act through

31731the rural development mission area.''.

31811SEC. 9007. RURAL ENERGY FOR AMERICA PROGRAM.

31812

31813 Section 9007 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002

31814(7 U.S.C. 8107) is amended--

31815 (1) in subsection (c)--

31816 (A) by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

31817 ``(1) In general.--

31818 ``(A) Assistance.--In addition to any similar

31819 authority, the Secretary shall provide--

31820 ``(i) loan guarantees and grants to

31821 agricultural producers and rural small

31822 businesses--

31823 ``(I) to purchase renewable energy

31824 systems, including systems that may be

31825 used to produce and sell electricity;

31826 and

31827 ``(II) to make energy efficiency

31828 improvements; and

31829 ``(ii) loan guarantees to agricultural

31830 producers to purchase and install energy efficient

31831 equipment or systems for agricultural production

31832 or processing that exceed--

31833 ``(I) energy efficiency building

31834 codes, if applicable;

31835 ``(II) Federal or State energy

31836 efficiency standards, if applicable; and

31837 ``(III) other energy efficiency

31838 standards determined appropriate by the

31839 Secretary.

31840 ``(B) Limitations.--With respect to loan guarantees

31841 under subparagraph (A)(ii)--

31842 ``(i) if no codes or standards described in

31843 such subparagraph apply to the energy efficient

31844 equipment or system to be purchased or installed

31845 pursuant to such subparagraph, the Secretary shall

31846 require, to the maximum extent practicable, such

31847 equipment or system to meet the same efficiency

31848 measurements as the most efficient available

31849 equipment or system in the market; and

31850 ``(ii) the Secretary shall not provide such a

31851 loan guarantee for the purchase or installation of

31852 any energy efficient equipment or system unless

31853 more than one type of such equipment or system is

31854 available in the market.''; and

31855 (B) in paragraph (3), by adding at the end the

31856 following:

31857 ``(D) Loan guarantees for energy efficient equipment

31858 to agricultural producers.--Using funds made available

31859 under paragraphs (1) and (3) of subsection (f), in each

31860 fiscal year the Secretary may use for loan guarantees

31861 under paragraph (1)(A)(ii) an amount that does not

31862 exceed 15 percent of such funds.'';

31863 (2) in subsection (e), by striking ``subsection (g)'' each

31864 place it appears and inserting ``subsection (f)'';

31865 (3) by striking subsection (f) and redesignating subsection

31866 (g) as subsection (f); and

31867 (4) in subsection (f)(3) (as so redesignated), by striking

31868 ``2014 through 2018'' and inserting ``2019 through 2023''.

31912SEC. 9011. CARBON UTILIZATION AND BIOGAS EDUCATION PROGRAM.

31913

31914 Title IX of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7

31915U.S.C. 8101 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

31916``SEC. 9014. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 8115.&gt;&gt; CARBON UTILIZATION AND BIOGAS

31917 EDUCATION PROGRAM.

31918

31919 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

31920 ``(1) Carbon dioxide.--The term `carbon dioxide' means

31921 carbon dioxide that is produced as a byproduct of the production

31922 of a biobased product.

31923 ``(2) Eligible entity.--The term `eligible entity' means an

31924 entity that--

31925 ``(A) is--

31926 ``(i) an organization described in section

31927 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and

31928 exempt from taxation under section 501(a) of that

31929 Code; or

31930 ``(ii) an institution of higher education (as

31931 defined in section 101(a) of the Higher Education

31932 Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001(a)));

31933 ``(B) has demonstrated knowledge about--

31934 ``(i) sequestration and utilization of carbon

31935 dioxide; or

31936 ``(ii) aggregation of organic waste from

31937 multiple sources into a single biogas system; and

31938

31939[[Page 132 STAT. 4888]]

31940

31941 ``(C) has a demonstrated ability to conduct

31942 educational and technical support programs.

31943

31944 ``(b) Establishment.--The Secretary, in consultation with the

31945Secretary of Energy, shall make competitive grants to eligible

31946entities--

31947 ``(1) to provide education to the public about the economic

31948 and emissions benefits of permanent sequestration or utilization

31949 of carbon dioxide with a primary objective of providing benefits

31950 and opportunities for rural businesses, rural communities, and

31951 utilities serving rural communities; or

31952 ``(2) to provide education to agricultural producers and

31953 other stakeholders about opportunities for aggregation of

31954 organic waste from multiple sources into a single biogas system.

31955

31956 ``(c) Funding.--There are authorized to be appropriated for each of

31957fiscal years 2019 through 2023--

31958 ``(1) $1,000,000 to carry out subsection (b)(1); and

31959 ``(2) $1,000,000 to carry out subsection (b)(2).''.

31960

31961 TITLE X--HORTICULTURE

31962

31963SEC. 10101. SPECIALTY CROPS MARKET NEWS ALLOCATION.

31964

31965 Section 10107(b) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008

31966(7 U.S.C. 1622b(b)) is amended by striking ``2018'' and inserting

31967``2023''.

31968SEC. 10102. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1627c note.&gt;&gt; LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET

31969 PROGRAM.

31970

31971 (a) Purpose.--The purpose of this section is to combine the purposes

31972and coordinate the functions, as in effect on the day before the date of

31973enactment of this Act, of--

31974 (1) the Farmers' Market and Local Food Promotion Program

31975 established under section 6 of the Farmer-to-Consumer Direct

31976 Marketing Act of 1976 (7 U.S.C. 3005); and

31977 (2) the value-added agricultural product market development

31978 grants under section 231(b) of the Agricultural Risk Protection

31979 Act of 2000 (7 U.S.C. 1632a(b)).

31980

31981 (b) Local Agriculture Market Program.--Subtitle A of the

31982Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1621 et seq.) is amended by

31983adding at the end the following:

31984``SEC. 210A. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1627c.&gt;&gt; LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET

31985 PROGRAM.

31986

31987 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

31988 ``(1) Beginning farmer or rancher.--The term `beginning

31989 farmer or rancher' has the meaning given the term in section

31990 343(a) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7

31991 U.S.C. 1991(a)).

31992 ``(2) Direct producer-to-consumer marketing.--The term

31993 `direct producer-to-consumer marketing' has the meaning given

31994 the term `direct marketing from farmers to consumers' in section

31995 3 of the Farmer-to-Consumer Direct Marketing Act of 1976 (7

31996 U.S.C. 3002).

31997 ``(3) Family farm.--The term `family farm' has the meaning

31998 given the term in section 231(a) of the Agricultural Risk

31999 Protection Act of 2000 (7 U.S.C. 1632a(a)).

32000 ``(4) Food council.--The term `food council' means a food

32001 policy council or food and farm system network, as determined by

32002 the Secretary, that--

32003 ``(A) represents--

32004

32005[[Page 132 STAT. 4889]]

32006

32007 ``(i) multiple organizations involved in the

32008 production, processing, and consumption of food;

32009 and

32010 ``(ii) local, Tribal, or State governments;

32011 and

32012 ``(B) addresses food and farm-related issues and

32013 needs within city, county, State, Tribal region,

32014 multicounty region, or other region designated by the

32015 food council or food system network.

32016 ``(5) Majority-controlled producer-based business venture.--

32017 ``(A) In general.--The term `majority-controlled

32018 producer-based business venture' means a venture greater

32019 than 50 percent of the ownership and control of which is

32020 held by--

32021 ``(i) 1 or more producers; or

32022 ``(ii) 1 or more entities, 100 percent of the

32023 ownership and control of which is held by 1 or

32024 more producers.

32025 ``(B) Entity described.--For purposes of

32026 subparagraph (A), the term `entity' means--

32027 ``(i) a partnership;

32028 ``(ii) a limited liability corporation;

32029 ``(iii) a limited liability partnership; and

32030 ``(iv) a corporation.

32031 ``(6) Mid-tier value chain.--The term `mid-tier value chain'

32032 means a local or regional supply network that links independent

32033 producers with businesses and cooperatives that market value-

32034 added agricultural products in a manner that--

32035 ``(A) targets and strengthens the profitability and

32036 competitiveness of small and medium-sized farms and

32037 ranches that are structured as a family farm; and

32038 ``(B) obtains agreement from an eligible

32039 agricultural producer group, farmer or rancher

32040 cooperative, or majority-controlled producer-based

32041 business venture that is engaged in the value chain on a

32042 marketing strategy.

32043 ``(7) Partnership.--The term `partnership' means a

32044 partnership entered into under an agreement between--

32045 ``(A) 1 or more eligible partners (as defined in

32046 subsection (e)(1)); and

32047 ``(B) 1 or more eligible entities (as defined in

32048 subsection (e)(1)).

32049 ``(8) Program.--The term `Program' means the Local

32050 Agriculture Market Program established under subsection (b).

32051 ``(9) Regional food chain coordination.--The term `regional

32052 food chain coordination' means coordination and collaboration

32053 along the supply chain to increase connections between producers

32054 and markets.

32055 ``(10) Secretary.--The term `Secretary' means the Secretary

32056 of Agriculture.

32057 ``(11) Socially disadvantaged farmer or rancher.--The term

32058 `socially disadvantaged farmer or rancher' has the meaning given

32059 the term in section 355(e) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural

32060 Development Act (7 U.S.C. 2003(e)).

32061 ``(12) Value-added agricultural product.--The term `value-

32062 added agricultural product' means any agricultural commodity or

32063 product that--

32064 ``(A)(i) has undergone a change in physical state;

32065

32066[[Page 132 STAT. 4890]]

32067

32068 ``(ii) was produced in a manner that enhances the

32069 value of the agricultural commodity or product, as

32070 demonstrated through a business plan that shows the

32071 enhanced value, as determined by the Secretary;

32072 ``(iii) is physically segregated in a manner that

32073 results in the enhancement of the value of the

32074 agricultural commodity or product;

32075 ``(iv) is a source of farm- or ranch-based renewable

32076 energy, including E-85 fuel; or

32077 ``(v) is aggregated and marketed as a locally

32078 produced agricultural food product; and

32079 ``(B) as a result of the change in physical state or

32080 the manner in which the agricultural commodity or

32081 product was produced, marketed, or segregated--

32082 ``(i) the customer base for the agricultural

32083 commodity or product is expanded; and

32084 ``(ii) a greater portion of the revenue

32085 derived from the marketing, processing, or

32086 physical segregation of the agricultural commodity

32087 or product is available to the producer of the

32088 commodity or product.

32089 ``(13) Veteran farmer or rancher.--The term `veteran farmer

32090 or rancher' has the meaning given the term in section 2501(a) of

32091 the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7

32092 U.S.C. 2279(a)).

32093

32094 ``(b) Establishment and Purpose.--The Secretary shall establish a

32095program, to be known as the `Local Agriculture Market Program', that--

32096 ``(1) supports the development, coordination, and expansion

32097 of--

32098 ``(A) direct producer-to-consumer marketing;

32099 ``(B) local and regional food markets and

32100 enterprises; and

32101 ``(C) value-added agricultural products;

32102 ``(2) connects and cultivates regional food economies

32103 through public-private partnerships;

32104 ``(3) supports the development of business plans,

32105 feasibility studies, and strategies for value-added agricultural

32106 production and local and regional food system infrastructure;

32107 ``(4) strengthens capacity and regional food system

32108 development through community collaboration and expansion of

32109 mid-tier value chains;

32110 ``(5) improves income and economic opportunities for

32111 producers and food businesses through job creation; and

32112 ``(6) simplifies the application processes and the reporting

32113 processes for the Program.

32114

32115 ``(c) Administration.--In administering the Program, the Secretary

32116shall--

32117 ``(1) streamline the Program to better support the

32118 activities carried out by the recipient of a grant under the

32119 Program;

32120 ``(2) connect producers with local food markets and value-

32121 added agricultural product opportunities;

32122 ``(3) partner with cooperative extension services, as

32123 appropriate, to provide Program technical assistance and

32124 outreach to Program stakeholders; and

32125 ``(4) ensure that the Rural Business-Cooperative Service and

32126 Agricultural Marketing Service provide Program technical

32127 assistance and outreach to Program stakeholders.

32128

32129[[Page 132 STAT. 4891]]

32130

32131 ``(d) Grants.--

32132 ``(1) In general.--Under the Program, the Secretary may,

32133 using funds made available under subsection (i), provide grants

32134 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023, in accordance with

32135 the purposes of the Program described in subsection (b), for the

32136 conduct of activities described in paragraph (2).

32137 ``(2) Eligible activities.--The recipient of a grant may use

32138 a grant provided under paragraph (1)--

32139 ``(A) to support and promote--

32140 ``(i) domestic direct producer-to-consumer

32141 marketing;

32142 ``(ii) farmers' markets;

32143 ``(iii) roadside stands;

32144 ``(iv) agritourism activities,

32145 ``(v) community-supported agriculture

32146 programs; or

32147 ``(vi) online sales;

32148 ``(B) to support local and regional food business

32149 enterprises that engage as intermediaries in indirect

32150 producer-to-consumer marketing;

32151 ``(C) to support the processing, aggregation,

32152 distribution, and storage of--

32153 ``(i) local and regional food products that

32154 are marketed locally or regionally; and

32155 ``(ii) value-added agricultural products;

32156 ``(D) to encourage the development of value-added

32157 agricultural products;

32158 ``(E) to assist with business development plans and

32159 feasibility studies;

32160 ``(F) to develop marketing strategies for producers

32161 of local food products and value-added agricultural

32162 products in new and existing markets;

32163 ``(G) to facilitate regional food chain coordination

32164 and mid-tier value chain development;

32165 ``(H) to promote new business opportunities and

32166 marketing strategies to reduce on-farm food waste;

32167 ``(I) to respond to changing technology needs in

32168 direct producer-to-consumer marketing; or

32169 ``(J) to cover expenses relating to costs incurred

32170 in--

32171 ``(i) obtaining food safety certification; and

32172 ``(ii) making changes and upgrades to

32173 practices and equipment to improve food safety.

32174 ``(3) Criteria and guidelines.--

32175 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall establish

32176 criteria and guidelines for the submission, evaluation,

32177 and funding of proposed projects under paragraph (1) as

32178 the Secretary determines are appropriate.

32179 ``(B) Producer or food business benefits.--

32180 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

32181 clause (ii), an application submitted for a grant

32182 under paragraph (1) shall include a description of

32183 the direct or indirect producer or food business

32184 benefits intended by the applicant to result from

32185 the proposed project within a reasonable period of

32186 time after the receipt of the grant.

32187 ``(ii) Exception.--Clause (i) shall not apply

32188 to a planning or feasibility project.

32189

32190[[Page 132 STAT. 4892]]

32191

32192 ``(4) Amount.--Unless otherwise determined by the Secretary,

32193 the amount of a grant under this subsection shall be not more

32194 than $500,000.

32195 ``(5) Value-added producer grants.--In the case of a grant

32196 provided under paragraph (1) to an eligible entity described in

32197 subparagraph (B), the following shall apply:

32198 ``(A) Administration.--The Secretary shall carry out

32199 this subsection through the Administrator of the Rural

32200 Business-Cooperative Service, in coordination with the

32201 Administrator of the Agricultural Marketing Service.

32202 ``(B) Eligible entities.--An entity shall be

32203 eligible for a grant under this paragraph if the entity

32204 is--

32205 ``(i) an independent producer (as determined

32206 by the Secretary) of a value-added agricultural

32207 product; or

32208 ``(ii) an agricultural producer group, farmer

32209 or rancher cooperative, or majority-controlled

32210 producer-based business venture (as determined by

32211 the Secretary).

32212 ``(C) Priorities.--The Secretary shall give priority

32213 to applications--

32214 ``(i) in the case of an application submitted

32215 by a producer, that are submitted by, or serve--

32216 ``(I) beginning farmers or ranchers;

32217 ``(II) socially disadvantaged

32218 farmers or ranchers;

32219 ``(III) operators of small or medium

32220 sized farms or ranches that are

32221 structured as family farms; or

32222 ``(IV) veteran farmers or ranchers;

32223 and

32224 ``(ii) in the case of an application submitted

32225 by an eligible entity described in subparagraph

32226 (B)(ii), that provide the greatest contribution to

32227 creating or increasing marketing opportunities for

32228 producers described in subclauses (I) through (IV)

32229 of clause (i).

32230 ``(D) Limitation on use of funds.--

32231 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

32232 clause (ii), an eligible entity described in

32233 subparagraph (B) may not use a grant for the

32234 purchase or construction of a building, general

32235 purpose equipment, or structure.

32236 ``(ii) Exception.--An eligible entity

32237 described in subparagraph (B) may use not more

32238 than $6,500 of the amount of a grant for an

32239 eligible activity described in paragraph (2)(J) to

32240 purchase or upgrade equipment to improve food

32241 safety.

32242 ``(E) Matching funds.--An eligible entity described

32243 in subparagraph (B) receiving a grant shall contribute

32244 an amount of non-Federal funds that is at least equal to

32245 the amount of Federal funds received.

32246 ``(6) Farmers' markets and local food promotion program.--In

32247 the case of a grant provided under paragraph (1) to an eligible

32248 entity described in subparagraph (B), the following shall apply:

32249 ``(A) Administration.--The Secretary shall carry out

32250 this subsection through the Administrator of the

32251 Agricultural Marketing Service, in coordination with the

32252 Administrator of the Rural Business-Cooperative Service.

32253

32254[[Page 132 STAT. 4893]]

32255

32256 ``(B) Eligible entities.--An entity shall be

32257 eligible to receive a grant under this paragraph if the

32258 entity is--

32259 ``(i) an agricultural cooperative or other

32260 agricultural business entity or a producer network

32261 or association, including a community-supported

32262 agriculture network or association;

32263 ``(ii) a local or Tribal government;

32264 ``(iii) a nonprofit corporation;

32265 ``(iv) a public benefit corporation;

32266 ``(v) an economic development corporation;

32267 ``(vi) a regional farmers' market authority;

32268 ``(vii) a food council; or

32269 ``(viii) such other entity as the Secretary

32270 may designate.

32271 ``(C) Priorities.--The Secretary shall give priority

32272 to applications that--

32273 ``(i) benefit underserved communities,

32274 including communities that are located in areas of

32275 concentrated poverty with limited access to fresh

32276 locally or regionally grown food; or

32277 ``(ii) are used to carry out eligible

32278 activities under a partnership agreement under

32279 subsection (e) and have not received benefits from

32280 the Program in the recent past.

32281 ``(D) Limitation on use of funds.--

32282 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

32283 clause (ii), an eligible entity described in

32284 subparagraph (B) may not use a grant for the

32285 purchase or construction of a building, general

32286 purpose equipment, or structure.

32287 ``(ii) Exception.--An eligible entity

32288 described in subparagraph (B) may use not more

32289 than $6,500 of the amount of a grant for an

32290 eligible activity described in paragraph (2)(J) to

32291 purchase or upgrade equipment to improve food

32292 safety.

32293 ``(E) Matching funds.--An eligible entity described

32294 in subparagraph (B) receiving a grant shall provide

32295 matching funds in the form of cash or an in-kind

32296 contribution in an amount that is equal to 25 percent of

32297 the total amount of the Federal portion of the grant.

32298

32299 ``(e) Partnerships.--

32300 ``(1) Definitions.--In this subsection:

32301 ``(A) Eligible entity.--The term `eligible entity'

32302 means--

32303 ``(i) a producer;

32304 ``(ii) a producer network or association;

32305 ``(iii) a farmer or rancher cooperative;

32306 ``(iv) a majority-controlled producer-based

32307 business venture;

32308 ``(v) a food council;

32309 ``(vi) a local or Tribal government;

32310 ``(vii) a nonprofit corporation;

32311 ``(viii) an economic development corporation;

32312 ``(ix) a public benefit corporation;

32313 ``(x) a community-supported agriculture

32314 network or association; and

32315 ``(xi) a regional farmers' market authority.

32316

32317[[Page 132 STAT. 4894]]

32318

32319 ``(B) Eligible partner.--The term `eligible partner'

32320 means--

32321 ``(i) a State agency or regional authority;

32322 ``(ii) a philanthropic organization;

32323 ``(iii) a private corporation;

32324 ``(iv) an institution of higher education;

32325 ``(v) a commercial, Federal, or Farm Credit

32326 System lending institution; and

32327 ``(vi) another entity, as determined by the

32328 Secretary.

32329 ``(2) Grants to support partnerships.--

32330 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary, acting through the

32331 Administrator of the Agricultural Marketing Service, in

32332 accordance with the purposes of the Program described in

32333 subsection (b), shall, using funds made available under

32334 subsection (i), provide grants for each of fiscal years

32335 2019 through 2023 to support partnerships to plan and

32336 develop a local or regional food system.

32337 ``(B) Geographical diversity.--To the maximum extent

32338 practicable, the Secretary shall ensure geographical

32339 diversity in selecting partnerships to receive grants

32340 under subparagraph (A).

32341 ``(3) Authorities of partnerships.--A partnership receiving

32342 a grant under paragraph (2) may--

32343 ``(A) determine the scope of the regional food

32344 system to be developed, including goals, outreach

32345 objectives, and eligible activities to be carried out;

32346 ``(B) determine the local, regional, State, multi-

32347 State, or other geographic area covered;

32348 ``(C) create and conduct a feasibility study,

32349 implementation plan, and assessment of eligible

32350 activities under the partnership agreement;

32351 ``(D) conduct outreach and education to other

32352 eligible entities and eligible partners for potential

32353 participation in the partnership agreement and eligible

32354 activities;

32355 ``(E) describe measures to be taken through the

32356 partnership agreement to obtain funding for the eligible

32357 activities to be carried out under the partnership

32358 agreement;

32359 ``(F) at the request of a producer or eligible

32360 entity desiring to participate in eligible activities

32361 under the partnership agreement, act on behalf of the

32362 producer or eligible entity in applying for a grant

32363 under subsection (d);

32364 ``(G) monitor, evaluate, and periodically report to

32365 the Secretary on progress made toward achieving the

32366 objectives of eligible activities under the partnership

32367 agreement; or

32368 ``(H) at the conclusion of the partnership

32369 agreement, submit to the Secretary a report describing--

32370 ``(i) the results and effects of the

32371 partnership agreement; and

32372 ``(ii) funds provided under paragraph (4).

32373 ``(4) Contribution.--A partnership receiving a grant under

32374 paragraph (2) shall provide funding in an amount equal to not

32375 less than 25 percent of the total amount of the Federal portion

32376 of the grant.

32377 ``(5) Applications.--

32378 ``(A) In general.--To be eligible to receive a grant

32379 under paragraph (2), a partnership shall submit to the

32380

32381[[Page 132 STAT. 4895]]

32382

32383 Secretary an application at such time, in such manner,

32384 and containing such information as the Secretary

32385 considers necessary to evaluate and select applications.

32386 ``(B) Competitive process.--The Secretary--

32387 ``(i) shall conduct a competitive process to

32388 select applications submitted under subparagraph

32389 (A);

32390 ``(ii) may assess and rank applications with

32391 similar purposes as a group; and

32392 ``(iii) shall make public the criteria to be

32393 used in evaluating applications prior to accepting

32394 applications.

32395 ``(C) Priority to certain applications.--The

32396 Secretary may give priority to applications submitted

32397 under subparagraph (A) that--

32398 ``(i)(I) leverage significant non-Federal

32399 financial and technical resources; and

32400 ``(II) coordinate with other local, State,

32401 Tribal, or national efforts;

32402 ``(ii) cover an area that includes distressed

32403 low-income rural or urban communities, including

32404 areas with persistent poverty; or

32405 ``(iii) have multiple entities and partners in

32406 a partnership.

32407 ``(D) Producer or food business benefits.--

32408 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

32409 clause (ii), an application submitted under

32410 subparagraph (A) shall include a description of

32411 the direct or indirect producer or food business

32412 benefits intended by the eligible entity to result

32413 from the proposed project within a reasonable

32414 period of time after the receipt of a grant.

32415 ``(ii) Exception.--Clause (i) shall not apply

32416 to a planning or feasibility project.

32417 ``(6) Technical assistance.--On request of an eligible

32418 entity, an eligible partner, or a partnership, the Secretary may

32419 provide technical assistance in carrying out a partnership

32420 agreement.

32421

32422 ``(f) Simplification of Application and Reporting Processes.--

32423 ``(1) Applications.--The Secretary shall establish a

32424 simplified application form for eligible entities that--

32425 ``(A) request less than $50,000 under subsection

32426 (d); or

32427 ``(B) apply for grants under subsection (d) under a

32428 single application through partnership agreements under

32429 subsection (e).

32430 ``(2) Reporting.--The Secretary shall--

32431 ``(A) streamline and simplify the reporting process

32432 for eligible entities; and

32433 ``(B) obtain from eligible entities and maintain

32434 such information as the Secretary determines is

32435 necessary to administer and evaluate the Program.

32436

32437 ``(g) Interdepartmental Coordination.--In carrying out the Program,

32438to the maximum extent practicable, the Secretary shall ensure

32439coordination among Federal agencies.

32440 ``(h) Evaluation.--

32441

32442[[Page 132 STAT. 4896]]

32443

32444 ``(1) In general.--Using amounts made available under

32445 subsection (i)(3)(E), the Secretary shall conduct an evaluation

32446 of the Program that--

32447 ``(A) measures the economic impact of the Program on

32448 new and existing market outcomes;

32449 ``(B) measures the effectiveness of the Program in

32450 improving and expanding--

32451 ``(i) the regional food economy through public

32452 and private partnerships;

32453 ``(ii) the production of value-added

32454 agricultural products;

32455 ``(iii) producer-to-consumer marketing,

32456 including direct producer-to-consumer marketing;

32457 ``(iv) local and regional food systems,

32458 including regional food chain coordination and

32459 business development;

32460 ``(v) new business opportunities and marketing

32461 strategies to reduce on-farm food waste;

32462 ``(vi) the use of new technologies in

32463 producer-to-consumer marketing, including direct

32464 producer-to-consumer marketing; and

32465 ``(vii) the workforce and capacity of regional

32466 food systems; and

32467 ``(C) provides a description of--

32468 ``(i) each partnership agreement; and

32469 ``(ii) each grant provided under subsection

32470 (d).

32471 ``(2) Report.--Not later than 4 years after the date of

32472 enactment of this section, the Secretary shall submit to the

32473 Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

32474 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

32475 a report describing the evaluation conducted under paragraph

32476 (1), including a thorough analysis of the outcomes of the

32477 evaluation.

32478

32479 ``(i) Funding.--

32480 ``(1) Mandatory funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity

32481 Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall use to carry out this

32482 section $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2019 and each fiscal year

32483 thereafter, to remain available until expended.

32484 ``(2) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized

32485 to be appropriated to carry out this section $20,000,000 for

32486 fiscal year 2019 and each fiscal year thereafter, to remain

32487 available until expended.

32488 ``(3) Allocation of funds.--

32489 ``(A) Value-added producer grants.--

32490 ``(i) In general.--Subject to clause (ii), of

32491 the funds made available to carry out this section

32492 for a fiscal year, 35 percent shall be used for

32493 grants under subsection (d)(5).

32494 ``(ii) Reservation of funds.--

32495 ``(I) Majority-controlled producer-

32496 based business ventures.--The total

32497 amount of grants under subsection (d)(5)

32498 provided to majority-controlled

32499 producer-based business ventures for a

32500 fiscal year shall not exceed 10 percent

32501 of the amount allocated under clause

32502 (i).

32503 ``(II) Beginning, veteran, and

32504 socially disadvantaged farmers and

32505 ranchers.--Of the

32506

32507[[Page 132 STAT. 4897]]

32508

32509 funds made available for grants under

32510 subsection (d)(5), 10 percent shall be

32511 reserved for grants provided to

32512 beginning, veteran, and socially

32513 disadvantaged farmers or ranchers.

32514 ``(III) Mid-tier value chains.--Of

32515 the funds made available for grants

32516 under subsection (d)(5), 10 percent

32517 shall be reserved for grants to develop

32518 mid-tier value chains.

32519 ``(IV) Food safety assistance.--Of

32520 the funds made available for grants

32521 under subsection (d)(5), not more than

32522 25 percent shall be reserved for grants

32523 for eligible activities described in

32524 subsection (d)(2)(J).

32525 ``(B) Farmers' market and local food promotion

32526 grants.--Of the funds made available to carry out this

32527 section for a fiscal year, 47 percent shall be used for

32528 grants under subsection (d)(6).

32529 ``(C) Regional partnerships.--Of the funds made

32530 available to carry out this section for a fiscal year,

32531 10 percent shall be used to provide grants to support

32532 partnerships under subsection (e).

32533 ``(D) Unobligated funds.--Any funds under

32534 subparagraph (A), (B), or (C) that are not obligated for

32535 the uses described in that subparagraph, as applicable,

32536 by September 30 of the fiscal year for which the funds

32537 were made available--

32538 ``(i) shall be available to the agency

32539 carrying out the Program with the unobligated

32540 funds to carry out any function of the Program, as

32541 determined by the Secretary; and

32542 ``(ii) may carry over to the next fiscal year.

32543 ``(E) Administrative expenses.--Not greater than 8

32544 percent of amounts made available to provide grants

32545 under subsections (d) and (e) for a fiscal year may be

32546 used for administrative expenses.''.

32547

32548 (c) Conforming Amendments.--

32554 project.'';

32559 indenting appropriately; and

32561 and heading;

32564 by striking ``Notwithstanding'' and all that

32565 follows through ``paragraph (2)'' and inserting

32567 than 2.5 percent of the funds made available to

32570 Marketing Act of 1946 to establish

32571

32575 Marketing Resource Center') at an eligible

32576 institution described in subsection (b)''; and

32582 (C) as paragraphs (1) through (3), respectively,

32583 and indenting appropriately; and

32584 (ii) in paragraph (1) (as so redesignated), by

32585 striking ``paragraph (1)(A)'' and inserting

32592 224))'' and inserting ``section 210A(d)(2) of the Agricultural

32593 Marketing Act of 1946''.

32597 Local Food Promotion Program established under section 6 of the

32599 3005)'' and inserting ``Local Agriculture Market Program

32600 established under section 210A of the Agricultural Marketing Act

32601 of 1946''.

32603 Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 2207b(a)) is amended by striking paragraph

32604 (1) and inserting the following:

32605 ``(1) section 210A of the Agricultural Marketing Act of

32606 1946;''.

32607 (5) Farmer-to-consumer direct marketing act of 1976.--

32618 (B) Sections 6, 7, and 8 of the Farmer-to-Consumer

32619 Direct Marketing Act of 1976 (7 U.S.C. 3005, 3006; 90

32620 Stat. 1983) are repealed.

32621SEC. 10103. ORGANIC PRODUCTION AND MARKET DATA INITIATIVES.

32622

32623 Section 7407(d) of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of

326242002 (7 U.S.C. 5925c(d)) is amended--

32625 (1) in paragraph (1)--

32626 (A) in the paragraph heading, by striking ``through

32627 fiscal year 2012''; and

32628 (B) by striking ``$5,000,000, to remain available

32629 until expended.'' and inserting the following: ``, to

32630 remain available until expended--

32631

32632[[Page 132 STAT. 4899]]

32633

32634 ``(A) $5,000,000 for each of the periods of fiscal

32635 years 2008 through 2012 and 2014 through 2018; and

32636 ``(B) $5,000,000 for the period of fiscal years 2019

32637 through 2023.'';

32638 (2) by striking paragraph (2);

32639 (3) by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (2); and

32640 (4) in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated)--

32644SEC. 10104. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6503 note.&gt;&gt; ORGANIC CERTIFICATION.

32645

32646 (a) Exclusions From Certification.--Not later than 1 year after the

32647date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue regulations to

32648limit the type of organic operations that are excluded from

32649certification under section 205.101 of title 7, Code of Federal

32650Regulations, and from certification under any other related sections

32651under part 205 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations.

32652 (b) Definitions.--Section 2103 of the Organic Foods Production Act

32653of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6502) is amended--

32654 (1) in paragraph (3)--

32655 (A) by striking ``The term'' and inserting the

32656 following:

32657 ``(A) In general.--The term''; and

32658 (B) by adding at the end the following:

32659 ``(B) Foreign operations.--When used in the context

32660 of a certifying agent operating in a foreign country,

32661 the term `certifying agent' includes any person

32662 (including a private entity)--

32663 ``(i) accredited in accordance with section

32664 2115(d); or

32665 ``(ii) accredited by a foreign government that

32666 acted under an equivalency agreement negotiated

32667 between the United States and the foreign

32668 government from which the agricultural product is

32669 imported.'';

32670 (2) by redesignating paragraphs (13) through (21) as

32671 paragraphs (14) through (22), respectively; and

32672 (3) by inserting after paragraph (12) the following:

32673 ``(13) National organic program import certificate.--The

32674 term `national organic program import certificate' means a form

32675 developed for purposes of the program under this title--

32676 ``(A) to provide documentation sufficient to verify

32677 that an agricultural product imported for sale in the

32678 United States satisfies the requirement under section

32679 2115(c);

32680 ``(B) which shall include, at a minimum, information

32681 sufficient to indicate, with respect to the agricultural

32682 product--

32683 ``(i) the origin;

32684 ``(ii) the destination;

32685 ``(iii) the certifying agent issuing the

32686 national organic program import certificate;

32687 ``(iv) the harmonized tariff code, if a

32688 harmonized tariff code exists for the agricultural

32689 product;

32690 ``(v) the total weight; and

32691 ``(vi) the organic standard to which the

32692 agricultural product is certified; and

32693

32694[[Page 132 STAT. 4900]]

32695

32696 ``(C) that is not more than otherwise required under

32697 an equivalency agreement negotiated between the United

32698 States and the foreign government.''.

32699

32700 (c) Accreditation Program.--Section 2115 of the Organic Foods

32701Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6514) is amended by striking subsection

32702(c) and inserting the following:

32703 ``(c) Additional Documentation and Verification.--The Secretary,

32704acting through the Deputy Administrator of the national organic program

32705established under this title, has the authority, and shall grant a

32706certifying agent the authority, to require producers and handlers to

32707provide additional documentation or verification before granting a

32708certification under section 2104, in the case of a compliance risk with

32709respect to meeting the national standards for organic production

32710established under section 2105, as determined by the Secretary or the

32711certifying agent.

32712 ``(d) Accreditation of Foreign Organic Certification Program.--

32713 ``(1) In general.--For an agricultural product being

32714 imported into the United States to be represented as organically

32715 produced, the Secretary shall require the agricultural product

32716 to be accompanied by a complete and valid national organic

32717 import certificate, which shall be available as an electronic

32718 record.

32719 ``(2) Tracking system.--

32720 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall establish a

32721 system to track national organic import certificates.

32722 ``(B) Integration.--In establishing the system under

32723 subparagraph (A), the Secretary may integrate the system

32724 into any existing information tracking systems for

32725 imports of agricultural products.

32726

32727 ``(e) Duration of Accreditation.--An accreditation made under this

32728section--

32729 ``(1) subject to paragraph (2), shall be for a period of not

32730 more than 5 years, as determined appropriate by the Secretary;

32731 ``(2) in the case of a certifying agent operating in a

32732 foreign country, shall be for a period of time that is

32733 consistent with the certification of a domestic certifying

32734 agent, as determined appropriate by the Secretary; and

32735 ``(3) may be renewed.''.

32736

32737 (d) Requirements of Certifying Agents.--Section 2116 of the Organic

32738Foods Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6515) is amended--

32739 (1) in subsection (i)--

32740 (A) in paragraph (1), by inserting ``or an entity

32741 acting as an agent of the certifying agent'' after ``a

32742 certifying agent'';

32743 (B) by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3);

32744 and

32745 (C) by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

32746 ``(2) Oversight of certifying offices and foreign

32747 operations.--

32748 ``(A) In general.--If the Secretary determines that

32749 an office of a certifying agent or entity described in

32750 paragraph (1) is not complying with the provisions of

32751 this title, the Secretary may suspend the operations of

32752 the certifying agent or the noncompliant office,

32753 including--

32754 ``(i) an office operating in a foreign

32755 country; and

32756

32757[[Page 132 STAT. 4901]]

32758

32759 ``(ii) an office operating in the United

32760 States, including an office acting on behalf of a

32761 foreign-domiciled entity.

32762 ``(B) Process for resuming operations following

32763 suspension.--The Secretary shall provide for a process

32764 that is otherwise consistent with this section that

32765 authorizes a suspended office to resume operations.'';

32766 and

32767 (2) by adding at the end the following:

32768

32769 ``(j) Notice.--Not later than 90 days after the date on which a new

32770certifying office performing certification activities opens, an

32771accredited certifying agent shall notify the Secretary of the

32772opening.''.

32773 (e) Certain Employees Eligible to Serve as National Organic

32774Standards Board Members.--Section 2119(b) of the Organic Foods

32775Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6518(b)) is amended--

32776 (1) in paragraph (1), by inserting ``, or employees of such

32777 individuals'' after ``operation'';

32778 (2) in paragraph (2), by inserting ``, or employees of such

32779 individuals'' after ``operation''; and

32780 (3) in paragraph (3), by inserting ``, or an employee of

32781 such individual'' after ``products''.

32782

32783 (f) National Organic Standards Board.--Section 2119(i) of the

32784Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6518(i)) is amended--

32785 (1) by striking ``Two-thirds'' and inserting the following:

32786 ``(1) In general.--\2/3\''; and

32787 (2) by adding at the end the following:

32788 ``(2) National list.--Any vote on a motion proposing to

32789 amend the national list shall be considered to be a decisive

32790 vote that requires \2/3\ of the votes cast at a meeting of the

32791 Board at which a quorum is present to prevail.''.

32792

32793 (g) Investigations.--Section 2120(b) of the Organic Foods Production

32794Act (7 U.S.C. 6519(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

32795 ``(3) Information sharing during active investigation.--In

32796 carrying out this title, all parties to an active investigation

32797 (including certifying agents, State organic certification

32798 programs, and the national organic program) shall share

32799 confidential business information with Federal Government

32800 officers and employees involved in the investigation as

32801 necessary to fully investigate and enforce potential violations

32802 of this title.''.

32803

32804 (h) Data Organization and Access.--Section 2122 of the Organic Foods

32805Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6521) is amended by adding at the end

32806the following:

32807 ``(c) Access to Data Documentation Systems.--The Secretary shall

32808have access to available data from cross-border documentation systems

32809administered by other Federal agencies, including the Automated

32810Commercial Environment system of U.S. Customs and Border Protection.

32811 ``(d) Reports.--

32812 ``(1) In general.--Not later than March 1, 2020, and

32813 annually thereafter through March 1, 2023, the Secretary shall

32814 submit to Congress, and make publicly available on the website

32815 of the Department of Agriculture, a report describing national

32816 organic program activities with respect to all domestic and

32817

32818[[Page 132 STAT. 4902]]

32819

32820 overseas investigations and compliance actions taken pursuant to

32821 this title during the preceding year.

32822 ``(2) Requirements.--The data described in paragraph (1)

32823 shall be broken down by agricultural product, quantity, value,

32824 and month.

32825 ``(3) Exception.--Any data determined by the Secretary to be

32826 confidential business information shall not be provided in the

32827 report under paragraph (1).''.

32828

32829 (i) Organic Agricultural Product Imports Interagency Working

32830Group.--The Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 is amended by inserting

32831after section 2122 (7 U.S.C. 6521) the following:

32832``SEC. 2122A. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6521a.&gt;&gt; ORGANIC AGRICULTURAL PRODUCT

32833 IMPORTS INTERAGENCY WORKING GROUP.

32834

32835 ``(a) Establishment.--

32836 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary and the Secretary of

32837 Homeland Security shall jointly establish a working group to

32838 facilitate coordination and information sharing between the

32839 Department of Agriculture and U.S. Customs and Border Protection

32840 relating to imports of organically produced agricultural

32841 products (referred to in this section as the `working group').

32842 ``(2) Members.--The working group--

32843 ``(A) shall include--

32844 ``(i) the Secretary (or a designee); and

32845 ``(ii) the Secretary of Homeland Security (or

32846 a designee); and

32847 ``(B) shall not include any non-Federal officer or

32848 employee.

32849 ``(3) Duties.--The working group shall facilitate

32850 coordination and information sharing between the Department of

32851 Agriculture and U.S. Customs and Border Protection for the

32852 purposes of--

32853 ``(A) identifying imports of organically produced

32854 agricultural products;

32855 ``(B) verifying the authenticity of organically

32856 produced agricultural product import documentation, such

32857 as national organic program import certificates;

32858 ``(C) ensuring imported agricultural products

32859 represented as organically produced meet the

32860 requirements under this title;

32861 ``(D) collecting and organizing quantitative data on

32862 imports of organically produced agricultural products;

32863 and

32864 ``(E) requesting feedback from stakeholders on how

32865 to improve the oversight of imports of organically

32866 produced agricultural products.

32867 ``(4) Designated employees and officials.--An employee or

32868 official designated to carry out the duties of the Secretary or

32869 the Secretary of Homeland Security on the working group under

32870 subparagraph (A) or (B) of paragraph (2) shall be an employee or

32871 official compensated at a rate of pay not less than the minimum

32872 annual rate of basic pay for GS-12 under section 5332 of title

32873 5, United States Code.

32874

32875 ``(b) Reports.--On an annual basis, the working group shall submit

32876to Congress and make publicly available on the websites

32877

32878[[Page 132 STAT. 4903]]

32879

32880of the Department of Agriculture and U.S. Customs and Border Protection

32881the following reports:

32882 ``(1) Organic trade enforcement interagency coordination

32883 report.--A report--

32884 ``(A) identifying existing barriers to cooperation

32885 between the agencies involved in agricultural product

32886 import inspection, trade data collection and

32887 organization, and organically produced agricultural

32888 product trade enforcement, including--

32889 ``(i) U.S. Customs and Border Protection;

32890 ``(ii) the Agricultural Marketing Service; and

32891 ``(iii) the Animal and Plant Health Inspection

32892 Service;

32893 ``(B) assessing progress toward integrating organic

32894 trade enforcement into import inspection procedures of

32895 U.S. Customs and Border Protection and the Animal and

32896 Plant Health Inspection Service, including an assessment

32897 of--

32898 ``(i) the status of the development of systems

32899 for--

32900 ``(I) tracking the fumigation of

32901 imports of organically produced

32902 agricultural products into the United

32903 States; and

32904 ``(II) electronically verifying

32905 national organic program import

32906 certificate authenticity; and

32907 ``(ii) training of U.S. Customs and Border

32908 Protection personnel on--

32909 ``(I) the use of the systems

32910 described in clause (i); and

32911 ``(II) requirements and protocols

32912 under this title;

32913 ``(C) establishing methodology for ensuring imports

32914 of agricultural products represented as organically

32915 produced meet the requirements under this title;

32916 ``(D) recommending steps to improve the

32917 documentation and traceability of imported organically

32918 produced agricultural products;

32919 ``(E) recommending and describing steps for--

32920 ``(i) improving compliance with the

32921 requirements of this title for all agricultural

32922 products imported into the United States and

32923 represented as organically produced; and

32924 ``(ii) ensuring accurate labeling and

32925 marketing of imported agricultural products

32926 represented as organically produced by the

32927 exporter; and

32928 ``(F) describing staffing needs and additional

32929 resources at U.S. Customs and Border Protection and the

32930 Department of Agriculture needed to ensure compliance.

32931 ``(2) Report on enforcement actions taken on organic

32932 imports.--A report--

32933 ``(A) providing detailed quantitative data (broken

32934 down by agricultural product, quantity, value, month,

32935 and origin) on imports of agricultural products

32936 represented as organically produced found to be

32937 fraudulent or lacking any documentation required under

32938 this title at the port of entry during the report year;

32939 ``(B) providing data on domestic enforcement actions

32940 taken on imported agricultural products represented as

32941 organically produced, including the number and type of

32942

32943[[Page 132 STAT. 4904]]

32944

32945 actions taken by United States officials at ports of

32946 entry in response to violations of this title;

32947 ``(C) providing data on fumigation of agricultural

32948 products represented as organically produced at ports of

32949 entry and notifications of fumigation actions to

32950 shipment owners, broken down by product variety and

32951 country of origin; and

32952 ``(D) providing information on enforcement

32953 activities under this title involving overseas

32954 investigations and compliance actions taken within that

32955 year, including--

32956 ``(i) the number of investigations by country;

32957 and

32958 ``(ii) a descriptive summary of compliance

32959 actions taken by certifying agents in each

32960 country.''.

32961

32962 (j) Authorization of Appropriations for National Organic Program.--

32963Section 2123 of the Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 6522)

32964is amended--

32965 (1) by striking the section heading and inserting

32966 ``funding'';

32967 (2) in subsection (b), by striking paragraphs (1) through

32968 (7) and inserting the following:

32969 ``(1) $15,000,000 for fiscal year 2018;

32970 ``(2) $16,500,000 for fiscal year 2019;

32971 ``(3) $18,000,000 for fiscal year 2020;

32972 ``(4) $20,000,000 for fiscal year 2021;

32973 ``(5) $22,000,000 for fiscal year 2022; and

32974 ``(6) $24,000,000 for fiscal year 2023.''; and

32975 (3) by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:

32976

32977 ``(c) Modernization and Improvement of International Trade

32978Technology Systems and Data Collection.--

32979 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall establish a new

32980 system or modify an existing data collection and organization

32981 system to collect and organize in a single system quantitative

32982 data on imports of each organically produced agricultural

32983 product accepted into the United States.

32984 ``(2) Activities.--In carrying out paragraph (1), the

32985 Secretary shall modernize trade and transaction certificates to

32986 ensure full traceability to the port of entry without unduly

32987 hindering trade or commerce, such as through an electronic trade

32988 document exchange system.

32989 ``(3) Access.--The single system established under paragraph

32990 (1) shall be accessible by any agency with the direct authority

32991 to engage in--

32992 ``(A) inspection of imports of agricultural

32993 products;

32994 ``(B) trade data collection and organization; or

32995 ``(C) enforcement of trade requirements for

32996 organically produced agricultural products.

32997 ``(4) Funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity Credit

32998 Corporation, the Secretary shall make available $5,000,000 for

32999 fiscal year 2019 for the purposes of--

33000 ``(A) carrying out this subsection; and

33001 ``(B) maintaining the database and technology

33002 upgrades previously carried out under this subsection,

33003 as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of

33004 the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018.

33005 ``(5) Availability.--The amounts made available under

33006 paragraph (4) are in addition to any other funds made available

33007

33008[[Page 132 STAT. 4905]]

33009

33010 for the purposes described in that paragraph and shall remain

33011 available until expended.''.

33012

33013 (k) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6521a note.&gt;&gt; Trade Savings Provision.--The

33014amendments made by subsection (i) shall be carried out in a manner

33015consistent with United States obligations under international

33016agreements.

33017SEC. 10105. NATIONAL ORGANIC CERTIFICATION COST-SHARE PROGRAM.

33018

33020Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 6523(a)) is

33021amended by striking ``(acting through the Agricultural Marketing

33022Service)''.

33023 (b) Funding.--Section 10606 of the Farm Security and Rural

33024Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 6523) is amended by striking subsection

33025(d) and inserting the following:

33026 ``(d) Mandatory Funding.--

33027 ``(1) In general.--Of the funds of the Commodity Credit

33028 Corporation, the Secretary shall make available to carry out

33029 this section--

33030 ``(A) $2,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 and

33031 2020;

33032 ``(B) $4,000,000 for fiscal year 2021; and

33033 ``(C) $8,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 and

33034 2023.

33035 ``(2) Availability.--Amounts made available under paragraph

33036 (1) shall remain available until expended.''.

33042SEC. 10107. SPECIALTY CROP BLOCK GRANTS.

33045U.S.C. 1621 note; Public Law 108-465) is amended--
