33047 (A) by striking ``2018'' and inserting ``2023''; and

33048 (B) by striking ``solely to enhance the

33049 competitiveness of specialty crops.'' and inserting the

33050 following: ``to enhance the competitiveness of specialty

33051 crops, including--

33052 ``(1) by leveraging efforts to market and promote specialty

33053 crops;

33054 ``(2) by assisting producers with research and development

33055 relevant to specialty crops;

33056 ``(3) by expanding availability and access to specialty

33057 crops;

33058 ``(4) by addressing local, regional, and national challenges

33059 confronting specialty crop producers; and

33060 ``(5) for such other purposes determined to be appropriate

33061 by the Secretary of Agriculture, in consultation with specialty

33062 crop stakeholders and relevant State departments of

33063 agriculture.'';

33064 (2) in subsection (j)--

33065 (A) by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (5) as

33066 subparagraphs (A) through (E), respectively, and

33067 indenting appropriately;

33068 (B) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) (as so

33069 redesignated), by striking ``Not later'' and inserting

33070 the following:

33071 ``(1) In general.--Not later''; and

33072 (C) by adding at the end the following:

33073

33074[[Page 132 STAT. 4906]]

33075

33076 ``(2) Administration of multistate projects from

33077 nonparticipating states.--The Secretary of Agriculture may

33078 directly administer all aspects of multistate projects under

33079 this subsection for applicants in a nonparticipating State.'';

33080 (3) in subsection (k), by adding at the end the following:

33081 ``(3) Evaluation.--

33082 ``(A) Performance measures and review.--

33083 ``(i) Development.--The Secretary of

33084 Agriculture and the State departments of

33085 agriculture, in consultation with specialty crop

33086 stakeholders, shall develop performance measures

33087 to be used as the sole means of performing any

33088 evaluation of the grant program established under

33089 this section.

33090 ``(ii) Review.--The Secretary of Agriculture,

33091 in consultation with the State departments of

33092 agriculture, shall periodically evaluate the

33093 performance of the grant program established under

33094 this section.

33095 ``(B) Cooperative agreements.--The Secretary of

33096 Agriculture may enter into cooperative agreements--

33097 ``(i) to develop the performance measures

33098 under subparagraph (A)(i); or

33099 ``(ii) to evaluate the overall performance of

33100 the grant program established under this

33101 section.''; and

33102 (4) in subsection (l)(2)(E), by inserting ``and each fiscal

33103 year thereafter'' after ``2018''.

33104SEC. 10108. AMENDMENTS TO THE PLANT VARIETY PROTECTION ACT.

33105

33106 (a) Asexually Reproduced Defined.--Section 41(a) of the Plant

33107Variety Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 2401(a)) is amended--

33108 (1) by redesignating paragraphs (1), (2), (3), (4), (5),

33109 (6), (7), (8), and (9) as paragraphs (2), (3), (4), (5), (6),

33110 (7), (8), (9), and (10), respectively; and

33111 (2) by inserting before paragraph (2), as so redesignated,

33112 the following new paragraph:

33113 ``(1) Asexually reproduced.--The term `asexually reproduced'

33114 means produced by a method of plant propagation using vegetative

33115 material (other than seed) from a single parent, including

33116 cuttings, grafting, tissue culture, and propagation by root

33117 division.''.

33118

33119 (b) Right to Plant Variety Protection; Plant Varieties

33120Protectable.--Section 42(a) of the Plant Variety Protection Act (7

33121U.S.C. 2402(a)) is amended by striking ``or tuber propagated'' and

33122inserting ``, tuber propagated, or asexually reproduced''.

33123 (c) Infringement of Plant Variety Protection.--Section 111(a)(3) of

33124the Plant Variety Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 2541(a)(3)) is amended by

33125inserting ``or asexually'' after ``sexually''.

33126 (d) False Marketing; Cease and Desist Orders.--Section 128(a) of the

33127Plant Variety Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 2568(a)) is amended, in the

33128matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting ``or asexually'' after

33129``sexually''.

33130SEC. 10109. MULTIPLE CROP AND PESTICIDE USE SURVEY.

33131

33132 (a) In General.--The Secretary, acting through the Director of the

33133Office of Pest Management Policy, shall conduct a multiple crop and

33134pesticide use survey of farmers to collect data for risk assessment

33135modeling and mitigation for an active ingredient.

33136

33137[[Page 132 STAT. 4907]]

33138

33139 (b) Submission.--The Secretary shall submit to the Administrator of

33140the Environmental Protection Agency and make publicly available the

33141survey described in subsection (a).

33142 (c) Funding.--

33143 (1) Mandatory funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity Credit

33144 Corporation, the Secretary shall use to carry out this section

33145 $500,000 for fiscal year 2019, to remain available until

33146 expended.

33147 (2) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized to

33148 be appropriated to carry out this section $2,500,000, to remain

33149 available until expended.

33150

33151 (d) Confidentiality of Information.--Section 1770 of the Food

33152Security Act of 1985 (7 U.S.C. 2276) is amended--

33153 (1) in subsection (a)--

33154 (A) by striking ``(a) In the case'' and inserting

33155 the following:

33156

33157 ``(a) In General.--In the case''; and

33158 (B) in paragraph (3), by striking ``subsection

33159 (d)(12)'' and inserting ``paragraph (12) or (13) of

33160 subsection (d)''; and

33161 (2) in subsection (d)--

33162 (A) by striking ``(d) For purposes'' and inserting

33163 the following:

33164

33165 ``(d) Provisions of Law References.--For purposes'';

33166 (B) in paragraph (11), by striking ``or'' at the

33167 end;

33168 (C) in paragraph (12), by striking the period at the

33169 end and inserting ``; or''; and

33170 (D) by adding at the end the following:

33171 ``(13) section 10109 of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

33172 2018.''.

33173SEC. 10110. REPORT ON THE ARRIVAL IN THE UNITED STATES OF FOREST

33174 PESTS THROUGH RESTRICTIONS ON THE

33175 IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN PLANTS FOR

33176 PLANTING.

33177

33178 Not later than March 1, 2021, the Secretary shall submit to Congress

33179a report--

33180 (1) evaluating the effectiveness of the Federal Government

33181 in intercepting pests in international shipping and on plants

33182 for planting;

33183 (2) describing the geographic sources of intercepted pests

33184 and the commodities or plant species most often associated with

33185 infested shipments;

33186 (3) quantifying the detection of forest pests in the

33187 national surveillance networks, including the Cooperative

33188 Agricultural Pest Survey and the Early Detection and Rapid

33189 Response network of the Forest Service;

33190 (4) describing new outbreaks of forest pests in the United

33191 States and the spread of existing infestations;

33192 (5) describing how the numbers of such interceptions,

33193 detections, and outbreaks described in a preceding paragraph

33194 have changed since January 1, 2018;

33195 (6) containing proposed additional actions to further reduce

33196 the rate of arrival for forest pests across the borders of the

33197 United States;

33198 (7) identifying current challenges with intercepting,

33199 detecting, and addressing outbreaks of tree and wood pests, as

33200 well as challenges in achieving compliance with the Plant

33201

33202[[Page 132 STAT. 4908]]

33203

33204 Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 7701 et seq.) and recommendations with

33205 respect to such challenges; and

33206 (8) describing the coordination and collaboration occurring

33207 between the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service and the

33208 Forest Service with respect to--

33209 (A) identifying and prioritizing critical detection,

33210 surveillance, and eradication needs for tree and wood

33211 pests; and

33212 (B) identifying the actions each agency takes within

33213 their respective missions to address identified

33214 priorities.

33215SEC. 10111. REPORT ON PLANT BIOSTIMULANTS.

33216

33217 (a) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment

33218of this Act, the Secretary shall submit a report to the President and

33219Congress that identifies any potential regulatory, non-regulatory, and

33220legislative recommendations, including the appropriateness of any

33221definitions for plant biostimulant, to ensure the efficient and

33222appropriate review, approval, uniform national labeling, and

33223availability of plant biostimulant products to agricultural producers.

33224 (b) Consultation.--The Secretary shall prepare the report required

33225by subsection (a) in consultation with the Administrator of the

33226Environmental Protection Agency, the several States, industry

33227stakeholders, and such other stakeholders as the Secretary determines

33228necessary.

33229 (c) Plant Biostimulant.--For the purposes of the report under

33230subsection (a), the Secretary--

33231 (1) shall consider ``plant biostimulant'' to be a substance

33232 or micro-organism that, when applied to seeds, plants, or the

33233 rhizosphere, stimulates natural processes to enhance or benefit

33234 nutrient uptake, nutrient efficiency, tolerance to abiotic

33235 stress, or crop quality and yield; and

33236 (2) may modify the description of plant biostimulant, as

33237 appropriate.

33238SEC. 10112. CLARIFICATION OF USE OF FUNDS FOR TECHNICAL

33239 ASSISTANCE.

33240

33241 Section 11 of the Commodity Credit Corporation Charter Act (15

33242U.S.C. 714i) is amended in the last sentence by inserting after

33243``activities'' the following: ``but excluding any amounts used to

33244provide technical assistance under title X of the Agriculture

33245Improvement Act of 2018 or an amendment made by that title''.

33246SEC. 10113. HEMP PRODUCTION.

33247

33248 The Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1621 et seq.) is

33249amended by adding at the end the following:

33250

33251 ``Subtitle G--Hemp Production

33252

33253``SEC. 297A. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1639o.&gt;&gt; DEFINITIONS.

33254

33255 ``In this subtitle:

33256 ``(1) Hemp.--The term `hemp' means the plant Cannabis sativa

33257 L. and any part of that plant, including the seeds thereof and

33258 all derivatives, extracts, cannabinoids, isomers, acids, salts,

33259 and salts of isomers, whether growing or not, with a delta-9

33260 tetrahydrocannabinol concentration of not more than 0.3 percent

33261 on a dry weight basis.

33262

33263[[Page 132 STAT. 4909]]

33264

33265 ``(2) Indian tribe.--The term `Indian tribe' has the meaning

33266 given the term in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and

33267 Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304).

33268 ``(3) Secretary.--The term `Secretary' means the Secretary

33269 of Agriculture.

33270 ``(4) State.--The term `State' means--

33271 ``(A) a State;

33272 ``(B) the District of Columbia;

33273 ``(C) the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico; and

33274 ``(D) any other territory or possession of the

33275 United States.

33276 ``(5) State department of agriculture.--The term `State

33277 department of agriculture' means the agency, commission, or

33278 department of a State government responsible for agriculture in

33279 the State.

33280 ``(6) Tribal government.--The term `Tribal government' means

33281 the governing body of an Indian tribe.

33282``SEC. 297B. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1639p.&gt;&gt; STATE AND TRIBAL PLANS.

33283

33284 ``(a) Submission.--

33285 ``(1) In general.--A State or Indian tribe desiring to have

33286 primary regulatory authority over the production of hemp in the

33287 State or territory of the Indian tribe shall submit to the

33288 Secretary, through the State department of agriculture (in

33289 consultation with the Governor and chief law enforcement officer

33290 of the State) or the Tribal government, as applicable, a plan

33291 under which the State or Indian tribe monitors and regulates

33292 that production as described in paragraph (2).

33293 ``(2) Contents.--A State or Tribal plan referred to in

33294 paragraph (1)--

33295 ``(A) shall only be required to include--

33296 ``(i) a practice to maintain relevant

33297 information regarding land on which hemp is

33298 produced in the State or territory of the Indian

33299 tribe, including a legal description of the land,

33300 for a period of not less than 3 calendar years;

33301 ``(ii) a procedure for testing, using post-

33302 decarboxylation or other similarly reliable

33303 methods, delta-9 tetrahydrocannabinol

33304 concentration levels of hemp produced in the State

33305 or territory of the Indian tribe;

33306 ``(iii) a procedure for the effective disposal

33307 of--

33308 ``(I) plants, whether growing or

33309 not, that are produced in violation of

33310 this subtitle; and

33311 ``(II) products derived from those

33312 plants;

33313 ``(iv) a procedure to comply with the

33314 enforcement procedures under subsection (e);

33315 ``(v) a procedure for conducting annual

33316 inspections of, at a minimum, a random sample of

33317 hemp producers to verify that hemp is not produced

33318 in violation of this subtitle;

33319 ``(vi) a procedure for submitting the

33320 information described in section 297C(d)(2), as

33321 applicable, to the Secretary not more than 30 days

33322 after the date on which the information is

33323 received; and

33324

33325[[Page 132 STAT. 4910]]

33326

33327 ``(vii) a certification that the State or

33328 Indian tribe has the resources and personnel to

33329 carry out the practices and procedures described

33330 in clauses (i) through (vi); and

33331 ``(B) may include any other practice or procedure

33332 established by a State or Indian tribe, as applicable,

33333 to the extent that the practice or procedure is

33334 consistent with this subtitle.

33335 ``(3) Relation to state and tribal law.--

33336 ``(A) No preemption.--Nothing in this subsection

33337 preempts or limits any law of a State or Indian tribe

33338 that--

33339 ``(i) regulates the production of hemp; and

33340 ``(ii) is more stringent than this subtitle.

33341 ``(B) References in plans.--A State or Tribal plan

33342 referred to in paragraph (1) may include a reference to

33343 a law of the State or Indian tribe regulating the

33344 production of hemp, to the extent that law is consistent

33345 with this subtitle.

33346

33347 ``(b) Approval.--

33348 ``(1) In general.--Not later than 60 days after receipt of a

33349 State or Tribal plan under subsection (a), the Secretary shall--

33350 ``(A) approve the State or Tribal plan if the State

33351 or Tribal plan complies with subsection (a); or

33352 ``(B) disapprove the State or Tribal plan only if

33353 the State or Tribal plan does not comply with subsection

33354 (a).

33355 ``(2) Amended plans.--If the Secretary disapproves a State

33356 or Tribal plan under paragraph (1)(B), the State, through the

33357 State department of agriculture (in consultation with the

33358 Governor and chief law enforcement officer of the State) or the

33359 Tribal government, as applicable, may submit to the Secretary an

33360 amended State or Tribal plan that complies with subsection (a).

33361 ``(3) Consultation.--The Secretary shall consult with the

33362 Attorney General in carrying out this subsection.

33363

33364 ``(c) Audit of State Compliance.--

33365 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary may conduct an audit of the

33366 compliance of a State or Indian tribe with a State or Tribal

33367 plan approved under subsection (b).

33368 ``(2) Noncompliance.--If the Secretary determines under an

33369 audit conducted under paragraph (1) that a State or Indian tribe

33370 is not materially in compliance with a State or Tribal plan--

33371 ``(A) the Secretary shall collaborate with the State

33372 or Indian tribe to develop a corrective action plan in

33373 the case of a first instance of noncompliance; and

33374 ``(B) the Secretary may revoke approval of the State

33375 or Tribal plan in the case of a second or subsequent

33376 instance of noncompliance.

33377

33378 ``(d) Technical Assistance.--The Secretary may provide technical

33379assistance to a State or Indian tribe in the development of a State or

33380Tribal plan under subsection (a).

33381 ``(e) Violations.--

33382 ``(1) In general.--A violation of a State or Tribal plan

33383 approved under subsection (b) shall be subject to enforcement

33384 solely in accordance with this subsection.

33385 ``(2) Negligent violation.--

33386

33387[[Page 132 STAT. 4911]]

33388

33389 ``(A) In general.--A hemp producer in a State or the

33390 territory of an Indian tribe for which a State or Tribal

33391 plan is approved under subsection (b) shall be subject

33392 to subparagraph (B) of this paragraph if the State

33393 department of agriculture or Tribal government, as

33394 applicable, determines that the hemp producer has

33395 negligently violated the State or Tribal plan, including

33396 by negligently--

33397 ``(i) failing to provide a legal description

33398 of land on which the producer produces hemp;

33399 ``(ii) failing to obtain a license or other

33400 required authorization from the State department

33401 of agriculture or Tribal government, as

33402 applicable; or

33403 ``(iii) producing Cannabis sativa L. with a

33404 delta-9 tetrahydrocannabinol concentration of more

33405 than 0.3 percent on a dry weight basis.

33406 ``(B) Corrective action plan.--A hemp producer

33407 described in subparagraph (A) shall comply with a plan

33408 established by the State department of agriculture or

33409 Tribal government, as applicable, to correct the

33410 negligent violation, including--

33411 ``(i) a reasonable date by which the hemp

33412 producer shall correct the negligent violation;

33413 and

33414 ``(ii) a requirement that the hemp producer

33415 shall periodically report to the State department

33416 of agriculture or Tribal government, as

33417 applicable, on the compliance of the hemp producer

33418 with the State or Tribal plan for a period of not

33419 less than the next 2 calendar years.

33420 ``(C) Result of negligent violation.--A hemp

33421 producer that negligently violates a State or Tribal

33422 plan under subparagraph (A) shall not as a result of

33423 that violation be subject to any criminal enforcement

33424 action by the Federal Government or any State

33425 government, Tribal government, or local government.

33426 ``(D) Repeat violations.--A hemp producer that

33427 negligently violates a State or Tribal plan under

33428 subparagraph (A) 3 times in a 5-year period shall be

33429 ineligible to produce hemp for a period of 5 years

33430 beginning on the date of the third violation.

33431 ``(3) Other violations.--

33432 ``(A) In general.--If the State department of

33433 agriculture or Tribal government in a State or the

33434 territory of an Indian tribe for which a State or Tribal

33435 plan is approved under subsection (b), as applicable,

33436 determines that a hemp producer in the State or

33437 territory has violated the State or Tribal plan with a

33438 culpable mental state greater than negligence--

33439 ``(i) the State department of agriculture or

33440 Tribal government, as applicable, shall

33441 immediately report the hemp producer to--

33442 ``(I) the Attorney General; and

33443 ``(II) the chief law enforcement

33444 officer of the State or Indian tribe, as

33445 applicable; and

33446 ``(ii) paragraph (1) of this subsection shall

33447 not apply to the violation.

33448 ``(B) Felony.--

33449

33450[[Page 132 STAT. 4912]]

33451

33452 ``(i) In general.--Except as provided in

33453 clause (ii), any person convicted of a felony

33454 relating to a controlled substance under State or

33455 Federal law before, on, or after the date of

33456 enactment of this subtitle shall be ineligible,

33457 during the 10-year period following the date of

33458 the conviction--

33459 ``(I) to participate in the program

33460 established under this section or

33461 section 297C; and

33462 ``(II) to produce hemp under any

33463 regulations or guidelines issued under

33464 section 297D(a).

33465 ``(ii) Exception.--Clause (i) shall not apply

33466 to any person growing hemp lawfully with a

33467 license, registration, or authorization under a

33468 pilot program authorized by section 7606 of the

33469 Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 5940) before

33470 the date of enactment of this subtitle.

33471 ``(C) False statement.--Any person who materially

33472 falsifies any information contained in an application to

33473 participate in the program established under this

33474 section shall be ineligible to participate in that

33475 program.

33476

33477 ``(f) Effect.--Nothing in this section prohibits the production of

33478hemp in a State or the territory of an Indian tribe--

33479 ``(1) for which a State or Tribal plan is not approved under

33480 this section, if the production of hemp is in accordance with

33481 section 297C or other Federal laws (including regulations); and

33482 ``(2) if the production of hemp is not otherwise prohibited

33483 by the State or Indian tribe.

33484``SEC. 297C. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1639q.&gt;&gt; DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE.

33485

33486 ``(a) Department of Agriculture Plan.--

33487 ``(1) In general.--In the case of a State or Indian tribe

33488 for which a State or Tribal plan is not approved under section

33489 297B, the production of hemp in that State or the territory of

33490 that Indian tribe shall be subject to a plan established by the

33491 Secretary to monitor and regulate that production in accordance

33492 with paragraph (2).

33493 ``(2) Content.--A plan established by the Secretary under

33494 paragraph (1) shall include--

33495 ``(A) a practice to maintain relevant information

33496 regarding land on which hemp is produced in the State or

33497 territory of the Indian tribe, including a legal

33498 description of the land, for a period of not less than 3

33499 calendar years;

33500 ``(B) a procedure for testing, using post-

33501 decarboxylation or other similarly reliable methods,

33502 delta-9 tetrahydrocannabinol concentration levels of

33503 hemp produced in the State or territory of the Indian

33504 tribe;

33505 ``(C) a procedure for the effective disposal of--

33506 ``(i) plants, whether growing or not, that are

33507 produced in violation of this subtitle; and

33508 ``(ii) products derived from those plants;

33509 ``(D) a procedure to comply with the enforcement

33510 procedures under subsection (c)(2);

33511 ``(E) a procedure for conducting annual inspections

33512 of, at a minimum, a random sample of hemp producers to

33513 verify that hemp is not produced in violation of this

33514 subtitle; and

33515

33516[[Page 132 STAT. 4913]]

33517

33518 ``(F) such other practices or procedures as the

33519 Secretary considers to be appropriate, to the extent

33520 that the practice or procedure is consistent with this

33521 subtitle.

33522

33523 ``(b) Licensing.--The Secretary shall establish a procedure to issue

33524licenses to hemp producers in accordance with a plan established under

33525subsection (a).

33526 ``(c) Violations.--

33527 ``(1) In general.--In the case of a State or Indian tribe

33528 for which a State or Tribal plan is not approved under section

33529 297B, it shall be unlawful to produce hemp in that State or the

33530 territory of that Indian tribe without a license issued by the

33531 Secretary under subsection (b).

33532 ``(2) Negligent and other violations.--A violation of a plan

33533 established under subsection (a) shall be subject to enforcement

33534 in accordance with paragraphs (2) and (3) of section 297B(e),

33535 except that the Secretary shall carry out that enforcement

33536 instead of a State department of agriculture or Tribal

33537 government.

33538 ``(3) Reporting to attorney general.--In the case of a State

33539 or Indian tribe covered by paragraph (1), the Secretary shall

33540 report the production of hemp without a license issued by the

33541 Secretary under subsection (b) to the Attorney General.

33542

33543 ``(d) Information Sharing for Law Enforcement.--

33544 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall--

33545 ``(A) collect the information described in paragraph

33546 (2); and

33547 ``(B) make the information collected under

33548 subparagraph (A) accessible in real time to Federal,

33549 State, territorial, and local law enforcement.

33550 ``(2) Content.--The information collected by the Secretary

33551 under paragraph (1) shall include--

33552 ``(A) contact information for each hemp producer in

33553 a State or the territory of an Indian tribe for which--

33554 ``(i) a State or Tribal plan is approved under

33555 section 297B(b); or

33556 ``(ii) a plan is established by the Secretary

33557 under this section;

33558 ``(B) a legal description of the land on which hemp

33559 is grown by each hemp producer described in subparagraph

33560 (A); and

33561 ``(C) for each hemp producer described in

33562 subparagraph (A)--

33563 ``(i) the status of--

33564 ``(I) a license or other required

33565 authorization from the State department

33566 of agriculture or Tribal government, as

33567 applicable; or

33568 ``(II) a license from the Secretary;

33569 and

33570 ``(ii) any changes to the status.

33571``SEC. 297D. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1639r.&gt;&gt; REGULATIONS AND GUIDELINES;

33572 EFFECT ON OTHER LAW.

33573

33574 ``(a) Promulgation of Regulations and Guidelines; Report.--

33575 ``(1) Regulations and guidelines.--

33576 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall promulgate

33577 regulations and guidelines to implement this subtitle as

33578 expeditiously as practicable.

33579

33580[[Page 132 STAT. 4914]]

33581

33582 ``(B) Consultation with attorney general.--The

33583 Secretary shall consult with the Attorney General on the

33584 promulgation of regulations and guidelines under

33585 subparagraph (A).

33586 ``(2) Report.--The Secretary shall annually submit to the

33587 Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

33588 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

33589 a report containing updates on the implementation of this

33590 subtitle.

33591

33592 ``(b) Authority.--Subject to subsection (c)(3)(B), the Secretary

33593shall have sole authority to promulgate Federal regulations and

33594guidelines that relate to the production of hemp, including Federal

33595regulations and guidelines that relate to the implementation of sections

33596297B and 297C.

33597 ``(c) Effect on Other Law.--Nothing in this subtitle shall affect or

33598modify--

33599 ``(1) the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C.

33600 301 et seq.);

33601 ``(2) section 351 of the Public Health Service Act (42

33602 U.S.C. 262); or

33603 ``(3) the authority of the Commissioner of Food and Drugs

33604 and the Secretary of Health and Human Services--

33605 ``(A) under--

33606 ``(i) the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

33607 (21 U.S.C. 301 et seq.); or

33608 ``(ii) section 351 of the Public Health

33609 Service Act (42 U.S.C. 262); or

33610 ``(B) to promulgate Federal regulations and

33611 guidelines that relate to the production of hemp under

33612 the Act described in subparagraph (A)(i) or the section

33613 described in subparagraph (A)(ii).

33614``SEC. 297E. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1639s.&gt;&gt; AUTHORIZATION OF

33615 APPROPRIATIONS.

33616

33617 ``There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as are necessary

33618to carry out this subtitle.''.

33619SEC. 10114. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1639o note.&gt;&gt; INTERSTATE COMMERCE.

33620

33621 (a) Rule of Construction.--Nothing in this title or an amendment

33622made by this title prohibits the interstate commerce of hemp (as defined

33623in section 297A of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (as added by

33624section 10113)) or hemp products.

33625 (b) Transportation of Hemp and Hemp Products.--No State or Indian

33626Tribe shall prohibit the transportation or shipment of hemp or hemp

33627products produced in accordance with subtitle G of the Agricultural

33628Marketing Act of 1946 (as added by section 10113) through the State or

33629the territory of the Indian Tribe, as applicable.

33630SEC. 10115. FIFRA INTERAGENCY WORKING GROUP.

33631

33632 Section 3(c) of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide

33633Act (7 U.S.C. 13a(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

33634 ``(11) Interagency working group.--

33635 ``(A) Definition of covered agency.--In this

33636 paragraph, the term `covered agency' means any of the

33637 following:

33638 ``(i) The Department of Agriculture.

33639 ``(ii) The Department of Commerce.

33640

33641[[Page 132 STAT. 4915]]

33642

33643 ``(iii) The Department of the Interior.

33644 ``(iv) The Council on Environmental Quality.

33645 ``(v) The Environmental Protection Agency.

33646 ``(B) Establishment.--The Administrator shall

33647 establish an interagency working group, to be comprised

33648 of representatives from each covered agency, to provide

33649 recommendations regarding, and to implement a strategy

33650 for improving, the consultation process required under

33651 section 7 of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16

33652 U.S.C. 1536) for pesticide registration and registration

33653 review.

33654 ``(C) Duties.--The interagency working group

33655 established under subparagraph (B) shall--

33656 ``(i) analyze relevant Federal law (including

33657 regulations) and case law for purposes of

33658 providing an outline of the legal and regulatory

33659 framework for the consultation process referred to

33660 in that subparagraph, including--

33661 ``(I) requirements under this Act

33662 and the Endangered Species Act of 1973

33663 (16 U.S.C. 1531 et seq.);

33664 ``(II) Federal case law regarding

33665 the intersection of this Act and the

33666 Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16

33667 U.S.C. 1531 et seq.); and

33668 ``(III) Federal regulations relating

33669 to the pesticide consultation process;

33670 ``(ii) provide advice regarding methods of--

33671 ``(I) defining the scope of actions

33672 of the covered agencies that are subject

33673 to the consultation requirement referred

33674 to in subparagraph (B); and

33675 ``(II) properly identifying and

33676 classifying effects of actions of the

33677 covered agencies with respect to that

33678 consultation requirement;

33679 ``(iii) identify the obligations and

33680 limitations under Federal law of each covered

33681 agency for purposes of providing a legal and

33682 regulatory framework for developing the

33683 recommendations referred to in subparagraph (B);

33684 ``(iv) review practices for the consultation

33685 referred to in subparagraph (B) to identify

33686 problem areas, areas for improvement, and best

33687 practices for conducting that consultation among

33688 the covered agencies;

33689 ``(v) develop scientific and policy approaches

33690 to increase the accuracy and timeliness of the

33691 process for that consultation, in accordance with

33692 requirements of this Act and the Endangered

33693 Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1531 et seq.),

33694 including--

33695 ``(I) processes to efficiently share

33696 data and coordinate analyses among the

33697 Department of Agriculture, the

33698 Department of Commerce, the Department

33699 of the Interior, and the Environmental

33700 Protection Agency;

33701 ``(II) a streamlined process for

33702 identifying which actions require no

33703 consultation, informal consultation, or

33704 formal consultation;

33705 ``(III) an approach that will

33706 provide clarity with respect to what

33707 constitutes the best scientific

33708

33709[[Page 132 STAT. 4916]]

33710

33711 and commercial data available in the

33712 fields of pesticide use and ecological

33713 risk assessment, pursuant to section

33714 7(a)(2) of the Endangered Species Act of

33715 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1536(a)(2)); and

33716 ``(IV) approaches that enable the

33717 Environmental Protection Agency to

33718 better assist the Department of the

33719 Interior and the Department of Commerce

33720 in carrying out obligations under that

33721 section in a timely and efficient

33722 manner; and

33723 ``(vi) propose and implement a strategy to

33724 implement approaches to consultations under the

33725 Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1531 et

33726 seq.) and document that strategy in a memorandum

33727 of understanding, revised regulations, or another

33728 appropriate format to promote durable cooperation

33729 among the covered agencies.

33730 ``(D) Reports.--

33731 ``(i) Progress reports.--

33732 ``(I) In general.--Not later than 18

33733 months after the date of enactment of

33734 this paragraph, the Administrator, in

33735 coordination with the head of each other

33736 covered agency, shall submit to the

33737 Committee on Agriculture of the House of

33738 Representatives and the Committee on

33739 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of

33740 the Senate a report describing the

33741 progress of the working group in

33742 developing the recommendations under

33743 subparagraph (B).

33744 ``(II) Requirements.--The report

33745 under this clause shall--

33746 ``(aa) reflect the

33747 perspectives of each covered

33748 agency; and

33749 ``(bb) identify areas of new

33750 consensus and continuing topics

33751 of disagreement and debate.

33752 ``(ii) Results.--

33753 ``(I) In general.--Not later than 1

33754 year after the date of enactment of this

33755 paragraph, the Administrator, in

33756 coordination with the head of each other

33757 covered agency, shall submit to the

33758 Committee on Agriculture of the House of

33759 Representatives and the Committee on

33760 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of

33761 the Senate a report describing--

33762 ``(aa) the recommendations

33763 developed under subparagraph

33764 (B); and

33765 ``(bb) plans for

33766 implementation of those

33767 recommendations.

33768 ``(II) Requirements.--The report

33769 under this clause shall--

33770 ``(aa) reflect the

33771 perspectives of each covered

33772 agency; and

33773 ``(bb) identify areas of

33774 consensus and continuing topics

33775 of disagreement and debate, if

33776 any.

33777 ``(iii) Implementation.--Not later than 1 year

33778 after the date of submission of the report under

33779 clause (i), the Administrator, in coordination

33780 with the head

33781

33782[[Page 132 STAT. 4917]]

33783

33784 of each other covered agency, shall submit to the

33785 Committee on Agriculture of the House of

33786 Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

33787 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report

33788 describing--

33789 ``(I) the implementation of the

33790 recommendations referred to in that

33791 clause;

33792 ``(II) the extent to which that

33793 implementation improved the consultation

33794 process referred to in subparagraph (B);

33795 and

33796 ``(III) any additional

33797 recommendations for improvements to the

33798 process described in subparagraph (B).

33799 ``(iv) Other reports.--Not later than the date

33800 that is 180 days after the date of submission of

33801 the report under clause (iii), and not less

33802 frequently than once every 180 days thereafter

33803 during the 5-year period beginning on that date,

33804 the Administrator, in coordination with the head

33805 of each other covered agency, shall submit to the

33806 Committee on Agriculture of the House of

33807 Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

33808 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report

33809 describing--

33810 ``(I) the implementation of the

33811 recommendations referred to in that

33812 clause;

33813 ``(II) the extent to which that

33814 implementation improved the consultation

33815 process referred to in subparagraph (B);

33816 and

33817 ``(III) any additional

33818 recommendations for improvements to the

33819 process described in subparagraph (B).

33820 ``(E) Consultation with private sector.--In carrying

33821 out the duties under this paragraph, the working group

33822 shall, as appropriate--

33823 ``(i) consult with, representatives of

33824 interested industry stakeholders and

33825 nongovernmental organizations; and

33826 ``(ii) take into consideration factors, such

33827 as actual and potential differences in interest

33828 between, and the views of, those stakeholders and

33829 organizations.

33830 ``(F) Federal advisory committee act.--The Federal

33831 Advisory Committee Act (5 U.S.C. App.) shall not apply

33832 to the working group established under this paragraph.

33833 ``(G) Savings clause.--Nothing in this paragraph

33834 supersedes any provision of--

33835 ``(i) this Act; or

33836 ``(ii) the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16

33837 U.S.C. 1531 et seq.), including the requirements

33838 under section 7 of that Act (16 U.S.C. 1536).''.

33839SEC. 10116. STUDY ON METHYL BROMIDE USE IN RESPONSE TO AN

33840 EMERGENCY EVENT.

33841

33842 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

33843 (1) Emergency event.--The term ``emergency event'' means a

33844 situation--

33845 (A) that occurs at a location on which a plant or

33846 commodity is grown or produced or facility providing for

33847 the

33848

33849[[Page 132 STAT. 4918]]

33850

33851 storage of, or other services with respect to, a plant

33852 or commodity;

33853 (B) for which the lack of availability of methyl

33854 bromide for a particular use would result in significant

33855 economic loss to the owner, lessee, or operator of the

33856 location or facility or the owner, grower, or purchaser

33857 of the plant or commodity; and

33858 (C) that, in light of the specific agricultural,

33859 meteorological, or other conditions presented, requires

33860 the use of methyl bromide to control a pest or disease

33861 in the location or facility because there are no

33862 technically feasible alternatives to methyl bromide

33863 easily accessible by an entity referred to in

33864 subparagraph (B) at the time and location of the event

33865 that--

33866 (i) are registered under the Federal

33867 Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (7

33868 U.S.C. 136 et seq.) for the intended use or pest

33869 to be so controlled; and

33870 (ii) would adequately control the pest or

33871 disease presented at the location or facility.

33872 (2) Pest.--The term ``pest'' has the meaning given the term

33873 in section 2 of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and

33874 Rodenticide Act (7 U.S.C. 136).

33875

33876 (b) Study.--

33877 (1) In general.--The Secretary, in consultation with the

33878 Secretary of State and the Administrator of the Environmental

33879 Protection Agency, shall complete a study on the potential use

33880 of methyl bromide in response to an emergency event.

33881 (2) Requirements.--The study under paragraph (1) shall

33882 include--

33883 (A) a risk-benefit analysis of authorizing State,

33884 local, or Tribal authorities, in accordance with

33885 appropriate requirements and criteria, such as the

33886 recommendations developed under subparagraph (E)--

33887 (i) to determine when the use of methyl

33888 bromide is required; and

33889 (ii) to authorize such use;

33890 (B) a risk-benefit analysis of authorizing the

33891 Secretary, in accordance with appropriate requirements

33892 and criteria, such as the recommendations developed

33893 under subparagraph (E)--

33894 (i) to determine when the use of methyl

33895 bromide is required; and

33896 (ii) to authorize such use;

33897 (C) a historic estimate of situations occurring on

33898 or after September 15, 1997, that could have been deemed

33899 emergency events;

33900 (D) a detailed assessment of the adherence of the

33901 United States to international obligations of the United

33902 States with respect to the prevention of ozone

33903 depletion; and

33904 (E) an assessment and recommendations on appropriate

33905 requirements and criteria to be met to authorize the use

33906 of methyl bromide in response to an emergency event

33907 (including any recommendations for revising the

33908 definition of the term ``emergency event'' in subsection

33909 (a)) in a manner that fully complies with the Montreal

33910 Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer,

33911 including

33912

33913[[Page 132 STAT. 4919]]

33914

33915 Decision IX/7 of the Ninth Meeting of the Conference of

33916 the Parties to the Montreal Protocol on Substances that

33917 Deplete the Ozone Layer.

33918

33919 (c) Report.--Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of

33920this Act, the Secretary shall submit a report on the study under

33921subsection (b) to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

33922Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Forestry, and

33923Nutrition of the Senate.

33924

33925 TITLE XI--CROP INSURANCE

33926

33927SEC. 11101. DEFINITIONS.

33928

33929 Section 502(b) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1502(b))

33930is amended--

33931 (1) by redesignating paragraphs (6), (7), (8), (9), (10),

33932 and (11) as paragraphs (7), (8), (10), (11), (12), and (13)

33933 respectively;

33934 (2) by inserting after paragraph (5) the following:

33935 ``(6) Cover crop termination.--The term `cover crop

33936 termination' means a practice that historically and under

33937 reasonable circumstances results in the termination of the

33938 growth of a cover crop.''; and

33939 (3) by inserting after paragraph (8) (as so redesignated)

33940 the following:

33941 ``(9) Hemp.--The term `hemp' has the meaning given the term

33942 in section 297A of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946.''.

33943SEC. 11102. DATA COLLECTION.

33944

33945 Section 506(h)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

339461506(h)(2)) is amended--

33947 (1) by striking ``The Corporation'' and inserting the

33948 following:

33949 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation''; and

33950 (2) by adding at the end the following:

33951 ``(B) National agricultural statistics service.--

33952 Data collected by the National Agricultural Statistics

33953 Service, whether published or unpublished, shall be--

33954 ``(i) provided in an aggregate form to the

33955 Corporation for the purpose of providing insurance

33956 under this subtitle; and

33957 ``(ii) kept confidential by the Corporation in

33958 the same manner and to the same extent as is

33959 required under--

33960 ``(I) section 1770 of the Food

33961 Security Act of 1985 (7 U.S.C. 2276);

33962 and

33963 ``(II) the Confidential Information

33964 Protection and Statistical Efficiency

33965 Act of 2002 (44 U.S.C. 3501 note; Public

33966 Law 107-347).

33967 ``(C) Noninsured crop disaster assistance program.--

33968 In collecting data under this subsection, the Secretary

33969 shall ensure that--

33970 ``(i) appropriate data are collected through

33971 the noninsured crop disaster assistance program

33972 established by section 196 of the Federal

33973 Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 (7

33974 U.S.C. 7333); and

33975

33976[[Page 132 STAT. 4920]]

33977

33978 ``(ii) not less frequently than annually, the

33979 Farm Service Agency shares, and the Corporation

33980 considers, the data described in clause (i).''.

33981SEC. 11103. SHARING OF RECORDS.

33982

33983 Section 506(h)(3) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

339841506(h)(3)) is amended by inserting ``applicants who have received

33985payment under section 522(b)(2)(E),'' after ``divisions,''.

33986SEC. 11104. USE OF RESOURCES.

33987

33988 Section 507(f) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1507(f))

33989is amended--

33990 (1) by striking paragraphs (3) and (4) and inserting the

33991 following:

33992 ``(3) the Farm Service Agency, in assisting the Board in--

33993 ``(A) the determination of individual producer

33994 yields;

33995 ``(B) sharing information on beginning farmers and

33996 ranchers and veteran farmers and ranchers;

33997 ``(C) investigating potential waste, fraud, or

33998 abuse;

33999 ``(D) sharing information to support the transition

34000 of crops and counties from the noninsured crop disaster

34001 assistance program established by section 196 of the

34002 Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996

34003 (7 U.S.C. 7333) to insurance under this subtitle; and

34004 ``(E) serving as a local point of contact for the

34005 dissemination of information on risk management options

34006 available to farmers and ranchers; and

34007 ``(4) other Federal agencies, in assisting the Board in any

34008 way the Board determines is necessary in carrying out this

34009 subtitle.'';

34010 (2) in paragraph (2), by striking ``(2) the'' and inserting

34011 the following:

34012 ``(2) the''; and

34013 (3) by striking ``(f) The Board'' in the matter preceding

34014 paragraph (1) and all that follows through the semicolon at the

34015 end of paragraph (1) and inserting the following:

34016

34017 ``(f) Use of Resources, Data, Boards, and Committees of Federal

34018Agencies.--If the Board determines it is necessary, the Board shall use,

34019to the maximum extent practicable, the resources, data, boards, and the

34020committees of--

34021 ``(1) the Natural Resources Conservation Service, in

34022 assisting the Board in--

34023 ``(A) the classification of land as to risk and

34024 production capability; and

34025 ``(B) the consideration of acceptable conservation

34026 practices, including good farming practices with respect

34027 to conservation (such as cover crop termination);''.

34028SEC. 11105. SPECIALTY CROPS.

34029

34030 (a) Specialty Crops Coordinator.--Section 507(g) of the Federal Crop

34031Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1507(g)) is amended--

34032 (1) by striking the subsection designation and all that

34033 follows through ``The Corporation'' in paragraph (1) and

34034 inserting the following:

34035

34036 ``(g) Specialty Crops Coordinator.--

34037 ``(1) In general.--The Corporation''; and

34038 (2) by adding at the end the following:

34039

34040[[Page 132 STAT. 4921]]

34041

34042 ``(4) Specialty crop liaisons.--The Specialty Crops

34043 Coordinator shall--

34044 ``(A) designate a Specialty Crops Liaison in each

34045 regional field office; and

34046 ``(B) share the contact information of the Specialty

34047 Crops Liaisons with specialty crop producers.

34048 ``(5) Website.--The Specialty Crops Coordinator shall

34049 establish a website focused on the efforts of the Corporation to

34050 provide and expand crop insurance for specialty crop

34051 producers.''.

34052

34053 (b) Addition of Specialty Crops and Other Value-added Crops.--

34054Section 508(a)(6) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

340551508(a)(6)) is amended--

34056 (1) in the paragraph heading, by adding at the end the

34057 following: ``(including value-added crops)'';

34058 (2) by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the

34059 following:

34060 ``(A) Annual review.--Not later than 1 year after

34061 the date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act

34062 of 2018, and annually thereafter, the manager of the

34063 Corporation shall prepare, to the maximum extent

34064 practicable, based on data shared from the noninsured

34065 crop disaster assistance program established by section

34066 196 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform

34067 Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C. 7333), written agreements, or

34068 other data, and present to the Board not less than 1 of

34069 each of the following:

34070 ``(i) Research and development for a policy or

34071 plan of insurance for a commodity for which there

34072 is no existing policy or plan of insurance.

34073 ``(ii) Expansion of an existing policy or plan

34074 of insurance to additional counties or States,

34075 including malting barley endorsements or contract

34076 options.

34077 ``(iii) Research and development for a new

34078 policy or plan of insurance, or endorsement, for

34079 commodities with existing policies or plans of

34080 insurance, such as dollar plans.'';

34081 (3) in subparagraph (B), in the subparagraph heading, by

34082 striking ``Addition of new crops'' and inserting ``Report''; and

34083 (4) by striking subparagraphs (C) and (D).

34084SEC. 11106. INSURANCE PERIOD.

34085

34086 Section 508(a)(2) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

340871508(a)(2)) is amended by striking ``and sweet potatoes'' and inserting

34088``sweet potatoes, and hemp''.

34089SEC. 11107. COVER CROPS.

34090

34091 Section 508(a) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(a))

34092is amended--

34093 (1) in paragraph (3)(B), in the subparagraph heading, by

34094 inserting ``determination review'' after ``practices''; and

34095 (2) by adding at the end the following:

34096 ``(11) Cover crops.--

34097 ``(A) In general.--The voluntary practice of cover

34098 cropping shall be considered a good farming practice

34099 under paragraph (3)(A)(iii) if the cover crop is

34100 terminated in accordance with subparagraph (B).

34101 ``(B) Termination.--

34102

34103[[Page 132 STAT. 4922]]

34104

34105 ``(i) In general.--The termination of a cover

34106 crop shall be carried out according to--

34107 ``(I) guidelines established by the

34108 Secretary; or

34109 ``(II) an exception to the

34110 guidelines approved under clause (ii).

34111 ``(ii) Exception to guidelines.--The

34112 Corporation shall approve an exception to the

34113 guidelines under clause (i)(I) if that exception

34114 is recommended by--

34115 ``(I) the Natural Resources

34116 Conservation Service; or

34117 ``(II) an agricultural expert, as

34118 determined by the Corporation, unless

34119 the exception is determined to be

34120 unreasonable by the Corporation.

34121 ``(C) Insurability of subsequent crop.--Cover crop

34122 termination shall not affect the insurability of a

34123 subsequently planted insurable crop if the cover crop is

34124 terminated in accordance with subparagraph (B).

34125 ``(D) Summer fallow.--In a county in which summer

34126 fallow is an insurable practice, a cover crop in that

34127 county that is terminated in accordance with

34128 subparagraph (B) shall be considered as summer fallow

34129 for the purpose of insurability.''.

34130SEC. 11108. UNDERSERVED PRODUCERS.

34131

34132 Section 508(a)(7) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

341331508(a)(7)) is amended--

34134 (1) in the paragraph heading, by inserting ``and underserved

34135 producers'' after ``states'';

34136 (2) in subparagraph (A)--

34137 (A) by striking the designation and heading and all

34138 that follows through ``the term'' and inserting the

34139 following:

34140 ``(A) Definitions.--In this paragraph:

34141 ``(i) Adequately served.--The term'';

34142 (B) in clause (i) (as so designated), by striking

34143 ``participation rate'' and inserting ``participation

34144 rate, by crop,''; and

34145 (C) by adding at the end the following:

34146 ``(ii) Underserved producer.--The term

34147 `underserved producer' means an individual

34148 (including a member of an Indian Tribe) that is--

34149 ``(I) a beginning farmer or rancher;

34150 ``(II) a veteran farmer or rancher;

34151 or

34152 ``(III) a socially disadvantaged

34153 farmer or rancher.'';

34154 (3) in subparagraph (B)--

34155 (A) by striking ``The Board'' and inserting ``Using

34156 resources and information available to the Board or the

34157 Secretary, the Board''; and

34158 (B) by striking ``subtitle'' and inserting

34159 ``subtitle, including policies and plans of insurance

34160 for underserved producers,''; and

34161 (4) by striking subparagraph (C) and inserting the

34162 following:

34163 ``(C) Report.--

34164 ``(i) In general.--Not later than 30 days

34165 after completion of the review under subparagraph

34166 (B), and

34167

34168[[Page 132 STAT. 4923]]

34169

34170 not less frequently than once every 3 years

34171 thereafter, the Board shall make publicly

34172 available and submit to the Committee on

34173 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and

34174 the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and

34175 Forestry of the Senate a report describing the

34176 results of the review.

34177 ``(ii) Recommendations.--The report under

34178 clause (i) shall include recommendations to

34179 increase participation in States and among

34180 underserved producers that are not adequately

34181 served by the policies and plans of insurance,

34182 including any plans for administrative action or

34183 recommendations for Congressional action.''.

34184SEC. 11109. TREATMENT OF FORAGE AND GRAZING.

34185

34186 (a) Availability of Catastrophic Risk Protection for Crops and

34187Grasses Used for Grazing.--Section 508(b)(1) of the Federal Crop

34188Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(b)(1)) is amended--

34189 (1) by striking ``(A) In general.--Except as provided in

34190 subparagraph (B), the'' and inserting ``The''; and

34191 (2) by striking subparagraph (B).

34192

34193 (b) Coverage for Forage and Grazing.--The Federal Crop Insurance Act

34194is amended by inserting after section 508C (7 U.S.C. 1508c) the

34195following new section:

34196``SEC. 508D. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1508d.&gt;&gt; COVERAGE FOR FORAGE AND

34197 GRAZING.

34198

34199 ``Notwithstanding section 508A, and in addition to any other

34200available coverage, for crops that can be both grazed and mechanically

34201harvested on the same acres during the same growing season, producers

34202shall be allowed to purchase separate policies for each intended use, as

34203determined by the Corporation, and any indemnity paid under those

34204policies for each intended use shall not be considered to be for the

34205same loss for the purposes of section 508(n).''.

34206SEC. 11110. ADMINISTRATIVE BASIC FEE.

34207

34208 Section 508(b)(5)(A) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

342091508(b)(5)(A)) is amended by striking ``$300'' and inserting ``$655''.

34210SEC. 11111. ENTERPRISE UNITS.

34211

34212 Section 508(e)(5) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

342131508(e)(5)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

34214 ``(E) Enterprise units across county lines.--The

34215 Corporation may allow a producer to establish a single

34216 enterprise unit by combining an enterprise unit with--

34217 ``(i) 1 or more other enterprise units in 1 or

34218 more other counties; or

34219 ``(ii) all basic units and all optional units

34220 in 1 or more other counties.''.

34221SEC. 11112. CONTINUED AUTHORITY.

34222

34223 Section 508(g) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(g))

34224is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

34225 ``(6) Continued authority.--

34226 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation shall establish--

34227 ``(i) underwriting rules that limit the

34228 decrease in the actual production history of a

34229 producer, at the election of the producer, to not

34230 more than 10 percent of the actual production

34231 history of the previous crop

34232

34233[[Page 132 STAT. 4924]]

34234

34235 year provided that the production decline was the

34236 result of drought, flood, natural disaster, or

34237 other insurable loss (as determined by the

34238 Corporation); and

34239 ``(ii) actuarially sound premiums to cover

34240 additional risk.

34241 ``(B) Other authority.--The authority provided under

34242 subparagraph (A) is in addition to any other authority

34243 that adjusts the actual production history of the

34244 producer under this Act.

34245 ``(C) Effect.--Nothing in this paragraph shall be

34246 construed to require a change in the administration of

34247 any provision of this Act as the Act was administered

34248 for the 2018 reinsurance year.''.

34249SEC. 11113. SUBMISSION OF POLICIES AND MATERIALS TO BOARD.

34255 subclauses (I) through (III), respectively, and

34256 indenting appropriately;

34257 (B) in the matter preceding subclause (I) (as so

34258 redesignated), by striking ``The Corporation shall'' and

34263 likely''; and

34267 under clause (i)(I) in the case of a policy or

34268 pilot program relating to the production of

34269 hemp.''; and

34273 end and inserting ``; and''; and

34274 (C) by adding at the end the following:

34278 requirement under subparagraph (A)(ii)(I).''.

34279SEC. 11114. CROP PRODUCTION ON NATIVE SOD.

342821508(o)(2)(A)) is amended--

34283 (1) by striking ``During the'' and inserting the following:

34284 ``(i) First 4 crop years.--During the'';

34285 (2) in clause (i) (as so designated), by striking ``after

34286 the date of enactment of the Agricultural Act of 2014'' and

34287 inserting ``beginning on February 8, 2014, and ending on the

34288 date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018'';

34289 and

34290 (3) by adding at the end the following:

34291 ``(ii) Subsequent crop years.--Native sod

34292 acreage that has been tilled for the production of

34293 an insurable crop after the date of enactment of

34294 the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 shall be

34295 subject to a reduction in benefits under this

34296 subtitle as described in this paragraph for not

34297 more than 4 cumulative years--

34298

34299[[Page 132 STAT. 4925]]

34300

34301 ``(I) during the first 10 years

34302 after initial tillage; and

34303 ``(II) during each of which a crop

34304 on that acreage is insured under

34305 subsection (c).''.

34306SEC. 11115. USE OF NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL STATISTICS SERVICE DATA

34307 TO COMBAT WASTE, FRAUD, AND ABUSE.

34308

34309 Section 515 of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1515) is

34310amended--

34311 (1) in subsection (d)(1)--

34312 (A) in subparagraph (B), by striking ``and'' at the

34313 end;

34314 (B) in subparagraph (C), by striking the period at

34315 the end and inserting ``; and''; and

34316 (C) by adding at the end the following:

34317 ``(D) using published aggregate data from the

34318 National Agricultural Statistics Service or any other

34319 data source to--

34320 ``(i) detect yield disparities or other data

34321 anomalies that indicate potential fraud; and

34322 ``(ii) target the relevant counties, crops,

34323 regions, companies, or agents associated with that

34324 potential fraud for audits and other enforcement

34325 actions.''; and

34326 (2) in subsection (f)(2)(A), by striking ``pursuant to''

34327 each place it appears and inserting ``under''.

34328SEC. 11116. SUBMISSION OF INFORMATION TO CORPORATION.

34329

34330 Section 515(g) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1515(g))

34331is amended--

34332 (1) in paragraph (1), by adding at the end the following:

34333 ``(D) The actual production history to be used to

34334 establish insurable yields.''; and

34335 (2) in paragraph (2)--

34336 (A) by striking ``The information required by

34337 paragraph (1)'' and inserting the following:

34338 ``(A) In general.--The information required to be

34339 submitted under subparagraphs (A) through (C) of

34340 paragraph (1)''; and

34341 (B) by adding at the end the following:

34342 ``(B) Actual production history.--

34343 ``(i) In general.--The information required to

34344 be submitted under paragraph (1)(D) with respect

34345 to an applicable policy or plan of insurance for a

34346 covered commodity (as defined in section 1111 of

34347 the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9011))

34348 shall be submitted so as to ensure receipt by the

34349 Corporation not later than the Saturday of the

34350 week containing the calendar day that is 30 days

34351 after the applicable production reporting date for

34352 the crop to be insured.

34353 ``(ii) Correction of errors.--Nothing in

34354 clause (i) limits the ability of an approved

34355 insurance provider to correct any error in the

34356 information submitted under paragraph (1)(D) after

34357 receipt of the information by the Corporation in

34358 accordance with clause (i).''.

34359SEC. 11117. CONTINUING EDUCATION FOR LOSS ADJUSTERS AND AGENTS.

34360

34361 Section 515 of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1515) is

34362amended--

34363

34364[[Page 132 STAT. 4926]]

34365

34366 (1) by redesignating subsection (k) as subsection (l); and

34367 (2) by inserting after subsection (j) the following:

34368

34369 ``(k) Continuing Education for Loss Adjusters and Agents.--

34370 ``(1) In general.--The Corporation shall establish

34371 requirements for continuing education for loss adjusters and

34372 agents of approved insurance providers.

34373 ``(2) Requirements.--The requirements for continuing

34374 education described in paragraph (1) shall ensure that loss

34375 adjusters and agents of approved insurance providers are

34376 familiar with--

34377 ``(A) the policies and plans of insurance available

34378 under this Act, including the regulations promulgated to

34379 carry out this Act;

34380 ``(B) efforts to promote program integrity through

34381 the elimination of waste, fraud, and abuse; and

34382 ``(C) other aspects of adjusting, delivering, and

34383 servicing policies and plans of insurance by adjustors

34384 and agents, as determined by the Secretary, including

34385 conservation activities and agronomic practices

34386 (including organic and sustainable practices) that are

34387 common and appropriate to the area in which the insured

34388 crop being inspected is produced.''.

34398SEC. 11120. MAINTENANCE OF POLICIES.

34399

34400 (a) In General.--Section 522(b) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7

34401U.S.C. 1522(b)) is amended--

34402 (1) in paragraph (1), by amending subparagraph (B) to read

34403 as follows:

34404 ``(B) Reimbursement.--

34405 ``(i) In general.--An applicant who submits a

34406 policy under section 508(h) shall be eligible for

34407 the reimbursement of reasonable research and

34408 development costs if the policy is approved by the

34409 Board for sale to producers.

34410 ``(ii) Reasonable costs.--For the purpose of

34411 reimbursing research and development and

34412 maintenance costs under this section, costs of the

34413 applicant shall be considered reasonable costs if

34414 the costs are based on--

34415 ``(I) for any employees or

34416 contracted personnel, wage rates equal

34417 to not more than 2 times the hourly wage

34418 rate plus benefits, as provided by the

34419 Bureau of Labor Statistics for the year

34420 in which such costs are incurred,

34421 calculated using the formula applied to

34422 an applicant by the Corporation in

34423 reviewing proposed project budgets under

34424 this section on October 1, 2016; and

34425

34426[[Page 132 STAT. 4927]]

34427

34428 ``(II) other actual documented costs

34429 incurred by the applicant.''; and

34430 (2) in paragraph (4)--

34431 (A) in subparagraph (C), by striking ``approved

34432 insurance provider'' and inserting ``applicant''; and

34433 (B) in subparagraph (D)--

34434 (i) in clause (i), by striking ``determined by

34435 the approved insurance provider'' and inserting

34436 ``determined by the applicant''; and

34437 (ii) by adding at the end the following:

34438 ``(iii) Review.--After the Board approves the

34439 amount of a fee under clause (ii), the fee shall

34440 remain in effect and not be reviewed by the Board

34441 unless--

34442 ``(I) the applicant petitions the

34443 Board for reconsideration of the fee;

34444 ``(II) a substantial change is made

34445 to the policy, as determined by the

34446 Board; or

34447 ``(III) there is substantial

34448 evidence that the fee is inhibiting

34449 sales or use of the policy, as

34450 determined by the Board.''.

34451

34452 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1522 note.&gt;&gt; Applicability.--

34453 (1) In general.--The amendments made by this section shall

34454 apply to reimbursement requests made on or after October 1,

34455 2016.

34456 (2) Resubmission of denied request.--An applicant that was

34457 denied all or a portion of a reimbursement request under

34458 paragraph (1) of section 522(b) of the Federal Crop Insurance

34459 Act (7 U.S.C. 1522(b)) during the period between October 1,

34460 2016, and the date of the enactment of this Act shall be given

34461 an opportunity to resubmit such request.

34462SEC. 11121. REIMBURSEMENT OF RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, AND

34463 MAINTENANCE COSTS.

34464
