34466is amended--

34467 (1) in paragraph (2), by adding at the end the following:

34468 ``(K) Waiver for hemp.--The Board may waive the

34469 viability and marketability requirements under this

34470 paragraph in the case of research and development

34471 relating to a policy to insure the production of

34472 hemp.''; and

34473 (2) in paragraph (3)--

34474 (A) by striking ``The Corporation'' and inserting

34475 the following:

34476 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), the

34477 Corporation''; and

34478 (B) by adding at the end the following:

34479 ``(B) Waiver for hemp.--The Corporation may waive

34480 the marketability requirement under subparagraph (A) in

34481 the case of research and development relating to a

34482 policy to insure the production of hemp.''.

34483SEC. 11122. RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY.

34484

34485 Section 522(c) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1522(c))

34486is amended--

34487 (1) by striking paragraphs (7) through (18) and (20) through

34488 (23);

34489 (2) by redesignating paragraphs (19) and (24) as paragraphs

34490 (7) and (8), respectively;

34491

34492[[Page 132 STAT. 4928]]

34493

34494 (3) in paragraph (7) (as so redesignated) (entitled ``Whole

34495 farm diversified risk management insurance plan''), by adding at

34496 the end the following:

34497 ``(E) Review of modifications to improve

34498 effectiveness.--

34499 ``(i) In general.--Not later than 18 months

34500 after the date of enactment of the Agriculture

34501 Improvement Act of 2018--

34502 ``(I) the Corporation shall hold

34503 stakeholder meetings to solicit producer

34504 and agent feedback; and

34505 ``(II) the Board shall--

34506 ``(aa) review procedures and

34507 paperwork requirements on agents

34508 and producers; and

34509 ``(bb) modify procedures and

34510 requirements, as appropriate, to

34511 decrease burdens and increase

34512 flexibility and effectiveness.

34513 ``(ii) Factors.--In carrying out items (aa)

34514 and (bb) of subclause (i)(II), the Board shall

34515 consider--

34516 ``(I) removing caps on nursery and

34517 livestock production;

34518 ``(II) allowing a waiver to expand

34519 operations, especially for small and

34520 beginning farmers;

34521 ``(III) minimizing paperwork for

34522 producers and agents;

34523 ``(IV) implementing an option for

34524 producers with less than $1,000,000 in

34525 gross revenue that requires

34526 significantly less paperwork and

34527 recordkeeping;

34528 ``(V) developing and using

34529 alternative records such as time-stamped

34530 photographs or technology applications

34531 to document planting and production

34532 history;

34533 ``(VI) treating the different growth

34534 stages of aquaculture species as

34535 separate crops to recognize the

34536 difference in perils at different phases

34537 of growth;

34538 ``(VII) moderating the impacts of

34539 disaster years on historic revenue, such

34540 as--

34541 ``(aa) using an average of

34542 the historic and projected

34543 revenue;

34544 ``(bb) counting indemnities

34545 as historic revenue for loss

34546 years;

34547 ``(cc) counting payments

34548 under section 196 of the Federal

34549 Agriculture Improvement and

34550 Reform Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C.

34551 7333) as historic revenue for

34552 loss years; or

34553 ``(dd) using an assigned

34554 yield floor similar to the

34555 limitation described in section

34556 508(g)(6)(A)(i), as determined

34557 by the Secretary;

34558 ``(VIII) improving agent training

34559 and outreach to underserved regions and

34560 sectors such as small dairy farms; and

34561 ``(IX) providing coverage and

34562 indemnification of insurable losses--

34563 ``(aa) after the losses

34564 exceed the deductible; and

34565

34566[[Page 132 STAT. 4929]]

34567

34568 ``(bb) up to the maximum

34569 amount of total coverage.

34570 ``(F) Beginning farmer or rancher defined.--

34571 Notwithstanding section 502(b)(3), with respect to plans

34572 described under this paragraph, the term `beginning

34573 farmer or rancher' means a farmer or rancher who has not

34574 actively operated and managed a farm or ranch with a

34575 bona fide insurable interest in a crop or livestock as

34576 an owner-operator, landlord, tenant, or sharecropper for

34577 more than 10 crop years.''; and

34578 (4) by inserting after paragraph (8) (as so redesignated)

34579 the following:

34580 ``(9) Tropical storm or hurricane insurance.--

34581 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation shall carry out

34582 research and development, or offer to enter into 1 or

34583 more contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to carry

34584 out research and development, regarding a policy to

34585 insure crops (including tomatoes, peppers, and citrus)

34586 against losses due to a tropical storm or hurricane.

34587 ``(B) Research and development.--Research and

34588 development under subparagraph (A) shall--

34589 ``(i) evaluate the effectiveness of risk

34590 management tools for a low frequency and

34591 catastrophic loss weather event; and

34592 ``(ii) result in a policy that provides

34593 protection for at least 1 of the following:

34594 ``(I) Production loss.

34595 ``(II) Revenue loss.

34596 ``(C) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date

34597 of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

34598 the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34599 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34600 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34601 Senate a report that describes--

34602 ``(i) the results of the research and

34603 development carried out under this paragraph; and

34604 ``(ii) any recommendations with respect to

34605 those results.

34606 ``(10) Quality loss.--

34607 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation shall carry out

34608 research and development, or offer to enter into 1 or

34609 more contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to carry

34610 out research and development, regarding the

34611 establishment of each of the following alternative

34612 methods of adjusting for quality losses:

34613 ``(i) A method that does not impact the actual

34614 production history of a producer.

34615 ``(ii) A method that provides that, in

34616 circumstances in which a producer has suffered a

34617 quality loss to the insured crop of the producer

34618 that is insufficient to trigger an indemnity

34619 payment, the producer may elect to exclude that

34620 quality loss from the actual production history of

34621 the producer.

34622 ``(iii) 1 or more methods that combine the

34623 methods described in clauses (i) and (ii).

34624 ``(B) Requirements.--Notwithstanding subsections (g)

34625 and (m) of section 508, any method developed under

34626

34627[[Page 132 STAT. 4930]]

34628

34629 subparagraph (A) that is used by the Corporation shall

34630 be--

34631 ``(i) optional for a producer to use; and

34632 ``(ii) offered at an actuarially sound premium

34633 rate.

34634 ``(C) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date

34635 of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

34636 the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34637 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34638 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34639 Senate a report that describes--

34640 ``(i) the results of the research and

34641 development carried out under subparagraph (A);

34642 and

34643 ``(ii) any recommendations with respect to

34644 those results.

34645 ``(11) Citrus.--

34646 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation shall carry out

34647 research and development, or offer to enter into 1 or

34648 more contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to carry

34649 out research and development, regarding the insurance of

34650 citrus fruit commodities and commodity types, including

34651 research and development of--

34652 ``(i) improvements to 1 or more existing

34653 policies, including the whole-farm revenue

34654 protection pilot policy;

34655 ``(ii) alternative methods of insuring revenue

34656 for citrus fruit commodities and commodity types;

34657 and

34658 ``(iii) the development of new, or expansion

34659 of existing, revenue policies for citrus fruit

34660 commodities and commodity types.

34661 ``(B) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date

34662 of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

34663 the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34664 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34665 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34666 Senate a report that describes--

34667 ``(i) the results of the research and

34668 development carried out under subparagraph (A);

34669 and

34670 ``(ii) any recommendations with respect to

34671 those results.

34672 ``(12) Hops.--

34673 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation shall carry out

34674 research and development, or offer to enter into 1 or

34675 more contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to carry

34676 out research and development, regarding a policy to

34677 insure the production of hops or revenue derived from

34678 the production of hops.

34679 ``(B) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date

34680 of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

34681 the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34682 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34683 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34684 Senate a report that describes--

34685 ``(i) the results of the research and

34686 development carried out under subparagraph (A);

34687 and

34688 ``(ii) any recommendations with respect to

34689 those results.

34690 ``(13) Subsurface irrigation practices.--

34691

34692[[Page 132 STAT. 4931]]

34693

34694 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation shall carry out

34695 research and development, or offer to enter into 1 or

34696 more contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to carry

34697 out research and development, regarding the creation of

34698 a separate practice for subsurface irrigation, including

34699 the establishment of a separate transitional yield

34700 within a county that is reflective of the average gain

34701 in productivity and yield associated with the

34702 installation of a subsurface irrigation system.

34703 ``(B) Report.--Not later than 18 months after the

34704 date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

34705 2018, the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34706 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34707 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34708 Senate a report that describes--

34709 ``(i) the results of the research and

34710 development carried out under subparagraph (A);

34711 and

34712 ``(ii) any recommendations with respect to

34713 those results.

34714 ``(14) Grain sorghum.--

34715 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation shall carry out

34716 research and development, or offer to enter into 1 or

34717 more contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to carry

34718 out research and development--

34719 ``(i) regarding improvements to 1 or more

34720 policies to insure irrigated grain sorghum;

34721 ``(ii) regarding alternative methods for

34722 producers with not more than 4 years of production

34723 history to insure irrigated grain sorghum; and

34724 ``(iii) to assess, by county, the difference

34725 in the rate, average yield, and coverage level of

34726 grain sorghum policies compared to policies for

34727 other feed grains in that county.

34728 ``(B) Report.--Not later than 18 months after the

34729 date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

34730 2018, the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34731 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34732 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34733 Senate a report that describes--

34734 ``(i) the results of the research and

34735 development carried out under subparagraph (A);

34736 and

34737 ``(ii) any recommendations with respect to

34738 those results.

34739 ``(15) Limited irrigation practices.--

34740 ``(A) Authority.--The Corporation shall--

34741 ``(i) consider expanding the availability of

34742 the limited irrigation insurance program to

34743 neighboring and similarly situated States (such as

34744 the States of Colorado and Nebraska), as

34745 determined by the Secretary;

34746 ``(ii) carry out research, or offer to enter

34747 into 1 or more contracts with 1 or more qualified

34748 persons to carry out research, on the

34749 marketability of the existing limited irrigation

34750 insurance program; and

34751 ``(iii) make recommendations on how to improve

34752 participation in that program.

34753 ``(B) Research.--In carrying out research under

34754 subparagraph (A), a qualified person shall--

34755

34756[[Page 132 STAT. 4932]]

34757

34758 ``(i) collaborate with researchers on the

34759 subjects of--

34760 ``(I) reduced irrigation practices

34761 or limited irrigation practices; and

34762 ``(II) expected yield reductions

34763 following the application of reduced

34764 irrigation;

34765 ``(ii) collaborate with State and Federal

34766 officials responsible for the collection of water

34767 and the regulation of water use for the purpose of

34768 irrigation;

34769 ``(iii) provide recommendations to encourage

34770 producers to carry out limited irrigation

34771 practices or reduced irrigation and water

34772 conservation practices; and

34773 ``(iv) develop web-based applications that

34774 will streamline access to coverage for producers

34775 electing to conserve water use on irrigated crops.

34776 ``(C) Report.--Not later than 18 months after the

34777 date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

34778 2018, the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34779 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34780 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34781 Senate a report that describes--

34782 ``(i) the results of the research carried out

34783 under subparagraphs (A) and (B);

34784 ``(ii) any recommendations to encourage

34785 producers to carry out limited irrigation

34786 practices or reduced irrigation and water

34787 conservation practices; and

34788 ``(iii) the actions taken by the Corporation

34789 to carry out the recommendations described in

34790 clause (ii).

34791 ``(16) Insurable irrigation practices for rice.--

34792 ``(A) In general.--The Corporation shall carry out

34793 research and development, or offer to enter into 1 or

34794 more contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to carry

34795 out research and development, to include new and

34796 innovative irrigation practices under the current rice

34797 policy or the development of a distinct policy

34798 endorsement rated for rice produced using--

34799 ``(i) alternate wetting and drying practices

34800 (also referred to as `intermittent flooding'); and

34801 ``(ii) furrow irrigation practices.

34802 ``(B) Report.--Not later than 18 months after the

34803 date of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of

34804 2018, the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34805 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34806 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34807 Senate a report that describes--

34808 ``(i) the results of the research and

34809 development carried out under paragraph (1); and

34810 ``(ii) any recommendations with respect to

34811 those results.

34812 ``(17) Greenhouse policy.--

34813 ``(A) In general.--

34814 ``(i) Research and development.--The

34815 Corporation shall carry out research and

34816 development, or offer to enter into 1 or more

34817 contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to

34818 carry out research and development,

34819

34820[[Page 132 STAT. 4933]]

34821

34822 regarding a policy to insure in a controlled

34823 environment such as a greenhouse--

34824 ``(I) the production of

34825 floriculture, nursery, and bedding

34826 plants;

34827 ``(II) the establishment of cuttings

34828 or tissue culture in a growing medium;

34829 or

34830 ``(III) other similar production, as

34831 determined by the Secretary.

34832 ``(ii) Availability of policy.--

34833 Notwithstanding the last sentence of section

34834 508(a)(1), and section 508(a)(2), the Corporation

34835 shall make a policy described in clause (i)

34836 available if the requirements of section 508(h)

34837 are met.

34838 ``(B) Research and development described.--Research

34839 and development described in subparagraph (A)(i) shall

34840 evaluate the effectiveness of policies for the

34841 production of plants in a controlled environment,

34842 including policies that--

34843 ``(i) are based on the risk of--

34844 ``(I) plant diseases introduced from

34845 the environment;

34846 ``(II) contaminated cuttings,

34847 seedlings, or tissue culture; or

34848 ``(III) Federal or State quarantine

34849 or destruction orders associated with

34850 the contaminated items described in

34851 subclause (II);

34852 ``(ii) consider other causes of loss

34853 applicable to a controlled environment, such as a

34854 loss of electricity due to weather;

34855 ``(iii) consider appropriate best practices to

34856 minimize the risk of loss;

34857 ``(iv) consider whether to provide coverage

34858 for various types of plants under 1 policy or to

34859 provide coverage for 1 species or type of plant

34860 per policy;

34861 ``(v) have streamlined reporting and paperwork

34862 requirements that take into account short

34863 propagation schedules, variable crop years, and

34864 the variety of plants that may be produced in a

34865 single facility; and

34866 ``(vi) provide protection for revenue losses.

34867 ``(C) Report.--Not later than 2 years after the date

34868 of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

34869 the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34870 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34871 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34872 Senate a report that describes--

34873 ``(i) the results of the research and

34874 development carried out under subparagraphs (A)(i)

34875 and (B); and

34876 ``(ii) any recommendations with respect to

34877 those results.

34878 ``(18) Local foods.--

34879 ``(A) In general.--

34880 ``(i) Feasibility study.--The Corporation

34881 shall carry out a study to determine the

34882 feasibility of, or offer to enter into 1 or more

34883 contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to

34884 carry out a study to determine the feasibility of,

34885 a policy to insure production--

34886

34887[[Page 132 STAT. 4934]]

34888

34889 ``(I) of floriculture, fruits,

34890 vegetables, poultry, livestock, or the

34891 products of floriculture, fruits,

34892 vegetables, poultry, or livestock; and

34893 ``(II) that is targeted toward local

34894 consumers and markets.

34895 ``(ii) Availability of policy.--

34896 Notwithstanding the last sentence of section

34897 508(a)(1), and section 508(a)(2), the Corporation

34898 shall make available a policy described in clause

34899 (i) if--

34900 ``(I) the results of the feasibility

34901 study under clause (i) are viable; and

34902 ``(II) the requirements of section

34903 508(h) are met.

34904 ``(B) Feasibility study described.--The feasibility

34905 study described in subparagraph (A)(i) shall evaluate

34906 the effectiveness of policies for production targeted

34907 toward local consumers and markets, including policies

34908 that--

34909 ``(i) consider small-scale production in

34910 various areas, including urban, suburban, and

34911 rural areas;

34912 ``(ii) consider a variety of marketing

34913 strategies;

34914 ``(iii) allow for production in soil and in

34915 alternative systems such as vertical systems,

34916 greenhouses, rooftops, or hydroponic systems;

34917 ``(iv) consider the price premium when

34918 accounting for production or revenue losses;

34919 ``(v) consider whether to provide coverage--

34920 ``(I) for various types of

34921 production under 1 policy; and

34922 ``(II) for 1 species or type of

34923 plant per policy; and

34924 ``(vi) have streamlined reporting and

34925 paperwork requirements.

34926 ``(C) Report.--Not later than 2 years after the date

34927 of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

34928 the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34929 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34930 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34931 Senate a report that--

34932 ``(i) examines whether a version of existing

34933 policies such as the whole-farm revenue protection

34934 insurance plan may be tailored to provide improved

34935 coverage for producers of local foods;

34936 ``(ii) describes the results of the

34937 feasibility study carried out under subparagraph

34938 (A)(i); and

34939 ``(iii) includes any recommendations with

34940 respect to those results.

34941 ``(19) High-risk, highly productive batture land policy.--

34942 ``(A) In general.--

34943 ``(i) Research and development.--The

34944 Corporation shall carry out research and

34945 development, or offer to enter into 1 or more

34946 contracts with 1 or more qualified persons to

34947 carry out research and development, regarding a

34948 policy to insure producers of corn, cotton, and

34949 soybeans--

34950

34951[[Page 132 STAT. 4935]]

34952

34953 ``(I) with operations on highly

34954 productive batture land within the Lower

34955 Mississippi River Valley;

34956 ``(II) that have a history of

34957 production of not less than 5 years; and

34958 ``(III) that have been impacted by

34959 more frequent flooding over the past 10

34960 years due to sedimentation or federally

34961 constructed engineering improvements.

34962 ``(ii) Availability of policy.--

34963 Notwithstanding the last sentence of section

34964 508(a)(1), and section 508(a)(2), the Corporation

34965 shall make a policy described in clause (i)

34966 available if the requirements of section 508(h)

34967 are met.

34968 ``(B) Research and development described.--Research

34969 and development described in subparagraph (A)(i) shall

34970 evaluate the feasibility of less cost-prohibitive

34971 policies for batture-land producers in high risk areas,

34972 including policies that--

34973 ``(i) consider premium rate adjustments;

34974 ``(ii) consider automatic yield exclusion for

34975 consecutive-year losses; and

34976 ``(iii) allow for flexibility of final plant

34977 dates and prevent plant regulations.

34978 ``(C) Report.--Not later than 2 years after the date

34979 of enactment of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018,

34980 the Corporation shall submit to the Committee on

34981 Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

34982 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the

34983 Senate a report that--

34984 ``(i) examines whether a version of existing

34985 policies may be tailored to provide improved

34986 coverage for batture-land producers;

34987 ``(ii) describes the results of the research

34988 and development carried out under subparagraphs

34989 (A) and (B); and

34990 ``(iii) includes any recommendations with

34991 respect to those results.''.

34992SEC. 11123. FUNDING FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT.

34993

34994 Section 522(e)(2)(A) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

349951522(e)(2)(A)) is amended--

34996 (1) by striking ``not more than $12,500,000 for fiscal year

34997 2008 and each subsequent fiscal year.'' and inserting the

34998 following: ``not more than--

34999 ``(i) $12,500,000 for each of fiscal years

35000 2008 through 2018; and''; and

35001 (2) by adding at the end the following:

35002 ``(ii) $8,000,000 for fiscal year 2019 and

35003 each fiscal year thereafter.''.

35004SEC. 11124. TECHNICAL AMENDMENT TO PILOT PROGRAMS.

350071523(i)(3)(A)) is amended by adding a period at the end.

35008SEC. 11125. EDUCATION AND RISK MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE.

35009

35010 (a) Education Assistance.--Section 524(a) of the Federal Crop

35011Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1524(a)) is amended--

35012

35013[[Page 132 STAT. 4936]]

35014

35015 (1) in paragraph (1)--

35016 (A) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by

35017 striking ``paragraph (5)'' and all that follows through

35018 ``the Secretary'' in subparagraph (B) and inserting

35019 ``paragraph (4), the Secretary''; and

35020 (B) by striking ``paragraph (3)'' and inserting

35021 ``paragraph (2)'';

35022 (2) by striking paragraph (2);

35023 (3) by redesignating paragraphs (3) through (5) as

35024 paragraphs (2) through (4), respectively;

35025 (4) in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated), in subparagraph

35026 (A)--

35028 inserting ``and providing technical assistance to

35030 and'';

35046 and succession planning, and crop insurance

35047 participation'' after ``benchmarking'';

35049 the end; and

35053 marketing systems to pursue new markets; and

35054 ``(E) producers that are underserved by the Federal

35055 crop insurance program established under this subtitle,

35056 as determined by the Corporation.''; and

35058 (A) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by

35067 carry out paragraph (3)(E).''.

35079SEC. 11126. REPEAL OF CROPLAND REPORT ANNUAL UPDATES.

35083

35084 TITLE XII--MISCELLANEOUS

35085

35086 Subtitle A--Livestock

35087

35088SEC. 12101. ANIMAL DISEASE PREVENTION AND MANAGEMENT.

35089

35090 (a) Definition.--Section 10403 of the Animal Health Protection Act

35091(7 U.S.C. 8302) is amended by adding at the end the following:

35092 ``(18) Veterinary countermeasure.--The term `veterinary

35093 countermeasure' means any biological product (including an

35094 animal vaccine or diagnostic), pharmaceutical product (including

35095 a therapeutic), non-pharmaceutical product (including a

35096 disinfectant), or other product or equipment to prevent, detect,

35097 respond to, or mitigate harm to public or animal health

35098 resulting from, animal pests or diseases.''.

35099

35100 (b) Animal Disease Preparedness and Response.--Section 10409A of the

35101Animal Health Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8308A) is amended--

35102 (1) by striking the section heading and inserting ``animal

35103 disease prevention and management'';

35104 (2) in subsection (a), by striking ``(a) Definition of

35105 Eligible Laboratory.--In this section,'' and inserting the

35106 following:

35107

35108 ``(a) National Animal Health Laboratory Network.--

35109 ``(1) Definition of eligible laboratory.--In this

35110 subsection,'';

35111 (3) in subsection (b)--

35112 (A) in paragraph (2), by redesignating subparagraphs

35113 (A) through (E) as clauses (i) through (v),

35114 respectively, and moving the margins of such clauses (as

35115 so redesignated) 2 ems to the right;

35116 (B) by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (3) as

35117 subparagraphs (A) through (C), respectively, and moving

35118 the margins of such subparagraphs (as so redesignated) 2

35119 ems to the right;

35120 (4) by redesignating subsections (b) and (c) as paragraphs

35121 (2) and (3), respectively, and moving the margins of such

35122 paragraphs (as so redesignated) 2 ems to the right; and

35123 (5) by adding at the end the following:

35124

35125 ``(b) National Animal Disease Preparedness and Response Program.--

35126 ``(1) Program required.--The Secretary shall establish a

35127 program, to be known as the National Animal Disease Preparedness

35128 and Response Program (referred to in this section as `the

35129 Program'), to address the increasing risk of the introduction

35130 and spread within the United States of animal pests and diseases

35131 affecting the economic interests of the livestock and related

35132 industries of the United States, including the maintenance and

35133 expansion of export markets.

35134

35135[[Page 132 STAT. 4938]]

35136

35137 ``(2) Program activities.--Activities under the Program

35138 shall include, to the extent practicable, the following:

35139 ``(A) Enhancing animal pest and disease analysis and

35140 surveillance.

35141 ``(B) Expanding outreach and education.

35142 ``(C) Targeting domestic inspection activities at

35143 vulnerable points in the safeguarding continuum.

35144 ``(D) Enhancing and strengthening threat

35145 identification technology.

35146 ``(E) Improving biosecurity.

35147 ``(F) Enhancing emergency preparedness and response

35148 capabilities, including training additional emergency

35149 response personnel.

35150 ``(G) Conducting technology development to enhance

35151 electronic sharing of animal health data for risk

35152 analysis between State and Federal animal health

35153 officials.

35154 ``(H) Enhancing the development and effectiveness of

35155 animal health technologies to treat and prevent animal

35156 disease, including--

35157 ``(i) veterinary biologics and diagnostics;

35158 ``(ii) animal drugs for minor uses and minor

35159 species;

35160 ``(iii) animal medical devices; and

35161 ``(iv) emerging veterinary countermeasures.

35162 ``(I) Such other activities as determined

35163 appropriate by the Secretary, in consultation with

35164 eligible entities specified in paragraph (3).

35165 ``(3) Eligible entities.--To carry out the Program, the

35166 Secretary shall offer to enter into cooperative agreements or

35167 other legal instruments, as authorized under section 10413

35168 (referred to in this section as `agreements') with eligible

35169 entities, to be selected by the Secretary, which may include any

35170 of the following entities, either individually or in

35171 combination:

35172 ``(A) A State department of agriculture.

35173 ``(B) The office of the chief animal health official

35174 of a State.

35175 ``(C) An entity eligible to receive funds under a

35176 capacity and infrastructure program (as defined in

35177 section 251(f)(1)(C) of the Department of Agriculture

35178 Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6971(f)(1)(C))).

35179 ``(D) A college of veterinary medicine, including a

35180 veterinary emergency team at such college.

35181 ``(E) A State or national livestock producer

35182 organization with direct and significant economic

35183 interest in livestock production.

35184 ``(F) A State emergency agency.

35185 ``(G) A State, national, allied, or regional

35186 veterinary organization or specialty board recognized by

35187 the American Veterinary Medical Association.

35188 ``(H) An Indian Tribe.

35189 ``(I) A Federal agency.

35190 ``(4) Special funding considerations.--In entering into

35191 agreements under this subsection, the Secretary shall give

35192 priority to applications submitted by--

35193 ``(A) a State department of agriculture or an office

35194 of the chief animal health official of a State; or

35195

35196[[Page 132 STAT. 4939]]

35197

35198 ``(B) an eligible entity that will carry out program

35199 activities in a State or region in which--

35200 ``(i) an animal pest or disease is a Federal

35201 concern; or

35202 ``(ii) the Secretary determines a potential

35203 exists for the spread of an animal pest or disease

35204 after taking into consideration--

35205 ``(I) the agricultural industries in

35206 the State or region;

35207 ``(II) factors contributing to

35208 animal pest or disease in the State or

35209 region, such as the climate, natural

35210 resources, and geography of, and native

35211 and exotic wildlife species and other

35212 disease vectors in, the State or region;

35213 and

35214 ``(III) the movement of animals in

35215 the State or region.

35216 ``(5) Consultation.--For purposes of setting priorities

35217 under this subsection, the Secretary shall consult with eligible

35218 entities specified in paragraph (3). The Federal Advisory

35219 Committee Act (5 U.S.C. App.) shall not apply to consultation

35220 carried out under this paragraph.

35221 ``(6) Application.--

35222 ``(A) In general.--An eligible entity specified in

35223 paragraph (3) seeking to enter into an agreement under

35224 the Program shall submit to the Secretary an application

35225 containing such information as the Secretary may

35226 require.

35227 ``(B) Notification.--The Secretary shall notify each

35228 applicant of--

35229 ``(i) the requirements to be imposed on the

35230 eligible entity that is the recipient of funds

35231 under the Program for auditing of, and reporting

35232 on, the use of such funds; and

35233 ``(ii) the criteria to be used to ensure

35234 activities supported using such funds are based on

35235 sound scientific data or thorough risk

35236 assessments.

35237 ``(C) Non-federal contributions.--When deciding

35238 whether to enter into an agreement under the Program

35239 with an eligible entity described in paragraph (3), the

35240 Secretary--

35241 ``(i) may take into consideration an eligible

35242 entity's ability to contribute non-Federal funds

35243 to carry out such an agreement; and

35244 ``(ii) shall not require such an eligible

35245 entity to make such a contribution as a condition

35246 to enter into an agreement.

35247 ``(7) Use of funds.--

35248 ``(A) Use consistent with terms of cooperative

35249 agreement.--The recipient of funds under the Program

35250 shall use the funds for the purposes and in the manner

35251 provided in the agreement under which the funds are

35252 provided.

35253 ``(B) Sub-agreement.--Nothing in this section

35254 prevents an eligible entity from using funds received

35255 under the Program to enter into sub-agreements with

35256 another eligible entity or with a political subdivision

35257 of a State that has legal responsibilities relating to

35258 animal disease prevention, surveillance, or rapid

35259 response.

35260

35261[[Page 132 STAT. 4940]]

35262

35263 ``(8) Reporting requirement.--Not later than 90 days after

35264 the date of completion of an activity conducted using funds

35265 provided under the Program, the recipient of such funds shall

35266 submit to the Secretary a report that describes the purposes and

35267 results of the activities.''.

35268

35269 (c) National Animal Vaccine and Veterinary Countermeasures Bank.--

35270Section 10409A of the Animal Health Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8308A), as

35271amended by subsection (b), is further amended by inserting after

35272subsection (b) (as added by subsection (b)(5) of this section) the

35273following:

35274 ``(c) National Animal Vaccine Bank.--

35275 ``(1) Establishment.--The Secretary shall establish a

35276 national animal vaccine and veterinary countermeasures bank (to

35277 be known as the National Animal Vaccine and Veterinary

35278 Countermeasures Bank and referred to in this subsection as the

35279 `Vaccine Bank') to benefit the domestic interests of the United

35280 States.

35281 ``(2) Elements of vaccine bank.--Through the Vaccine Bank,

35282 the Secretary shall--

35283 ``(A) maintain sufficient quantities of veterinary

35284 countermeasures to appropriately and rapidly respond to

35285 the most damaging animal diseases affecting or with

35286 potential to affect human health or the economy of the

35287 United States; and

35288 ``(B) leverage, when appropriate, the mechanisms and

35289 infrastructure that have been developed for the

35290 management, storage, and distribution of the National

35291 Veterinary Stockpile.

35292 ``(3) Priority for response to foot and mouth disease.--The

35293 Secretary shall prioritize the acquisition and maintenance of

35294 sufficient quantities of foot and mouth disease vaccine and

35295 accompanying diagnostic products for the Vaccine Bank. As part

35296 of such prioritization, the Secretary may offer to enter into

35297 one or more contracts with one or more entities that are capable

35298 of producing foot and mouth disease vaccine and that have surge

35299 production capacity of the vaccine.''.

35300

35301 (d) Funding.--Section 10409A of the Animal Health Protection Act (7

35302U.S.C. 8308A), as amended by subsections (b) and (c), is further amended

35303by striking subsection (d) and inserting the following:

35304 ``(d) Funding.--

35305 ``(1) Mandatory funding.--

35306 ``(A) Fiscal years 2019 through 2022.--Of the funds

35307 of the Commodity Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall

35308 make available to carry out this section $120,000,000

35309 for the period of fiscal years 2019 through 2022, of

35310 which not less than $5,000,000 shall be made available

35311 for each of those fiscal years to carry out subsection

35312 (b).

35313 ``(B) Subsequent fiscal years.--Of the funds of the

35314 Commodity Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall make

35315 available to carry out this section $30,000,000 for

35316 fiscal year 2023 and each fiscal year thereafter, of

35317 which not less than $18,000,000 shall be made available

35318 for each of those fiscal years to carry out subsection

35319 (b).

35320 ``(2) Authorization of appropriations.--

35321 ``(A) National animal health laboratory network.--In

35322 addition to the funds made available under

35323

35324[[Page 132 STAT. 4941]]

35325

35326 paragraph (1), there is authorized to be appropriated

35327 $30,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023

35328 to carry out subsection (a).

35329 ``(B) National animal disease preparedness and

35330 response program; national animal vaccine and veterinary

35331 countermeasures bank.--In addition to the funds made

35332 available under paragraph (1), there is authorized to be

35333 appropriated such sums as are necessary for each of

35334 fiscal years 2019 through 2023 to carry out subsections

35335 (b) and (c).

35336 ``(C) Additionality.--The funds authorized for

35337 appropriation under this paragraph are in addition to

35338 any funds authorized or otherwise made available under

35339 this section or section 10417.

35340 ``(3) Administrative costs.--

35341 ``(A) Secretary.--Of the funds made available under

35342 this section or section 10417 to carry out the National

35343 Animal Health Laboratory Network under subsection (a)

35344 and the National Animal Disease Preparedness and

35345 Response Program under subsection (b), not more than 4

35346 percent may be retained by the Secretary to pay

35347 administrative costs incurred by the Secretary.

35348 ``(B) Eligible entities.--Of the funds made

35349 available under this section or section 10417 to carry

35350 out the National Animal Disease Preparedness and

35351 Response Program under subsection (b), not more than 10

35352 percent may be retained by an eligible entity that

35353 receives funds under any agreement entered into under

35354 such subsection, including any sub-agreement under

35355 paragraph (7)(B) of such subsection to pay

35356 administrative costs incurred by the eligible entity to

35357 carry out activities under the Program.

35358 ``(4) Duration of availability.--Funds made available under

35359 this subsection, including any proceeds credited under paragraph

35360 (5), shall remain available until expended.

35361 ``(5) Proceeds from veterinary countermeasures sales.--Any

35362 proceeds of a sale of veterinary countermeasures from the

35363 Vaccine Bank shall be--

35364 ``(A) deposited into the Treasury of the United

35365 States; and

35366 ``(B) credited to the account for the operation of

35367 the Vaccine Bank to be made available for expenditure

35368 without further appropriation.

35369 ``(6) Limitations on use of funds for certain purposes.--

35370 Funds made available under the National Animal Health Laboratory

35371 Network, the National Animal Disease Preparedness and Response

35372 Program, and the Vaccine Bank shall not be used for the

35373 construction of a new building or facility or the acquisition or

35374 expansion of an existing building or facility, including site

35375 grading and improvement and architect fees.

35376

35377 ``(e) Availability and Purpose of Funding.--

35378 ``(1) In general.--Using the funds made available under

35379 subsection (d), the Secretary of Agriculture shall offer to

35380 enter into contracts, grants, cooperative agreements, or other

35381 legal instruments under subsections (a) through (c) during each

35382 of the fiscal years 2019 through 2023.

35383

35384[[Page 132 STAT. 4942]]

35385

35386 ``(2) Effect.--Nothing in paragraph (1) shall be construed

35387 to terminate a contract, grant, cooperative agreement, or other

35388 legal instrument entered into during the period specified in

35389 such paragraph.''.

35390SEC. 12102. SHEEP PRODUCTION AND MARKETING GRANT PROGRAM.

35391

35392 Section 209(c) of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C.

353931627a(c)) is amended by striking ``$1,500,000 for fiscal year 2014'' and

35394inserting ``$2,000,000 for fiscal year 2019''.

35395SEC. 12103. FEASIBILITY STUDY ON LIVESTOCK DEALER STATUTORY TRUST.

35396

35397 (a) In General.--The Secretary shall conduct a study to determine

35398the feasibility of establishing a livestock dealer statutory trust.

35399 (b) Contents.--The study conducted under subsection (a) shall--

35400 (1) analyze how the establishment of a livestock dealer

35401 statutory trust would affect buyer and seller behavior in

35402 markets for livestock (as defined in section 2(a) of the Packers

35403 and Stockyards Act, 1921 (7 U.S.C. 182));

35404 (2) examine how the establishment of a livestock dealer

35405 statutory trust would affect seller recovery in the event of a

35406 livestock dealer payment default;

35407 (3) consider what potential effects a livestock dealer

35408 statutory trust would have on credit availability, including

35409 impacts on lenders and lending behavior and other industry

35410 participants;

35411 (4) examine unique circumstances common to livestock dealers

35412 and how those circumstances could impact the functionality of a

35413 livestock dealer statutory trust;

35414 (5) study the feasibility of the industry-wide adoption of

35415 electronic funds transfer or another expeditious method of

35416 payment to provide sellers of livestock protection from

35417 nonsufficient funds payments;

35418 (6) assess the effectiveness of statutory trusts in other

35419 segments of agriculture, whether similar effects could be

35420 experienced under a livestock dealer statutory trust, and

35421 whether authorizing the Secretary to appoint an independent

35422 trustee under the livestock dealer statutory trust would improve

35423 seller recovery;

35424 (7) consider the effects of exempting dealers with average

35425 annual purchases under a de minimis threshold from being subject

35426 to the livestock dealer statutory trust; and

35427 (8) analyze how the establishment of a livestock dealer

35428 statutory trust would affect the treatment of sellers of

35429 livestock as it relates to preferential transfer in bankruptcy.

35430

35431 (c) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of

35432this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of

35433the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

35434Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report describing the findings

35435of the study conducted under subsection (a).

35436SEC. 12104. DEFINITION OF LIVESTOCK.

35437

35438 Section 602(2) of the Emergency Livestock Feed Assistance Act of

354391988 (7 U.S.C. 1471(2)) is amended in the matter preceding subparagraph

35440(A) by striking ``fish'' and all that follows through

35441

35442[[Page 132 STAT. 4943]]

35443

35444``that--'' and inserting ``llamas, alpacas, live fish, crawfish, and

35445other animals that--''.

35446SEC. 12105. NATIONAL AQUATIC ANIMAL HEALTH PLAN.

35447

35448 Section 11013 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7

35449U.S.C. 8322) is amended--

35450 (1) by striking subsection (d); and

35451 (2) by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection (d).

35452SEC. 12106. VETERINARY TRAINING.

35453

35454 Section 10504 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002

35455(7 U.S.C. 8318) is amended--

35456 (1) by inserting ``and veterinary teams, including those

35457 based at colleges of veterinary medicine,'' after

35458 ``veterinarians''; and

35459 (2) by inserting before the period at the end the following:

35460 ``and who are capable of providing effective services before,

35461 during, and after emergencies''.

35462SEC. 12107. REPORT ON FSIS GUIDANCE AND OUTREACH TO SMALL MEAT

35463 PROCESSORS.

35464

35465 (a) In General.--The Secretary shall offer to enter into a contract

35466with a land-grant college or university or a non-land-grant college of

35467agriculture (as those terms are defined in section 1404 of the National

35468Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7

35469U.S.C. 3101)) to review the effectiveness of existing Food Safety and

35470Inspection Service guidance materials and other tools used by small and

35471very small establishments, as defined by regulations issued by the Food

35472Safety and Inspection Service, operating under Federal inspection, as in

35473effect on the date of enactment of this Act, including--

35474 (1) the effectiveness of the outreach conducted by the Food

35475 Safety and Inspection Service to small and very small

35476 establishments;

35477 (2) the effectiveness of the guidance materials and other

35478 tools used by the Food Safety and Inspection Service to assist

35479 small and very small establishments; and

35480 (3) the responsiveness of Food Safety and Inspection Service

35481 personnel to inquiries and issues from small and very small

35482 establishments.

35483

35484 (b) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment

35485of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture

35486of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture,

35487Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report that describes--

35488 (1) the results of the review conducted under subsection

35489 (a); and

35490 (2) recommendations on measures the Food Safety and

35491 Inspection Service should take to improve regulatory clarity and

35492 consistency and ensure all guidance materials and other tools

35493 take into account small and very small establishments.

35494SEC. 12108. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 1622 note.&gt;&gt; REGIONAL CATTLE AND

35495 CARCASS GRADING CORRELATION AND

35496 TRAINING CENTERS.

35497

35498 (a) In General.--The Secretary shall establish not more than 3

35499regional centers, to be known as Cattle and Carcass Grading Correlation

35500and Training Centers (referred to in this section as the ``Centers''),

35501to provide education and training for cattle and

35502

35503[[Page 132 STAT. 4944]]

35504

35505carcass beef graders of the Agricultural Marketing Service, cattle

35506producers, and other professionals involved in the reporting, delivery,

35507and grading of feeder cattle, live cattle, and carcasses--

35508 (1) to limit the subjectivity in the application of beef

35509 grading standards;

35510 (2) to provide producers with greater confidence in the

35511 price of the producers' cattle; and

35512 (3) to provide investors with both long and short positions

35513 more assurance in the cattle delivery system.

35514

35515 (b) Location.--The Centers shall be located near cattle feeding and

35516slaughter populations and areas shall be strategically identified in

35517order to capture regional variances in cattle production.

35518 (c) Administration.--Each Center shall be organized and administered

35519by offices of the Department of Agriculture in operation on the date on

35520which the respective Center is established, or in coordination with

35521other appropriate Federal agencies or academic institutions.

35522 (d) Training Program.--The Centers shall offer intensive

35523instructional programs involving classroom and field training work for

35524individuals described in subsection (a).

35525 (e) Coordination of Resources.--Each Center, in carrying out the

35526functions of the Center, shall make use of information generated by the

35527Department of Agriculture, the State agricultural extension and research

35528stations, relevant designated contract markets, and the practical

35529experience of area cattle producers, especially cattle producers

35530cooperating in on-farm demonstrations, correlations, and research

35531projects.

35532 (f) Prohibition on Construction.--Funds made available to carry out

35533this section shall not be used for the construction of a new building or

35534facility or the acquisition, expansion, remodeling, or alteration of an

35535existing building or facility (including site grading and improvement,

35536and architect fees). Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, the

35537Secretary may use funds made available to carry out this section to

35538provide a Center with payment for the cost of the rental of a space

35539determined to be necessary by the Center for conducting training under

35540this section and may accept donations (including in-kind contributions)

35541to cover such cost.

35542

35543 Subtitle B--Agriculture and Food Defense

35544

35545SEC. 12201. REPEAL OF OFFICE OF HOMELAND SECURITY.

35546

35547 Section 14111 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (7

35548U.S.C. 8911) is repealed.

35549SEC. 12202. OFFICE OF HOMELAND SECURITY.

35550

35551 Subtitle A of the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of

355521994 (7 U.S.C. 6911 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the

35553following:

35554``SEC. 221. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6922.&gt;&gt; OFFICE OF HOMELAND SECURITY.

35555

35556 ``(a) Definition of Agriculture and Food Defense.--In this section,

35557the term `agriculture and food defense' means any action to prevent,

35558protect against, mitigate the effects of, respond to, or recover from a

35559naturally occurring, unintentional, or intentional threat to the

35560agriculture and food system.

35561

35562[[Page 132 STAT. 4945]]

35563

35564 ``(b) Authorization.--The Secretary shall establish in the

35565Department the Office of Homeland Security.

35566 ``(c) Executive Director.--The Office of Homeland Security shall be

35567headed by an Executive Director, who shall be known as the Executive

35568Director of Homeland Security.

35569 ``(d) Duties.--The Executive Director of Homeland Security shall--

35570 ``(1) serve as the principal advisor to the Secretary on

35571 homeland security, including emergency management and

35572 agriculture and food defense;

35573 ``(2) coordinate activities of the Department, including

35574 policies, processes, budget needs, and oversight relating to

35575 homeland security, including emergency management and

35576 agriculture and food defense;

35577 ``(3) act as the primary liaison on behalf of the Department

35578 with other Federal departments and agencies in activities

35579 relating to homeland security, including emergency management

35580 and agriculture and food defense, and provide for interagency

35581 coordination and data sharing;

35582 ``(4)(A) coordinate in the Department the gathering of

35583 information relevant to early warning and awareness of threats

35584 and risks to the food and agriculture critical infrastructure

35585 sector; and

35586 ``(B) share that information with, and provide assistance

35587 with interpretation and risk characterization of that

35588 information to, the intelligence community (as defined in

35589 section 3 of the National Security Act of 1947 (50 U.S.C.

35590 3003)), law enforcement agencies, the Secretary of Defense, the

35591 Secretary of Homeland Security, the Secretary of Health and

35592 Human Services, and State fusion centers (as defined in section

35593 210A(j) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 124h(j));

35594 ``(5) liaise with the Director of National Intelligence to

35595 assist in the development of periodic assessments and

35596 intelligence estimates, or other intelligence products, that

35597 support the defense of the food and agriculture critical

35598 infrastructure sector;

35599 ``(6) coordinate the conduct, evaluation, and improvement of

35600 exercises to identify and eliminate gaps in preparedness and

35601 response;

35602 ``(7) produce a Department-wide centralized strategic

35603 coordination plan to provide a high-level perspective of the

35604 operations of the Department relating to homeland security,

35605 including emergency management and agriculture and food defense;

35606 and

35607 ``(8) carry out other appropriate duties, as determined by

35608 the Secretary.

35609

35610 ``(e) Agriculture and Food Threat Awareness Partnership Program.--

35611 ``(1) Interagency exchange program.--The Secretary, in

35612 partnership with the intelligence community (as defined in

35613 section 3 of the National Security Act of 1947 (50 U.S.C. 3003))

35614 and fusion centers (as defined in section 210A(j) of the

35615 Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 124h(j)) that have

35616 analysis and intelligence capabilities relating to the defense

35617 of the food and agriculture critical infrastructure sector,

35618 shall establish and carry out an interagency exchange program of

35619 personnel and information to improve communication and analysis

35620 for

35621

35622[[Page 132 STAT. 4946]]

35623

35624 the defense of the food and agriculture critical infrastructure

35625 sector.

35626 ``(2) Collaboration with federal, state, and local

35627 authorities.--To carry out the program established under

35628 paragraph (1), the Secretary may--

35629 ``(A) enter into 1 or more cooperative agreements or

35630 contracts with Federal, State, or local authorities that

35631 have analysis and intelligence capabilities and

35632 expertise relating to the defense of the food and

35633 agriculture critical infrastructure sector; and

35634 ``(B) carry out any other activity under any other

35635 authority of the Secretary that is appropriate to engage

35636 the authorities described in subparagraph (A) for the

35637 defense of the food and agriculture critical

35638 infrastructure sector, as determined by the

35639 Secretary.''.

35640SEC. 12203. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 8914.&gt;&gt; AGRICULTURE AND FOOD DEFENSE.

35641

35642 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

35643 (1) Animal.--The term ``animal'' has the meaning given the

35644 term in section 10403 of the Animal Health Protection Act (7

35645 U.S.C. 8302).

35646 (2) Disease or pest of concern.--The term ``disease or pest

35647 of concern'' means a plant or animal disease or pest that--

35648 (A) is--

35649 (i) a transboundary disease; or

35650 (ii) an established disease; and

35651 (B) is likely to pose a significant risk to the food

35652 and agriculture critical infrastructure sector that

35653 warrants efforts at prevention, protection, mitigation,

35654 response, and recovery.

35655 (3) Established disease.--The term ``established disease''

35656 means a plant or animal disease or pest that--

35657 (A)(i) if it becomes established, poses an imminent

35658 threat to agriculture in the United States; or

35659 (ii) has become established, as defined by the

35660 Secretary, within the United States; and

35661 (B) requires management.

35662 (4) High-consequence plant transboundary disease.--The term

35663 ``high-consequence plant transboundary disease'' means a

35664 transboundary disease that is--

35665 (A)(i) a plant disease; or

35666 (ii) a plant pest; and

35667 (B) of high consequence, as determined by the

35668 Secretary.

35669 (5) Pest.--The term ``pest''--

35670 (A) with respect to a plant, has the meaning given

35671 the term ``plant pest'' in section 403 of the Plant

35672 Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 7702); and

35673 (B) with respect to an animal, has the meaning given

35674 the term in section 10403 of the Animal Health

35675 Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8302).

35676 (6) Plant.--The term ``plant'' has the meaning given the

35677 term in section 403 of the Plant Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 7702).

35678 (7) Plant health management strategy.--The term ``plant

35679 health management strategy'' means a strategy to timely control

35680 and eradicate a plant disease or plant pest outbreak,

35681

35682[[Page 132 STAT. 4947]]

35683

35684 including through mitigation (such as chemical control),

35685 surveillance, the use of diagnostic products and procedures, and

35686 the use of existing resistant seed stock.

35687 (8) Transboundary disease.--

35688 (A) In general.--The term ``transboundary disease''

35689 means a plant or animal disease or pest that is within 1

35690 or more countries outside of the United States.

35691 (B) Inclusion.--The term ``transboundary disease''

35692 includes a plant or animal disease or pest described in

35693 subparagraph (A) that--

35694 (i) has emerged within the United States; or

35695 (ii) has been introduced within the United

35696 States.

35697 (9) Veterinary countermeasure.--The term ``veterinary

35698 countermeasure'' has the meaning given such term in section

35699 10403 of the Animal Health Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8302).

35700

35701 (b) Disease or Pest of Concern Response Planning.--

35702 (1) In general.--The Secretary shall--

35703 (A) establish a list of diseases or pests of concern

35704 by--

35705 (i) developing a process to solicit and

35706 receive expert opinion and evidence relating to

35707 the diseases or pests of concern entered on the

35708 list; and

35709 (ii) reviewing all available evidence relating

35710 to the diseases or pests of concern entered on the

35711 list, including classified information; and

35712 (B) periodically update the list established under

35713 subparagraph (A).

35714 (2) Response plans.--

35715 (A) Comprehensive strategic response plan or

35716 plans.--The Secretary shall develop, in collaboration

35717 with appropriate Federal, State, regional, and local

35718 officials, a comprehensive strategic response plan or

35719 plans, as appropriate, for the diseases or pests of

35720 concern that are entered on the list established under

35721 paragraph (1).

35722 (B) State or region response plan or plans.--The

35723 Secretary shall provide information to a State or region

35724 to assist in producing a response plan or plans that

35725 shall include a concept of operations for a disease or

35726 pest of concern or a platform concept of operations for

35727 responses to similar diseases or pests of concern that

35728 are determined to be a priority to the State or region

35729 that shall, as appropriate--

35730 (i) describe the appropriate interactions

35731 among, and roles of--

35732 (I) Federal, State, Tribal, and

35733 units of local government; and

35734 (II) plant or animal industry

35735 partners;

35736 (ii) include a decision matrix or dynamic

35737 decision modeling tools that, as appropriate,

35738 include--

35739 (I) information and timing

35740 requirements necessary for the use of

35741 veterinary countermeasures;

35742 (II) plant health management

35743 strategies;

35744 (III) deployment of other key

35745 materials and resources; and

35746 (IV) parameters for transitioning

35747 from outbreak response to disease

35748 management;

35749

35750[[Page 132 STAT. 4948]]

35751

35752 (iii) identify key response performance

35753 metrics to establish--

35754 (I) benchmarking to provide

35755 assessments of capabilities, capacity,

35756 and readiness to achieve response goals

35757 and objectives;

35758 (II) progressive exercise

35759 evaluation; and

35760 (III) continuing improvement of a

35761 response plan, including by providing

35762 for--

35763 (aa) ongoing exercises;

35764 (bb) improvement planning

35765 and the implementation of

35766 corrective actions to enhance a

35767 response plan over time; and

35768 (cc) strategic information

35769 to guide investment in any

35770 appropriate research to mitigate

35771 the risk of a disease or pest of

35772 concern; and

35773 (iv) be updated periodically, including in

35774 response to--

35775 (I) an exercise evaluation; or

35776 (II) new risk information becoming

35777 available regarding a disease or pest of

35778 concern.

35779 (3) Coordination of plans.--Pursuant to section 221(d)(6) of

35780 the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994, as

35781 added by section 12202, the Secretary shall, as appropriate,

35782 assist in coordinating with other appropriate Federal, State,

35783 regional, or local officials in the exercising of the plans

35784 developed under paragraph (2).

35785

35786 (c) National Plant Diagnostic Network.--

35787 (1) In general.--The Secretary shall establish in the

35788 Department of Agriculture a National Plant Diagnostic Network to

35789 monitor and surveil through diagnostics threats to plant health

35790 from diseases or pests of concern in the United States.

35791 (2) Requirements.--The National Plant Diagnostic Network

35792 established under paragraph (1) shall--

35793 (A) provide for increased awareness, surveillance,

35794 early identification, rapid communication, warning, and

35795 diagnosis of a threat to plant health from a disease or

35796 pest of concern to protect natural and agricultural

35797 plant resources;

35798 (B) coordinate and collaborate with agencies of the

35799 Department of Agriculture and State agencies and

35800 authorities involved in plant health;

35801 (C) establish diagnostic laboratory standards;

35802 (D) establish regional hubs throughout the United

35803 States that provide expertise, leadership, and support

35804 to diagnostic labs relating to the agricultural crops

35805 and plants in the covered regions of those hubs; and

35806 (E) establish a national repository for records of

35807 endemic or emergent diseases and pests of concern.

35808 (3) Head of network.--

35809 (A) In general.--The Director of the National

35810 Institute of Food and Agriculture shall serve as the

35811 head of the National Plant Diagnostic Network.

35812 (B) Duties.--The head of the National Plant

35813 Diagnostic Network shall--

35814 (i) coordinate and collaborate with land-grant

35815 colleges and universities (as defined in section

35816 1404 of the National Agricultural Research,

35817 Extension, and

35818

35819[[Page 132 STAT. 4949]]

35820

35821 Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103)) in

35822 carrying out the requirements under paragraph (2),

35823 including through cooperative agreements described

35824 in paragraph (4);

35825 (ii) partner with the Administrator of the

35826 Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service for

35827 assistance with plant health regulation and

35828 inspection; and

35829 (iii) coordinate with other Federal agencies,

35830 as appropriate, in carrying out activities

35831 relating to the National Plant Diagnostic Network,

35832 including the sharing of biosurveillance

35833 information.

35834 (4) Collaboration with land-grant colleges and

35835 universities.--The Secretary shall seek to establish cooperative

35836 agreements with land-grant colleges and universities (as defined

35837 in section 1404 of the National Agricultural Research,

35838 Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103)) that

35839 have the appropriate level of skill, experience, and competence

35840 with plant diseases or pests of concern.

35841 (5) Authorization of appropriations.--In addition to the

35842 amount authorized to carry out this subtitle under section

35843 12205, there is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this

35844 subsection $15,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through

35845 2023.

35846

35847 (d) National Plant Disease Recovery System.--

35848 (1) Recovery system.--The Secretary shall establish in the

35849 Department of Agriculture a National Plant Disease Recovery

35850 System to engage in strategic long-range planning to recover

35851 from high-consequence plant transboundary diseases.

35852 (2) Requirements.--The National Plant Disease Recovery

35853 System established under paragraph (1) shall--

35854 (A) coordinate with disease or pest of concern

35855 concept of operations response plans;

35856 (B) make long-range plans for the initiation of

35857 future research projects relating to high-consequence

35858 plant transboundary diseases;

35859 (C) establish research plans for long-term recovery;

35860 (D) plan for the identification and use of specific

35861 genotypes, cultivars, breeding lines, and other disease-

35862 resistant materials necessary for crop stabilization or

35863 improvement; and

35864 (E) establish a watch list of high-consequence plant

35865 transboundary diseases for the purpose of making long-

35866 range plans under subparagraph (B).

35867SEC. 12204. BIOLOGICAL AGENTS AND TOXINS LIST.

35868

35869 Section 212(a)(1)(B)(i) of the Agricultural Bioterrorism Protection

35870Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 8401(a)(1)(B)(i)) is amended--

35871 (1) in subclause (III), by striking ``and'' at the end;

35872 (2) by redesignating subclause (IV) as subclause (V); and

35873 (3) by inserting after subclause (III) the following:

35874 ``(IV)(aa) whether such inclusion

35875 would have a substantial negative impact

35876 on the research and development of

35877 solutions for the animal or plant

35878 disease caused by the agent or toxin;

35879 and

35880 ``(bb) whether the negative impact

35881 described in item (aa) would

35882 substantially outweigh the risk

35883

35884[[Page 132 STAT. 4950]]

35885

35886 posed by the agent or toxin to animal or

35887 plant health if it is not included on

35888 the list; and''.

35889SEC. 12205. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

35890

35891 In addition to other amounts made available under this subtitle,

35892there is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this subtitle

35893$5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.

35894

35895 Subtitle C--Historically Underserved Producers

35896

35897SEC. 12301. FARMING OPPORTUNITIES TRAINING AND OUTREACH.

35898

35899 (a) Repeal.--

35900 (1) In general.--Section 7405 of the Farm Security and Rural

35901 Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 3319f) is repealed.

35902 (2) Conforming amendments.--

35903 (A) Section 226B(e)(2)(B) of the Department of

35904 Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C.

35905 6934(e)(2)(B)) is amended by striking ``the beginning

35906 farmer and rancher development program established under

35907 section 7405 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment

35908 Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 3319f).'' and inserting ``the

35909 beginning farmer and rancher development grant program

35910 established under subsection (d) of section 2501 of the

35911 Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990

35912 (7 U.S.C. 2279).''.

35913 (B) Section 251(f)(1)(D) of the Department of

35914 Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C.

35915 6971(f)(1)(D)) is amended by striking clause (iv) and

35916 inserting the following:

35917 ``(iv) The beginning farmer and rancher

35918 development grant program established under

35919 subsection (d) of section 2501 of the Food,

35920 Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990

35921 (7 U.S.C. 2279).''.

35922 (C) Section 7506(e) of the Food, Conservation, and

35923 Energy Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 7614c(e)) is amended--

35924 (i) in paragraph (2)(C)--

35925 (I) by striking clause (v);

35926 (II) by redesignating clauses (i)

35927 through (iv) as clauses (ii) through

35928 (v), respectively;

35929 (III) by inserting before clause

35930 (ii) (as so redesignated) the following:

35931 ``(i) each grant and cooperative agreement

35932 awarded under subsection (d) of section 2501 of

35933 the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act

35934 of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279);'';

35935 (IV) in clause (ii) (as so

35936 redesignated), by striking

35937 ``450i(b)(2));'' and inserting

35938 ``3157(b)(2));''; and

35939 (V) in clause (iv) (as so

35940 redesignated), by adding ``and'' at the

35941 end; and

35942 (ii) in paragraph (4)--

35943 (I) by striking subparagraph (E);

35944 (II) by redesignating subparagraphs

35945 (A) through (D) as subparagraphs (B)

35946 through (E), respectively;

35947

35948[[Page 132 STAT. 4951]]

35949

35950 (III) by inserting before

35951 subparagraph (B) (as so redesignated)

35952 the following:

35953 ``(A) subsection (d) of section 2501 of the Food,

35954 Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7

35955 U.S.C. 2279);'';

35956 (IV) in subparagraph (B) (as so

35957 redesignated), by striking ``450i(b));''

35958 and inserting ``3157(b));'';

35959 (V) in subparagraph (D) (as so

35960 redesignated), by adding ``or'' at the

35961 end; and

35962 (VI) in subparagraph (E) (as so

35963 redesignated), by striking ``; or'' and

35964 inserting a period.

35965

35966 (b) Outreach and Education for Socially Disadvantaged Farmers and

35967Ranchers, Veteran Farmers and Ranchers, and Beginning Farmers and

35968Ranchers.--Section 2501 of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and

35969Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279) is amended--

35970 (1) by striking the section heading and inserting ``farming

35971 opportunities training and outreach'';

35972 (2) by redesignating subsection (i) as paragraph (5) (and

35973 moving the margins of such paragraph 2 ems to the right) and

35974 moving such paragraph (as so redesignated) so as to follow

35975 subsection (a)(4);

35976 (3) by redesignating subsections (a) (as amended by

35977 paragraph (2)), (b), (c), (d), (e), (g), and (h) as subsections

35978 (c), (g), (k), (h), (a), (i), and (j), respectively, and moving

35979 the subsections so as to appear in alphabetical order;

35980 (4) by moving paragraph (5) of subsection (a) (as so

35981 redesignated) so as to appear at the end of subsection (c) (as

35982 so redesignated) and redesignating such paragraph as paragraph

35983 (6);

35984 (5) in subsection (a) (as so redesignated)--

35985 (A) by striking the subsection designation and

35986 heading and inserting the following:

35987

35988 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:'';

35989 (B) by redesignating paragraphs (1), (2), (3), (4),

35990 and (6) as paragraphs (6), (5), (1), (3), and (4),

35991 respectively, and moving the paragraphs so as to appear

35992 in numerical order;

35993 (C) in paragraphs (1), (5), and (6) (as so

35994 redesignated), by striking ``As used in this section,

35995 the'' each place it appears and inserting ``The'';

35996 (D) in paragraph (1) (as so redesignated)--

35997 (i) in the paragraph heading, by striking

35998 ``agriculture'' and inserting ``agricultural'';

35999 and

36000 (ii) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A),

36001 by striking ``agriculture'' and inserting

36002 ``agricultural''; and

36003 (E) by inserting after paragraph (1) (as so

36004 redesignated) the following:

36005 ``(2) Beginning farmer or rancher.--The term `beginning

36006 farmer or rancher' means a person that--

36007 ``(A)(i) has not operated a farm or ranch; or

36008 ``(ii) has operated a farm or ranch for not more

36009 than 10 years; and

36010 ``(B) meets such other criteria as the Secretary may

36011 establish.'';

36012 (6) by inserting after subsection (a) (as so redesignated)

36013 the following:

36014

36015[[Page 132 STAT. 4952]]

36016

36017 ``(b) Farming Opportunities Training and Outreach.--The Secretary

36018shall carry out this section to encourage and assist socially

36019disadvantaged farmers and ranchers, veteran farmers and ranchers, and

36020beginning farmers and ranchers in the ownership and operation of farms

36021and ranches through--

36022 ``(1) education and training; and

36023 ``(2) equitable participation in all agricultural programs

36024 of the Department.'';

36029 Ranchers'' after ``Assistance'';

36038 subsection, the term'';

36041 subsection''; and

36042 (iii) in subparagraph (F), by striking

36043 ``450b))'' and inserting ``5304))'';
