36045 (i) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A),

36046 by striking ``The Secretary of Agriculture shall

36047 carry out'' and inserting ``Using funds made

36048 available under subsection (l), the Secretary of

36049 Agriculture shall, for the period of fiscal years

36050 2019 through 2023, carry out''; and

36051 (ii) in subparagraph (B), by striking

36052 ``agricultural'' and inserting ``agricultural,

36053 forestry, and related'';

36054 (iii) by striking ``agricultural'' and

36055 inserting ``agricultural, forestry, and related'';

36056 (F) in paragraph (3) (as so redesignated), by

36057 striking ``(1)'' in the matter preceding subparagraph

36058 (A) and inserting ``(2)''; and

36059 (G) in paragraph (4) (as so redesignated)--

36060 (i) in subparagraph (A)--

36061 (I) by striking the subparagraph

36062 heading and inserting ``Outreach and

36063 technical assistance.--'';

36064 (II) by striking ``(2)'' and

36065 inserting ``(3)''; and

36066 (III) by inserting ``to socially

36067 disadvantaged farmers and ranchers and

36068 veteran farmers and ranchers'' after

36069 ``assistance'';

36070 (ii) in subparagraph (C), by striking ``(1)''

36071 and inserting ``(2)'';

36072 (iii) in subparagraph (D), by adding at the

36073 end the following:

36074 ``(v) The number of farms or ranches started,

36075 maintained, or improved as a result of funds made

36076 available under the program.

36077

36078[[Page 132 STAT. 4953]]

36079

36080 ``(vi) Actions taken by the Secretary in

36081 partnership with eligible entities to enhance

36082 participation in agricultural programs by veteran

36083 farmers or ranchers and socially disadvantaged

36084 farmers or ranchers.

36085 ``(vii) The effectiveness of the actions

36086 described in clause (vi).''; and

36087 (iv) by adding at the end the following:

36088 ``(E) Maximum term and amount of grant, contract, or

36089 agreement.--A grant, contract, or agreement entered into

36090 under subparagraph (A) shall be--

36091 ``(i) for a term of not longer than 3 years;

36092 and

36093 ``(ii) in an amount that is not more than

36094 $250,000 for each year of the grant, contract, or

36095 agreement.

36096 ``(F) Priority.--In making grants and entering into

36097 contracts and other agreements under subparagraph (A),

36098 the Secretary shall give priority to nongovernmental and

36099 community-based organizations with an expertise in

36100 working with socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers

36101 or veteran farmers and ranchers.

36102 ``(G) Regional balance.--To the maximum extent

36103 practicable, the Secretary shall ensure the geographical

36104 diversity of eligible entities to which grants are made

36105 and contracts and other agreements are entered into

36106 under subparagraph (A).

36107 ``(H) Prohibition.--A grant, contract, or other

36108 agreement under subparagraph (A) may not be used for the

36109 planning, repair, rehabilitation, acquisition, or

36110 construction of a building or facility.

36111 ``(I) Peer review.--The Secretary shall establish a

36112 fair and efficient external peer review process that--

36113 ``(i) the Secretary shall use in making grants

36114 and entering into contracts and other agreements

36115 under subparagraph (A); and

36116 ``(ii) shall include a broad representation of

36117 peers of the eligible entity.

36118 ``(J) Input from eligible entities.--The Secretary

36119 shall seek input from eligible entities providing

36120 technical assistance under this subsection not less than

36121 once each year to ensure that the program is responsive

36122 to the eligible entities providing that technical

36123 assistance.'';

36124 (8) by inserting after subsection (c) (as so redesignated)

36125 the following:

36126

36127 ``(d) Beginning Farmer and Rancher Development Grant Program.--

36128 ``(1) In general.--Using funds made available under

36129 subsection (l), the Secretary, acting through the Director of

36130 the National Institute of Food and Agriculture, shall, for the

36131 period of fiscal years 2019 through 2023, make competitive

36132 grants or enter into cooperative agreements to support new and

36133 established local and regional training, education, outreach,

36134 and technical assistance initiatives to increase opportunities

36135 for beginning farmers and ranchers.

36136 ``(2) Included programs and services.--Initiatives described

36137 in paragraph (1) may include programs or services, as

36138 appropriate, relating to--

36139 ``(A) basic livestock, forest management, and crop

36140 farming practices;

36141

36142[[Page 132 STAT. 4954]]

36143

36144 ``(B) innovative farm, ranch, and private,

36145 nonindustrial forest land transfer and succession

36146 strategies;

36147 ``(C) entrepreneurship and business training;

36148 ``(D) technical assistance to help beginning farmers

36149 or ranchers acquire land from retiring farmers and

36150 ranchers;

36151 ``(E) financial and risk management training,

36152 including the acquisition and management of agricultural

36153 credit;

36154 ``(F) natural resource management and planning;

36155 ``(G) diversification and marketing strategies;

36156 ``(H) curriculum development;

36157 ``(I) mentoring, apprenticeships, and internships;

36158 ``(J) resources and referral;

36159 ``(K) farm financial benchmarking;

36160 ``(L) agricultural rehabilitation and vocational

36161 training for veteran farmers and ranchers;

36162 ``(M) farm safety and awareness;

36163 ``(N) food safety and recordkeeping; and

36164 ``(O) other similar subject areas of use to

36165 beginning farmers and ranchers.

36166 ``(3) Eligibility.--

36167 ``(A) In general.--To be eligible to receive a grant

36168 or enter into a cooperative agreement under this

36169 subsection, the recipient of the grant or participant in

36170 the cooperative agreement shall be a collaborative

36171 State, Tribal, local, or regionally-based network or

36172 partnership of public or private entities.

36173 ``(B) Inclusions.--A recipient of a grant or a

36174 participant that enters into a cooperative agreement

36175 described in subparagraph (A) may include--

36176 ``(i) a State cooperative extension service;

36177 ``(ii) a Federal, State, municipal, or Tribal

36178 agency;

36179 ``(iii) a community-based or nongovernmental

36180 organization;

36181 ``(iv) a college or university (including an

36182 institution awarding an associate's degree) or

36183 foundation maintained by a college or university;

36184 or

36185 ``(v) any other appropriate partner, as

36186 determined by the Secretary.

36187 ``(4) Terms of grants or cooperative agreement.--A grant or

36188 cooperative agreement under this subsection shall--

36189 ``(A) be for a term of not longer than 3 years; and

36190 ``(B) provide not more than $250,000 for each year.

36191 ``(5) Matching requirement.--

36192 ``(A) In general.--Except as provided in

36193 subparagraph (B), to be eligible to receive a grant or

36194 enter into a cooperative agreement under this

36195 subsection, a recipient or participant shall provide a

36196 match in the form of cash or in-kind contributions in an

36197 amount equal to 25 percent of the funds provided by the

36198 grant or cooperative agreement.

36199 ``(B) Exception.--The Secretary may waive or reduce

36200 the matching requirement in subparagraph (A) if the

36201 Secretary determines such a waiver or modification is

36202 necessary to effectively reach an underserved area or

36203 population.

36204

36205[[Page 132 STAT. 4955]]

36206

36207 ``(6) Evaluation criteria.--In making grants or entering

36208 into cooperative agreements under this subsection, the Secretary

36209 shall evaluate, with respect to applications for the grants or

36210 cooperative agreements--

36211 ``(A) relevancy;

36212 ``(B) technical merit;

36213 ``(C) achievability;

36214 ``(D) the expertise and track record of 1 or more

36215 applicants;

36216 ``(E) the consultation of beginning farmers and

36217 ranchers in design, implementation, and decisionmaking

36218 relating to an initiative described in paragraph (1);

36219 ``(F) the adequacy of plans for--

36220 ``(i) a participatory evaluation process;

36221 ``(ii) outcome-based reporting; and

36222 ``(iii) the communication of findings and

36223 results beyond the immediate target audience; and

36224 ``(G) other appropriate factors, as determined by

36225 the Secretary.

36226 ``(7) Regional balance.--To the maximum extent practicable,

36227 the Secretary shall ensure the geographical diversity of

36228 recipients of grants or participants in cooperative agreements

36229 under this subsection.

36230 ``(8) Priority.--In making grants or entering into

36231 cooperative agreements under this subsection, the Secretary

36232 shall give priority to partnerships and collaborations that are

36233 led by or include nongovernmental, community-based organizations

36234 and school-based educational organizations with expertise in new

36235 agricultural producer training and outreach.

36236 ``(9) Prohibition.--A grant made or cooperative agreement

36237 entered into under this subsection may not be used for the

36238 planning, repair, rehabilitation, acquisition, or construction

36239 of a building or facility.

36240 ``(10) Coordination permitted.--A recipient of a grant or

36241 participant in a cooperative agreement under this subsection may

36242 coordinate with a recipient of a grant or cooperative agreement

36243 under section 1680 in addressing the needs of veteran farmers

36244 and ranchers with disabilities.

36245 ``(11) Consecutive awards.--A grant or cooperative agreement

36246 under this subsection may be made to a recipient or participant

36247 for consecutive years.

36248 ``(12) Peer review.--

36249 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall establish a

36250 fair and efficient external peer review process, which

36251 the Secretary shall use in making grants or entering

36252 into cooperative agreements under this subsection.

36253 ``(B) Requirement.--The peer review process under

36254 subparagraph (A) shall include a review panel composed

36255 of a broad representation of peers of the applicant for

36256 the grant or cooperative agreement that are not applying

36257 for a grant or cooperative agreement under this

36258 subsection.

36259 ``(13) Participation by other farmers and ranchers.--Nothing

36260 in this subsection prohibits the Secretary from allowing a

36261 farmer or rancher who is not a beginning farmer or rancher

36262 (including an owner or operator that has ended, or expects to

36263 end within 5 years, active labor in a farming or ranching

36264 operation as a producer, retiring farmers, and non-farming

36265

36266[[Page 132 STAT. 4956]]

36267

36268 landowners) from participating in a program or service under

36269 this subsection, to the extent that the Secretary determines

36270 that such participation--

36271 ``(A) is appropriate; and

36272 ``(B) will not detract from the primary purpose of

36273 increasing opportunities for beginning farmers and

36274 ranchers.

36275 ``(14) Education teams.--

36276 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall establish

36277 beginning farmer and rancher education teams to develop

36278 curricula, conduct educational programs and workshops

36279 for beginning farmers and ranchers in diverse

36280 geographical areas of the United States, or provide

36281 training and technical assistance initiatives for

36282 beginning farmers or ranchers or for trainers and

36283 service providers that work with beginning farmers or

36284 ranchers.

36285 ``(B) Curriculum.--In promoting the development of

36286 curricula, educational programs and workshops, or

36287 training and technical assistance initiatives under

36288 subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall, to the maximum

36289 extent practicable, include content tailored to specific

36290 audiences of beginning farmers and ranchers, based on

36291 crop diversity or regional diversity.

36292 ``(C) Composition.--In establishing an education

36293 team under subparagraph (A) for a specific program or

36294 workshop, the Secretary shall, to the maximum extent

36295 practicable--

36296 ``(i) obtain the short-term services of

36297 specialists with knowledge and expertise in

36298 programs serving beginning farmers and ranchers;

36299 and

36300 ``(ii) use officers and employees of the

36301 Department with direct experience in programs of

36302 the Department that may be taught as part of the

36303 curriculum for the program or workshop.

36304 ``(D) Cooperation.--

36305 ``(i) In general.--In carrying out this

36306 subsection, the Secretary shall cooperate, to the

36307 maximum extent practicable, with--

36308 ``(I) State cooperative extension

36309 services;

36310 ``(II) Federal, State, and Tribal

36311 agencies;

36312 ``(III) community-based and

36313 nongovernmental organizations;

36314 ``(IV) colleges and universities

36315 (including an institution awarding an

36316 associate's degree) or foundations

36317 maintained by a college or university;

36318 and

36319 ``(V) other appropriate partners, as

36320 determined by the Secretary.

36321 ``(ii) Cooperative agreements.--The Secretary

36322 may enter into a cooperative agreement to reflect

36323 the terms of any cooperation under subparagraph

36324 (A).

36325 ``(15) Curriculum and training clearinghouse.--The Secretary

36326 shall establish an online clearinghouse that makes available to

36327 beginning farmers and ranchers education curricula and training

36328 materials and programs, which may include online courses for

36329 direct use by beginning farmers and ranchers.

36330

36331 ``(e) Application Requirements.--In making grants and entering into

36332contracts and other agreements, as applicable, under

36333

36334[[Page 132 STAT. 4957]]

36335

36336subsections (c) and (d), the Secretary shall make available a simplified

36337application process for an application for a grant that requests less

36338than $50,000.'';

36339 (9) by striking subsection (f) and inserting the following:

36340

36341 ``(f) Stakeholder Input.--In carrying out this section, the

36342Secretary shall seek stakeholder input from--

36343 ``(1) beginning farmers and ranchers;

36344 ``(2) socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers;

36345 ``(3) veteran farmers and ranchers;

36346 ``(4) national, State, Tribal, and local organizations and

36347 other persons with expertise in operating programs for--

36348 ``(A) beginning farmers and ranchers;

36349 ``(B) socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers;

36350 or

36351 ``(C) veteran farmers and ranchers;

36352 ``(5) the Advisory Committee on Beginning Farmers and

36353 Ranchers established under section 5(b) of the Agricultural

36354 Credit Improvement Act of 1992 (7 U.S.C. 1929 note; Public Law

36355 102-554);

36356 ``(6) the Advisory Committee on Minority Farmers established

36357 under section 14008 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of

36358 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2279 note; Public Law 110-246); and

36359 ``(7) the Tribal Advisory Committee established under

36360 subsection (b) of section 309 of the Federal Crop Insurance

36361 Reform and Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994

36362 (7 U.S.C. 6921).'';

36363 (10) in paragraph (3) of subsection (h) (as so

36364 redesignated), by inserting ``and not later than March 1,

36365 2020,'' after ``1991,''; and

36366 (11) by adding at the end the following:

36367

36368 ``(l) Funding.--

36369 ``(1) Mandatory funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity

36370 Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall use to carry out this

36371 section--

36372 ``(A) $30,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 and

36373 2020;

36374 ``(B) $35,000,000 for fiscal year 2021;

36375 ``(C) $40,000,000 for fiscal year 2022; and

36376 ``(D) $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2023 and each

36377 fiscal year thereafter.

36378 ``(2) Authorization of appropriations.--There is authorized

36379 to be appropriated to carry out this section $50,000,000 for

36380 each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.

36381 ``(3) Reservation of funds.--Of the amounts made available

36382 to carry out this section--

36383 ``(A) 50 percent shall be used to carry out

36384 subsection (c); and

36385 ``(B) 50 percent shall be used to carry out

36386 subsection (d).

36387 ``(4) Allocation of funds.--

36388 ``(A) In general.--Not less than 5 percent of the

36389 amounts made available to carry out subsection (d) for a

36390 fiscal year shall be used to support programs and

36391 services that address the needs of--

36392 ``(i) limited resource beginning farmers and

36393 ranchers, as defined by the Secretary;

36394 ``(ii) socially disadvantaged farmers and

36395 ranchers that are beginning farmers and ranchers;

36396 and

36397

36398[[Page 132 STAT. 4958]]

36399

36400 ``(iii) farmworkers desiring to become farmers

36401 or ranchers.

36402 ``(B) Veteran farmers and ranchers.--Not less than 5

36403 percent of the amounts made available to carry out

36404 subsection (d) for a fiscal year shall be used to

36405 support programs and services that address the needs of

36406 veteran farmers and ranchers.

36407 ``(5) Interagency funding.--Any agency of the Department may

36408 participate in any grant, contract, or agreement entered into

36409 under this section by contributing funds, if the contributing

36410 agency determines that the objectives of the grant, contract, or

36411 agreement will further the authorized programs of the

36412 contributing agency.

36413 ``(6) Administrative expenses.--Not more than 5 percent of

36414 the amounts made available to carry out this section for a

36415 fiscal year may be used for expenses relating to the

36416 administration of this section.

36417 ``(7) Limitation on indirect costs.--A recipient of a grant

36418 or a party to a contract or other agreement under subsection (c)

36419 or (d) may not use more than 10 percent of the funds received

36420 for the indirect costs of carrying out a grant, contract, or

36421 other agreement.''.

36422SEC. 12302. URBAN AGRICULTURE.

36423

36424 Subtitle A of the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of

364251994 (7 U.S.C. 6911 et seq.) (as amended by section 12202) is amended by

36426adding at the end the following:

36427``SEC. 222. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6923.&gt;&gt; OFFICE OF URBAN AGRICULTURE AND

36428 INNOVATIVE PRODUCTION.

36429

36430 ``(a) Office.--

36431 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall establish in the

36432 Department an Office of Urban Agriculture and Innovative

36433 Production.

36434 ``(2) Director.--The Secretary shall appoint a senior

36435 official to serve as the Director of the Office of Urban

36436 Agriculture and Innovative Production (referred to in this

36437 section as the `Director').

36438 ``(3) Mission.--The mission of the Office of Urban

36439 Agriculture and Innovative Production shall be to encourage and

36440 promote urban, indoor, and other emerging agricultural

36441 practices, including--

36442 ``(A) community gardens and farms located in urban

36443 areas, suburbs, and urban clusters;

36444 ``(B) rooftop farms, outdoor vertical production,

36445 and green walls;

36446 ``(C) indoor farms, greenhouses, and high-tech

36447 vertical technology farms;

36448 ``(D) hydroponic, aeroponic, and aquaponic farm

36449 facilities; and

36450 ``(E) other innovations in agricultural production,

36451 as determined by the Secretary.

36452 ``(4) Responsibilities.--The Director shall be responsible

36453 for engaging in activities to carry out the mission described in

36454 paragraph (3), including by--

36455 ``(A) managing programs, including for community

36456 gardens, urban farms, rooftop agriculture, and indoor

36457 vertical production;

36458

36459[[Page 132 STAT. 4959]]

36460

36461 ``(B) advising the Secretary;

36462 ``(C) coordinating with the agencies and officials

36463 of the Department to update relevant programs;

36464 ``(D) engaging in stakeholder relations and

36465 developing external partnerships;

36466 ``(E) identifying common State and municipal best

36467 practices for navigating local policies;

36468 ``(F) coordinating networks of community gardens and

36469 facilitating connections to local food banks, in

36470 partnership with the Food and Nutrition Service; and

36471 ``(G) collaborating with other Federal agencies.

36472

36473 ``(b) Urban Agriculture and Innovative Production Advisory

36474Committee.--

36475 ``(1) In general.--Not later than 180 days after the date of

36476 enactment of this section, the Secretary shall establish an

36477 Urban Agriculture and Innovative Production Advisory Committee

36478 (referred to in this subsection as the `Committee') to advise

36479 the Secretary on--

36480 ``(A) the development of policies and outreach

36481 relating to urban, indoor, and other emerging

36482 agricultural production practices; and

36483 ``(B) any other aspects of the implementation of

36484 this section.

36485 ``(2) Membership.--

36486 ``(A) In general.--The Committee shall be composed

36487 of 12 members, of whom--

36488 ``(i) 4 shall be individuals who are

36489 agricultural producers, of whom--

36490 ``(I) 2 individuals shall be

36491 agricultural producers located in an

36492 urban area or urban cluster; and

36493 ``(II) 2 individuals shall be

36494 farmers that use innovative technology;

36495 ``(ii) 2 shall be representatives from an

36496 institution of higher education or extension

36497 program;

36498 ``(iii) 1 shall be an individual who

36499 represents a nonprofit organization, which may

36500 include a public health, environmental, or

36501 community organization;

36502 ``(iv) 1 shall be an individual who represents

36503 business and economic development, which may

36504 include a business development entity, a chamber

36505 of commerce, a city government, or a planning

36506 organization;

36507 ``(v) 1 shall be an individual with supply

36508 chain experience, which may include a food

36509 aggregator, wholesale food distributor, food hub,

36510 or an individual who has direct-to-consumer market

36511 experience;

36512 ``(vi) 1 shall be an individual from a

36513 financing entity; and

36514 ``(vii) 2 shall be individuals with related

36515 experience or expertise in urban, indoor, and

36516 other emerging agriculture production practices,

36517 as determined by the Secretary.

36518 ``(B) Initial appointments.--The Secretary shall

36519 appoint the members of the Committee not later than 180

36520 days after the date of enactment of this section.

36521 ``(3) Period of appointment; vacancies.--

36522

36523[[Page 132 STAT. 4960]]

36524

36525 ``(A) In general.--Except as provided in

36526 subparagraph (B), a member of the Committee shall be

36527 appointed for a term of 3 years.

36528 ``(B) Initial appointments.--Of the members first

36529 appointed to the Committee--

36530 ``(i) 4 of the members, as determined by the

36531 Secretary, shall be appointed for a term of 3

36532 years;

36533 ``(ii) 4 of the members, as determined by the

36534 Secretary, shall be appointed for a term of 2

36535 years; and

36536 ``(iii) 4 of the members, as determined by the

36537 Secretary, shall be appointed for a term of 1

36538 year.

36539 ``(C) Vacancies.--Any vacancy in the Committee--

36540 ``(i) shall not affect the powers of the

36541 Committee; and

36542 ``(ii) shall be filled as soon as practicable

36543 in the same manner as the original appointment.

36544 ``(D) Consecutive terms.--An initial appointee of

36545 the committee may serve an additional consecutive term

36546 if the member is reappointed by the Secretary.

36547 ``(4) Meetings.--

36548 ``(A) Frequency.--The Committee shall meet not fewer

36549 than 3 times per year.

36550 ``(B) Initial meeting.--Not later than 180 days

36551 after the date on which the members are appointed under

36552 paragraph (2)(B), the Committee shall hold the first

36553 meeting of the Committee.

36554 ``(5) Duties.--

36555 ``(A) In general.--The Committee shall--

36556 ``(i) develop recommendations and advise the

36557 Director on policies, initiatives, and outreach

36558 administered by the Office of Urban Agriculture

36559 and Innovative Production;

36560 ``(ii) evaluate and review ongoing research

36561 and extension activities relating to urban,

36562 indoor, and other innovative agricultural

36563 practices;

36564 ``(iii) identify new and existing barriers to

36565 successful urban, indoor, and other emerging

36566 agricultural production practices; and

36567 ``(iv) provide additional assistance and

36568 advice to the Director as appropriate.

36569 ``(B) Reports.--Not later than 1 year after the date

36570 on which the Committee is established, and every 2 years

36571 through 2023, the Committee shall submit to the

36572 Secretary, the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

36573 Representatives, and the Committee on Agriculture,

36574 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report

36575 describing the recommendations developed under

36576 subparagraph (A).

36577 ``(6) Personnel matters.--

36578 ``(A) Compensation.--A member of the Committee shall

36579 serve without compensation.

36580 ``(B) Travel expenses.--A member of the Committee

36581 shall be allowed travel expenses, including per diem in

36582 lieu of subsistence, in accordance with section 5703 of

36583 title 5, United States Code.

36584 ``(7) Termination.--

36585 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), the

36586 Committee shall terminate on the date that is 5 years

36587

36588[[Page 132 STAT. 4961]]

36589

36590 after the date on which the members are appointed under

36591 paragraph (2)(B).

36592 ``(B) Extensions.--Before the date on which the

36593 Committee terminates, the Secretary may renew the

36594 Committee for 1 or more 2-year periods.

36595

36596 ``(c) Grants.--The Director shall award competitive grants to

36597support the development of urban agriculture and innovative production

36598to any of the following eligible entities:

36599 ``(1) A nonprofit organization.

36600 ``(2) A unit of local government.

36601 ``(3) A Tribal government.

36602 ``(4) Any school that serves any of grades kindergarten

36603 through grade 12.

36604

36605 ``(d) Pilot Projects.--

36606 ``(1) Urban and suburban county committees.--

36607 ``(A) In general.--Not later than 1 year after the

36608 date of enactment of this section, the Secretary shall

36609 establish a pilot program for not fewer than 5 years

36610 that establishes 10 county committees in accordance with

36611 section 8(b)(5)(B)(ii)(II) of the Soil Conservation and

36612 Domestic Allotment Act (16 U.S.C. 590h(b)(5)(B)(ii)(II))

36613 to operate in counties located in urban or suburban

36614 areas with a high concentration of urban or suburban

36615 farms.

36616 ``(B) Effect.--Nothing in this paragraph requires or

36617 precludes the establishment of a Farm Service Agency

36618 office in a county in which a county committee is

36619 established under subparagraph (A).

36620 ``(C) Report.--For fiscal year 2019 and each fiscal

36621 year thereafter through fiscal year 2023, the Secretary

36622 shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the

36623 House of Representatives and the Committee on

36624 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a

36625 report describing a summary of--

36626 ``(i) the status of the pilot program under

36627 subparagraph (A);

36628 ``(ii) meetings and other activities of the

36629 committees established under that subparagraph;

36630 and

36631 ``(iii) the types and volume of assistance and

36632 services provided to farmers in counties in which

36633 county committees are established under that

36634 subparagraph.

36635 ``(2) Increasing community compost and reducing food

36636 waste.--

36637 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary, acting through the

36638 Director, shall carry out pilot projects under which the

36639 Secretary shall offer to enter into cooperative

36640 agreements with local or municipal governments in not

36641 fewer than 10 States to develop and test strategies for

36642 planning and implementing municipal compost plans and

36643 food waste reduction plans.

36644 ``(B) Eligible entities and purposes of pilot

36645 projects.--Under a cooperative agreement entered into

36646 under this paragraph, the Secretary shall provide

36647 assistance to municipalities, counties, local

36648 governments, or city planners, as appropriate, to carry

36649 out planning and implementing activities that will--

36650 ``(i) generate compost;

36651

36652[[Page 132 STAT. 4962]]

36653

36654 ``(ii) increase access to compost for

36655 agricultural producers;

36656 ``(iii) reduce reliance on, and limit the use

36657 of, fertilizer;

36658 ``(iv) improve soil quality;

36659 ``(v) encourage waste management and

36660 permaculture business development;

36661 ``(vi) increase rainwater absorption;

36662 ``(vii) reduce municipal food waste; and

36663 ``(viii) divert food waste from landfills.

36664 ``(C) Evaluation and ranking of applications.--

36665 ``(i) Criteria.--Not later than 180 days after

36666 the date of enactment of this section, the

36667 Secretary shall establish criteria for the

36668 selection of pilot projects under this paragraph.

36669 ``(ii) Consideration.--In selecting,

36670 undertaking, or funding pilot projects under this

36671 paragraph, the Secretary shall consider any

36672 commonly known significant impact on existing food

36673 waste recovery and disposal by commercial,

36674 marketing, or business relationships.

36675 ``(iii) Priority.--In selecting a pilot

36676 project under this paragraph, the Secretary shall

36677 give priority to an application for a pilot

36678 project that--

36679 ``(I) anticipates or demonstrates

36680 economic benefits;

36681 ``(II) incorporates plans to make

36682 compost easily accessible to

36683 agricultural producers, including

36684 community gardeners;

36685 ``(III) integrates other food waste

36686 strategies, including food recovery

36687 efforts; and

36688 ``(IV) provides for collaboration

36689 with multiple partners.

36690 ``(D) Matching requirement.--The recipient of

36691 assistance for a pilot project under this paragraph

36692 shall provide funds, in-kind contributions, or a

36693 combination of both from sources other than funds

36694 provided through the grant in an amount equal to not

36695 less than 25 percent of the amount of the grant.

36696 ``(E) Evaluation.--The Secretary shall conduct an

36697 evaluation of the pilot projects funded under this

36698 paragraph to assess different solutions for increasing

36699 access to compost and reducing municipal food waste,

36700 including an evaluation of--

36701 ``(i) the amount of Federal funds used for

36702 each project; and

36703 ``(ii) a measurement of the outcomes of each

36704 project.

36705

36706 ``(e) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be

36707appropriated to carry out this section and the amendments made by this

36708section $25,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.''.

36709SEC. 12303. TRIBAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE.

36710

36711 Section 309 of the Federal Crop Insurance Reform and Department of

36712Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6921) is amended--

36713 (1) by striking ``The Secretary'' and inserting the

36714 following:

36715

36716 ``(a) In General.--The Secretary''; and

36717

36718[[Page 132 STAT. 4963]]

36719

36720 (2) by adding at the end the following:

36721

36722 ``(b) Tribal Advisory Committee.--

36723 ``(1) Definitions.--In this subsection:

36724 ``(A) Indian tribe.--The term `Indian tribe' has the

36725 meaning given the term in section 4 of the Indian Self-

36726 Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C.

36727 5304).

36728 ``(B) Relevant committees of congress.--The term

36729 `relevant committees of Congress' means--

36730 ``(i) the Committee on Agriculture of the

36731 House of Representatives;

36732 ``(ii) the Committee on Agriculture,

36733 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate; and

36734 ``(iii) the Committee on Indian Affairs of the

36735 Senate.

36736 ``(C) Tribal organization.--The term `tribal

36737 organization' has the meaning given the term in section

36738 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education

36739 Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304).

36740 ``(2) Establishment of committee.--

36741 ``(A) In general.--The Secretary shall establish an

36742 advisory committee, to be known as the Tribal Advisory

36743 Committee (referred to in this subsection as the

36744 `Committee') to provide advice and guidance to the

36745 Secretary on matters relating to Tribal and Indian

36746 affairs.

36747 ``(B) Facilitation.--The Committee shall facilitate,

36748 but not supplant, government-to-government consultation

36749 between the Department of Agriculture (referred to in

36750 this subsection as the `Department') and Indian tribes.

36751 ``(3) Membership.--

36752 ``(A) Composition.--The Committee shall be composed

36753 of 11 members, of whom--

36754 ``(i) 3 shall be appointed by the Secretary;

36755 ``(ii) 1 shall be appointed by the chairperson

36756 of the Committee on Indian Affairs of the Senate;

36757 ``(iii) 1 shall be appointed by the ranking

36758 member of the Committee on Indian Affairs of the

36759 Senate;

36760 ``(iv) 1 shall be appointed by the chairperson

36761 of the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and

36762 Forestry of the Senate;

36763 ``(v) 1 shall be appointed by the ranking

36764 member of the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition,

36765 and Forestry of the Senate;

36766 ``(vi) 2 shall be appointed by the chairperson

36767 of the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

36768 Representatives; and

36769 ``(vii) 2 shall be appointed by the ranking

36770 member of the Committee on Agriculture of the

36771 House of Representatives.

36772 ``(B) Nominations.--The Secretary shall accept

36773 nominations for members of the Committee from any of the

36774 following:

36775 ``(i) An Indian tribe.

36776 ``(ii) A tribal organization.

36777 ``(iii) A national or regional organization

36778 with expertise in issues relating to the duties of

36779 the Committee described in paragraph (4).

36780

36781[[Page 132 STAT. 4964]]

36782

36783 ``(C) Diversity.--To the maximum extent feasible,

36784 the Secretary shall ensure that the members of the

36785 Committee represent a diverse set of expertise on issues

36786 relating to geographic regions, Indian tribes, and the

36787 agricultural industry.

36788 ``(D) Limitation.--No member of the Committee shall

36789 be an officer or employee of the Federal Government.

36790 ``(E) Period of appointment; vacancies.--

36791 ``(i) In general.--Each member of the

36792 Committee--

36793 ``(I) subject to clause (ii), shall

36794 be appointed to a 3-year term; and

36795 ``(II) may be reappointed to not

36796 more than 3 consecutive terms.

36797 ``(ii) Initial staggering.--The first 3

36798 appointments by the Secretary under paragraph

36799 (3)(A)(i) shall be for a 2-year term.

36800 ``(iii) Vacancies.--Any vacancy in the

36801 Committee shall be filled in the same manner as

36802 the original appointment not more than 90 days

36803 after the date on which the position becomes

36804 vacant.

36805 ``(F) Meetings.--

36806 ``(i) In general.--The Committee shall meet in

36807 person not less than twice each year.

36808 ``(ii) Office of tribal relations

36809 representative.--Not fewer than 1 representative

36810 from the Office of Tribal Relations of the

36811 Department shall be present at each meeting of the

36812 Committee.

36813 ``(iii) Department of interior

36814 representative.--The Assistant Secretary for

36815 Indian Affairs of the Department of the Interior

36816 (or a designee) shall be present at each meeting

36817 of the Committee.

36818 ``(iv) Nonvoting representatives.--The

36819 individuals described in clauses (ii) and (iii)

36820 shall be nonvoting representatives at meetings of

36821 the Committee.

36822 ``(4) Duties of committee.--The Committee shall--

36823 ``(A) identify evolving issues of relevance to

36824 Indian tribes relating to programs of the Department;

36825 ``(B) communicate to the Secretary the issues

36826 identified under subparagraph (A);

36827 ``(C) submit to the Secretary recommendations for,

36828 and solutions to--

36829 ``(i) the issues identified under subparagraph

36830 (A);

36831 ``(ii) issues raised at the Tribal, regional,

36832 or national level; and

36833 ``(iii) issues relating to any Tribal

36834 consultation carried out by the Department;

36835 ``(D) discuss issues and proposals for changes to

36836 the regulations, policies, and procedures of the

36837 Department that impact Indian tribes;

36838 ``(E) identify priorities and provide advice on

36839 appropriate strategies for Tribal consultation on issues

36840 at the Tribal, regional, or national level regarding the

36841 Department;

36842 ``(F) ensure that pertinent issues of the Department

36843 are brought to the attention of an Indian tribe in a

36844 timely

36845

36846[[Page 132 STAT. 4965]]

36847

36848 manner so that timely feedback from an Indian tribe can

36849 be obtained; and

36850 ``(G) identify and propose solutions to any

36851 interdepartmental barrier between the Department and

36852 other Federal agencies.

36853 ``(5) Reports.--

36854 ``(A) In general.--Not less frequently than once

36855 each year, the Committee shall submit to the Secretary

36856 and the relevant committees of Congress a report that

36857 describes--

36858 ``(i) the activities of the Committee during

36859 the previous year; and

36860 ``(ii) recommendations for legislative or

36861 administrative action for the following year.

36862 ``(B) Response from secretary.--Not more than 45

36863 days after the date on which the Secretary receives a

36864 report under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall

36865 submit a written response to that report to--

36866 ``(i) the Committee; and

36867 ``(ii) the relevant committees of Congress.

36868 ``(6) Compensation of members.--Members of the Committee

36869 shall be compensated at a rate equal to the daily equivalent of

36870 the annual rate of basic pay prescribed for level IV of the

36871 Executive Schedule under section 5315 of title 5, United States

36872 Code, for each day (including travel time) during which the

36873 member is engaged in the performance of the duties of the

36874 Committee.

36875 ``(7) Federal advisory committee act exemption.--Section 14

36876 of the Federal Advisory Committee Act (5 U.S.C. App.) shall not

36877 apply to the Committee.''.

36878SEC. 12304. BEGINNING FARMER AND RANCHER COORDINATION.

36879

36880 Subtitle D of title VII of the Farm Security and Rural Investment

36881Act of 2002 (as amended by sections 7506 and 12301(a)(1)) is further

36882amended by inserting after section 7403 (7 U.S.C. 3119b note; Public Law

36883107-171) the following:

36884``SEC. 7404. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6934a.&gt;&gt; BEGINNING FARMER AND RANCHER

36885 COORDINATION.

36886

36887 ``(a) Definitions.--In this section:

36888 ``(1) Beginning farmer or rancher.--The term `beginning

36889 farmer or rancher' has the meaning given such term in section

36890 2501(a) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of

36891 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279(a)).

36892 ``(2) National coordinator.--The term `National Coordinator'

36893 means the National Beginning Farmer and Rancher Coordinator

36894 established under subsection (b)(1).

36895 ``(3) State coordinator.--The term `State coordinator' means

36896 a State beginning farmer and rancher coordinator designated

36897 under subsection (c)(1)(A).

36898 ``(4) State office.--The term `State office' means--

36899 ``(A) a State office of--

36900 ``(i) the Farm Service Agency;

36901 ``(ii) the Natural Resources Conservation

36902 Service;

36903 ``(iii) the Rural Business-Cooperative

36904 Service; or

36905 ``(iv) the Rural Utilities Service; or

36906 ``(B) a regional office of the Risk Management

36907 Agency.

36908

36909 ``(b) National Beginning Farmer and Rancher Coordinator.--

36910

36911[[Page 132 STAT. 4966]]

36912

36913 ``(1) Establishment.--The Secretary shall establish in the

36914 Department the position of National Beginning Farmer and Rancher

36915 Coordinator.

36916 ``(2) Duties.--

36917 ``(A) In general.--The National Coordinator shall--

36918 ``(i) advise the Secretary and coordinate

36919 activities of the Department on programs,

36920 policies, and issues relating to beginning farmers

36921 and ranchers; and

36922 ``(ii) in consultation with the applicable

36923 State food and agriculture council, determine

36924 whether to approve a plan submitted by a State

36925 coordinator under subsection (c)(3)(B).

36926 ``(B) Discretionary duties.--Additional duties of

36927 the National Coordinator may include--

36928 ``(i) developing and implementing new

36929 strategies--

36930 ``(I) for outreach to beginning

36931 farmers and ranchers; and

36932 ``(II) to assist beginning farmers

36933 and ranchers with connecting to owners

36934 or operators that have ended, or expect

36935 to end within 5 years, actively owning

36936 or operating a farm or ranch; and

36937 ``(ii) facilitating interagency and

36938 interdepartmental collaboration on issues relating

36939 to beginning farmers and ranchers.

36940 ``(3) Reports.--Not less frequently than once each year, the

36941 National Coordinator shall distribute within the Department and

36942 make publicly available a report describing the status of steps

36943 taken to carry out the duties described in subparagraphs (A) and

36944 (B) of paragraph (2).

36945 ``(4) Contracts and cooperative agreements.--In carrying out

36946 the duties under paragraph (2), the National Coordinator may

36947 enter into a contract or cooperative agreement with an

36948 institution of higher education (as defined in section 101 of

36949 the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001)), cooperative

36950 extension services (as defined in section 1404 of the National

36951 Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of

36952 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103)), or a nonprofit organization--

36953 ``(A) to conduct research on the profitability of

36954 new farms in operation for not less than 5 years in a

36955 region;

36956 ``(B) to develop educational materials;

36957 ``(C) to conduct workshops, courses, training, or

36958 certified vocational training; or

36959 ``(D) to conduct mentoring activities.

36960

36961 ``(c) State Beginning Farmer and Rancher Coordinators.--

36962 ``(1) In general.--

36963 ``(A) Designation.--The National Coordinator, in

36964 consultation with State food and agriculture councils

36965 and directors of State offices, shall designate in each

36966 State a State beginning farmer and rancher coordinator

36967 from among employees of State offices.

36968 ``(B) Requirements.--To be designated as a State

36969 coordinator, an employee shall--

36970 ``(i) be familiar with issues relating to

36971 beginning farmers and ranchers; and

36972 ``(ii) have the ability to coordinate with

36973 other Federal departments and agencies.

36974

36975[[Page 132 STAT. 4967]]

36976

36977 ``(2) Training.--The Secretary shall develop a training plan

36978 to provide to each State coordinator knowledge of programs and

36979 services available from the Department for beginning farmers and

36980 ranchers, taking into consideration the needs of all production

36981 types and sizes of agricultural operations.

36982 ``(3) Duties.--A State coordinator shall--

36983 ``(A) coordinate technical assistance at the State

36984 level to assist beginning farmers and ranchers in

36985 accessing programs of the Department;

36986 ``(B) develop and submit to the National Coordinator

36987 for approval under subsection (b)(2)(A)(ii) a State plan

36988 to improve the coordination, delivery, and efficacy of

36989 programs of the Department to beginning farmers and

36990 ranchers, taking into consideration the needs of all

36991 types of production methods and sizes of agricultural

36992 operation, at each county and area office in the State;

36993 ``(C) oversee implementation of an approved State

36994 plan described in subparagraph (B);

36995 ``(D) work with outreach coordinators in the State

36996 offices to ensure appropriate information about

36997 technical assistance is available at outreach events and

36998 activities; and

36999 ``(E) coordinate partnerships and joint outreach

37000 efforts with other organizations and government agencies

37001 serving beginning farmers and ranchers.''.

37002SEC. 12305. AGRICULTURAL YOUTH ORGANIZATION COORDINATOR.

37003

37004 Subtitle D of title VII of the Farm Security and Rural Investment

37005Act of 2002 (as amended by sections 7506, section 12301(a)(1), and

3700612304) is further amended by inserting after section 7404, as added by

37007section 12304, the following:

37008``SEC. 7405. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6934b.&gt;&gt; AGRICULTURAL YOUTH

37009 ORGANIZATION COORDINATOR.

37010

37011 ``(a) Authorization.--The Secretary shall establish in the

37012Department the position of Agricultural Youth Organization Coordinator.

37013 ``(b) Duties.--The Agricultural Youth Organization Coordinator

37014shall--

37015 ``(1) promote the role of youth-serving organizations and

37016 school-based agricultural education in motivating and preparing

37017 young people to pursue careers in the agriculture, food, and

37018 natural resources systems;

37019 ``(2) work to help build youth awareness of the reach and

37020 importance of agriculture, across a diversity of fields and

37021 disciplines;

37022 ``(3) identify short-term and long-term interests of the

37023 Department and provide opportunities, resources, input, and

37024 coordination with programs and agencies of the Department to

37025 youth-serving organizations and school-based agricultural

37026 education, including the development of internship

37027 opportunities;

37028 ``(4) share, internally and externally, the extent to which

37029 active steps are being taken to encourage collaboration with,

37030 and support of, youth-serving organizations and school-based

37031 agricultural education;

37032 ``(5) provide information to youth involved in food and

37033 agriculture organizations concerning the availability of, and

37034

37035[[Page 132 STAT. 4968]]

37036

37037 eligibility requirements for, participation in agricultural

37038 programs, with particular emphasis on beginning farmer and

37039 rancher programs;

37040 ``(6) serve as a resource for assisting youth involved in

37041 food and agriculture organizations in applying for participation

37042 in agriculture; and

37043 ``(7) advocate on behalf of youth involved in food and

37044 agriculture organizations in interactions with employees of the

37045 Department.

37046

37047 ``(c) Contracts and Cooperative Agreements.--For purposes of

37048carrying out the duties under subsection (b), the Agricultural Youth

37049Organization Coordinator shall consult with the cooperative extension

37050and the land-grant university systems, and may enter into contracts or

37051cooperative agreements with the research centers of the Agricultural

37052Research Service, cooperative extension and the land-grant university

37053systems, non-land-grant colleges of agriculture, or nonprofit

37054organizations for--

37055 ``(1) the conduct of regional research on the profitability

37056 of small farms;

37057 ``(2) the development of educational materials;

37058 ``(3) the conduct of workshops, courses, and certified

37059 vocational training;

37060 ``(4) the conduct of mentoring activities; or

37061 ``(5) the provision of internship opportunities.''.

37062SEC. 12306. AVAILABILITY OF DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE PROGRAMS FOR

37063 VETERAN FARMERS AND RANCHERS.

37064

37065 (a) Definition of Veteran Farmer or Rancher.--Paragraph (7) of

37066subsection (a) (as redesignated by section 12301(b)(3)) of section 2501

37067of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C.

370682279) is amended--

37069 (1) in subparagraph (A), by striking ``or'' at the end;

37070 (2) in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end

37071 and inserting ``; or''; and

37072 (3) by adding at the end the following:

37073 ``(C) is a veteran (as defined in section 101 of

37074 that title) who has first obtained status as a veteran

37075 (as so defined) during the most recent 10-year

37076 period.''.

37077

37078 (b) Federal Crop Insurance.--

37079 (1) Definition of veteran farmer or rancher.--Section 502(b)

37080 of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1502(b)) (as amended

37081 by section 11101) is amended by adding at the end the following:

37082 ``(14) Veteran farmer or rancher.--The term `veteran farmer

37083 or rancher' means a farmer or rancher who--

37084 ``(A) has served in the Armed Forces (as defined in

37085 section 101 of title 38, United States Code); and

37086 ``(B)(i) has not operated a farm or ranch;

37087 ``(ii) has operated a farm or ranch for not more

37088 than 5 years; or

37089 ``(iii) is a veteran (as defined in section 101 of

37090 that title) who has first obtained status as a veteran

37091 (as so defined) during the most recent 5-year period.''.

37092 (2) Crop insurance.--Section 508 of the Federal Crop

37093 Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508) is amended--

37094 (A) in subsection (b)(5)(E)--

37095

37096[[Page 132 STAT. 4969]]

37097

37098 (i) by striking ``The Corporation'' and

37099 inserting the following:

37100 ``(i) In general.--The Corporation''; and

37101 (ii) in clause (i) (as so designated), by

37102 striking the period at the end and inserting the

37103 following: ``, and veteran farmers or ranchers.

37104 ``(ii) Coordination.--The Corporation shall

37105 coordinate with other agencies of the Department

37106 that provide programs or services to farmers and

37107 ranchers described in clause (i) to make available

37108 coverage under the waiver under that clause and to

37109 share eligibility information to reduce paperwork

37110 and avoid duplication.'';

37111 (B) in subsection (e)(8)--

37112 (i) in the paragraph heading, by inserting

37113 ``and veteran'' after ``beginning''; and

37114 (ii) by inserting ``or veteran farmer or

37115 rancher'' after ``beginning farmer or rancher''

37116 each place it appears; and

37117 (C) in subsection (g)--

37118 (i) in paragraph (2)(B)(iii), in the matter

37119 preceding subclause (I), by inserting ``or veteran

37120 farmer or rancher'' after ``beginning farmer or

37121 rancher'' each place it appears; and

37122 (ii) in paragraph (4)(B)(ii)(II), by inserting

37123 ``and veteran farmers or ranchers'' after

37124 ``beginning farmers or ranchers''.

37125 (3) Education and risk management assistance.--Paragraph (3)

37126 of section 524(a) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C.

37127 1524(a)), as redesignated by section 11125(a)(3), is amended--

37128 (A) in subparagraph (D)(ii), by striking ``and'' at

37129 the end;

37130 (B) in subparagraph (E), by striking the period at

37131 the end and inserting ``; and''; and

37132 (C) by adding at the end the following:

37133 ``(F) veteran farmers or ranchers.''.

37134

37135 (c) Down Payment Loan Program.--Section 310E of the Consolidated

37136Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1935) is amended--

37137 (1) in subsection (a)(1), by striking ``qualified beginning

37138 farmers or ranchers and socially disadvantaged farmers or

37139 ranchers'' and inserting ``eligible farmers or ranchers'';

37140 (2) in subsection (d)--

37141 (A) in paragraph (2)(A), by striking ``recipients of

37142 the loans'' and inserting ``farmers or ranchers'';

37143 (B) by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the

37144 following:

37145 ``(3) encourage retiring farmers and ranchers to assist in

37146 the sale of their farms and ranches to eligible farmers or

37147 ranchers by providing seller financing;'';

37148 (C) in paragraph (4), by striking ``for beginning

37149 farmers or ranchers or socially disadvantaged farmers or

37150 ranchers'' and inserting the following: ``for--

37151 ``(A) beginning farmers or ranchers;

37152 ``(B) socially disadvantaged farmers or ranchers, as

37153 defined in section 355(e); or

37154

37155[[Page 132 STAT. 4970]]

37156

37157 ``(C) veteran farmers or ranchers, as defined in

37158 section 2501(a) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation,

37159 and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279(a)); and''; and

37160 (D) in paragraph (5), by striking ``a qualified

37161 beginning farmer or rancher or socially disadvantaged

37162 farmer or rancher'' and inserting ``an eligible farmer

37163 or rancher''; and

37164 (3) by striking subsection (e) and inserting the following:

37165

37166 ``(e) Definition of Eligible Farmer or Rancher.--In this section,

37167the term `eligible farmer or rancher' means--

37168 ``(1) a qualified beginning farmer or rancher;

37169 ``(2) a socially disadvantaged farmer or rancher, as defined

37170 in section 355(e); and

37171 ``(3) a veteran farmer or rancher, as defined in section

37172 2501(a) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of

37173 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279(a)).''.

37174

37175 (d) Interest Rate Reduction Program.--Section 351(e)(2)(B) of the

37176Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1999(e)(2)(B)) is

37177amended--

37178 (1) in the subparagraph heading, by inserting ``and

37179 veteran'' after ``Beginning'';

37180 (2) in clause (i), by inserting ``or veteran farmers and

37181 ranchers (as defined in section 2501(a) of the Food,

37182 Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C.

37183 2279(a)))'' before the period at the end; and

37184 (3) in clause (ii), by striking ``beginning''.

37185

37186 (e) National Food Safety Training, Education, Extension, Outreach,

37187and Technical Assistance Program.--Section 405(c) of the Agricultural

37188Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998 (7 U.S.C. 7625(c))

37189is amended by inserting ``veteran farmers or ranchers (as defined in

37190section 2501(a) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of

371911990 (7 U.S.C. 2279(a))),'' after ``socially disadvantaged farmers,''.

37192 (f) Administration and Operation of Noninsured Crop Assistance

37193Program.--Section 196 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform

37194Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C. 7333) is amended--

37195 (1) in subsection (k)(2), by inserting ``, or a veteran

37196 farmer or rancher (as defined in section 2501(a) of the Food,

37197 Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C.

37198 2279(a)))'' before the period at the end; and

37199 (2) in subsection (l), in paragraph (3) (as redesignated by

37200 section 1601(7)(D))--

37201 (A) in the paragraph heading, by inserting

37202 ``veteran,'' before ``and socially''; and

37203 (B) by inserting ``and veteran farmers or ranchers

37204 (as defined in section 2501(a) of the Food, Agriculture,

37205 Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C.

37206 2279(a)))'' before ``in exchange''.

37207

37208 (g) Funding for Transition Option for Certain Farmers or Ranchers.--

37209Section 1241(a)(1)(B) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

372103841(a)(1)(B)) is amended by striking ``beginning farmers or ranchers

37211and socially disadvantaged farmers or ranchers'' and inserting ``covered

37212farmers or ranchers, as defined in section 1235(f)(1)''.

37213 (h) Supplemental Agricultural Disaster Assistance.--

37214 (1) Definition of covered producer.--Section 1501(a) of the

37215 Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(a)) is amended--

37216

37217[[Page 132 STAT. 4971]]

37218

37219 (A) by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (4) as

37220 paragraphs (2) through (5), respectively; and

37221 (B) by inserting before paragraph (2) (as so

37222 redesignated) the following:

37223 ``(1) Covered producer.--The term `covered producer' means

37224 an eligible producer on a farm that is--

37225 ``(A) as determined by the Secretary--

37226 ``(i) a beginning farmer or rancher;

37227 ``(ii) a socially disadvantaged farmer or

37228 rancher; or

37229 ``(iii) a limited resource farmer or rancher;

37230 or

37231 ``(B) a veteran farmer or rancher, as defined in

37232 section 2501(a) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation,

37233 and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279(a)).''.

37234 (2) Emergency assistance for livestock, honey bees, and

37235 farm-raised fish.--Section 1501(d) of the Agricultural Act of

37236 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081(d)) is amended by adding at the end the

37237 following:

37238 ``(4) Payment rate for covered producers.--In the case of a

37239 covered producer that is eligible to receive assistance under

37240 this subsection, the Secretary shall provide reimbursement of 90

37241 percent of the cost of losses described in paragraph (1) or

37242 (2).''.

37243

37244 Subtitle D--Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994

37245 Amendments

37246

37247SEC. 12401. OFFICE OF CONGRESSIONAL RELATIONS AND

37248 INTERGOVERNMENTAL AFFAIRS.

37249

37250 (a) Assistant Secretaries of Agriculture.--Section 218(a)(1) of the

37251Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C.

372526918(a)(1)) is amended by striking ``Relations'' and inserting

37253``Relations and Intergovernmental Affairs''.

37254 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6918 note.&gt;&gt; Succession.--Any official who is

37255serving as the Assistant Secretary of Agriculture for Congressional

37256Relations on the date of enactment of this Act and who was appointed by

37257the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, shall

37258not be required to be reappointed as a result of the change made to the

37259name of that position under the amendment made by subsection (a).

37260SEC. 12402. MILITARY VETERANS AGRICULTURAL LIAISON.

37261

37262 Section 219 of the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of

372631994 (7 U.S.C. 6919) is amended--

37264 (1) in subsection (b)--

37265 (A) in paragraph (3), by striking ``and'' at the

37266 end;

37267 (B) in paragraph (4), by striking the period at the

37268 end and inserting a semicolon; and

37269 (C) by adding at the end the following:

37270 ``(5) establish and periodically update the website

37271 described in subsection (d); and

37272 ``(6) in carrying out the duties described in paragraphs (1)

37273 through (5), consult with and provide technical assistance to

37274 any Federal agency, including the Department of Defense, the

37275 Department of Veterans Affairs, the Small Business

37276 Administration, and the Department of Labor.''; and

37277

37278[[Page 132 STAT. 4972]]

37279

37280 (2) by adding at the end the following:

37281

37282 ``(d) Website Required.--

37283 ``(1) In general.--The website required under subsection

37284 (b)(5) shall include the following:

37285 ``(A) Positions identified within the Department of

37286 Agriculture that are available to veterans for

37287 apprenticeships.

37288 ``(B) Apprenticeships, programs of training on the

37289 job, and programs of education that are approved for

37290 purposes of chapter 36 of title 38, United States Code.

37291 ``(C) Employment skills training programs for

37292 members of the Armed Forces carried out pursuant to

37293 section 1143(e) of title 10, United States Code.

37294 ``(D) Information designed to assist businesses,

37295 nonprofit entities, educational institutions, and

37296 farmers interested in developing apprenticeships, on-

37297 the-job training, educational, or entrepreneurial

37298 programs for veterans in navigating the process of

37299 having a program approved by a State approving agency

37300 for purposes of chapter 36 of title 38, United States

37301 Code, including--

37302 ``(i) contact information for relevant offices

37303 in the Department of Defense, Department of

37304 Veterans Affairs, Department of Labor, and Small

37305 Business Administration;

37306 ``(ii) basic requirements for approval by each

37307 State approving agency;

37308 ``(iii) recommendations with respect to

37309 training and coursework to be used during

37310 apprenticeships or on-the-job training that will

37311 enable a veteran to be eligible for agricultural

37312 programs; and

37313 ``(iv) examples of successful programs and

37314 curriculums that have been approved for purposes

37315 of chapter 36 of title 38, United States Code

37316 (with consent of the organization and without any

37317 personally identifiable information).

37318 ``(2) Review of website.--

37319 ``(A) In general.--Not later than 5 years after the

37320 date of enactment of this paragraph, and once every 5

37321 years thereafter, the Secretary shall conduct a study to

37322 determine if the website required under subsection

37323 (b)(5) is effective in providing veterans the

37324 information required under paragraph (1).

37325 ``(B) Ineffective website.--If the Secretary

37326 determines that the website is not effective under

37327 subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall--

37328 ``(i) notify the agriculture and veterans

37329 committees described in subparagraph (C) of that

37330 determination; and

37331 ``(ii) not earlier than 180 days after the

37332 date on which the Secretary provides notice under

37333 clause (i), terminate the website.

37334 ``(C) Agriculture and veterans committees.--The

37335 agriculture and veterans committees referred to in

37336 subparagraph (B)(i) are--

37337 ``(i) the Committee on Agriculture of the

37338 House of Representatives;

37339 ``(ii) the Committee on Agriculture,

37340 Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate;

37341

37342[[Page 132 STAT. 4973]]

37343

37344 ``(iii) the Committee on Veterans' Affairs of

37345 the House of Representatives; and

37346 ``(iv) the Committee on Veterans' Affairs of

37347 the Senate.

37348

37349 ``(e) Consultation Required.--In carrying out this section, the

37350Secretary shall consult with organizations that serve veterans.

37351 ``(f) Report.--

37352 ``(1) In general.--Not later than 1 year after the date of

37353 enactment of this subsection, and annually thereafter, the

37354 Military Veterans Agricultural Liaison shall submit a report on

37355 beginning farmer training for veterans and agricultural

37356 vocational and rehabilitation programs for veterans to--

37357 ``(A) the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

37358 Representatives;

37359 ``(B) the Committee on Veterans' Affairs of the

37360 House of Representatives;

37361 ``(C) the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and

37362 Forestry of the Senate; and

37363 ``(D) the Committee on Veterans' Affairs of the

37364 Senate.

37365 ``(2) Contents of report.--The report submitted under

37366 paragraph (1) shall include--

37367 ``(A) a summary of the measures taken to carry out

37368 subsections (b) and (c);

37369 ``(B) a description of the information provided to

37370 veterans under paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (b);

37371 ``(C) recommendations for best informing veterans of

37372 the programs described in paragraphs (1) and (2) of

37373 subsection (b);

37374 ``(D) a summary of the contracts or cooperative

37375 agreements entered into under subsection (c);

37376 ``(E) a description of the programs implemented

37377 under subsection (c);

37378 ``(F) a summary of the employment outreach

37379 activities directed to veterans;

37380 ``(G) recommendations for how opportunities for

37381 veterans in agriculture should be developed or expanded;

37382 ``(H) a summary of veteran farm lending data and a

37383 summary of shortfalls, if any, identified by the

37384 Military Veterans Agricultural Liaison in collecting

37385 data with respect to veterans engaged in agriculture;

37386 and

37387 ``(I) recommendations, if any, on how to improve

37388 activities under subsection (b).

37389

37390 ``(g) Public Dissemination of Information.--

37391 ``(1) In general.--Not later than 1 year after the date of

37392 enactment of this subsection, and annually thereafter, the

37393 Military Veterans Agricultural Liaison shall make publicly

37394 available and share broadly, including by posting on the website

37395 of the Department--

37396 ``(A) the report of the Military Veterans

37397 Agricultural Liaison on beginning farmer training for

37398 veterans and agricultural vocational and rehabilitation

37399 programs; and

37400 ``(B) the information disseminated under paragraphs

37401 (1) and (2) of subsection (b).

37402 ``(2) Further dissemination.--Not later than the day before

37403 the date on which the Military Veterans Agricultural

37404

37405[[Page 132 STAT. 4974]]

37406

37407 Liaison makes publicly available the information under paragraph

37408 (1), the Military Veterans Agricultural Liaison shall provide

37409 that information to the Department of Defense, the Department of

37410 Veterans Affairs, the Small Business Administration, and the

37411 Department of Labor.''.

37412SEC. 12403. CIVIL RIGHTS ANALYSES.

37413

37414 (a) In General.--The Secretary shall conduct civil rights impact

37415analyses in accordance with Departmental Regulation 4300-004 issued by

37416the Department of Agriculture on October 17, 2016, with respect to the

37417Department of Agriculture's employment, federally-conducted programs and

37418activities, and federally-assisted programs and activities.

37419 (b) Study; Report.--

37420 (1) Study.--Not later than 2 years after the date of

37421 enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United

37422 States (referred to in this section as the ``Comptroller

37423 General'') shall conduct a study describing--

37424 (A) the effectiveness of the Department of

37425 Agriculture in processing and resolving civil rights

37426 complaints;

37427 (B) minority participation rates in farm programs,

37428 including a comparison of overall farmer and rancher

37429 participation with minority farmer and rancher

37430 participation by considering particular aspects of the

37431 programs of the Department of Agriculture for producers,

37432 such as ownership status, program participation, usage

37433 of permits, and waivers;

37434 (C) the realignment of the civil rights functions of

37435 the Department of Agriculture, as outlined in

37436 Secretarial Memorandum 1076-023 (March 9, 2018),

37437 including an analysis of whether that realignment has

37438 any negative implications on the civil rights functions

37439 of the Department;

37440 (D) efforts of the Department of Agriculture to

37441 identify actions, programs, or activities of the

37442 Department of Agriculture that may adversely affect

37443 employees, contractors, or beneficiaries (including

37444 participants) of the action, program, or activity based

37445 on the membership of the employees, contractors, or

37446 beneficiaries in a group that is protected under Federal

37447 law from discrimination in employment, contracting, or

37448 provision of an action, program, or activity, as

37449 applicable; and

37450 (E) efforts of the Department of Agriculture to

37451 strategically plan actions to decrease discrimination

37452 and civil rights complaints within the Department of

37453 Agriculture or in the carrying out of the programs and

37454 authorities of the Department of Agriculture.

37455 (2) Report.--Not later than 60 days after the date of

37456 completion of the study under paragraph (1), the Comptroller

37457 General shall submit a report describing the results of the

37458 study to--

37459 (A) the Committee on Agriculture of the House of

37460 Representatives; and

37461 (B) the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and

37462 Forestry of the Senate.

37523 and outreach'' and inserting ``partnerships and public

37528

37529[[Page 132 STAT. 4976]]

37530

37533 Office of Advocacy and Outreach established under section 226B

37534 of the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7

37535 U.S.C. 6934) in any provision of Federal law shall be deemed to

37537 Engagement.

37540Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6934), as amended by

37594

37595[[Page 132 STAT. 4977]]

37596

37597 of the Senior Executive Service under subsection (b) of section

37608SEC. 12409. RURAL HEALTH LIAISON.

37609

37610 Subtitle C of title II of the Department of Agriculture

37611Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6941 et seq.) is amended by adding

37612at the end the following:

37613``SEC. 236. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6946.&gt;&gt; RURAL HEALTH LIAISON.

37614

37615 ``(a) Authorization.--The Secretary shall establish in the

37616Department the position of Rural Health Liaison.

37617 ``(b) Duties.--The Rural Health Liaison shall--

37618 ``(1) in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human

37619 Services, coordinate the role of the Department with respect to

37620 rural health;

37621 ``(2) integrate across the Department the strategic planning

37622 and activities relating to rural health;

37623 ``(3) improve communication relating to rural health within

37624 the Department and between Federal agencies;

37625 ``(4) advocate on behalf of the health care and relevant

37626 infrastructure needs in rural areas;

37627 ``(5) provide to stakeholders, potential grant applicants,

37628 Federal agencies, State agencies, Indian Tribes, private

37629 organizations, and academic institutions relevant data and

37630 information, including the eligibility requirements for, and

37631 availability and outcomes of, Department programs applicable to

37632 the advancement of rural health;

37633 ``(6) maintain communication with public health, medical,

37634 occupational safety, and telecommunication associations,

37635 research entities, and other stakeholders to ensure that the

37636 Department is aware of current and upcoming issues relating to

37637 rural health;

37638 ``(7) consult on programs, pilot projects, research,

37639 training, and other affairs relating to rural health at the

37640 Department and other Federal agencies;

37641 ``(8) provide expertise on rural health to support the

37642 activities of the Secretary as Chair of the Council on Rural

37643 Community Innovation and Economic Development; and

37644 ``(9) provide technical assistance and guidance with respect

37645 to activities relating to rural health to the outreach,

37646 extension, and county offices of the Department.''.

37647SEC. 12410. NATURAL RESOURCES CONSERVATION SERVICE.

37648

37649 (a) Field Offices.--Section 246 of the Department of Agriculture

37650Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6962) (as amended by section

3765112404(b)(1)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

37652 ``(g) Field Offices.--

37653 ``(1) In general.--The Secretary shall not close any field

37654 office of the Natural Resources Conservation Service unless,

37655

37656[[Page 132 STAT. 4978]]

37657

37658 not later than 30 days before the date of the closure, the

37659 Secretary submits to the Committee on Agriculture of the House

37660 of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition,

37661 and Forestry of the Senate a notification of the closure.

37662 ``(2) Employees.--The Secretary shall not permanently

37663 relocate any field-based employees of the Natural Resources

37664 Conservation Service or the rural development mission area if

37665 doing so would result in a field office of the Natural Resources

37666 Conservation Service or the rural development mission area with

37667 2 or fewer employees, unless, not later than 30 days before the

37668 date of the permanent relocation, the Secretary submits to the

37669 Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

37670 Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate

37671 a notification of the permanent relocation.

37672 ``(3) Sunset.--The requirements under paragraphs (1) and (2)

37673 shall cease to be effective on September 30, 2023.''.

37674

37675 (b) Technical Corrections.--Section 246 of the Department of

37676Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6962) (as amended by

37677subsection (a)) is further amended--

37678 (1) in subsection (b)--

37679 (A) by striking paragraph (2);

37680 (B) by redesignating paragraphs (3) through (6) as

37681 paragraphs (2) through (5), respectively;

37682 (C) in paragraph (4) (as so redesignated), by

37683 inserting ``; Public Law 101-624'' after ``note''; and

37684 (D) in paragraph (5) (as so redesignated), by

37685 striking ``3831-3836'' and inserting ``3831 et seq.'';

37686 and

37687 (2) in subsection (c), in the matter preceding paragraph

37688 (1), by striking ``paragraphs (1), (2), and (4) of subsection

37689 (b) and the program under subchapter C of chapter 1 of subtitle

37690 D of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3837-

37691 3837f)'' and inserting ``paragraphs (1) and (3) of subsection

37692 (b)''.

37693

37694 (c) Relocation in Act.--

37695 (1) In general.--Section 246 of the Department of

37696 Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6962) (as

37697 amended by subsections (a) and (b)) is--

37698 (A) redesignated as section 228; and

37699 (B) moved so as to appear at the end of subtitle B

37700 of title II (7 U.S.C. 6931 et seq.).

37701 (2) Conforming amendments.--

37702 (A) Section 226 of the Department of Agriculture

37703 Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6932) (as amended

37704 by section 12404(a)) is amended--

37705 (i) in subsection (b)(5), by striking

37706 ``section 246(b)'' and inserting ``section

37707 228(b)''; and

37708 (ii) in subsection (g)(2), by striking

37709 ``section 246(b)'' and inserting ``section

37710 228(b)''.

37711 (B) Section 271(2)(F) of the Department of

37712 Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C.

37713 6991(2)(F)) is amended by striking ``section 246(b)''
