39425SEC. 12604. WOOL RESEARCH AND PROMOTION.

39426

39427 Section 12316(a) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 7101

39428note; Public Law 113-79) is amended by striking ``2015 through 2019''

39429and inserting ``2019 through 2023''.

39430SEC. 12605. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 7632 note.&gt;&gt; EMERGENCY CITRUS DISEASE

39431 RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT TRUST FUND.

39432

39433 (a) Definition of Citrus.--In this section, the term ``citrus''

39434means edible fruit of the family Rutaceae, including any hybrid of that

39435fruit and any product of that hybrid that is produced for commercial

39436purposes in the United States.

39437 (b) Establishment of Trust Fund.--There is established in the

39438Treasury of the United States a trust fund, to be known as the Emergency

39439Citrus Disease Research and Development Trust Fund (referred to in this

39440section as the ``Citrus Trust Fund''), consisting of such amounts as

39441shall be transferred to the Citrus Trust Fund pursuant to subsection

39442(d).

39443 (c) Use of Fund.--From amounts in the Citrus Trust Fund, the

39444Secretary shall, beginning in fiscal year 2019, carry out the Emergency

39445Citrus Disease Research and Extension Program in section 412(j) of the

39446Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998 (7

39447U.S.C. 7632(j)).

39448 (d) Funding.--Of the funds of the Commodity Credit Corporation, the

39449Secretary shall transfer to the Citrus Trust Fund $25,000,000 for each

39450of fiscal years 2019 through 2023, to remain available until expended.

39451SEC. 12606. EXTENSION OF MERCHANDISE PROCESSING FEES.

39452

39453 Section 503 of the United States-Korea Free Trade Agreement

39454Implementation Act (Public Law 112-41; 19 U.S.C. 3805 note) is amended

39455by striking ``February 24, 2027'' and inserting ``May 26, 2027''.

39456SEC. 12607. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2204i.&gt;&gt; REPORTS ON LAND ACCESS AND

39457 FARMLAND OWNERSHIP DATA COLLECTION.

39458

39459 (a) Land Access.--Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment

39460of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture, in consultation with the

39461Chief Economist, shall submit to Congress and make publicly available a

39462report identifying--

39463 (1) the barriers that prevent or hinder the ability of

39464 beginning farmers and ranchers (as defined in section 2501(a) of

39465 the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7

39466 U.S.C. 2279(a))) and socially disadvantaged farmers and

39467

39468[[Page 132 STAT. 5007]]

39469

39470 ranchers (as defined in such section) to acquire or access

39471 farmland;

39472 (2) the extent to which Federal programs, including

39473 agricultural conservation easement programs, land transition

39474 programs, and financing programs, are improving--

39475 (A) farmland access and tenure for beginning farmers

39476 and ranchers and socially disadvantaged farmers and

39477 ranchers; and

39478 (B) farmland transition and succession; and

39479 (3) the regulatory, operational, or statutory changes that

39480 are necessary to improve--

39481 (A) the ability of beginning farmers and ranchers

39482 and socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers to

39483 acquire or access farmland;

39484 (B) farmland tenure for beginning farmers and

39485 ranchers and socially disadvantaged farmers and

39486 ranchers; and

39487 (C) farmland transition and succession.

39488

39489 (b) Farmland Ownership.--The Secretary shall collect and, not less

39490frequently than once every 3 years report, data and analysis on farmland

39491ownership, tenure, transition, and entry of beginning farmers and

39492ranchers and socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers (as those terms

39493are defined in section 2501(a) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation,

39494and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 2279(a))). In carrying out this

39495subsection, the Secretary shall, at a minimum--

39496 (1) collect and distribute comprehensive reporting of trends

39497 in farmland ownership, tenure, transition, barriers to entry,

39498 profitability, and viability of beginning farmers and ranchers

39499 and socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers;

39500 (2) develop surveys and report statistical and economic

39501 analysis on farmland ownership, tenure, transition, barriers to

39502 entry, profitability, and viability of beginning farmers and

39503 ranchers, including a regular follow-on survey to each Census of

39504 Agriculture with results of the follow-on survey made public not

39505 later than 3 years after the previous Census of Agriculture; and

39506 (3) require the National Agricultural Statistics Service to

39507 include in the Tenure, Ownership, and Transition of Agricultural

39508 Land survey questions relating to--

39509 (A) the extent to which non-farming landowners are

39510 purchasing and holding onto farmland for the sole

39511 purpose of real estate investment;

39512 (B) the impact of these farmland ownership trends on

39513 the successful entry and viability of beginning farmers

39514 and ranchers and socially disadvantaged farmers and

39515 ranchers;

39516 (C) the extent to which farm and ranch land with

39517 undivided interests and no administrative authority

39518 identified have farms or ranches operating on that land;

39519 and

39520 (D) the impact of land tenure patterns, categorized

39521 by--

39522 (i) race, gender, and ethnicity; and

39523 (ii) region.

39524

39525 (c) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be

39526appropriated to carry out this section $3,000,000 for each fiscal years

395272019 through 2023, to remain available until expended.

39528

39529[[Page 132 STAT. 5008]]

39530

39531SEC. 12608. REAUTHORIZATION OF RURAL EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES

39532 TRAINING AND EQUIPMENT ASSISTANCE

39533 PROGRAM.

39534

39535 Section 330J of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 254c-15) is

39536amended--

39537 (1) in subsection (a), by striking ``in rural areas'' and

39538 inserting ``in rural areas or to residents of rural areas'';

39539 (2) by striking subsections (b) through (f) and inserting

39540 the following:

39541

39542 ``(b) Eligibility; Application.--To be eligible to receive grant

39543under this section, an entity shall--

39544 ``(1) be--

39545 ``(A) an emergency medical services agency operated

39546 by a local or tribal government (including fire-based

39547 and non-fire based); or

39548 ``(B) an emergency medical services agency that is

39549 described in section 501(c) of the Internal Revenue Code

39550 of 1986 and exempt from tax under section 501(a) of such

39551 Code; and

39552 ``(2) submit an application to the Secretary at such time,

39553 in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary

39554 may require.

39555

39556 ``(c) Use of Funds.--An entity--

39557 ``(1) shall use amounts received through a grant under

39558 subsection (a) to--

39559 ``(A) train emergency medical services personnel as

39560 appropriate to obtain and maintain licenses and

39561 certifications relevant to service in an emergency

39562 medical services agency described in subsection (b)(1);

39563 ``(B) conduct courses that qualify graduates to

39564 serve in an emergency medical services agency described

39565 in subsection (b)(1) in accordance with State and local

39566 requirements;

39567 ``(C) fund specific training to meet Federal or

39568 State licensing or certification requirements; and

39569 ``(D) acquire emergency medical services equipment;

39570 and

39571 ``(2) may use amounts received through a grant under

39572 subsection (a) to--

39573 ``(A) recruit and retain emergency medical services

39574 personnel, which may include volunteer personnel;

39575 ``(B) develop new ways to educate emergency health

39576 care providers through the use of technology-enhanced

39577 educational methods; or

39578 ``(C) acquire personal protective equipment for

39579 emergency medical services personnel as required by the

39580 Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

39581

39582 ``(d) Grant Amounts.--Each grant awarded under this section shall be

39583in an amount not to exceed $200,000.

39584 ``(e) Definitions.--In this section:

39585 ``(1) The term `emergency medical services'--

39586 ``(A) means resources used by a public or private

39587 nonprofit licensed entity to deliver medical care

39588 outside of a medical facility under emergency conditions

39589 that occur as a result of the condition of the patient;

39590 and

39591

39592[[Page 132 STAT. 5009]]

39593

39594 ``(B) includes services delivered (either on a

39595 compensated or volunteer basis) by an emergency medical

39596 services provider or other provider that is licensed or

39597 certified by the State involved as an emergency medical

39598 technician, a paramedic, or an equivalent professional

39599 (as determined by the State).

39600 ``(2) The term `rural area' means--

39601 ``(A) a nonmetropolitan statistical area;

39602 ``(B) an area designated as a rural area by any law

39603 or regulation of a State; or

39604 ``(C) a rural census tract of a metropolitan

39605 statistical area (as determined under the most recent

39606 rural urban commuting area code as set forth by the

39607 Office of Management and Budget).

39608

39609 ``(f) Matching Requirement.--The Secretary may not award a grant

39610under this section to an entity unless the entity agrees that the entity

39611will make available (directly or through contributions from other public

39612or private entities) non-Federal contributions toward the activities to

39613be carried out under the grant in an amount equal to 10 percent of the

39614amount received under the grant.''; and

39615 (3) in subsection (g)(1), by striking ``2002 through 2006''

39616 and inserting ``2019 through 2023''.

39617SEC. 12609. COMMISSION ON FARM TRANSITIONS--NEEDS FOR 2050.

39618

39619 (a) Establishment.--There is established a commission to be known as

39620the Commission on Farm Transitions-Needs for 2050 (referred to in this

39621section as the ``Commission'').

39622 (b) Study.--The Commission shall conduct a study on issues impacting

39623the transition of agricultural operations from established farmers and

39624ranchers to the next generation of farmers and ranchers, including--

39625 (1) access to, and availability of--

39626 (A) quality land and necessary infrastructure;

39627 (B) affordable credit;

39628 (C) adequate risk management tools; and

39629 (D) apprenticeship and mentorship programs;

39630 (2) agricultural asset transfer strategies in use as of the

39631 date of the enactment of this Act and improvements to such

39632 strategies;

39633 (3) incentives that may facilitate agricultural asset

39634 transfers to the next generation of farmers and ranchers,

39635 including an assessment of, and recommendations for, how

39636 existing and new Federal tax policies--

39637 (A) facilitate lifetime and estate transfers; and

39638 (B) impact individuals seeking to farm who do not

39639 have family farm lineage or access to farmland;

39640 (4) the causes of the failures of such transitions, if any;

39641 and

39642 (5) the effectiveness of programs and incentives providing

39643 assistance with respect to such transitions in effect on the

39644 date of the enactment of this Act and opportunities for the

39645 revision or improvement of such programs.

39646

39647 (c) Membership.--

39648 (1) Composition.--The Commission shall be composed of 10

39649 members, as follows:

39650 (A) 3 members appointed by the Secretary.

39651

39652[[Page 132 STAT. 5010]]

39653

39654 (B) 3 members appointed by the Committee on

39655 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate.

39656 (C) 3 members appointed by the Committee on

39657 Agriculture of the House of Representatives.

39658 (D) The Chief Economist of the Department of

39659 Agriculture.

39660 (2) Federal government employment.--In addition to the Chief

39661 Economist of the Department of Agriculture, the membership of

39662 the Commission may include 1 or more employees of the Department

39663 of Agriculture or other Federal agencies.

39664 (3) Date of appointments.--The appointment of all members of

39665 the Commission shall be made not later than 60 days after the

39666 date of enactment of this Act.

39667 (4) Term; vacancies.--

39668 (A) Term.--A member shall be appointed for the life

39669 of the Commission.

39670 (B) Vacancies.--A vacancy on the Commission--

39671 (i) shall not affect the powers of the

39672 Commission; and

39673 (ii) shall be filled in the same manner as the

39674 original appointment was made.

39675 (5) Initial meeting.--Not later than 30 days after the date

39676 on which all members of the Commission have been appointed, the

39677 Commission shall hold the initial meeting of the Commission.

39678

39679 (d) Quorum.--A majority of the members of the Commission shall

39680constitute a quorum for the transaction of business, but a lesser number

39681of members may hold hearings.

39682 (e) Chairperson.--The Secretary shall appoint 1 of the members of

39683the Commission to serve as Chairperson of the Commission.

39684 (f) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of

39685this Act, the Commission shall submit to the President, the Committee on

39686Agriculture of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on

39687Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report containing

39688the results of the study required by subsection (b), including such

39689recommendations as the Commission considers appropriate.

39690 (g) Hearings.--The Commission may hold such hearings, meet and act

39691at such times and places, take such testimony, and receive such evidence

39692as the Commission considers advisable to carry out this section.

39693 (h) Information From Federal Agencies.--The Commission may secure

39694directly from a Federal agency such information as the Commission

39695considers necessary to carry out this section. On request of the

39696Chairperson of the Commission, the head of the agency shall provide the

39697information to the Commission.

39698 (i) Postal Services.--The Commission may use the United States mail

39699in the same manner and under the same conditions as other agencies of

39700the Federal Government.

39701 (j) Assistance From Secretary.--The Secretary may provide to the

39702Commission appropriate office space and such reasonable administrative

39703and support services as the Commission may request.

39704 (k) Compensation of Members.--

39705

39706[[Page 132 STAT. 5011]]

39707

39708 (1) Non-federal employees.--A member of the Commission who

39709 is not an officer or employee of the Federal Government shall be

39710 compensated at a rate equal to the daily equivalent of the

39711 annual rate of basic pay prescribed for level IV of the

39712 Executive Schedule under section 5315 of title 5, United States

39713 Code, for each day (including travel time) during which the

39714 member is engaged in the performance of the duties of the

39715 Commission.

39716 (2) Federal employees.--A member of the Commission who is an

39717 officer or employee of the Federal Government shall serve

39718 without compensation in addition to the compensation received

39719 for the services of the member as an officer or employee of the

39720 Federal Government.

39721 (3) Travel expenses.--A member of the Commission shall be

39722 allowed travel expenses, including per diem in lieu of

39723 subsistence, at rates authorized for an employee of an agency

39724 under subchapter I of chapter 57 of title 5, United States Code,

39725 while away from the home or regular place of business of the

39726 member in the performance of the duties of the Commission.

39727

39728 (l) Federal Advisory Committee Act.--Sections 9 and 14 of the

39729Federal Advisory Committee Act (5 U.S.C. App.) shall not apply to the

39730Commission or any proceeding of the Commission.

39731 (m) Termination.--The Commission shall terminate on September 30,

397322023.

39733SEC. 12610. EXCEPTIONS UNDER UNITED STATES GRAIN STANDARDS ACT.

39734

39735 (a) Geographic Boundaries for Official Agencies.--Section 7 of the

39736United States Grain Standards Act (7 U.S.C. 79) is amended--

39737 (1) in subsection (f)(2)--

39738 (A) by redesignating subparagraphs (A), (B), and (C)

39739 as clauses (i), (iii), and (iv), respectively, and

39740 indenting appropriately;

39741 (B) in the matter preceding clause (i) (as so

39742 redesignated), by striking ``Not more'' and inserting

39743 the following:

39744 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), not

39745 more'';

39746 (C) in subparagraph (A) (as so designated), in the

39747 matter preceding clause (i) (as so redesignated), by

39748 striking ``Secretary, except that, if'' and inserting

39749 the following: ``Secretary.

39750 ``(B) Exceptions.--Subject to subsection (g)(4)(A),

39751 if'';

39752 (D) in subparagraph (B) (as so designated), by

39753 inserting after clause (i) the following:

39754 ``(ii) a person requesting inspection services

39755 in that geographic area has not been receiving

39756 official inspection services from the current

39757 designated official agency for that geographic

39758 area;''; and

39759 (E) by adding at the end the following:

39760 ``(C) Termination of nonuse of service exception.--

39761 The exception under subparagraph (B)(ii) may only be

39762 terminated if all parties to that exception jointly

39763 agree on the termination, unless terminated according to

39764 subsection (g)(4)(A).

39765 ``(D) Restoration of certain exceptions.--

39766

39767[[Page 132 STAT. 5012]]

39768

39769 ``(i) Definition of eligible grain handling

39770 facility.--In this subparagraph, the term

39771 `eligible grain handling facility' means a grain

39772 handling facility that--

39773 ``(I) was granted an exception under

39774 the final rule entitled `Exceptions to

39775 Geographic Areas for Official Agencies

39776 Under the USGSA' (68 Fed. Reg. 19137

39777 (April 18, 2003)); and

39778 ``(II) had that exception revoked

39779 between September 30, 2015, and the date

39780 of enactment of the Agriculture

39781 Improvement Act of 2018.

39782 ``(ii) Restoration of exceptions.--Within 90

39783 days of notification from an eligible grain

39784 handling facility, the Secretary shall restore an

39785 exception described in clause (i)(I) with an

39786 official agency if--

39787 ``(I) the eligible grain handling

39788 facility and the former excepted

39789 official agency agree to restore that

39790 exception; and

39791 ``(II) the eligible grain handling

39792 facility notifies the Secretary of the

39793 preferred date for restoration of the

39794 exception within 90 days of enactment of

39795 the Agriculture Improvement Act of

39796 2018.''; and

39797 (2) in subsection (g), by adding at the end the following:

39798 ``(4) Effect on exceptions.--

39799 ``(A) In general.--The exceptions under clauses (ii)

39800 and (iv) of subsection (f)(2)(B) shall not apply if the

39801 designation of an official agency is terminated,

39802 pursuant to paragraph (1).

39803 ``(B) Designation renewed or restored.--If the

39804 designation of an official agency is renewed or restored

39805 after being terminated under paragraph (1), the

39806 Secretary may renew or restore the exceptions under

39807 subsection (f)(2)(B) in accordance with that

39808 subsection.''.

39809

39810 (b) Unauthorized Weighing Prohibited.--Section 7A(i)(2) of the

39811United States Grain Standards Act (7 U.S.C. 79a(i)(2)) is amended--

39812 (1) by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses

39813 (i) and (iii), respectively, and indenting appropriately;

39814 (2) in the matter preceding clause (i) (as so redesignated),

39815 by striking ``Not more'' and inserting the following:

39816 ``(A) In general.--Subject to subparagraph (B), not

39817 more'';

39818 (3) in subparagraph (A) (as so designated), in the matter

39819 preceding clause (i) (as so redesignated), by striking

39820 ``Secretary, except that, if'' and inserting the following:

39821 ``Secretary.

39822 ``(B) Exceptions.--If'';

39823 (4) in subparagraph (B) (as so designated)--

39824 (A) in clause (i), by striking ``or'' at the end;

39825 and

39826 (B) by inserting after clause (i) the following:

39827 ``(ii) a person requesting weighing services

39828 in that geographic area has not been receiving

39829 official weighing services from the current

39830 designated official agency for that geographic

39831 area; or''; and

39832 (5) by adding after subparagraph (B) (as so designated)--

39833 ``(C) Restoration of certain exceptions.--

39834 ``(i) Definition of eligible grain handling

39835 facility.--In this subparagraph, the term

39836 `eligible

39837

39838[[Page 132 STAT. 5013]]

39839

39840 grain handling facility' means a grain handling

39841 facility that--

39842 ``(I) was granted an exception under

39843 the final rule entitled `Exceptions to

39844 Geographic Areas for Official Agencies

39845 Under the USGSA' (68 Fed. Reg. 19137

39846 (April 18, 2003)); and

39847 ``(II) had that exception revoked

39848 between September 30, 2015 and the date

39849 of enactment of the Agriculture

39850 Improvement Act of 2018.

39851 ``(ii) Restoration of exceptions.--Within 90

39852 days of notification from an eligible grain

39853 handling facility, the Secretary shall restore an

39854 exception described in clause (i)(I) with an

39855 official agency if--

39856 ``(I) the eligible grain handling

39857 facility and the former excepted

39858 official agency agree to restore that

39859 exception; and

39860 ``(II) the eligible grain handling

39861 facility notifies the Secretary of the

39862 preferred date for restoration of the

39863 exception within 90 days of enactment of

39864 the Agriculture Improvement Act of

39865 2018.''.

39866

39867 (c) Technical Correction.--Section 7(f)(1) of the United States

39868Grain Standards Act (7 U.S.C. 79(f)(1)) is amended by indenting

39869subparagraph (C) appropriately.

39870SEC. 12611. CONFERENCE REPORT REQUIREMENT THRESHOLD.

39871

39872 Section 14209(a)(3)(A) of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of

398732008 (7 U.S.C. 2255b(a)(3)(A)) is amended by striking ``$10,000'' and

39874inserting ``$50,000''.

39875SEC. 12612. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2204j.&gt;&gt; NATIONAL AGRICULTURE IMAGERY

39876 PROGRAM.

39877

39878 (a) In General.--The Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the

39879Administrator of the Farm Service Agency, shall carry out a national

39880agriculture imagery program to annually acquire aerial imagery during

39881agricultural growing seasons from the continental United States.

39882 (b) Data.--The aerial imagery acquired under this section shall--

39883 (1) consist of high resolution processed digital imagery;

39884 (2) be made available in a format that can be provided to

39885 Federal, State, and private sector entities;

39886 (3) be technologically compatible with geospatial

39887 information technology; and

39888 (4) be consistent with the standards established by the

39889 Federal Geographic Data Committee.

39890

39891 (c) Supplemental Satellite Imagery.--The Secretary of Agriculture

39892may supplement the aerial imagery collected under this section with

39893satellite imagery.

39894 (d) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be

39895appropriated to carry out this section $23,000,000 for fiscal year 2019

39896and each fiscal year thereafter.

39897SEC. 12613. REPORT ON INCLUSION OF NATURAL STONE PRODUCTS IN

39898 COMMODITY PROMOTION, RESEARCH, AND

39899 INFORMATION ACT OF 1996.

39900

39901 Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act,

39902the Secretary of Agriculture shall submit to the Committee on

39903Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on

39904Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report

39905

39906[[Page 132 STAT. 5014]]

39907

39908examining the effect the establishment of a Natural Stone Research and

39909Promotion Board pursuant to the Commodity Promotion, Research, and

39910Information Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C. 7401 et seq.) would have on the

39911natural stone industry, including how such a program would effect--

39912 (1) research conducted on, and the promotion of, natural

39913 stone;

39914 (2) the development and expansion of domestic markets for

39915 natural stone;

39916 (3) economic activity of the natural stone industry subject

39917 to such a Board;

39918 (4) economic development in rural areas; and

39919 (5) benefits to consumers in the United States of natural

39920 stone products.

39921SEC. 12614. ESTABLISHMENT OF FOOD ACCESS LIAISON.

39922

39923 (a) In General.--Subtitle A of the Department of Agriculture

39924Reorganization Act of 1994 (7 U.S.C. 6901 et seq.), as amended by

39925sections 12202, 12302, 12403, and 12504, is amended by adding at the end

39926the following:

39927``SEC. 225. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6925.&gt;&gt; FOOD ACCESS LIAISON.

39928

39929 ``(a) Establishment.--The Secretary shall establish the position of

39930Food Access Liaison to coordinate Department programs to reduce barriers

39931to food access and monitor and evaluate the progress of such programs in

39932accordance with this section.

39933 ``(b) Duties.--The Food Access Liaison shall--

39934 ``(1) coordinate the efforts of the Department, including

39935 regional offices, to experiment and consider programs and

39936 policies aimed at reducing barriers to food access for

39937 consumers, including but not limited to participants in

39938 nutrition assistance programs;

39939 ``(2) provide outreach to entities engaged in activities to

39940 reduce barriers to food access in accordance with the statutory

39941 authorization for each program;

39942 ``(3) provide outreach to entities engaged in activities to

39943 reduce barriers to food access, including retailers, markets,

39944 producers, and others involved in food production and

39945 distribution, with respect to the availability of, and

39946 eligibility for, Department programs;

39947 ``(4) raise awareness of food access issues in interactions

39948 with employees of the Department;

39949 ``(5) make recommendations to the Secretary with respect to

39950 efforts to reduce barriers to food access; and

39951 ``(6) submit to Congress an annual report with respect to

39952 the efforts of the Department to reduce barriers to food

39953 access.''.

39954

39955 (b) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6925 note.&gt;&gt; Technical Assistance.--The Secretary

39956shall provide technical assistance to entities that are participants, or

39957seek to participate, in Department of Agriculture programs related to

39958reduction of barriers to food access.

39959SEC. 12615. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 6622b.&gt;&gt; ELIGIBILITY FOR OPERATORS ON

39960 HEIRS PROPERTY LAND TO OBTAIN A FARM

39961 NUMBER.

39962

39963 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

39964 (1) Eligible documentation.--The term ``eligible

39965 documentation'', with respect to land for which a farm operator

39966

39967[[Page 132 STAT. 5015]]

39968

39969 seeks assignment of a farm number under subsection (b)(1),

39970 includes--

39971 (A) in States that have adopted a statute consisting

39972 of an enactment or adoption of the Uniform Partition of

39973 Heirs Property Act, as approved and recommended for

39974 enactment in all States by the National Conference of

39975 Commissioners on Uniform State Laws in 2010--

39976 (i) a court order verifying the land meets the

39977 definition of heirs property (as defined in that

39978 Act); or

39979 (ii) a certification from the local recorder

39980 of deeds that the recorded owner of the land is

39981 deceased and not less than 1 heir of the recorded

39982 owner of the land has initiated a procedure to

39983 retitle the land in the name of the rightful heir;

39984 (B) a fully executed, unrecorded tenancy-in-common

39985 agreement that sets out ownership rights and

39986 responsibilities among all of the owners of the land

39987 that--

39988 (i) has been approved by a majority of the

39989 ownership interests in that property;

39990 (ii) has given a particular owner the right to

39991 manage and control any portion or all of the land

39992 for purposes of operating a farm or ranch; and

39993 (iii) was validly entered into under the

39994 authority of the jurisdiction in which the land is

39995 located;

39996 (C) the tax return of a farm operator farming a

39997 property with undivided interests for each of the 5

39998 years preceding the date on which the farm operator

39999 submits the tax returns as eligible documentation under

40000 subsection (b);

40001 (D) self-certification that the farm operator has

40002 control of the land for purposes of operating a farm or

40003 ranch; and

40004 (E) any other documentation identified by the

40005 Secretary under subsection (c).

40006 (2) Farm number.--The term ``farm number'' has the meaning

40007 given the term in section 718.2 of title 7, Code of Federal

40008 Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of this Act).

40009

40010 (b) Farm Number.--

40011 (1) In general.--The Secretary shall provide for the

40012 assignment of a farm number to any farm operator who provides

40013 any form of eligible documentation for purposes of demonstrating

40014 that the farm operator has control of the land for purposes of

40015 defining that land as a farm.

40016 (2) Eligibility.--Any farm number provided under paragraph

40017 (1) shall be sufficient to satisfy any requirement of the

40018 Secretary to have a farm number to participate in a program of

40019 the Secretary.

40020

40021 (c) Eligible Documentation.--The Secretary shall identify

40022alternative forms of eligible documentation that a farm operator may

40023provide in seeking the assignment of a farm number under subsection

40024(b)(1).

40025SEC. 12616. EXTENDING PROHIBITION ON ANIMAL FIGHTING TO THE

40026 TERRITORIES.

40027

40028 (a) In General.--Section 26 of the Animal Welfare Act (7 U.S.C.

400292156) is amended--

40030 (1) in subsection (a)--

40031

40032[[Page 132 STAT. 5016]]

40033

40034 (A) in paragraph (1), by striking ``Except as

40035 provided in paragraph (3), it'' and inserting ``It'';

40036 and

40037 (B) by striking paragraph (3);

40038 (2) by striking subsection (d); and

40039 (3) by redesignating subsections (e), (f), (g), (h), (i),

40040 and (j) as subsections (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (i),

40041 respectively.

40042

40043 (b) Use of Postal Service or Other Interstate Instrumentalities.--

40044Section 26(c) of the Animal Welfare Act (7 U.S.C. 2156(c)) is amended by

40045striking ``(e)'' and inserting ``(d)''.

40046 (c) Criminal Penalties.--Subsection (i) of section 26 of the Animal

40047Welfare Act (7 U.S.C. 2156), as redesignated by section 2(3), is amended

40048by striking ``(e)'' and inserting ``(d)''.

40049 (d) Enforcement of Animal Fighting Prohibitions.--Section 49(a) of

40050title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking ``(e)'' and

40051inserting ``(d)''.

40052 (e) &lt;&lt;NOTE: 7 USC 2156 note.&gt;&gt; Effective Date.--The amendments made

40053by this section shall take effect on the date that is one year after the

40054date of the enactment of this Act.

40055SEC. 12617. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 1538 note.&gt;&gt; EXEMPTION OF EXPORTATION

40056 OF CERTAIN ECHINODERMS FROM PERMISSION

40057 AND LICENSING REQUIREMENTS.

40058

40059 (a) Definitions.--In this section:

40060 (1) Conservation and management.--The term ``conservation

40061 and management'' has the meaning given the term in section 3 of

40062 the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act (16

40063 U.S.C. 1802).

40064 (2) Marine fisheries commission.--The term ``Marine

40065 Fisheries Commission'' means an interstate commission (as that

40066 term is used in the Interjurisdictional Fisheries Act of 1986

40067 (16 USC 4101 et seq.)).

40068 (3) State jurisdiction.--The term ``State jurisdiction''

40069 means areas under the jurisdiction and authority of a State as

40070 described in section 306(a)(2) of the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery

40071 Conservation and Management Act (16 U.S.C. 1856(a)(2)).

40072

40073 (b) Exemption.--Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment

40074of this Act, the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service

40075shall amend section 14.92 of title 50, Code of Federal Regulations, to

40076clarify that--

40077 (1) except as provided in paragraph (2) and subsection

40078 (d)(2)--

40079 (A) fish and wildlife described in subsection (c)

40080 are fishery products exempt from the export permission

40081 requirements of section 9(d)(1) of the Endangered

40082 Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1538(d)(1)); and

40083 (B) any person may engage in business as an exporter

40084 of fish or wildlife described in subsection (c) without

40085 procuring--

40086 (i) permission under section 9(d)(1) of the

40087 Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C.

40088 1538(d)(1)); or

40089 (ii) an export license under subpart I of part

40090 14 of title 50, Code of Federal Regulations (or

40091 successor regulations); and

40092 (2) notwithstanding paragraph (1), unless the person has

40093 qualified for and obtained an export license described in

40094 paragraph (1)(B)(ii), any person that has been convicted of 1 or

40095 more violations of a Federal law relating to the importation,

40096

40097[[Page 132 STAT. 5017]]

40098

40099 transportation, or exportation of wildlife shall not be

40100 permitted, during the 5-year period beginning on the date of the

40101 most recent conviction, to engage in business as an exporter of

40102 fish or wildlife described in subsection (c).

40103

40104 (c) Covered Fish or Wildlife.--The fish or wildlife referred to in

40105subsection (b) are members of the species Strongylocentrotus

40106droebachiensis (commonly known as the ``green sea urchin''), including

40107any products of that species, that--

40108 (1) do not require a permit under part 16, 17, or 23 of

40109 title 50, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor

40110 regulations);

40111 (2)(A) are harvested in waters under State jurisdiction; or

40112 (B) are imported for processing in the United States

40113 pursuant to an import license as required under section 14.91 of

40114 title 50, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor

40115 regulation), and not exempt from import license requirements

40116 under section 14.92 of that title (as in effect on the day

40117 before the date of enactment of this Act); and

40118 (3) are exported for purposes of human or animal

40119 consumption.

40120

40121 (d) Information Collection on Exports.--

40122 (1) In general.--The State agency that regulates or

40123 otherwise oversees a State fishery in which the fish and

40124 wildlife described in subsection (c) are harvested shall

40125 annually transmit the conservation and management data (as

40126 defined in subsection (a)) to the Interstate Fisheries

40127 Management Program Policy Board of the applicable Marine

40128 Fisheries Commission.

40129 (2) Privacy.--Such data thereafter shall not be released and

40130 shall be maintained as confidential by such applicable Marine

40131 Fisheries Commission, including data requested under the section

40132 552 of title 5, United States Code, unless disclosure is

40133 required under court order or unless the data is essential for

40134 an enforcement action under Federal wildlife management laws.

40135 (3) Exclusion.--The exemption under subsection (b)(1) shall

40136 not apply in a State if--

40137 (A) the State fails to transmit the data required

40138 under paragraph (1); or

40139 (B) the applicable Marine Fisheries Commission

40140 determines, in consultation with the primary research

40141 agency of such Commission, after notice and an

40142 opportunity to comment, that the data required under

40143 paragraph (1) fails to prove that the State agency or

40144 official is engaged in conservation and management of

40145 the fish or wildlife described in subsection (c).

40146SEC. 12618. DATA ON CONSERVATION PRACTICES.

40147

40148 Subtitle E of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C.

401493841 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

40150``SEC. 1247. &lt;&lt;NOTE: 16 USC 3847.&gt;&gt; DATA ON CONSERVATION

40151 PRACTICES.

40152

40153 ``(a) Data on Conservation Practices.--The Secretary shall identify

40154available data sets within the Department of Agriculture regarding the

40155use of conservation practices and the effect of such practices on farm

40156and ranch profitability (including such effects relating to crop yields,

40157soil health, and other risk-related factors).

40158

40159[[Page 132 STAT. 5018]]

40160

40161 ``(b) Report.--Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of

40162the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018, the Secretary shall submit to

40163the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the

40164Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report

40165that includes--

40166 ``(1) a summary of the data sets identified under subsection

40167 (a);

40168 ``(2) a summary of the steps the Secretary would have to

40169 take to provide access to such data sets by university

40170 researchers, including taking into account any technical,

40171 privacy, or administrative considerations;

40172 ``(3) a summary of safeguards the Secretary employs when

40173 providing access to data to university researchers;

40174 ``(4) a summary of appropriate procedures to maximize the

40175 potential for research benefits while preventing any violations

40176 of privacy or confidentiality; and

40177 ``(5) recommendations for any necessary authorizations or

40178 clarifications of Federal law to allow access to such data sets

40179 to maximize the potential for research benefits.''.

40180SEC. 12619. CONFORMING CHANGES TO CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES ACT.

40181

40182 (a) In General.--Section 102(16) of the Controlled Substances Act

40183(21 U.S.C. 802(16)) is amended--

40184 (1) by striking ``(16) The'' and inserting ``(16)(A) Subject

40185 to subparagraph (B), the''; and

40186 (2) by striking ``Such term does not include the'' and

40187 inserting the following:

40188

40189 ``(B) The term `marihuana' does not include--

40190 ``(i) hemp, as defined in section 297A of the Agricultural

40191 Marketing Act of 1946; or

40192 ``(ii) the''.

40193

40194 (b) Tetrahydrocannabinol.--Schedule I, as set forth in section

40195202(c) of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 812(c)), is amended

40196in subsection (c)(17) by inserting after ``Tetrahydrocannabinols'' the

40197following: ``, except for tetrahydrocannabinols in hemp (as defined

40198under section 297A of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946)''.

40199

40200 Approved December 20, 2018.

40201

40202LEGISLATIVE HISTORY--H.R. 2:

40203---------------------------------------------------------------------------

40204

40205HOUSE REPORTS: Nos. 115-661 (Comm. on Agriculture) and 115-1072 (Comm.

40206of Conference).

40207CONGRESSIONAL RECORD, Vol. 164 (2018):

40208 May 16-18, considered and failed House.

40209 June 21, considered and passed House.

40210 June 27, 28, considered and passed Senate, amended.

40211 Dec. 11, Senate agreed to the conference report.

40212 Dec. 12, House agreed to the conference report.

40213DAILY COMPILATION OF PRESIDENTIAL DOCUMENTS (2018):

40214 Dec. 20, Presidential remarks and statement.

40215

40216 &lt;all&gt;

40217

40218</pre>

40219<script>

40220

40221$(document).ready(function () {

40222 if ($('#billTextContainer')[0].scrollWidth >

40223 $('#billTextContainer').width()) {

40224 $('#billTextContainerTopScrollBar div').width($('#billTextContainer')[0].scrollWidth);

40225

40226 $('#billTextContainerTopScrollBar').height('20px').scroll(function () {

40227 $("#billTextContainer").scrollLeft(

40228 $("#billTextContainerTopScrollBar").scrollLeft()

40229 );

40230 });

40231

40232 $("#billTextContainer").scroll(function(){

40233 $("#billTextContainerTopScrollBar").scrollLeft(

40234 $("#billTextContainer").scrollLeft()

40235 );

40236 });

40237 }

40238});

40239</script>

40676 <div class="top-link">

40677

40678 <a href='#' id='sticky-back-to-top'>

40679<i>

40680</i>

40681<span>

40682Back to top</span>

40683</a>

40684

40685 </div>

40686

40687 <script type="text/javascript">

40688

40689 $(function () {

40690 var scroll_timer,

40691 displayed = false,

40692 $message = $('.top-link a').hide(),

40693 $window = $(window),

40694 top = $(document.body).children(0).position().top;

40695

40696 $("#sticky-back-to-top").click(function(event){

40697 $window.scrollTop(0);

40698 event.preventDefault();

40699 return false;

40700 });

40701

40702 $window.scroll(function () {

40703 window.clearTimeout(scroll_timer);

40704 scroll_timer = window.setTimeout(function () {

40705 if($window.scrollTop() <= top){

40706 displayed = false;

40707 $message.fadeOut(800);

40708 }else if(displayed == false){

40709 displayed = true;

40710 $message.stop(true, true).show().click(function () { $message.fadeOut(800); });

40711 }

40712 }, 100);

40713 });

40714 });

40715 </script>

40716

40717</footer>

40718<!-- end footer -->

40719

40720<script src="/js/cache/fe1e6068d26f27e4e348a4821b6eb803.js">

40721</script>

40722

40723 <script src="//f1-na.readspeaker.com/script/6927/ReadSpeaker.js?pids=embhl">

40724</script>

40725

40726 <script src="/js/readspeaker.js">

40727</script>

40729 </div>

40731 <div class="actionLoaderWrapper" style="display:none">

40732

40733 <div class="actionLoader">

40734

40735 <i class="fas fa-circle-notch fa-spin fa-3x fa-fw">

40736</i>

40737

40738 <span class="sr-only">

40739Loading...</span>

40740

40741 </div>

40742

40743</div>

40744

40745 <script>

40746

40747 $(document).ready(function(){

40748 // Display system alert if not empty, suppress borwser support warning if present

40749 if ($('#system_alert').is(':not(:empty)')) {

40750 $('#system_alert').removeAttr("style").prepend('<span class="hide_fromsighted">

40751Alert: </span>

40752');

40753 $('#browser_support_alert').attr("style","display:none");

40754 }

40755

40756 var h = window.location.hash,

40757 scrollTo = 0;

40758

40759 if (h) {

40760 if ($(h).offset() !== undefined) {

40761 scrollTo = $(h).offset().top;

40762 }

40763 }

40764

40765 if (scrollTo >

40766 0) {

40767 $('html, body').stop().animate({ scrollTop : scrollTo + "px"}, 0);

40768 }

40769

40770 $('body').congress_LAC({ checkUrl: '/lac/check' });

40771 });

40772 </script>
